Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: moonchick50
Reviews.Content: Is this a 5 star property? No, but the location, staff and ambience make up for those last stars. My room (481) was clean, comfortable and had a view of the ocean from the lanai. The grounds are very nice with grass, trees and the ability to move a lounge chair to where you want it. The Tilki Bar and Grill are very good.. and the Tiki Terrace was great with nightly entertainment.Trilogy cataraman leaves from the beach at the hotel. Walking distance to Whaler's Village. Will I go back? Absolutely!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: tnpharmer
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. It's not fancy, but it is a great place to stay. All of the staff are very helpful. The grounds are always spotless. The guys are out every morning raking up the leaves and blooms that fell off the night before. The rooms are nice and clean. We had a room with a king bed on the 6th floor of the Kauai wing with a perfect view of the grounds and the ocean. We had the breakfast buffet every morning (it was included in our package). It was very good with the usual-scrambled eggs, bacon, pancakes, various breads, rice, potatoes, fruit, cereal, juices. If we make it back to Hawaii, we will most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated but actually very nice”
Reviews.Author: LF0308
Reviews.Content: I will be the first to admit when we arrived we did think omg what have we done! But after staying here it was a pleasant experience. It was also about half the price of the more expensive neighbours who's resorts you can just wander into. We had a partial sea view from the Molokai wing which is the original building. There are no lifts so you have to carry your bag up the stairs. The room was comfortable but dated, beds were comfy and we had a nice view. Only downside to this wing was the noise from the showers. I think if anyone in the vacinity of our room had a shower you could hear the pipes. And people are up early for flghts or tours! Other than that apart from one set of very loud neighbours we didn't hear any others through the walls.. The grounds are lovely and you can lie under the trees or in the sun. The pool is small however the beach is great. You can walk down to Black Rock for swimming with the fish and turtles (if you are going early keep a beach towel from the day before as they don't open till 8). Breakfast buffet was ok, a little more variety would be nice. We also ate from the Tiki bar/hut a couple of times and the food was good. All the other hotels are in easy walking distance and after we had been through them all we actually did like our hotel a little more. The Westin has the wow factor but the Hyatt and Sheraton were quite bland and the Marriott is just timeshare hell! We caught the bus into Lahaina several times. Get the $2 day ticket rather than $1 each way and you can always go back in at night. The nightly music at the hotel was nice, we didn't go see the show but listened to the music from our lanai. Staff were helpful, especially on the tour desk. If you are looking for a spa highly recommend the Westin. Overall this was a nice experience and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Whale Watching !”
Reviews.Author: NomadicTeachers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 586, an oceanfront room and woke on our first morning to see whales just off-shore and we spent many hours on the balcony whale watching. The room itself was well-appointed and the staff were always friendly and helpful. I would skip the breakfast presentation on the first morning – it’s very long, only gives information on the trips which you can get easily elsewhere and the breakfast isn’t as good as in the main restaurant. Generally the food was OK but the menus are limited. However, Whalers village is only a few hundred yards away with an excellent range of restaurants. $1 gets you on the bus into Lahaina. We only saw it during the day but it was worth a visit. If you are going to do a lot of excursions, it’s worth going here as the range on offer is bigger and probably cheaper. The beach is very good and there is some reasonable snorkelling a short walk along the beach. We had a great few days here and would thoroughly recommend the hotel – get an oceanfront room if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hawaiiana”
Reviews.Author: tboliek
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed a week at the KBH. Loved the very friendly staff, nightly Hawaiian shows, excellent breakfast buffet & little touches like grounds staff raking every morning, but leaving plumeria flowers on the grass to put in our hair. We had an ocean-view room, which gave us a nice view of Kaanapali beach. Rooms were outdated, but totally functional & met all our needs. Only complaint would be that the mattress sets were very old & not comfortable. Amazing location, beautiful beach--can't be beat, so worth the trade-off. We took the Trilogy whale-watching catamaran excursion right off the beach & saw a bunch of whales right under & around our boat. The snorkeling off Black Rock is excellent. Props to Leoda's Pie Shop for the coconut cream pie, just south of Lahaina (Olawalu)--best in the world!! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Family Christmas vacation”
Reviews.Author: N712KM
Reviews.Content: This place is home away from home. The staff is so welcoming. Great night entertainment. The Tiki Grill has the best food ever. This place is truly a hidden jewel.

Reviews.Title: “fits the bill perfectly”
Reviews.Content: is it the Ritz, no. Is it on the prettiest stretch of beach - YES. Is it oozing with Hawaiian charm - YES. Is the staff incredibly helpful and kind - YES! The room package that we purchased included the breakfast buffet which did not vary much from day to day but had breat fresh fruit, eggs, bacon, Miso soup, rice etc. It made for a good start to our mornings. The rooms were clean, the bathrooms were clean, the partial ocean views were great from the lanai.The beds were comfortable Coffee makers and mini fridge in the room worked and the showers had amazing water pressure and the "made in Hawaii" soap and conditioners were a nice added touch. Whats not to love about this hotel...one thing the walls are a little thin.I cannot comment on the pool since I travel to Hawaii for the beaches. The departure ceremony with the Kukui necklace is quaint. Cannot wait to go back and be in the heart of Ka'anapali again...oh yeah did I mention the Tiki bar!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, relaxed hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuePhoenix
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing fancy, so if you're looking for that, you'll be happier at the Marriott or Hyatt. However, the grounds are really pretty. The pool is whale shaped and basic. No waterfalls. The beach is great and fairly large (by Maui standards). We saw whales from the beach and there is snorkeling right there. We did not see any sea turtles, but we heard they've been around. We had both a "partial ocean view" room and "ocean view" room. From the lanai the partial ocean view had a nice view of the pool, the gounds and a bit of the ocean. The beds were so-so. The shower/toilet/sink/in room coffee maker were all in the same room. The ocean view room we upgraded to upon our return was located in the building FARTHEST away from the water but we could see more of the ocean through the pretty trees on the lawn. Again, nice lanai. In this room the shower/toilet were separated from the room with the sink, and the coffee maker had its own little nook/space outside of the bathroom. The room itself was bigger and the beds were more comfortable. If you want to be able to sit on your lanai with an unobstructed view, make sure you request an "ocean FRONT". We had breakfast at the restaurant. The buffet was very good (@ $20 per person) and had a lot to offer. We did not eat dinner there and cannot comment on that or on the nightly show. They also have a deli where you can get food items and drinks to go (and coffee for $1). They also have a nice little gift shop. Most of the employee's were extremely friendly. I think the very best thing about the hotel was that it was within easy walking distance to many restaurants and (expensive) shopping at Whaler's Village. Other reviews have stated that it is alot cheaper than the Hyatt and Marriott, which is probably true. I would definately recommend this hotel and would definately return.......I might check out prices for the Sheraton Black Rock hotel and see what their rates were as they had a really nice pool, and they share the exact same beach as KBH.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel- AMAZING location”
Reviews.Author: Melissa C
Reviews.Content: The nice thing in Maui is that all beaches are public. Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is located just down from Black Rock on one side and Whalers Village on the other. Older hotel, with tiny shower and horribly uncomfortable bed. However, the location right on the beach was AMAZING! Affordable beach chairs/umbrella was also available.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Hawaiian Hotel--REALLY?!?!”
Reviews.Author: B and P S
Reviews.Content: This was our cheapest stay on a 3 island vacation and we had lowered our expectations of the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel, but this place lowered them even more. Arrived at 11:30AM and our room was not ready and was not availble until 3:30PM. They said they would call us when it was ready, but they never did. We took our own bags to our room and were dismayed to find out that there were no elevators to our third floor room. Our room took our breath away, but not in a good way. It was in desparate need of updating, walls were paper thin, roaches in the bathroom and we believe the room's rug or AC made my wife ill during our stay. That night we had a pricey dinner for very mediocore food and had to wait 20 minutes and order twice for our first drinks. Service staff were not very attentive or particulary friendly--which was a theme of our stay. We were shocked by other TripAdvisor reviews of their Aloha spirit and their claim as "The Most Hawaiian Hotel." If their claim is accurate, it is a sad statment about the Hawaiian people. We did meet others that seemed pleased with the hotel, but to us, these people would have been just as pleased at a tacky Las Vegas or Orlando hotel. As this was my wife's first trip to the Hawaiian islands, she was very pleased to learn and use the new words "aloha" and "mahalo." Suprisingly, both these words were lacking from the staff. We read about the staff's education in Hawaiian culture and their community activities, but their Aloha Spirit seemed forced at best. They did not smile, greet others, or intiate helpfulness. A great representation of this was our 8AM "goodbye" ceremony in they lobby that we arrived at 3 minutes late. They woman leading the ceremony sang good by Karaoke-style and gave everyone, EXCEPT US, a kiki nut lei. She then asked everyone, EXCEPT US, where they were returning to. We waited around for awhile, while she got into a conversation with the last group and I said jokingly, "You forgot about us." She flatly replied, "I didn't forget about you, you were late." My wife left in tears. We will say the Aloha breakfast was nice and very informative. The story behind the canoe that the staff built themselves is touching. The nightly music and hula dancing were great. The drinks at the bar were potent and worth the price, which helped ease our disappointments. We would have been better off getting a condo and fending for ourselves or a more expensive hotel because we would have gotten more for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: jendin25
Reviews.Content: We got married in hawaii and stayed for our honeymoon. This hotel was decent. We must have been in the "old " wing because the bathroom had no tub just a shower stall. The room was clean and the beds and pillows were actually really soft and nice. Beach was nice...you have to pay for chairs and umbrellas so keep that in mind. We paid for the buffet breakfast when we booked the trip and it was nice to wake up and just go downstairs for breakfast but its the same food everyday. Eggs, cold potatoes, mystery meat and fish, cereal, fruit...not a huge selection. We were very sick of eating it by the end of the week and the servers (all they do is bring u a cup of coffee and water) expect you to leave a 20% tip for doing basically nothing. The staff was ok...nothing special. I am not sure why they call themselves the "most hawaiian hotel". There are shows at night but after seeing one its enough. Location is ok...you can walk to whalers village and there are 3 good restaurants there...we liked Hula Grill the best. You can also catch the bus there and get an all day pass for $2.There is really nothing else in walking distance and if you ask the staff where a good place to eat is they act like no one has ever asked them before. They are also awful at giving directions so be cautious. I would not recommend eating dinner at the hotel restaurant...expensive and not very good. The tiki bar to go food was decent tho. Another thing is that we were probably the youngest people staying at the hotel and we are both 30...it is a much older crowd. Everyone was older than my parents. All in all, the hotel served its purpose but I wish we would have stayed somewhere a little nicer for our honeymoon. I would probably stay somewhere else in the future if we were to go back and pay a little more money. If you are on a budget tho and just want somewhere clean to stay this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Strong on culture & service, weak rooms & amenities”
Reviews.Author: Da5idLW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for 5 nights in February 2012. Our family of 4 booked one room with 2 beds. We have good friends who've been coming here with their families for many, many years because it's a great value and the hospitality is absolutely amazing. We first checked in and received a room in the oldest (read: original) wing of the hotel. Yikes. We were on a first floor, partial ocean view room. The room was dark, the paint peeling, The bathroom tiny with no tub, just a shower stall. Not what we expected or wanted with 2 young kids. We politely asked for a different room (we don't like 1st floor for security/safety reasons and we wanted a tub to bathe our 2 young kids). After the second request, they found a way to move us. The second room was great. It was in the newest wing. The lighting, paint, furniture, bathroom, were all very good. It was on the 4th floor so the view and light were great. If you stay here -- PLEASE ask for the new wing! The main restaurant was good for the breakfast buffet. Nothing outstanding, but reasonably god food at a reasonable price. Even better if you book a package rate with vouchers included. The Tiki Grill offers fine pub food and reasonably priced and potent drinks. The staff is truly amazing. As I said, they are polite, knowledgable, and genuine. They are open about sharing their culture and offer many ways for adults and kids alike to learn about it. They claim recognition for being the "Most Hawaiian Hotel" and from my dozen trips to Hawaii in 20 years, I would agree. Our kids loved the passport program where they got to collect stamps for learning and doing different things around the hotel. The pool is tiny but is fine for young kids' entertainment for an hour a day, but it's definitely not a fancy resort pool. I'll be honest that with kids 6 and 8, I kind of missed that. The beach is steps away and an activities shack for snokeling & scuba trips sits on-property. Convenient! Overall, I would recommend this hotel for couples and older (middle aged to senior singles) and young families on a budget. Also for anyone who values hospitality and value over fancy rooms and amenities. It might be just what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place , Great People , Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Bryan P
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have recently taken our Honeymoon to the Hawaiian Islands FEB 16-FEB 28. I say Islands because we wanted to hop around. Our 1st stop was Oahu for one night layover. Airport hotel for convience. The next Day Feb 17th 2012 we departed for Maui. I picked out Ka'anapali Beach hotel. Two reasons, Location, and they offer a package. Upon arriving , we were greated with much hospitality. We spent 6 nights here and enjoyed every night. We took many trips up and down the beach exploring other facilities, crowded, lack of greenspace, concrete facades. As we traveled to the other Islands ( Big Island, back to Oahu) I was searching for that same service and hospitality, but I was not finding anything close for the same type of dollar. They get many Kudos for keeping the Hawaiian spirit alive throughout the hotel. I am looking to book my next trip with them for sure... Bryan Prack Cleveland,Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: chips221
Reviews.Content: Checked in on January 30th. We spent 11 days and enjoyed every minute. We sat in on the nightly entertainment and signed up for daily lessons in hula, ukelele, lei making and weaving. Walked to Black Rock to snorkel most mornings. This is the place to relax and enjoy your vacation. If you are looking to run everyday to some attraction or event you could do that from here also. Great location right on the beach. Walking distance from shopping and restaurants. You can take the Maui bus to Lahania with just a short walk to Whalers village.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Rich S
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 day stay at the KBH and it was great. I will write a longer review in a few days but I wanted to let everyone know it's a nice place to stay on a great beach and it's location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Whale Watcher's Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Tiggerdane
Reviews.Content: I and my niece have just returned from a 5 day stay at the above hotel and are experience was an excellent one. We arrived and booked in at the hotel in a painless few minutes and whilst at reception a young man started talking to us and before we knew where we were he had our suitcases and escorted us to our room. This we thought a little strange, but he put the cases inside and left. We were surveying our room and the telephone went, on answering it was reception who were apologising for the intervention of the young man and said how strange they also thought it was. Without further ado the receptionist asked us if we would like to move rooms, to which we agreed as to be honest it had unnerved us a little, however we did want a room with a similar view (the ocean). After a few minutes they sent up a porter and moved us to the floor above, and low and behold we had a better oceanic view. The room and facilities were excellent. The beds very clean and comfortable, and rooms and towels cleaned everyday. The only downside to this hotel was the use of the hotel phone. We bought a phone card to phone back home daily and when we checked out we found that the hotel had charged us 75c for every phone call, not a lot I know but over 5 days it adds up and the phone card says no charges - we had used the card at our other hotel and there was no charge. There was also a safe in the hotel room, which upon booking out we found we had had to pay for. Neither of these minor faults detracted from the wonderful holiday we had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Adschro
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the hotel.. We stayed in the kuaui building (little more updated) We plan on returning next year for sure. Great location, perfect beach and walking distance to many restaurants. You can do everything from the hotel grounds.. Snorkel, whale watch, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Excellant!”
Reviews.Author: Jpgimroth
Reviews.Content: Thanks for a great 25th wedding anniversary and for keeping your hotel so Hawaiian! Love every time we come there and we love the truly Hawaiian hospitality you have! Never loose that!

Reviews.Title: “If you want comfort go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Kims0993
Reviews.Content: It is a great location, but we were left wondering what all the hype about "the most hawaiian hotel" meant. All we could figure out is it means old rooms with air conditioning that doesn't work and roaches in the drawer. The whale watching from the balcony was spectacular and the ability to snorkel over to Black Rock was nice. But for $350 per night we expected a bit more out of the room. We are on a multi island tour of Hawaii and this is the third and most expensive place we've stayed. It also was the most run down. We heard that the departure ceremony was fantastic, too bad it's every hour on the hour starting at 8 am. Our flight left at 9 from the airport an hour away. Might make more sense to have a welcome reception when people arrive rather than make them juggle their schedule so you can say goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: hostafan
Reviews.Content: Stay at the KBH if you are interested in a great location a short walk from excellent snorkeling, all types of restaurants from gourmet to a food court, and shopping. The hotel staff is very friendly, the grounds are simple but beautiful, the nightly show is entertaining, and the restaurant has a lot to offer. Is this the most luxurious hotel in Maui? No. But it is clean, easy, and hundreds less per night than its luxury resort neighbors. The Ka'anapali Beach area is great. The very long beach has plenty of room for snorkelers, paddle boards, body surfing, walkers, and sunbathers. The hotel is a few minutes north of Lahaina which has great shopping, whale watch tours, art galleries, and lots to do. Plenty of golf as well. Since we stayed a week, we drove all over the island and really found the Ka'anapali Beach to be a convenient and beautiful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Bloggin1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in January 2012, we got an upgraded room (601) in the Lanai wing, it was a really nice big room over looking the pool and grounds. We even had a partial ocean view if you stood in the corner of the balcony. I really liked the location in the middle of a great beach, you have snorkeling at black rock at one end of the beach and surfing at the other end of the beach. It was also nice to be able to come back to the hotel and sit under a tree in the heat of the afternoon. I had lunch at the Tiki hut and I thought it was reasonable, I expect to pay some extra for the convenience of having lunch by the pool. We had friends staying in another wing of the hotel and saw that their room and wing had not been upgraded yet and the room was much smaller, but they were paying the same price we were. I would defiantly ask for the Lanai building and room 601 if staying there again. I would defiantly recommend this hotel to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: cotijo
Reviews.Content: We loved the Ka'anapali so much we're planning another stay. It isn't the newest or most modern hotel, but the hawaiian hopitality there can't be beat. Very clean rooms. The nightly bands and hula dancers under the moon were my favorite part. Ahhh, nothing beats those hawaiian nights! If you cant have a full ocean view, their garden views are the next best thing, nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Second verse, good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: thea123
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Kaanapali Beach Resort and it was as good as the first! They upgraded our room at no charge for our second stay and we were given a spacious 6th floor ocean view room in the Lanai Building. We like this building the best because it directly faces the pools, gardens, ocean, and looks down on the nightly hula show. This hotel sits on one of the nicest and least crowded beaches in Lahaina. It is a quiet, peaceful and very relaxing place to stay with lovely grounds, accommodating staff, and comfortable, clean accommodations. Highly recommend the Trilogy boat trip during humpback season, which departs directly from the hotel beach. Incredible, up-close encounters with many, many humpback whales made this experience a standout. Strongly recommend the Kaanapali Beach Hotel as a low key, laid back and budget friendly gem in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Kaanapali location”
Reviews.Author: Nebmom
Reviews.Content: One thing that I really appreciate about this hotel is that they don't try and pretend that they're something they're not. They call themselves a hotel rather than a resort and we knew what we were getting. We loved our stay here, especially the quick walk to Whaler's Village where a lot of the action was. Upon check in they could not give us a king bed as requested, but we were able to change rooms the next day and that king bed room was wonderful. We watched whales from our balcony and enjoyed relaxing on our ocean view lanai. The staff was always friendly. We did not use the pool or restaurants, but did take an enjoyable whale watching excursion through Trilogy which conveniently left from the beach of the hotel. It was fun to see the variety local craft sellers in the lobby every morning. There was evening entertainment outside at the hotel in the evenings and quite a few people watching it. If you want more contemporary music, Hula Grill at nearby Whaler's Village has live outdoor music too. Considering the value, we would definitely stay here again especially because of the location. The free welcome breakfast the first day was a nice way to start vacation. I've seen other reviews that mention not being able to get the requested bed configuration as happened to us, if Kaanapali Beach Hotel could solve this problem, they would be unbeatable for ambiance, value and location. We enjoyed great service here and enjoyed the Hawaiian atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hawaiian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: p z
Reviews.Content: When we first got to the hotel for our eight day vacation, we weren't sure what to expect. The hotel is somewhat dated and the lobby is small and uninviting. The ladies at check were very helpful and friendly. Our room was suppose to be ocean front with a king bed. But when we got there it had twin beds and after calling the front desk, they were fully? booked and we couldn't move for two days and the only room was on the smoking floor. Once the room was corrected, the balance of the week was wonderful. Even though the hotel is a bit dated, the grounds and surrounding areas were kept very clean. The staff were extremely helpful. One thing that bothers me is they charge for everything, parking, internet, local calls, beach chairs and umbrellas. In comparison to the other hotels in the area, this is by far the best in value for your dollar and by far the best beach. This is Hawaii so expect to pay top dollar for everything. We ate at Hulas Bar and Grill and at Leonai's which are owned by the same people. It was interesting that the Mai Tais at Hulas Grill were $1.50 more than at Leonai's but serve in the same mug. All in all we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hawaiian Hotel at a Great Bargain.”
Reviews.Author: robin082
Reviews.Content: Our five night stay at the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel on Maui was exceptional. The hotel exceeded our expectations in every respect. The rooms are excellent â€“ almost suite-like with a glass table next to the wide glass front, wicker chair, sofa and very tastefully decorated in pleasing Hawaiian dÃ©cor. Very clean and very well maintained. A large lanai with comfortable chairs and glass table added to the pleasure of the hotel. An apartment sized fridge allowed us to bring in breakfast fixings and snacks. We chose the room and car option which is a great bargain in light of the high cost of car rentals in Hawaii. The staff was genuinely friendly and helpful in every respect. The grounds of the hotel set it apart from the string of resorts along the coast. The hotel is a horseshoe around wide-wide beautiful grounds. Native trees, wide expanse of lawn, many separate sitting areas, a quiet small pool in the middle made for an exceptionally relaxing and very attractive setting. (A contrast to the closed-in and much less expansive public areas of most of the much more expensive resorts along the coast.) The complimentary welcome breakfast was very nice. It is hosted by the concierge and is not a â€œtime-shareâ€� pitch but a good overview of many of the attractions, whale watches etc, -- with a good objective guide on whatâ€™s good and whatâ€™s not. We like a simple breakfast, so we picked up juice, cereal, yogurt and OJ at the Safeway three miles away. There is a deli on the grounds so one can do that (with a bit less choice) if you want to skip a huge buffet breakfast. The restaurant is excellent â€“ and substantially less-expensive than the three main choices at the nearby Whalerâ€™s Village (a five minute stroll along the boardwalk from the hotel). We did have a nice dinner at Cane & Taro there. Later in the week we had a terrific dinner at Dukeâ€™s a few miles north of the hotel in one of the resort condos. Overall, we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Smokers”
Reviews.Author: christopher h
Reviews.Content: It's increasingly hard for travelers who smoke to find hotels that will accommodate their habit. KBH allows smoking on hotel property and actually sets aside whole floors where smoking is permitted on the room balconies. The hotel staff refer to these floors as smoking floors. Unfortunately for us, we're not a family of smokers. We brought our 4 month old and 4 year old with us on a 10 night stay at KBH in February 2012. Though we had a spectacular ocean view from our balcony, the second hand smoke from neighboring rooms was a near constant presence. Our last 3 nights were the worst, with second hand smoke blowing into our room whenever we opened the sliding glass balcony doors. We did complain to hotel staff and spoke with a hotel manager who politely explained that KBH does allow smoking, but is careful to follow state law. The manager also said that for most of their guests, the smoking and second-hand smoke is a non-issue. Moreover, the manager said, if KBH were to ban smoking on the premises, KBH would lose a large portion of their clientele. Well, you lost this family KBH. Our stay at your hotel left a bad taste in our mouths (literally) and we felt that our health was compromised.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Hotel Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Angel_OB_Nurse
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at KBH 2/7/12 through 2/14/12. My husband, mom, dad, and myself truly enjoyed this hotel. The location is absolutely perfect, especially if you love to snorkel! I was able to snorkel at Black Rock with beautiful fish and SEA TURTLES. No costly trip needed to have such amazing snorkeling right on your own beach. The hotel grounds are amazing and well kept up. The staff is very friendly. We had the breakfast buffet included in the price of the hotel which is well worth it, it had a nice selection daily (fresh fruit, eggs, bacon, sausage, fish, potatoes, rice, cereal, etc) It is just a short walk down the beach from amazing shopping and restaurants or a short drive to Lahaina which has TONS of shopping and restaurants. We were able to take a whale watching cruise right from hotel beach as well. There is a little shop set up on the property from a boating company called Trilogy and they pull their catamaran right up to the beach for you to board. You can rent snorkeling gear, cabanas, chairs, umbrellas etc from the shop as well. You can even whale watch right from the beach without getting on a boat. Our pool view room even had views of the ocean. The lanai was great and the sound of the ocean is pure heaven. As I had researched before booking this hotel it not a glamorous hotel, the pool isn't huge, the beds were okay but it FELT like we were in Hawaii, the service was great, and it was well kept and clean. We would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. We will definitely be back to KBH!!!! I miss it already ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location . . .”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl S
Reviews.Content: . . . especially if you really want to relax, and not have to get in the car for everything! We stayed here 5 nights 1/30/12 to 2/4/12 and it was our first time at KBH, but definitely not our last. It really FEELS like you're in Hawaii. But if you're looking for glitz and glamour, and multi-level swimming pools with waterfalls, you're at the wrong place. However, our partial ocean view room in the center building was clean, and comfortable. We could even watch the free evening entertainment from our lanai if we wanted. Our travel agent lives on Maui, www.mauikay.com, and she suggested we get the package that included buffet breakfast, and it was so enjoyable, with a good variety and good service. She had steered us away from another nearby place because of construction, and we were glad for her advice when we saw (and heard) it. My husband likes to snorkel at Black Rock, so he loved being able to just walk there and not have to load up the car each time. Also, lots of great restaurants (and shopping!) to walk to nearby. My favorite feature of this hotel has to be the local crafters in the lobby every morning. It was so nice to be able to buy something made locally, not in China! Some of the crafters even worked on their items there and all of them were happy to talk about their craft and Maui in general. The KBH employees are very helpful and so pleasant. Yes, you still get a bill when you leave, but they also have a farewell lei ceremony, to which you receive a written invite.

Reviews.Title: “It IS the most Hawai'ian hotel in Hawai'i...”
Reviews.Author: DuffyLeB
Reviews.Content: I could hear the ocean at nite. The help there was more than helpful. It's like they knew what you wanted before you knew it. They taught me that you give a lei on departure not on arrival. They even gave me a kukui nut lei when I checked out. The Tiki Hut (I think that's what it was called) is for very casual affair (great hamburger & fries) located next to the outdoor bar. Island dance shows nitely. There's a variety of other types of dining also. One is a dinner/magic show. Use the valet parking. You've come this far - treat yourself. Have an aloha time...

Reviews.Title: “location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: sunbuns
Reviews.Content: spent 10 nights here feb 1 through feb 10th with two other friends,paid for a partial ocean view but apon arrival was given room 143(back of resort next to the parkade).was told the resort was full but we were moved the next morning to room 268(kawai wing),we were very happy with this room,our friends were closer to the ocean in room 280 but had a poorer view (because of foilage.the resort is definitely 70s dated(thought i saw Jack Lord hanging by the tiki bar)but still retains a certain charm.(just don,t take a walk down the beach walk trail to the left and see the sparkling new resorts). The beach is what kannapali is all about and i would say that the k.b.h. has both the best beach and the best location in the entire area.The aquatic life here is unbeliveable!!we took the whale watching tour(trilogy) that leaves directly in front of this beach and it was well worth it,but we also saw tons of whales from shore with a mother and calve breaching right in front of us not more then 600 feet of of shore!!we also saw giant sea turtles swim right by us not 30 feet of off the shore passing right by swimmers who never noticed them! Just a word about the surf.it ranged from gentle rollers on day one to 6 foot crashers by day 8.alot of people seemed oblivious to the power of these waves with bad results which included many getting hurt(although not seriously),wardrobe malfunctions,and even little childern getting dragged out into the water!I,m not saying stay out of the water,but a little common sense is in order. the hula entertainment seemed to get better towards the weekend and was then worth watching.the tiki bar was worth checking out and is almost allways full.if you are 20 somethings and are looking for late night partying,this resort or kannapali in general is probably not for you as by 10.45 p.m. this place gets very quite as does all of kaanapali (including whalers village).try lahaina? In general,we loved this place.we always look for value when we travel thereby allowing us to travel more often and that is what we received here.the staff were nothing short of fantastic,the food above average,and if relaxation and beauty are what you are looking for,this is your place! p.s. take in the magic dinner show(again located on site).it was truly entertaining(and funny)and the family that does the show has a true passion for there craft. The true mark of a good resort for me is wether i would return,in this case it is a big yes,enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Beach, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: laumas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 2-2-2012 to 2-8-2012. Hotel is a bit aged, but is clean and everything worked. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room had a balcony, safe, iron, refrigerator, hair dryer. Shower worked OK, but takes a little while to drain. Provide a cord for plug-in internet access for $9.95 for 24 hours, but I was able to connect to a free wifi connection from my room (not from the hotel). TV is a tube type 25 inch. The breakfast buffet is offered as a part of a package or pay as you go. It was adequate, but very overpriced at $19.95 pp, standard fare of fruit, eggs, sausage and bacon.. Most Hotels in the area are even more expensive for Breakfast, Better to go to nearby CJ's or a short drive to Lahania for breakfast. Breakfast much less expensive and much better. There is no natural shade on the beach. You can rent an umbrella/lounge chairs or cabana for $30 per day, or you can go by the pool where there are plenty of chairs and tree shade. Pool is mediocre (smaller than most resorts). Towels are provide at no charge on beach or pool. Alcohol is not allowed on beach, but I think this is a law Maui-wide. Tiki Bar, and Snack Shack are adequate, but small. The restaurant is just OK, with much better options in nearby Lahania. All food in this area is very expensive, average is $30 for your base entree unless you go very early and get the early-bird specials. Parking is $9 per day self-park, unlimited in/out.

Reviews.Title: “First time there”
Reviews.Author: kathyfletchall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at this hotel Jan 2012 and really enjoyed ourselves. The place started with great staff, always helpful and very polite and ended the same way. The breakfast buffet was included in our stay and it was very delicious. We never had to wait for anything here, the staff always was available and so very polite. Our only problem, which was remedied after the first night, was our room type wasn't available (2 Queens instead of 1 King). After talking with the front desk people and our travel agent, the King was available the next day. The pool was pretty little, but it did the trick anyway. The beach is beautiful there so that was a big hit with us. We ate dinner in Lahaina every night, and it was really very convenient. The traffic in this area of Maui is terribly congested, but the beauty of the area made up for this. Since this was whale watching time, you could watch the whales jumping out of the water at any time of day right from your balcony. It was spectacular. We also did the magic show at the hotel, very fun with a great dinner too. The concierge there was very informative for us, and she suggested the "Feast at Lele in Lahaina, which was a total blast. Great food and great hula and dancing. We would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a redo”
Reviews.Author: Diana C
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here 4 nights from 1/28 through 2/1/2012. We came here from the Four Seasons on Lanai which was beautiful and wonderful, so we had been spoiled. When we walked into the lobby of the Kannapali Beach Hotel, we were very disappointed. It is small, boring, and dated. They gave us a room in the Molokai wing even though I had requested one in the newly renovated Kauai wing, but they had upgraded us to a partial ocean view room. It was very dreary and depressing. The hallways were narrow with low ceilings, and the best word to describe it was dreary. The rooms were decorated in brown and beige with dark blue and white bedspread. Why in the world wouldn't you use "pretty colors" in Hawaii? We went over to the Kauai wing and the hallways were taller and wider and it looked alot better, alothough still not "pretty". When we checked in, they said that we could be moved to Kauai wing in 2 days. However, we decided to go back and press the issue. We told them we would like to be moved or we wanted to leave the next morning. They then found us a room in the Kauai room which was much better. They bill themselves as "the most Hawaiian Hotel on Maui", however, in reality, I think that is just trying to put a nice spin on the fact that the hotel needs a serious redo. In their defense, the rates were probably significantly cheaper than the other hotels on the Kannapali Beach strip, but after you spend all the money and time and effort to get there, you want a nice place to stay. The hotel we came from on Lanai was about $15.00 more per night and 20 times nicer. They charge for beach chairs, etc not so in Lanai. We ate 3 meals there and all 3 were average or below. My husband said he liked his meal okay the first night, however. And the prices were not cheap. We did the Sunday buffet brunch which was $39.00 each, and it was quanity over quality in my opinion. It was the most expensive meal we had on our trip but nowhere near the best. Plus, the service was terrible. I was having to get my own drinks, no one was checking on us to see if we needed refills, they were not clearing our used plates, etc. Yet, when the bill came, they were suggesting your tip which was over 20%. It was a buffet for pete's sake and the service was terrible. The people are nice but they don't know good service. On the pro side, the hotel is well located and our room ended up being convenient. The people at the concerige desk were nice. We had not been to Maui in 27 years and I could not believe how much more "crowded" it was and over built. They are turning paradise into a concrete jungle. I prefer less crowded beach areas. Lanai was alot nicer for about the same price, although Maui is still beautiful. Can't beat the sunsets on Kaanapali Beach. We did not have a car there, they were sold out, so we had to use the bus. Another good thing about this hotel is it is near Whaler's Village which has a bus stop. For 2 bucks, you can hop on and off all day and it worked okay. If we went back, I might just get a car for part of the days when we wanted to drive far away. This was a significant savings. We went on a whale watch with Pacific Whale Foundation. A piece of advice. Go early and join the foundation. You get a free admission and a free tee shirt plus priorirty boarding, etc., and it all totals about what you would pay for one admission. I didn't realize this until after we were already on the boat. If I went back to Kannapali Beach, I would try to stay at the Sheraton, the Hyatt or the Westin. They all were very nice in terms of their grounds and lobby, but I did not see the rooms. I probably would not go back to this hotel unless I knew they had had a serious redo.

Reviews.Title: “Basic resort with great location”
Reviews.Author: Sydneymum09
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly basic place in comparison to many other hotels in the area. The location and views are great, but the interior finishes and general vibe had quite a dated feel. We found the food over priced and not really to our tastes - once again, it felt like we were back in the 1970's. The pool is basic , but cutely whale-shaped. Our room was spacious and clean, with a gorgeous view over the ocean - seeing the whales spout from the lanai was a highlight of our trip. The luhau we attended at the Royal Lahaina, recommended by friendly staff, was great - and kids got in free. This is a pretty and friendly place, but not quite up to par for a really special holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Best value choice on this strip of resorts!”
Reviews.Author: Polar_Caver
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before booking here and ended up booking a beach front room a 3 nights. It was our 1st nights in Maui. The room was standard and nice, but the location could not have been beat. We only 50 yards at the most from he ocean and sound of the waves were worth every penny. The first morning we headed down on to the beach and went for a swim, we thought about renting some chairs but as we looked up at our room only feet away we decided to head back to our balcony. We did take in the welcome breakfast which was fun and we also took a free ukulele lesson the resort offered for free. We did walk up and down the walkway in the front that connects all the resorts all the name brand resorts seemed very polished and probably the reason they were more expensive, but for the price of one of their standard rooms our ocean front room was so much better. We are not very resort type people I don't like only having a couple of dining choices and a couple of bars to pick from, but as resorts go, this one was great. Great service and everyone was always smiling. I also liked to cost $9/day to park or Valet for $11, it was worth the extra $2 for sure. We did eat here the first night and it was really good, but it kind of felt like you were eating a gourmet dinner that was set-up to be served to 200 people all at once. It was tasty but seemed to be missing some of the personnel touch. We never tried the on sight pool, just seemed a little small especially compared to the mammoth pools of all the surrounding resorts, but really we didn't care since we were there for the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is a great ocean front property with an authentic feel!”
Reviews.Author: jjandaDICE
Reviews.Content: The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel has always been a go-to for us when visiting Maui; mostly because of the ocean-front location on the main drag in Kaâ€™anapali. Youâ€™re short walk from Whalerâ€™s Village where all the shopping and dining are, and black rock is just in front of the Sheraton, next door with Lahaina just minutes down the road. There are two restaurants on property but we usually ate at our favorite local eatery, Aloha Mixed Plate. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean but definitely dated, and the pool is a joke, but at least youâ€™re right on the sand! When in Maui, one should ALWAYS choose the beach over the pool anyways! The outdoor pool/tiki bar makes killer Mai Taiâ€™s and there were always â€œHawaiianâ€� activities happening on the property. Snorkeling gear, paddle boards, beach loungers, etc can also be rented in front of the hotel. The rooms are nice but again, dated and in need of some renovation. Theyâ€™re clean and will do if you spend minimal time in your room. King rooms also have a twin size day bed in them. Just a heads-up, they also do not have room service. We love this hotel and are usually low-maintenance when in Maui so the lack of amenity is not a big deal to us. We always return because the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel has great rates for the location.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Haze933
Reviews.Content: If relaxing is what you are looking for then this is the Hotel for you. It may not be one of the high end hotels on Maui, however, it is a perfect place to relax and take in one of the best Cultures in the world. This place prides themselves on making sure you know that Hawaii is not just a tourist destination, but a lifestyle with history. The staff was very friendly and accomadating. The bus stop to Lahania was a few steps from the hotel and were able to rent and drop off our Jeep from the hotel. On Sunday they held a worship service on the grounds that was a perfect fit for the scenery around us. The breakfast was included and included the typical favorites of eggs,bacon,totast etc. they also included some great Hawaiian foods as well.

Reviews.Title: “Our Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: michelle t
Reviews.Content: In November 2011 we stayed here for 6 nights after spending 4 nights in Oahu. We had the most wonderful welcome and our room upgraded to a partial Ocean view. We arrived on Thanksgiving afternoon and were invited to the evening dinner buffet. It was a great experience amazing food good value and we felt part of the American experience. The hotel was not a flash hotel like the others on the beach and that what we had stayed in Oahu however it was an it gave us a truly Hawaiian experience. We loved the welcome breakfast was worth going to and a nice touch. Plenty of activities during the day, me and my husband enjoyed Lei making and the pineapple cutting demonstration. The nightly Hula shows were great entertainment and free. Each evening we walked to the Whaler Village for dinner the Hula Grill had great food in the bar area the service in the restaurant was the worse we experienced in our whole trip if you eat there stick to the bar food. Each evening we would go back to the Tiki Bar we Suzette and Chantelle were great bartenders and very entertaining. We ate at the hotel one evening at surprisingly had the best meal that we had on the Island. Everyone who stayed at the hotel was friendly and there to have a good time, especially Larry and Rose. Most people we spoke to had stayed there before and had been coming back every year. If you go to Maui you must stay at this hotel if you really want to experience Hawaii the other hotels are just big chains that you can get anywhere. In summary if you go to Maui make sure you experience the Luau at the Hyatt, take a bus to Lahania, watch the Black Rock nightly show, sundown at the Hula Grill, do as many of the free activities that you can. Also make sure you arrange a shuttle from the airport if you donâ€™t hire a car. We got a Taxi from the airport and it cost just over 100 Dollars compared to 50 dollars on the way back in a shuttle. We had a wonderful honeymoon made more special by staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SHP7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location on Ka'anapali beach, It's a short walk to Whaler's Village, where you have lots of dining options (well, at least for a resort area) and shops (although, what is a Louis Vuitton doing here??). The hotel also fronts a beautiful sand beach that is large and lovely and close enough to Black Rock that you can walk there but not so close that this area of the beach is overly croweded. I've stayed at the Hyatt on Ka'anapali before and although that was a much nicer (newer) hotel, the location of the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel cannot be beat. The staff here is extremely warm and friendly and made our stay fantastic. We didn't really use the pool or eat at any of the restaurants on site so I can't really anything about that but we could see the pool from our balconey and although there were always people there, it seemed like you could easily get a chair whenever you wanted to. The rooms are a bit dated but totally clean and spacious and nice. No wifi though except in the common areas. All in all, a great stay. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location To Explore Maui”
Reviews.Author: Blakeman11
Reviews.Content: If you are unsure of an area or hotel to stay at on Maui this is it - the location is perfect. The hotel says it is the Hawaiian Experience and it is just that. It is relatively old fashioned but that suits the Hawaiian feel. However, in the area of Lahaina it is just beautiful around the West / North Western coast and a ideal place to start any tours. Make sure you hire a vehicle. Beaches are stunning, the surf is incredible, the sun shines and is just the right temperature. Would we go back - you better believe it!!!! We also travelled the road to Hana (an unbelievable experience) which took approx 3/4 hour to reach the start of the 50+ mile road trip. I could go on and on, but one thing is for sure, if this particular hotel turned out not to be your ideal, I can guarantee it will not spoil your trip. There is so much to see and do........ did I mention Haleakala - the trip up to 10,000 ft - the moonscape is something I will never ever forget - as I put in our photo album, just stunning!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old-fashioned Hawaiian hotel will charm you”
Reviews.Author: liveonthego
Reviews.Content: This place took me back to the '70s, but it is a nice hotel. The rooms are not fancy, but they are clean. The hotels grounds are beautifully kept, the beach is amazing and the staff is very friendly. The singer/ukulele entertainer on Saturday night was the best I heard on the Kaanapali strip. The restaurant food was good, but the service was a little slow. There seemed to be a lot of retired people. For $200 a night, you can't find a better bargain in Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Something Happening All the Time!”
Reviews.Author: kb4plh
Reviews.Content: My wife has stayed there twice and this waw my first time. GREAT service, GREAT location to get away and still be close and CONSTANTLY something to do. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jan.2012 on the 3rd floor of the maui wing. The room was clean and spacious with a king bed, the view was of the green area and of the pool. The ocean was in partial view around the trees. The bed was on the hard side but was comfortable, the tv was on the small side and the channels were not that clear and sound was not great. Didn't go to watch tv any way.The grounds are very well kept and had one of the largest green areas for sun tanning on the whole beach, pool is nice size and the kids love it as it has an end just the right depth for them. Food is comparable to all resturants in the area, if you want a cheaper breakfest go to whalers village downstairs and there is good food for reasonable prices. Nighty music and dancers were a nice touch and enjoyable, the staff were very helpful and friendly with all tours booked right in the hotel. From what we experenced you can not go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “true local experience”
Reviews.Author: michelle s
Reviews.Content: My family has s tayed here twice and we treated wonderful by the local staff who have worked here sometimes even danced in the free show the have when they were kids and their p[arents worked here. A great place with kids and many room on the kawaii wing have been updated. the beach is right ..take the classes which are free to enjoy and learn about the culture .. If you like the big fancy resorts please go there but for a truly hawaiian experience and a personal touch you cant do any better!

Reviews.Title: “A reasonably priced hotel in Kaanapali...”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Beach hotel is definitely the most Hawaiian hotel as they claim to be. The spirit of Aloha is exuded by all staff. They make you feel at home. The room rates are quite good for the area. The rooms are nothing special but are decent. The pool is a decent size and there are plenty of lounge chairs. The grounds are beautiful and perfect for laying out and reading. The value can't be beat, one can easily overspend in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own towels and chairs”
Reviews.Author: Ron5432180
Reviews.Content: When went to their beach, they ran out of towels and chairs and umbrellas that they rent. When we complained the had an oh well attitude. We had to go to the store and buy our own chairs. Hotel has about 400 rooms, but only about 20 chairs and umbrella to rent out.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccm21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kaanapali Beach hotel early Januaury 2011. It is an older hotel, slightly outdated, but the rooms are clean and serve the purpose. The location is unbeatable. Centered right in between Whalers Village and Black Rock on a pristine stretch of Kaanapali Beach, this is the ideal location. We enjoyed our trip so much last year that we are returning to Kaanapali beach Hotel again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Love and miss you all!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skimowoman
Reviews.Content: Not enough words can be said. No words can say HOW WONDERFUL!!! Staff are more than family. Wish we didn't rent a car... Cause we never wanted to leave. Wonderful wonderful!!! I'm a super clean freak and they passed the test. Miss you all see you next year. 3 kids had a blast and hubby was relaxed. Hardest working staff ever and always :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ka'anapali BH from Dec.23 - Jan. 2 and had a great experience. When we first walked into the lobby we were taken aback because it is, as mentioned by others, a bit "dated." However, the hotel is very well taken care of and the style becomes charming. The staff at this hotel were incredibly nice, after a couple of days we developed friendships with the staff and found ourselves to be at-home. The grounds were meticulously maintained and a pleasure. The staff at the Tiki bar were, for the most part, pretty good. Dale is the bomb and a local legend on island. I noticed after a few days that the Tiki Bar is the most popular bar in the hotel area for locals which, to me, says something about the hotel and staff. The breakfest is average at best. If your not getting a package that includes it then I'd eat in Lahaina 5mins away for $15 bucks cheaper. The only complaints I have of the hotel are rather small and I'd imagine other hotels do the same thing. They charge .75 cents to use the telephone, even on local calls. The money wasn't the issue here, I just found this to be a bit petty on their part. However, I'm sure other hotels are doing the same. Another issue I had is they charge a $1.50 per day to use the safe. Of course, it's optional so we just informed the front desk we had no intentions on using it but charges like these could easily be wrapped up into the room charges. Charge people an extra $10 bucks and allow us to use the phone and safe without trying to nickel and dime us. It's convenient, clean, and the staff here are great. I definitetly reccommend staying at this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gjjw
Reviews.Content: My family and I had the most beautiful room and great service here. We will return and definitely recomend you do the same! Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Comfort”
Reviews.Author: kdg01
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and service. Quiet and relaxing in Hawaiian style. A great break for us before Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Major Ant Problems Ruined My Stay”
Reviews.Author: km1372
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ka'anapali over Christmas this year, and had to change rooms twice during my six-day stay due to a major ant infestation in the Kauai wing of the hotel. While I enjoyed the third and final room of my stay, by that point it was too little, too late to rehab my opinion of the hotel. The grounds are delightful, but for $300 a night, they can afford an exterminator. Friends of mine stayed at the Westin next door, and that's where I plan to book for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely ocean front suite.”
Reviews.Author: SoCalMomOf3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the ocean front suite with our 3 kids, ages, 10, 19, and 21. The room was very spacious we had a comfortable queen bed and also a twin /day bed. The back room had a double as well as the brought in a roll away bed since my boys, on of them 6'3 didn't want to share a double bed. There was lots of closet space, though the shower was on the small side it sved it's purpose. There was a coffe pot and a mini refrigerator that came in handing for morning breakfast items on our Lanai. We had a ground floor unit that I loved since we could walk righ out to the Lanai as well as a grassy area where we could lounge in the Lounges chairs right outside our room. This is an older hotel without all the Resort amities so don't come expecting a fancy resort. The room did have a little of the older island hotel smell but overall the room was very clean. This is a hotel with a great location, rooms where you don't have to hike a mile to get to the beach. We loved sitting outside in the mornings and evenings watching the sun rise and set with views of Black Rock and of the island of Lanai. Staff was very helpful and friendly. We have stayed at 3 other resorts on this stretch of beach and this is now are favorite Ka'anapali beach hotel. Cose to Black Rock and Whalers Village, with a great view from our room.

Reviews.Title: “book direct for better rooms”
Reviews.Author: mrwtrskr
Reviews.Content: This is an older yet charming hotel in a great beach location. We booked through a 3rd party flight/hotel package broker and got stuck in one of the 20 or so rooms that face the back of the adjacent Sheraton whose guests are staring into your room. Couldnt switch because we didnt book direct we were told. Avoid these outward facing rooms at the back of the old building. Almost all the rest appear to look at the lovely grounds and at least partial ocean view. The staff is very helpful and friendly although some of the bar staff are a little past their prime. The older building has thin walls and small bathrooms but has been remodeled within the last few years. Our friends in one on the newer buildings had a much better room for about the same price. This is a semi-budget hotel but there is nothing cheap about the Kaanapali beach area. The hotel's restaurant is above average in quality and less expensive than the surroundinghotel's offerings.

Reviews.Title: “True Aloha Spirit”
Reviews.Author: willholts
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas 2011 with the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. I say with because the staff there do make you feel part of the family. Everyone there is really friendly and are geuinely happy to have you stay at the hotel. Our room, was recently renovated, clean and comfortable. The extra wide sliding door to the lanai made the room feel more spacious. We enjoyed the view of the grounds and Black Rock. Christmas Eve was memorable for a number of reasons. Our son sprained his ankle skim boarding. The staff at the hotel were extraordinarily helpful in making him comfortable until we could get him to urgent care. A special thankyou to the couple who helped get him off the beach. The evening became more memorable with the hotel presenting a very entertaining hula show. They did a great job considering the winds were knocking out the power that night. All in all we would certainly return to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel...we have to. We need to get some white kukuli nuts on our leis.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and comfortable and a bargain”
Reviews.Author: bdysrfr57
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here in Dec. 2011. I have absolutely no complaints or negative remarks. It was the least expensive hotel in Kaanapali, it was clean, the service was excellent and the rooms comfortable. They have many perks for return guests. We loved sitting on the lanai and listening to the live music from the Brunch on Sunday afternoon. The beach is amazing, great snorkeling, great walking and people watching. There were a lot of families with small children here and also older individuals.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Oceanfront on Ka'anapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: Kizzy1985
Reviews.Content: This was not our first trip to Maui, but was our first time staying at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel, and also our first time vacationing in Maui over Christmas. We traveled as a family of 5 with two adjoining oceanfront rooms. For the price, you cannot beat the level of accommodations and services provided by the KBH. This hotel is situated on the best beach in Maui; within walking distance to a variety of shops, restaurants and entertainment, and some of the best snorkeling is right outside your door at Black Rock. I did not get to see any of the other room categories in the hotel, but the oceanfront rooms were updated, roomy and super-clean. The special touches we received were a pleasant surprise: fruit and cheese plate in our room, turn down service with cookies each night, mid-trip in-room gift, a Christmas gift, and lei departure when we left. One of the many highlights of our trip was seeing Santa arrive Christmas morning via canoe! Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for it's warm employees, nightly entertainment, various free Hawaiian-themed classes and spectacular location. If you truly want a genuine Hawaiian vacation and to experience the Aloha of the local people, you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice based on overall value”
Reviews.Author: Scubadoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for a week during Christmas. This is a great hotel at a great location for the price. Itâ€™s not 5 stars but itâ€™s clean and well maintained. The place is comfortable in the common areas inside and out, not over-crowded or oversold. The grounds are landscaped nicely and kept up. Every day at the crack of dawn staff are out picking up anything that fell on the grounds over night and straightening the lounge chairs of which there were plenty. Our room was in good shape, clean, fresh, furnished well, nicely decorated with Hawaiian accents and not worn, everything worked, and had a mini-fridge and safe. Itâ€™s not newly built or newly renovated so there will likely be small imperfections to be found but you have to look for them. Sure, there are some places that could use a spot of paint here and there but they do attend to these things. They were actually painting some railings in the parking garage on the day we left. Hotel is made up of three interconnected buildings and one remote building with no elevators. The center building has only ocean view (straight ahead through the grounds) rooms (except lower ocean facing floors) with exterior corridors. Other buildings have interior corridors with rooms on both sides, ocean views at an angle and ocean may not be visible from deep inside the rooms, rooms on the opposite side are probably lowest rates with views of adjacent properties. What really stands out it the way all of the staff goes out to make everyone feel welcome and at home, and yes with the Hawaiian flare. We found Christmas presents in our room on Christmas. This was a return trip and with that we got a confirmed no-charge room upgrade with our reservation. We also opted for a package that included rental car, breakfast buffet, local phone calls, and room safe. This package basically gave us the breakfast, phone calls, and safe (normally $1.50/day) for free (after pricing car options separately). In addition, we got a welcome gift on the first day (nice big fruit and cheese platter) and another gift on the 6th day. The hotel gives out a kukui nut lei to guest when they leave and all of the staff have them as well. The nuts are brown to start and the staff gets a white nut for each year of service. Returning guests are asked to bring back their leis on return trips to get a white nut on each return. The hotel treats the staff as family which is evident by how many have been there for so many years and treats the guests as family as well. If something isn't quite right they will make it right and you won't get the "it's not my job response". The breakfast buffet was mid-sized but nothing too fancy and drinks are included. Would not have paid extra for this, or used it if not for the package but it seemed fine for many people eating there. There is an option at additional charge (with the package) to order cooked to order items. Likewise did not opt for the even larger Sunday Champagne brunch on this trip for about $40 pp. Had dinner at the Tikki Terrace restaurant once. Food was good and presented well and only a little pricy compared to similar offerings and quality at the offsite restaurants nearby. Sandwiches and burgers at the Tikki Bar were mediocre; prices are high but typical for the Maui area. Some may find the nightly free Hawaiian hula show on the terrace a bit corny but they try to keep it authentic rather than just another tourist event. Pros-Nice hotel for the price, great location, great beach No required hidden fees or â€œresortâ€� fees Cons- Parking and Internet is extra charge but typical for this area. Internet is wired. Beach chairs, umbrellas, cabanas for the beach are available for extra charge

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Soandso4321
Reviews.Content: We came around Christmas time, and while tourist bombs were going off at the big mega-hotels down the beach, ours remained quiet and relaxing. Compared to those chain resorts that we went by for dinner and events, the Ka'anapali is definitely more laid back, more Hawaiian, and just more pleasant. The rate is far better. They don't make you wear uncomfortable ID wristbands. The public grounds are (unlike other hotels) quiet and un-congested. The atmosphere is Hawaiian, but not to the point where it becomes tacky. Our room was right on the water, so we just left the sliding balcony door open all day and night, listening to the methodic churn of the ocean. The room was spacious, bright, and well decorated. The view was impeccable, especially the sunsets. The service was impressive. We would walk into the bathroom and literally shake piles of sand out of our clothes. There wasn't a grain left after they cleaned. For better or for worse, it would probably be easier to break through the wall than the bulletproof front doors that would close with a tremendous boom. You get used to it after a while, but some foam padding may be in order. The internet was not free, and used an ethernet cable rather than WiFi. This made it unusable for my computer that doesn't have one. I was annoyed at first, but became kind of glad because it was one less gadget to worry about. Whaler's village is a short walk away, which is great. We were able to domost of our X-mas shopping there. The Tiki Terrace restaurant at the hotel was very good, but still not as good as some of the independent restaurants. They gave a free luau show every night, which was a very nice way to end the day. When we got up early one morning we saw tons of people at the Westin, Marriott, and Hyatt staking out their beach chair for later, because it would become such a mob scene. It was total mayhem around there later. The decor at those hotels was over the top, and not even Hawaiian at times, like the Penguin enclosure in the Hyatt. The rates at those places were around 700 dollars a night. The Ka'anapali is very much a local business that hires locally, has Hawaiian owners, and has a stake in Maui itself. I avoid the Hotel-opolis' in a place with a fragile ecosystem, because they have no real stake in the future of the environment, or the economy, in that place. I would never consider another hotel on Maui. I fully intend to go back there again someday soon. p.s.- go swimming in the ocean in the morning, the water's really warm and it's deserted on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “An "Average" Hotel - don't expect resort services”
Reviews.Author: IndustryDoc
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the full resort experience with all the shops, spas, restaurants and amenities, then this hotel is not for you. But if you have plans to actually DO things during your Maui stay, then this may be the right choice. Average is the best I can say about the experience. The rooms are average - there was an average king bed, a "couch" that could double as a twin bed if needed, a balcony facing a condo building with an average partial eastern ocean view, and an abysmal bathroom that suggested memories of my Motel 6 experiences of the past. They chintzed on the shampoo, no cream rinse and only one pack of coffee per day. As we stayed during Christmas break due to a family function, it was high season, and there are many babies, kids and early teeners along with your slew of oldsters camped outside the pool area. The only in house restaurant is the open air Tiki Terrace, where they serve average quality menu meals and a really bad overpriced breakfast buffet. Skip it and go to LuLu's 5 miles down the road - excellent and half the price. The other aggravation was the never-ending Hawaiian "entertainment" - bad singers wailing Hawaiian songs and pre-pubescent dance troupes gyrating traditional dances badly. It gave us the impetus to leave and seek dinner elsewhere as fast as we could get out. But this place markets themselves as "Hawaii's most Hawaiian Hotel" so I guess you asked for it. It just really gets old after day 2. That said, we came to Maui for the diving, whales and other activities. We would leave as early as 5:00 AM and return late with no hassles. The paved beach walk gave us access to many of the other hotels' eateries and a rental car gets you into Lahaina. The parking garage was a good addition and easy access from our room. So we never stayed in the hotel or beach very long unless we were cleaning up or sleeping. Take that in mind, and the hotel is a better bargain than the other resorts. As lots of the dives leave from Kihei, if we ever come back this way we will check out that area for hotels and save ourselves a 50 mile commute each time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: annetho
Reviews.Content: There are a few issues but ultimately if you are on a budget, for the money, this place is worth it. I was concerned about the few negative reviews but it turned out to be okay and nice in many ways. Pros: Location Beach Garden Security managed to retrieve our back pack (had been stolen at the beach) with most of the contents Staff is nice Kauai Room 476 has a lovely view Cons: Balcony railing wobbled Bathroom needs a new shower curtain and toilet, bathroom floor and shower curtain rod need deep cleaning and water does not drain from tub fast enough No free wifi No free parking Other notes: If you don't have much time, I would go to either Hana or Haleakala but not both. We only had 5 full days so in hindsight I'd only give up one beach day to do a lot of driving. Drive up and down the coast to other snorkeling beaches instead. Also, be sure to look at the Banyan tree in old Lahaina, wow! Going to costco is okay but we ended up with too much of some stuff and Safeway is actually more practical with similar prices. Rent boogie boards and snorkel gear much cheaper than at the hotel down front street or next to cannery mall. If you need gifts get them at Longs and in Cannery Mall, where you can get t-shirts 4 for 20 bucks.There is also a cheap food court there. Also, next time I'd go to Molokini for a 2 hour 25 dollar snorkeling tour. The Royal Lahaina Luau is fantastic but there are cheaper ones that are probably also good.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second 10 day stay at KBH. Room 687, ocean front...listen to the waves all day and night...watch the palm trees, whales and boats from your lanai. Above all, this hotel has the "aloha" spirit..it isn't high end (no room service or amazing pool area), but lovely grounds (never a shortage of lounge chairs), nicely furnished rooms and great Hawaiian artwork and artifacts in the halls and lobby area. Can't say enough about the staff. I think they truly like their jobs! We have stayed at many of the high end hotels in Kaanapali and Wailea, but think we have found our "forever" place here. Don't miss the nightly entertainment when the staff performs..particularly Malahini, a gifted dancer and lovely representative of the Hawaiian spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with nightly entertainment”
Reviews.Author: stevedunn48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definately NOT a five start place, but it is clean and the staff is very nice. It is located on one of the best beaches in Maui, but it is a long way to get to many of the attractions such as the road to Hana/observatory. The nightly entertainment is a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: fusionrider06
Reviews.Content: my fiance and I stayed here for 9 nights. We have been to maui 2 times before this trip and always had walked by the kbh. This this time we made the choice to stay here and we were so happy with everything. If your looking for fancy its not the place but it is afordable and location location location. Best spot on kaanapali beach by far. Use your money on something besides a fancy hotel how.much time do you spend in the room anyways. Wish we could have stayed longer we will definiatly make a return trip to kbh

Reviews.Title: “Ok, place to stay, but the booking price is just the beginning”
Reviews.Author: DustyBottoms
Reviews.Content: The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel has an excellent location on Ka'anapali beach, near both Whalers Village and Black Rock. The hotel is ok, but could use some updating. The staff is very friendly and helpful, though there was a communication barrier with the housekeeping staff when I called to see if an item left behind had been found. The grounds are as expected beautiful and meticulously maintained. The big disappointment comes with the nickel and dime approach to the resort, not that others don't do that, but it is annoying. For instance, $9 per day to part, $1.50 per day to use the in-room safe, $9.95 to use the wireless internet - that only works near the pool and cafe, etc. It would be a refreshing change for Maui resorts to simply give the total cost at booking and include the things that most travelers expect.

Reviews.Title: “everything was perfect except the loud pastor on sunday morning”
Reviews.Author: dlm2010_12
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was very nice. The location is perfect and the guests and the staff are friendly. It is close to the Whaler's Village, restaurants, and the beach cannot be better. However, I would like to recommend that whoever leads the religious service early sunday morning in the area in front of the rooms tries to not be loud, as there are many guests in the hotel, with balconies facing the courtyard where this religious service takes place. I have nothing against the event itself, just would like to ask that it is done in a way that will not disturb the peace and quiet of the other guests. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: BBJT
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and we love it. My wife loves the daily crafts and I love the beach. You can't ask for a better location. We booked the planthat included a breakfast buffet and cannot complain of the value. The rooms are roomy and the staff are very caring and ensure that you have everything. We have no problem recommending this hotel and we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Enviable location with needed upgrades”
Reviews.Author: worldisabook
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an enviable location along the famed Kaanapali Beach. It was connected to the other hotels and the Whaler village with shops, restaurants and a food court via a narrow beachside boardwalk. This boardwalk did get pretty crowded in the mornings as the pedestrians had to share it with the joggers. The grounds were expansive and well manicured with plenty of plumeria trees.
