The pool area was a bit small for the hotel this size but the kids in our group all enjoyed it. A big hit with the kids was the giant checkerboard on the grounds. We mainly booked this hotel because friends from Oahu flew in to join us for the weekend and were able to get adjoining rooms with the Kaamaina or Hawaii resident rate. It was $50 less per night than their cheapest rate to the public. However, we all joked that they probably put all the residents who got this rate in their oldest rooms. We were in the Molokaâ€™i building. Our room had a balcony and a partial ocean view. The rooms were circa 1970â€²s Hawaiian dÃ©cor and could use some major updates despite the flat screen TV in the room. They were renovating a few rooms down the hall from ours so hopefully theyâ€™re bringing it into this century. It was clean and very spacious though. The beds were comfortable. There was a mini-refrigerator and an in-room safe (charge of $1.50 for the entire stay). There was nightly entertainment which we didnâ€™t have the chance to sit and watch. We did see some children preparing for a hula show on a Friday night. During the day, there were craft sellers in the lobby. Unfortunately, we were out exploring Maui so we didnâ€™t have the chance to take advantage of their free classes ranging from hula lessons to lei making. We were able to obtain the Aloha Passport for kids even though they were only able to participate in note card making. The guest relations staff wrote their names and their equivalent Hawaiian names. As we were waiting to checkout, we were presented with kukui nut shells which represent being part of their â€˜family/ohanaâ€™ and to wear it when we come back for special privileges. There was a convenience store by the entrance and there were restaurants within the hotel though a little bit pricey. The tiki grill was also expensive with $8 small mai tai drinks. Self-parking was $9 and valet parking was $11 which was a pretty good deal and they were fairly prompt. While the location and grounds were great and the programs were variable, we probably would not go back to this hotel unless the rooms were upgraded and updated.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, good value, & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: irishmama34
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for families, couples, and singles looking for a great Maui beach location and good value. Our daughter said she wouldn't choose it for a honeymoon because the other resorts can offer more ("lots of free honeymoon stuff", amenities, upgrades, perks, etc), but she liked it for our purposes (clean & comfortable place to sleep, shower & change for our beach, snorkeling, & sight-seeing; nice pool; delicious breakfast buffet). This hotel is the first (so oldest) of Kaanapali's resort hotels, but the beach is the best of any of the resort hotels at Kaanapali, plus close to Black Rock Point coral reef for some great snorkeling (including sea turtles, fish, & eels). The staff are super friendly and helpful - very "ohana" (a family) and proud of their long association with the hotel. They are also proud that the Kaanapali Beach Hotel is "the most Hawaiian" - and it's true. The big name resorts could be located anywhere in the world (they're always the same). This hotel is Hawaiian and offers Hawaiian activities so visitors can learn about Hawaiian culture. Our room was pleasant, clean, and comfortable (included a small fridge, too), not luxurious - but we came to spend our time outdoors. The rooms are no smoking and some of the buildings don't allow smoking on the balconies, either (thankfully). The garden grounds are lovely and beautifully maintained. The pool, tiki bar, snack hut, gift shop, etc were pleasant. There were plenty of chaise lounges at the pool, but if you require one at the beach, you have to rent it (also availble to rent are umbrellas & shade loungers - they give a discount for multiple day rentals). Towels for the pool & beach are provided at the hut (don't use your white room towels). The daily breakfast buffet is excellent (don't miss it) and we always chose to eat outside under the canopy (excellent choice). Skip the croissants & sweet rolls for their Hawaiian bread and their bread pudding which were like dessert. The pineapple & papya and scrambled eggs were fresh & delicious. Every evening had live music entertainment with dinner - we enjoyed dancing with each other and watching hula and other entertainers. We also enjoyed it from our balcony (lanai). The weekend also had live music at brunch. Go down to the beach at sunset - lovely. Sit on the beach after dark for some great star-gazing (we saw shooting/falling stars)! Go down to the beach for sunrise - look & enjoy both directions as the sunrise is actually behind the hotel & mountains beyond, but the clouds over the ocean also reflect the sunrise colors. The departure aloha ceremony is a nice touch - don't miss it (on the hour from 8-noon every morning). You won't have to buy yourself a bead lei in the souvenier shops, either. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: Located right on the best beach in Maui. Staff was excellent. Rooms a little dated but still nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value”
Reviews.Author: Firewife77
Reviews.Content: Hotel is older and doesn't offer amenities like Marriott or Sheraton, but grounds kept tidy and room seemed updated. Most hotels along Kaanapali have little or no beach. There's plenty of beach and close walk down beach to black rocks for great snorkeling. We got a garden view room which was really a view of the condos next door and construction items from next door. However we were on an upper floor so if we sat on the balcony, we did get a partial ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Very Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Huskercutie068
Reviews.Content: Our anniversary trip to Maui was fabulous all with the help of the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. Not only did they switch us to a king size bed room but took our limited amount of time and assisted us with planning our stay filled with those things that we had discussed doing before we got there! Their breakfast buffet and Thanksgiving meal were excellent! The view from our room and proximity to the ocean was AWESOME! Maybe a couple of updates on the elevators would be good but I won't knock my review for that as the hotel has been around for a little while. I would definitely stay here again!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this place...affordable and LOCATION, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Lynette F
Reviews.Content: Our third time to this property...they always make return guests feel welcomed and appreciated...we received a wonderful fruit plate on our first full day back. They also gave us a gift on our 4th day last year so not sure if we will see something this year as well. We can only comment on the BEACH Front rooms as that is where we have stayed each time. I'm a "hotel snob" so I am picky in regards to cleanliness and condition of room...each year our room has been clean and comfortable. Our vacation trip included hotel, car rental (high pressure sales at Budget rental counter at the airport so be ready for that and have a plan), two breakfast buffet coupons per day (food is pretty good and the seating in the courtyard is relaxing and pretty. The Ka'anapali Beach is the perfect place to relax, enjoy the beach (uncrowded and very expansive), snorkel (Black Rock has tons of fish AND turtles most mornings), good food (and not so good). The cleaning staff at KBH are wonderful (please be sure to tip them daily...cleaning up your mess is not easy)...some of the lobby staff is les welcoming but still FAR BETTER than many other options. FOR AFFORDABLE FUN, stay at KBH...aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous spot!”
Reviews.Author: MelRourke
Reviews.Content: We had 4 days here in Nov. We were upgraded to oceanfront room which despite not being the ultimate in luxury fittings, was really comfortable and just the perfect position. The balcony was a reasonable size and the view was to die for - all along the beach to the rocky point, where the snorkelling was great. I saw a couple of turtles and really colourful fish, the coral doesn't quite match the Great Barrier Reef but hey, you can't have everything! Short walk to the Whalers Village for food outlets, restaurants and shopping, also the little bus into Lahaina was handy. The hotel offered reasonable food, tho didn't eat there much. Had a good massage there too!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and spacious stay in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: orpheus123
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I spent the first few days of our honeymoon here and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel may seem like it needs some renovating (the rooms in particular) but the grounds are lovely, it has it's own very accessible and surprisingly quiet bit of beach. It is a very short walk to Whalers Village along the beachfront where there are some nice shops, and a few pleasant bars and restaurants. As mentioned, the rooms are a little dated but not unpleasant. Lots of space for luggage, coffee maker with complimentary Kona coffee, safe, fridge and a lovely hot shower. We had a private little balcony although we didn't use it. Breakfast was very good, lots of options and the service was good. We made good use of the valet parking which was only a couple of dollars more although the proximity to shops and restaurants meant that we had the option of not having to take the car just to get something to eat and also not being limited to the hotel restaurant. I'd definitely recommend this hotel if you want something fairly laid back and comfortable and don't need the frills of a luxury chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't stay here, you're stupid”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl319
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon in Maui and spent our entire time at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. In case you are wondering, this is the friendliest hotel on the planet! First, I would like to point out that this hotel has the best beach area of all the hotels on Ka'anapali Beach. As you go further down the beach gets smaller. And if you are a fan of snorkeling Black Rock (located right next store in front of the Sheraton)has excellent snorkeling. Go in the morning though because the waves get rougher as the day goes on. This hotel is perfect if all you are looking for is a clean place to shower and lay your head at night. If you are a "hotel snob" then you will hate it here. This place is simple, yet clean and the grounds are beautiful! The staff are among the friendliest people I have ever encountered. Our room attendant, Suzanne, was amazing! She talked to us everyday and always greeted us with a big smile! She always asked us how our day was and she was genuinely interested. I am a very practical person, and I would rather spend money elsewhere when I travel then on the hotel, where I spend very little time. This hotel was very reasonably priced for what you get. And you can't ask for a better location! I am not bothered if its is "outdated." I am not buying the place, I am simply renting it for a short period of time. We paid for a garden view room and we actually got a partial ocean view room which was a nice surprise! The ONLY problem I had with this hotel was the bed was very uncomfortable. But, that wasn't really a problem because we were so tired from the day's activities that we both slept well. We did get the breakfast package and I thought it was really good! It was nice to get up and go right to breakfast everyday. We ate in the TikKi Terrace one night for dinner and the food was also very good. They do have entertainment every night, but we really didn't sit down and watch any of the shows. You are also very close to Whaler's Village, which is a shopping area with a few restaurants. You can walk there from the hotel. Also, Lahaina is very close. This is where a lot of the shops and restaurants are. It takes about five minutes by car from the hotel. We had a car the whole time as well which was nice because we drove everywhere! We didn't have to take any tours because we had a car. If you have a car, definitely wake up at 2am and go and see the sunrise at Haleakula. Amazing! The road to Hana was very pretty as well, but if you get motion sickness or car sickness do not do it! Its $9 per day to park the car (w/o valet), but all of the hotels charge for this. In short, if you are like me, a practical person, who just wants a clean and quiet place to stay where you are not on top of other guests and also appreciate great customer service and a great location, then stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. If you enjoy blowing your money on material things then stay at the Grand Wailea (which is not close to anything) or you can send your money to me and I will make sure it goes to a good place :) Enjoy Maui!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best.”
Reviews.Author: Eliz9586
Reviews.Content: Great location, average service, old hard mattress with old bedding. The rooms need a facelift. The grounds are beautiful though. We were bothered by smokers above and next to our room despite having a non-smoking room. We called the front desk to confirm that we were in a non-smoking room, they offered no solution to our problem. We could not open our doors due to cigarette smoke. I would not stay here again despite the property's highlights.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne1954
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights & I wish it had been longer. the most Hawaiian hotel is not wrong. really chilled out here, pool was great & good shops & restaurants within easy walk along coastal promanade. Staff were great & entertainment was good too.Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Touring Hawaii and this was our hotel in Mauii”
Reviews.Author: CamsPig
Reviews.Content: Four days in Mauii for our Silver Wedding Anniversary and we were lucky enough to be staying here. A great location, excellent room, excellent staff, free Hawaiian entertainment in the evenings. Nicely located to be able to get to local restaurants and shops and overall a really pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “11-11-11 @ KBH”
Reviews.Author: Snowshoeman1
Reviews.Content: Wow! Crazy wind, big waves, lots of weddings, then calm, quite, hot, good snorkeling, great people watching, great location and setting. Spent 5 nights at KBH. Would I stay here again? Yes. But do not spend time in rooms. I like to backpack and don't mind pit toilets, so this was comfortable. My wife, not that happy with room. Old, worn beds ok ( remember i'm ok sleeping on the ground). But our room was 1 minute from an amazing beach and pool was fine. So I can overlook rodents in room at night. Once I got rid of any food in room the furry critters left us alone. Staff were great, but food at hotel restaurants...not so much. For cheap, ok food head up the hill a half mile to CJ's. Spend your time on beach or in water and this place is AMAZIING! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MommaBear541
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful vacation in Maui and stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel, largely because of reviews on Trip Advisor. We had a beautiful ocean front room for a very affordable price.The hotel is located on the widest, most beautiful stretch of Kaanapali Beach. The ocean is also the best for swimming -- free of rocks and coral. That cannot be said for other area hotels. Check out the satellite views before booking. The hotel markets itself as the "most Hawaiian" and I really liked the low-key atmosphere. There is a welcome breakfast ( not a timeshare promo) with a buffet, entertainment and info about Maui, and activities each day. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. That said, the hotel is not the fanciest. It was very clean, but a bit dated. If you are looking for multiple pools, a luxury lobby etc. this is not the place. Also, the Whalers next door is undergoing renovation and we could hear the construction during the day from our room, but we were never there anyway. Might be a factor if you have little kids napping. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: LindsayC00
Reviews.Content: Our room was in a great location with a view of the pool and ocean. This hotel could use a little lovin', but you get great value for the money. It is on a nice, swimmable beach, has a good pool, and a cute bar. The room cleanliness was fine, but some updates are definitely needed. The Whaler's shopping centre is a short walk away, along with some nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Needs TLC”
Reviews.Author: Sue V
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the staff is friendly, but this property is worn, torn, tired and in serious need of a refurb. Even a fresh coat of paint would help. This hotel is less expensive than other Kaanapali area hotels and I was trying to keep costs down. So, I was willing to overlook the peeling wallpaper, worn furniture and aged bathroom. But, a sleepless night on a rock-hard bed was the limit. We packed our bags, had our travel agent book another slightly more expensive hotel in the same area and we departed - never to return.

Reviews.Title: “Superb All Around Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JChtt
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Maui. Our travel agent rightly recommended KBH. We stayed 10 days. We thoroughly enjoyed the facility, the grounds, the staff, the ambiance. We were always treated royally. Everyone, and I do mean everyone were very courteous and always had a smile. This was our 31st wedding anniversary trip. The hotel had a bottle of champagne chilling in the refrigerator, and we received little gifts throughout our stay. The welcome breakfast was good, a very Hawaiian welcome; which gave good insight into island history. Sally who handled the Kupanaha magic show (we enjoyed it too) was special. We made a friend. Dale was really great at the Tiki Bar, so nice. The Tiki Grill served very delicious burgers. There were craft shows every day, cultural activities, and the nightly hula shows were different each night, and good. The Sunday champagne buffet was very good. The view was outstanding. The hotel grounds are maintained beautifully, and offered plenty of lounge chairs. The swimming pool was whale shaped. A short walk and you were on the beach. A slightly longer walk (Black Rock) and you are snorkeling with the fish, and sea turtles. A short walk in the other direction, and you were at Whaler's Village a nice shopping plaza. It was very evident why this hotel earned recognition as Hawaii's most Hawaiian hotel! When it was time to leave, there was a small ceremony where we received kukui nut leis. We became ohana (family). The cons are that you have to pay to park in the garage, and breakfast pricing was extremely high. We walked to Whaler's Village and paid quite a lot less. Regardless, when we make a return visit, we will definitely stay at KBH again. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Hawaii's most Hawaiian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slenda_Glenda
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Ka'Anapali Beach Hotel on Maui. Was originally going to stay at the Sheraton Hotel until I read reviews that you needed a packed lunch to get from your room to the pool and restaurant. We booked an oceanfront room with breakfast in the Kaua'i wing which had been renovated not that long ago. The room was more than adequate with 2 queen size beds on the 4th floor of 6 floors. The breakfast buffet was very good and the meals in the Tiki Terrace restaurant at night we exceptional. There was also free Hawaiian entertainment. We decided we should try a different restaurant at least once and went to the Cane and Taro at the Whaler's Village but found it not as good at the Tiki Terrace. In the foyer area in the mornings there was a small "market" set up with local people selling locally made souvenirs and clothes. The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is only a short stroll to a fantastic area for swimming and snorkelling. There is also a kiosk where you can hire all the snorkelling equipment. Another plus is that if you want to do a cruise the catamaran pulls up right at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. There is a free shuttle bus which connects all the hotels to the Whaler's Village shopping centre. However walking along the beach is a very pleasant experience and it only takes about 10 minutes tops to get to the shops. From the Whaler's Village you can catch the local bus for about $2.00 and this will take you to the historic town of Lahaina which is definitely worth a visit. We played golf on the Royal Ka'anapali Course after 1pm when the rate was discounted by 50%(also club hire 50% discount) The views were fabulous. Can recommend the Polynesie Cirque du Soleil which performs in the grounds of the Hyatt Hotel. the Hyatt Hotel's foyer is definitely worth a look. All in all turning to Ka'anapali is definitely back on my bucket list for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HONEYMOON!”
Reviews.Author: jryan0511
Reviews.Content: We had the best time here on our honeymoon! The breakfast buffet was delicious - i agree with some others that the selection can get old from day to day, but i still enjoyed it every day. The wait staff were always helpful and very pleasant. A walk to whalers village was def nice throughout the trip as it was only about 3 minutes on the walking trail.. The room was very spacious and comfortable - sleeping with the slider open to hear the waves was amazing! The beach was NEVER crowded and neither was the pool, there was always a place to put your things - you didn't have to get up early and reseve chairs. The food at the tiki terrace was great - although their selection was not huge, what they did make was very good! Our goodbye ceremony was a nice touch and the the lei bead program is a great bonus as i would love to imagine i will be back again someday :)

Reviews.Title: “KBH is the only hotel we'll stay at on Maui”
Reviews.Author: ericl1098
Reviews.Content: This was our second time since 2009 that my wife and I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. We can't wait to return. The KBH is not a 5-star hotel, but is a great place to stay. The staff at the hotel is amazing, everyone is very friendly and makes you feel like you are at home. Rooms are clean and the hotel is very well kept. The nightly Hawaiian music and hula dancing is great. We especially liked the show they hold on Tuesdays and Saturdays ... it was like a free luau and the performers were terrific. The Tiki Bar was my favorite bar on the Island. Dale, Chantel, Sue, the Tiki Bar bartenders, are so friendly and they make great drinks. The Tiki Terrace has an incredible Sunday Brunch that I recommend to all! Lastly, location of KBH is awesome. If you like to Snorkel, Black Rock is steps away up the beach. We saw tons of tropical fish, many turtles, and even some Spotted Ray's. We recommend renting gear from Maui Dive Shop vs. renting from a beach vendor. Renting from Maui Dive Shop was 1/4 the cost as renting from the beach vendor. I highly recommend the Ka'anpali Beach Hotel to anyone wanting a true Hawaiian flair to their Maui vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: DiRT73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights in September. It was an OK hotel, nothing fancy, but is clean and the staff are friendly. They have cultural activities including a free hula show and they have a restaurant as well as a â€˜grillâ€™ that serves burgers and the like which are very nice (I really enjoyed the burgers!). They also have a bar and a whale shaped pool. The beach location is very nice (although we couldn't go into the water due to surf conditions) and the cost is far less than some of the fancier hotels and resorts in the area. We were in the Molokai wing, which has 3 floors, but no lift. We were on the second floor. One of the staff took our bags up for us. I know heâ€™d be used to it, but I still felt a bit sorry for him! One thing I really appreciated after having been travelling for over a week was that they had a coin operated laundry in that building. It has one washing machine and two dryers. The dryers were not super (we split up our one washing machine load between them to get our clothes dry), but still better than nothing. Unfortunately we did not get a chance to do the cultural activities, but they looked interesting. We did attend the lei farewell ceremony, which was really lovely but if you are from Australia be aware that you cannot bring your Kukui nut leis back home - quarantine will take them and destroy them. So you can still take you lei from the hotel if you like, but you will only get to enjoy it while in Hawa'i. Below is a list of pros & cons for the hotel. Pros: Good location (nice beach area). Friendly & attentive staff. Clean and neat rooms. Free live shows of an evening and cultural activities. Laundry facilities. Close to shops (Whalers Village). Lovely lei farewell ceremony (optional). Relatively inexpensive Cons: An older hotel â€“ the walls are quite thin and you can hear your neighbours â€“ especially at night. Hard mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Becky2011_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in Oct and had a fabulous time! We arrived early yet our room was ready and had a bottle of champagne awaiting for us for our anniversary! We were made to feel very welcome, lots of free classes, excellent location of the beach and whalers village, and bus into the local town. We also tried scuba diving and enjoyed a trip to Hana, along with the magic show at the hotel and the local theatre show in the town, cant remember the name now, but was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “As always, the best on the island!”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalMankato
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from 5 nights at KBH. The staff are just wonderful! We chose to use the valet parking and were greeted with a smile daily by Bobby! He was always helpful in answering any questions we had. You can't stay here without visiting the Tiki Bar where you will meet Tom and Dale. These guys are fixtures at the KBH! Thanks guys, for always remembering our names and treating us like we've been friends forever! Thanks also to Roy who gave us a nice tour of the hotel and the gift bag filled with treats. I loved the KBH bag! It came in very handy for our many shopping excursions! This resort is in a perfect location and the grounds are immaculate. The rooms were pretty decent size with a coffee maker and a frig to keep our soda and beer cold! My one and only complaint is that it was always quite late in the day before housekeeping would come. More times than not, the housekeeper would leave behind half full cups of water that were sitting on the night stand, or on the table on the patio. My friend and I are both smokers, so would empty the astray into a bag, so as not to stink up the room. That bag was left outside on the patio and not removed. If you're planning on a luau, you simply MUST do the luau at The Westin....just down the beach from KBH. The show is amazing and the food is to DIE for!! All in all this is a great resort and I would reccomened it in a heartbeat....and I usually do!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but not as 'friendly' as we expected”
Reviews.Author: Abbi W
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks in October 2011 on our honeymoon. It is a very nice, clean and tidy hotel that is reasonably priced for the area. There are lots of free activities and the facilities are pretty comprehensive for a hotel of this size. Straight onto miles of open sand and easy access to lots of places to eat and drink without the need for a car. Having read reviews of this hotel before going we were expecting it to be smaller and the staff to be a lot friendlier, not just when it was time to pay a bill and they wanted a tip. The restaurant receipts have a tip calculator but for a buffet breakfast where the price is included in the room rate I resent being recommended to tip 17-23%, all the server did was bring a coffee pot to the table, clear 2 plates and bring the bill. I know tipping is different in the states to the UK but at a recommended minimum of $4.76/day (for 2 of us) this is big extra on the cost of a hotel. As this was a honeymoon we were informed by our travel agent that we would get a room upgrade and some kind of welcome gift (champagne or similar) but neither of these materialised and when we told any of the staff that it was our honeymoon we received glazed looks that assured us that we were no more special than the other hundreds of guests.

Reviews.Title: “1 Week at Kaanapali Beach Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: agabbymama11
Reviews.Content: Three generations (myself, my daughter and my granddaughter) enjoyed a weeks stay on Maui, it was totally awesome. There was some construction going on next door at The Whaler, but KBH can't control that. My only complaint at all, was the food prices. It was terribly expensive to eat anywhere. McDonalds and Burger King were about the only economical places to eat. We did go to the grocery store for snacks and drinks in the room. There is a mini-refrigerator in the room that we made use of. We picked up all the magazines at the airport, with lots of 2 for 1 coupons, but most restaurants were located in Lahaina, so had to drive to them. And even with the coupons, it cost around $10 pp to eat. Our Garden View room had plenty of storage & closet space and was a good sized room for the three of us. Decor was typical Hawaiian. Clean and comfortable beds. And the grounds were clean. We didn't see one crawling insect in the room or on the grounds. There were gnats, flies and bees, but again KBH can't really control those. The staff was so warm and welcoming, always a smile and "Aloha". Guests ranged from newlyweds to families to older folks (like myself). The Hawaiian activities were a nice plus (lei making, hula dancing lessons, ukulele lessons, language lessons, weaving lessons, cultural walk, etc. They even had a Snuba demonstration in the pool (which Kayla loved). All free. They have a Children's Passport Program and if the child participates in all the free activities, they get a small gift for each and when their passport is full, they get a KBH t-shirt. And from 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm they put on a Hula show every night free. You could order dinner or drinks or just sit and enjoy the show (Kayla danced the hula on-stage two different nights, she's really a ham). Every day from 8:00 am to 12:00 noon, they have local craft vendors in the lobby selling their wares. They have a free E-ticket kiosk for your boarding pass, and a small office area with two computers at 49 cents a minute for Internet access. They do have an activity desk, and they offer cabanas on the beach for a fee. A free Welcome Breakfast Buffet and a really nice "Aloha" Kukui nut lei Departure ceremony. They really make you feel wanted. And when you consider the neighboring hotels (Sheraton, Westin, Hyatt Regency) at $300+ per night for a garden view room, KBH at $149 was a real bargain. It's a 5 minute walk to Whaler's Village (lots of high end shops, Louis Vitton and Brighton as well as restaurants). And possibly the most beautiful beach right at the doorstep. Kaanapali Beach is a nice sandy strip of beach. We aren't much for the beach, prefer the pool (which was a nice size). No waterfalls or water slides, but Kayla loved it. She was always eager to go swimming the instant we returned to the hotel. Another thing I have to mention, that turns some folks off, but was a big plus for me, THEY ALLOW SMOKING. We had a ground floor room, with a lanai where I could smoke. And they have 4 smoking stations around the property, so I didn't feel like a leper. Smoking isn't allowed in the rooms or any of the public areas of the hotel or around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Bad to say!”
Reviews.Author: Molly H
Reviews.Content: My husban and I got married here in Oct 2011. We had an amazing time! The staff was so friendly and helpful and did so much more than I expected on our wedding day! Of course, we sprung for a partial ocean view and they upgraded us to ocean front which was beautiful This deffinitly isnt an amazing fancy hotel but for the price it is a bargain! The breakfast buffett is good, I would recommend getting it as part of your package becuase it is pricey otherwise. We didnt end up eating at the Tiki Bar, because there were lots of nice resturuants just a few minutes down the beach. We snorkled out in front of the hotel and saw amazing fish and sea turtles! What a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “A Pocket of "Real Hawai'i"”
Reviews.Author: Randy B
Reviews.Content: Hardly noticed among the "super-resorts" on Maui is a charming, clean, affordable, and (most importantly to me) Hawaiian hotel. The KÄ�'anapali Beach Hotel has opted not to add the huge swimming pool with water slides, or faux waterfalls with a swim-up bar, which make the other resorts sort of blend together. Instead, you will find a refreshing whale-shaped pool in the middle of a huge grassy courtyard scattered with much needed shade trees and Hawaiian artifacts. The beach front is about the best on Maui, just a few steps from your room. The real treasure of the hotel is its employees! Just sit in the lobby for a 20 minutes and you will feel like part of the family! I live just an hour drive from this hotel, but have made it a family tradition to spend a weekend there every November for the past 20 years. I will return next week, and of course indulge myself at the famous Sunday morning brunch!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, nice view”
Reviews.Author: doerrway
Reviews.Content: We returned from three weeks in our 50th state, and one of our most enjoyable portion was the stay at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. We were greeted warmly upon our arrival from Oahu, upgraded our room to a first-floor ocean view which really made our stay more enjoyable, and then we relaxed. The staff was friendly, the service good. Prices are higher throughout the Hawaiian Islands than on the mainland, but KBH was not out of line. Being on the beach, we took advantage of the beach walk that runs along the shoreline between the hotels, condos, and Whaler's Village. Extending almost 1 mile, we were able to leave our car parked and walk to most dinners, most shopping, and just for exercise. When we checked out, the staff give you a "going away" present of Kukui leis - and offer to add another nut when you come back to see them again. We would definitely do so.

Reviews.Title: “You Are Part of Ohana Here.... Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: esmeek
Reviews.Content: I truly felt part of the "family" or Ohana at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Although I did not take advantage of all of the great (and free!) amenities offered by the hotel, I SO enjoyed the kindness and friendliness of the staff, and their willingness to help and even their courtesy. Sooo nice to be greeted each and every moment with a friendly "Alohaaa!" by EVERYONE. It didn't matter if it was a housekeeper, a groundsman, a front desk person, a waiter.... whoever it was, they were SUPER friendly. The rooms were kept immaculate by our housekeeper, "Nena" and the grounds on the property were constantly being manicured. I remember at sunset seeing petals from some of the trees scattered all over the lawn. By sunrise, the petals were gone and all you saw was pure green grass. The rooms were large and comfortable. The views from the 5th floor were AMAZING. The luau shows were very nice also. The Tiki Grill had GREAT food and drinks. And the BUFFET BREAKFAST was FANTASTIC!!!! Definitely worth it to add it to your package. Then as if it everything wasn't great, they gave us a farewell ceremony and gave us all the "nut" leis as a goodbye. Just awesome. All in all, I LOVE this hotel and would DEFINITELY come back again and again!!! Mahalo and a hui hou!!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place on earth”
Reviews.Author: margyj60103
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another wonderful stay at KBH (#15 or so I think). A couple we met at the Tiki Bar has been coming to KBH for 31 years! We love everything about the hotel, from their stunning grounds with the many beautiful flowering trees, the great beach just steps away, and the Tiki Bar and nightly free Hawaiian entertainment. Most of all, we love the great people at KBH. Most, if not all, are native Hawaiians and they are very warm and genuine people. When we arrived, one of the staff in the lobby recognized us, gave us a big hug and said "welcome home". The location of the hotel is a few steps away from the Black Rock, a very good snorkeling spot. You can rent some snorkel gear right at the hotel and walk down to Black Rock. No need to take an expensive excursion to see seat turtles, stingray and many beautiful fish. This is an older hotel, but very clean and comfortable. If you are looking for a "luxury" hotel with fancy pools with water slides and luxury amenities, this is not your place. But if you are looking for a clean, comfortable room and a great experience, stay at KBH and you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in lush location”
Reviews.Author: Ross L
Reviews.Content: We last stayed here 14 yrs ago, rooms have been updated, grounds are meticulously maintained, miles of walking paths. I would recommend at least a "partial ocean view" room, rooms on the backside have dismal views. Breakfast buffet option is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Maui's most Hawaiian hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJW1941
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Kaanapali Beach Hotel each of the past five years & hope to return in 2012. It is a great place for us as my wife uses a mobility scooter & the accessibility of the area is just super. The staff at the hotel are well trained hospitable genuine Hawaiians that make you feel welcome & want you to return. Even the housekeeping staff are great! This is the only hotel we have ever stayed at that the maid gave my wife a hug on the day we were leaving. The facility is not new, but it is well maintained & updated as needed. You can spend more & find more luxury, but you will not find a better value & a better staff on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: read1623
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in September. The staff is very attentive and welcoming. Rooms are clean, but a bit outdated, at least the one we stayed in. The breakfast buffet is very good...lots to choose from and very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “4th Year that we have stayed”
Reviews.Author: macdowelln
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 times in the last few years in the month of October, It feels like home each time we return. We plan on returning each year going forward. The staff makes this hotel. They may not have a waterfall in the lobby, but the the smiles and hugs make this resort what the spirit of Hawaii is all about. The grounds are beautiful, the ocean is right in front, the food is very good, and the activities for all ages about Hawaiian culture are very interesting and worth while. You can lounge around the hotels green areas besides their clean pool or meet many interesting people at the Tiki Bar. We also enjoyed the nightly hula and Hawaiian music shows. You can walk the beach (or separate sidewalk) to one of the islands best shopping centers which includes 2 more top restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get better!”
Reviews.Author: Sue K
Reviews.Content: what a charming and perfect hotel. Staff amazing and attentive. Tiki Bar a great place to hang out for mai tais & onion rings. Partial ocean view would be oceanview for most hotels. My husband and I will definitely be visiting this little bit of Hawaiiana again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved KBH, great place! Loved the beach and friendly beach staff”
Reviews.Author: E J
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a week at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. First of all we loved to location on the west side right in Kaanapali close to shops, resturants, and most importantly the beach! All of the hotel staff was extremely friendly especially the beach attendants. We rented a cabana several days and enjoyed lounging on the beach watching the ocean waves with frequent stops to visit Dale at the tiki bar who fullfilled our liquid libation needs. We even rented a stand up paddle board and explored black rock for ourselves. The boys at triogy were very helpful giving us tips and even carried the boards to the water for us and helped us out when we were done. I highly recoomend this hotel! We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Old Hawaiian Style & Charm”
Reviews.Author: luxlisa
Reviews.Content: I wasn't very impressed with the lobby of this hotel, it was hot and looked outdated (mailboxes and world clocks!) but once we headed up to our room, I was pleasantly surprised! The hotel is older, and therefore, the rooms are larger! We were happy to find queen sized beds in the room (as opposed to the full size ones in Waikiki). The patio is really large - and pretty much all the rooms in the main building have ocean views - across the whale-shaped pool. The location is nice, the room was comfortable, and it was perfect for the amount of time we spent in it. I enjoyed the laid-back atmosphere here too. We rented snorkels and fins from the beach desk for $8/hour and saw sea turtles right off the black rock point. Would definitely say to try that while you're here! We blew a fuse in the room and maintenance was really quick to come and fix it for us, with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: orock25
Reviews.Content: Stay here for only three nights and wish we could have stayed forever. After reading the reviews here I was expecting the hotel to be a little run down and I didnâ€™t feel that to be the case. We loved the laid back Hawaiian feel of the place. The beach was amazing and the staff was always so helpful, cheerful, and perfect. We never saw anyone with a frown on their face. I could go on and on but the bottom line is weâ€™ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not Terrible, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: TravelsLI
Reviews.Content: Let me first start off by saying that we were in Hawaii for 2 weeks- first 7 nights at the Maui Marriott Ocean Club (beautiful-loved it) and then to Kauai for 4 nights at the Sheraron (another classy hotel) -Our last 3 nights were spent at the KBH- There is NO comparison to the other 2- staff was pleasant enough but the hotel is dated, "run down" and forget about "old fashioned Hawaii" as their ads indicate- just think OLD - the beach is beautiful in front of the property and their breakfast is acceptable(except for the many birds landing all over the tables and plates left there)- We had an ocean front room -beautiful view from our balcony but again the room was dated and "dingy" - the best thing about this hotel is the location and the price - But honestly in this case you really do get what you pay for- I would not stay here again unless some major renovations take place- There are MUCH nicer places to stay even for the 250 a night that we paid .

Reviews.Title: “Misleading advertisements and photo's”
Reviews.Author: alohaheidi
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved Hawaii overall, and Maui in particular. However, The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel was the worst experience. No one was mean or rude, the staff were perfectly fine. However the hotel and the grounds were pretty "dumpy" (for lack of better words right now). It all looked and smelled musty and old. They really need to do some major updating on this location. Also, we went to the on-site restaurant the day we arrived. They had *only* a pre-fixed menu (for Valentines Day) AND they didn't tell us until 20 minutes after we had ordered that the non-red meat options were all sold out. Seriously!? I don't eat red meat; and they didn't have any vegetarian options or any chicken or seafood options. Only red meat left. And they waited a full 20 minutes after we had ordered to bother to tell me this. That was very disturbing. I had to ask for the manager and they came up with a meal option that was not on the menu....but it really took advocacy on my part to get them to offer that. The Beach location was great. The buildings, grounds were in poor shape. They need to do renovations. I would highly suggest doing more research and finding a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Best staff ever"”
Reviews.Author: happygal42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel from Sept 22 to Oct.10. We were due to leave on the 29th of Sept., but because of a medical emergency, we had to extend our stay. The staff was so kind especially Daisy, Jenny, Hope and Salome the manager. My husband had to be taken by ambulance to Maui Memorial Hospital which was 25 miles away from the hotel.. When they found out they made me feel so special and taken care of. I had to stay by myself at the hotel and felt very safe. I could walk the grounds at night and go to the Whalers village to eat and shop. Never once did I feel alone with all the care and good wishes from the staff.Yes the Hotel is a little old, but has a charm about it. The rooms are quite nice and very clean, the bad reviews, I feel are unfounded. The grounds are beautiful, the beach sand is like powder. At black rock you can snorkel and see the giant sea turtles. I did not encounter one person who was in a bad mood, or not able to answer any of my questions. If you want a quiet, friendly, Hawaiian hotel, this is the one. I would go back in a heartbeat. The hotel is going through an upgrade so the rooms should be newer in some of the wings. The only knock I have is the t.v. a little outdated, but who watches that much t.v. when you are in paradise!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Four times to Maui, the only place that I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: Scottsterkel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love the location and the local flavor at KBH. I can't give an honest opinion on whether or not it's the "Most Hawaiian Hotel" since it's the only one on Maui that we've stayed at, but they do make you feel like you are in Hawaii. The rooms are nice, the staff is friendly, the beach is awesome. I love the kukui necklace that they give you upon your initial stay. When you stay with them again, they take your necklace and replace one of the brown kukui nuts with a white one. It's a simple little thing, but my wife and I always make sure that we pack our necklaces when we head to Maui. My only complaint is that when you go to there evening hula show and musical performance, they will not let you bring your own bottles of water. That's a bit ridiculous considering that we spend between $2500-3000 every time to stay at this hotel. My wife usually drinks water but I ALWAYS order a few mixed drinks, so they are getting money from us during the show. This is an outdoor show that many can watch from their balconies, yet if you are sitting in the serving area, they will not let you bring water (EVEN IF YOU PURCHASED THAT WATER AT THE HOTEL). That seems a bit ridiculous and petty. This hotel obviously treats there workers well, because there is very little turnover. We've been going to this hotel over the last 10 years and see many of the same workers that we saw our first time in 2001. When I've told some of the locals where we're staying, they all seem to really have respect for this place. If you are traveling to Maui for the first or even the fifth time, I highly recommend Kaanapali Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ShannBarn
Reviews.Content: This was me and my husband's first trip to Maui - we were in Hawaii for a wedding - and we decided to stay at this hotel because of the reviews on this site. It was a great decision! This hotel was great; everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The personnel called and set up a car rental for us for the next day, which was difficult because last minute car rental is hard to do on Maui. KBH is directly located on a breathtaking beach and they offer a free Luau with dinner. The room was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. We got a room with an ocean view and it was well worth it! Some of the reviews I read had said the hotel did not have a lot of amenities - which is true - but if you are a person who doesn't care about facials and massages you will love this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Made for a great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jaytee16
Reviews.Content: We spent the first week of our honeymoon here and we splurged and went with the Island Romance Package. My husband wasn't totally convinced it would be worth it, but he was really impressed when we actually got there! The package was definitely more worth it than many "honeymoon packages" I had read at other hotels - the picnic basket alone won us over! It was amazing - could've fed a family 4 easily! The hotel had entertainment all the time - there was always music playing, the hula dancers at night were amazing - it was a great hotel! It's also a close drive to Lahaina, where we spent many evenings as there are great shops and restaurants. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “smoker's paradise”
Reviews.Author: ...agoodday
Reviews.Content: As non-smokers, we were among the minority of the guests at this hotel. All though we were supposedly on a non-smoking floor, smoke from the balconies next to us and below us was constantly drifting into our room, stinking up our clothes and suitcases. The staff half-heartedly offered to move us, but the question was to where? The entire hotel is dingy and run down, HOWEVER, the location is perfect -- central to everything, right on the beach and the famous Kaanapali beach path. That being said, the hotel is VERY noisy until quite late at night. The nightly entertainment seemed sort of sad, one night consisted of young children who appeared very tired, with forced smiles (seemed vaguely creepy....we left.... wondering why they were out so late on a school night)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kim W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here on our honeymoon, overall a great hotel. I loved the setup, the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable, loved the Hawaiian cultural activities offered daily! Best part of Ka'anapali beach is right on this property. Kid friendly, but also great for people without kids! The only think keeping me from giving a 5 is that they do not offer room service. In spite of that, if we ever go back to Maui, we plan to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Warm”
Reviews.Author: DanSyl
Reviews.Content: We love the Kaanapali Beach Hotel, we just spent our 6th visit there for the past 2 weeks. Everyone is so very friendly and truly make you feel like ohana (family). The staff are always very accommodating, we have requested the same ocean front room for every visit and have received it every time. The room is spacious and very clean. The atmosphere is very relaxed and not pretentious. Great views from the balcony. Does not have a fancy pool area, but that is not what we are looking for, we prefer an more open area that is more private and that is what KBH offers in it's yard. The location is perfect ... just a couple of minutes to Black Rock and a couple of minutes the other direction to Whaler's Village. They have local artisans everyday in the lobby with some very nice and quality products. It is very interesting talking with the vendors about how their products are made. Would like to recognize three people that have been there for years and provide excellent service: 1) Tom, at the Tiki Bar, always great service, 2) Dale, at the Tiki Bar, also great service and 3) Rosita, our housekeeper, she always did a wonderful job everyday cleaning the room and keeping it shiny and spotless for us. When you check out, they have a Lei presentation ... if you are returning you bring your original Lei and they exchange on of the dark nuts for a white nut ... we know have 5 white nuts in our Lei's ... and we plan to return to have additional added to them. Couple of suggestions: include the dally parking fee and daily safe rental fee into the price of the room, is a little frustrating to pay $9 a day to park and $1.50 a day to use the safe in the room. The daily breakfast buffet is disappointing for the price ... but the Sunday Brunch is very good. All in All, I would definitely recommend KBH. We will definitely be returning for our 7th visit.

Reviews.Title: “Tiki Bar”
Reviews.Author: maddy456
Reviews.Content: We have been to Hawaii over 10 times, we have been to the tiki bar outside by the pool /=-098several times. The service is terrible!!!! In fact last time when we went we asked if they served food they said the kitchen closed at 9pm, it was 8:45 and they closed the kitchen. Then we asked if we could see a drink menu, she handed us the menu then walked over to the other employees and talked to the other employees for about 10 minutes. I then walked over to her to see if we could order something and she said she would be right over to our table, again another 5 minutes went by, we decided to leave by then. Everytime we go there the service is TERRIBLE!!!! The only reason why we keep going back is the entertainment is really great. We did talk with the food manager and he offered his apologies and gave us his card for a free drink.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: deedle123
Reviews.Content: Was in Maui and stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for a week. Thanks to all the reviews here, we couldn't have picked a better place. I can't say enough about the people there, the atmosphere, the kind people that always had a smile. I can't imagine a better place to stay in Maui. A special thanks to Sherman, the Security person there who kept everything on the up and up. Thanks, Sherman for the wheelchair when we needed one! You deserve a raise. Since I left there, I've been thinking about going back there all the time - which says alot about how much we loved it there. Thanks to Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for a wonderful vacation. We're definitely coming back soon for the white nut on our necklace!

Reviews.Title: “Just right for us!”
Reviews.Author: betsytrot
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It has a laid back, relaxed kind of vibe. We had an ocean front room. The room was very spacious, with a large tiled area in the entry that was nice for throwing down our snorkel gear without worrying about the carpet. The furnishings were average, Hawaiian looking and in good repair. Yes, the bedspreads were a little faded, but that tells me that they wash them regularly! The beds were comfortable, housekeeping was friendly and thorough. The location is good because it is a short walk to the Whaler's village, a shopping area with a few restaurants. The hotel grounds were immaculate. The pool was small but I would never use a pool with the ocean so close, and the lack of water slides meant there weren't a lot of screaming kids around. I took the free ukulele lesson, and man oh man, I totally recommend it! It was about an hour, and we learned a LOT. The teacher was excellent. I picked up an ukulele when I got home! All in all, a wonderful stay in a warm, friendly, comfortable hotel. We spent the next week at the Grand Hyatt in Kauai and kept pining for this hotel! Will definitely come again"

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location just steps from the beach for travellers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: vderickson
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui after getting married there. We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and were really pleased with it. It has an intimate feel and it literally only takes you 5 minutes to walk out of your room and hit the beach. The room that we stayed in had a lanai (I think they all do) and you could sleep with the sliding door open and listen to the ocean and the breeze in the palms. We had family staying at the hotel as well and the 3 rooms varied slightly. My mom and sisters had a room in the same building but on the 1st floor and they said our pillows and mattress were much better. I think our room was 216. Ours was a "pool view" on the second floor of the Molokai section. We couldn't actually see the pool but that was fine for us. We spent most of our time on the beach or out in town. The hotel has a convenience store in the lobby area which sells beer and wine, a great alternative for people who don't want to buy a beer for $7. Rooms come with refrigerators as well so you can store your groceries. This hotel is a little outdated and if you are used to staying in mega-hotels, you will probably not like this one. I am the type of traveler who enjoys having a more authentic, close to the roots experience and KBH offers that in spades. After Maui, we went to Oahu and stayed at a 5 star hotel that was huge. It was just not as enjoyable to me and I felt like just another number rather than a valued guest. It took forever to get from our room, down the elevator, down the escalator, through the shopping area and finally out to the beach. One final aspect that was really nice is that our package came with a breakfast buffet everyday. That was great because you can pop down and get some of Hawaii's delicious fresh fruit as well as the typical buffet fare. The food isn't mind blowing but it's a real money and time saver and we really appreciated that. I would definitely stay at KBH again and would recommend it to anyone with the caveat that this is not a 5 star, mega hotel but more of a boutique hotel. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “7Days in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: baseballlwalt
Reviews.Content: After cruising the 4 major islands on the Norwegian Pride of America for a week we flew to Maui to relax for another week at this beautiful quaint older resort. We could not asked for a better place to just do whatever we wanted. The "Best of the Beach" package we had included a car for the week cabana for 3days and breakfast every morning. The room could use some modernizing but still very clean quiet and comfortable. We had top floor room facing the pool and beach FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon dreams”
Reviews.Author: oubliatrix
Reviews.Content: This hotel has heart, alot of it. It has a sense of Family without the feeling of it being overrun by children (we actually saw very few on our trip) Stop by the Tiki bar for one of Dales mai tais and make friends. The staff from the neighboring hotels hang out here. The nightly shows are free and blow any over-priced luau package anyday of the week. We will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal on Ka'anipali Beach”
Reviews.Author: peghaz
Reviews.Content: Our friends invited us to join them in running the Maui Marathon and suggested we stay at Ka'anipali Beach Hotel where they have been annual guests for many years. On prior trips to Hawaii, we always stayed in B&Bs and we were not sure we would like staying on Ka'anipali Beach or in a big hotel. But it was very convenient to the race start and finish at nearby Whaler's Village so we took a chance and booked a partial ocean view room with breakfast buffet. We were delighted with our 6th floor room that had a more generous ocean view than we expected, and discovered that our friends had referred us for a free upgrade. The hotel is located on the pretty beach, with a hedge between its grounds and the sand. Its gardens are stunning, but very natural (without the Disneyland quality of the nearby big-name chain hotels). Every day I selected a fallen plumeria bloom or two to tuck behind my ear. We enjoyed the nightly Hawaiian music, sometimes from our room's lanai, and took advantage of the on-site Tiki Bar and Tiki Terrace restaurant, where we sampled the traditional healthier Hawaiian Diet for dinner one evening. The breakfast buffet was generous and good, with fresh fruit, hot dishes (eggs, quiches, pancakes, delicious bread pudding, etc) and Japanese selections (miso soup, rice, etc). Many of the staff are very caring and down-to-earth people, some are local Hawaiians, who have been with the hotel for years.They are educated with the traditional culture of Hawaii and share their knowledge and experience with guests in complimentary classes and demonstrations. My husband signed up for an ukelele playing class and I took classes in lei making and lauhala weaving; all were excellent, small group experiences that contributed immensely to our visit. Finally, on our last morning we participated in the farewell ceremony when each guest receives a gift of a handmade kukui nut lei from staff member Malihini, who taught my lei classes. She explained how the ceremony was initiated after the 9/11 tragedy when guests were stranded there, and both staff and guests realized they are all part of one family. We tearfully accepted our leis from her and promised to return again for what was for us a surprisingly intimate visit on a very busy beach in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Never coming back here!”
Reviews.Author: LemurMan
Reviews.Content: Run down, bad service, lousy resort. As a sufferer of chronic leg pain, carrying my luggage up 3 floors of this run down hotel without elevators in this building set the tone. No bell men at the door to take our luggage. Check in was extremely slow, also. This place is sucks all around. The rooms are run down. The plumbing is so loud that whenever someone flushed a toilet in a near by room, it would wake me up in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Very Hawaiian”
Reviews.Author: MSteeves
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for two nights during our recent trip to Maui to attend a wedding at the Maui Sheraton next door. The room was nice, but nothing to brag about. The bed was extra soft, not my favorite. After being at the beach for a few days I was impressed with how well the staff manages to suck up the ridiculous amount of sand that you track into your room. The best part of the hotel is the beautiful grounds and the fact that it backs straight up ka'anapali beach which is AWESOME. When you check out they give you a kukui net lei, which was actually pretty cool. Overall, a good experience and we would stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ErinEKM
Reviews.Content: We are still here at the hotel and we don't want to leave! We have an ocean front room in the Molokai building and the view is unbelievable. The staff so is friendly and helpful, the grounds are beautiful, great location. The breakfast that was included with our room was good. Remember, it's a free breakfast so you're not going to get your eggs cooked to order but there is a buffet with a variety of fruits, breads, muffins, french toast, pancakes, scrambled eggs, hash, fish and a few other things that they rotate every day. We've walked up and down the beach here and there are some hotels that appear to be newer or a little more updated but none with the charm that this hotel has. It's close to anything you might want to do, walking distance to the Whaler's Village, short drive to Front Street. They have free activities you can participate in. I'm taking Hula lessons this afternoon. Parking is $9 a day or $11 for valet. The extra $2 is definitely worth it to have someone else worry about parking. Internet is $10 for 24 hours, which I kind of thought was a rip off but I guess that's the norm here on the Islands. There is a safe fee is $1.50 per day, which again I thought was a little absurd but if you need it, you can't really argue. The water pressure is nothing short of amazing, the blow dryer seems to be super-charged, which is important to me at least. The only thing we would say needs to be changed is the lighting in the shower area. It's tolerable but I wouldn't have minded if it were brighter. All in all, we've had a wonderful stay and are already trying to figure out when we can make it back.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Wedding”
Reviews.Author: owensam10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali at the start of September, our 2 nd trip to Hawaii, although it had been few years ago since our last visit! I picked it for my destination wedding, after organising with the wedding coordinator a year earlier. The hotel was a welcoming as we had remembered, a real Hawaiian hotel with an authentic feel! We HAD arrived in Hawaii. We went to our rooms, my party had a mixture of garden, pool and seafront rooms, all were of a good size and standard. Our room was a sea front view, wow what a view for sunset and sunrise!!!! Very comfortable rooms with amazingly comfy beds. Breakfasts were great lots of choice and sitting outside under a canopy was a joy in the mornings! A gorgeous stretch of beach to walk along, a short walk to the whalers village, with great restaurants such as hula grill and leilanas and shops to browse in. A pool that was a joy to relax around and a nice cocktail bar, to enjoy a mai tai or three.... We relaxed up to the wedding, visited lahaina which is a must, you can catch a bus from whalers village every hour. It's a lovely town, with the famous Banyan Tree in it's centre. Aswell as shops, bars and restaurants galore! We ate at kimos for my partners birthday, outside, it was lovely and great food! A luau is a must too, we went next door to the one at the Sheraton it was a lovely night. Good food and entertainment! There is also ones in lahaina itself and at the Hyatt Hotel. The wedding came, it was amazing, I was thrilled, the hotel did everything to make my wedding a dream come true!! We got married just before sunset and ate outside near the beach, memories I will never forget!! All in all this hotel is a lovely, relaxing and chilled place. With the Hawaiian feel you should experience whilst in Maui. Friendly and helpful staff around you wanted to make your holiday the best yet! There's a leaving ceremony on your last day, which is lovely as everyone receives a special necklace and a song is sang to bid you farewell and in hope you will return again. If you are thinking about a vacation in Hawaii go to Maui, stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Enjoy! Aloha! X

Reviews.Title: “Best low-key Hawaii hotel, serene, quiet, simple, friendly, relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Hellokim69
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel so far! We stayed at a slightly "fancier" hotel in Oahu so when we first checked in I thought KBH was roughing it, but after the first day I realized it was so much better than the big bells-and-whistles hotels. The vibe here is quiet and chill, they have a gorgeous courtyard of grass and trees and a pool. We usually hung by the pool where there is both shade and sun and lots of little birds and plumeria, and walked the 50 feet to the ocean to play in the waves. The KBH is located near the end of a strip of about 5 hotels, and there is a boardwalk that you can walk up and down and visit the different restaurants and shopping and most of all jump in the other hotel pools ;). Everyone is generally really cool and happy and it was always great to walk back to the most chill of all hotels and hang by our pool. We took a surfing lesson that you can sign up for at the KBH towel cabana and the instructor was awesome (Patrick)! Cool and not pretensious at all. Everyone we talked to (staff) was so genuine and nice. I highly recommend this Hawaii experience.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth returning to!”
Reviews.Author: children6
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 4 nights at this beautiful resort. Day one, they welcome you with a complimentary buffet breakfast and an introduction to the staff, amenities and activities available at the resort and in the area. The room was a basic hotel room but very clean and comfortable and a balcony with a very nice partial (nearly full) ocean view and view of the whale shaped swimming pool. Complimentary safe, parking was $9 per day self parking which was not bad for Hawaii. Internet was available but at a cost although you could print boarding passes up for free in the lobby. The guest services staff was exceptional! Loads of free activities with supplies provided, such as lei making, note card making, ukelele lessons, hula lessons, garden tour, and children had a special passport with activities for them as well. Free sunset hula show each evening with local talent...Exceptional!!!! Thank you to my lovely hula teacher and patient lei making teacher as well. :-) Every staff member treated you like special guests and made us feel right at home. Most beautiful beach with snorkeling right there. Towels available right near the beach. Beautiful sunsets at this spot!! Paved walkway along the beach to the Whalers Village with a free museum and lots of beautiful shops. This makes it possible for even wheelchair bound clients to enjoy strolling along the beach. Prices in hotel gift shop and lobby were reasonable. Non-Smoking property but plenty of safe areas for smokers that were not intrusive. Lawn and garden area is kept spotless! Staff come out and pick up all debris from trees and bushes each morning. The day you leave they hold a special farewell ceremony for you and present you with a beautiful kukui seed lei to keep and add to on each visit. We had a package that included breakfast buffet each day which saved us a lot on food. Lahaina (with the historical banyan tree in the Courthouse square filling the entire corner) wide is a short $1 ride away and well worth visiting. Many free parking spots in Lahaina and we always found one quickly. good restaurants at reasonable prices there too. The beach at this resort is one of the prettiest I have seen. I am not good at swimming in the ocean so really enjoyed the sparkling clean pool, but many guests were swimming and snorkeling. I would highly recommend this resort for friends, family and clients.

Reviews.Title: “Changed my Life”
Reviews.Author: Oceanview Please
Reviews.Content: I am sorry my review is so late; our stay was last year during the tsunami. We stayed 7 days and wish it had been 7 years. We had a partial ocean view room that had a full ocean view with a pool and some other units in front of it. Snorkeling in their bay has been life changing for me, I donâ€™t get around well and seeing a guy with a cane in the surf was probably odd but the wonders 3 feet off your shore are true treasures. We spent a lot of our time driving the coast looking for small paths to the water; we were never disappointed and meet some of the nicest people on earth, one day we spent an entire afternoon just chatting with a local grandmother watching her grandson swimming in the small lagoonâ€¦ Yes you must do the obligatory luau with a Don Ho impersonator but you will still not be disappointed just knowing there is more to eat than poi. Ka'anapali I still miss you and even though the tsunami ruined out trip around the south of the island it only gives me an excuse to returnâ€¦ I carry a lot of metal parts in the old bod so I set off alarms so I had a hard time looking for someone to tip for the massage I received on our departure, but the kid took it in good humor. I think of your island, the people, and the hospitality often and often talk of our return, Thank you, Ka'anapal, Love you Mauiâ€¦ Go out and meet the people, you wonâ€™t regret itâ€¦ Oh and Hi â€œFredâ€�, the small red headed bird I shared my bagel and coffee with every morning watching the whales breachâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alissa78
Reviews.Content: We those this hotel because of the good reviews on trip advisor, and we did not regret it!!!! This hotel is cheaper than the others, but has the best location OF THEM ALL! The hotel call itself the most Hawaiian experience, and it really was. When we walked past the other hotels in the evening With all their noisy entertainment and touristy hula dance - we where so happy to be living on quiet Kanapali Beach Hotel. The staff is excellent and very helpful. When you arrive the arrange a welcome breakfast to tell you about all the opportunities Maui has to offer. The breakfast is simple, fruit, eggs, pastries, juice and so on â€“ but who cares, it gives you very good information about the things Maui has to offer. The hotel grounds is bountiful kept â€“ with palms, flowers and so on. There are lots of free chairs you can drag around and sit where you want. The hotel is located just by the fantastic beach and an excellent snorkeling point black Rock that has turtles and spotted eagle ray. We had a rooms on the 5 floor and had a view of the beach â€“ we had ordered partial sea view â€“ but when we arrived they gave us a free upgrade to a sea view. We had the most amazing view â€“ it was worth every penny. The rooms where great and had all the necessary things to keep you happy - we had a room with a king size bed and a queen bed (we just used it as a sofa) The hotel has the Tiki grill that makes tasty snacks during the day â€“ in the evening we took the short walk to whalers to find a restaurant, and there were lots to chose from. We used Trilogy for our 2 sailing trips around the island. They are the company the hotel recommends and they have an office almost on the hotel grounds by the beach. We sailed to Monakini to snorkel and on the way home we visited turtle town and snorkeled there also (we snorkeled with major sea turtles â€“ so cool) We also took a trip with them to Lanai (an island close to Maui) and had a very nice day. I must say it is a must to take the Monakini trip â€“ not so much the trip to Lanai But Trilogy was great - great boats â€“ great service â€“ good food and so on. And they donâ€™t bring as many people on board as the other companies. The day of our departure I was sick - and we got to stay in our room all day without any extra charge We loved the Kanapali Beach Hotel - and when we return to Maui we will be going back there no doubt. I understand why this hotel has so many people coming back year after year - this hotel just has something the bigger chain hotels donâ€™t!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Dalney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from an 8 day stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel where we had a wonderful time. The beach is beautiful and the location is perfect for a relaxing break or as a centre for visiting the local area. There is easy access to the local town, Lahiaina, which is a $1 bus ride away. There is typical Hawian entertainment every evening which we both enjoyed. If you are looking for an Hawian hotel, rather than the typical corporate complex, then this is the place to go. We are already planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and beach!”
Reviews.Author: hawkorange
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. It met our expectations in every way. The location is very good for getting out and exploring the rest of the island and is an easy walk to great shops and really good restaurants, but our favorite part was the beach! Wow! What a beautiful beach it is! Great for swimming and snorkeling. We had an amazing experience swimming with the turtles...It was probably the highlight of our trip! The hotel is actually much larger than I expected from looking at the website. Our room was very nice and clean. We really enjoyed the huge sliding glass doors out to the balcony. They let us enjoy our fantastic view! The nightly entertainment is very nice, service was always good and friendly. We made use of the guest laundry room and appreciated the convenience. I would highly recommend the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and hope to stay there again one day!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Globalcitizen12
Reviews.Content: One basic operational problem is breakfasts only start at 630 am, yet many activities in Maui start early. The restaurant staff are not at all interested in helping anyone requesting something to eat earlier than 630. We were asked to pay 6 dollars for 2 bananas!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: LIFEISGOODFORUS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2010 (not 2011). It is a lovely place. Everyone is so pleasant. When we first arrived the AC wasn't working but they sent someone up immediately to look at it. It did take a little time to fix it but we were O.K. with that because they got on it right away. Do go to the Welcome Breakfast. It is informational about the things you can book but no one pressures you to book anything. If you do the Road to Hana you should reserve the CD from the hotel to play along the way. Ask a day or two in advance. The nightly show is small be very nice. After a long day it is nice to relax and watch the show. The beach is only O.K. for swimming but just to the right of their beach is very nice for snorkling. If you walk down the boardwalk to the left there is a shopping area with restaurants. A very nice walk in the evening. We were very happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights, two different rooms and generally disappointed”
Reviews.Author: arobin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live on the big island and went to Maui to see visiting friends. All we needed was a clean and safe place to sleep and bathe. The first room we stayed in was in an older building...we had the pleasure of carrying out suitcases up the stairs a few flights to get to our room as there was no elevator in this building. The hallway carpet was OLD and disgusting. The mattress felt like it was from the 70's or 80's and the quilts looked like they had seen better days. The bathroom....ugh. Mildew stains on all the grouting...if there was actually grouting present. There was a lot of worn/broken grout. The room with the toilet and shower was no more than 30 inches wide and maybe 5-6 feet long. I am a petite woman and the shower felt claustrophobic for me. Had we not arrived to our room at 11:00PM, we would have moved BUT I somehow managed to fall asleep. We got a new room the following day that had clearly been redone sometime in the past 5-10 years and the mattress, although firm, was better than the first. The only reason the hotel does not get a 0 was because the second bedroom at least provided the basic clean hotel room. All this for the Kamaaina rate of about $130. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE do not stay here hoping for a reasonable choice for a honeymoon/romantic getaway....maybe if you are traveling with 2 kids and want to fit everyone in one room?

Reviews.Title: “NICE !!!”
Reviews.Author: ANTHONY G
Reviews.Content: Nice location, great staff the hotel is simple but will impress you with the level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous Week”
Reviews.Author: Susan3027
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just wish to thank you for another wonderful week at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We have traveled to many locations but always return to KBH as our "home away from home" for at least one week per year. It's so nice to see familiar faces each time we arrive. It says something about the management, that their employees are happy to remain there and they all make an effort to make sure each guest feels welcome. Aside from their wonderful hospitatlity, the Kaanapali Beach Hotel is located in one of the best places on Kaanapali Beach. Even though we get a rental car, we find that just about every activity or restuarant we are interested in, are all within walking distance, so we rarely move the car once we get there. The beach is one of the best, the snorkeling area is perfect, there are catarmaran sails right at the end of the beach, or a short walk to Whalers Village, and there are plenty of restaurants for everyone's taste. We strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who truly wants the "Hawaiian Experience". See you again, next year. Aloha, and Mahalo, Susan & Hugh Clarke
