Reviews.Title: “The most Hawaian hotel with a crapy restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Mraschio
Reviews.Content: Great location. Old school rooms with even older TV's. Staff was nice and efficient. The fine dining restaurant attached was horrible. The Tiki bar was great. No jacuzi.

Reviews.Title: “Will be returning in the future!”
Reviews.Author: jamher
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Beach Hotel was a great hotel! It was clean, the staff were all SOOO friendly and we always felt welcome. The pool is beautiful, the white sandy beach was amazing! Dale at the Tiki Bar makes a mean Mai Tai! Few of them and you are well on your way. These bartenders do not hold back on the booze, you get what you pay for! There is a convenience store attached to the hotel for snacks, sunscreen etc and prices aren't bad. Buffet breakfast is included every day and it is decent. It is worth the extra money to pay on top of your breakfast voucher for the Sunday Champagne Brunch. It was fantastic. The hotel is super close to Whaler's Village so our family ate at a different restaurant every night and it was about a 5 minute walk if that. If you are looking for a 5 star resort then this is not your hotel to stay at. The flooring is all carpet so the humidity gets trapped in it but it never bothered us. There is A/C that works as long as your lanai door is closed. The rooms are clean and there are adjoining rooms upon request for families. Upon our departure there was a lei ceremony where everyone gets their ku kui nut leis. Bring it back next time and they add a white nut to it for every return.

Reviews.Title: “had a ball”
Reviews.Author: elp1948
Reviews.Content: Wonderful trip--great food, entertainment; loved the magic show!!

Reviews.Title: “Now THIS is Hawaii!!!!”
Reviews.Author: catstewart
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited 4 islands on a 35th anniversary trip to Hawaii. We wanted to stay at this hotel because it was "the most Hawaiian hotel." We began our trip in Oahu; then stayed a few nights in Kauai. When we pulled up in front of this hotel, my husband said, "Now THIS is Hawaii!!" We were in the Maui building and it was a perfect location! We were on the second floor, so we had a view of the pool and the grounds and could see and hear the music every night from our lanai. (If we were to stay here again, we would ask for the 4th floor; you can see the ocean from there.) Our room was old Hawaii, but that was exactly what we wanted. Beautiful Hawaiian quilts. Even though it was an older hotel, it was clean and nice. The staff was wonderful! We especially liked the people downstairs who helped with excursions and the older gentlemen who booked my husband's golf at the Royal Kaanapali. Always very helpful and very kind! Everyone catered to what we wanted right down to the gift shop people. (We even had a gift from the hotel in our room since it was our anniversary...what a nice touch!) In one instance, I wanted to know how to say something in Hawaiian. The young lady was not sure, but she found out and made a point to find us and tell us the answer. The welcome breakfast was entertaining and informative. We had ideas of what to do since I had done a LOT of research before we came, but they also gave us helpful hints. The pool was nice. The dinner we had at the outside restaurant was fabulous! Music every night was great and entertaining. The magic dinner theatre was great! We loved the fact that each morning there were local vendors in the lobby. We were able to get real Hawaiian gifts for our family and ourselves! We had purchased breakfast vouchers, and we were unable to use 2 of them because of early morning activites. I would probably not purchase these again as we were not able to give them to anyone so they were wasted. The pool was great! Swimming in the ocean was fun, but it was winter and the waves were big and strong! The snorkeling was a little rough because of the wave action, but the view of Black Rock and the nightly diving ceremony was phenomenal. All in all it was an EXCELLENT value, and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed these time shares”
Reviews.Author: Correen B
Reviews.Content: It was great to have a view and the ability to go to the store and prepare food in the kitchen. We ate out dinners, but enjoyed breakfast and lunch in to save money. Not to mention on the alcohol.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casual relaxing hotel for great price”
Reviews.Author: judy S
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. For their reasonable prices,nightly free hula show and music, great restaurant, relaxing atmosphere, but if you come here, be prepared to be around lots of kids, this is a big family hotel. We are a couple in our mid 50s without young kids, but the relaxing atmosphere is great and snorkeling off turtle rock near by as wonderful. if you want a five star high end hotel, this is not for you. We are not night clubbers or dance clubbing people, we sure enjoy the relaxing outdoor music and hula show each night, patio full of folks including kids. they offer drinks and bar snacks during show, such as pizza, etc.. Pool is is small but nice!

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary Brunch”
Reviews.Author: ihitchhiker
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the better known brunches on the island. This very large venue was almost full. Food was present in abundance but - the offerins were rather common. The brunch was apparently quite popular, but this would not appeal to foodies. On the positive side, the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely loved this place”
Reviews.Author: twenty4hourdan
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 4 days here and it's quite simply the best hotel we've stayed in on a vacation. The customer service was the best we've experienced. From the time we checked in to the time we left we felt welcome and like they actually wanted us to be there. The location is fantastic. We had an Ocean Front room and the beach was just steps away. We enjoyed walking on the sidewalk that runs along the beach past all of the other resorts that neighbor the KBH. There were so many things to do that the hotel does for free... Ukelele lessons, hula lessons, lei making, weaving... hula demonstrations every night. It was hard to take advantage of everything. I can't imagine staying anywhere else when we're in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Eric F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in August for six nights. In summary, a decent older hotel located in an ideal location for a very reasonable price. Our room was called partial ocean view. Yes, we could see the ocean from the balcony through some trees but the view could have been a bit more ocean and a bit less of the grounds but we weren't in the room much anyway. Our room was decently decorated with comfy bed, old style tv, decent bathrroom, and small closet with a safe. The room was clean and the housekeeping staff cleaned it daily. I suggest getting a room facing the interior grounds otherwise you may be facing The Whaler next door with extensive remodeling going on which is loud. The grounds were very pretty with a nice green lawn and many pretty shade trees. You can grab a couple lounge chairs and find a shady spot to relax, read, etc. This is a nice feature and not sure if other hotels in the area allow you to do this. The pool was smaller but is was clean and we only used the pool once since we the ocean was just steps away. The gounds and pool area were never overcrowded and we were always able to find a lounge chair. Our vacation reservation included daily buffet breakfast which we enjoyed each morning. Plenty of fresh fruit daily and breakfast choices such as eggs, pancakes, waffles, bacon, cererals, pastries, etc. The food was good. One of the best features of the hotel is the location. Right on Kaanapali beach. A very pretty beach with a friendly sand bottom so don't have to worry about cutting your feet on coral. Walk not even five minutes to the right and you're snorkeling at Black Rock. Walk not even five minutes to the the left and you're at Whaler's Village for shopping and restaurants. If one just wanted to relax and enjoy the hotal and beach you wouldn't even have to drive a car during your stay. The hotel also provides daily free Hawaii'n classes such as hula dancing and ukelele lessons which we enjoyed. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful though a few could have been a bit more friendly. This hotel is not a luxury 4 or 5 star hotel. It is a nice 3+ star hotel in an excellent location for a very reasonable price. You can get a good deal through Costco and include the breakfast buffet and a rental car. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hawaiian, Would Choose other hotels in area if we come back”
Reviews.Author: tngirl888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon. Maui was the 2nd island we visited. Compared to our hotel in Kauai, this hotel was much more dated. I get that they want to be â€œHawaiianâ€�, but they could update the furnishings and bed and still have the same feel. We had an partial ocean view room, but could only see a sliver of water because we were on the 2nd floor behind some trees. One other note to honeymooners- this is a VERY family friendly hotel with only one pool. We love children, but after getting up to see the sunrise we just wanted to relax and sleep by the pool. It was difficult to do with the cannonball competition at the pool by a few children with little supervision. We loved the location! Quick walk to the Whalerâ€™s Village was so nice. From there we often took the shuttle to Lahaina. The staff was friendly and mostly helpful. As part of our package, we had free tickets to the magic show at the hotel, but the performers decided to take a week vacation the week we were there. The staff at the hotel treated us to a meal because of the inconvenience. I also did the lei making class, which was fun.

Reviews.Title: “What a relaxing place!”
Reviews.Author: missnahardy
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Maui after reading mixed reviews about this hotel. I had hesitations but as soon as I arrived at the hotel those hesitations went away! The best part of this hotel is that it's not like a concrete jungle like some hotels. It has a massive garden setting and you aren't crammed in like sardines. You can peacefully read a book under the frangipani trees, take a dip in the pool or grab a snack at the tiki bar (The calamari is awesome!) The rooms aren't too bad, a little dated, but they are clean and comfortable and house keeping comes religiously everyday. Staff are very friendly, always saying aloha when they walk past and previous comments are correct in saying that some people from the neighbouring hotels pop in because it's so different to any of the hotels on the Ka'anapali strip.

Reviews.Title: “It was fun.”
Reviews.Author: trvlnfun21
Reviews.Content: I won this trip through the local radio station. The people at the hotel were very friendly. It is more of a relaxed, nothing fancy, atmosphere. Their courtyard area was beautiful and the beach was great too. The only thing we did not like is the fee rental for beach chairs and the bartender that would make you wait 15 minutes for your change when there was no one else at the bar but us. Frustrating. The room was clean. The housekeeper that we had was the nicest lady we encountered on our trip. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Andy W
Reviews.Content: The beauty of this hotel is that it has a charm and character that newer more modern hotels lack. The rooms were comfortable, the staff pleasant and helpful and the atmosphere and ambience combined to provide us with an extremely relaxed and enjoyable holiday. We liked the close proximity of shops and restaurants at whalers village a short pleasant stroll along the beachfront.We loved the beautifully maintained gardens where you could sit and look out onto the sea before going for a dip to cool off before coming back to your book, music or whatever on one the hotels comfortable loungers. Certainly worth hiring a car to get about the island to appreciate how truly beautiful it is and always looked forward to getting back to our balcony for an evening lager watching the sun go down over the sea before heading out for something to eat. Will certainly be back

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: GoTwins34
Reviews.Content: When going to Maui - particularly Kaanapali Beach - it's likely that you are going to spend a majority of your time at the beach or sightseeing. That's what makes the KBH perfect. It's right on the best beach on the island and by far the least expensive motel along the beach. The rooms were clean and plenty big and the pool was good enough (why stay by the pool when the ocean is that close?). Plenty of chairs were provided for those who wanted to stay near the pool. This is the second time we've stayed at the KBH and we've enjoyed both stays, mainly because of its proximity to Kaanapali Beach, which was a 60 second walk from our room. Pros of the motel: Right on the beach, clean, good service, plenty of parking, Whaler's Village is less than a five-minute walk away, Lahaina is just a five-minute drive away Cons: No grills to use for personal cooking

Reviews.Title: “Book it!”
Reviews.Author: cmearns20
Reviews.Content: Firstly a big huge thank you to Rance! His kindness and hard work saved our honeymoon after a missed flight sent me into a panic. He was calm, kind, friendly and very patient and understanding. I would return to the hotel again just for this member of staff! The hotel itself is clean, friendly and in a good location. The food and the cocktails are great and it's a good, fun, family feel to the resort! Would return again! Word of warning to Australian travels, during the leaving presentation the lei you receive can be brought back to Aus, however it must be declared and will cost $30 to be treated so you can keep it

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Welcoming Property”
Reviews.Author: Kathy C
Reviews.Content: My Family of four stay at this Hawaiian property for one week. I have twin sons that are 20 years old. This was a perfect location for many of the activities we wanted to experience. The grounds are lush and absolutly beautiful. We were able to snorkle at Black Rock several times and walk to Whalers Village for shopping and eating. The pool is small and very simple, but who is plannig to sit by a pool with one of the most spectacular beaches just steps away? This pool however is fun for small children. Our rooms were very comfortable and clean. We had wonderful ocean views. The service of the housekeeping staff was very friendly and gracious. We ate at the Tiki Grill and Tiki Terrace as well as had drinks at the Tiki Bar. The on site entertainment was enjoyable and relaxed. We had a fabulous time and the price fit our budget. I hope to return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Get Real, People!”
Reviews.Author: aldalebr
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another trip to Maui, celebrating our wedding anniversary at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. This was our SEVENTH yearly stay at this hotel, and hopefully not our last. Most of the Trip Advisor reviews are quite positive about this hotel, but a few recent negative ones need a response. The general consensus from reviewers is that the rooms are not as fancy as one might find down the beach. Do we honestly care that the rooms look like they are out of the 1970's??? Not at all!!! They are always clean, have the necessary furniture, towels, running water, a/c, etc.. We could care less that toothbrushes are not provided. In fact, in all of our travels to various hotels in the past few years, we have never seen toothbrushes provided. If you need a shower cap, try calling the front desk to see if they stock extras, or go to the deli/market located on the premises and buy one. One of the appeals of this hotel is that it offers great value, so I would not expect them to duplicate what the Outrigger on Oahu offers. The staff is most pleasant at this place, and everyone from the handyman to the maid to the front desk staff is always saying "aloha". Hotel grounds are immaculate and the bushes, trees, and flowers are gorgeous. We had specific requests, too, like for a king bed and a non-smoking floor. They have always honored these requests, but we are told up front that as much as they will try, they cannot promise with 100% certainty. Anyone who runs a hotel understands that various factors prevent absolute guarantees such as these. Our breakfast was "complimentary", that is, we received daily coupons for the buffet. This was included in the price of our room, but you had to reserve a room with this option included. If you didn't, then of course you won't get a free breakfast! Just know what you are reserving ahead of time, and there won't be a problem at check-in. And finally, we found the front desk staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. During our entire stay, we felt we were treated royally. This hotel is a true gem in a perfect location. If you want a hotel with fancy everything and thousands of other guests, stay elsewhere. If you want a clean, safe, and secure environment, fewer crowds, and don't want to pay exorbitant prices for "fluff", then stay at this beautiful Hawaiian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: Maui Coconut
Reviews.Content: Though we live on Maui, we decided to celebrate our wedding anniversary by booking a weekend getaway to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. It turned out to be so much more than we expected. We had a room in the Kauai wing that overlooked the courtyard and a bit of an ocean view. The room was large and it was nice to have a fridge/coffeemaker. The bathroom is pretty small but the tub/shower itself was roomy and everything was well maintained. Loved the fact that the room amenities (soaps/lotion etc) were all made in Hawaii. Best part is that the rooms are steps from the ocean, no need to take a long walk through a lobby, past a restaurant etc in order to get to the beach. The location of the hotel is fantastic as the swimming/snorkeling right off the beach is wonderful. The other plus is the fact that their courtyard area is peaceful and relaxing with sunny/shady options for lounging. Yep, there's no pool slide or water bridges but that also means no fighting for lounge chairs, no being elbow to elbow with other guests or inhaling someone elses sunscreen spray. You can actually find a lounge chair you like, take it to a perfect spot and take a nap or have a private conversation - a nice surprise! There is a giant checker board in the courtyard and a pingpong table that families seem to be enjoying. Though our kids weren't with us , we thought about how that would be a much better option than the pay-for-play TV video games we've seen at other hotels. Another surpise, the staff was so friendly - seems that everyone was saying "hello" as we walked by - even the gardener who was kneeling in the plants looked up as we walked by. After a long day at the beach we grabbed snacks from the Tiki Grill - they were fast and food was good. We were there on Friday/Saturday and found they have free entertainment on Friday evenings so we had dinner at the Tiki Terrace and hung around a while to watch the show. It was music/hula with a local flavor. It was like a luau show (minus the firedancer) without a luau price. Can't beat it - for free! There was a good crowd watching the show - seemed like some folks walked over from neighboring hotels. If you choose not to eat at the hotel - it is an easy walk to Whaler's Village or neighboring hotels. We had breakfast at Cane & Taro twice and a dinner at Westin's Tropica. While our dinner at the Westin was wonderful, as we walked around the Westin we decided our weekend "home" at Kaanapali Beach was much more comfortable. If you need brass, glass, marble, stuffy shirts and lots of "things" to make your vacation special - perhaps you aren't a good match for this hotel. However, if you're looking for somewhere to really connect with a spouse or your family - a place where you can truly relax among nice people in comfortable surroundings,I'm sure you'll enjoy yourself as much as we did. So much that we've decided to make it a new annivesary tradition:)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, gorgeous gardens”
Reviews.Author: Coogeethree
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for a week. It was lovely...the room is a touch dated but everything was clean and worked perfectly. the real selling point of this hotel is the immaculate gardens and grounds. We had a pool view room so our lanai looked out onto the most gorgeous greenery, trees, flowers and manicured lawns. People were just chilling under the shade or by the pool...very relaxed. Another great feature is the Hawaiian activities they offer...for kids and adults and also the passport system for kids. Worked really well... I will agree with others that the food wasn't fantastic - we only ate at the Tiki Grill and it was heavily reliant on deep fried food. But it's not a restaurant per se, so I guess is geared at offering bar snacks only. The Hula shows and live music every night are fantastic. The hotel is in a great spot, walking distance to Whalers Village and with a beautiful beach right out the front close to Black Rock. Would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend. Staff were great too

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, would recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: Craig K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in august for a week as the final part of my honeymoon and was looking for a place to relax and take in Hawaii. And that exactly what i did. The staff are all lovely, made us feel really welcome and even had a complimentary bottle of champagne to our room to say congratulations on arrival. When we left they give us a parting gift (as they do to everyone) and give a traditional farewell. When they say they are the most traditional hawaii experience hotel i believe they really are. Its not as modern as its surrounding hotels buts thats what we were looking for. Ask for a pool or sea view room though! The location is perfect. Right near everything you need. The next town is only $1 on the bus and theres plenty to do and see. I would recommend hiring a car and seeing all the waterfalls and swimming in them, its cheaper and more personal than doing excursions to see them with loads of people. The beach is amazing and i could not believe you can swim with giant sea turtles everyday right on our doorstep. They turn up around black rock around 4pm everyday to feed and are amazing to swim with. The food at the hotel is great at the tiki grill by the pool but we only ate at the main restaurant once as its not brilliant and there are plenty of others that are much better only a few minutes stroll away. To sum up i would definitely recommend this place and i am positive i will be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “MANAGENT PLEASE READ: THE GOOD, THE BAD, THE UGLY”
Reviews.Author: ShaNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: As a former free lance travel writer this is an excellent hotel for the vaue, and if you don't mind staying in an outdated hotel where the rooms cannot compete with the likes of the more well known hotels in Maui I would go ahead and book this hotel knowing this in advance. The rooms are well kept, and the food is great, .The free nightly show is better then the one I paid $150.00 at the the Hilton in Waikiki. Too me, this show was the real deal and you can tell it evokes memories of Hawaii as it was in years past. Kudo's to the entertainment staff . Also, this hotel has many things going for itincluding the grounds, pool, beach,and if you book an oceanfront room as I did, the roaring surf will lull you to sleep, and when morning comes, the views from the room are truly amazing. My complaint, and I hope management reads this as well as the other 45 negative reviews, is with the front desk management and check in. I did not find the Aloha spirit with neither the male manager, nor the woman who checked me in. My request for a king size bed was not honored, nor was the complimentary breakfast honored too. If you read the guest services book it clearly states breakfast and orientation is included free. Management did nothing to smooth over this incident. And now to the owner of the hotel... You cannot run a hotel as if it is going out of business. Cutting back on small details such as one coffee pod per day, not honoring the complimentary breakfast orientation, holding back on bathroom products, such as no toothbrush, no shower cap, etc,. Please take a hint from the Outrigger Hotel in Waikiki, and read about how people rave about having these things. And, as for dinner. The food is above excellent, yet for two people serving one roll for dinner, and no more, shows you are watching the bottom line, and cutting back too much. As for the rooms, I believe some or all the complaints from others are real, and perhaps you should think about upgrading. Despite what I just said, this hotel is wonderful, and I encourage others to book it. Every hotel has a problem, but nothing that cannot be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ,let down by it's food and service”
Reviews.Author: ChrisK71
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, friendly staff and on a wonderful beach. The let down is the food and in particular the service. Stay here but eat elseware

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel on Beautiful Maui”
Reviews.Author: Yackswife
Reviews.Content: We went to Hawaii for our 40th anniversary, spending the first three nights in Honolulu and six nights at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel on Mauil. It's an older and not a luxurious hotel and the rooms need some updating but all in all it was an enjoyable place to stay. It's on a beautiful beach and the grounds are well maintained. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We stayed in an ocean view room that also overlooked the whale shaped pool. Our room was spacious including the bathroom and there was a small lanai. As I mentioned above the rooms do need some renovating but they were clean. There was entertainment every night on the Tiki Terrace. The Hawaiian music and hula dancers, especially watching the children, were enjoyable. The night of our anniversary we went on a dinner cruise. The food was good, not exceptional, but the ride itself and watching the amazinng sunset was well worth it. We rented a car which is definitely needed on Maui and intended on driving the famous Road to Hana. After speaking with other people, they suggested going with a tour and I'm so glad we did. We were picked up at our hotel early in the morning and returned almost 11 hours later. The driver was well informed, made numerous stops along the way, lunch was included and we spent the day with very nice people from other states, from Paris andeven Australia. We are so glad we let someone else do the driving, there are a lot of uneven and winding roads. It's a great trip, you really get to see Maui with the beautiful waterfalls and flowers. We did drive ourselves to see the Haleakala sunrise. Driving in the middle of the night, up this winding mountain 10,000 feet definitely is an experience. It's quite cold up there, a jacket and a blanket from our room barely kept us warm but feeling like you are on top of the world, watching the sun to come up was amazing. Don't know if I would do it again, but glad I did. I got to also spend my birthday on Maui, going to the Old Lahaina Luau. Very authentic and very entertaining. It was a wonderful evening. We also attended a dinner show at our hotel featuring a great magician, a show we highly recommend. The Kaanapali Beach Hotel is a lovely place to stay. On the day of our departure we were invited to a farewell ceremony with other departing guests at which we were presented with leis made of beads. It was truly a warm and memorable moment, marking the end of a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hang loose at the Ka'anapali beach hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rosslyn M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting Maui for 6 nights. I will be honest, that my first impression of the hotel was that it was in some serious need of some modernisation as the rooms look like they have been stuck in a time-warp! But they were clean, and fresh towels and room cleaned every day. However, after meeting the bar staff and chatting with a few people staying there, we soon settled in. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and really made you get in to the Hawaiian way. The free Hawaiian activities that the hotel offered were really fun. There were always plenty of loungers by the pool area, and the beach is right on the door step. There are also plenty of restaurants within walking distance from the hotel at the Whalers Village, or you can also jump on the shuttle bus at the whaler village for $1 an pop into Lahaina town. Love, Love, Loved it! Mahalo to all the staff at the Ka'anapali beach hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Billed as the "most Hawaiian" and lives up to that. We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: nubievagabond
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not new, but the ambiance is very Hawaiian. Lots of trees, flowers, serenity. The staff was great, and our room had a great view of the beach. Snorkeling just a ways down the beach was excellent. We saw turtles every day. The sunset from here was lovely. If you stay here you won't be disappointed unless you're expecting a lot of "glitz."

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the location”
Reviews.Author: angeltiff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a friends wedding and was happily pleased. Their wedding was right out on the lawn with the view of the beach in the background. One of our most memorable trips with our friends. About the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel... Location: Great location... 5 minute drive from the main area of Lahaina, 5 minute walk to Black Rock and decent snorkling... and most obviously thumbs up for beachfront property. Property: You can tell that Ka'anapali is a privately owned hotel. They keep the property maintained, not too many frills, but it's Hawaii.... not many frills are needed! Only downfall is that I stayed in one of the older buildings on the 4rd floor without an elevator. I'm 30 and so is my husband, so it wasn't too big a deal for us to lug our suitcases up... but definitely would use the belldesk if needed. It can be a bit of a walk and climb to your room. Parking: $9/day... what a deal. Property all over Hawaii doesn't come by cheap, so when I heard parking was under $10 a day... I knew I was going to rent a car. Rates: You can't beat the rates at this place. For the location, quality and price, I was very pleased. Yes you can stay at resorts that cost more, but you're in Hawaii, I basically used my room as a place to store my belongings and sleep. Aside from that I was always out and about. Tip for guests: If youre celebrating a honeymoon, anniversary... mention it at the front desk and you might get a free bottle of champagne. My anniversary fell on our trip and so it was a nice treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: gardenlover22
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 30th Anniversary in Maui at the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel. This trip was our first time in Hawaii. That was the best choice I made after reading a lots of reviews during my research. Our room and the whole hotel were clean and comfortable with very friendly staff. A bottle of Champaign waited us in the fridge as complements from the hotel Manager with a nice card. They also upgraded our room for a better view for no charge. The hotel is located in the west side of Maui on the row of expensive hotels. We had dinner at the Tiki Grill at the hotel; the fruit and salad was very fresh and good size. We found the breakfast too expensive for us at the hotel. The hotel is in walking distance from Whalerâ€™s Village where we walked several times to shop, to eat, to get entertainment. There is a nice museum located on the second floor. Every morning we woke up and walked on the beach which was quite and very peaceful. We didnâ€™t rented car during our visit, so we used Maui Shuttle service when we needed to go the Airport. Also we took a bus to go the Lahaina which is a very interesting little village. The bus was conveniently running hourly from Whalerâ€™s Village. At the Whalerâ€™s village I attended a free lei making class and free hula dance class which also available at the hotel with other interesting classes. Every night at the Hotel had great entertainment free and so much to do and learn there. We enjoyed the welcome breakfast where the hotelâ€™s employee were singing, the manager gave great presentation of what we can do there and around. The breakfast was extremely delicious full sit down breakfast. Before the guests leave they get an invitation to go to the lobby where we received beautiful lei from them as a present along with a nice Hawaiian song. The check out time is 11 A.M. but they did hold our luggage there because our flight was late at night. Do not miss to see the daily cliff diving ceremony at sunset at the Black Rock. Just walk to next door Sheraton Hotel. I recommend that before you go there go to the hotelâ€™s website and print out the Useful Hawaiian phrases and greetings. Before our trip, my husband learned the phrases and he was showing off with this knowledge on the Island. I found the hotelâ€™s website very useful and interesting.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent adventure”
Reviews.Author: tommitchell
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali hotel was excellent, great food great service and close to everything we chose to do. Like Arnie says "We'll be back"

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at great location but in need of a renovation”
Reviews.Author: HugoN83
Reviews.Content: We lived at the KBH for 7 nights during our honeymoon to Hawaii and we were generlally satisfied with our stay. The hotel's location is stunning, just by the famous Ka'anapali Beach and close to the beautiful but ridiculously over-crowded snorkle spot by the Black Rock. The hotel buildings were a lot less personal and inviting than we'd thought and are very much in need of a renovation. The tiny whale-shaped pool might have been impressing in the 60's but for today's standars simply to small and also a little dirty. We only swam there once. The hotel garden, however, was large, well groomed and really inviting with plenty of place either in the sun or in the shade. In comparison to the other artificially landscaped hotels neighbouring the KBH, this was a real treat. The staff was alright, but we didn't notice that much of their self-proclaimed "aloha spirit." In our opinion, the most aloha-spirit is to be found at the Outrigger Reef on the Beach in Waikiki. We'd paid extra for breakfast buffet which was meagre at the best. We advice future travelers to save their money for the hotel breakfast and instead have breakfast either in Waling village which is just around the corner, or drive to Lahaina. The hotel charged us $10 a day for internet access (no WiFi), $9 a day for parking and $1.50 for using the safe (!?). The room was old but serving its purpose and the balcony was large enough and we had a really beautiful view. The best parts with this hotel is the garden, the Tiki Bar by the pool, and that it is relatively cheap compared to its huge neighbours. For people searching for luxury and comfort, this is not the right place. Otherwise, you'll be fine here, though not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For The Money”
Reviews.Author: JeremyRiverside_CA
Reviews.Content: This place was great. Sure it is a tad dated, but they keep it very clean and it is located in one of the best spots on Maui. The staff was very friendly, and when we had a problem with the room keys and opening the door, they handled it like it was the biggest emergency ever, which made us feel great. I would not hesitate to recommend a stay here. Just make sure you ask for the breakfast coupon upon check in, and when you check out don't forget to get you kuikui(sp?) nuts which are awesome and free. We stayed in a partial ocean view on the bottom floor (try to get a second, or third florr for a better ocean view and to see the whale shped pool). In all honesty I cannot see how any room would not have an ocean view. It appeared to me that every room did.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly perfect”
Reviews.Author: Fordshire
Reviews.Content: This is only the 2nd review we have written for trip advisor - this review initiated as a response to ur stay, and other reviews! The hotel is perfect. So perfect that this is the 3rd time we have been here, travelling from the UK! The staff are so obliging,and friendly - and there are plenty of them! The facilities are stunning - and in keeping with Maui! the rooms are gorgeous - spacious and perfectly clean. The grounds alone are worth the visit - overlooking the ocean, and impeccably maintained. i coudl go on - but readers would get bored. The place is spot on for a tremendous holiday - and unworthy of previous critisism! Will be be back next year..... of course! Beg bugs - no Rude staff - no Faulty door keys - err..... well get it replaced! Construction near by..... a little maintainance of a hotel next door - wouldn't know it was going on if i hadn't read about it on here

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people wonderful location!!”
Reviews.Author: DrOllie
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect! The beach was incredible! Snorkeling by Black Rock was amazing! The restaurant is very good with excellent service and great food. My husband proposed to me while we were watching the free luau (Fridays they have a free show). It was romantic and probably one of my favorite hotels now! When we checked in, they had a bottle of champagne waiting for us, it was so great! We can't wait to go back and stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience for the kids, great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: 14Surprise
Reviews.Content: This was our kids first time to Hawaii and we wanted to be sure that they learned about island culture and tradition. We picked Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for their kids passport program and we were not disappointed. The girls loved getting their 'Hawaiian' names, making leis, and learning to hula. The resort is very welcoming and warm. The rooms were very nice, we had a king bed and the kids slept on a single daybed. Our room was downstairs facing the outside rim of the property with a small patio and was private. There is another resort next door but there are trees and plantings separating the properties. We could simply walk out the back patio and then down several rooms to the beach. Like most resorts in Maui, you have to pay for beach lounges, which was somewhat annoying. But, no other fees around the resort. The pool area was nice for small kids but it was a simple, shallow pool. Bigger kids would probably want water slides and more exciting water activities. But there is the beach! The food at the restaurants was good and the magic show was very nicely done. We loved hanging out in the evening with live music and the kids danced their hearts out. We only stayed four night but we wished we had seven!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the best location on the best beach!”
Reviews.Author: mikez68
Reviews.Content: 4th time there and we can't wait to go back. Great value, good food and entertainment. Hotel does need some updating but you can't beat the price and location! Staff is very friendly and the gardens are very well kept. Vary spacious courtyard never gets crowded like some other hotels in the area do. If you want to be on the beach and not break the bank then this place is for you. They provide discounts to returning guests if you call them directly.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful property....we'll never stay anywhere else on Maui....”
Reviews.Author: StartPackin
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been to KBH twice and we will return again and again. From the courteous and cheerful staff and coconut cookies at turn-down, to the beautiful grounds and complimentary Kikui nut necklace, we have always felt like "ohana" here. (They were more than accomodating .......we looked at three different rooms to get just the right view and were never made to feel we were imposing.) Although it is likely you will develop "pool envy" compared to the other hotel pools off the beach walk, (this pool is very small and in the shape of a whale...) KBH more than makes up for it in beauty, the unbelievable Sunday brunch, the free nightly show, the stunning view of Black Rock from many of the rooms, and the complimentary classes each day (hula lessons, mat making, Hawaiian monarch history lessons,etc.) (These sound a bit cheesy....but, they are not.) We love it because it isn't big, loud, or pretencious. And the beach path allows you to visit all the other big hotels for their shows and bars, but when the evening is done you will look forward to returning to your little peace of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “my home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: sailmags
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here for almost three years and fell in love with with the staff and hotel from day one. I always learn something new about the Hawaiian culture when I stay at kbh which makes my time on maui all the more valuable. Malihini is a true gem. I've never met anyone like her. she takes an interest in each guest as if they were family. I supposed to her, they really are. love the shack boys at the trilogy beach hut. james makes me laugh and Michael runs a first-rate operation. between the hotel and that shack you can't go wrong choosing this spot as your maui home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds”
Reviews.Author: 65Becky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May. Grounds are beautiful, rooms were updated,but not as nice as they could be.Balcony had a really bad paint job. Was a ocean view room, had to look between the trees and around the other buildings. Pool was small, but you are right on Kaanapali Beach so you could go there. They have a Beach walk that connects all the resorts in the area. It ran along the beach and had the Whalers Village on it. This is a little shopping center. Great places to eat in the Whalers Village also.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Comfortable with lots of personality!”
Reviews.Author: szpal
Reviews.Content: No wonder this hotel has so many great reviews and so many repeat customers. Of the three places we stayed on Ka'anapali Beach, hands-down this was my favorite. It's not the fanciest for sure. But in terms of cleanliness, value, and comfort, this is a winner. Our family reserved two ocean front rooms, adjoining. Our balcony was SO CLOSE to the water. Unbelievable! The staff at this hotel could definitely teach hospitality lessons to some 4 and 5 star hotels we've visited. Wonderful staff! Loved them! We ate at the restaurant once for breakfast and it was alright but not great. The little grill there, though was a great place to find reasonably priced, decent food--especially for my kiddos. The beach outside the hotel is the BEST of all the beaches we tried. We played in the surf for hours and it never got old. Also, we loved that we could get free beach towels from the little kiosk. No hassle, either. So nice to be able to trade in towels and not track a bunch of sand into our hotel room. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the price”
Reviews.Author: cradlemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel. It was roughly half the price of the Westin, located down the beach, where we had reservations for the other 4 nights of our vacation. I have to say that in terms of relaxation, this hotel was tops! There was no competition for pool chairs, and the staff was wonderful There are numerous hawaiian cultural classes for free, such as hula dancing, lei making or even pineapple cutting. The sunday brunch is amazing. Our rooms were very comfortable and well appointed. The lawn area in front of the hotel was huge with ample shade trees and lounge chairs. We will definitely return here in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying there again if I can help it”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl62
Reviews.Content: I'm trying to think of what nice thing to say about the KBH but nothing comes to mind. From the minute we got to the hotel I knew I wasn't in Kansas anymore. It all started when the bellman got a ticked off by the amount of luggage he had to carry in. His exact quote was "you guys come prepared don't you?" Well if he was traveling 6000 miles for 2 weeks then he'd understand that whether you like it or not, you bring everything. When we got to the desk, they were pleasant enough and we did get our room right away (I guess that's my nice thing to say) BUT then we got to the room. Right away the musty smell overpowered us. We couldn't escape it. Then we noticed that about 15 years ago this was probably a decent hotel. It needs severe updating or at least new bedspreads. Some people would have complained (usually me) but after 13 hours on a plane, a 6 hour time difference and pure exhastion we figured hey, it's only for one night (we were moving to the Grand Wailea the next day but they had no rooms available for us that night) Then came the sheets...dingy and I hate to say this, they smelled like wet dog. Take that back: dirty wet dog. My dog smells like lavender after her bath. The next day, knowing we were leaving, my husband & daughter went to the pool while I packed up our dirty clothes, toiletries, etc. The smell was so overwhelming that I actually got sick (and no, I am no fragile flower, I'm from Jersey, need I say more?) I couldn't wait to get the heck out of there. I too am a firm believer in location, location, location but in this case location is the only thing this hotel has got going for it. And you shouldn't base your hotel on location alone. There are a lot "dives" in great locations. You want to know that when you get your room it's at least clean when you first walk in. What happens while you're occupying it is your business. So I honestly cannot give this hotel a good review, and to be honest with you, if you can avoid it, do so. If you are one these people that says "oh, I'm only there to sleep and shower" then maybe this is a good choice for you, especially if you like sleeping on a wet dog.

Reviews.Title: “Everything people have said is true, both good and bad.”
Reviews.Author: PiscesLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at KBH and I have to say I agree with all the reviews. I think for the price, this is one of the best places to stay. I like avoiding all the one-ups-manship that can happen in upscale hotels (get enough of that in Los Angeles). But there are some downers... The bad: -The facility is definitely a tired one (the bar/restaurant area is screaming for a rehab; it's very worn out and can be a bit of turn off to staying for the entertainment). -Parking garage is dirty, and tight, so drive carefully if you park yourself. -While not at the Motel 6 level, you definitely feel that you are on the downscale side of hotels. -The Mixed Plate Restaurant is listed on all the hotel info, but has been closed for two years according to the lady in the hotel's market. The good: -We were in two different rooms due to a loud child next door in our first room (not the child's fault, he was on mainland time, which translated to loud chatter at 3:00 in the morning). The front desk was extremely helpful in changing our room. The second room seemed to fresher than the first, so it's possible that there is some replacement of worn drapery etc. that happens. -The breakfast buffet was much more than adequate. The coffee was good, there were many choices in juices and fresh fruits, the hot foods were just fine. -The daily craft items for sale in the lobby were quite interesting and handy for souvenirs. The GREAT: -The staff was wonderful. Malahini was delightful (she does lovely hula dancing, and teaches you how to cut pineapples, string leis, hula dance); Michelle at the front desk was cheery and helpful. The concierge lady (sorry I don't know her name) was helpful with info. The restaurant was well run with constant service. The rooms are cleaned promptly and efficiently. -The beach was one of the best of all the hotels in Kaanapali Beach Resort area. The beach rental stand was very fairly priced, for snorkel equipment, boogie boards, cabanas, etc. -LOCATION! A short walk to all the other hotels and shopping at Whaler's Village. Check out the Sunset Cliff Diving ceremony at the Sheraton. It's a fun time to watch the torch bearer run through the bar area lighting torches and stopping for posed photos. Fun! Oh, and a short drive to Lahaina, with lots of shopping, restaurants, and historical sites. All in all, if you want to spend your money on luxurious settings, this is not the place for you. If you want to spend it on all the other activities on the island, and the great restaurants, then this is the place to stay without breaking the bank. Remember, other than the pool and rooms, you can take advantage of what all the other hotels have to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Most Hawaiian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Capemalia
Reviews.Content: This is a non pretentious resort hotel, and a lot of Maui history. If you want a splashy lobby and glitzy rooms, you have lots of choices elsewhere. If you want to experience an authentic stay, then relax, enjoy and visit Old Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again-great value!”
Reviews.Author: Kvacances
Reviews.Content: I was nervous because we have never stayed at a place like this but was pleasantly surprised. The free hula and history classes were wonderful, the location was AMAZING, there are great little seating areas in the middle of the complex where you can have a nice picnic dinner, you can walk to fancier places. Great family place and although there is some cheesiness, our kids loved it. Not fancy, not upscale, but very homey and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “"Not as good as the Westin, but not as pricey."”
Reviews.Author: mjbphx
Reviews.Content: After spending 6 days at the Westin, and having our flight cancelled, we were put up by USAir in the kaanapoli Beach hotel (2 properties away from the Westin) and ended up staying 2 extra nights. The room was well equipped with a refrigerator and safe, but it seemed to be decorated with 70's beach decor and old style TV. The folks seemed helpful and friendly enough. The nightly free luau music was entertaining the first night but got a little old after that. Would recommend if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.!”
Reviews.Author: Kupono4
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel in Maui! My family of four stayed here 2 years ago. It was Great! The staff was very polite and showed the "Aloha" Spirit, My family booked a room in a builing where there was no elevator, and we were staying on the 4th floor! We went to talk to the front desk. They more that happily switch our room to a bigger, nicer one, in a building with a elevator (with NO extra charge:) That was great. My family with be staying here again in august.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: CharlieSUP
Reviews.Content: As I live on Maui's North shore and rarely stay on the west side its was very nice hotel. Large lawns and new pool area are great to chill out on or just head out to the beach for a swim, all very easy. Must hit the Tiki Bar and see Dale the longest running bartender in Ka'anapali,he has served over 400,000 Mai Tai's it's worth a stop. Located in the middle of Ka'anapali just steps from Whalers Village with its many shops and restaurants. Easy to walk right to Black Rock for some killer snorkeling and swimming, great for the kids and family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to be and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Vern83
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the hotel. Our room was very nice and always clean. The people were great and helped with travel arrangements, tickets and anything else we needed. I think some of the people who wrote reviews for this hotel and ran it down should go to a few hotels in TN, FL and a few other places. If they wanted a "resort" then they should have paid the extra money...they aren't any better, they just have a kitchen. We went to Hawaii to see Hawaii not sit in a room anyhow! We can't wait until our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst property on any of the islands”
Reviews.Author: geehoo
Reviews.Content: We were four and the rooms are so small...they only had king bed and a day bed for a family of four. the roll away bed couldn't fit in the room...the bed has bugs and staff is so rude from top to bottom...we visited three islands and Maui was our last destination spot and what a horrible way to end a ten day trip to Hawaii...We had gone through a travel agent and they had praised this hotel about having a Hawaiian living culture and property so cultured...this was worst than a Motel.....Never Again...I am so mad with the TOur company and the agent for putting us in this hotel..we had bought the breakfast package ahead of time and still upon arrival, they refused to cover the children and we ended up paying for it there....If I could grade this hotel in negatives I would....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Helpful and Friendly Staff - Lots of Pros”
Reviews.Author: MauiVisitor2011
Reviews.Content: Lots of Pros including: -Great location just off a beautiful beach. -All the staff were very friendly and helpful -Great place for children - includes a "Passport" program where kids collect prizes -Kids loved the pool and the beach -Free entertainment every evening -Free progams including lei making, hula dancing, hawaiian language lessons taught by a very friendly, enthousiastic and knowledgable local Few Cons including: -Plumbing issues - both toilet and tub drainage... -No free in-room wireless internet access

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, calm way to experience Maui”
Reviews.Author: KathleenCo
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights here - first stay at KBH, third trip to Maui. (Other visits, at The Sheraton at Black Rock and at a condo in Kahana.) I can't speak to the run-down building described in other reviews, but our building and room were fine and good value for the package we purchased through Alaska Air: Room was clean, spacious, comfortable,. Very good bed, plenty of pillows, great air conditioner, and featured a small but sufficient deck overlooking the pool area. (Package also included daily buffet breakfast which again, we found to be quite good. Fresh fruit platters, replenished every few minutes, mild and tasty bread pudding, crisp bacon, again replenished every few minutes, fresh juices, salmon, noodles, rice, pastries, etc. True, it's not Merriman's - but I'd give it a solid "B" for a daily buffet, and I'm pretty picky. The coffee was the only thing I'd complain about a little - it was a bit bitter. We ate a few times at the poolside grill, which for relatively inexpensive bar fare (hot dogs with grilled sweet Maui onions, a tasty sandwich of eggplant, grilled sweet red pepper/balsamic vinegar sauce on pita bread) was good. Here's the thing: this is not a place to go to feel "pampered", if to you that means granite countertops in the bathroom, marble entryways and a snotty staff. I only encountered one staff member who probably either needs coaching (you're here to help customers, not drink coffee) or to be let go. She seemed quite young, perhaps her first job? In any case, every other person I met smiled, was friendly, kind, generous and sincere (again - I notice these things). What you will find here is a large, grass-covered property, right on a lovely swimming beach, within walking distance to much of Ka'anapali. You'll enjoy an abundance of lounge chairs which you are free to drag anywhere on-site, to your own little shady, tree-encircled oasis. You'll find a campy little place called "The Tiki Bar". True, you won't find an acres-spanning pool, but listen: we walked to The Westin one morning, with its much-touted never-ending pool, and the place felt like a loud, crowded gymnasium: kids running everywhere (yes, even inside, in the lovely marble entryway halls), yelling, throwing fruit at the poor caged tropical birds, throwing balls across the pool passageways and loungechairs on the pool deck, gaaaa. You'll find KBH to be a quiet, friendly, unpretentious place. Save your money for special dinners out, a sunset sail on the Scotch Mist II, a lovely piece of jewelry. We were very happy with our stay here and recommend the place highly.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: hazzaman6
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 , 2 adults and 3 children and we stayed at this hotel for 4 nights too long. The food there was like vomit on a hot dog. The beds are full of bed bugs and insects.The keys to the rooms don't work so you will probably have to change rooms every night (what we had to do). Don't let this put you off Ka'anapali beach because it is great but just make sure you don't stay at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. There are some great looking hotels at Ka'anapali besides from Ka'anapali Beach Hotel so try them before you even consider staying at KBH. P.S there was a massive poo in the pool when we were staying at KBH.

Reviews.Title: “The Second Worst Hotel on the Kaanapali shore”
Reviews.Author: bettyta
Reviews.Content: Where do I start from. Maybe from the fact that they surely are glad to have you as a guest... so that they can take as much as money as possible from you, and not offer anything in return!!! In the end, you end up just sleeping there, and getting as far away from the hotel as possible. Of all the hotels in the area, they had the worst entertainment program (almost none), you pay for your safe deposit box, parking, daily internet (for a week it equals approx. the double monthly rates that you pay at home), and the welcoming breakfast they are offering is just an embarrassment and a personal offense. But, if you are looking for a place to crash in, this is the right place for you. Check the prices in the other hotels, though. You might get more value for your money!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: clalves
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 15 years ago, and decided to return to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. Staff was great. Our ocean view room was on the 5th floor great view, wonderful room. We had prepaid for breakfast, was very good. Beach wonderful. The farewell ceremony, so touching. We loved everything about our stay. Thank you Ka'anapali for helping us have such a wonderful 35th wedding anniversary vacation. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Graduation Vacation”
Reviews.Author: bargich
Reviews.Content: Our family recently spent 5 beautiful days at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and it was great. This was a special gift to my son who recently graduated from high school. The vacation was even more memorable since he brought along two friends to join in the fun. The hotel staff was very friendly, the food was great, and the Magic Show was excellent. This was the second time we have stayed at the KBH and have once again enjoyed the the "The Most Hawaiian Hotel". We definitely felt like we were a part of the KBH family.

Reviews.Title: “This is a really nice place!”
Reviews.Author: tennisbob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the center of one of the nicest beaches in Maui. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a home away from home. The rooms were very clean. We were there for our wedding aniversary and our agent mentioned that during our reservation. The hotel upgraded us to a better view and there was champagne waiting in the room. This was a nice touch. There was a free breakfast on the first day and that too was an imformative event since they explained the different options for trips and shows without pushing any specific event. We did go to the magic show and that too was well done. The only thing I would suggest about the magic show is that it should start later. It is a dinner show and dinner starts at 5:00 with the show starting at 6:00. I would suggest a later start time. There is free music and hola dancing every night which can been heard and viewed from the restaurant. There are also various free class about Hawaiian culture and language during the day. This hotel really tries to keep the Hawaiian feeling going. I would recommend this hotel highly. The one negative I have is parking is extra and there was a charge of 9.00$ a day. I would think the parking could be included with the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way!”
Reviews.Author: catmac1957
Reviews.Content: I'm a fussy traveler, and I must say I was delighted with the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. It was clean, the staff was very helpful and always friendly, the room was comfortable, the beds and pillows were perfect and the price and location were terrific. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Highly disappointing on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Adnama85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights during our honeymoon after staying a few nights at another resort. After walking around for a while looking for an elevator, we finally realized there wasn't one in our building. So after our exhausting trip, we had to drag all of our luggage up three flights of stairs. We were excited for our "free" breakfast the next morning only to realize that we had eaten the "wrong breakfast" and our meal wasn't the right one for the coupon. Luckily, after we spoke with staff, the front desk, and management, we got our free breakfasts. Why would we pay for a breakfast when we have a voucher for a free one?? Their motto is that they are "the most hawaiian experience" which would be true if Hawaiian people are just pissed-off, Mexican, workers that give you a dirty look when you smile at them. Nobody there was really friendly at all, and the atmosphere was really really old and boring. All in all, it just required us to be outside of the hotel and do more activities, which I guess was a plus in the end.

Reviews.Title: “8 fantastic days here”
Reviews.Author: beachboy52-54
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Maui.Our travel agent suggested this hotel as a truly Hawaiian experience.Boy was she right.The entire staff was there to make you stay great.Everyone was very helpful and super friendly,right down to the housekeeping staff.Lots of activities each day to acquaint you with the Hawaiian culture.Hula lessons,lei making,ukulele lessons,Hawaiian language classes all taught by locals who enjoyed teaching you.I can't say enough about the terriffic week we had there.Definetly consider staying here for a truly enjoyable vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not fancy, hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: OutsidePlaying
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 traveling and planning many island activities while on Maui, and we needed 2 rooms for our stay. Decided on this hotel based on a friend's stay a couple of years ago. We basically showered and slept here and relaxed on the beach a couple of afternoons during our 6-night stay, so the proximity to the beach and pool from our ocean-view room was great. The pool was a bit small. The rooms and baths are a bit small for more than 2 people in a room so we were glad we had the 2 adjoining rooms. The rooms and bath were clean and linens were fresh. There was a slight 'beach musty' smell when we first walked in, but I didn't notice it after the first day. It was nice to open the patio door and sit on the lanai (small) early in the morning with coffee. A condo might have been a better option, but we had a good AAA rate which included breakfast, and there was a refrigerator in the room for chilling drinks and snacks. The location is also good as we could take the short walk to Whaler's Village for shopping or eating out. We mostly were on other parts of the island for lunch or dinner and only ate the buffet a few mornings. It was OK but became tiresome after a couple of days. Fruit was always good, and we don't feel we have to eat everything offered on the buffet just because it's there. My grand-daughter ordered a waffle and they happily made one for her. We could also order eggs cooked to order for a small extra charge. Like most everything else in Hawaii, things are expensive (self-parking, internet, etc) so you just have to be prepared for that. We are an active bunch and enjoyed snuba diving, the Haleakala sunrise and biking down the mountain, and zip lines among other things. I could skip the Hana drive again but it is scenic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort on the beach”
Reviews.Author: princessrenee
Reviews.Content: We chose this property because it was the most "Hawaiian" hotel in Hawaii and it was more affordable than a lot of other properties in Maui. At the end of our stay not sure why they give themselves this title as it wasn't as "Hawaiian" as we thought it would of been. Our room was nice but we had to change rooms a few nights later because we were given the wrong one. (make sure you get what you pay for). The only thing I could say about the rooms that we didn't like is that it seems the rooms are not noise proof (both in the older and newer sections) of the hotel. You could hear people in nearby rooms talking and using the toilet and showering at all times of the day and night. The resort has nice gardens and very close to the beach. The food at the snack bar wasn't great and the hot chips (fries) were absolutely horrible and I threw them in the bin. Breakfast here was buffet style and served in two different places. The variety wasn't too bad but the quality of the most of the food was highly undesirable. The quality could of been better and I am not usually that fussy but most of the food was so mass produced, so oily, fatty and just overall poor quality. Some of it was ok. The service at breakfast time was hit and miss depending on who you get. We had one waitress that asked us what we wanted to drink and when we ordered it we never got it even after requesting it 3 times. In the end we gave up and asked someone else. Funny enough at the end of our breakfast you could tell she still expected a tip - I don't think so! Activities here were good. We enjoying the lei making classes but book in advance as unfortunately some activities aren't on offer every day. The nightly entertainment was pretty good while eating dinner. Most staff were quite friendly. We had dinner here a few times and the quality was much better. Its not cheap but it was nice to have a decent meal without leaving the resort. Other times we ate out of the resort as it was cheaper and more options at the nearby shopping village. At the end of the stay we got some lovely 'nut lei' to take home. We were told that the lei won't get through Australian customs. We thought that would be the case but once we arrived home we declared them and was able to take them home so that was a bit of a nice surprise. Internet access is not cheap here. Overall we enjoyed our stay here for a nice relaxing time in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel not fancy”
Reviews.Author: Glenda1957
Reviews.Content: Had a 7 night stay for our 25th wedding anniversary. Nice room, friendly staff, breakfast ok. Great magic show. Beautiful beach. Not fancy but would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what pictures and reports say it is. Move down the strip.”
Reviews.Author: tripseeker007
Reviews.Content: We attempted to stay here in March of this year. We heard our local radio station sending trip giveaways to this location. We thought it to be a good location according to the pictures and website. In short, not at all what it is built up to be. This resort needs to be updated dramatically. It feels like you are stuck in the early eighties. What is billed as the most "hawaiian" hotel really means old. Nothing we saw looks remotely new. From computers the staff works on to the room amenities. We got a ocean front room. Upon check in we found dust on the ceiling and musty order. It felt like I got thrown back about 20 years. For the $320 a night, this would clearly be not worth it. After talking with the manager, she let us look at another room. Same thing!. Old and musty. We left this hotel for another one (RL). At the (RL) resort, we got modern amenities, ocean view room, and valet service for $70 cheaper a night. Choose another resort than this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gleboeuf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Kaanapali Beach Hotel for 31st Anniversary and was very pleased with this Hotel. The location is perfect for staying on Maui and the rooms were a nice size and comfortable. The beds are outstanding. Althoough there isn't a great restraurant on the premises, Whalers village is a couple hundred yards away with a couple of great places. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value, friendliest hotel and lots of space! It really is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyNaturegirl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are 2 young looking single girls (39 and 40) who wanted to get away to Maui for 2 weeks of relaxation, fun and adventure with feeling surrounded by honeymooners or crowded pool and beach areas. This hotel was cheaper than all the five star ones and was actually perfect! It had large rooms with yes Hawaiian decor but that's what made it special and genuine. The staff we so friendly and did anything for you. They had free classes on lei making, hula dancing, basket weaving and loads more. Free hula shows and entertainment every night. They only had one pool but a huge spacious beautiful garden so that you could lay on a sun lounge in your own space without 10 other guest right next to you. We didn't notice loads if couples because of the space and location. All the 5 star ones we looked at while we were there had elaborate pools and gardens which were great to look at but they were do crowded and the only place for sun lounges were by the pools all lined up like sardines! Of course the beach is right there and there's loads of space there. We spent a mixture of time on the beach and in the hotel grounds sunbaking and looking out to the beach. I really felt I was in nature and it didn't feel crowded. See my photos to compare the hotel areas and you will see! We also did the road to Hana drive using the cd you buy to play in the car for directions, I highly reccommend that! We also swam with turtles just there at the beach in kaanapali and the snorkeling was great.plenty of choice for food all along the beach walk and in each of the hotels too. We had the perfect holiday!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Will Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: KeithB_805
Reviews.Content: Took family (wife/me, 3 daughters (aged 21, 19, 18) with husband/bf/friend (8 total). Stayed in Oceanfront rooms 201-204. 204 had a palm that blocked view to Black Rock but others had a great view of entire beach. So close I could throw a rock into the ocean (didn't try though). Not perfect but the pluses far outweighed the negatives. If you want a quiet hotel with a more local feel, this is the place. Entertainment (music, hula) every night until 9 pm. Never felt crowded. Went to welcome breakfast, no hard sales pitch. One of my daughters went to magic show/dinner and loved it (got a good rate from the breakfast). Another daughter took the free lei making class and liked that too. Third daughter won a free dinner at the restaurant at the welcome breakfast and loved that too. If you are traveling with small kids, this probably isn't the place. The Westin has a bigger pool with water slides and was packed when we walked by it. Guess it all depends what you're looking for. Parking was $8/day. Internet was $9 for 24 hours (wired).

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time and would recommend the hotel to Friends!”
Reviews.Author: Mary12345678910
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels for business and vacation. This trip was a family trip and we all enjoyed the stay. The hotel was clean and well maintained. There were plenty of activities for eveyone and the guest services staff went over and above to help coordinate activities, inform us of Hawaii culture and history, and provide wonderful hospitality. I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: mjpileggi
Reviews.Content: The Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel sits on a beautiful beach in west Maui. The gardens/grounds are beautiful. While the place sits in a huge resort area, we felt comfortable being there. Itâ€™s within walking distance to Black Rock for some great snorkeling (swimming with turtles and tropical fish) and the Whalerâ€™s village for some shopping and dining options. The main restaurant was closed for construction. Breakfast buffet is expensive. The Tiki bar has good drinks and pupu's but I've had better mai tai's elsewhere. Bar staff could be friendlier and not look like they don't care for their job. I booked the hotel in advance (garden view room) requesting an airline discount (DH is a pilot). I was informed we would receive, â€œcomplimentary upgrade based on our availability at time of check-inâ€� with our airline discount. At check in, the young woman told me that the hotel was full when I asked about the complimentary upgrade. We were given room 167 which we were extremely disappointed. There was no garden view room to speak of and in fact the lanai felt claustrophobic with the small hedges dividing the lanai and a building on the other side of the hedges facing the lanai. This room faced the exterior of the complex. I called the front desk from the room and asked for another garden view room. The same young woman told me there were no other garden view rooms but that we could upgrade to a pool view room for an additional cost. I said, â€œIf you have available rooms then shouldnâ€™t we get the new room under the complimentary upgrade?â€� She stated, â€œThatâ€™s not always the case.â€� I explained to her I had my email from the reservations manager, which included upgrade comment. She said we could move to room 160 (same building). The view from room 160 in the Kauai building was much better, as it faced the interior gardens, although it did not have a pool view at all. In fact, when we came home I looked at their web site that had the photos of the various room categories. Room 160 is a garden view room, not a pool view room. Room 167 was actually an Aloha Value room that faces, â€œexterior lawns or surrounding hotels.â€� We understood the policy of upgrading based on availability at time of check-in, but the first room wasn't what I reserved in the first place, and in fact there was availability. At the minimum we should have received the garden view room, 160. This kind of service, or lack thereof, is so disappointing and a letdown. Here they advertise being the most Hawaiian of hotels and having grown up on Oahu, I do know what the Aloha spirit means and I know customer service. We didnâ€™t receive that kind of Aloha treatment. In fact, I wrote a letter to the manager and have never received a response. What a shame. It would be nice to say we will return there on our next trip to Maui, but it wonâ€™t be the case.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: maggiejean48
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful 10 days my daughter and I spent at the Ka' anapali Beach Hotel! Everyone was so kind, gracious, and genuinely friendly. The many activities made it a truly Hawaiian experience. Not only did we learn traditional lei making, but also, our wonderful teacher, Malihini, taught us a most fun hula lesson to the Hukilau Song. She also shared with us her personal insight into what it was like growing up in Hawaii. We loved the nightly Hawaiian music and hula shows as well. We both had a difficult time leaving our "paradise on earth". Tears actually flowed. After walking the path in front of the other hotels each day, there is no question as to which hotel we would stay at on our next visit - The Ka' anapali Beach Hotel! Aloha, Jean Larsen, Milwaukee, Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back in 2 years”
Reviews.Author: Foreverhappy526
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very hawaiian. Everyone was friendly and smiling and very accomodating. The pineapple is so delicious in Hawaii - nothing like you get on the mainland. The sunsets are to die for. We are going back in 2 years and staying longer!

Reviews.Title: “Inviting, laid back, and gorgeous beach front”
Reviews.Author: rev5
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel in 20 years and I found each stay enjoyable. The grounds are attractive and the beach front is very nice â€“ wide with white sand. The hotel is somewhat outdated but itâ€™s clean, well located, and accommodating. The staff was helpful and friendly. We received a complimentary breakfast each morning with a large selection of food choices and the food was tasty. The room was clean and the beds were OK. The hotel is close to shopping and restaurants in Lahaina. Parking was covered and controlled by card access. The Kukui Lei Ceremony is a nice touch provided by the hotelâ€¦ they present you with a kukui nut lei upon your departure. If you visit the hotel again in the future, they will update your lei to show how many times youâ€™ve stayed with them. This hotel has a laid back, comfortable feel to it and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: chaperones
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with our parents on their honeymoon. The hotel was everything we had hoped for. We paid the lowest price and got a wonderful garden view. Next time we would pay a little more and get a pool or ocean view, but it really didn't matter because we just wanted to be outside all the time. We didn't use the pool because we love the ocean, but the kids there seemed to love it. The beds were very comfortable and the room clean and fresh every day. The staff was very welcoming and helpful whenever we had a question. The free (first morning only) breakfast was very delicious and the information time afterwards gave us lots of help on how to spend our week. Our favorite activity was snorkling out at the black rock, just steps away in front of the next hotel. We saw large turtles (everyday!!) and lots of colorful fish. We just couldn't get enough of it!! There were people of all ages going out to snorkle. One recommendation is that if you are not a good swimmer, a flotation devise is advised. My husband rescued a man that was drowning because he was too exhausted to make it to shore. We purchased cheap swimming "noodles" and felt like we could be out there all day if we wanted (and we consider ourselves strong swimmers). We also purchased cheap chairs and an umbrella from a store in Lahaniah. It was well worth the $ because then we did not have to pay a daily fee to rent. It was no problem to take them home with us on the airplane (just a small extra luggage fee). Bring your own beach towel from home. Because we did not stay in a condo, we had to buy all our meals which became quite expensive. If we would come back to Maui with our children, we would consider a condo property, just so that we would have the choice of eating in or out. But we would still try to be close to the Black Rock. As it turned out we bought muffins and fruit, juice and milk, pop and beer, crackers, cheese and snacks at a grocery store in Lahania. This really helped to cut some costs.
