Each room has a small fridge and coffee maker. It is very worth your while to rent a vehicle. We were so glad we did. We went back and forth from our hotel to Lahainah many times for eating and great shopping. And for travelling around the island site seeing. For free internet and a nice place to eat breakfast or a smaller meal, go to CJ's it is just up the hill from the hotel. The front desk can give directions. They also pack lunches in a cooler for you with a refundable deposite for the cooler. It was great! We went on a day trip and were so glad we had it along so that we could eat anywhere. The whalers village was a few hotels down the other way from the black rock. It was great for shopping (I bought all my gifts there!), having ice cream, restaurants for dinner, ABC store for those forgotton items and so much more. Our hotel had wonderful entertainment each night. Our favorite was when the group of girls ages 5 - 20 came out to the stage. They put on such a wonderful show of dancing and music. Each night there was lots of singing and dancing from sundown at 6:45 well into the evening. If that was the only evening entertainment that we did we would have been happy. We went out a few nights to other places and felt like we had missed out! We went through some of the more expensive properties along the beach, and we were still so very happy with the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone going to Maui. When you leave the staff sings a farewell song and gives to a lei as a goodbye present. Nice touch! Writing all this makes me want to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Leisure Spot”
Reviews.Author: pjwooden
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the end of May & first few days of June. It was a very good location for walking the beach & enjoying the area around Lahaina. It was peaceful sitting in the garden area reading a book or just being lazy and enjoying the surroundings. We ate breakfast every morning at the hotel, enjoying a buffet with very good hot & cold items. This was included with our room rate and was a great way to go. We did not need to hurry to get out and go somewhere just to eat & then return to enjoy the beach. We did not do any of the activities that the hotel offers...lei-making, hula lessons, basket weaving....but I'm sure they would have been great! Every employee that we came in contact with, was very friendly and helpful. The morning we were leaving, the hotel gave us a necklace made with Kukai nuts and we thought this was so sweet!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: newstwin
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor we decided to go with this hotel... but to be honest I was a bit reluctant. But man am I happy we did! Let me start by admitting I am a hotel snob. So I like to stay at chain hotels. Ones I am familiar with. But in Maui, those hotels are outrageously expensive! This was our honeymoon and we wanted to do other things then just sit in a hotel or at a pool. Spending our budget on a hotel for a week was not my idea of a good time. So we found this hotel and it was way less expensive and it was on the best beach in the area. The pool is small but it does it's job. The grounds are gorgeous. The rooms are older but they're clean! The staff is so nice! Very accomodating. If you want to see Maui and do all the fun stuff there... stay here! The rates are much better and you won't blow your budget!!! One thing though, the food here isn't all that great so you will have to eat off property.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nwtravel4fun
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience staying at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. The room was updated and clean, the staff was wonderful and extremely helpful. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The view from our room was incredible, we slept with the sliding glass door open so we fell asleep and woke up to the sound of the waves every day which was great. Some of the hallways and common areas inside could use some updating and the food was adequate but a little over priced. Otherwise there are no complaints and would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hawaiian holiday location - we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: UkBobsgirl
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Hawaii, and this resort made it very special ! We had a great room overlooking the ocean, and the food in the Tiki Terrace restaurant... was terrific! We ate dinner there almost every night! The pool was nice, shaped like a whale, clean with plenty of loungers around on the grounds, and under the shade of the trees. The grounds were manicured, and we took advantage of their Culture Walk that taught us about Hawaii's special plants and trees, and their medicinal qualities. We participated in one of the lei making classes, and made our own fresh flower leis! We were able to walk out onto the beach and walk into the ocean to snorkel with the most beautiful colourful fish near the Black rock point. The staff were very friendly and patient with all of my questions. We watched the free hula and Hawaiian music show every evening as we began our dinner. The Tiki bar was so convenient at the middle of the day to have a cool drink, or a light lunch. The hotel gave us a free Welcome Breakfast the first morning we were there to orient us as to all of the offerings this fantastic resort had to share, and a teaser for the Magic show they offer each night. Very impressive! The room was spacious, clean and the bed and pillows were very comfortable! YES, yes, yes - I would recommend this resort to anyone coming to Maui ! don't forget to attend the Leaving ceremony to get your Kukui nut lei! The only downside was that it is 45 minute ride from the airport, and SpeediShuttle forgot us as we were leaving. We nearly missed our plane to the big island !

Reviews.Title: “Frustration and Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Holly1875
Reviews.Content: We've stayed on Maui many times at a variety of places from condos to resort hotels. We have also traveled quite a lot and have experienced many levels of service. We were sorely disappointed with the service at this property, so much so that we changed hotels the night we checked in. I read the TA reviews of this hotel and based on the mostly positive responses decided to stay here. We hadn't stayed at Kaanapali for a number of years and this place has always intrigued me. I was very taken with the "most Hawaiian hotel" marketing. I was pleased to get a good AAA rate of $214/night including breakfast. We arrived about 12:30, 3 hours before check-in time. We were greeted by a bellman who asked if we were checking in when we pulled up to the lobby. No "aloha" or welcome. The lobby is 1960's chic;small with low ceilings and numerous people in various states of attire milling about. We stood in line behind a velvet rope to check in with the one person at the front desk. When it was our turn we were told by the poor overworked young woman that our room wasn't ready yet and we should go get lunch or wander around until we received a call. Fair enough as we were 3 hours early for check-in. We ate lunch, went shopping, talked with one of the concierges and 2 hours later our room still wasn't ready. By the way, the concierge told us that the whole beach was at 60% occupancy. So why wasn't there a room available for us? Maybe they didn't have enough staff? Finally, after checking at about 3:00 we were given a room. We dragged our wheelies over to the partial ocean view room and were unpleasantly surprised to find 2 beds, not a king as requested. We also found that we could see the ocean if we went out on the balcony (this was no lanai) and leaned over. Pretty steamed, I called the front desk and said this would not do. To make a painfully long story short, after being told the only king room available was on the 2nd floor (including any ocean view rooms which we were willing to upgrade to) we ended up asking to talk with the manager on duty. She told us that based on our room request (quiet, away from elevators and ice machine and a king bed) they decided that quiet was more important than the bed size (we had also told them this was our 35th anniversary)! We opted to try the 2nd floor room (which had the possibility of carrying in noise from the people walking by outside) but we had to wait for that to be inspected by whoever at housekeeping. The manager gave us some drink tickets so we sat at the outside bar with our suitcases waiting for the call to tell us the room was ready. We had the possibility of changing to a 4th floor room the next day if this room turned out to be too noisy for us. We finally got into the room sometime after 4:00 and unpacked. It was a basic motel room, nothing fancy with a balcony which actually had more of an ocean view that the 4th floor room. However, once we opened the doors we got to hear our neighbors shouting from the lawn to their roommates so it wasn't too pleasant. Also, the bare chested guy who leaned his gut against the front desk podium wasn't too appealing either. And did I mention that while we were waiting in the lobby I got up from a couch to find my butt was all wet because someone in a wet suit apparently sat there before me (I'm hoping!). Oh, and one of the concierge's cell phone went off while she wasn't near it and that made kind of a racket too. So, most Hawaiian hotel on Maui or whatever they claim? I don't think so. Relaxing? Not at all. Aloha spirit? Couldn't find it. That evening we stopped by the Napili Kai Beach Resort where we last stayed 10 or 11 years ago. We were warmly welcomed by the two front desk people and were told they could help us in just a few minutes while they finished checking in some folks. The mere act of acknowledging our presence was a refreshing difference between this property and the KPH. Because the rates were higher I didn't consider staying here when planning our trip. Luckily, they had available rooms and we ended up switching hotels that night. The rest of our vacation couldn't have been more relaxing. I've learned my lesson - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bkl0irnnk
Reviews.Content: The reviews on TripAdvisor are very accurate. If you plan to spend most of your time at the beach and exploring the island, this hotel is perfectly fine. If you are someone who wants to sit by a lavish pool, choose somewhere else. The hotel itself is outdated, but it was clean and functional for what we used it for. The grounds were beautiful and the location is excellent. We didn't use the pool at all. It's very simple, shaped like a whale, not very big, not jacuzzi. Also, I think it's comparable with other hotels, but they hit you with hidden fees every chance they get. If you use the safe, it costs ~$2.5/day. We didn't know this until we got our bill at the end of the week. We explored the other hotels in this area, and next time we'll probably opt to spend a little more and stay at either the Sheraton or Westin. We ate at the restaurant once, only because the service was so terrible. The food was really good, but even though it wasn't crowded when we were there, dinner took around 2-2.5 hours. That's just for appetized and entree. We didn't have dessert or coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: Gregstr630
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on price and other reviews and were very pleased to find that we shared the great experiences that everyone else has had. We felt at home from the minute we arrived to the minute we left. We enjoyed a couple of dinners in at the Tiki Terrace where the food was great and the bread was fantastic. We went the "Welcome" get together breakfast expecting to be pitched and it wasn't that all. They just gave us information and discounts that we would not have otherwise recieved. From this presentation we bought a couple of excrusions but the best part was getting discounted tickets for the Kupanaha Magic Show. We really enjoyed this and it was top notch. I've seen a lot of Vegas act Magic shows and this was as good if not better because you were closer to the action and Jody Baran is a fun and personable entertainer. The food was average but it was a bonus as the act alone was worth the money. The fact that you could walk to the Whaler's Village was a huge plus for us. It is so nice to walk the beach anyway but to have your desitination be such a great shopping and restaurant area was a plus. We used Trip Advisor to pick where we ate so we ate at Leilani's on the Beach twice in the lower Beachside Grill and loved it both times. It's less expensive, easier to get into and we saved our nice meal money for Mama's Fish House. Other things we liked was the close parking to our room. Don't need to valet park (we found that out after paying for it and when we told the front desk they gave us a refund). Easy to get the little mini-cabana lounge chairs. I went early as advised but on any day we saw extra chairs available. Tip your cabana boy (man). We loved hearing the Hawaiian music every night from their little stage area by the Tiki Terrance. Nice little shows from local musicians and dancers. So, stay here if you like Hawaiian atmosphere and a great beach location. But don't stay here if you like the quiet, smuggness of the Westin or the crowds and rat race of the Grand Wailea. We walked through both and although both are beautiful they were more like conference hotels. All you saw at the Wailea were upset guests looking for luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay here, but it won't be the last.”
Reviews.Author: SueHenderson
Reviews.Content: We love Kaanapali Beach Hotel! The staff is very friendly and definitely makes you feel welcome. It isn't the fanciest place you'll ever stay, but our room had been recently remodeled and was very clean. The grounds are lush and beautiful, and it sits on one of the most beautiful beaches on Maui. Admittedly, we don't use the pool (the beach is far too inviting!). It's just a short walk down the beach path to Whaler's Village, where you can find great restaurants and shops. Also within walking distance is Black Rock, a fantastic place to snorkel. There is a small stage in the courtyard which features a live band with hula dancing every night. It's a great place to enjoy dinner on the patio, have a couple of drinks or just sit and watch the show. Kaanapali Beach Hotel is a terrific value. In my opinion, this is the best location in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Best true Hawaiian experience and best value- true relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: lbearpal
Reviews.Content: We are world travellers and have tried some other Maui hotels but always come back to the Ka'anapali Beach. It isn't the fanciest- it's just the warmest and most genuinely Hawaiian hotel in Maui. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the huge beautifully landscaped sitting area means you aren't jammed in with a hundred other people on some concrete pool jungle. The beachfront is also lovely and part of a miles long beach walk to stretch your legs. The only negative was the wifi being pricey and cumbersome. If you want condo chic this isn't the place. If you want relaxation, comfort and wonderful ambience, including the great breakfasts and serenading evening shows, this is your kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a memorable stay & beautiful wedding!”
Reviews.Author: AJU32243
Reviews.Content: Madie, Darren, Sam, Tom, Leah and Everyone else at the KBH that created an unforgettable time for our wedding and guests- THANK YOU! We worked with Madie when we arrived to finalize the details: she was very organized, provided helpful suggestions and even though our wedding day was on her day off; she provided all the details to Sam and the rest of the staff so that the ceremony and reception went perfectly. Our guests are still talking about our wedding, the beautiful grounds, the organization of the event and how friendly everyone was. We enjoyed 8 nights stay at the hotel as well as many of our guests. Yes, the hotel is older but the room was clean, nice and updated enough to stay in for the week....especially when you are only in the room to sleep. You truly feel as though you are staying right in paradise. Our KBH experience was very special and we will certainly return for our anniversaries to come. Thanks again! Amie & Joe Updike

Reviews.Title: “We loved every second of our stay and will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: ptat52
Reviews.Content: It was our honeymoon and I decided to try a different hotel from where we stayed 2 years ago. We had a wonderful experience at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Although it is an older hotel, everything about it was great. The oceanview room had a truly magnificient view of the ocean and the pool and gardens. The staff was wonderful. We had no problems with the staff or maid service. The room and bathroom-shower area was a very nice size, larger the upscale hotel we stayed at 2 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Shanon J
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. If you are looking for the perfect Maui experience on a budget, this is a great hotel! They have all of the amenities, but their rates are very affordable. Prime location on an amazing beach with a black rock cliff at the end of the beach. There are so many activities right on property you never have to leave. THey do an amazing job of promoting the culture and every employee takes part in creating that experience. There is daily entertainment every evening that you can enjoy from the restaurant or the bar. I ordered a Pineapple Pupule drink and it was AMAZING...if that's the one thing you do, well worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you're there to see Maui, not the inside of a hotel room.”
Reviews.Author: ninja_turtle_21
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at KBH. We would definitely stay there again. Here's the main reasons why: KBH is right on Kaanapali Beach. This is one of the nicer beaches in Maui - that means no rocks or stinging jelly fish - only bright white sand and blue water. This is probably the number one reason we'd stay again (that, and the price). The grounds are gorgeous and the pool is a good size. You can grab a beach lounger and pick a spot anywhere on the grounds - shady or sunny, near the beach or near the pool and relax. Compare this to the Whaler next door whose swimming pool is the size of a postage stamp and all the loungers are crammed in around it. The staff were very friendly. I didn't pass one without a smile and an "Aloha". Our room was comfortable and perfect for travelers who are there to see Maui and don't want to spend too much time in or money on a hotel. We didn't even pay for a room with a view (cheapest option) and even though the lanai directly faced the hotel next door, with just a quarter turn to the left you could see the ocean. I spent a lot of time on the lanai. Ample parking at $9 a day. The Whaler next door charged $11 and our friends staying there often had difficulty finding a spot because the owners on the condo side of the Whaler leave their cars there all year round. We didn't eat at the restaurants, but our friends ate at the Tikki Terrace and said the food was incredible. Expect to pay ~$25 an entree though. The other great thing is that it's just a short 5 minute walk to Whaler's Village. Shops and restaurants galore! Be sure to eat at Leilani's on the patio and try the double kobe burger. You could skip the barefoot bar at the restaurant next door though - the food wasn't great and even though it seems novel to eat in the sand with your shoes off, it's really more hassle than it's worth. Also - be sure to stop in at YogurtLand. We went there 3 times during our stay! There were a few things that didn't bother us, but that might bother others. We didn't have a tub in our room - only a stand up shower. They gave us 2 double beds - but may have switched us to a room with a queen if we had asked. Local calls were $.75 and they charged us to use the safe. Also, internet was ~$10.00 a day. We got around this by using WiFi hotspots around the area. The Molokai building does not have an elevator (not sure about the other buildings). Only 3 flights, but keep this in mind if you have mobility issues. Otherwise, if you are planning on going with the "no view" option, the Molokai building is probably the best way to get a partial view. Some of the other buildings overlook the parking lot. Oh yeah and there's entertainment every night. And they give you a free lei when you leave - one of the ones with the kukui nuts - so don't buy one as a souvenir.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: snorkelgirl55
Reviews.Content: My friends had been to Kaanapali Beach Hotel 20 years ago and wanted to go back. It is still a very Hawaiian hotel and we loved it there. It is an older hotel and not a fancy resort, but it was quiet, relaxing, the service was excellent, and it was perfect for us. It was also on a gorgeous beach. We could walk a few minutes down the beach to snorkel at Black Rock which we loved or walk to Whaler's Village for shopping and eating. It was easy to take the bus from Whaler's Village to Lahaina for only $1 for more shopping and more restuarants. I want to go back now!

Reviews.Title: “Maui No ka 'oi”
Reviews.Author: rhmw
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our eighth vacation stay at Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel on Maui, Hawaiâ€™I and are planning our ninth consuctive year for May 2012. Although not the newest or most glamorous full scale resorts on Maui, Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel offers its valued guests the most Aloha Spirit in the islands. By its vote as being Hawaiâ€™i most Hawai;ian Hotel , each and every guest can appreciate how the entire staff extends fondest Aloha to all. The eleven acres that the resort occupies gives each guest a relaxed pace and the beautiful grounds with plenty of shade and sun offers a rewarding experience. The Ohana ( family ) sprit is truly expressed each and every day from all of the staff. We welcome the fact that KBH is truly our home away from home in the islands. We plan on spending many enjoyable times with all of our friends at KBH and wish that everyone would also will investigate for future vacation plans. Mike and Rodger Hunter McMinnville, Or

Reviews.Title: “No need for penguins or flamingos.”
Reviews.Author: crazytobeinvegas
Reviews.Content: Our second time here. We totally love KBH. Let me tell you the pros. Literally steps to the beach, awesome shopping 5 minute walk away, great breakfast buffet, minutes to black rock, excellent free entertainment nightly, great free classes. Did I mention the staff? They are so amazing. That is why we came back to Maui this year. On our way home we had to stay an extra night due to airline issues. They sent us to another hotel in Ka'anapali Beach area. It was nice ($800. a night). Eventhough they are a large resort with penguins and flamingos on the grrounds I would not trade it for KBH. The staff and overall atmosphere here at KBH is just so relaxing. Thank you and we'll see you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flycou
Reviews.Content: Got what I expected for the price. Great location. Older facility but kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: royal2904
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 week on the second leg of our honeymoon. Having stayed at a Hilton hotel in Oahu we were a little disappointed with the comfort level of the rooms. Dubbed as the most Hawaiian hotel in Maui, the decor was traditional but a little out dated. The beds were uncomfortable and the maid service was a little unreliable. On the other hand the location was great for the beach, snorkeling, shopping and dining. The gardens were beautiful and the pool was good to. Surprisingly everything closed at 9pm and there was no room service. I would not recommend this for single people. I wold recommend this hotel for couples and families as it was good value in comparison to neighboring hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Dana007
Reviews.Content: Everyone was helpful and friendly while providing great service our whole stay. The rooms are well kept and clean with provided amenities and a safe if needed. As for the location, its Hawaii, of course it was perfect! The only thing we did not like was leaving. Thank-you to all the staff at Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel for a great time. Joe & Dana M.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Dana
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe what a WONDERFUL place this was to stay! Staff was VERY FRIENDLY & HELPFUL, gift shop prices were reasonable, ALWAYS some activities planned for the day. I really LOVE LOVE LOVED that they offered & held Sunday morning church service in the courtyard! BIG PLUS! We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DJphoto
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel. Kaanapali beach can be an expensive area to stay on Maui but the Kaanapali offers a great value with out all of the frills. The hotel could use a bit of updating and better amenities also the mixed plate was closed down "Due to the economy". It was all ok for us. We ate at the hotel's other resturant and also went to Lahaina for food. Over all the place has not changed much in the past ten years or so. The Aloha sprit is very prevalent at the KBH and we will return again for sure :)

Reviews.Title: “The right hotel for us on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: chucky2
Reviews.Content: This is our third time to KBH in the last 35 years -- and the reviews (I read them all) are correct. I would confirm the Pros: the best stretch of beach on Kaanapali; it is just below Black Rock for snorkeling with turtles etc (make sure you have the right KBH hotel because other hotels can fool you and use a similar name) make sure it is right beside BLACK ROCK and WHALERS VILLAGE; you also have Whalers V illage with excellent dining and shops; excellent other dining establishments along the Kaanapali Parkway as well; KBH has great Hawaiian spirit that includes artisans and live Hawaiian music on site; staff certainly have the Hawaiian aloha spirit and virtually all of them greet you everywhere on the resort; I also need to mention the great spirit among the staff at the Tiki Bar and the Tiki Grill just beside the pool -- it is not pretentious and is laid back. The pool was large enough; plenty of beach chairs; towels; I was happy to find significant upgrades to rooms; breakfeast was fine and had variety (it was included in our package); LAHAINA is only 5-10 minutes away with its many shops and dining area (and all the tours you can book - even a ferry boat for a day trip to Lanai !). KBH is only 10 minuites from Kapalua Beach (a must see and great snorkeling), and Honoloa Bay also for snorkeling (but rocky). We recommend the trip up Haleakala but best to call ahead to ensure it is not too cloudy - for good views of the volcano valley). Also I recommend the visit to the Blow Hole just past Kapalua on the West/North area coast. It is not well advertised but ask - wear hiking shores and make your way doen the trail to the ocean - now at the Blow Hole there is also a heart carved right in the rock - great for pictures - ask for directions CONS: no jacuzz- -I'm not sure why KBH after so many years don't at least put in one large jacuzzi. In conclusion when you have the sun and views of lanai and molokai islands in front of you at KBH (in the day or at sunset) , with Hawaiiian music coming from the Tiki Bar area ---- you will have everything (Enjoy !).

Reviews.Title: “too much fun!”
Reviews.Author: Belowthepeak
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, close to everything, affordable, wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: lisatarheel
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, great experience. Not our first visit and won't be our last. Local Hawain flavor adds an extra special touch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway with kids”
Reviews.Author: RhodyGirl17
Reviews.Content: As a GM for several hotels on the Mainland, I can be very critical and watchful for service and overall quality of a hotel. I was very pleased with our 11day stay in Maui. Although this is not the most modern hotel-I found it clean and functional for all of our needs. This hotel has one of the most pleasant and knowledgeable staff I have ever met. It is obvious that they love their jobs and that the hotel is run very well. You should take advantage of the morning welcome breakfast-it really helps to plan the activities available on the island. The free classes offered at the hotel are great for adults and children. Mikala was our guide in two our classes. He was so patient and kind-a real asset for the hotel. I am looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy047
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves here. We stayed in a beautiful partial ocean view room and highly recommend that view, instead of one facing the parking areas. I was nervous about reviews saying it was brown and outdated, etc.. I am happy to report that the hotel lobby was cheerful and upbeat and not at all outdated. It did not feel too Hawaiian at all, either, and the staff seemed helpful and friendly, though we didn't have any issues. Our room was modern and cheerfully decorated. We spent most of our free time sitting on the balcony, enjoying the view and shade. The grounds of this hotel felt so much more spacious and private compared to some of the other high-rise and perhaps fancier hotels. Their pools were just feet from the sidewalk, whereas this place had so much more greenery and privacy. The size of the room was quite generous, as was the bathroom, and the lighting was fine, too. We had the breakfast package and thought it was very delicious, even though each day was similar to the previous. That was fine with us and we stuffed ourselves with the freshly cut fruit (and everything else!). The hotel very generously offers you a 30 minute stay in a room to shower before your flight back home (and lets you spend the day on the grounds, of course). I will say that that room, which faced the parking areas, was smaller, and had a smaller and not as well-lit bathroom. I recommend you get the partial ocean view, if you can. Also, we had a great time at the Warren and Annabelle Magic Show in Lahaina. The food there was pretty good but not spectacular, but we would have starved if we didn't eat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here will come back again!”
Reviews.Author: karigjo
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip through Costco and did the package deal. I was a little nervous flying with a young child and going to a place I had little information about. My Husband and I were so pleasantly surprised! WE LOVE THIS PLACE! I will Definitely come back! We were so impressed at how family friendly it was, and how easy it was to relax there. I loved all the friendly staff and they really took good care of us. One thing I wish i had known earlier was how good the dinners were are the Tiki Terrace! We did a breakfast buffet everyday there which was fine, but the dinners are awesome! We met my brothers family there and this is definitely a place to enjoy with small children!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in beautiful Maui”
Reviews.Author: Africabat
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this truly Hawaiian hotel. We prefer this hotel to the bigger, more corporate feel hotels such as The Sheraton or Marriott. The location of the hotel is ideal, on a beautiful stretch of sandy beach and close to bars and restaurants in the Whaler's Village. You can also get the shuttle to lovely Lahaina Town for more restaurants and shops. The hotel offers a variety of Hawaiian activities and has spacious, well kept grounds. You can also snorkel off the beach at Black Rock. I would recommend getting an ocean front room, as sunset views are fantastic and the sound of the waves is very relaxing. Consider the hire car package that the hotel offers as it is an easy drive from the airport and there is lots to see around the island. We hope to come back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: moseleygal1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week on our second half of a two-week break in Hawaii. After a hellish (and overpriced) break at a Sheraton on Kauai this place was a revelation. The staff are incredibly friendly and beam at you as you check-in. The fastest bar tender in the world serves drinks by the pool. The grounds leading up to the beach are huge, and most rooms have a fabulous ocean front view. The location is fabulous but we were happy to spend a few days just chilling by the pool, which was lovely. The decor is a little kitsch and most rooms seems to open out on to open air landings. But it was fabulous value - for a prime spot on Ka'anpali beach - and everything was very comfortable. The staff were great and to be honest a stay here would be worth twice what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hula Show for Kids”
Reviews.Author: KMcDente
Reviews.Content: Instead of going to an expensive luau with the kids, we go to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for their nightly hula show. For the cost of a couple drinks your kids get to watch some hula. It is amateurish but entertaining and the whole night cost us $12. They even validate parking.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hawaiian hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: HonorX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days and had a wonderful time. The hotel is right by a lovely stretch of the beach with plenty of room to be found to sit and gaze at the fabulous views across the water. The rooms are nice, clean and spacious, with good bathrooms and everything you need. The staff here are absolutely lovely and seem to really enjoy working at the hotel. It prides itself on being very Hawaiian and they do a lot for the local community, which was a big plus point for us. Everyone who works there has a vested interest in the success of the place which does mean people really care about what they are doing. The hotel is also very good value compared to some places in this area. And it is right by the Whalers village so there is easy access to shops and restaurants. Lahina (which was a lot nicer than we expected!) is a 10 min drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Beach Front Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TandDfromIowa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for our honeymoon because of the great price, despite some of the poor reviews we read online. We had a great time and enjoyed the hotel despite a few annoyances. Even though the hotel wasn't perfect, we would stay here again because of the awesome location & price. We arrived at about 10:30pm and were hungry as we had not eaten dinner yet. We were disappointed to find that the hotel restaurant was closed, the hotel bar was no longer serving food, and the front desk clerk said he was unsure if we'd find any place open to eat at. We booked a room with a king sized bed, but were told that none were available. We were given a room with two twin sized beds for our first night. (How romantic for a honeymoon?) After we found our room we decided to wander down the beach to look for a place to eat. The hotel next door had a restaurant on the beach which was open and still serving food even though the desk clerk told us otherwise. They had us change rooms for the second day and offered no compensation for the inconvenience. The wing we stayed in did not have an elevator so we had to drag our luggage up the stairs. On the third day we found a fruit tray & champaign in our refrigerator which a family member had arranged to be sent to us upon arrival. It would have been nice to have this the first night. We were VERY pleased with the view from our room. When booking, we selected a "garden view" room which was the cheapest option, but we had a beautiful ocean view from our balcony. The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect. It is right on the beach with a beautiful view of the ocean. It is a short walk to Whaler's Village shopping center, which we visited every day. There is an ABC store there which was great for buying cheap snacks & souvenirs. I would highly recommend renting a car as the driving is very easy and relaxed. We also frequently drove to Lahaina town for shopping and dining. I HIGHLY recommend going to the welcome show!!! So much great info & yummy free breakfast! The magic show at the hotel was pretty neat. The magician gave us some great info about where the best shows & sites were. The hotel had live music every night and the tiki torches all lit up was very neat. The rooms were not bad at all. A bit outdated maybe but nothing that bothered me. Very quiet, no problem getting great sleep. The goodbye ceremony was very nice. Overall it was a fine place to stay and we loved being right on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Best on Ka'anapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: Wally_G_Minneapolis
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you are on Maui for Sightseeing, Sun, and Surf. The hotel has everything you need at a reasonable price. The staff is great, the rooms comfortable, and the location on Ka'anapali could not be better. Easy access to the Black Rock swim area and Whalers Village shopping via the beachside path. Also an easy drive to Lahaina, 5 minutes down the road. We enjoyed the lei ceremony at the end of our stay. We wore the lei's the rest of the day on O'ahu. You will not get that kind of personal attention at any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Focus on the positives, which far outweigh the negatives.”
Reviews.Author: SkipperB
Reviews.Content: We spent last week at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel in an ocean front room (Kauai wing) with our teenage daughter and her best friend. We'd been to the hotel nearly 20 years ago, and have since stayed at many other properties on Maui .. but I chose the KBH for specific reasons. You can basically get the ocean front room here for pretty much the same price as a room overlooking the parking lot at one of the more upscale resorts in Kaanapali. For us, there is nothing quite like falling asleep with the sliding doors open and the sound of the ocean waves hitting the shoreline. And waking up to the birds singing in the trees. I was OK with the fact that the bedspreads could be updated and the shower drained a little slowly. The room was clean. We all fell asleep listening to the ocean....it's hard to put a price on that! The grounds are spacious and lounge chairs are plentiful. We've been to high-end resorts with great pool areas, etc. .. but you have to rush to save a chair early in the day and then you're wedged in with hardly any room to move. At KBH .. you have this massive lawn area and you're free to pull a chair under a tree or wherever you want. It's lovely and perfectly relaxing. Our girls did the paddle surf lessons from the beach shack .. and loved it. They saw turtles, a monk seal, and many tropical fish right there at Black Rock. We walked over to Whaler's Village to eat a few times (Leilani's has their famous Hula Pie .. don't miss it!) and shop. Also walked down the foot path to the Hyatt Regency for their Drums of the Pacific Luau - - which was great. The valet parking was only $11.00 per day (unheard of for this area!) and the guys there were genuinely kind. The free classes (we did lei making, hula lessons, notecard making) are fun! The music each night ends by 9pm, hardly a nuisance. It's lovely!! The lobby area hasn't changed much in 20 years .. but who cares?! You walk through it occasionally, you're not sleeping in the lobby! If you decide to book the Kaanapali Beach Hotel .. enjoy it for its perfect location, charming employees, amazing views (ocean front .. so worth it!), affordability, spacious grounds and ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Silicon_Valley_Guy1
Reviews.Content: I had not been to Kaanapali beach in over 20 years. So for my 4 day stay in March, 2011, I chose the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH). It is located at the northern end of the hotels lining Kaanapali Beach - in between the Sheraton (to the north) and the Kaanapali Alii to the south. The hotel's location is good; easy walking distance to Whaler's Village with shopping and restaurants. Even the Hyatt - which is the last hotel to the south was not a particularly long walk. The hotel grounds are well maintained and there is a bar and a snack/grill place both located by the pool. The pool is adequate but nothing spectacular. When you stay at the KBH you are trading off hotel amenities for a lower room cost. So the pool is merely adequate; the restaurant is adequate; the hotel is clearly an older hotel but still maintained well. Parking for my rental car was $9/day with unlimited in and out. A surprise to me was that the hotel does not provide any chairs or lounges for use at the beach. Instead there is a 3rd party vendor there who charges a rental fee. During my stay the surf was breaking close in to shore, so no body surfing was possible. No wireless and a $10/day charge for internet access in the room via ethernet wire connection. I was happy with the KBH and the trade-off I made. But then other than sleeping and breakfast, I did not spend much time there. I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Plain, dated interior but can't beat price or location”
Reviews.Author: LD2232
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first three nights of our visit to Maui in March 2011 and I had chosen to stay based on the tripadvisor reviews and the affordability - the later part of our trip was to be at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua so we wanted to save a bit on the front end. Overall we enjoyed our time there and you honestly cannot beat the price or the location, so I would recommend it for those reasons. However, if you are used to newer accommodations or higher-end items, this is not the place for you and you may be disappointed. The hotel prides itself on being Maui's most Hawaiian hotel, but I didn't feel that. It may be the most simple and down to earth one, but we met plenty of lovely folks from Maui at our other accommodation too. What we loved - the view and location!! We booked a pool view and had a gorgeous pool and ocean view to watch sunsets from - though every night standing by the pool or beach was typically where you'd want to be. Gorgeous sunsets. Easy walk to Whalers Wharf with restaurants and shops was a great plus - and they have a shuttle bus there for $1 that takes you into Lahaina - awesome deal! Cab fares are very expensive on the island. What we didn't like - I like newer feeling hotels. Everything was clean - it just felt very dated. Again, if you don't mind that, this is a great reasonable option. Also, I left a drawer full of clothes in our room. Totally my fault - when we moved to the next hotel later in the week I realized it immediately and called the KBH to have them check and just felt like it was more difficult than normal to do. I called Housekeeping - they said they hadn't found anything so I had to ask them to please go to the room and look in the drawer. Then I had to call back. Again, I would think they'd call me to say they found it. Again, my fault but higher end places would be going above and beyond to assist in my opinion. Sure enough they had it and put it in a bag for me which was nice (again, it was MY fault) - but then you compare that to excellent service (Ritz Kapalua) - who sent a driver at no cost down to the hotel to pick up my stuff for me and bring it back to my room. Again, grounds, location, price are unbeatable - just don't expect new and shiny. And I didn't feel any over the top service. Just regular.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic means cheesy and dirty”
Reviews.Author: wahinestacie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here along with many guests in March 2011 for a friend who was getting married in the area. On the hotel website, it advertises itself as Hawaii's Most Hawaiian Hotel. You will notice this fact the moment you walk into the lobby. There are many vendors selling Hawaiian goods like it was a bazaar or swap meet. It is a rather cheesy look and feel. We were put in a room in their Kauai building overlooking a construction site. I wasn't too concern about the view. The air conditioner didn't work because the sensors on the sliding door fell off. I wouldn't lean on the balcony railing because it was wobbly and seemed like it was ready to break off. The room was rather dark and just had a dirty feeling like a cheap motel. The Hawaiian quits they advertise on their beds appear very worn and needs replacement. There are old CRT tvs in the room. If you do not tell them you will NOT be using the safe in the room, they will automatically charge you a daily fee. You can use the safe at the front desk for free. Moreover, I had a room near the elevator so I could hear the elevator go up and down all night. The one good thing about how their property is setup is that we could always find parking and the parking structure is connected directly to the buildings so it was easy to walk to. The location is pretty good if you plan to stay on the west side of Maui. There is a beach walking path in front of the hotel. There is easy access to Black Rock (popular swimming/ snorkeling area) and a couple of strip malls for food, clothes and Hawaiian goods. Lahaina is about a 10 - 15 minute drive. Taxis are not easy to find so a car is essential if you plan to leave the area. The hotel is about 45 minutes from the airport. I hear it is about $100 taxi ride or a $50 shuttle fee but I am not sure since I rented a car. Overall, growing up on Oahu, I didn't enjoy the Ka'anapali Beach hotel at all. The buildings, rooms and decor needs a major face lift. I was not comfortable at all. Everything seems old and appeared dirty. One of my friend's said it just encouraged them to spend less time in the room and more time on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed (from Seattle, WA)”
Reviews.Author: mommyof3littleones
Reviews.Content: If you're used to Marriott-level or higher accommodations, this is not the place for you,. We just returned from 5-day trip with our entire family. My husband and I along with 3 little kids booked our flight/hotel stay at KBH/rental car as a package through Costco Travel. We used Costco Travel for our honeymoon to Greece 6 years ago and were very pleased with all the accommodations and transportation arrangements made for the package. After reading mostly good reviews for KBH, we decided to buy the package. Meanwhile my parents and other family members booked condos at The Whaler next door. We were disappointed upon arrival to KBH. More disappointed when we saw our room. Then, after seeing the beautiful condos our relatives were staying at at The Whaler, we couldn't help but feel like we wasted our money on KBH. We can't believe Costco would put that out there. The KBH prides itself in being "The most hawaiian hotel" in kaanapali. Yes, it's lobby screams 1960's tiki hut with it's wood panelled walls and island furniture, in dire need of updating. Apparently, some of the rooms have been/are being updated, but it's just the luck of the draw which room you get. Unfortunately, we had an older room. Hard mattresses. Rough sheets that sounded like paper. One day, housekeeping did not get to our room and came by to apologize in the afternoon, "Sorry we didin't clean your room, we got so busy with all the checkouts." Being a germaphobe, all I could think of was 'bedbugs'. I worried about my little ones playing on the beds, walking on the carpet, etc. It just wasn't homey enough or relaxing for our family with little ones. We've learned our lesson: that we're more comfortable in a condo with a small kitchen and a separate living space from the bedrooms. On the positive side, overall the staff was friendly and helpful. Guest services let us borrow a wheelchair for a few days without charge. The bartender at the pool bar was great and adored the kids. Our package stay came with free daily buffet breakfast for 2 at the restaurant. A nice perk, considering my husband and I didn't want to have to cook or do dishes while on vacation. The breakfast buffet spread varied daily but included a variety of fresh fruit, traditional American food (either pancakes, waffles, bacon, sausage), traditional Hawaiian breakfast (either corned beef hash, sausage, grilled mahi mahi, pork), danishes, bread bar, cereal bar, and drinks--coffee, juices including tropical juices, milk, etc. Our kids have a ton of food allergies, and it was nice to have a variety of warm, hearty food that we could all eat and start our day off with. However, the breakfast does cost $14 per person, and we definitely would not have paid that on our own if we didn't have breakfast as part of the package. The location of KBH is amazing. We've stayed in northern Kaanapali and Kehei on past trips. This was the first time we stayed on this part of Kaanapali Beach and really loved it. Close to shopping, restaurants, beautiful beach, etc. Plus, our parents and relatives were just a walk away next door. They did use our pool because The Whaler did not have a kiddy pool for my nephew to use. So the kids did enjoy the KBH pool. You're also just a short drive to Lahaina, to grocery stores and other shopping, restaurants. Bottome line: it was an affordable travel package. but we got what we paid for. To go to a gorgeous place like Maui, we wish we would've splurged and stayed at a nice hotel or condo. KBH was not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with our stay at Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: porkycar
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Kaanapali Hotel and loved it! Our daughter and her family also stayed in the room next to us and we were ocean front and just steps from the beach and the ocean boardwalk. Our daughter and family also had nothing but good things to say about their stay there. The beds were comfortable, maid service good, not far to walk to restaurants, etc. The weather was fantastic which really capped off the wonderful week spent at Kaanapali Beach Hotel.Its a great place for families, we highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rebeccajewel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the recommendation of my mother who stayed here a good 20 or so years before us - and we were very happy. I didn't want budget accommodation and I was pleasantly surprised. Don't expect the Hilton or the Sheraton but in terms of value for money - I really enjoyed it. You are on the end of the beach/chain of restaurants, which means you aren't in the hive of activity - which is either a good thing or a bad thing. We spent our evenings hopping from one restaurant bar to the next with a five year old in tow. The beach at the time was too rough for my daughter to swim, so we spent a lot of time in the pool. The "kids club" was great - I only have one child (a daughter) and it isn't a club that you drop your kid off and see them at the end of the day. You participate with them, creating lei's, learning dances, etc - which builds on the whole holiday experience. We had great fun together, which I think is the whole purpose of a holiday. If you are looking for value for money, having fun with your kids while still having adult fun - this is it. It needs to be said that our room overlooked the beach!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs upgrading”
Reviews.Author: ArtCook
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 10 years ago and based on the current reviews decided to give it another try. We found the rooms to be in serious need of upgrade. The grounds and beach are immaculate, but the rooms and the restaurant were disappointing. Our friends asked their room to be changed because of a musty odor that was obvious as soon as the door was opened. The food at the rstaurant was just average. We tried the breakfast buffet which we found to be Denny's type food at Ritz prices. We also had dinner only becuse we didn't want to go somewhere else. We only did this once. But there are plenty of other restaurants nearby. It isa great location. Service was wonderful. But I won't stay again until they spend some money to fi it up.

Reviews.Title: “Love KBH, came alone this time and was totally comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gaicha
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel. Last time came with husband and 2 teens. This time alone. Felt totally safe and comfortable. Everyone is so nice. Room 474 was perfect, good price, great view. Went on the trilogy catamaran off the beach and had a great trip. Good captain and crew. This is my favorite hotel in Maui and we have stayed at quite a few of them over the years. If your flight leaves later in the day you can request to use the hospitality room for 1/2 hour to shower.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hawaiiana Experience!”
Reviews.Author: SteveHindahouse
Reviews.Content: Dear Staff at the KBH - My wife and I completely enjoyed out getaway. The staff was pleasant and kind. Many fun activities - we did ukulele lessons, and my wife did the hula lessons. Great snorkeling right off the beach at Black Rock. Great magic show. The Guest Services folks were awesome - and gave us little trinkets to take back to the kids. I'd definitely recommend this hotel. Great sense of family here. Thank you! Steve H. San Antonio, TX

Reviews.Title: “The only thing more lumpy than the beds, are the pillows.”
Reviews.Author: Tavis2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff not friendly or helpful. Guest services are a joke. Food is below average. The shower could use a good cleaning. The beds are horrible and pillows are worse. Parking is a disaster, and cost 9.00 a day. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than the big resorts....”
Reviews.Author: Mainegirl72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the KBH for the first time and I will ALWAYS stay there in the future. The staff there is unbelievable, Stella, Patty and Ron, just to name a few. They make you feel like you are part of the family. Staying at the KBH is far more relaxed and intimate then staying at the huge resorts, with all the people and kids and such. You can venture down the beach to any one of the other resorts if you would like to try out the different restaurants and shopping. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Island Romance Package”
Reviews.Author: Todderm
Reviews.Content: Several things about this hotel attracted us initially. The location, the price compared to the other properties around it and their description as being "the most Hawaiian hotel". We know Maui in general, is expensive. Some things met our expectations and others didn't. 3 weeks later, I still feel as if we were ripped off and that they stuck it to us. I hate having that feeling! We're pretty seasoned travelers too. After re-evaluating, we could have upgraded to another hotel and paid the same or less after all the add on fees and taxes Ka'anapali charges. Breakfast - almost indeible - the fruit is terrible (aren't we in Maui?) and the coffee is out of a box and barely tolerable (c'mon Kona?) Pool - very small Rooms - Decor needed updating, clean but they put us in a "smoking allowed on the balcony" bldg. At night we had to keep our patio doors closed as the people next to us smoked outside all the time. Tikki Hut food - only tolerable and not a good value Parking - The parking spots in the garage are SO tiny, even a VW has a hard time parking without getting door dings. It's a nightmare every time to get into a spot. Fitness - There is no fitness facility at all, so if you do want to exercise, you have to pay to belong to the gym up the street. Keep that in mind as added expense. The Island Romance Package (or probably any package) - a complete ripoff. Be very careful on the fees and and the cost of the car. This is a big money maker for them and terrible for the customer. It looks good when quoted but the car ended up costingus a small fortune. I have never been so angry! Also, we should have had an oceanfront room, but didn't get it. No discussion that I had on numerous attempts at the front desk and guest services seemed to make a difference and no-one seemed to care. They are nice to your face, but there is absolutely NO follow up or follow thru. Read the fine print on all and any of your hotel/package info careully as the cost often goes up from what you were quoted. Be aware that they never add taxes and fees in anything til you get the bottom line - especially the car.

Reviews.Title: “Rests on its laurels... likely shadow of former self.”
Reviews.Author: nathonkim
Reviews.Content: My impression of the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel is that it is likely a shadow of its former self. It looks like at one point, perhaps in the 70â€™s, this was THE place to be, but has since rested on its laurels and reputation and depends on repeat business from people who remember it in its hey-day. A sign of this was when they had their â€œgoodbyeâ€� ceremony. I think at one point this must have been a grand ceremony where the entire staff came out to sing goodbye to the guests and gave them leisâ€¦ but it has been downgraded to one person singing along with a recording. I think this is probably symptomatic of how much this place is cutting corners and going downhill from its former glory. Granted, it is in a great location just by Black Rock on the beautiful Kaâ€™anapali Beach, I expected more for the price I paid for this prime location. The buildings and dÃ©cor similar to what you would find in an average motel on the mainland. At no point during our stay did I feel like we were at a resortâ€¦ just a place to sleep near the beach with a restaurant and live music. And thatâ€™s what we treated it asâ€¦ but at nearly $200 a night, I really did expect much, much more. My biggest complaint is about what happened to me and my wife during and after the Tsunami Warning of mid-march 2011. When the warning was issued at 10PM, the security staff very rudely entered our room with their master key and informed us that we have to evacuate the room immediately and that they would come in every hour until we did so. When I asked where we were supposed to go, they didnâ€™t have an answer for us. When we finally got an answer, it was not ideal. The only place they could evacuate us to was the outdoor 6th floor hallway and we would have to sleep on the floor until morning. My wife was sick, and I did not want to expose her to the elements. The staff there seemed very unsympathetic to our dilemma. Instead of risking pneumonia on the floor in an outdoor hallway, we chose to sleep in our car until morning. When I asked for a refund for the night we spent in the car instead of in the beds they were contractually obligated to provide for us, we received no reply. I understand that it was an unusual situation, but my complaint was that they offered no recourse other than to â€œdeal with itâ€�. It seemed that when the warning was issued, they washed their hands of us and didnâ€™t really care if we were comfortableâ€¦ just that we were out of harms way so that if by the remote chance something did happen, we couldn't sue. We entrusted this place with our hard-earned vacation time and money and expected to be treated better than the treatment we got both during and after the pseudo-crisis. I think this situation summed up what this hotel has become. The analogy would be an old crooner who thinks heâ€™s still relevant today and thinks that people should like him because he used to have talentâ€¦ but in reality doesnâ€™t give a lick about his audience and is only doing it for the money. And people still swoon because they remember how it USED to beâ€¦ and canâ€™t open their eyes to the present reality.

Reviews.Title: “Premium Maui at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: joanpierc
Reviews.Content: There are no water slides for the kiddies, but it is situated on the beach next to the Whaler which is much pricier and just south of the Sheraton at black rock (great snorkeling area). Staff was very helpful, especially since this happened during the predicted tsunami. The grounds are spacious, our room with a partial ocean view had a great balcony overlooking the ocean and a large open space for lounging, strolling on the paths, or swimming in their pools, eating at the economical and casual Tikki or drinking at their outdoor bar. They also have a restaurant on site. They offer informative discussions on Hawaiin culture, crafts including lei making to guests along with other activities daily. If you want the bells and whistles of a 4 or 5 star, this probably isn't it, but if you want comfort and the beauty of Maui that won't break the bank, this is your place. And a word about service. We forgot a bag in the garage. They found it, contacted us and had it taxied to us just before our flight left. That was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel in Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: beanweb24
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at KBH as a solo female traveler (late 30s). I really wanted to love KBH...folks always rave about the charm and aloha, and I was ready to experience it myself. I came away liking the hotel, not loving it, but wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to travelers looking for budget lodging in a really great location. Pros: room was exceptionally clean, nice sized lanai, fridge in the room, location really cannot be beat, Trilogy activities desk onsite was great and reasonably priced, live music nightly. Cons: room was very dated, had an electrical issue with the sconce (shot flames out of it...very scary but quickly tended to), thin walls, had to pay for parking, pool was just okay, and not fitness facilities, no wireless internet. Also, only the Molokai wing offers non-smoking rooms, and I believe those are the most outdated rooms. A note about the thin walls -- this actually was not an issue until one night when the electricity went off and I could hear the person next door to me snoring. Otherwise, I found that I was definitely younger than most of the guests at the hotel...which was both good and bad: good because there were no crazy loud nights or early mornings, but bad because I did feel a little out of place and did not really hang out at the Tiki Bar like I thought I might. I did not really interact with the staff, and that appears to be what typically garners this hotel such high reviews. I know it has a reputation for its true Hawaiian spirit and aloha, but frankly KBH did not have the same hold on me. What it did deliver, unquestionably, was a very clean room in a location that you really cannot beat. I loved being able to walk to Whalers Village in a matter of minutes, and the beach in front of the hotel is really nice (and the cabana rentals are very reasonable). I even enjoyed lying in the beach chairs at night to do a little star gazing. Come to this hotel if you're on a budget and you don't need a fancy, manicured resort to complete your Hawaiian vacation. For the price and location, it's a solid value.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: traveluver047
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 7 nights in Maui. We have stayed all over the island from Wailea, Kihei, to Kaanapali. The best advice is to make sure you know what you really want before booking this hotel. It is older, built in the 60's and it shows in the building. The grounds are beautiful but not "manicured" compared to some other properties in Kaanapali. The rooms are ok, but worn. Breakfast is good, but exactly the same every morning. The Tiki bar makes great drinks. The Tiki grill has a small menu with very few healthy choices, but really great service. The pool is small, but theres no fighting over lounge chairs, and no charge for towels. We traveled with two young teen boys who didn't really care for it. Not much for them on the property. Nightly music was lovely. This hotel didn't have many young couples (30-40 age range). Mostly older folks 55+. Our stay wasn't bad but it wasn't spectacular either. The entire hotel staff was very very nice. If you want a higher end hotel, multiple pools, updated rooms and amenities,this is not the place for you. If you want laid back on a budget your golden!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for the dough”
Reviews.Author: DaveAndCarolyn_9
Reviews.Content: Just returned from KBH and left a pretty favourable impression. As other travellers have stated, a pretty good hotel, great location, and really good staff. We recommend staying in the freshly updated rooms. We were on the 5th floor (Kauai bldg), and the room and it's view were fabulous. Only 2 minor criticism's: The property is a bit aged, and the included breakfast package venue is a bit chinsey (location faces the front of the hotel and buffet offerings a little boring). Other than that, a truly fine time and cudo's to the property owners and their promotion of Hawaiian heritage. PS--Don't miss Dale (the 400,000 Mai Tai Guy) at the Tiki Bar. As he would say......AhhhhhhhhRight! Well done KBH. As a side for dining, highly recommend the Tiki Grill (at KBH) and the adjacent Hula Grill and Lelanis.............do not go to Dukes, about 15 minutes down the road. This restaurant does not hold a candle to the other Dukes eateries/locations.

Reviews.Title: “"Best Place on Maui" can not wait to come back - Just like Home”
Reviews.Author: Downey2008
Reviews.Content: I have been there three times in the last ten years.. Rent a car or not its close to Great shopping. Package deals are the way to go. Ours include breakfast vouchers for the mixed grill ( the best for breakfast -lunch or dinner) They do have gourmet dinning at night - fantastic entertainment at night. The friendliest staff and managers Locally owned. Listen-up people they pay people to give Bad reviews.. WAKE UP. you do not have to spend $600 a day to have fun and enjoy island life. Ma halo

Reviews.Title: “This is what a vacation should be”
Reviews.Author: KMHud
Reviews.Content: This is not the most glamorous hotel or condo on Kaanapali. You will not be in awe of their lobby. You will be in awe of their staff, their flexibility, their knowledge of the Hawaiian Islands and culture, and their aloha spirit. It was genuine. They had great classes available at no charge. Adults and kids were welcome. Three different kinds of lei making projects, pineapple cutting, weaving, and a tour and explanation of the medicinal properties of many of the native plants on the property. There was hula provided by students at the local hula schools each evening and music by locals who just like to play Hawaiian music. Lunch was available at the Tiki Grill and beverages at the Tiki Lounge. I was suprised to see there was no price gouging as I've seen at other places on Kaanapali. Usually there is a premium for poolside snacks and beverages - not here. There was a large grassy lawn with lots of sun and large trees. You could hang out in the sun for awhile and move to the shade when you'd had enough. They didn't care if the beach chairs were scattered all about. And of course, the beach was just a few steps away We had an ocean front room that was at most 50 yards from the beach. Which was fabulous until the tsunami warnings came. Then it was a little disconcerting. All was well and the waves never surpassed the beach. Sam, the conceirge, had 6 strangers knock on his door - at home, looking for a place to stay for a bit during the warnings. His family took them in without question. That is just the kind of folks that work there. For my husband and I this was our most relaxing Hawaiian vacation. We have been to most of the islands many times and have stayed in hotels and condos, but never the same place twice. I believe we will plan to stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel next time we go to Maui. Hopefully sometime very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: kdtleonia
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on Kaanapali Beach. Beautiful beach with pretty beachwalk connecting resorts and Whalers Village shopping mall. Hotel has beautiful, well-maintained grounds with an outdoor bar and grill. Rooms were adequate, but not luxurious. Staff was delightful and very helpful. Excellent value for the price; a relative bargain along this pricey stretch of beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Fanatic_NM
Reviews.Content: This hotel really made my wife and myself feel the cultural of the islands. It was so close to the beach that my wife kept the sliding glass door open so we could hear the ocean waves lapping on the shore. The only downside was some rather questionable service from the Tiki bar, the wait person just kept on walking by us while we were listening to the nightly entertainment, which we loved (the entertainment, not the wait person). We tried the what is claimed the best Mia Tia on the island and were NOT impressed. I guess they were having an off night. Restaurant is a little dated but the hotel and grounds were kept in great shape. I was a little put off by them putting us in the old portion of hotel because it had no elevator but the front desk lady told us it is a gently sloping steps of which they were. Overall our experience was a very good one and highly recommend and will stay here the next time we come to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: ebo47
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Maui, and loved the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. The beach is so beautiful, and is right at your doorstep. The view from our 'Partial Ocean View' room was quite acceptable. The tsunami event that occurred while we were there was a bit unsettling, but there was no damage. Sam who gave the snuba and snorkel lessons in the pool was great! He gave me the confidence to try snorkelling at Black Rock which fullfilled a lifetime dream! The breakfast buffet was tasty, with a good selection of food. We hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Another AMAZING month in Maui!!”
Reviews.Author: Linda-Gord
Reviews.Content: Our partial ocean view room was amazing, the grounds are beautiful and the weather can't be beat. Spending a month in paradise is everyones dream, but for us an amazing reality. Friends we met at this hotel a few years back were there with us and we enjoyed the entire trip. The staff at the hotel are extremely friendly and make you feel like family. In the dining room, from the first day onward, we never had to ask for anything. All our favorites were on the table waiting for us. The servers, housekeeping staff and front office always called us by name. We really felt like we belonged there, and we wouldn't hesitate to return. The rooms were always clean, and if you needed something, you had only to ask and it was provided. Overall, we couldn't ask for a nicer hotel, better people or greater service. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the sounds of Waves and Live Music”
Reviews.Author: cydeweyz
Reviews.Content: We kept our sliding glass door open, and the sounds of evening music, ocean waves and birds echo into our room on this property. The staff was always helpful. Being beachfront and steps from Whaler's Village was a bonus. My only disappointment would be that no free internet is available in the room. I heard there may be free wifi somewhere on the property, but my iPhone never found it, so I ended up in Lahaina at Starbucks for my downloading pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Just what we wanted - Most Hawaiian Hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Wiseee
Reviews.Content: Definately stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel if you want the best beach location on Maui, comfortable and airy room, excellent friendly and attentive staff, beautiful hotel grounds, having easy reach of all Ka'anapali shops, restaurants and bars. And best of all you will only be paying a portion of the rates demanded by the bigger branded hotels. We were always given a great friendly Aloha by all staff as we wandered the grounds. Our Oceanview room was always kept clean and fresh. The balcony was excellent overlooking the gronds and ocean. In the evenings we could sit out and listen to the waves crashing, the nightly entertainment playing out the last tunes, birds singing in the morning and breathtaking views of the humpback whales breaching out on the oceans horizon. The best value breakfast buffet on the Ka'anapali beachfront is definately to be had from the onsite diner. Not luxurious in any way but if you need a filling breakfast of cereals, juices, fruits, warm breakfast, tea coffe you will not find it cheaper or more convenient than here at $14 each. We had an amazing time here and would definately recommend it to anyone visiting Maui. Avoid the screaming kids at all other resort hotels, avoid the pretentiousness of all other resort hotels. Experience the culture and feel of Hawaii at this wonderful Hotel. We made all our bookings through Kay Ryan (www.mauikay.com). Kay really helped us make our planning stress free and ensured we got exactly what we wanted from our honeymoon vacation. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “KBH Your Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: consue231
Reviews.Content: We just finished our 4th trip to Maui & KBH. The word that comes to mind is "Paradise". The entire staff are the most kindest and nicest people you would ever want to meet. The location is great because it is very peaceful there. There is plenty of shopping, resteraunts and entertainment for all ages. And of course don't forget the show the whales perform everyday on the ocean. There is snorkeling everyday if you want on Black Rock. Try KBH you are guarenteed to like it. We wouldn't think of staying any place else. Wayne & Connie Munford Muskegon MI.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful, very run down, though great location”
Reviews.Author: FunSun16
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a comfortable vacation - this hotel is not for you! I had no idea that the hotel in Hawaii and the one they call most Hawaiian hotel can be so aweful! The room that they gave us first on the ground level was just behond unbearable and had sickening smell of milldew and mold. When we complained they moved us to the room on the 5th floor with the decent view but we were terrified to discover that there was ants everywhere on the floor. I was really scared they'd crawl in our bags. They treated them next day, so there were less of them the day after, but they weren't gone completely. Overall it was just an aweful experience. The mail lobby and main areas were also really bad and run down. The stuff was very friendly and tried to accommodate, but there is not much consolation in that when your room stinks and all the grounds smell like a dump. I guess what you pay is what your get, but this was just really aweful even for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Staff”
Reviews.Author: mnspiceman
Reviews.Content: This was the third time my wife and I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. The staff is the best of any of the dozen or so hotels we've stayed at in Hawaii over the years. The grounds are impeccable - the best I've seen. The hotel has activities (free) that introduce guests to Hawaiian culture. The beach is one of Hawaii's best. There is shopping close by at Whaler's Village and a short drive away at Lahaina town. The welcome breakfast is great and the tips they give are informative to the first time visitors. Golf is across the street. Live music and hula every night. Who won't like it? If you like high-end, pampering hotels, go elsewhere. If you want a hotel that will take care of your kids all day long, go elsewhere. If you want a brand-new, shiny hotel, go elsewhere. This is not the RItz (that's a few miles away). If you want an elaborate pool area, walk down the beach a hundred yards. The KBH is a feel-good, friendly, welcoming hotel. If you want to get engaged with your surroundings, the staff will embrace you. If you don't, they're not going to come looking for you. Like anything else, you need to make an effort. When I come to the hotel, I do feel like family. I know of no other hotels like the KBH. What could be improved? The food. That has been handled by offering the restaurant's buffet (for breakfast) and menu service (for lunch/supper), rather than the small diner in front of the hotel. The hotel's restaurant has much better food. Some of the rooms are a little rough, but they have been remodeling. This isn't the finest hotel in the world, but it's my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hawaiian Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Helen102010
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel are very friendly, courteous, and helpful no matter what time of day or night. The view from the balconey of our oceanfront room was spectacular. Everyone at the hotel treated us like we were their Ohana(family) from the time that we got there until the time we left. This will be the only place that we will ever stay when we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian flavor”
Reviews.Author: vettetraveler56
Reviews.Content: The hotel was different from the others in the area - definitely Hawaiian, not the run-of-the-mill chain. While our room was billed as partial ocean view and had a nice balcony/lanai, it overlooked a tennis court that was being used for construction storage. The buffet breakfast was very good, but we were disappointed in dinner so usually ate elsewhere. Most of the staff were very friendly and were committed to the Hawaiian experience. The farewell ceremony and daily activities were nice and in the spirit of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location, but in need of a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Euro_101
Reviews.Content: I chose this resort based on the reviews, location, price, and that it is dubbed as the 'most hawaiian resort.' The service and employees are really great. They offer free cultural courses - it was so great to take a hula lesson! They also provide nightly entertainment - song and dance. These were great touches. Location is also fabulous and the price was right when compared to the Sheraton next door. However I will say I was not impressed with the hallway decor - it's very drab and takes away from the Hawaiian resort feel. Our room was fine - stuff was not as 'new' and 'crisp' looking as I would have liked. The room was clean though, which is one of the most important things. It was just disappointing to see it show its age. I also stayed on three other islands during this trip at some really great hotels - with that new/crisp look, so naturally I compare the KBH to these. Good value and location. Clean, but hallway and rooms could use a facelift. Just stuff to be aware of .

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: sanbern51
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room with a king size bed w/ ocean view. On the night of arrival we were assigned a room in the Molokai building -a room with 2 double beds. We were told that king size rooms were based on "availability". The room had obviously not been used in awhile as it smelled very musty and mildewy. The ceiling fan was very dirty. The sliding, old wooden door in the bath area had sand all over the floor. The fixtures in the bath were very old. I have asthma and needless to say, things went from bad to worse. The next day my husband and I,(after a miserable night) did get moved into what we were told was our "original reserved room" which was in a different building, with a king size bed and a great view. Why didn't they do that in the first place? It's obvious that hotels overbook just as the airlines do. Beware the Molokai building if anybody stays there. The other buildings in the complex were very nice.
