Reviews.Title: “Not another cookie cutter hotel”
Reviews.Author: idaholuckyducks
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel over the Marriott at Wailea for a couple of reaons. First, it was a thousand dollars cheaper for the week, but also because it is a locally owned hotel with some personality. We are so glad we chose Kaanapali Beach over Wailea. Much more central to island activities and a lot more action very nearby. The hotel was just lovely. The rooms were comfortable, spacious and attractive, but not over the top luxurious. Our favorite part was falling asleep everynight to the strains of the live Hawaiian music drifting through our open lanai doors. The location is fantastic. No room is more than a few steps to the beach. We really liked the local vendors that set up every morning in the lobby to sell handmade items. The hotel restaurant was very good. It is small enough to feel right at home right away. We will return to the KBH when we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “We call it our most favorite vacation place on the planet,and we travel lots”
Reviews.Author: Auldchic
Reviews.Content: This is our forth visit to this hotel,each time as good as or better than the last,Maui has so much to offer that it is great to come"home"and enjoy the daily activeties and nightly entertainment,this with the whale watching from the gardens,and Tiki Bar and stage make this the most Hawiian part of the vacation.

Reviews.Title: “KBH is Home”
Reviews.Author: Kalena1953
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the KBH should be renamed, 'The Ka'anapali Beach Home! From gracious smile of generous staff, to gorgeous gardens of fruit and flower, this is Hawaii. You will be planning your next trip home, before you leave. Welcomed as guest, you will depart as 'ohana'. Karen Bielecki, Chandler, Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and welcoming...treated like family”
Reviews.Author: jedigiraffe
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Kaanapali Beach Hotel (first was in 2009), and we'll gladly book again on our next trip. The staff genuinely treats each guest like family, and it's valuable to know that much of their staff has been with the hotel for 10+ years. When we spoke with locals around the area, their respect for Kaanapali Beach Hotel is genuine--the hotel is deeply rooted in the community and frequently participates/volunteers in school, neighborhood, and environmental initiatives. Everyone is warm & welcoming, and it's very easy to relax! If you're the type of traveler who is looking for 5-star everything, all-inclusive resort style vacationing, then you might not be happy here--the facility is on the older side (although very clean and well maintained). We enjoyed being able to relax at the pool, the expansive private beach area, AND being able to get out into town (Lahaina) to enjoy the local scene. Traveling with small kids here is easy, and we'll happily return next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye5290
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our honeymoon traveling the five major islands of Hawaii. Maui was our favorite island followed by Molokai. We returned this year to celebrate our retirement and chose to spend two weeks on Maui. We've stayed at the Royal Hawaiian on Oahu and the Sheraton on Ka'anapali Beach. If you want an ultra luxury hotel and plan to spend many hours on the hotel grounds, KBH may not be the best choice. On the other hand, if you want to enjoy the beaches of Maui and stay on the island as long as possible, KBH is an excellent choice. We had a beautiful view of the ocean from our ocean view room on the 5th floor. We enjoyed the friendly atmosphere and excellent service. KBH is conveniently located near Whaler's Village (shopping and restaurants) and getting to town involves a five minute bus ride ($2 for an all day bus pass). Unlike the Sheraton, KBH does not charge $26 per day in resort fees. The breakfast buffet at the Sheraton costs $35 compared to $14 at KBH. Whale watch and snorkeling trips pick you up on the beach right in front of KBH. We plan to return to Maui many times during our retirement and just hope the KBH is always open for business. We look forward to adding many white beads to our KBH lei. Ka'anaplai Beach does not need another ultra luxury hotel. KBH is a moderately priced hotel with nice amenities. We highly recommend it to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “All About the Location”
Reviews.Author: jasmine3407
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for the first time in April 2010 with a pool view room, booked through Expedia. I have already booked my next stay here for this May 2011, also through Expedia. This hotel offers a "Lei Aloha" program, where repeat guests get some perks. But this only applies when you call for reservations (no third-party bookings, such as Expedia, and doesn't apply even to online reservations on their own website). Although the perks were enticing, the room rates were much more expensive when calling the hotel directly, than even from their website, so I declined to take advantage of this program for my next stay. I was impressed with the grounds, the gardens, the old Hawaiian artifacts, the lack of a resort fee, and the free activities (due to time constraints, I only participated in making a carnation lei, and in one ukulele lesson). I had been hearing from other travelers that the staff here was superb. There were about 4 staff members who I felt were consistently pleasant and went out of their way for me, but the majority of the staff members were just ordinary hotel works, and some were even rude (such as some of the valet drivers). I stayed in the newly renovated Kauai Wing, with great views of the pool, the ocean, and the West Maui Mountains from the 4th floor, and only a 30 second walk to the ocean. The first floor of the building was still being renovated during my stay, but construction noise was minimal. The room was nicely decorated and adequate for my needs, and housekeeping promptly took care of any issues I had (such as my coffeemaker not working or extra towels). The walls are paper thin, the elevators are older-looking, the pool is basic (although nice for kids, since it is whale-shaped), but I enjoyed my stay here, nonetheless. There are small touches everywhere that are charming, such as the ceiling fans shaped like whale tails, and even the cheesy Polynesian window stickers all over the place. The grounds were immaculate, with a variety of Plumeria trees and Hibiscus bushes. There were loungers and picnic tables in the gardens, so you can take advantage of the beautiful gardens, if you were tired of the beach. The restaurants here were expensive, as are most of the restaurants along the Beach Walk. I had a breakfast buffet at the Tiki Terrace once, and wasn't impressed at $22. I do hear the Terrace has good dinners, so I might dine there for dinner during my next stay. I did stop for drinks at the Tiki Bar Happy Hour many times, and loved the staff there. I also ate at the Tiki Grill once, and found it to be convenient for taking back to eat on my lanai, or taking onto the beach! There is another restaurant here, but I didn't eat there. Luckily, there is a mini-fridge in the room (in the closet), so I stocked it up with as many snacks, drinks, and deli items as it could hold, from Safeway. I visited the onsite convenience store for coffee every morning ($1 for a small cup), and browsed around the main gift shop once. There is also a jewelry store and salon on the grounds, but I didn't visit them. The Welcome Breakfast is a pretty nice overview of Maui, if you've never been to Maui. The Checking out Ceremony is beautiful and makes you want to book another stay right then and there. There is an Activities Desk there, to help you plan your stay, and I never felt pressured from them. The location and ambiance is what makes this place a winner, to me. Having only been to Oahu before this, this location was a great mixture of quiet and busy, that is hard to explain. Centrally located on Ka'anapali Beach, literally only steps away from Black Rock and Whaler's Village (I know, this sounds like it came from Maui Revealed, but it is true!). Parking is super cheap, compared to neighboring hotels along this beach ($9/day for garage, $11/day for valet...compared to $20 and over at other hotels). I chose valet, because I hate looking for parking, and I don't want to lug beach stuff through the garage to the main building. You can also check your account balance from the TV menu, as well as check-out from the TV. I was surprised that this hotel offered this. This place is also great for kids, if you have them. Big gardens to run around in, a free kids' program, a shallow pool. There is a Trilogy shack right on the beach of the hotel, where you can rent snorkel gear and sign up for snorkel tours (one leaves right from Ka'anapali beach, so you don't have to even drive to the harbor). And there is a lady who sells beautiful photography right next to the Trilogy shack! I would definitely stay here again if I were staying in West Maui. Great value that is also filled with great charm! Come here for the charm, not the frills (no room service, older looking buildings and rooms, despite the renovations). Don't come here if you usually stay at the Four Seasons! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: jts813
Reviews.Content: They claim to be the most "Hawaiian" hotel. I paid around 170-190 a night. No other larger hotel in Maui could even come close to that price. Even when it was sold out through online companies if you go to their homepage directly you can still book a room and it was actually even cheaper from their home page. I didn't have any major complaints. It's a not a lavish, high end, resort style hotel. It's more of a homey feeling. Average rooms, average pool-all a little out dated (no flat screen tv, etc). But the staff was great. I did have an issue with luke warm shower water during the day time. They offer multiple classes a day on different cultural aspects (lei making, dancing, etc). The bar was fair, but their prices for drinks were great. Their restaurant was also a pleasant surprise. The best thing about the hotel though is their prime beach location. If I had money to spare yeah I would probably stay at the Hyatt or Sheraton or in Wailea at the Four Seasons next time. But if I had the chance to choose all over again, I would still choose the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel-primarily because of the price value.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful and friendly place.”
Reviews.Author: reen60051
Reviews.Content: My husband & I checked in on Friday, Feb. 11 to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted with "Happy Anniversary" and in our room was a note from the manager and a bottle of champage. What a nice touch. We loved the grounds and every person we spoke to was so friendly. We were so sad to check out on the 15th even though we were heading to the Big Island. We hope to be able to come back again in the future and just stay here for 2 weeks. We walked the whole beach and we thought this section of beach was the nicest - widest and close to Black Rock. Also loved the walkway to Whaler's Village - very convenient for a quick meal or ice cream.

Reviews.Title: “This is paradise”
Reviews.Author: schoenhl
Reviews.Content: The entire staff treats you like family. This is the third time we have stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and each year we look forward to going back. It is so relaxing. The hotel activities are great and you also learn some history about the island.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: NDSimplyLiving
Reviews.Content: I will definitely go to this hotel again. It was absolutely wonderful, just what we pictured Hawaii to be like. We were impressed by the staff, they were funny and very helpful! The restaurant on site was wonderful. There is also a little grill where you can get burgers and fries, and a full bar by the whale shaped pool. The rooms were nice-very spacious. The hotel grounds are beautiful. The best part-it's right ON the beach. A 30 second walk and you are in the sand and sun listening to the ocean waves. You can walk down the street about 5 minutes and shop at Whalers which was a nice little shopping center. We are already missing the warm weather of Hawaii-and want to plan our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: alvie037
Reviews.Content: Everything went great for us. Traveled with my 87yr old Dad. They were so accommidating to him. The hotel is clean and the food is excellent. Close to everything.for shopping and the hotel sits right on the beach . This hotel is family oriented and very laid back. You will go home relaxed. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with nice amenities and great location”
Reviews.Author: agroeber
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself it fairly average - clean and neat - but the decor is a little dated. The hotel makes up for this with nice amenties - nightly music & hula shows. Our rate through Costco came with a daily breakfast buffet that was very good. The location is great both for being on Kaanapali beach, and the distance from Lahaina to the northern and southern locations on western Maui. $9 / day for self-parking was fair, although $1.50 / day for the safe in the room seemed unnecessary. We'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine, nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: janeavril
Reviews.Content: This way our second time on Maui, the first time was 5 years ago when we got married on the beach and stayed next door at the Sheraton. This time we really had to cut costs, but we still wanted to be in the same location on Ka'anapali Beach, so KBH was perfect. We got a deal through Costco that included a rental car and the buffet breakfast each morning for about $200 per night, for 7 nights. Compared to the best deal we could find at the Sheraton or Westin (outside of Priceline-type bidding, which I'm not comfortable with) we saved over $800 total on our hotel, which was very much worth it to us. If the savings had been closer to $300-400, we would have probably gone with one of the bigger resorts. We were in the Kauai wing, in the closest room to the beach that didn't actually face the beach. We looked out at the Whaler next door, but had a good view of the ocean to the side. The room was small and the bathroom was tiny- 2 people really couldn't be in there at the same time. I've had bigger hotel rooms in Europe, but generally it worked. The ceiling fan circulated air well, and we mostly slept with the lanai door open, until about 6:30 when the birds would get active outside. The room looked like it had been renovated, but still, the hotel is old and a bit dated so it isn't necessarily sparkling. It was cleaned nicely every day, and we never had a problem with dirt, insects, etc. We were a little annoying to be nickeled and dimed for some things- $1.50 per day for the safe? Really? The grounds are nice and expansive, and you are right next to the beach and just a short walk to Whaler's Village, so the location is fantastic. We occasionally stopped for a drink at the Tiki Bar, which was nice and the bartenders were friendly, and the drinks were a little cheaper than at other places. The Tiki Grill, however, didn't impress us. We were hoping for a healthy snack option, and tried to order a Thai chicken wrap but we were told they were out of the ingredients for that. Ended up with a dry chicken sandwich and some fried wontons. We don't eat a lot of fried food, so it was disappointing, but there are many options just a short walk away for a better snack so it didn't slow us down. The breakfast buffet was OK- food was good, but there wasn't enough variety to eat there every morning. Breakfast is important to me, especially on vacation- I love to sit, sip my coffee, and discuss the plans for the day. It certainly was a lovely location for that, but I got sick of pancakes and scrambled eggs every morning. The quiche was tasty, but not 7 mornings in a row. They really didn't change things out from day to day- the things they did change weren't really breakfast foods- stir-fried pork, potato wedges, fried rice, breaded fish, etc. My husband loved that stuff but I was dying for a waffle or even a piece of toast by the end of the week. To be fair, we were occasionally asked if we wanted to see a menu, so that could have been an option, I just never went that route, so I take some of the blame. They had many activities going on at the hotel- lei making class, ukelele class, hula show in the evening, but we really didn't take advantage of any of that. The people operating the activities seemed very patient and friendly. During the day they had several vendors set up in the lobby with their local arts and crafts, and I noticed that they did change from day to day so if you see something you want, buy it right way- we only saw the scented salts guy once. There are some displays set up around the hotel that describe how each staff member takes part in building or creating different cultural artifacts- one being a canoe. I think that is really cool that the staff immerses themselves in the culture like that. Does it necessarily make my stay at the hotel any more enriched? No. But still, I think it is very nice that they do that sort of thing. The pool was small, and we knew that before going, but it was a little disappointing. Many of the resorts in the area have large, sprawling pools with swim-up bars, waterfalls, etc. The KBH pool is a basic neighborhood pool in the shape of a whale. Yawn. Overall, we were happy with this hotel because of the location and the price. However, if we were going for a special occasion (like our wedding or honeymoon) We would have splurged for one of the other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, the staff and the location.”
Reviews.Author: CariBea
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui. The staff at this hotel bend over backwards to ensure you have a wonderful vacation. Chantel at the Tiki Bar made the absolute best margarita. After 7 hours on a plane, standing around for like what seemed forever waiting for our luggage at the airport, being frustrated with Alamo and the rental car we received, and being over dressed on a hot humid day, we were far from relaxed. Within 10 minutes of experiencing one of Chantel's margaritas, we were instantly transported into relaxation/vacation mode!! We paid a few dollars more for the beach front room at the Ka'anapali on the 6th floor and it was worth every penny. The only thing between us and the beach was a walking path. The number of people who were dedicated to their morning jogging ritual along the pathway at 6:30 a.m., was something to rather marvel at. We didn't join them - it was a vacation! Our morning ritual included coffee on the lanai, watching the whales. It was spectacular. We met people from all over the world at this hotel. The Ka'anapali host a very friendly, intersting and nice clientele. Hi Mary and Susan from London, England if you're reading this!! We loved the different local bands who entertained every night from 6 - 9 pm on the outdoor stage. There was also authentic hula performances nightly as well. We never even bothered going to a luai and from the comments we received from others who did, really didn't miss a thing. Every morning, until noon, there were local artisans offering their products in the lobby and in the courtyard. It was so interesting to talk with these people and see their creations. We learned a lot about the history of Maui itself, from these very talented people. The hotel also offered lei making lessons, ukulele lessons, garden tours - all for free. You could rent beach cabanas, boogie boards, surf boards, etc. right on site. The food was a little expensive. We never included breakfast in our package, which we had the opportunity to do. They have a wonderful breakfast buffet that included hot items, cold items and an array of fresh fruit until 11 am and it often was our main meal of the day. It would have been much more economical to spend the few extra dollars when we booked our package, than what we paid daily for this buffet. The lei ceremony on our last day, was a perfect end to our vacation in paradise. We can hardly wait to go back. Before we travelled, we anticipated that we would get a condo for our second trip to Maui. Not the case anymore. This is the only place we can imagine coming back to. Is there anything we would change? We'd come in mid-February instead of mid-January and I'd take the ukulele lessons!! ;D

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inattentive service”
Reviews.Author: WaterArt
Reviews.Content: As a regular solo traveller, I often feel invisible and that was the case at this hotel. It's location is great. It's rooms are old style but perfectly adequate. It celebrates its connection to Hawaiian culture and offers night time music and day time activities - all of which is great. But it was the small things that made me feel unconnected. Arriving after midnight, there was no information about breakfast; no help to get to the room; no capacity to change the hawaiian greeting breakfast to another day as I had early starts for the first 2 days. It was fine but felt lonely.

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Caprice_in_Alberta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location. Why would you spend twice as much at another hotel to stay at the same beach? It was clean, well maintained with a mature garden, large shade trees and palms. The pool is small but we had the deep blue sea to swim in, so we didn't care (we still did manage to enjoy the pool when it got too hot!). The restaurant was very good and the prices were the best in the area plus we got 20% off one meal. You could get a decent bottle of wine for $15 and a glass for only $4 (unheard of!) The breakfast buffet was included in our room and was very good. We used our little fridge and bought a few groceries to keep in it so we only had to purchase one meal per day. We went to Safeway in Lahaina (be prepared for expensive tho!). We chose to rent a cabana on the beach 2 of the days we were there and it was so nice (cost $21 for 4 hours). The guys at the beach hut were very nice and helpful as well. We rented paddle boards one day as well and that was so very peaceful (once you got the hang of it, cost $25 for 1st hour). The snorkeling at black rock was just as good as the snorkeling tour we took. There were lots of sea turltes there as well as all the colorful fish. You could walk the beach path and end up at Whalers Village, which was basically an outdoor mall with some very good restaurants (Leilani's was excellent). I do have one complaint. The mattress was not comfy at all. I am used to sleeping on a beautiful plush pillow top mattress, so we didn't really get that great of sleeps. On a positive note it did make us get up early and enjoy the day! The internet would have cost us $10ish per day so we just passed on it, who needs to go on the internet when on vacation anyway? Some other costs are the parking at $9 per day and the safe at $1.50 per day, but just incorporate those into your budget and then relax and enjoy paradise. One thing I really enjoyed was the Road to Hana. It is not for the faint of heart but those guys out there who love driving (like my husband) will just love it. Not only is it fun but the views are breathtaking and diverse, rainforest, ocean, mountains, waterfalls, gardens, cliffs, black sand beach, blow holes, lava tube, the list goes on!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel I have been to in the last 40 years”
Reviews.Author: Iforgetmyname4
Reviews.Content: This is the friendliest hotel I have been to since the mid-60's. The rooms are not exciting but no problems either. The location is great - on Ka'anapali Beach you want to be between the Whaler's Village (shopping and restaurants) and the Black Rock (Sheraton - for snorkeling). The hotel is not as crowded as the other here. Buildings are less than half the height of any of the other hotels and there is a large central lawn/garden/pool area. However, the buildings appear to be older, but very well kept up. Staff is great. I recommend the free nightly music at the Tiki Bar - many folks don't seem to buy anything but just enjoy the music. Wonderful friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as nice as their website portrays”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of nights last week during my stay in Maui, and I couldn't help but be disappointed. The hotel in itself I suppose isn't that bad, but when compared to its website - which is what set our expectactions so highly - it was a large disappointment. We found the room to be generally decent, though the bathroom was tiny and aged. The building we stayed in was aged in general, which was surprising. I found the staff to be friendly at an acceptable level, but not exactly willing to go the extra distance to help you out. My friend and I found this to be the case on two or three occasions. One example was when we tried to book the hotel. I phoned and was given one rate, but on the website I was given a lower rate. I wanted to pay using my American Express card, but those are only taken by phone and not on the web. When I phoned to explain this, they would not do the booking for me over the phone and give me the web rate, which was rather frustrating. The website lists several awards and recognitions but I've got to say, I can't really see why. There are many hotels in the area which outshine this one (as I realized once I got there). I can only assume it might be because it's family friendly, but as I was travelling without children, this in no way was helpful to me.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly felt like home”
Reviews.Author: CamperfromND
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with our stay we spent a week there.Have free entertainment nightly outdoor by the Tiki Bar.Hula dancing,singers& dance floor. Tiki bar has daily specials & happy hour. Tiki grill has good selection of quick food from pizzas to burgers at reasonable price for the area.We enjoyed the show Kupana at the hotel it included dinner & drinks, Magician & Hawaiin theme, we thought it was a very good value. Hotel staff was very friendly with a greeting & willing to help & visit. Nice location on the beach & used free trolley for local travel. Whalers shopping center just a few doors down the beach has variety of restaurants & shops with ABC discount store. We didn't use internet as there was a charge for use which we are not used to paying additional fee for also daily fee for parking if you have a rental otherwise we were satisfied with the value.We did purchase buffet breakfast in advance as it was cheaper that way good breakfast. we did do the Sunday Champagne Brunch which was spendy but excellent food with many choices from pork,prime rib,clams,shrimp,crab legs etc. Pool was nice not overly large & water temp was a little cool in Jan assume no heat. We would stay again if we go back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: msshepard
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel last July with 2 of my girlfriends while we were visiting the island. It exceeded our expectations! The staff was very friendly and you cannot beat the location. We picked a room that was a "pool view" room, but had an amazing view of the beach from our lanai and you can walk right onto the beach from the hotel! The staff was so welcoming and helpful with any questions or suggestions that we needed. By the end of our stay (3 days), we felt like we had been there for weeks because of how attentive the staff was to each of us. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to go someplace where you can feel at home in paradise. The food was also great and the drinks were delicious as well. It is just a quick drive into Lahaina if you need to pick anything up or want to try out some of the restaurants. We are planning on visiting the island again in the next year or so and will definitely be staying at KBH again!

Reviews.Title: “When can I come back?”
Reviews.Author: Lovesthebeach04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I selected KBH because it was Maui's "most Hawaiian hotel" and for the value. We were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like family. Beautiful grounds, centrally located, with some of the best beach front in the area, KBH provides a real value for travellers. We were impressed with Chef Chris' expertise in the kitchen at the Tiki Restaurant - excellent food, great service and never a wait for a table with great free evening entertainment. We met several travellers who have come back to KBH for many many years in a row and by the end of our stay, we understood why. Personal attention, great location, great value, great food - when can we come back??

Reviews.Title: “SOOO sad to leave this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: amychristine1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our honeymoon here. It was fantastic. A few things we enjoyed: The magic show (strong drinks:), Parasailing (just walked down to the whaler mall), the food at the main resturant (amazing steak for cheap), the nightly entertainment, hand making postcards outside with plants and paint, the weather!! The drinks.....lavaflow was yummy.The grounds were perfect, right on the beach. The room was perfect. Loved the ceiling fan and the sliding glass door. Soooo clean too. I can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarrieWilsonRN
Reviews.Content: We went to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for an anniversary celebration. The staff was friendly and charming. Our room was freshly updated and sparkling clean. We were very happy with the close proximity to Lahina, and the walking path to Whaler's village and the beach was fantastic. Our package included a buffet breakfast that really saved on the food costs. There is a fridge included in the room that makes it perfect for drinks and snacks. The warm water beach was beautiful and snorkeling was very close. The nightly Hawaiian music and Hula dancers really added that special touch. The only complaint I have is there is a parking fee of $ 9.00 per day, that alone added an extra $ 99.00 to our final bill. I know this is a "little thing" and we heard that every Hotel adds this extra. It was a surprise to us, and is the reason I gave it 4 stars rather than the 5 I think it deserves. So just be aware when you book. Even with this, I would totally return... and can't wait to!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the KBH”
Reviews.Author: balmac
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay at the KBH .. and we're already looking forward to a third! The KBH is the perfect location on the beach .. so easy to walk to the Whalers Village and also to snorkel off Black Rock. The reservations staff were very helpful prior to our visit .. we ended up with a great room overlooking the pool and ocean .. and we also booked a car through their Jump into January package. The KBH may not be the biggest, smartest or newest hotel you will ever stay at but as far as Lahaina is concerned, I won't go looking anywhere else. It is the perfect family holiday spot for us. Oh, and the Magic Show is still my favourite!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for my toddler”
Reviews.Author: snowboard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on the positive reviews for this hotel with families. This was the perfect place for my son. He was given a bunch of toys for the beach, hotel and absolutely loved the hula lessons. The staff was so attentive and helpful. They treated you like family. We took full advantage of the classes that they offered and loved them. The staff was excellent and the service phenomenal. Our only complaint was the food at the restaurant, but with being in such a good location you are within a short walk distance to many great restaurants. Our room did flood a little with rain, but the staff promptly cleaned it up for us. The location of the hotel was excellent as well. If you are looking for a more pricey place to stay with pampering, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a place with excellent service and great location, this is the place for you. We just left and are already planning our next trip back.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: SmalltownColorado
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas week there with our adult children and their families. I can't think of a more perfect experience. The most beautiful beach is right out the door with all the amenities you could want. Yes, it is an older facility, as many have commented, but it still has a charm that compensates. Minor problems were ants in one of the kids room, no hot tub and waiting in line to reserve a cabana for the day. These things seemed really minor to me compared to the value, location and general experience of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay when visiting Maui”
Reviews.Author: miller131110
Reviews.Content: I could not believe how friendly and helpful the staff are at this hotel. The room was spacious and clean and the classes they offer are fantastic. We had a partial ocean view room and it was gorgeous. The only down side was the pillows were a little uncomfortable. Everything else was great. I hope to return to Maui someday and I would stay here again for sure. I am also addicted to Maui coffee, we never get coffee that good in london!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a premium location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrails007
Reviews.Content: If pampering or fine decor is what you're looking for, this isn't the place for you. If however you don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room and you don't mind a dated hotel and ammenities (i.e. the pool), this is a great value. I tend generally to be one who prefers to be pampered, staying at higher end hotels with great services but my Maui stay was different. The hotel was the hub but I spent so much time on the beach, shopping in Lahaina, and travelling the island that this hotel was just right. Spending the prices required for fine lodging at a similar premium location wouldn't be worth it. If you, like me, won't be reading a book at the poolside or expecting decent dining and a well apportioned room (e.g. internet is via a long cable only and $10 for 24 hours), stay here!

Reviews.Title: “will not stay again Poor service”
Reviews.Author: chum94555
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of family vacation package we bought from Costco we found hotel has excellent location and landscape but this is where good stops Service overall is very poor Specially in their free breakfast area and bell and vaelt parking area . Staff is untrained and even rude Carpet old and stinks. Not well maintained and water leaks when it rains We will not go back to same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most Hawaiian hotel ever stayed in Maui”
Reviews.Author: atbeach21
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great beach location. If you are not going to spend the time in the hotel much, then this is great for the price. The rooms are comparable to the other hotels. Has many activities like lei making. ukelele and hula classes for the young and young at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hawaiian experience”
Reviews.Author: LauraDiItaly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely resort in August 2010 ; we had room #671 in the Kauai building , nice garden/mountains view, very quiet ! Our room / wing looked like they had been recently redone : sparkling clean , comfortable queen beds , small balcony from which we could have a glimpse of the beach/ocean ! Should you be a HYATT type guy , this hotel isnâ€™t for you ! BUT if you wish a truly Hawaiian experience , with lots of ALOHA and friendly staff YOUâ€™LL ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS HOTEL !!! We specially loved our evening meals at their main restaurant , with FREE but AWESOME & WELL PERFORMED hula show ; you can watch that show EVERY night â€¦ and itâ€™s always different ! We adored the REAL Hawaiian staff , who put up many classes about Hawaiian culture : I did two different LEI-making classes and the hula dance class twice ; cannot remember the name of our â€œkumu hulaâ€� (teacher) , but she was absolutely lovely , one of my warmest memories about this vacation. Youâ€™ll find nice Hawaiian touches all over the hotel and grounds â€¦ and big smiles everywhere , from the WELCOME buffet breakfast ( with the staff serenading you ) to the touching â€œUntil we meet againâ€� kukui lei ceremony on the day of your departure : We LOVED the champaghe they delivered to our room as it was our anniversary ; the Whalers Village is a short walk away and there you can find everything , fron REAL scrimshaw to quick bites , shave ice and hearty cheap breakfast !! Try Kimoâ€™s restaurant at night !! The famous Black Rock is steps away ; be sure to watch that awesome Cliff Diving ceremony ( at sunset)â€¦ you just need to walk a couple minutes on the beach â€¦ Be sure also to save one evening to watch the awesome Magic Show which is helf at Kaanapali Beach Hotel (Kupanaa) : it is really amazing. We are already dreaming of a return trip : wouldnâ€™t consider to stay anywhere else !!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly paradise”
Reviews.Author: GRAMPSO_FallonIl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is authentic and they keep it that way. We stayed for 10 days and were treated as family. Every staff member smiled and went way beyond the expected. The valet parking guys were always joking and smiling. The desk clerks waved when you passed by. The special events people were not selling activities, but matching them to the group of adults and two children. The costs were less through the hotel than at the attraction or activity. The room was cleaned very well and special requests were honored every time. The food options were really good and reflected local costs. The hotel grounds are like a garden with every type of tree and flower on the island. The area was manicured daily with every leaf picked up and every chair in place. They made us feel like rich people (we aren't). The view is great and the sound of the surf was soothing and constant. The pool is clean and the Tiki Bar keeps you supplied with great food and drinks. I highly reccomend this hotel for family trips. If we go to Maui again we will stay there, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hawaiian hotel, great location, not a lot for your money though”
Reviews.Author: Emstabiff
Reviews.Content: A lovely Hawaiian hotel, great location, easy to find and situated on a lovely sandy beach overlooking Black Rock. We saw Humpback whales and dolphins from the beach! The room was clean, air conditioning ice cool and beds very comfy, although the bathroom was quite small but all was decorated fairly modernly and in good taste. The beach and grounds were all immaculate, the pool was clean, although quite small, and no seperate kids pool which is sometimes nice if you are travelling with no kids yourselves. The staff were friendly and helpful, they evening left a bottle of champagne in our fridge as it was our honeymoon, they also give you a leaving ceremony where you are given a Lai necklace. We booked bed and breakfast, breakfast wasn't bad, buffet style, some odd choices but usually quite tasty. We tried the restaurant and it was one of our best meals, very good quality food, we also tried the tiki grill for lunch which was also really good. Generally a nice relaxed hotel and we enjoyed it very much. The down sides were: Quite expensive for what you get. You have to pay $9 per day parking, which is a bit of a cheek! The Bar closes at 10pm! Pool is quite small Not that much to do, they did some classes but I never saw any going on Not many sun loungers on beach, you also have to pay for those. Despite the chilled reputation Hawaii has, we found it quite strict there, not as chilled and relaxed as we thought it would be for example: Smoking only in designated areas (which are few and far between) No alcohol on the beach Our bar closed at 10pm Fireworks banned Plastic carrier bags banned Maui does offer so much to do, we ziplined, drove up a volcano, went whale watching and saw some amazing sights, lots of restaurants and altogether highly recommended, We would definately go back but not necessarily to Kaanapali Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kcolterman
Reviews.Content: Great resort hotel. Very expensif over the Christmas Holiday. My only suggestions would be to have more activities for the older children travelling with their parents. Itravelled with my 18 and 20 year old. The food was great. Perhaps the breakfast buffet could have had a little more variety or chang it up and a little less pricy. Overall I would rate it a 4. Thank You Kelly from Ottawa Canada

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: eztravel604
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights from Christmas Eve, booked through their website with car Budget car rental included which we upgraded. Everything went very smoothly with car rental and check-in. We were very pleased with our 4th floor ocean front room in Kauai block that had a spectacular view of the ocean, as the other ocean front block looked much older and run down. Our spacious room had 2 double beds and we added a roll away with no extra charge. Enjoyed very much sitting in the balcony so close to the ocean and the sound of pounding waves, beach is right in front. Whalers Village, a few minutes walk away has a Macdonalds and ABC Store, we ate dinners at Leilanis and Hula Grill there, had to pre-book as the wait was 1.5 hours perhaps due to Xmas crowd. Only downside was the Christmas dinner buffet at Kaanapali itself, food was mushy and not worth the price, we were told to come at 7 pm but they closed the food service at 7:45, we did not eat at the hotel after that. Cleaning staff were efficient, car parking was easy and room had internet (paid). All in all a very pleasant stay, especially the great ocean front location of our room.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: tallmoon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 12 days at Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Is it the Ritz? Not by a long shot. Does it have the the high end pools and landscaping such as the Shariton, Weston, Marriot, or Hyatt. No it does not. But it does have half the price per night. Which bought us Helicopter Tours, Dive Trip's, Plantaition Tour, Aquarium Tour, Magic Show, Rental Car, Road to Hana, Crater Tour, Etc. Our room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The bathroom was a bit smaller than I am use to, but all in all it worked out. The bed was fine. At home I sleep on a $3,000 bed and I was perfectly happy with the bed in our room. The grounds of the property were very clean and well cared for. I do not think I was ever on property without seeing a caretaker cleaning and or maintaining the landscaping. If I had to find something to be negative about was the elevators. They seemed a bit worn out. Looks wise not the operation of the elevator. This hotel must be 30 plus years old. When we first arived I must admit this is no Maui Westin. And I was second guessing my hotel pick. But after a 15 hour travel day I could have picked the Westin apart. After a day or two we settled in and all was just fine. I came to like the fact that I could move around a lounge chairs on the lawn any where I wanted to sun, shade, or pool. Try that at the major brand hotels. That lounge chair is not being moved. It was like my own back yard. The staff alway's made us feel welcome. The pool well, yes it is a pool. Nothing fancy, just a little better than basic. I must admit all the other major brand hotels have awsome looking pools. Again we paid half the price. And did activities we did not do on a prior trip because we paid $450.00 per night. The location is great with snorkeling at Black Rock a couple of time a day. It is just a short walk and like wise for the Whaler's Village. Our room was on the 5th floor so we could see Black Rock and the diver every evening at sunset. The hotel is quiet at 10:00 and they enforce it. If you want to spend $400.00 plus a night just go next door to the Shariton. I have paid that price in the past and did a whole lot less in activites. So ask your self. How much are you in the room any way? Would I stay at Kaanapali Beach Hotel again? In a heart beat I would. It is the same beach. Oh, by the way we purchased the breakfast package and we were pleased with the food. The wait staff is a bit confused it seamed. I think some of them need a bit more training. However the food was fine. And you could have as much of what ever you would like for breakfast. There are pleanty of breakfast foods to choose from. You will not go hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Kanapali”
Reviews.Author: cheesemakers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel andwere very happy with it. This was a first for us , as we usually stay with allinclusives in the carribian. This hotel is older but it was very nice, rooms were a little outdated but they were not bad, we were in room 253, i thought the room set up was very nice, the bed wasnt like home but was not bad. Beautiful views everywhere. you did have to pay extra for everything.We rented a car on the island, we were not at the hotel much. The pool was small but was nice, the grounds were well kept. The food we thought was average price for the states , drinks also. We ate at the grill a few times very good. This hotel offered free breakfeast every morning which was very nice & the cocunut syrup was amazing. The beach was just unreal beautiful, Everyone at the hotel aws very nice and i mean everyone we loved our stay. we ventured out alot , the downtown area was so cute , every island was different in there own way. We snorkled one day ~ which i didnt think was that great compared to other places we have been ,saw no turtles although there were some in our group thet said they did, We drove on some roads we probly shouldnt have ~ The road to hannah was nothing compared to the one road we were on. We did the old lahaina lua and that was great.We did some hiking alot of driving . This island really was beautiful we would come back and we would choose this hotel again. The day we left they offered a little gift that was very nice we truly did enjoy our experience at this hotel and the island!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...great for families on a budget..”
Reviews.Author: tobaja
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online at the 11th hour,as we were not sure if we would be making our flight to Maui. Upon arrival the booking could not be found...and our room wasn't ready. We had to fill in a few hours before coming back to check in. I must add that the hotel was really busy as there was a Hula competition on. Eventually after we checked into our room,we were pleasantly surprised. We had a garden view room,which you could see the ocean from. The room was very spacious,though the shower/toilet was tiny. The pillows were not fantastic and the hotel had no others to offer. I think the hotel is more suited to families on a budget. We were told the hotel is privately owned which to me added to the quaintness of the hotel...no big chain name..the hotel has truly been kept in sleepy Hawaiian style..which isn't a bad thing(maybe except for the pillows)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: windsurfergirl
Reviews.Content: Beach is nice. Family oriented. Very friendly staff. Facility is dated. No workout facility. Pillows are the worst, bed is ok. I have seen staff replacing mattresses everyday...so that will hopefully be less of an issue. Less expensive than other properties around. We did not have lofty expectations so it is about what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Justfuntraveler
Reviews.Content: It's a good option if you're on a tight budget, but you do get what you pay for. You feel like a poor cousin next to far more expensive hotels, but you have access to the same beaches, shops, and restaurants at 1/3 to 1/2 their price. We were first given a room that was very old and smelled strongly of turpentine (they were working on the room next door.) After we complained, they gave us another room that was better, but not by much. We paid for partial ocean view, but neither rooms had it. The pool is small and not worth dipping in when you have the vast ocean in front of you. Food is very average but costs just as much as other hotels and is far more pricey than restaurants close by, so go somewhere else for your meals. You'll see lots of seniors on fixed incomes here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, lovely location, Hawaiian activities”
Reviews.Author: Tiagogo
Reviews.Content: I spent my last nights here. This is a great hotel that is not as expensive as nearby resorts. It is convenient to Lahaina and Honolua Bay. I was very pleased with my room, which was garden view but I could still see the ocean in the distance. The room was large with a settee and king bed and a nice, large balcony. Although I didn't spend much time in the room, it was nice to return from a day of traveling to a comfy bed with lots of pillows. The room has a fridge, safe, coffee maker, and ceiling fan! The hotel differentiates itself from other resorts in the area by offering complementary Hawaiian activities such as lei making and hula dancing. I got to take advantage of the new Hawaiian language class where I learned how to correctly pronounce Hawaiian letters and words (wish I could've taken that class my first day in Maui!). The hotel is also right on the boardwalk leading to Whale Village which has nice shops and restaurants. Only downside -- parking is $9/day and Internet is an extra $10/day. However, the hotel does not charge a resort fee, which is a pretty penny at the surrounding resorts. If you plan on sightseeing the island more than relaxing on the beach, I'd recommended staying at this hotel rather than the Hyatt or Westin or another resort. Save on that resort fee and use it to put more gas in your rental!

Reviews.Title: “Older room, but nice overall”
Reviews.Author: MaxConcrete
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Molokai wing on the second floor. The toilet/shower area had a sliding door which (as best as I could tell) could not be locked. The door did not slide very well. There was a loose floor tile in the toilet/shower area. The bathroom sink area was large with a large countertop. I could not find an elevator in our building. The stairs were gently sloped, presumably to make it easier to carry up luggage. The air conditioning was central air (not a window unit) as was very quiet. The room was clean. Our room had a balcony with a garden view. The pool was closed for maintenance/repairs during our visit. The pool is much smaller than the pools at adjacent resorts on this strip. The outdoor dining and tiki bar area were nice, providing a very Hawaiian atmosphere. The breakfast buffet was good - plenty of selection and nearly everything I ate was good. Parking was $9 per day. The garage was convenient but most spaces were narrow. The paved trail along the beach connecting the resorts on the strip was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: BigdawgChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 days in a ground floor room overlooking the garden. I was watching my money on this trip and wanted the cheapest room available which was $149 a night. Although on the ground floor, there was no outside noise disturbing me at night. There was a problem one night when the people in the room next to me must have had a party and were loud and noisy until 2 AM when the hotel remedied the situatuion. This disturbance wasn't the hotel's fault and they did tell me the next day that these "guests" were no longer welcome and would not be there the next night. I asked to be comped for the night of the disturbance but the mananger declined. It would have been a nice customer relations move to give me some type of credit. The room was recently redone as everything looked and smelled new and the hallway carpeting still smelled new. Room was clean. The bed was comfortable and free WI-FI was very good. As any traveler knows, some resort hotels charge $10 to $20 a night for WI-FI and the free service was appreciated. Yes, the bathroom is small but who cares-you don't live or sleep there and it was clean. There is a nice desk area for the computer and an extra chair. The only drawback was a tube TV with limited channels. Self park was plentiful and close to the room. A big plus is that Whaler's Village is a 5-10 minute walk and has at least two good restaurants-Leilani's and Hula Grill. The hotel is next to the ocean and a walkway that goes along the beach. I did not hang around the hotel or interact with staff so can't comment on the staff. The good-bye shell lei is a nice touch. I did catch some of the free hula show which was well done and similar to what you have to pay to see at a luau. The bottom line is that this hotel is very reasonably priced for a resort in Ka'aanapali on the ocean and well worth it. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it ~ not a national chain. Lots of local ambience.”
Reviews.Author: KSMeadowlark
Reviews.Content: I compared a lot of Maui hotels while deciding where to stay on Maui. Ka'anapali Beach Hotel had great reviews and I had been wanting to stay here. This hotel met my expectations completely. Very customer focused staff. The grounds are beautiful. Price is reasonable. We wanted whale watching and were able to view many from our lanai with binoculars. Located on the "leeward" side of Maui, the beach is beautiful, sunsets were spectacular, warm breeze ~ not windy, close to good shopping, close to Lahaina. Restaurant is reasonably priced compared to other Maui dining choices, plus the Tiki Grill provides less expensive dining options with local influence. A very nice free breakfast/orientation for new visitors and guests. Local entertainment with hula show on hotel grounds every night was a nice way to relax at pua hana time. Kakui nut lei ceremony for departing guests is very charming and a great inspiration for future plans to visit Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to start your Maui holiday”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Aussie21
Reviews.Content: It was pretty easy to find the hotel, the only confusion was when we arrived because we had a jeep, where to park it. I knew that they had valet and self parking but I didnâ€™t have a ticket to go out. Anyway we just parked at the front while we dropped our bags at the front where the concierge and I tried to check in. We arrived pretty early like 11 or something so our room wasnâ€™t available which was fine but I just wanted to let them know we were here. After that, we went around to a shopping centre, lunch, then back to KBH. We did the self parking and just got a ticket â€“ I donâ€™t know why I kept it but anyway. Went to the reception and got our cards and they advised us they moved us to the pool view room ground floor which was surprising. Ok so just went with flow and when we go to the room, we were glad we got upgraded. Because its just on the ground floor so easily can get there, donâ€™t need to get a lift. Our room was at the end so was close to the beach but in saying that it didnâ€™t matter where you were, its close to the beach anyway. We got a king size beach and it was nice. As you see from the photos, the room was pretty cool. Didnâ€™t have any faults about the room and was really satisfied. Breakfast was included and it was suffice. We made the error ofâ€¦ well every Sunday they have this brunch so with the coupons you get, you get $12 discount and you pay the difference. Basically the brunch goes from morning to lunch I suppose and they open the room inside which has a lot of cool food. Anyway I asked the lady if breakfast was included inside and she said yes but there mustâ€™ve been a breakdown of communication because we were caught by another person saying no thatâ€™s not included. Plus when he offered me champagne for breakfast I thought that was a bit funny and I declined. In the end we said we would upgrade since it was our only Sunday there because we were only there for 5 nights and was worth it. Lots of cool food, seafood & deserts yummy! Back to normal breakfast on a normal day. Didnâ€™t like how I had to tip but thatâ€™s coming from a stingy aussie but we tipped because its their way of life & customary too. The pool was small and wouldâ€™ve been good if they had a bigger pool but was suffice. From the room, the pool is formed in the shape of a whale but from a ground view you canâ€™t really see it. The Tiki Bar and the tiki restaurant/takeaway was good though packed when it got busy. We would have a couple of hotels and food from there and the price wasnâ€™t too expensive. On the last day when you check out, one of the managers does a presentation because you are leaving and it was a nice Hawaiian feeling. It was funny though at the end how when he finished, he just walked away and didnâ€™t say, thanks and goodbye. So I side-lined him to ask for a photo of one of the backdrops in the hotel foyer. They also give a lei but we had that confiscated at Sydney International Airport because its wood & might carry something inside â€“ oh wells. After that, checked out and was on our way to our next accommodation in Maui. Cost? It was fortunate that when we booked it, they had some special â€˜holo holoâ€™ promo which brought the price $100-$200USD down depending on what package you booked. We purchased the Holo Holo Garden Brkfst Garden w/2 dbl beds which was $924.35 USD for 5 nights. So when we got upgraded to the â€˜Pool/Courtyardâ€™ I was delighted as I knew it was a tad more expensive when you book this ($20USD extra per night?). Because the self parking was $12 each day and the additional cost from the brunch, we paid an extra $105 USD thus total price in the end was $1029 USD If you try and book a package now for Garden Brkfst Garden, they donâ€™t have a â€˜Holo holoâ€™ anymore unfortunately and when I look at the price now for 5 nights, the total amount $1156.85USD. So in the end you can see I save some money which was good J Overall: I would definitely come back again, itâ€™s a nice Hawaiian atmosphere when you stay here. They also have activities that you can undertake but we were so busy checking out the beaches and stuff, we didnâ€™t get any time to do any of it lol. Only downside is pool size and you when you see the other resorts have bigger pools, then you might be a bit jealous â€“ but hey, just go to the beach instead or just try to sneak into other resorts pool without them knowing lol

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Hype”
Reviews.Author: Texcoug
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Maui, but the first with our children. We had previously stayed at the Marriott Ocean Club and Hyatt on Ka'anapali. We considered those plush locations for our family trip, but on a tip, booked the KBH instead. It was the best decision we have made in a long time. I must say I was concerned when we drove up -- just didn't seem that nice. The walk to our rooms was a little discouraging compared to the initial vibe you get from Hyatt or Marriott. But then, we opened the doors (they accommodated our adjoining rooms request) and were delighted in the setup of the rooms (with the step down). We were on the ground floor (loved it) and walked right out to the beach. Incredible! Rather than choke their grounds with shops and pools and the like customary of resorts, were were welcomed to lush, open lawns and instant access to the beach. We have a pool so were not paying the money to go to Maui to play in a pool. Our kids loved the beach. The staff were INCREDIBLE. Here is a breakdown: 1. You have heard about the amazing staff -- BELIEVE IT. The activities for kids were awesome. They entertained my 12 YO daughter all the way down to my 4 YO son. The kids loved the staff and looked for opportunities to go to the free Hawaiian culture classes. 2. The culture classes were A++. Our kids learned the Hula and teared up in story telling time. I have 5 kids -- girls 12 and 10 and boys 8, 6, and 4. The classes were a major hit with all my kids and the Passports were too. My 4 YO still requires that we call him by his Hawaiian name. 3. I loved the openness of the grounds. Very peaceful. 4. Beach location is A+++. Perfect area for swimming. Safe for kids. There is great sand that goes out a long way. The beaches in front of the Hyatt and Marriott lack that nicety -- no walking out there. In fact, lots of beaches lack that in Hawaii. The beach here is perfect -- great sand and soft. 5. Black rock is right next door and Lanaii in the distance. Great spot for water activities. Trilogy can accommodate any request. I would recommend picking up snorkeling gear near the Maui Ocean Center on your drive in -- you can rent it for the week for the cost of 1 day at Ka'anapali. 6. Food Ok at resort but Whaler's Village right next door with some tasty options. (We love both Longboards and its sister restaurant). 7. Parking is amazing. Believe it or not -- you actually self park and will be right by your rooms. 8. Did I mention the staff was amazing? I will absolutely return. I think this is a perfect place for families. If it were just my wife and I (like our first two trips), I would still return but may consider other options. If I am bringing my kids, it is an absolute no brainer.

Reviews.Title: “A Grateful Traveler”
Reviews.Author: GratefulTraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Hawaii has been our go-to-destination since our first trip to Maui and Kauai in 1972 to escape the Seattle rain. So imagine our surprise and joy in the complete Aloha Experience offered at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel (KBH) in October this year. Our experience included the very best customer service, with staff who actually remember your name and treat you like family rather than guests; small, thoughtful gifts that make you smile; and great fun! Initially, we selected the KBH for its ideal location (Northwest Shore in Ka'anapali, on the 2-3 mile boardwalk along the fabulous Pacific Ocean shoreline, with its own golf course). The hotel is also within walking distance to fine shopping and excellent food in every price range. We will go back to KBH again (and again) because of our Aloha Experience this year. We also learned more about Hawaiian culture during this trip than during many previous visits to numerous museums, plantations, parks and historic venues because we received history lessons and learned family lore that were combined with hula and lei-making classes, welcome and departure ceremonies, and other demonstrations and activities provided generously for KBH guests. The staff is so welcoming and accessible, you will be comfortable asking any questions as a guest or tourist interested in off-property entertainment, and confident that you will receive the correct answer the first time. We loved it. The KBH is an older property that is meticulously maintained. It is also very affordable. Our only regret is that we did not bring the rest of our family to enjoy the tropical paradise and many fun activities at KBH that are perfect for travelers of all ages! Aloha and Mahalo Nui Loa, KBH! Susan and Bob

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding -- one of nicest hotels my Dutch husband has ever seen”
Reviews.Author: jumpsturdy
Reviews.Content: No vested interest in this hotel's qualities, as I WON THE TRIP!!! We were both very pleasantly surprised, especially after viewing sterile Ritz-Carlton, which could have been located anywhere. The Ka'anapali is truly Hawaiian in spirit, with its daily culture lessons, spirit of Aloha among all the staff (some who refused tips), and historic knowledge. We enjoyed lovely, lavish breakfast buffet every day, the grounds were the only place we saw plumeria trees, and we were able to swim and snorkel right off the beach. Instead of dining at crowded Whaler's Village with hour-long waits, we had quiet, non-touristy dinners at good value. Hated Mai Tais, stickin' with Blue Hawaiians. As world travellers, we truly did not expect to find such a delightful setting -- so it turned out to be a honeymoon sans ceremony! Slept perfectly in Ocean View room with only screens closed, to sounds of waves crashing. You can find adventure by driving north across the tip of the island, which is extremely beautiful and rugged. Only complaint -- they need to fix the bathtub drains, I sure dragged in a lot of sand. Would definitely stay here again. Staff superb in all ways.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: prts78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad but after all the reviews read I expected it to be more clean and nice. When we arrived we were accommodated to a room which didn't smell fresh, and wasn't renovated for very long. I asked to move us to another room and fortunately (not easily) we were moved. It was nicer but I had to purchase some cleaning staff and wash the bathroom. It wasn't clean! We had lots of small ants everywhere and in the beds as well but they didn't bother us too much. There were many activities in the hotel which we learned about occasionally two days before departure and for most of them you need to sign up which we also learned about too late. So my opinion itâ€™s not a bad hotel but Iâ€™m not going there again.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT DISAPPOINTMENT FOR A BIG PRICE”
Reviews.Author: mtnresortdeb
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with an extra night in Maui, by booking an oceanfront room for our first night there. After the long trip over, we couldn't wait to get to our room. I was so excited to surprise him. Oceanfront, King bed, paying $300 + for one night, you'd expect something nice. To my chagrin, we had 2 double beds. The room was dated. I called and there were no other rooms available with the view (which was great) with a king bed. We decided to keep the room and went to dinner. Upon return we went to shower, and the bathtub was dirty. After seeing that, I looked at the toilet and found hair and urine around it. I called the front desk, who sent a cleaning person to clean. (This is now 7:30 Hawaiian time) She came, cleaned the tub but not the toilet. I called again (I NEVER DO THIS) and asked for the manager to come look.Instead she sent housekeeping and the cleaning person (probably at least 60 years old)and another man whose position wasn't disclosed. I showed them and was told that the dirt was probably stains. I was never approached by anyone to resolve this. Instead we were told that there were 5 weddings there that evening and the next evening. Since I PAID IN ADVANCE some weeks prior, I don't believe they cared what they gave us. THIS IS THE MOST DISAPPOINTED I HAVE EVER BEEN, AND WAS A TERRIBLE BEGINNING TO OUR TWO WEEK STAY. I do want to add that the valet personnel were exceptional, friendly, and accommodating, the best part of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome people, warm caring and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: sitanshugupta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is actually the most Hawaiian Hotel in Hawaii. The tag line said this, and it is true. The location is awesome. Right on Kaanapali Beach. Awesome place to take the beach chairs and watch the sun set, creating a silhouette of the pine trees. The restaurants on this hotel and nearby are awesome. The rooms are awesome with everything made of cane. We booked this hotel for it was the cheapest deal we could find.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need/want.”
Reviews.Author: SDiCastro
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an eleven-night stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in west Maui. We're not impossibly picky, but at the same time know a gem from a dud. This is definitely a gem. Perfectly situated right on western Maui's most beautiful stretch of beach, the KBH is neither opulent nor extravagant. What it is is clean, comfortable, friendly, full-featured, and quite frankly your best bang for your buck. I'll be posting more in the future (just got back!), with lots of detail, but for now just know that you can't go wrong here...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelTwin777
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. The grounds were beautiful, the staff were proud of their hotel, the breakfast buffet was delicious, the nightly entertainment was fun, the classes were great, and the departure lei was a very nice touch. Location right on beach was fantastic. The rooms need a little updating, but were very clean, spacious and comfortable. If I ever go back to Maui I would not hesitate to stay at Kaanapali Beach Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “They make you want to come back”
Reviews.Author: melinda1955
Reviews.Content: I got a special offer with travelzoo and delta airlines. I upgraded to ocean front room. On arrival they upgraded us to a family suite and the view was the best you could ask for. We had a balcony on the second floor and the sound of the waves was wonderful. They left us a note and a bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary. The next morning we attended a full breakfast where they give you tips on what to see in Maui, Very informative and they don't sell you anything. We are used to staying in four star hotels and this one isn't as fancy but we loved it just the same. Everyone there is very friendly and helpful Would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ToiEtMoiPit
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five days stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (Oct. 30 to Nov. 4, 2010). We were there to celebrate my 50th birthday and were so very happy with our decision to stay at the KBH. The location is simply perfect! We were really impressed by the view of our top floor Ocean Front room. Breathtaking! We enjoyed the view particularly in the morning and before dinner. The sunsets were absolutely spectacular ! The hotel is a bit old but well maintained. Our room was well cleaned and we always had fresh towels and sheets. The grounds are beautiful, the beach is awesome and the food is good (we had lunch a couple of times and dinner once, after a trip to Hana). We only have good comments about the staff. Very friendly and hard workers, they do a wonderful job! Finally, the Aloha ceremony before we left was very touching and made it even more difficult for us to leave. If we ever go back to MauÃ¯, we would definitely stay at the KBH again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and beach with memorable departure”
Reviews.Author: LindasColorado
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for six times over the last 20 years and we have enjoyed every aspect of this place. The grounds are large with room to sit in a lounger next to the pool, on the grass in the sun, or in the shade without feeling crowded. The pool is large and in the shape of a whale. The best part is the fact that this hotel is located on the best part of Kaanapali Beach. The beach in front of the hotel has about 150-200 feet of crowd free sand to the ocean. In comparison, the Sheridan is to the northwest has a relatively crowded smaller beach. As you head to the southeast on the beach from this hotel, the beach becomes less sandy and rockier until you reach the Hyatt where there is no sand and just rocks. The hotel has a friendly staff, free Hawaiian activities during the day and a free Hawaiian show each night. The rooms are spacious and clean. All rooms have a lanai with a table large enough to have a drink or food. We did not have the breakfast as part of the hotel package this time, but have had it in the past. If you like a hearty (or in our case heart stopping) buffet breakfast, you will enjoy theirs. It has a large variety of tasty breakfast items. What we think is one of the best parts of the stay is what we call the closing ceremony. The day of your departure, each guest is presented with a large kukui nut lei. Each time return a white kukui nut is added to the lei. This is a tradition that was started after 9-11. The staff sings a traditional Hawaiian song and they tell you how much they appreciated your stay and wish you a safe trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hawaiian Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: ahardung
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great. The Resturant, tiki bar (dale), hawaiian activities, music and vendors,...so very close to the beach and to other beach activities too. My room was Clean, the grounds were taken care of and the cost was way less than the commercialized/trendy hotels up the road. In addition, the Staff were all very helpful especially Malahini, thanks for everything!! I can not say enough about the great time I had in Maui and having a great hotel experience was part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: draabe
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at the KBH...unless you want incredible service, the most authentic Hawaian experience on the island, cultural experiences, a wonderful breakfast buffet, an amazing show every night, the most popular Tiki Bar on the beach, and service by people who love their island and look forward to sharing their experiences with guests. This was our third trip to Maui. We stayed at the KBH the first trip and tried somewhere else for the second trip. We went back to the KBH and will never book with another hotel on the island. So if you decide to stay somewhere else you will never know what you are missing and there will always be room at the KBH when my wife and I are fortunate enough to return. If you want a big hotel luxury feeling.....go somewhere else. If you are looking for a unique, relaxing, wonderful environment where you are treated like family and can appreciate all that this hotel has to offer then by all means stay at the KBH.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: oconnb2
Reviews.Content: This is not a ritzy hotel so if that is what you are looking for go somewhere else, but if you can get over the fact you aren't staying at a brand new Hilton, you will enjoy this hotel. The rooms themselves are very average, they are cleaned daily and they do a good job, they are just nothing special, but the grounds and staff and location are wonderful! You don't feel like you are at the same hotel you stayed at on every other vacation. This place definetely makes you feel like you are in Hawaii. The resteraunt has great food, the tiki bar has great drinks (ask for Dale), there is a tiki grill to grab an afternoon burger, pool is great, beach is great! The staff will help you plan what to do around the island. There is also always something Hawaiian going on at the hotel incase you don't feel like exploring the island on a given day. I am very glad we stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. We had an ocean front room and the view was amazing. If we go back to Maui, we will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Contributed to our memorable wedding/honeymoon in Maui”
Reviews.Author: tuesday4us
Reviews.Content: My husband and I actually stayed at Ka'anapli Beach Hotel last October (2009) when we got married on the beach. We stayed for 9 days and I don't remember exactly what the name of the room was but we were on the top floor with the view of the garden but only feet away from the beach. The beach was literally a hop, skip and a jump! The staff was very accomodating and friendly and they kept the grounds very manicured. We wanted a true Hawaiian experience and this hotel was voted Maui's most Hawaiian hotel. The champagne brunch is a must...we talk about the unending crab all the time! Not to mention that everything we had for dinner there at the hotel restaurant was awesome! We will definitely be back and next time we will stay much longer! Very reasonably priced, as well :) Mahalo, KBH!!!! P.S. There is a semi-luau act some nights and the singers and dancers are very good...it adds to the ambiance at night!

Reviews.Title: “A Really Hawaiian Experience”
Reviews.Author: flowerfloosey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in room #360 in the Kaui building for 9 days Oct 15 thru Oct 24th. We were in Maui for our son's wedding and our 40th anniversary. The location of this hotel is perfect! It is so close to excellent snorkleing at Black rock and everything thing you need is right there. We were able to see huge turtles and Eagle Rays and lots of colorful firsh. The Tiki bar for drinks and the Tiki grill for food. Just a short walk to the Hula Grill, Leilanis' and Whalers Villiage for great shopping and nightlife. You can watch the nightly ceremony at black rock with the torch lighting and diver. We were upgraded from a pool view to a partial ocean view room and we had a lovely view from our lani. Although the room was comfortable, it did not meet our expectations and it was in the updated wing. We were ok with it but it was kind of old fashioned but had everything we really needed. The bed was comfy but not cushy. The linen was very basic not lux. The location of this hotel and the friendliness of the staff here makes it still a good choice for the traveler that wants to save a little money on hotel cost but stay in the best area on Kaanapali beach. We enjoyed watching and talking to (long Hawaiian name "mr smith") who did coconut palm weaving..and we loved the nightly hawaiian free show on the stage. The daily buffet breakfast was good and convenient. We got tired of the buffet and only on the last day discovered that the voucher for breakfast would go toward the regular menu for 9$. A waffle is 14.95 with fruit on the menu. As for the room number..the higher the number the closer you are to the oceanfront. Our room was a bit noisy from the lani because it was right above the walkway to the elevators. The room was very soundproof when the doors were closed. We could totally block out the music from the show by closing our sliding door. The hotel is used for tour groups and the lobby is crowded when the buses come in. The grounds of this hotel are extremely beautiful and well kept. The plumeria trees are everywhere! The beach is a short walk from your room anywhere at this hotel. You can relax on the grassy area, by the pool or on the beach. Overall a very relaxing vacation. We would return to this hotel in a heartbeat! If you like magic shows..don't go to the one on the premises of this hotel..instead go to Warren and Annebells..it is absolutely amazing experience. Our dining experience here was just ok. The prices were high and not a very extensive menu.The food at the Tiki Grill is convenient for a day of relaxing and not wanting to walk or drive anywhere but it is expensive for what you get. This is a middle class hotel in a upperclass area. Internet is 10$ a day. Beware of end of stay costs as one needs to plan on the cost of parking etc.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel I have ever stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: WestEndVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed and held our wedding at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. It was absolutely perfect. I have stayed at hotels in North America, Europe and Asia, and this was by far my favourite. The staff at the KBH -- from front desk to housekeeping to activity planning -- are so genuine and happy to help. We had an ocean front room with a lanai - breathtaking views. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. We went to the welcome breakfast at the hotel - a great introduction, and one of the staff (Jody the magician) even took the time after the breakfast to point out points of interest on a map of the island.
