We enjoyed relaxing on the hotel grounds, which were much more pleasant with their grass, trees and flowers, than some nearby hotels which seemed to have a lot more concrete than greenery. The hotel's Tiki Bar and Grill was great (we made fast friends with the bartender) as was the beach hut where we borrowed towels and rented snorkel gear. We spent time on the beach in front of the hotel, swimming and sunbathing. We walked the five minutes or so to Black Rock for snorkeling a couple of times, and saw sea turtles, many different kinds fish, and even a sting ray. We rented a car so drove around the island and went on a few hikes (Twin Falls and Iao Valley). We also took surfing lessons, went to the hotel magic show (fantastic!) and enjoyed the nightly music and hula at the hotel (excellent Friday night hula show featuring local youth). I participated in lei making at the hotel with my mum and sister. The hotel did a fantastic job of planning our wedding for us - I would definitely recommend it for anyone considering getting married in Hawaii. Overall, a really wonderful experience. We will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: jimmyrw
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews I have read sum trhis place up brilliantly. It is not the most plush hotel on Maui (or even on this stretch of beach) but it has other things going for it. KBH has a great location and has a brilliant atmosphere, it is more relaxed than the Hyatt and Sheraton on the same stretch, we would rgeularly sit round the bar and chat to other guests, the staff were all helpful and fun and the location is top drawer. It is cheaper than the other hotels and in my opinion friendlier than the other hotels, even little things like the number and availability of sun beds round the ball and in the grounds (several people told us the other hotels charged for these). Dont go here if you want 5 star rooms, do go here if you want a hotel in a brilliant location, with a lovely atmosphere that costs less and leaves you more spending money for other things.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! The best!”
Reviews.Author: SiouxFallsSiouxFalls
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel from Oct. 12th to 20th, 2010. This hotel was the PERFECT place to celebrate our 30th anniversary. The room was so nice, the location was perfect, the grounds were beautiful, and the staff members were all so incredibly nice. I don't think we could have picked a more perfect place! The room... We had a garden view room in the Moloka'i building. The building is obviously not new, but certainly seemed to be well taken care of. The king size bed was very comfortable, we had a view of Black Rock from our lanai, everything was clean and worked properly... and a bonus was the excellent water pressure in the shower! The location... couldn't be more convenient - VERY close to Black Rock but also has views of Molokai and Lanai. VERY close to Whaler's Village ( we walked there sometimes 2 or 3 times a day ) where you can eat and/or shop for almost anything you can imagine, or you can take a bus to Lahaina from Whalers Village for only a dollar each way! The beach walk that connects all of the hotels along Kaanapali is a great place to get a little exercise and see the ocean. We also took the bus to Kapalua one day. And a Trilogy kiosk on site made it easy to book a sunset sail cruise and a snorkeling cruise... the boats leave from the beach at the hotel. (Both cruises were EXCELLENT, the food was fantastic, Captain Kevin and his ship mates were fun and so helpful, and we even tried SNUBA! It was great!) We also went to the Kupanaha magic show at the hotel, sat at the front row of tables, had a GREAT meal, and then were AMAZED by the magic. It was fantastic! The grounds... Well, the pictures online just don't do justice to the hotel grounds. There is such a variety of plants! The pool is much larger and deeper than we anticipated, but there are shallow parts, too, and the water temp was perfect. We ate at the Tiki Grill a couple of times, had mai tais (or the daily drink special) at the Tiki Bar almost every day, and watched the nightly hula show a few times. There is a real mix of people here. There were people of every age group, lots of couples, lots of families with kids, and lots of people who appeared to be single. It seemed that anyone would feel at home here. Another bonus - walking around the grounds after dark, listening to the Hawaiian music, and smelling the plumeria trees. It just doesn't get any better than that! The staff... Everyone (and I do mean EVERYONE ) was friendly, helpful, and attentive without being intrusive. It's obvious that they are proud of their hotel, and their connection to Hawaii and to the environment. We took several of the free classes that they offer, and we learned so much while having fun. The information we received at the free breakfast on our first day was very helpful and the food was great. And the ceremony on our final day was touching and very special. We spent 8 days here and enjoyed every minute of it. We did not rent a car, and we never felt that we needed one. The bus system will get you almost anywhere you need to go, and it's a quick walk to Whalers Village to catch the bus. We had our MOST AMAZING AND WONDERFUL anniversary dinner at Gerard's in Lahaina and used the bus to get there and back. Two great golf courses are just across the road. A couple of great boat tours with Trilogy leave from the hotel beach. Snorkel equipment can be rented there, too, and the snorkeling at Black Rock was GREAT... saw at least 5 big sea turtles and lots of other sea life there. We took the Hana Tour with Valley Isle Excursions - they picked us up at the hotel ON TIME and delivered us safely after the tour. The hotel was MOST helpful with reservations and information, and everything went perfectly! Thanks to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel, it's going to be hard to ever top the vacation we just returned from!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful place to make relaxing, loving, romantic memories!!!”
Reviews.Author: garyking31
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent, very friendly, helpful and made us feel at home. The hotel was beautiful, inviting and full of activities for all of us to choose from. Excellent food and entertainment. An overall wonderful experience and hope to visit again in the future. Would highly recommend to others to make wonderful memories here at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in Maui!!! A great place for honeymooners and for anniversary celebrations. We celebrated our 40th anniversary here. Thank you for helping us make wonderful memories!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: mauigirl74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the KBH back in 1972, the first time ever on Maui. Most recently stayed the week of Sept. 18-26. I have stayed in several Maui Hotels, with higher ratings, but none can compare to KBH. It is not as fancy, but it really the most Hawaiian Hotel, so comfortable and a perfect location. At first, I was a little disappointed in the beds. They are a little hard, but seriously it was not a problem. I slept like a baby every night. The grounds, pool, Tiki Bar & Grill are perfect. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel made our Hawaiian experience better then we could have imagined.”
Reviews.Author: Aloha19
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not too expensive. Location was GREAT. The beach is beautiful and walking distance to many fun things. Shopping, restaurants, excursions, snorkeling, etc. Black Rock is located 100 yards down the beach. We spent almost every morning swimming/snorkeling with giant sea turtles. The Tiki Bar and Tiki Grill on site are great late night hangouts. Hawaiian entertainment every night. We toured some of the other hotels. While some of them might have some nicer features. Pool/Hot Tub. The employees at Ka'anapali are second to NONE. This is what really made out trip. We learned so much about the culture from the friendly employees. Aloha or a greeting from all no matter what they were doing. We took advantage of some of the on site activities including Lei making and learning the Hula. Our instructor for both was a very special women named Malihini. If you spend any time at this hotel you MUST spend some time with her. Plenty of info for all off site trips.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hawaii resort should be”
Reviews.Author: steveinchicago
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and totally enjoyed it. At first I was concerned about the dated looking lobby, but after spending time there I found it to be the most authentically Hawaiian resort I've seen. If you are looking for a overly manicured luxury resort with a fancy pool and flamingos & penguins, then this place is not for you. If you want to enjoy the beach and the sun in a relaxed, uniquely hawaiian environment, then this is where you want to be. Of all the resorts on Kaanapali Beach, this one has the best beach location. It is the only part of the beach that has a deep, sandy beach and a rock free ocean front. You can go swimming in the warm clear water without having to worry about a rocky surf or you can relax on the sandy beach. The grounds are spacious and well maintained, but not overly manicured, there is a cute pool with plenty of lounge chairs to relax in. There is a Tiki bar and Tiki Grill near the pool. You can place a beach chair anywhere on the spacious lawn, not only in designated areas around the pool. So if you want to read or relax without being bothered by hundred of people around a crowded pool, you can do that. Every night they have a Hula show on the stage near the tiki bar which is a nice way to end a relaxing day at the beach. The breakfast buffet was a good selection of eggs, meats (including fish), cereal, fruit and pastries. We started every day with a full stomach of wholesome food. We were touched by the goodbye ceremony before we left. Even though the KBH is the most affordable resort on Ka'anapali beach, I would highly recommend it at any price. If I wanted a fancy manicured resort with a spectacular pool, I can find that closer to home. I went to Hawaii for the beach, the sunshine and the unique hawaiian environment and thats what I found at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GRRRRREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TheSawardFamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a true Hawaiian hotel! We were welcomed authentically, the rooms and grounds felt authentic and the nightly Luau was to die for. I felt no trouble allowing my 5.5 and 11 year old out by themselves at the pool. Everything was close and it was small enough to be personal. The breakfast buffet was great and a little different every day. We will come back and I know it will be terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Made the right choice”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoJohnnyPadre
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place for a family vacation. Lots of activities for kids and parents. The pool is kid friendly and the rooms have been recently renovated and always kept clean. The staff is very friendly and you really do feel welcomed and feel that aloha spirit. Staying at this hotel added to the great memories of our family vacation in Hawaii and a big part of why we would love to return someday. We all miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Pleased with our Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: truthful
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip with hubby and kids (under 10 years) and met a mother inlaw and sister inlaw at the hotel too. The staff is personable, friendly, considerate and move about the hotel seamlessly! My poor son had stomach issues the night we arrived and the staff was so diligent about getting the room cleaned up and the carpet smelling good again that I knew right then and there I would stay here repeatedly in the future. Their breakfast buffet is worth getting in the room package and their restaurant is a fun and tasty place for dinner. There is a kids passport program for which they go to different parts of the hotel and collect goodies to put n their beach bag. Management sent up a bottle of bubbly for our 10th anniversary and we received a reusable shopping bag to carry our treasures in when we made the brief stroll to Whaler's Village. At their suggestion, we took a Trilogy Catamaran to the island of Lana'i and found the staff on board to be so friendly and fun! It was pricey-but was an all day event which included 3 very yummy meals!! I think you are missing out if you don't sail somewhere with this company! Anyway overall I would give this resort a 12 out of 10!!! Maybe somethings aren't perfect (like a toilet that needed the handle to be jiggled a bit or some entertainment that was a much after 9pm) but the quality of customer service and respect can't be matched!! The sunsets from the Lanai are hard to beat too!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever.”
Reviews.Author: KevinP68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in April 2010 on our first trip to Maui. We chose KBH because of their reputation as Hawaii's Most Hawaiian Hotel; since we were going to be in Maui, we really wanted to experience the culture. We were thrilled with the hotel. We signed up for and attended the lei making classes, experienced the music and stories of the islands, and had a great time. Whe you go, make sure to check out the outrigger canoe that the employees of the hotel made; it was beautiful. We opted for a partial ocean view room, but couldn't have asked for a more beautiful view of the beach and ocean. The beach itself was wonderful, just steps from our hotel room and we spent at least some of each day there basking the sun and playing in the surf. Shopping and restaurants are just a short walk down the beach, and was close enough that we saved on parking at the Whaler's Village shopping center. Lahaina is just a couple of miles away, with lots of additional shopping and restaurants. The people at the hotel were wonderful from the time we arrived until we left with our kukui nut leis. Always friendly and helpful, they truly made us feel like we were ohana. The majority of the hotel management and staff are Native Hawaiians, and they have a definite desire to ensure that the experiences are authentic. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else when we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: rebecca-rn
Reviews.Content: My husband planned our trip as a surprise for my 40th Birthday. I had NO idea where we were going until just before we left. I was amazed to be going to Maui, and when we arrived at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel I was even more amazed! Who knew my husband could plan such a wonderful trip? Luckily, we landed here, at Hawaii's "Most Hawaiian Hotel". It is an older hotel, but is kept up nicely, the rooms have been updated, and the location is fabulous. It is 200 yards from Black Rock, a famous snorkeling spot. The hotel has everything you need right there, so you never need to leave the area if all you want to do is chill out & relax in paradise. If you do want to get out & about but stay close to home base, there is a beach walk in front of the hotel, spanning the length of the stretch of hotels in that area. We went to a Luau at the Hilton, which was easily within walking disntance. There is also the Whalers Mall, an outdoor mall, with lots of quaint shops & restaurants. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful, with lots of trees, including plumeria, so the whole place smells like heaven! There is a gift shop, convenience store, restaurant, a tiki bar, and a grill, all near the pool. They also have a stage outdoors where local talent is presented nightly, for free. And, a rental place for snorkeling & other water activites.Additionally they have a Dinner & Magic show (Kapunaha) that was alot of fun- our kids loved it & the food was fantastic! The restaurant serves regular meals & also has a breakfast buffet that we enjoyed. The Hotel offers FREE classes in Hawaiian arts & activities....but a word of caution, sign up EARLY or you will miss out, like we did! We were upset that we missed the Lei-making class & Hula dancing! They staff is so friendly & really go out of their way to welcome you, help plan activites on or off site, and take care of all your needs. We plan to make Maui a regular vacation spot, and wiil definitely always stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rainbowmoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2010 and were very pleased with the location. It's across from the golf course and the view of the mountains was spectacular. The hotel is right on the beach and you can rent cabanas to lie there and enjoy the sound of the waves and even see the divers at sunset from Black Rock. The hotel is a little dated. The first room we had was not very clean and the bathroom fixtures were old and not in good working order. We went down to the front desk and Michelle was very nice and changed our room the next day. The room was upgraded to partial ocean view and was bigger. This one was nicer and we really enjoyed it. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. On site laundry facilities came in handy before our flight home. Kaanapalli Beach Hotel is within walking distance (maybe 5 minutes) from Whalers Village where you can catch "the bus", public transportation to Lahaina where there's lots of good eating places, a Safeway, and souvenir shopping. Recommend Aloha Plate in Lahaina to catch a nice sunset and reasonable portions/prices. We enjoyed Hula Grill and Leilani's in Whaler's Village also. You can get happy hour specials at both for very reasonable prices. Kaanapali Beach Hotel is a good family oriented place to stay with lovely grounds and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Keeper - And Well Worth Returning To!”
Reviews.Author: SASprings
Reviews.Content: After quite a bit of research into vacation accomodations on Maui, we selected the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. Our first impressions were less than great, since our guaranteed 3:30pm check-in was not accomplished until 4:15pm due to our beach front room not being ready for us. However, everything after that was exceptionally good, including the hotel's gracious acknowledgement of the belated (May) 40th wedding anniversary celebration by providing a bottle of champagne and a congradulatory note in our room. The room was truly ocean front, about 20 steps from the impressive beach. Within walking distance is the Whalers Village shipping center, as are all of the other resorts and time-share condo's located on the long Ka'anapali Beach boardwalk. Old town Lahaina's extensive Front Street's shopping and dining area is only a 5-10 minute driving distance away. The [free] evening hula dance and Hawaiian music show at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel makes for a relaxing evening after a bustling tourist day, made even more so by probably the best Pina Colada drinks from the Tiki Bar, located in the show's area. On our departure day the hotel presented the customers who were leaving that day a kokua nut necklace, and for those on a repeat visit(s) to the hotel, an additional white kokua nut to signify the return visit(s) - one of the couples in our departure group received their 7th white nut, signifying their 8th stay at the Ka'anapali. We will definitely return to this exceptional facility!

Reviews.Title: “Although it was our honeymoon, the hotel was still amazing”
Reviews.Author: Macknelly
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to its tag of being the most Hawaiian Hotel in Maui. It was amazing, although not as slick and polished as other hotels in the area it definitely makes up for it in character. The room was a great size and was clean and comfortable. The greatest thing about our experience here was the fact that from day one we were sent little gift and made to feel special. On arrival we had a bottle of champaign in our room waiting and every few days little cards and treat were left in our room. The hotel activities were based on Hawaiian culture which was amazing and although you are slap bang in the middle of corporate Ka'anapali beach area it was nice to still feel the traditions of Hawaii were being demonstrated. We tried Lei making, ukulele playing and saw reed making and wood carving demonstrations. The evening entertainment was brilliant and the ranges of bands playing were very talented. The tiki bar and restaurant were well worth being around and after some of the disappointing food and drinks we had in the whalers village it was nice to know we had good places to eat in our own hotel. With the Famous Ka'anaplai beach and point at the end of the hotels luscious gardens there was plenty to do and hire from the hotel. The staff were lovely and made us all feel so welcome especially Malihini Keahi who felt like our adoptive mum, always greeting us with smiles and warm hellos. Thank you for a great honeymoon and holiday.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel, truly the total Hawaiian experience!”
Reviews.Author: TexasWoman44
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Maui and the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel for my birthday. We stayed at the hotel on September 18th thru the 25th and simply loved the hotel, the staff. We loved the magic show dinner theater Kupanaha, the food was fantastic and the show was better than anything you would ever see in Las Vegas. Jody the Magician and his wife Kathleen were totally awesome! Had a Hula Lesson on my birthday and my teacher Malihini made me a special carnation lei for my birthday, the staff also sang happy birthday to me in the lobby . We did feel like Ohana (family) while we were there. It was the best birthday I have ever had! We will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone because yes it is the best and the most Hawaiian hotel and we hope to return, bring our kukui lei and receive our white nut. Receiving the farewell kukui lei was so very special. Thank you all for a memorable experience at the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: raingurl
Reviews.Content: I generally pick a brand name when traveling to a new place, but I decided to take a risk. It was WELL worth it. The Ka'anapali Beach hotel had the best beach by far, a truly excellent staff, great food and even ave us a free upgrade when we got there. We talked about it, and really couldn't see why we'd go to one of the more expensive hotels that offered no beach, just drop-offs to the water. We had everything we wanted there. We were just a short walk from the restaurants at Whaler's Village and dined twice at the Tiki restaurant on-site. Their unique and free hula shows were great. We've been home only two days and are planning our next trip to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Stacy47111
Reviews.Content: My travel agent highly recommended this hotel for it's value, so after reading tons of reviews I went ahead and booked it. It was as I expected clean and comfortable and a view that is unsurpassed. The ocean view room was as good as some oceanfront rooms I have stayed in before but with the beautiful mountains on the other side and the great courtyard below. You are in the middle of these other higher priced hotels and you get the same views. We loved being able to walk a couple of blocks to Whalers Village for shopping and dinner. Being right next to Black Rock provided lots of snorkeling opportunities. Lots of beautiful fish to see.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Maui”
Reviews.Author: IslandLovinTwosome
Reviews.Content: From our partial ocean-view room, we could see Black Rock and a postcard-worthy view of the Ocean and hear the waves from our room. After walking almost the entire length of Kaanapali Beach, we found the beach area in front of the Kaanapali Beach Hotel to be among the best. The staff was efficient and friendly; we had turn-down service and macadamia nut cookies on our bed every night after returning from dinner or a show. We were only a couple of minutes walking distance from Whaler's Village as well as Black Rock for some excellent snorkeling. There were many free activities offered at the hotel, and all of this was available for a very reasonable price. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Hotel provides a comfortable relaxing Hawaiian ambiance”
Reviews.Author: hoeckmann
Reviews.Content: We stay at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel whenever we visit Maui which has been 3 times in the past 7 years. The staff is so warm and friendly with true spirit of "aloha." The guest services staff is incredible, so full of knowledge about the islands and helpful hints for travelers. We just love Malihini and Mikala! In fact when we visit we look forward to seeing them again. It's like going home to old friends. The hotel does an awesome job of keeping a comfortable and relaxing ambiance on the grounds; unlike other hotels which can feel cold and impersonal. The location is also excellent, right on the beach and next to Black Rock which has the best snorkeling and sea turtles too. Our room was very comfortable and we love the lanai. We can't say enough good things about the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. If you are looking for a truly Hawaiian hotel then you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, but the location is great”
Reviews.Author: NTP66
Reviews.Content: I really, really don't like leaving negative reviews. I really, really wanted to like the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. I even booked our final 3 nights in Maui there BECAUSE of TripAdvisor reviews. Unfortunately, my wife and I did not have a great time there. My wife and I had already stayed at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club the previous 7 nights, and maybe we were just used to higher quality... everything. When we first checked in, we were given a ground floor unit right at the corner of a walkway. So, basically anyone that walked by had a terrific, clear view of your unit - unless you shut all of the curtains, turning your room into a cave. I asked for a different room, as I was on my honeymoon, and the woman at the front desk quickly moved me to a 3rd floor unit with no hassle at all. The staff in general are very nice. The AC unit in our room made a 4' x 4' section of the carpet (and wall) very damp. So damp that housekeeping had to bring in a huge industrial fan and have it blowing 100mph for an entire afternoon to try and dry it out, which it never did. So, we learned to never walk around barefoot or with socks on. The TV's are still incredibly old, but that wasn't a huge deal to me. After all, we didn't book the room to watch TV. The fridge is tiny, so you can't put much in it at all, and the safe is more like a small metal locker than anything else - one that you pay a daily rate for. I needed to use my laptop to look up some things - restaurants, activities, etc. Well, they charge $10 for 24-hours of Internet usage here. Seriously! For me, that is absolutely ridiculous. I ended up just using my iPhone 4's internet to get everything that I needed, not wanting to put another dime into this hotel's bank. Dinner was very good, but they brought out a completely different meal than what my wife had ordered, so she had to wait for them to cook the correct meal and bring it back out; they did not take a few bucks off the bill for this, which I thought was pretty inconsiderate, since just about *any* other restaurant would have done the same. On our final day, I was in the middle of showering and packing to get ready to leave for the airport when the front desk called me telling me that I had to move my car so that the tree trimmers could get in. No advanced notice was given to anyone, nor were there any signs posted. This isn't a big a deal as the rest of my issues, but little things keep adding up here. I know I wasn't the only one inconvenienced by this, as I saw a few older ladies having to move their cars into the garage (which was pretty full at the time). To sum it up: PROS: -Conveniently located near Whaler's Village and Black Rock -The beach in front of the hotel is outstanding -Very friendly staff CONS: -Severely dated rooms (even in the newly-renovated rooms) -$9/day self-parking or $11/day valet -$10 for 24-hours of internet access -Uncomfortable beds and pillows. Seriously, I was able to get *maybe* 5 hours of sleep a night on them; the same goes for my wife Overall, we were very disappointed with our stay here, and will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Option on a Great Stretch of Beach”
Reviews.Author: travbud1
Reviews.Content: You seem to get what you pay for at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and you are paying for the location. Billed as the most "Hawaiian Hotel", I believe it lives up to its billing. Having said that, it is not the "Best Hotel". Every person will tell you that the rooms are a bit worn and there is no doubt. We stayed in a "renovated room" and I would not want to see a non-renovated room! However, this is an excellent budget friendly option. The location is unbeatable sandwiched between the Whaler shops and restaurants, the Westin, the Hilton and the Ka'anapali golf courses and of course the ocean. The staff are quite friendly and I would recommend it for families. I do not believe there is any where better in this price range directly on the beach. So just know what to expect and you shouldn't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “This is our favorite hotel in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: jerickd
Reviews.Content: The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel provides the perfect combination of activities, entertainment, relaxation, good food and location. This was our second stay there, and we plan to go back. Our first stay was 8 years ago, and the hotel is just as nice now as it was then. The beach is great for swimming and is just a few yards from a great snorkeling spot. There are shops and restaurants within walking distance and Lahaina is only a 5 minute drive away. Some snorkeling trips even depart right from the beach, so you don't have to drive and find parking. Hotel employees are the friendliest I have ever known. The hotel itself as well as their employees treat each other and guests as part of their ohana (family). There is an outdoor grill and Tiki bar, plus a stage. Every evening there is live Hawaiian music with hula dancing. On many days there are free lessons or demonstrations in hula, lei making, ukulele playing and more. If you want to a great Hawaiian vacation, this is the place to have it!

Reviews.Title: “True Hawaiian experience!”
Reviews.Author: swmlmm
Reviews.Content: We came to Hawaii to celebrate our 40th Wedding Anniversary- with it being our very first time to Hawaii not knowing exactly what to expect, KBH exceeded all of our expectations with their friendly and caring staff. It is truely a home away from home.l We felt very welcome and safe.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: GiantsFanLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Hawaiian theme. We had problems with check-in for our complimentary breakfasts, but management finally cleared it up. convenient to the beach. concierge didn't tell us that we could get cheaper luau ticket at hyatt, though, so we ended up paying higher price. evened out by getting discount to hotel's own magic show.

Reviews.Title: “Tiki Bar...we miss you Tiki Bar No Ka Oi...”
Reviews.Author: onlineprofessor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the KBH in early September. The hotel is starting to show its age but the staff and attitude of the employees makes up for an aging hotel. Employees are genuine and sincere and always wishing guests aloha..... Our room was clean and overlooked the gardens and a partial ocean view. My only suggestion...drop the parking charges....unless valet parking. The Tiki Bar was second to none...Dale is a master mixologist and Lynn busts her buns to provide the very best service.....Thanks Lynn. Even the guests seem more relaxed and engaging than at other higher-priced hotels. Nightly entertainment is world-class. We even came back after leaving the hotel to enjoy the Tiki Bar and nightly entertainment. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location - truly is Hawaii's most hawaiian hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bear025
Reviews.Content: My partner and i have just returned from maui and stayed at the KBH. The hotel is so welcoming to all guests and really make your stay amazing. the hotel rooms are very big and relaxing. The hotel is right on the beach which makes for amazing snorkelling by day and the best sunsets ever by night! located right next to whalers village you really have a wide variety of choice of evening entertainment, tho the nightly shows at the hotel make you want to stay! cant wait to return for our honeymoon :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kmludwig76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at KBH for 10 nights in early September and couldn't have left any happier :) All in all, the hotel is a great value for the price and is in a perfect location on a beautiful beach with one of the best snorkeling spots on the island. Service was perfect, employee attitudes are very positive, and the hotel does make a strong effort to live up to its "most hawaiian" slogan. We stayed on the 6th floor of the Maui building with a beautiful view out on the balcony, overlooking the sea with Lanai in the distance on our left and Molokai in the distance on the right. The hotel is also a very short walk to the Whaler's Village that provides several nice restaurants and some quick shopping. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again in the future based on the location, value, employee service/attitude, and the general beauty & adventure Maui has to offer. Overall, I'd rate the vacation as magical/priceless/indescribable and KBH was a big part of that!

Reviews.Title: “Most Hawaiian Hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: angelfishps
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. There's so many helpful and courteous staff and we enjoy every minute of our stay. They are true "customer service experts" and we'll come back again and again. The nightly sunset show is wonderful. We love the location too--right next to Black Rock and Whaler's Village and just across from the Kaanapali Golf Course!!

Reviews.Title: “simply great a pure life treasure”
Reviews.Author: solo201032999
Reviews.Content: day 1 to day6 just great...the service,entertainment,food,the whole entire vacation was unbelieveable.my time there wasn't long enough.A very nice room.The location, an hidden treasure,the sites,the warm waters, just unbelieveable.To say what I like best were watching the sunrises and sunsets each day from my fourth floor balcony.I truly enjyed my stay at your wonderful HOTEL...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to spend our 15th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: LindaPTucson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at KBH for nine days in mid-May. We chose a room overlooking the ocean. The location was perfect because there's lots of action on the water and on the beach walk, but the hotel itself is on the quiet end of the beach. Our room was quite comfortable, but we were most impressed with the staff and service. Everyone was so friendly and welcoming. All of the housekeepers and groundskeepers in every area of the hotel greeted us with a smile every time we walked by them. Although we didn't take advantage of the free hula dancing or lei-making classes, we saw quite a few people who did. We enjoyed looking at the crafts tables that the various local artisans set up on during the mornings we were there. It was also fun to go over to the little stage by the bar between 6 p.m. and 9 p.m to watch the free hula shows. We didn't bother going over to the free breakfast on the first day because we knew we'd have to listen to an orientation. The breakfast buffet at the restaurant was good, but quite expensive, so we usually went into Lahaina for a cheaper breakfast. We also didn't care much for the one dinner we had at KBH restaurant, so ate elsewhere the rest of the time. We thought the closing ceremony for all the guests who were leaving that day was a lovely touch and now have a beautiful memento of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The most Hawaiian Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Maui_Loving_Ohana
Reviews.Content: KBH is not one of those fancy luxury resorts that you can find in Ka'anapalai Beach, but it more than makes up for this by being a very friendly hotel. Their motto is to provide the guests with the "most Hawaiian " experience. They provide free Hawaiian crafts for guests of all ages. e.g lei making and hula dance lessons. They also have a free nightly sunset hula show and music for their guests. They have one of the best beaches right off of their property and walking distance to "black-rock", which is a prime location for snorkeling. The hotel is very clean and reasonably priced and most rooms have a full or partial view of the ocean. 12 years ago,when looking to plan a trip to Maui, our travel agent recommended KBH, and we have been return guests ever since. For us, it is like going back home to be with friends and get our fulfillment of the Hawaiian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and noisy... Way overrated...”
Reviews.Author: cybertao
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good location, and the employees are nice. However, this is about it. If you want a place close to the beach, this is probably the best value around that area. However, this is about all you will get. I had two rooms (one for me, another for my in-laws), and my wife found two roaches in our room, another in the other room... . Even worse, people from both rooms in my party started to have marks of bug bites after just one night.... Everybody are now itching. After I checked on the Internet, it seems to be bedbugs... ouch... This hotel is probably not the only one with this type of problem, but the hotel was not that clean (in my opinion). Also, the A/C is ancient and noisy. It was like a puzzle to close the veranda door in a way that it would make the AC restart! I needed to call maintenance three times to close the door... In the end, we just gave up about using the veranda due to this problem. They provide with a "free" breakfast in the first morning, but just skip it and use your time in a better way.... It is just a pitch about tourist trap activities. They say they don't receive any commissions, but who is actually verifying their claims? The breakfast is just pineapples, eggs, sausage and danish.... They will hold you there for 45 minutes, and make you wait quite a long time since everybody must enter the room at the same time. They will give you a LOUSY powerpoint presentation (that seemed assembled by a middle schooler!) for all that time..... They are some interesting free Hawaiian activities, but they make you sign up in advance, so you need to build your schedule around them --- what made them worthless to me. We booked the "Ocean partial view". Technically, it is correct, but the coconut trees blocked almost the entire "partial" view , so it was not worthy paying the extra money in hope to be able to see a little bit of ocean... If they place you at the "Maui" or "Lanai" wing, jsut ask to be move to other places. It is quite way in the back, bad view and we needed to walk through the lobby to go back to our rooms. Very inconvenient. This may be a good hotel for someone willing to save a few bucks for a beachfront hotel in Kaanapali area, but if you a *clean*, resort-like feeling hotel better look for another one...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, Five stars”
Reviews.Author: tdzsic514
Reviews.Content: We just spent our third time at the KBH! Another fabulous trip to our favorite place on Maui! The entire staff is absolutely wonderful and we especially love Malihini who is so gracious and kind. It is true that this is Hawaii's Most Hawaiian Hotel. There are many restaurants nearby along the beachfront walk, lots of shopping at nearby Whaler's Village, and Black Rock has the best snorkeling! The hotel rooms are immaculate and spacious. The nightly hula show is fabulous! We love the Tiki Grill for poolside lunch and the Tiki Bar for great smoothies and drinks. There is a whale-shaped pool which is great for younger children because half of the pool is only 3 feet deep. They also have a passport program for the kids in which they get their book stamped and receive little gifts from the store, gift shop, etc. The entire property is very well maintained and beautifully landscaped. We would choose KBH over the "big" resorts any day. It feels like returning to our Hawaiian home and family.

Reviews.Title: “We returned to Kaanapali's Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rinehokie
Reviews.Content: We returned after two years to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH or Kaanapali's Best Hotel). We have 2 young daughters who were very excited to return to Maui as it created some of our best vacation memories ever in 2008. We booked our vacation in January of this year through the KBH website for hotel, car and flight (with free breakfast for 2). The value could not be beat (because I looked for 2 months prior just to compare prices). Returning to KBH was just as we remembered. The hotel gives the authentic feel of Maui and the staff is exceptional. We spent the day in the pool or at the beach (also recommend a trip to Lanai with Trilogy). I spent hours snorkeling up/down Kaanapali Beach and around Black Rock (which has very good snorkeling and decent SCUBA). I can say that the beach in front of KBH (and the Sheraton) is the best of the entire Kaanapali area. We have stayed at the Hyatt in Maui, visited the Ritz-Carlton (which is nice but we would have to give them a child to stay there), The Westin, Sheraton and others along the strip of beach and we plan to return only to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel when we visit (hopefully again in 2 years) Maui. Mahalo Nui Loa

Reviews.Title: “Dont go on first impressions - this hotel is a hidden gem...”
Reviews.Author: Monkeygirl30
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 days at the Ka'anapali Beach hotel and had a great stay. On first impressions my family and I thought we'd make a mistake booking here, especially as a customer was complaining about a mouldy shower as we waited to check in! But we couldnt have been more wrong. The rooms are spacious and were equipped with all the things you could need. The rooms were cleaned and tidied every day. In fact, you can see that the staff are constantly renovating the hotel whilst trying to maintain a traditional Hawaiian feel. The service we recieved was fantastic- if we asked for extra towels, new lightbulb, etc. the staff had already done it by the time we got back to our room! The hotel is right on the nicest part of the beach and they provide free use of sun loungers and beach towels. You do have pay if you want a lounger on the beach itself, but its not really necessary as you're only a few steps away. The hotel also offers free activities every day such as lei making and hula dancing, as well as a hawaiian show each night. The only downsides to the hotel are that the pool is not very big (but the pools didnt seem very big at any of the hotels) and you had to pay $1.50 a day to use the in-room safe. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant every morning and also ate dinner there a couple of times, and the food was beautiful with very good service. 5 minutes walk down the beach is Whalers Village which has restaurants and lots of great little shops. But my favourite place was Lahaina, which you can get to by a 10-min bus ride from Whalers Village. Its a lively shopping street, with more reasonably priced souvenirs and a better choice of good places to eat. We hired a car for 2 days but some of the roads in Maui are only for the bravest drivers and to be honest, the area around the hotel and Lahaina were the nicest places to visit with lots to see and do. I think overall this a fantastic hotel for people who cannot afford to pay the 5-star prices, but want to visit the beautiful island of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “We had a fabulous time at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: simbababy1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel on our honeymoon and we had a wonderful stay. The welcome breakfast was very nice. Our room was very large, clean and had an amazing view of the ocean (we had an ocean front room) and the gorgeous sunsets. The staff was very friendly. The rooms were reasonably priced. The food and drinks were very good. The hotel was very close to Lahaina, which is what we wanted, so that was nice. The farewell ceremony was memorable for us. We are keeping the kukui leis for the next time we stay there. We WILL be returning to Maui and definitely to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Hawaii and not outrageously priced”
Reviews.Author: john_from_stlouis
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at a few hotels across the main Hawaiian islands and this one far surpassed our expectations. We liked the focus on Hawaiian culture and language, which enriches the experiences beyond mere pleasantry. Beach is right there, but also has nice outdoor pool, tiki bar/grill, and restaurant right outside your room within a nicely manicured tropical garden setting. Nightly live Hawaiian music and frequent hula performances can be heard from your room. The Kupanaha magic show was a big hit with our 3-year-old (we were impressed, too), as was the Keiki (kids) program that the hotel runs. Very family-friendly place. Bid you farewell with a Hawaiian song and free kukui lei. Kind, helpful staff. The "aloha" you expect in Hawaii but may be hard-pressed to find these days! I can't comment on how this compares with the pricier hotels in Hawaii (>$200/night), but this felt like a steal. I would definitely return here on my next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Marie60737
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. All the staff was extremely friendly, helpful and seemed to really enjoy making their hotel environment family oriented. We enjoyed taking the classes and learning about Hawaiian culture. We were able to ask any question and have it throughly answered. They arranged our off site activities for us as well as got us set up for on site activities. Even when a class was full they managed to get us in on site. I highly recommend this hotel to any who likes to feel at home away from home. Best trip ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “They make you feel like the hotel is your personal island get away”
Reviews.Author: orange084
Reviews.Content: Everyone should experience this place. The people, the atmosphere everything is so vacation orientated. Everyone wants you and your family to have the best time and enjoy everything that is Hawaii. The employees are helpful, and remember you and your family no matter how many times you visit. If you are looking for a quite, simple place to just relax. This is the place

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: MollyJanelle
Reviews.Content: My stay at Ka'anapali beach hotel could be described in one word - amazing. The hotel has something for everyone. There were families there, newlyweds, and just groups of friends and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. The staff are so welcoming and only after being there for a day they knew me and my two friends and would always chat and say hello. Not only can you learn to hula with one of the nicest women I have ever met but you can watch live entertainment (dance/music) every night! I will definitely be taking another trip back :)

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pgodfrey
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th visit to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. We were celebrating our 32nd anniversary. This hotel has the most incredible staff ! Everyone was friendly and eager to help. Our room was clean and had a wonderful view from our lanai. We loved the beach which is on one of the most beautiful sites on Maui. There are many activities at this hotel and great restaurants and shopping nearby. There is also a wonderful nightly hula show each evening. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and plan to return again in the next year.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff and the beautiful grounds were the highlights”
Reviews.Author: Joanne0810
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel, but our second stay in that area. We were very pleased with the hotel. Our children are aged 10 and 12 and were able to stay in our room at no additional charge. The hotel staff made sure we had a large enough room and a fold out bed. They responded very quickly when we requested extra blankets. The rooms were very clean, comfortable, and well maintained. The grounds of the hotel are really nice - large and green, with a dolphin shaped swimming pool, large grassy areas, trees, the tiki bar and grill, and some shaded hut shelters for sitting in. The pool was good for all ages, with a large shallow section at the tail end (2 feet deep), which was good for young kids (or a sitting adult), and plenty of deeper water at the other end for the big kids and adults. The hotel's location was handy, right by the beach, just a few minutes from Black Rock (one of the best snorkeling locations) and the Whaler's Village Shopping Center. The parking was OK, and I never saw it completely full. We enjoyed the hotel's free breakfast on the first day, when they told us about the hotel and the area, and the lei ceremony at the end (which they invite all of their guests to participate in if they want), which was done warmly and with humor. We liked the kukui nut leis they gave us, and it made for a very pleasant close to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, and beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: jzb1
Reviews.Content: Love the relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff. Not a luxury hotel, but one of the best locations on Maui, especially for the price. The grounds of the hotel are beautifully maintained and it's right on Kaanapali beach and close to shopping/restaurants (walking distance to Whaler's Village and a short drive to Lahaina). There is also a restaurant, bar, and grill on site. Good snorkeling at black rock also within walking distance. We booked a partial ocean view room and the view from the balcony was gorgeous. (I preferred a room with a balcony to relax on vs. being on the ground floor- although a ground floor unit might be better with kids because of easier access to the pool/grounds). I saw someone else comment on the A/C in their room, but ours worked great for our entire stay and I like the room cool when I sleep. We chose to have breakfast included in our package and the vouchers were good for a breakfast buffet inside the Tiki Terrace Restaurant (the Mixed Plate was closed). Even though we had free vouchers we still left $5 tip each day, but did not leave hungry. Parking cost $9 a day, which is similar to other hotels in the area. Housekeeping did a great job with the room cleaning and supplying clean towels/toiletries. Also loved the people selling crafts in the hotel lobby each morning. This was my second trip to this hotel and I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: sblanks
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th visit to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel, and each visit just gets better. The entire staff , from management to housekeeping, greets you with the aloha spirit. Our room was always clean and well kept. The location on the beach was probably one of the best on the entire island of Maui. We did not rent a car on this visit, but found plenty of great restaurants and shopping nearby. The food on the hotel premeises at the Tiki Terrace and Mixed Plate was excellent. There are many activities at the hotel including hula lessons, lei making and pineapple cutting, to name a few. This hotel is known as "Hawaii's Most Hawaiian Hotel" because of its dedication to preserving and teaching the culture of the islands. I always recommend this hotel to friends and family planning a trip to Maui. We hope to return again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good - this hotel has pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Leicester_Girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for 7 nights in July. We booked the hotel last minute and found that this was one of the only resonably priced hotels in Maui on the beach and as it had pretty good reviews on Tripadvisor, we booked up. Having read a lot of the reviews, the hotel was as I expected - the rooms are a little dated but fully functional and they contain everything you need for a beach holiday. The a/c wasn't up to much though and we relied heavily on the fan to sleep in a cool room at night. We booked a garden view room which I soon found out meant the cheapest room but actually the ones facing the pool and ocean were noisier than our room so we were very happy and slept perfectly all week! The location cannot be beaten - right on the beach, a wide stretch of sand (it's much narrower towards the Hyatt Hotel) and it's not even a 5 minute walk to Whalers Village which has a suprisingly good selection of restaurants and shops (some expensive, some cheap). The staff were friendly but we didn't take part in much of evening entertainment or hotel organised events and preferred to dine at a different restaurant every night. The only other point I would mention was that our cleaning wasn't very thorough - some days it seemed that none of the surfaces in the bedroom or bathroom were cleaned at all and all we could see that had been done was the bed been made. However, with hotel prices so high in Maui, this hotel is a good choice and provides good accommodation and location for a reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, not the greatest view from my room”
Reviews.Author: Shagley
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location for beach and shopping, beautiful grounds, clean and comfortable room, friendly, helpful staff. Cons: paid for a garden view room and requested non smoking and on a higher floor. What I got was a room where the view was a small strip of grass and a few potted plants that overlooked the condos next door, in a smoking building (smoking only allowed on lanai so not a big problem) and on the ground floor. After i got over the initial disappointment with the lack of view from my room I was very happy with this hotel (plus the location of my room allowed me to "borrow" the wireless internet from the condo next door for free). It is very affordable plus has everything I was looking for. I will definately stay here again, but next time will pay for at least a partial ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome location, beautiful beach and view.”
Reviews.Author: Rdditten
Reviews.Content: The first thing you will notice about a stay here is the employees. Very helpful, full of smiles, work hard to make your stay fun, enjoyable, and great service. The coordinators provide all information you need on all kinds of excursions. They are willing to setup a reservation, and give directions on how to get there. From the Valet parking attendants to the house keeping, everyone is friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the beach and the location. The illusionist dinner/show was entertaining. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The nightly entertainment and Hulas were very good. We just had a very wonderful experience here. We felt like we were part of the family during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: fxkcalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel as part of a package and were generally pleased with it. Pros: * It's right on Ka'anapali Beach, which is really nice. * Kiheli Beach is a short walk away, just around Black Rock. * Honolua Bay (which has great snorkeling) is about 20 min by car. * Lahaina is about 10 min by car. * The grounds are filled with shade trees and sitting in a lawn chair listening to the surf is really nice. * The pool is nice. * The staff is really nice and the maid service was great -- in a world of sand, they manage to keep the rooms spotless. * Breakfast was copious and fairly good, but after a few days you get tired of it. Cons: * If you think you'll be spending a lot of time in East Maui/Upcountry -- this is not the location for you. * It's pretty loud and there are people around all the time. We tend to prefer smaller B&B's, so the abundance of people got to be a drag. If you're used to bigger, resort-like hotels, this won't be an issue for you. * They sort of nickel-and-dime you: for $20 a night, breakfast is "included," but "included" doesn't include the tip which ends up being another $5/day. Parking is an extra $9/day. Wifi is also extra. * You have to drive everywhere (true most places in Maui). * There are no cooking facilities, so you have to eat all your meals out and the restaurant offerings aren't great (food courts or really expensive places -- expensive even by Maui standards). * There's a band playing Hawaiian music and covers every night. And after a couple of nights, you've really had enough. Even as a fan of Brother Iz, it'll probably be another 3 years before I will willingly choose to listen to Hawaiian music.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: wiggygail
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here with family members we took to Maui. I booked the trip through Hawaiian Airlines and I was so pleased with this hotel. Our rooms were in the Kauai Building on the 5th floor. We could sit on our balcony and see the beautiful blue ocean as well as the beautiful plants and flowers located off our balcony. The room was very nice, clean, well decorated and very comfortable. We had a fridge and took the opportunity to keep snacks and breakfast items there. I love the hotel because it is so "Hawaiian" and so laid back. No stuffiness at all here and the staff is helpful and pleasant. You can sit on the beautiful grounds in lawn chairs you are able to move to any location you desire (under blooming plumeria trees was my favorite) and you can have coolers with drinks, food, etc. which is not allowed at some of the high end chains. We saw several large groups having reunions enjoying time lounging on the property with their own snacks, etc. The hotel also has a nice outside bar and musical entertainment in the evening. We chose to pay 90$ for a late (6pm) checkout because our flight was not till 11 pm. This allowed us another day on the beautiful beach. With crystal clear water and black rock to snorkel--this is the perfect location for anyone to enjoy Maui. Free use of beach towels and plenty of lawn chairs are an added benefit. We will return to this great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: Melwhimsy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May for the first part of our honeymoon. It was a very enjoyable place with so many delightful features. The location is prime- with just steps to the beautiful beach. The sunsets and starry skies on the beach are breathtaking. The grounds at the hotel are beautifully landscaped and the ambiance is set with a centralized tiki bar. The bar offers DELICIOUS cocktails and reasonably priced daily specials. The LAVA FLOWS were to die for! The rooms were comfortable and since we had a ground-level room, we had a very large lanai that opened right up to the lawn. We loved being able to sit on our lanai and listen to the music from the free nightly entertainment. Also, for any running enthusiasts out there, I very much enjoyed running along the boardwalk in the early morning. It was peaceful, but there were other enthusiasts running and taking in the various resorts and beachscapes along the way. The morning weather in Maui was perfect for jogging. As far as local activities go, my husband and I loved the beach so much that we didn't do much else on the island aside from beach bumming it. But we did go to the Old Lahaina Luau, which was good. We also checked out Whaler's Village and a few of the restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in its own secluded town”
Reviews.Author: menome
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, I think it was also great value for what you get. It is geared towards all sorts of people, familes, couples, groups. It is a real hawaiian experience, they offer dancing every night, with classes, lots of activities to choose from, but it does not get noisy with children and people if you need to get into your room and get away from it all and is very close to the beach for a quiet walk. It feels as if you are on an private island but it is not too far from everyday places like shopping plazas, banks, etc. It is quite a drive from the airport (45-60 mins). The rooms were fantastic, not world class 5 star grade, but very comfortable and not corporate looking. They are very good with service. We booked a car, which is a must for this hotel given its location and you need a car to drive to places. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the Planet”
Reviews.Author: Edward3495
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Maui and picked this hotel because it was voted the most Hawaiian. We stayed for 11 days. it was and amazing experiance. The staff and nightly entertainment made us not want to leave. I travel for work and have been all over the world and by far, this was the best experiance i have had. If you are going to Maui this is where you need to stay for a truly memorable experiance. I will say if you are looking for that mega style resort this wont be for you. But if you want to experiance the island and its wonderful people this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - Did not want to come home”
Reviews.Author: KerryZ35
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, effecient and friendly. While it lacks the corporate feel of a Hilton, Marriott or Westin - it does not try to be them. The atmosphere is family friendly, comfortable and has charm. Nightly shows of local music with hula dancing were great to listen to from the balcony or stage side. It was a way to relax and feel like you were some place special. Issue first night was that show ends at 9pm and that was 3am in my head...till you get used to the time change. So a problem first became a good thing later. The room had 2 beds, effecient hot water shower, ample towels and soaps. (good room services) ....had a great view of the ocean and a fridge for pop, water and beer. Hotel has towels for the beach at the ocean side - so they encourage you to get to the beach. Very close to Black Rock - only a 5 minute walk to this great place to see fish snorkling or even from the water if you dare getting close to the rocks. The convenient store next to the bell hops had fair prices. You could get a pop, lotions, newspapers, toothpaste.....even beer for $1.75 or $2.00 easily. The Tiki Grill gave you options to stay on the property. Liked the friendly staff and help. Breakfast was included in our room package. Spent 8 days there and had every combination of scrambled eggs, bacon, pancakes, fresh fruit, pastry, potatoes, rice, eggs benedict, corned beef hash...etc. Had to tip on free breakfast and $42.00 was the waved cost - so $7.14 was minimum tip to be fair. Food was good quality. Had to fend off outside birds coming in for droppings of food.....but this again was the way it was everywhere you eat outdoors. First day..... strange - later did not bother me at all. Charged $9.00 per day parking. In and Out privledges. $11.00 for valet. Used room key to get in and out. Was good feature. Was not expecting to pay for parking...but it is Maui. Walking distance to fancy beach side shopping. Good close place on beach was the Hula Grill. If eat there a second time get huge brownie dessert with receipt. Food court exists in the local mall off the pathway. Even a McDonalds in this mall. (did not try) Morning walks on pathway were a treat. Other hotels can be viewed on walk for their amenities and pools. Enjoy the time there. We liked it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home On Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Beaverbabe
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at KBH the past 20 years and have never been disappointed! Situated directly on Kaanapali Beach and steps away from Whalers Village, this is the best value and represents the true Hawaiian hospitality on Maui. The super friendly employees (or family as we like to call the wonderful people who work at KBH) do everything they can to make our visit comfortable. Every evening there is Hawaiian music and entertainment in the courtyard, the whale pool, while small, is large enough to accomodate every guest and the expansive grounds create a feeling of a tranquil park with tropical birds entertaining while we relaxed in the lounge chairs reading under swaying palms. We would recommend this property to anyone who desires the real Hawaiian feeling while visiting the beautiful island of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is what Maui and Hawaii is all about, they help you understand the culture and why!”
Reviews.Author: Gene711
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on possibly the best beach on Maui, the ocean front rooms are awesome. We have stayed at this hotel twice in the same ocean front room. The hotel keeps computer records for years and offers returning guests special prices and room requests whenever posible. The staff, service, restaurants and pool are terrific. The true feeling of the Hawaiian culture is very strong here. If you want to relax and enjoy Hawaii at its best, this is the hotel to stay at. The beach walk links at least six hotels and The Whaler Shopping village/restaurants is only one hotel away. The beach is great and there is great snorkeling near by at Black Rock. Maui is our favorite island and we will continue to stay at this hotel every time we visit. Yes, there are golf courses nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and hospitable - can't wait to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: julsmavis
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was quiet, relaxing, clean, beautiful, and most reasonably priced. We enjoyed the hotel's Hawaiian atmosphere, and signed up for many of the interesting, free activities. The staff were superb--very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was super, and the chef created an extra-special, extra-yummy, vegetarian dinner for our first night. Every night there's excellent hula entertainment, magnificent sunsets, and swimming in the whale-shaped pool under the stars. People come from all over the island to enjoy the terrific dinner and magic show. A few minutes' walk to Whaler's Village, a 10-minute bus ride to Lahaina and about a half-hour ride to Napili Bay, this hotel is easily accessible without a car. Excursions to all sorts of exciting adventures can be booked right in the lobby. Trilogy Excursions has a hut at KBH, where you can sign up for snorkelling, snuba-ing, and other thrills. Visit Rebecca Lowell's on-site art gallery. A walk along the fabulous beach will take you to other hotels, where you can indulge in their happy hour specials. On the day we left, our lovely maid gave me a hug! We can't wait to go back to collect another kukui nut for our aloha lei, which is presented to all guests in a poignant farewell ceremony on their last day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: grandmato2
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located right on the beach. They have a welcome breakfast buffet the first day of your stay where they have entertainment, great food, and give you an overview of all the activities available at the hotel and in the surrounding area. When you leave, they have a ceremony where they give you a kukui nut lei. There are many free classes to sign u for at the hotel: lei making, weaving with palm leaves, hula lessons, Hawaiian language instruction, etc. All of their employees attend Hawaiian culture school and are very knowledgable about anything a tourist wants to know. Whaler's Village,a great shopping opportunity, is just a short beach walk away from the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “So liked it!!!”
Reviews.Author: JaneTarasova
Reviews.Content: It was our honeymoon. We stayed just for 3 nights but we liked this hotel so much! They have very welcome stuff! So delicious breakfasts and food in total! We had ocean front room and very very beautiful view on sunset! Very good program for evenings and mornings! Hula girls, nice ocean view, great music. It was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Fun, Relaxing, Cultural and Topped With a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: merboy8
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The landscaping is lush and beautiful. The rooms are spacious with very comfortable beds, private lanais and great views of the grounds and Pacific. There is free nightly entertainment featuring a live band and hula. Every day there are different cultural crafts or lessons you can do which were great fun. It's located about 5 mins from Lanai. It's also a very short walk to Whalers Village which features cool shops and a couple of nice restaurants. The KBH also has the best staff of any hotel I've visited. They are super friendly, very helpful and every single one of them greets you with a smile, talks to you and oftentimes knows your name. Their goal is to treat you like family, and they succeed. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Believe what you read - KBH no ka oi!”
Reviews.Author: newsanchor
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 6th trip to the KBH since our honeymoon in 1990. Our 20th anniversary was just as special as the rest have been! You've read the reviews, and they're all true. The hotel is not fancy, and if you look around, you will find plenty of flaws within the physical structure. What you will not find is a shortage of aloha from a staff dedicated to making their guests feel like family. You will also find a place that is an INCREDIBLE value compared to other properties in Kaanapali. If you feel the need to grumble about parking fees or internet service fees or the cost of breakfast, you might as well stay home, because you'll find those costs to be much higher elsewhere... And good luck finding lower prices within a walking distance of Black Rock! Other guests have complained on this site about the poor condition of some rooms at KBH. That problem can be easily solved by booking in a category that is 2 or 3 rungs from the bottom of the ladder. You'll still be paying less than you would be elsewhere in West Maui. And here's a useful tip that the hotel does not advertise... If you have a late flight home and want to enjoy the pool or beach on your last day, the hotel will, upon request, offer you a room to shower and change in, free of charge. That alone is a great value! But don't get me wrong... What really makes the KBH special is its people, and their dedication to make sure YOU have a great vacation! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “This is the only destination for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: superbonbon5
Reviews.Content: From their greeting to departure, this is THE hotel to stay with. Watch a rainbow appear every night. Shop nearby. The ocean is a few feet away and the waves breaking put you to sleep at night. Watch a show in the evening (free) The air is perfumed with plumeria. Close to many experiences, you need only ask any of the friendly and knowing staff. The view is outstanding! So close to heaven Bonnie C. Westminster, Md

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else on Maui...an incredible find...a gem!”
Reviews.Author: kardeb
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in ten months. The management and staff at The Kaanapali Beach Hotel should be a model for all hotels in Hawaii. The spirit of "Aloha" is immediately evident from the minute you check in. Each and every staff member is educated about Hawaiian culture and are eager to share it with the guests. It is clear that everyone at The Kaanapali Beach Hotel wants to make you happy and comfortable throughout your stay. The hotel is tastefully decorated, clean and comfortable. The grounds are absolutely lovely and there's no place in the world we'd rather be. We were treated like "Ohana" (family) and have never felt more comfortable in any other hotel in Hawaii or elsewhere. The Tiki Restaurant was incredible! The food was prepared to perfection and the menu was surpassed by none.

Reviews.Title: “10 days in Paradise, can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: Huno2010
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Maui and to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Excellent location, a nice walk to Whaler's Village and a short drive to shops, restaurants and activities. The staff is outstanding. The housekeeping and grounds staff keep the property immaculate. How nice to see their smiles and aloha around every corner. We can't say enough about the guest services staff ; always available, helpful and friendly, guiding us to all the local favorites. We enjoyed two excellent dinners at the Tiki Terrace restaurant and relaxed shopping in the KBH shops. -Deb & Paul from MA

Reviews.Title: “It was the greatest time for us ever”
Reviews.Author: Roppaku85
Reviews.Content: Hi! Our name is Bettina and Balazs. We are both Hungarians but living in Scotland, Shetland. We went to tha Ka'anapali Beach Hotel to get married. It sounded so romantic to get married in Hawai'i anyway! Our friends and family were really jelaous tho! The trip was tremendously long but it worth all the hassle! We had an oceanfront room and I really loved the sound of the waves all the time. The staff was really friendly and helpful. OUr room was always clean as a whistle Our wedding was perfect and it was really something to remember for the rest of our life! I can highly recommend the hotel and all the opportunities for all those people who wants to get married in a special way and for those who wants to spend quality time in a very special place! Bettina and Balazs Szabo

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Ruth030
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Kaanapali the first week of May and had a fabulous time. It was everything we expected and more. The hotel grounds are beautiful and very well kept. Even the walkway from our room to the parking garage was lined with beautiful plants and flowers. Our room was very large, very clean, and looked over the gardens and pool with an amazing view of the ocean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were treated to a welcome breakfast buffet on our first morning. On the morning of our departure, they had a little departure ceremony and presented each of us with a kakuli nut lei. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Island and Resort”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Ed_10
Reviews.Content: We had a great week at the Kaanapoli Beach Hotel and on the island of Maui. There were wonderful sights in and around the Hotel. My wife and I learned to make Lais from one of the hotel staff. There was plenty of shopping with the Whalers village just up the beach walk. Speaking of beach, the sand and waves were all we could ask. Several trips to the fishing village of Lahaina rounded out our trip nicely. We are planning our next trip to the island and to be back at Kaanapoli Beach will be a must.

Reviews.Title: “"Awesome"/Very nice accommodations/Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TandCofSD
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd trip to Maui April of 2010. Since we had a positive time in April of 2009 (celebrating our 30th Anniversary) at The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel; we decided to return to the same hotel to celebrate our 31st Anniversary. The staff was very accommodating in helping us book our Luau, Dinner cruise, and our trip to Hana. Our room was very clean & nice and overlooked the gardens & ocean. The buffet brunch offered with our room was awesome! The grounds were very manicured, plus the smell of the Plumeria trees and listening to the ocean waves made our trip very enjoyable. We especially enjoyed our walks on the beach /and the boardwalk/and the great drinks at the TIKI Bar. The hotel staff were very genuine and made us feel a part of their Hawaiian family for the week we stayed in Maui while trying to see & do different things than the last tear visit. What a great way to celebrate our anniversary and relax!

Reviews.Title: “Just as they say, the most Hawaiian hotel. very relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: softdog
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is excellent. The rooms are great, great views, grounds are beautiful. All the staff is very helpful with much aloha. The vast span of beach is the best on Maui, and the hotel is in walikng distance of the shopping village with lots of shops to explore. Can't wait to return. Love hearing the ocean. A wonderful Hawaiian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at The Ka anapli Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Retiredbro
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time we have been to Maui. Everytime we come we love staying at the KBH. The staff is friendly and always helpful. We really enjoyed walking on the beach and sitting by the pool, it was so relaxing. The Magic Show was realing entertaining, as was the nightly shows by the Tiki Terrace. I have always recommended this hotel to all my friends who come to Maui. We are looking forward to our next visit. Bert & Marcella Ortega, Chula Vista, CA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in a Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: WXRN
Reviews.Content: This may not be the newest or flashiest hotel on Kaanapali Beach, but it is an excellent value for a nearly flawless room. It is on one of the most scenic beaches in all of Hawaii. You can see Molokai, Lanai, and Kahoolawe across the usually tranquil sea. The islands protect the beach from ocean swells, and the tradewinds are blocked by Maui, so it is a good beach for young kids. Mauka (towards the mountains) from the hotel, sugar cane fields climb the mountain side. Just south is Lanai with plenty of shopping and relatively expensive restaurants. Parking is $9 per night in a garage with very narrow stalls (remember that before upgrading your rental car). The grounds were lush and immaculate. All the public areas we saw were clean and well maintained. We stayed on the 2nd floor of the Kauai tower. There was ongoing renovation of the 1st floor, but we never heard it. The room appeared to have been recently renovated, and I could see no flaw. The lighting and ceiling fan were on dimmer switches. They had a combination of traditional and halogen lights. The TV was not flat screen, but it was newer. The small refridgerator and safe were in the closet which made it a bit cramped, but we had no problem working around it. The bathroom was clean. The ocean was even visible from the balcony. We booked the room through AAA with budget in mind, so it was much nicer than we expected. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better than this place.”
Reviews.Author: the_woman_n_black
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We also stayed at Kona Village on the big island for a few days (you can see my raving review of that place too). If I had it to do over, we would have spent all of our time there, and none of it at the Kaanapali. This place was packed. The service was mediocre at best. Complimentry is an unheard of word at this place. We got the "romance package" which among other things included bottled water, a picnic lunch, and a rental car for the duration of our stay. Parking was not included (free car, and $9 per day parking?) You had to go down to their convenince shop to get your bottled water, because I guess it's too inconvenient for them to bring it to your room? They had two ancient computers for general use that charged by the minute for use, seriously tacky. The place was kind of run down, and our room smelled funny.
