I'm not a snobby a person, but I don't know how to put this without sounding snobby; the bar...was kind of low class. The people all seemed really trashy. It made me think I was at a local dive bar, except there was a pool and we were a few hundred feet away from the beach. It was amost disturbing how trashy some of the people were, considering how much it costs to go on a Hawaiian vacation. The beach was beautiful, but packed. The snorkelling was good, but you would physically run into people because there were so many people snorkelling. The food was ok. Breakfast was a huge buffet. They offered you a menu as well, but if you had a 'free breakfast' package, the vouchers were only good for a certain dollar amount. Almost everything on the menu was more than the vouchers amount. They had no fine dinning option, so you had to go elseware if you wanted a decent meal. I highly suggest Sonz at Swan Court in the Hyatt Regency; considered one of the most romantic restaurants in the world. Don't walk though - it's about 25 minutes up the beach. All and all, if you want a quiet, relaxing vacation, I don't know if this is the spot for you. If you're looking for something fairly cheap and don't mind a lot of people around you, then give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Maui - culture heritage hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoumyaM
Reviews.Content: The Hula Dance, the kukui Beads, the traditional welcome and good bye and the Tiki-bar. Don't miss them

Reviews.Title: “A non-smoking room does mean you will not be smoking.”
Reviews.Author: DynamicDuo2007
Reviews.Content: TThe ocean front rooms are most expensive, gorgeous, right overlooking the water...but watch out for the smoker's paradise that may engulf you while you sit on the lanai of your NON-SMOKING room. The hotel allows smoking in the Kauai bldg on the first and sixth floors--so any floor in between is sandwiched in smoke, unless you keep your lanai doors closed and do not actually use your lanai. If you want a truly non-smoking room and lanai, you will need to stay in the Molokai bldg, which is less well appointed: only three floors high; no elevator, only stairs; and no bathtubs, only showers. Why the management penalizes non-smokers in this way I do not understand. I guess because smokers can't climb stairs?? Why should we have to drag our beach equipment and a toddler up three flights to preserve basic health? According to the front desk, it is because many of the people who stay in this resort are smokers. I much prefer the smell of the ocean and the tropical flowers to the smell of cigarettes, and with a child with asthma, a smoking environment doesn't just stink, it is dangerous. Native Hawaiians didn't smoke tobacco, or suffer most addictions of modern society, so I would urge this "most Hawaiian hotel" to reconsider their smoker-friendly policy. Despite their great location, they have lost our business.

Reviews.Title: “Best Anniverary Ever”
Reviews.Author: Susan3027
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from another fabulous week at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. This time we celebrated our 37th Wedding Anniversary. It's so nice to return year after year and see the same friendly faces in the lobby behind the desk, the same waiters and bus boys, the same cocktail waitress, the same house keeping staff and of course the wonderful Guest Services Agents. Malihini is always there to greet us when we arrive. It truly feels as if "we've come home". This year we stayed in the Lanaii Wing. It was lovely. The room was spacious and the beds were very comfortable. One of the best things about the hotel are the grounds where you never feel crowded and there are enough plummaria trees for everyone to sit under if they want shade. Your location on the beach is one of the best with snorkeling and other activities right there. Once again, Maholo for making our Anniversary memorable. Susan & Hugh Clarke San Clemente, CA

Reviews.Title: “Ants”
Reviews.Author: lovelandgirl
Reviews.Content: We were there durring renovation, so I wont judge the hallways and elevators, but there were ants in mine and my moms room! They sent somone to spay for my mom, and left her there... I had my 1 year old with me so they did change our room. My nephew was also with us and they gave him a room overlooking a dumpster and I hear it smelled bad. While we booked as a group our rooms were not together, in fact they were not even on the same floor. The beach it was on had some pretty hard waves rolling in and for me I would love it but for the baby not so much,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaydoh9
Reviews.Content: It may not be the most posh hotel, but for the money you cannot beat this hotel! This is my fifth time in Maui and this was by far my favorite place. I stayed here for 10 days and the only thing it was lacking was a gym, but there is one right up the street. Was upgraded to a nice pool/ocean view room with a large Lanai'. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: augerAustinTX
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at KBH in two years. Best location, best amenities, best value. It fits our needs perfectly. We don't look elsewhere. BTW, this year, we got a partial ocean view which is well worthwhile. We also rented a cabana on the beach which gave us the shade we needed. The only thing we'd like to see is more healthy options at the Tiki grill.

Reviews.Title: “Grows on you!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiansuperman
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because the website said - 'Most Hawaiian hotel in Hawaii'. When we reached there, my first impression was that i should have booked sheraton (next building) instead. If you are expecting a posh building with luxury rooms with a modern look; this may not be the right place. You get a regular looking comfortable room, with a hawaiian imprint wall paper, and some hawaiian paintings. There is no room service offered.The restaurant,bar and food are ok (had very limited vegetarian options; but they worked out something for us!) There is only 1 pool for the whole resort, which is smallish. However, over the next few days, the place really grew on us. The room and bed were actually very comfortable, the location at the beach was perfect. Every evening was filled with lovely hawaiian songs and hula dance, and it really removed any tiredness we had during the day and was very relaxing. They have lot of hawaiian activities going on everyday, and i learned lei making from a very patient and sweet teacher. The songs and the activities really made it a different experience from a regular resort. The welcome breakfast is not as big a deal as it sounds. On the last day, we were bid farewell from the hotel staff and presented with a handmade lei. It was a touching moment, and really made our last day very fulfilling and pleasant. Pros: - Very homely and comfortable feel - Lovely live hawaiian music and dance every day - Hawaiian activities for both adults and children - Shoreline is beautiful - Very helpful staff Cons: - Doesn't look modern (as people may expect from resorts). - Looks like a very old building, can do with repainting. - Food and restaurant is ok (Based on vegetarian meals only). - Small swimming pool - Spa not very good - Parking was 9$ per day - Had to rent cabana at 21$ for half a day

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: eagles54
Reviews.Content: I returned as a guide for a tour group for the 5th year. I am always so excited to tell the people about this hotel and all attention and love we receive while staying there. They are friendly, provide information for daily activities, a welcome breakfast to familiarize us with the island, the music each evening out in the courtyard, the lei send off our last day!! It is like coming home to be greeted and recognized each year. What a wonderful staff and place to call home for our stay in Maui!!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Loveland, CO and Mt. Vernon, IA
Reviews.Title: “A Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: BobandSusan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel from May 31-June 3. Accommodations were excellent, ranging from the room to the location to the grounds and amenities itself. Each detail deserves examination (with the realization all things cost money in Hawaii): The hotel staff was beyond efficient, they were gracious. The facility itself was well-kept, beautiful and comfortable. The location was supreme, as we snorkeled near the coral reefs, played in the ocean, and spent leisure time walking to the nearby Whaler's village. The magic show and meal was a hoot, a bargain for the money indeed. The art vendors were not necessarily affiliated with the hotel, but came by invitation. They told the story of the locals. Above all, the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel strives to preserve the Hawaiian dance, language and culture that unfortunately is being stolen over these years. Yes, we were guests, but we felt at home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dm120233
Reviews.Content: This is our family's 2nd time to stay at Kaanapali - and we LOVED it! This hotel is for those looking for a great location, comfy rooms, very friendly staff, affordable prices and an overall relaxing vacation. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. There is a nice sized patio on the partial ocean view rooms (worth the extra cost). There is minimal maintenance going on around the hotel, and they always do the work quietly during the day so as not to disturb you. The grounds are meticulously kept up and tended to every morning. The smell of fresh flowers and the ocean are everywhere! There is a grill and a bar located by the pool. The grill has some of the best turkey burgers and pizza around - all at affordable prices. The main reason to stay at this hotel is the location! It is is about a 30-45 min. drive from the Kahului airport to this hotel, depending on traffic (avoid rush hour when locals are finishing work). The hotel is right on the beach, so within 2 mins anywhere at the hotel you are on the beach. The water is crystal clear and not too crowded. The hotel also offers a free "orientation" breakfast. This was a great way to see what the hotel offers as far as activities. The TOP thing I recommend: take the surfing lessons!!! It is offered through Kaanapali but is run by the Westin - which is 2 hotels over (only a 5 min walk). The lessons were fantastic - great instructors - and it was our favorite thing to do! Can't recommend enough. There is also a magic show put on by the hotel, called Kupanaha. It was a great magic show! It's great for all ages, and isn't too "childish" or too "adult" either. The magician is really good - worth doing while you're at the hotel. There is a small group of shops and restaurants - called "Whaler's Village" - which is about 5-10 mins walking from the hotel. It has some great restaurants - try Leilani's (eat upstairs for fancier eating and downstairs for beach views and a casual menu). Also, go to Cheeseburger in Paradise in Lahaina (a town about 10 min drive from hotel - to get there act as though you are driving back towards the airport and you'll see it within 5-10 mins) on the right hand side. It is a burger place (kind of like In & Out Burger) but with great views and delicious food. Finally, the staff were WONDERFUL at Kaanapali. Special kudos to Mikala for always being around and helping out, even on his days off! The hotel is touted as the "most Hawaiian hotel" and they offer free classes (ie: lei making, ukulele lessons, etc.) My favorite was the ukulele lessons - no experience needed! The classes may sound cheesy, but there's always a group of people doing it and it's a blast. I can't emphasize enough what a GREAT hotel this was. Our family will come back to Maui, and we will stay here again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Motel quality disguised as "Maui's Most Hawaiian"”
Reviews.Author: DollDesert_CA
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews, we were not expecting "luxury" but the KBH is nothing more than a motel with a lot of hype about being Hawaiian. We arrived about 45 minutes before the check-in time of 3:30pm and were told that our partial ocean view room in the Maui wing was not ready as it still needed to be "inspected". That did not seem unusual until we noticed that many others who arrived after us were being checked in immediately. At 3:30pm, I asked why so many other arriving guests were immediately checked in and what was the nature of this "inspection". What a suprise, our room was now available! Based on the previous reviews we inquired about any construction and we were told that the room had been remodeled. It was very typical of a motel quality room. The king size bed was covered with a well worn, faded, Hawaiian fabric printed bedspread. The other furniture was modest to say the least. The sheets were totally too small for the king size mattress and there was no fitted sheet. Every morning we woke up to the sheet off the mattress rolled in a wrinkled mess. Also, they use a blanket type mattress pad that also is not fitted, so it was very hot and bunched up with the ill fitting sheets. Two days before our check out there was a message on our phone that the pest control inspectors were going to be doing their "ongoing" inspection and they wanted access to our room. We had not seen any evidence of bugs or other pests and since we both suffer from allergies, we declined the inspection. The air conditioner broke down and could not be fixed until the next day as another message said that they needed parts that were not available on the island. The breakfast buffet was included in our package. There is a large selection and it was buffet quality food. One day I ordered off the menu as they allowed a $14.00 credit if you did not want the buffet. The ala carte prices are expensive so I ordered the waffle which cost my entire credit. It appeared fine but after one bite I realized there was something wrong. I sent it back and the server told me that she had the chef try it and he confirmed that the batter had gone sour. The buffet is at least fresh as it appeared that most guests had the breakfast vouchers and ate the buffet food. Anything else could be risky. The grounds are maintained by a crew that every morning trim and rake the fallen flowers. However, the area is in much need of repair with the cement cracked and well worn. The Tiki bar has a daily special. One day we went for a drink when the nightly entertainment was about to start. There were some "regulars" who asked the bartender to play rap music in a boombox. We decided to walk to one of the other hotels to enjoy a drink and entertainment. Don't be fooled by the "most hawaiian" hype. All of the hotels in the area have nightly free entertainment in a much more comfortable, relaxing setting. The staff did not seem overly friendly, nor were they unfriendly. Just like any other hotel, they all wear hawaiian print clothing and say aloha. The claim of "Maui's most hawaiian" is nothing more than a marketing strategy. It is an effort to create the illusion of Old Hawaii when the reality is that the KBH is in need of a major facelift. Although it is certainly cheaper than any other hotel in the area, we did not feel it was a value. Our experience is that we did not pay much but we certainly did not get much in terms of quality or comfort. We would not recommend the KBH and will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Strongbow3
Reviews.Content: The staff is the friendliest, the Tiki Bar is so much fun, the location is fantastic! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great price”
Reviews.Author: codemonkeyken
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui and our travel agent recommended staying here. We trusted her judgment and we were glad we did. They really emphasize the Hawaiian culture and you can't help but be enchanted by it all. I had reads the reviews of KBH before we went and so I knew what to expect. Still, we were very pleasantly surprised by the level of service we received. We thought all the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. They all said hello whenever we passed them. Our room was awesome. Some call them dated but we thought it was very Hawaiian. It overlooked the lawns and the pool but it was very quiet most of the time. The only complaint was that we could hear people in the hallways sometimes whenever they were being very loud. A bonus of our room was that we could watch and listen to the nightly hula shows from our balcony. Overall, I would recommend the KBH for anyone who would like a nearly authentic Hawaiian experience.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok”
Reviews.Author: mishajmo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the price and the reviews. I wish I could of switched with the last person and stayed at the Sheraton. This place is in serious need of an update. The staff was ok, but nothing above and beyond. The guy who checked us in gave us poor directions to our room and nobody offered to help with luggage. The rooms have thin walls and I was able to enjoy my neighbor brushing his teeth every morning. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for the buck. Prime West Maui Location. A bit different...”
Reviews.Author: sivadyert
Reviews.Content: First thing, is keep in mind that my ratings, and certainly those of others on this site, are based largely on 2 factors which are keeping the ratings high: 1. location, 2. price. I picked this hotel because 1. it was rated high on TripAdvisor, 2. the location seemed excellent--which it is, and 3. the price was by far the cheapest in the area, and overall one of the cheapest throughout Maui. On the negative side, staying at KBHotel is like going back in time. The buildings are older--some of them quite old (mine had no elevator), the TVs are CRT style, and not flat screen (if you came to Maui to watch tv, get a life), nothing looks new quality-wise either. The rooms could use an update and at least some maintenance. The parking lot was a long walk from my building, plus I had to drag my luggage up 2 flights of stairs to get to the 3rd floor. If I had paid anything but the cheap 150ish bucks per night, I'd be upset at this point. HOWEVER, On the positive side, though, this is the closest Hotel to the south side of Black Rock(except for the Sheraton which costs 2x as much), the PRIME location for staying overnight in West Maui, in my opinion. You are practically RIGHT at Black Rock and along the touted beach walk that fronts all of the hotels on this part of the beach. Also, the grounds were particularly nice w/ a more Hawaiian feel than the other hotels--this they like to brag about. The staff were all VERY nice and friendly and accomodating to boot--it felt genuine too. The atmosphere was really laid back here. I think everyone who stayed at this hotel was here to relax and have fun. I've stayed at some of the best hotels around the world--where basic rooms cost $600 or more in some cases. I felt just as comfortable here--like I could be myself and enjoy Hawaii and not have to put so much stock in my hotel. I think sometimes when you stay at a 5 star place, you feel like you should be at the hotel all of the time...this is a stupid reason to vacation in my opinion. Where I live there is a 5 star hotel I go to just to be pampered about once per quarter.... but I save the plane ticket. If you want to enjoy Hawaii and an absolutely fantastic location, this is it. If you're hung up on living a 5 star existence the entire time, book elsewhere. I'd recommend to anyone but rich people who were born with a silver spoon and those who want to pretend. P.S. the evening show featured some good musicians and interesting dancers. Thanks KBH staff!

Reviews.Title: “For a special event, book another”
Reviews.Author: skiuaw
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean enough but thats it. In the mornings at 6am there was no hot water. When I called the front desk I was told to let it run for awhile. I said that I had for 15 minutes and no hot water. The desk said they would report it. 4 days later still had the same issue. The buffet restaurant was closed except for Mothers Day. Then only open for Breakfast. No room service. Front Desk service was almost non-existant, not enough help. Only had one person. The best service was the Valet's. Parking was too high for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: janimmo
Reviews.Content: Apart from having to wait 5 hours for our rooms to be ready, we enjoyed our 2 night stay here, as did other Australians I spoke to. We headed off to the Onion Festival just down the path and had an excellent time while waiting. Had a couple of cheaply priced cockails at the bar and our rooms were ready. Mine was just near a garden wedding, so I was aprehensive, but it turned out to be a fantastic wedding and most house guests participated and applauded when the evening ended! I could have retired, the rooms are very well insulated and quiet indeed. Clean and comfortable but the power points did not work in the bathroom so had to make my coffee in the room, NOT the bathroom. Wondered why my camera battery was flat for the "Road to Hana" Trip!!! The grounds are immaculate, constantly being raked and mown and the pool sparkled. Reception was typically on Hawaiian Time, slow, but friendly as were the porters and housekeeping staff. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fast friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: c_riggs2010
Reviews.Content: The room was great. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly, and lots of help in all areas. Loved the view from our balcony. The only thing I saw that could help a lot of the first time travelers there, is the smoking laws need to be explained the the folks. Letting them know that there are set areas to smoke in, so that when regestering they can request a room close to a smoking area. All other service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki63
Reviews.Content: We're a week back from our trip to Maui and of course, wishing we could turn back time and do it all over. The trip itself was so much fun, and made more so by our choosing to stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. What a lovely place! Our room was comfortable and immaculately clean, overlooking the central courtyard and pool. The grounds were beautiful - I wish I could grow such lovely plants here at home! The pool was refreshing, and we met not one staff member, no matter what their position, who neglected to say Aloha and/or had a smile on their face. Location was GREAT - within walking distance on the boardwalk of Whaler's Village for shopping and dining, walking distance to Black Rock, where we snorkeled with sea turtles right off our own beach. Driving wise it was easy in & out of the parking garage and not too far away from anything we chose to do. We had a delightful welcome breakfast on our second morning there where staff members performed a song/dance & hula, and we were presented with a kukui lei and parting song on our last morning. Each evening we were treated to music that we could choose to listen to in person at the Tiki bar, or, as we often did - listened while relaxing on our private balcony with cool drink in hand as we watched the sky turn blue & turquoise and fade into a star-strewn sky over the Pacific. We attended a wonderful cultural dance/hula/song presentation by local Maui kids on Friday evening. While there were tons of activities offered through the hotel, we were on the run a lot, but my husband did attend a Ukelele lesson one afternoon - which he got a total kick out of. I tried too, but opted to take pictures. Maybe someday we'll return to Maui, and if we do, we'll more than likey be staying at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel again - there's a reason why they tout themselves as Hawaii's most Hawaiian Hotel - and we know why!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: liberrygal
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. The rooms have been refurbished from last time we were here. Our room was very comfortable: daybed and king bed. The room was very clean. We even got champagne and macademia chocolates! The level of service is topnotch. As other reviewers have noted: the staff here genuinely seem to like their jobs and the customer service is excellent. Staff always warmly greeted us as we passed them by in the hallway or grounds. KB is great for families. My family included 3 year old, 8 year old, myself and my hubby. The free classes were great; my niece signed up for a hula class, a few of the lei making classes. While we were at the pool, I overheard a couple guests talking about their experiences staying at nearby hotels. One gentleman said he's stayed at the Sheraton and Hyatt but he and his wife prefer KB over the others. They said the same thing too- that the staff at KB are all so pleasant and helpful. My only minor complaint (and this is very minor) was that we missed out on the farewell lei presentation. A nice man asked us if we were waiting for the ceremony. We said yes, so he gave our kids a couple children's leis and then instructed us to walk out front for the ceremony. We walked outside, waited for 10 minutes but no one brought over our leis. I have to admit, it was a crazy morning: the freeway was closed because of a brush fire so KB was short staffed and a lot of guests weren't sure if they would be able to get to the airport for their departure flights. It was a bit chaotic at the front desk. After waiting awhile, my family and I decided to go back to our room to retrieve our luggage and check out. I was just a bit disappointed because I've heard a lot of cool things about the farewell ceremony. Anyway, hopefully I'll get to experience the farewell ceremony next time we visit KB.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place -- good value”
Reviews.Author: Kawena
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Maui Marathon. We got a free room upgrade without asking. The staff were all very nice and helpful. We loved the large lawn surrounding the pool and noticed that many local families (perhaps relatives of employees) enjoyed it too, which gave it more of a park-like atmosphere than a typical resort.

Reviews.Title: “location and value”
Reviews.Author: martybiscuit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best value of all hotels on this stretch of beach. The location is perfect. Great snorkeling just minutes away at Black Rock. Sunsets are fantastic. Lahaina is just three miles south for shopping and funky eats. There are good restaurants at this and nearby hotels. We drove to Hana for the day, not to be missed. The Ka'anapali area is the best area to stay in on Maui. It's all about location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful location - right on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: TineeCarr
Reviews.Content: This hotel prides itself on being friendly and welcoming and it certainly is. The staff were pleasant and accommodating and seemed to enjoy working there. We had paid extra for a beach front room which was certainly worth it for the view alone (see photo). It was such a joy watching the sun set after the hustle and bustle of Los Angeles, our previous stopover. Our room was of reasonable size for three people, clean with extremely comfy queen size beds. Bathroom was well equipped, powerful shower and fresh towels daily. The gardens leading down to the beach are beautiful with picnic areas and benches if you want to sit and relax outside. It is a short walk from the hotel through the gardens to the beach which when we were there was not at all crowded - sandy beach but some coral/pebbles in the shallow water - swim shoes advised for children. The surf here was fine for adults and older children and possibly snorkeling - my son reckoned he could hear dolphins singing to each other! There is a whale shaped swimming pool in the grounds with sunloungers etc. Beach towels are available to borrow. It is also a short walk to Whalers Village - a shopping mall with restaurants based around newer hotels/timeshares. The nearest town is Lahaina where you can book tours for whale watching. The hotel offers hawaiian dancing every evening and craft activities during the day.It is also worthwhile taking up your first day complimentary breakfast as you will be given a lot of information about what you can do on the island (and what the hotel can arrange for you). Just a few things to bear in mind about this hotel regarding extra costs. Although beach towels are free, any other beach equipment has to be hired from a separate company located near the entrance to the beach - this includes chairs and sushades if you have not brought your own. Internet access costs just under $10 for 24 hours - with an 11 hour time difference with the UK this meant we were paying quite a lot for a limited window of use. There is a charge of $1.50 per day for the use of the safe and car park charge is $9.00 a day. The grill restaruant was closed when we were there, so the only option if eating in was the terrace restaurant which was quite expensive compared to other places in Lahaina, particularly for breakfast (buffet breakfast cost $17.99 per person). This can mount up if feeding hungry teenages! However there is a happy hour in the bar to take the edge off it! The hotel was apparently one of the first to be built in the area and it is showing its age a bit. However, as was described to us when we were leaving, they try to create a living room atmoshphere and in this I think they succeed, as it is cosy and welcoming and noone minds if you wear casual clothes all the time. We particulalry liked the leaving ceremony - first time visitors are given a kukui lei - a necklace of nuts which you are meant to bring back with you on your return visit whereupon you will be given a white nut to show you have returned. Some guests had a number of white nuts on their leis which shows how popular the hotel is! We wished we had spent more time at the hotel, and on the island of Maui in particular, and we certainly plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just got home, wishing we were there already-even with wind!”
Reviews.Author: GenaF
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights at KBH. Unusually windy, sunny, cooler, less humidity than we remembered, dangerous surf advisory each day. The KBH grounds immaculate, beautiful, pool very clean. Did not snorkel, but another guest reported seeing giant turtle (described as 300# size), smaller turtles, some rays, and many colorful fish around Black Rock. They got their snorkel gear at Boss Frogs for $9 for the week. Trilogy on the beach walk at KBH also has gear, including the prescription snorkels but I didn't note the prices. Maui Dive shop in Whalers also has similar wkly deals. We didn't see as many various Dive shop coupon deals as last time. Trilogy did have a nice rental digital underwater camera that you could take as many pictures as you wanted, and they load to a CD for you. The beach has been eroded a bit since we were there two years ago, so there is a gentle drop of about 2 feet from the beach walk level to sand and then the surf. Still plenty of space to lay out in sun, play, and no one tripping over each other. With the wind and higher tide the surf was dramatic and beautiful, especially at sunset. Black Rock area calmer water and folks snorkeling despite the red flags out. The beach area there looked about the same as previously. Whales still visible and playing not too far off shore. We were returning for the second time and took advantage of the Lei Aloha program, which gave us a free room upgrade. Upon arrival we were given 5th floor Kauai wing "ocean view". This was supposed to have ocean view from room, but we had to stand on lanai and look to left to see ocean. We weren't satisfied with this as the web site clearly stated that the ocean view was to be from the room, the partial ocean view from the lanai. We talked with Holly at the front desk, who tried to help us and we looked at 2 other rooms. (An ocean front with two queens, which would have been $40 more a night-wonderful view in Kauai wing-but Hubby wanted king bed. One in Lanai wing, partial ocean view, but musty and not upgraded-was on the floor where folks could smoke on lanai and we started sneezing minute walked in.) We decided to stay in the original room, but I spoke with managers Salome and Kimberly, and they did give us appropriate rate. We ended up being ok with that in the end, as it was so windy we couldn't have sat on the lanai on the ocean front anyway, except for 2 days. We could hear the nightly hula show, which was nice, and see part of it from the lanai. Interestingly, we had to advocate for the "free upgrade" on our other trip as well. Hmm, lesson I learned is: speak up kindly. calmly, and firmly, asking for the manager right away if this is something of importance to you. There was also an offer to move to ocean view in a couple of days in the Maui wing, but we couldn't look at a similar unit. So far my experience there has taught me to view the room prior to moving luggage in. The renovations are nice in the Kauai wing. Hallway and room carpet new, new art. No funky BO hallway smell. This wing has interior corridors. The room ceilings are now all white, with a tray effect, recessed lights. We had king bed, and a day bed in our room plus the usual tables etc. The bathroom in our unit was updated, still a little mismatched surfaces, the counter and sink much lower than we are accustomed to, new carpet, new linens, new furniture-still "island style" and BEST of all a new mattress that was pillow top like and not hard as a board! The room had separate closet from bathroom area, where the fridge and safe are, had a door on it. No drain problems as reported by others. In the Lanai wing the closet/fridge area is open and across from the bathroom sink, with the toilet and tub/shower separate...at least room we had two years ago did. Plenty of space to put everything and then some. KBH Food:The Mixed Plate was closed. Tiki Terrace (where our breakfast vouchers were for) had a order menu and/or buffet. The buffet was a excellent variety of hot foods, fruit, pancakes, pastry assortment, cereals, yogurt, juices etc. I am now addicted to maui onion quiche, maui gold pineapple, and KBH pancakes with macadamias and coconut syrup! We used the voucher as a credit for their Sunday brunch ($20 off $36 per person). Oh my-what a spread! When we go again, if we do this, we will go closer to noon...there was so much variety and food I didn't even try some of everything. We ate at 9 AM and didn't eat the rest of the day, except some fruit in evening. We tried the mahi mahi sandwich at the Tiki Grill KBH, and it was great. The fish was fresh caught. Be aware of this while ordering at Maui restaurants...I found by asking which fish was local caught vs frozen and brought in from Japan and elsewhere. (The salmon, crab,shrimp at the KBH Sunday event very high quality, though). Be aware there are various coupons in the many brochures for the restaurants, venues, entertainment at the airport kiosk and all around. Some places have more than one coupon deal to choose from if you like. In the Whalers one there is a list of offers, not coupons (like 10% off of whole purchase at Crazy Shirt). You take in the little magazine to get the deal. They had vendors daily in the KBH lobby, and then on Tues/Weds had vendors on the lawn. Very good deals for soaps, jewelry, crafts, compared to the malls, and is same things. The craftspeople seemed willing to give "aloha" deal to you to encourage purchase. There was a t shirt booth that had nice quality and unique designs for $18-we didn't barter there though. FYI: there is a little borrowing library of books in the laundry area. We drove to the "north" up past the blowhole, clear to the one lane road. We didn't go the whole way around on it, many beautiful views and micro-climates to see. Went to Lahaina-much warmer there, no wind. Went to the Maui coffee company by the smokestack, had a little tour. Enjoyed Whalers museum more fully. Another day went down to La Perouse bay past Wailea/Makena to the lava fields, beautiful areas-supposed to be good snorkeling but very windy, high surf day we were there. Went to the winery area, upcountry sights, and followed that road pretty far...didn't meet up with the Hana road, but figure were pretty close. Winery tour good. At KBH, ask one of the staff, Sam especially, about the rock game in the lobby-fun. We really enjoyed our stay and relaxed, reconnected with each other, did something new each day from the last visit, and still have new things to try, see, experience for the next time we come. The staff, the grounds, amenities, location, warm, laid -back atmosphere, really make this place special. Visiting with other guests cool too. If you return don't forget your kukui nut lei! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “First family trip- a memorable vacation!”
Reviews.Author: poppasmurf79
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation with a child (15 month old daughter). It was truly a trip of a lifetime and hopefully not the last. We came all the way from New York City and were on a budget. It was our first trip ever to Hawaii and after reading many reviews we decided to go to Maui for our 4th year anniversary. We decided to book our vacation at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel due to its location (near Black Rock), price, and beach quality. Like many of you know, the hotel is located near Black Rock. This is a wonderful spot for snorkeling and spotting sea turtles (we saw 3 at a given time). Having a young child with us, snorkeling through a tour operator was not possible since most of them have an age limit for riding on the boat. This location gave my wife and I the freedom to snorkel while one of us stayed on the beach with the baby. The beach was beautiful and the quality of the sand was very nice (soft to the touch) our daughter loved the taste of it LOL. The sun was pretty intense in Maui so we recommend rash guards if your skin is sensitive. The hotel grounds are kept nice and clean. The 1st floor was undergoing renovations so you could see how outdated the place used to be . We were on the 4th floor which was already renovated. Our room had a partial ocean view (very good one at that). The bed was comfortable and large enough (king size) for the 3 of us. We did request a crib but decided not to use it since the mattress was too soft for our daughters comfort. She did not like it at all and neither did we. It was an old fashioned aluminum crib (outdated hospital style) which we used as a drying/towel rack. There was an extra twin size bed in the room which we didn't use. We did notice that the drain in the bathtub was slow, which we believed was from all the sand that had accumulated in the drain. These were minor issues to us and didn't matter at all. We ate at the Tiki Terrace and enjoyed the food and service. The price was reasonable compared to NYC standards. We had breakfast a couple times at the buffet. Once again the food was good and so was the service. We didn't get to see many shows/ activities since we were always out (car rental is a must in Maui). The housekeeper was very friendly and always cleaned the room when we got back from our daily activities. We do recommend you buy some drinks before heading back to your room since most of the vending machines were out of stock during our stay. There was also a laundry room in the hotel which came in handy for us. Parking was available at a cost ($9/day) and a few shops were available in the hotel grounds. The Whalers Village (shopping center) was a short walking distance away. There you can find restaurants and shops. Overall our trip was wonderful and worth every penny. We definitely recommend this hotel to future travelers on a budget who don't want to skip out on location. The hotel staff was very humble and friendly. They were genuine and didn't come off as people who just wanted a tip. We would definitely come back to this hotel. Other Notes: The weather was great! no rain at all since Maui is dry on that side of the island. We did the road to Hana, Haleakala crater, aquarium, Iao Valley, drove to various beaches, and also attended the Old Lahaina Luau for our anniversary. For those who have young children, it would be wise to locate some doctors who take your insurance , just in case your child gets sick. Our daughter had an ear infection and we found a pediatric facility in Lahaina just prior to our trip. We also recommend NOT to overpack! Toiletries and baby supplies are easily available at Costco, Walmart, and Kmart which are right by the airport. We recommend getting some food at Aloha mixed plate, Paia Fish Market (great fish sandwiches), Alexanders fish and chips in Kihei (great fish tacos) , Da Kitchen at the Wharf (in Front Street, Lahaina), Gazebo Restaurant in Napili (great breakfast and nice view) and for the best shaved ice go to Ululani shaved ice in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian soul”
Reviews.Author: travel2dive
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in the most Hawaiian hotel in Maui. They really treat you like family. They offer free activities for kids & adults, giving kids small gifts and a hawaiian name, which they loverd. We got a great rate on Hotels.com so the value was exceptional. The beach had a surf advisory so it was recommended not to go in the water but we ended up going toward black rock where it was somewhat calmer and where snorkeling is awesome. I went diving to Molokini and ended up seeing pretty much the same thing as at black rock. There were 2 giant green sea turtles, unicornfish, trompetfish, wrasses, butterflyfish, etc..., right off the beach. The hotel also has a small fridge which was a god-sent for stocking liquids. There is a nightly free hula show with music, and the whaler's shopping center is walking distance. I recommend looking first for cheap souvenirs at ABC stores and then for what you don't find there, go to other stores which are much more pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here and will go back”
Reviews.Author: chattygirl7491
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nites at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in Maui and 5 at the Sheraton in Kaui. We did the Drive to Hana again this year, did a Trilagy trip to the crater to snorkel ... I think it called Molikini. In Kaui we took a plane trip over the island for pictures. This was our second time at KBH and I feel certain we will return. They upgraded us for free to a second floor with Part. ocean view and the room was comfie and simple .. similar to a holiday Inn. I don't usually like to return to a place we travel to .. I like new stuff so when I say I'll go back a third time ... it means I really like it. What I like about this hotel is ... it's cost, location, staff are very friendly, the extras (free lei, and free breakfast) and I really like they send me christmas cards every year. One of the main perks is the snorkeling ... It's really close to the best off shore snorkeling I've ever done(black rock at Ka'anapali beach and 15 minutes from Kapalua bay which is even better snorkeling. At black rock I snorkeled and saw lots of fish, huge sea turtles and this time I heard the whales sing to be every day. I will post pics and underwater video so you can hear the whales. I love to swim and snorkel but I don't like fighting the waves. The pool is not huge but it's has a deep end which is hard to find. They also give you a free breakfast everyday which is a huge bargain. We really enjoyed the path that was nice for a nightly stroll and walked alot to the restraunts and shops just 5 minute walk. when it comes to swimming in the ocean I like really tiny qentle waves and thats what we usually had there. As for restraunts we LOVED Hula at the whalers mall just 5 minutes walk ... I'll write a review for them. But once we found it .. we ate there most every meal ... loved it. The food and view were great .. plus free nitely show with singer or hula .. it was fun. Negatives: There aren't many ... since I love it there. This is't the Ritz so don't expect dazzling luxury. It's small and simple but clean and comfortable. The ice machines didn't always work so we had to for severel floor to get ice (not a huge issue). there were TINY ants ... i think they come up the drain so we started closing the drain. I had a great time there and literally teared up when we were closing the door to leave our room.

Reviews.Title: “You've got to go here!”
Reviews.Author: Fendoff
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for years and in all these years , the service has always been great and the facility beautiful! We think it's the best located Hotel,has a super beach and is walking distance to shops and restaurants. We've tried other places and always end up coming back here because it's just the best! Everyone we've told to come here has had the same experience too.....you've got to try it out!

Reviews.Title: “3rd Trip to this Hotel and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: prouddad2
Reviews.Content: Of course you can stay at a fancier Hotel, but the service and the hominess of this place is beyond compare. We are always tearful to say goodbye to the employees who treat us like family. It is small enough so we always know where our children are plus walking distance to so many terrific restaurants. Perfect for families - not for young singles looking to hook up!

Reviews.Title: “Elderly widow warmly recieved.”
Reviews.Author: dasiy04
Reviews.Content: As a elderly widow traveling alone, I would like to point out how great all the staff (not to mention the good accomodations) at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel are. The friendliness here is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was right on the beach and it had gorgeous views of the ocean sunsets.”
Reviews.Author: mullin62
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, but it is about 30 miles from the airport. You have to pay for your own shuttle service, which is about $60-$70 each way. It's well worth it though once you get there, because it has balcony views overlooking the ocean which is only 50ft away. The service and hospitality was great, and it's easy to get directions or information about anything to do or anyplace to go. The rooms were really nice, but they don't have bathtubs in the regular rooms. There is lots to do nearby, and it's all fun. The prices in Maui in general are a bit high, but we felt the expanse was definitely worth paying for how picturesque, relaxing, and fun it is.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: LisleFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: Our family of four with 2 teenagers stayed over Spring Break for a week. We spent a week at this same hotel 2 years ago. You get an excellent value for what you spend at Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH). It is a 3 star hotel that is surrounded by hotels with higher star ratings, and with those higher star ratings typically comes with a higher cost. KBH is an older hotel, and while the hotel has been on a program of updating hotel rooms, it is hard to hide the age of the facility. What you will get is a comfortable room that is clean and for the most part quiet. It is great for a family on the go and where you plan on not spending a lot of time in your room - you are in Maui after all and you can always rest when you get back from vacation. The hotel staff make this a unique Hawaiin experience, we recognized many of the same employees from 2 years ago and many have been with the hotel for 10+ years. Some pointers if you are going to stay at KBH. Unless you positively have to be looking out at the ocean, don't book an ocean view room. You will spend most of your time looking at the ocean when you are on the beach and driving around. You can get a partial ocean view room by reserving a pool view room and then requesting a higher up floor. The room rate is cheaper and you can sit out on your lanai and see and hear the ocean just fine. You will have to pay for parking if you rent a car. There is a parking garage, but just north of the parking garage is a small ground level parking lot that has wider spaces and is right next to rooms and elevators and is more convenient. The spaces in the garage are very tight and we got door dinked on the first day. Lastly, on the last day, our plane left at 7 pm. Check out time is 11 am. We wanted to spend more time on the beach, and KBH offers a hospitality room that is available throughout the afternoon for free. It is a hotel room where you are allowed a half an hour to shower and get dressed - we took advantage of this and enjoyed an extra 4 hours on the beach. You need to sign up for it on the morning that you are checking out - the earlier the better.

Reviews.Title: “We Give the KBH a Solid B+”
Reviews.Author: TomVancouverCanada
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 12 night stay at the KBH. We stayed in the 3 level low-rise building. Pro: -Beautiful spacious grounds -Plenty of lawn chairs available -Shade always available if needed -Right on the beach. Great views -Very friendly and helpful staff. The maids are terrific. -Tiki Bar is a nice place for a drink on a hot day. $4 pints and daily specials. - 10 minute bus ride to Lahaina -4 minute walk to Whalers Village Con: - The low-rise is an older wood building. Nice rooms but not very soundproof. If someone uses the shower in the floors above you...you will know it. Won't be able to hear the TV or converse easily. You can hear *everything* in the next door room. You could carry on a conversation with the people next door quite easily. -Security seems lax, especially on weekends. Groups of kids and vagrants freely wander onto the property and loiter. We didn't think it was that big of deal until I had my backpack stolen one day then rifled through the next day. The first time it was stolen it was done by a group of 4 teens. Two watched while two others grabbed the bag and passed it on to the others (as told to me by an elderly couple that watched). The bag was beside my girlfriend who had her head down (very brazen). After that I started observing the property and noticed a few times loiterers "casing" people to watch their lounging habits. Easily stopped if security made a few rounds and challenged people that were obviously not guests. -My only problem with the service was when I ordered a desert for takeout one night. They mentioned a service charge and I told them it wasn't for room service. They said all takeout gets a service charge ..room service or not. A little disappointing. -50 cents a minute to use the internet. I don't know what they charged for wireless. Overall a very nice place that I would visit again. One thing to mention, and everyone is probably aware of this when visiting Maui. It is not a cheap place. Usually we get a condo with a kitchen to lessen the cost. Our accommodations for this last minute trip was just a hotel room. It is very difficult to find a reasonably priced meal in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Hotel and The Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: familymemories4
Reviews.Content: We just spent 10 fabulous days. We originally booked the Kaanapali beach hotel figuring we wouldn't spend much time in our room. I had read all the reviews and was prepared for the sales pitch to upgrade to the Royal Lahaina. We did upgrade and it was a bit more money but worth every penny. I am only sorry that I had prejudged the resort as a sales scheme, it wasn't. The staff seemed genuine and looked for our best enjoyment with a family of four, two teenagers. The garden suite was huge with a full kitchen and two TV's and two bathrooms and great beds. It allowed us our space so no one got on each others nerves even after 10 days 24/7. The stay was worth every penny and all the staff were great, friendly and personal. We will be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Hotel is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: croppinkimmy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel 12 times since 2002. It is the best vacation place in all of Maui. They have the best staff around. Looking forward to returning again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “What Else Could You Ask For????”
Reviews.Author: RW1963
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous 8 days in Maui.This was our third trip to Maui and 2nd stay at KBH.I am not sure what else that a person could ask for from a hotel If you are looking for a 5 star luxury hotel this is not for you.If you are looking for a hotel at a perfect location that is reasonably priced(for Hawaii) clean with a great staff this is it.When we booked our room I decided to go for ocean front and it is worth every penny.This cost us about what it would for the lowest priced rooms at other hotels in the area.Our room had been newly remodeled and a lot of the rooms are being upgraded now.It was very clean and we were very satisfied.The grounds are beautiful and very well taken care of .Every member of the staff was extremly friendly and I truly believe they try to make your stay as pleasant as possible.In my opinion this place is the only place to stay if you want to stay in the Kaanapali Beach area.We are planning on going back to Maui and we will be staying at KBH again

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time staying on the beach at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Emma0044
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in February in one of the ocean front rooms and it was great! The Humpback Whales could be seen from our Lanai from early in the morning until late afternoon. The breakfast buffet at their Tiki Restaurant was very good and we ate there every morning. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and happy to talk with you and give you directions or whatever you need. We have stayed at this hotel before and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I'd Definitely Come Back Here!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaJGF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. I loved the location and the feel of the place. It felt joyous, friendly and very Hawaiian. The grounds were beautiful, there was a good choice of restaurants, the staff was very friendly and you're only a few steps from the beach and two minutes from the Whaler's Village shopping center with even more great restaurants. The rooms were very attractive too -- and they have lots of activities and a welcome breakfast the first morning to welcome you to the hotel. (There's even a goodbye ceremony for you upon check out!!) The only things I'd say that I didn't like is they do charge for unexpected things... for example, it costs $1.50 per day to use the hotel safe (!), $9 a day for parking and $9 to access the internet in your room. That adds up. But still the price is better than other hotels and the hotel is very charming. So all in all, I would definitely come back here and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location , Rooms are old and musty”
Reviews.Author: FunkyIngy
Reviews.Content: The ka'anapali beach hotel is highly recommended here in trip advisor as a great hotel however I was less than impressed when we arrived. Our room although huge with a big bed , lots of space etc but it smelled musty and damp. A smell I just could not shake throughout our 4 nights there. I am rather sensitive to smells so I was uncomfortable the whole time. I know its not about the room however it is meant to be our home away from home and i don't like a smelly home! sorry about that. Also although there is a huge room there was no kitchen facilities at all. would have been nice to have nice cutlery and glasses , a microwave on another note AT LEAST it was in a great location. If you just want to hang at the beach and have a very quiet relaxing holiday this is for you. Unfortunately hubby and I like the hustle and bustle of waikiki - beach and shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: cathDe
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at KBH on 5 occasions. The staff go out of their way to be helpful. The rooms are comfortable and the veiws are great. You are right on the beach and that is great too. KBH is a short beautiful walk to Whaler Village, we love it there. Also, just a walk down the beach to Black Rock for snorkling. We have recommended KBH to everyone and would never stay any where else on Maui. We went to Maui after 9/11 and the staff has a ceremony for all who are leaving each day It is truely heartwarming. Hoping to return this fall!

Reviews.Title: “Had so much fun”
Reviews.Author: cfnm
Reviews.Content: After getting delayed a day because of snow, we actually got on our way while Hawaii was waiting for a tsunami. Our friends, who were already at the hotel, said the staff was so organized. Phone messages went to all rooms explaining what to do. Hotel - Lobby - nice, low key. vendors every morning selling nice stuff. One elevator was out of service the entire week, ice machines not working on all the floors. First Floor is under construction. No distractions from it. Was surprised they charged $9 a day for parking and another buck and half for the safe. You also had to pay for a chair or lounge on the beach. $10 for so so lounge chair. $31/day for the cool wooden lounge chairs, with pads and little cabana covers. we splurged two days. it was worth it when it started to sprinkle. Rooms - We had a very nice room - Kauai 477. You could lay in your bed and watch the ocean. Room was clean, tub didn't drain properly. They came to fix it - worked for about a day. Bed was very comfortable. Restaurant/Bar - Tiki Restaurant was awesome. Tiki Bar had the best Mai Tai's we had all week. Tiki Grill - try the teryaki burger with grilled pineapple. Mixed Plate out front was great for breakfast. fresh fruit, yogurts, eggs, different breakfast meat every day. the best bread pudding. No inside bar. Bummer the night it rained. Beach/Pool - Not alot of people on the beach because of the cost. The whale action was unbelieveable. take binoculars. Most people took lounge chairs and spread out all over the lawn around the pool and beach. it was quite nice. plumerias blooming. the air had such a sweet smell. Isaiah, who worked for Trilogy Dive Center by the beach, was great. Learned so much from him.... Be careful of rip currents at Black Rock. dangerous the beginning of the week, like a lake at the end of the week. Road to Hana - no more water falls, 7 sacred pools are dried up. it sucked. third time we've done it. never looked like this. Isaiah said a developer snuck in and tapped the water for developing three years ago. There is no island like Maui, where can you see rainbows are one side and whales breaching on the other. It's paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Not so Great Room”
Reviews.Author: mogilvie
Reviews.Content: This hotel does live up to what other reviews have said. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a great location right on Kaanapali beach. The on site Tiki Terrace restaurant is good and decently priced compared to the restaurants at the Whalers Village next door which are more trendy and busy. They cost more but the food is not any better. Your best bet for food is in Lahaina, which is a few minutes down the road, where they have better food at gentler prices in most cases (but not all). I have stayed at other 3* hotels on the Big Island and in Waikiki and I would have to say that this hotel is not up to par with them. Our room was in the "Molokai Wing" and really was at the level of a cheap motel. My wife and I are not picky people but we do like a clean, somwhat current room when paying for a 3* hotel. Our room had not been updated in sometime and the toilet/shower portion of the washroom contained various colours of mold, yellowed caulking, peeling wallpaper and cracked drywall. There were pictures on tripadvisor of one of these washrooms but they seem to have been removed. The bed and the pillows (tiny) were not comfortable and I can sleep on anything. I went to the front desk upon arrival (Thursday) to see if we could be moved to a different room. I was told there would be nothing available until Sunday and to comeback then between 10 & 6. We were not around the hotel on the Sunday and I never heard back from the staff about a room change. I think they are used to complaints about this wing and just try to grin and bear it. They seem to use it as overflow space for when they are most busy. If you do stay at this hotel I would make sure that you are in the newer wing. Otherwise I would recomend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This is the most awesome place to stay - it feels like home to us.”
Reviews.Author: Norwood_10
Reviews.Content: We just spent our fourth time at Kaanapali Beach Hotel - ten glorious days. It is a beautiful hotel and the grounds are magnificent. We love to stay here and the staff go above and beyond. We do not have children with us, but it seems to really cater to families. We plan to go back as often as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: wunderkind1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and paid $132 a night, and for that I'd say it was a great buy. We were given a room with two double beds for the first two nights of our four night stay despite having requested a king, but that was the only hiccup and it wasn't a big deal. I've stayed a few of the placed on Kaanapali beach and this is on par with the lower end of those hotels (the Whaler next door has a very similar level of service). The included breakfast was nice to have available (the coffee is undrinkable however - starbucks is a short drive) and saved us time on early mornings. There is live music in the poolside area at night and it was great - not too loud but we could listen if we opened up the lanai. I'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “I felt at home at the KBH”
Reviews.Author: Donna-VI
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. They truly did make you feel like one of the family. The food was great, lots of choices. The little Deli Store was convenient if you didn't want to walk to Whaler's village for snacks etc. I stayed in the Kauai building and the room was very nice, clean, comfortable. The grounds were large and nicely laid out, there was always a chair available either near or around the pool. There were plenty of shady spots to take a chair to if you wanted to escape the sun. There was always room on the beach if you wanted to sit on the beach. The location right on Ka'anapali Beach was very convenient. Aside from a quick shopping trip into Lahaina - I didn't feel the need to leave the Ka'anapali beach area. There is a lovely boardwalk that covers the whole beach so you can easily walk to other areas like Whaler's Village. The Teralani tour boats pick you up right on that beach so it was convenient for day trips as well. Traveling alone, I felt very safe there. I enjoyed the lei making classes and hula lesson, as well as the evening hula show and Kupanaha dinner show. Overall, I would be very happy to return to the KBH and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “The only Hotel We will Ever Visit Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Linda-Gord
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th trip to Hawaii, and our 5th time staying at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. Our stay, was the entire month of February plus a few extra days. It's a wonderful place, beautiful location and the people who work there are amazing. We have made some great friends, have had even greater times and would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jettajen
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel; it exceeded our expectations and we would recommend this hotel to anyone! We traveled with our 4 year old son and found the property to be a perfect fit for us - from the swimming pool (a large section of the pool was only 2 feet deep which was nice for our son), to the beautiful grounds and the beach just steps away! The staff was very helpful and just wonderful. The room was spacious and was nicely decorated and very clean. The activities on site and the nightly entertainment were wonderful. The buffet breakfast, included in our package was very good and we enjoyed the large selection!! We can't wait to go back!!!We could not have asked for a better hotel for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: haleaka
Reviews.Content: Loved the staff and location. Will definitely stay at this property with my family again. The hotel is 50ish years old and in process of being renovated...we were in a renovated room that looked great. The staff are very friendly and accomodating. The beach is awesome and a quick swim to Black Rock (snorkeling). Whalers Village is less than a 5 minute walk from the property via a ocean front walkway that runs about a mile and a half along Kaanapali Beach. Overall, the hotel is perfectly located for day trips to Hana, Haleakala, north shore, snorkeling and just about anything else you would want to do. If you have kids, they will love the pool - it has a shallow and deep (7 foot) end for all to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sunnytraveller2010
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time with a helpful/caring staff, great Hawai'ian activities on-site, and really enjoyed the Kupanaha magic show with dinner. This was my fourth trip to this hotel and look forward to my next trip. Just sorry that the Mixed Plate is only open for breakfast now.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise - Best vacation ever!!”
Reviews.Author: ahuihoa
Reviews.Content: I have been to many different places for vacations such as Costa Rica, Dominican, El Salvador and Panama but none come close to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in Maui. It is definitely the best value and the nicest location, It is nestled between two high priced hotels that can't hold a candle to Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is on 10 acres. Nobody ever has to go without a lounge chair. You are allowed to pull the chair anywere on the property and there is plenty of sun and shade locations. The adjoining properties only allow people to sit in a small area around their pools in close quarters. The rooms are excellent. The beds are extremely comfortable and provide for an awsome sleep. We stayed in the older wing, and chose to go for the cheapest room known as the Aloha rooms. We had a partial ocean view and had a large balcony. There is not a bad view in the place. The property is beautiful. The hotel is right on the beach. On the other side is a world class golf course and a great view of the mountains. The staff were amazing. I wanted to book an island flight to Oahu. I went to the guest services desk and was met by Malihini Keahi-Heath. She called the airport and within 5 minutes, the flight was booked at a great price. Thank you Malihini....you are awsome!! She was also very informative in all other questions. Our housekeeper, Florita was great too! She gave us excellent information on good places to check out and made sure our room was spotless every day. Thank you Florita!! All the staff members would go out of their way to help out. Everyone is very easy going at the resort. We were awoken early one morning and learned a tsunami was heading our way. There was no panic whatsover from the staff. We were informed every hour on the hour what was going on and were provided clear instructions on the evacuation plan. We were all instructed to go to the 6th floor of the tallest buiding for one hour prior to the tsunami hitting the beach. They brought up chairs and fed everyone lunch (including Maui Gold pineapple). Their calmness rubbed off on the tourists and nobody seemed to panic as a result. Thankfully, there was no damage and a few hours later, we were given the all clear to resume our vacation. Although it is not an all inclusive and it is a bit more expensive to stay there, people can do so on a budget. A refridgerator is provided in all the rooms free of charge. There is an excellent bus system. A bus stop is located 2 minutes from the hotel. For $1 you can get a 10 minute bus ride into Lahaina where you can get your groceries at Safeway. There are two malls there as well. The Whaler's Village is a small shopping mall in walking distance from the hotel. We bought fresh fruit and yogurt from the ABC store and had cheap breakfasts. The Cane and Taro is a restaurant located at Whaler's Village. On Tuesday and Wednesday's if you place your order between 5 and 6 p.m., all food is 50% off. Two of us ate gormet dinners, prawns/ steak etc and paid no more that $20 each and that included a heafty tip. Whaler's Village also has a food court with Mcdonalds, Chineese Food, a pizza place and a sub shop. Another way to dine on a budget. Another great place to eat is CJ's. A short walk up the hill behind the golf course leads to a strip mall. CJ's is like a roadhouse and had great prices. We also stumbled upon coupons from an information booth along the beach which gave us 50% the second entree. The food here is great. The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel also has excellent food but it is a bit more pricey. Probably due to the fact there is a word renowed chef working there. The Tiki Grill has hamburgs, hot dogs , onion rings etc for a reasonable price. The entertainment was fabulous. It is the only hotel that had free entertainment from 6-9 every night. There is music and some hula shows. During the day, the hotel offers numerous activites all geared to demonstrate the Hawaian culture. The beach is awsome. Lots of room for everyone. People were snorkeling by Black Rock while others were boogy boarding. We saw a huge turtle and lots of other marine life in the water right near the hotel. You don't have to pay big $$ to see any of it, its all right there. We also saw countless humpback whales right from the beach (good time to go for viewing whales is in February). Beware thought that the rip tides are very strong. If you are not a confident or strong swimmer, heed the warnings and your stay will be a safe one. The hotel will notify you everyday if there is any warnings or concerns. I do recommend the Atlantis sub. You go down to 130 ft and see a tremendous amount of marine life and a sunken ship. It was an amazing experience. You get on the sub in Lahaina. I don't recommend the taxi's though. Very expensive. You are much better off to rent a car for a few days or take the bus. We brought food and extra clothes but none of it was needed. They have washing machines and dryers available for the guests. Eveyone that stays there is considered family. Upon departing, everyone gets a special lei that is handmade by the staff. If you return to the hotel you bring your lei back and they will add a different nut to the lei. Maui is truly a garden of eden and the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is by far the best place to stay on the island. We look forward to going back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “it's a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: pls610
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place to stay. As it was our first visit to Maui, we were very pleased and happy to stay at this hotel. The people were so friendly and helpful and the location was perfect. The room was very clean and decorated so nice. Everyone went out of their way to make this a memorable vacation. We will definitley go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel staff ALWAYS went above and beyond to make our stay the best ever!”
Reviews.Author: KeenaNorthDakota
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maui for the first time for the purpose of rest and relaxation. The staff at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel were so friendly and always ready to please that we felt like we were leaving family when it was time for us to leave. I'm talking about EVERYONE from Guest Services to the front desk to the bartender to the maid!!!! We would highly recommend this Hotel as the best one to stay at in Maui. The rooms were nice, easily accessible with a great view. The location was very good, close to beach, shopping and dining. GO - HAVE A WONDERFUL TIME!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: bhayes
Reviews.Content: We stayed just two nights, were over seeing family from the Big Island. Room rate was wonderful. We arrived 2 hours ahead of check in time, our requested king non smoking in the least expensive rooms wasn't available yet, we were given an option for our bags to be held, or to take a room with 2 doubles with an ocean view right away. We took the ocean view and loved it, looked down the beach to Black Rock. Room nicely done and spotlessly clean. Grounds beautiful and staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Maui'd”
Reviews.Author: mountain-lowlander
Reviews.Content: As a couple in their early 30's, we paid for our wedding. We chose the KBH for it's reputation of being the "most Hawaiian hotel" and the value. The grounds were groomed every morning. The staff were VERY helpful. Our partial view room was clean & had a great view (we sat on the lani every night listening to the band). It's very close to Whaler village shopping, dining, and can easily catch a bus to Lahaina. While at the Old Lahaina luau, an newlywed couple (2nd marriage) voiced the numerous problems they experienced at the more expensive Hyatt. As a very particular traveler that expects the best for the value....the KBH did exceeded all expectations!.

Reviews.Title: “Great first impression!”
Reviews.Author: jbsom20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon. We had never been to Hawaii before and we really enjoyed this hotel. The atmosphere was amazing. We were right on the beach, the view from our hotel room was great, there was entertainment every day and great shopping along the ocean front. We had the chance to explore and eat some wonderful cuisine and take in some of the local shows as well. For being our first time in Hawaii and the first island we stopped at...we truly had a great first impression and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Daughters Wedding”
Reviews.Author: LindaK27
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, one of the oldest on the island of Mauai. Had a great time all personnel were kind and helpful. Had the wedding on the beachfront. Fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A paradise away from home”
Reviews.Author: Nanooser
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a truly Hawaian experience with the staff going out of their way to make one feel genuinely part of their family.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Personified”
Reviews.Author: kjnazz
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to the Hawaiian islands. Our first trip to this hotel was back in 2000. We had a condo in Kihei to use at no cost to us for two weeks. After a few days in Kihei we decided we needed to reconnect with the "Aloha" spirit of Hawaii. It was feeling like an average vacation which was not why we came to Hawaii. We called the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel reservation desk and were pleasantly surprised to be able to make reserv for 5 days. We stayed in the recently renovated section of the hotel, were upgraded to ocean front view as returning guests along with many other perks. We were so completely happy with our stay at this hotel. Calling it a hotel is an understatement. It truly does feel like home. This truly is the MOST HAWAIIAN HOTEL. This hotel makes you feel part of their "Ohana" or family. They share the true Hawaiian spirit and culture with you, not the tourism side that most other hotels give you. They have local true Hawaiian dance throughout the evenings. We are already planning on taking family and friends with us for our next visit "back home". We want to share our Hawaiian Ohana with our family back home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ronaldw703
Reviews.Content: I booked the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for 12 nights for my honeymoon. This was my 5th trip to Hawaii (Maui) and the hotel was very nice. This is an older hotel located between more upper class and newer hotels. It's a perfect location because you can walk to the Whaler's Village to shop and dine. The Kaanaplai Beach Hotel staff were very pleasant and accomodating. The rooms I found to be very clean, as was the property outside. The maid service was good and the rooms cleaned as expected. The breakfast buffet was good, but the same food is served everyday with no variety or changes. The breakfast buffet was convenient and it was included in the price of my stay. The hotel offered Lei making lessons and hula lessons, among other free activities. My wife enjoyed these classes. The food in the restaurant at dinner was excellent and priced good, we ate there 4 days out of the 12 we stayed there. Overall, this is not a high class hotel. It's location is a plus and the staff is friendly. The beach is excellent and there are many activities available on the hotel site such as booking excursions. I would stay here again and recommend it to my friends. Do not expect Ritz type service or first class food. This is an affordable hotel in a great location. One negative thing to say is that the noise from ajoining rooms can be disheartening. When I wake in the morning and can hear the person in the next room taking a shower it loses some appeal to the honeymoon. The plumbing is loud when your neighbor showers. A sign of an older property. Expect to be charged for daily parking and for using the safe in the room. I find the fee for the in-room safe a real negative.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: mamaanjeli
Reviews.Content: We booked a courtyard room on expedia but end up with an fantastic ocean view room. Not ocean front, but I can see the ocean and the beach from our bed. We also have mountain view on the other side which is very nice as well. The beach is literally 20-30 steps away from our room. We stayed in the Lanai wing. We were on the 6th floor and can see whales blowing and breeching from the balcony. It was terrific. The only real issue I have with the room is that even though the building itself is non-smoking; you can smoke in the lanai. Being on the top floor, sometimes we can smell smoke inside the room if we leave the balcony door open. The staff is friendly but really not any friendlier than other hotel staff I've encountered outside of Hawaii. I didn't really get any of the Aloha warm fuzzies from them. Maybe because I was expecting more. But as I said, they are friendly and helpful. The Friday night Hula dance show is wonderful. My kids went to all the hula shows and really enjoyed them. They also went to the lei making and hula classes. Great place for a family. The pool is okay but again the beach is only steps away. Snorkeling is also great at Black Rock (especially for beginners) and it's less than a quarter mile from the hotel. The other hotels in the area are definitely a lot fancier than KPH. We plan to come back to Maui soon (2011 I hope) and would definitely consider the KPH again.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but clean and staff is outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganSteveB
Reviews.Content: If your looking for the luxury experience--don't stay here. If you want a clean room on Ka'anapali Beach with attention to Hawaiian culture--this is your place. Rooms are dated and need to be upgraded. But they are very clean and the food and service is impeccable. Good stay for the price and I would stay here on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: palmtrees001
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at KBH and this time I brought 20+ family members. Everyone had such a great time. The location is top notch.
