Having an awesome beach right outside your door is the best. Snorkeling at Black Rock is awesome. Being on a boardwalk that leads to Whalers Village (shops & restaurants) is so convenient. The hotel employees are all very friendly & helpful. The grounds are beautiful. The hotel activities and nightly entertainment are a plus. The rooms are clean & more than adequate. I really cannot say enough about this hotel. If you are looking for a beautiful location to enjoy one of Maui's best beaches and stunning sunsets, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ehjWnc
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely helpful and fun. They have the best beach and snorkeling on the island without all the snob appeal of the neighboring hotels. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean with attentive maid service. My teenage daughters loved the hotel jewelry store and really got to know the owner well. The life sized checkers board was also a big hit. I have recommended this hotel to several friends already and would love to return myself

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hatethis
Reviews.Content: This hotel had really good reviews which is why I booked it. It was old, (which is why it was very quiet and uncrowded) . I will have to say it was clean and well kept. The beds were not comfortable nor the pillows. The restaurant food was awful. We usually stay in really nice hotels and this was such a disappointment. The reviews talk about how friendly the staff is. I did not find that at all. The only friendly ones were the valet, which we tip very well. The concierge booked a helicopter ride for us, but he was a real jerk about it and acted if we were bothering him when we asked questions. The soda machines never worked and they ran out of beach towels. If you like nice hotels with nice rooms restaurants don't stay here. If you want just a cup of coffee in the morning, there is a convenience store out front to get it with fake cream. NO ROOM SERVICE EITHER!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, affordable hotel on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: rkatao
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a very good experience at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. They offer several different package deals and ours was called Leap into 2010. It included a partial ocean view room and the breakfast buffet each day. Partial ocean view is a little subjective as the ocean could only be seen from the balcony. I don't know if the package limited us to the Molokai wing but this is the oldest portion of the motel and it shows. There are no elevators in this wing but the building is only 3 stories tall. The shower and toilet were in a very confined portion of the bathroom. The grounds of the hotel are very nicely maintained and the hotel is located close the Black Rock to the north and Whalers Village to the south. The hotel is much more affordable than the other big name motels on this section of the beach. The staff was very friendly and and mostly local Hawaiians. There was hula and music each night near the Tiki Bar. They offer daily Hawaiian activities and a very good magic show in the showroom.

Reviews.Title: “The Fines Stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaBlues
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the lovely KBH. We will never book elsewhere on Maui (though we have in the past). The staff is local, gracious, and warm. During this holiday, we awoke to the carols of the itinerant staff - a holiday treat! The ground are more spacious than any hotels', a grand but subtle entrÃ© to the finest beach in Maui. You will NOT find congested rows of chairs and loud, presumptuous guests. A quick drive to Fleming Beach and the surf. And very quick (8 minute) drive to Lahaina and you have access to shops and great fare. Don't been fooled, this is not a Hyatt, Marriott, etc. Not a 5-star you could be in anywhere in 100's of hotels anywhere. This is quintessentially Maui. Rooms are very generous. Well appointed. Well updated and maintained. The breakfast menu and buffet are an excellent value. Fresh and varied. Pool-side food is average. But Lahaina is replete with GREAT fare and venues. Head to town for the evening and, upon your return to KBH, you will find a nice treat and a turned-down welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Some good points, some average points, but would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: ilovefeta
Reviews.Content: Again after much deliberating and a wonderful stay in Waikiki, we were pretty excited about relaxing in Maui. We had a private shuttle out to KBH where our driver raved about how friendly the place and the staff were and that they'd know our names by the end of day one. We arrived and well, after hearing things like that and just staying at Hotel Renew where the staff were amazing, we were pretty underwhelmed. The staff were just average, nothing special and no they didn't know our names by the end of day two. In saying that, it wasn't a make or break for the holiday! Rooms were older but still spacious and very comfy. Absolutely loved our view - we booked a partial ocean view and the view was a lovely view of the hotel grounds and out to the ocean. You could sleep with the balcony door open at night and the nicest breeze and ocean sounds would come through the door it was lovely. The hotel grounds were actually my favourite part about the hotel, large gardens where you could pull up a chair under a tree and read all day in peace if you wanted too. Food at the hotel restaurant was average and the little food hut near the pool was over priced and quite frankly the food served there was awful. Not to worry though because Whaler's village was the shortest walk away (I was expecting further...maps!) and Cane and Taro had the beeeeeeeeeeest food, we ate there four nights out of our 8 night stay! I hope this review doesn't sound too negative, but wanted to be honest. It was still a really relaxing stay, the hotel grounds impressed me so much all the other stuff didn't bother me much. I would stay here again but with realistic expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Paid for a lux hotel New Year's Eve - got a motel.”
Reviews.Author: DianaBayArea
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights in room 545 with beautiful ocean view. Room tidy + shabby + unsanitary. Beware. Hotel lobby like a turkish bazaar. KBH is a run down motel sitting on gorgeous grounds & beach near Black Rock--great snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Will Work for Plane Tickets
Reviews.Content: I almost gave this place 3 stars but it has a things going for it: the price, the location, and the staff. The hotel itself is a little shabby, eg. chipped paint, broken bathroom door, a little loud - but you simply CANNOT beat the price for the location. The hotel is right in the middle of Kaanapali Beach and walking distance to bars, restaurants, and shopping. Considering we were at the hotel only to sleep, it was fine. Anywhere else would be double or triple the price. The staff is really friendly and accommodating. The brought me a large fruit plate when I ordered the small one, didn't charge for coffee at breakfast, helped us book a shuttle to the airport last minute - nice stuff like that. The bar isn't so great. Go next door to the Sheraton for drinks and sit at the bar there for sunset - great view and great happy hour. This is definitely more of a "families from the Midwest" place and not so good for couples. I still think your best bet in this part of Maui is a condo with a kitchen since the restaurants are generally waaaaay overpriced for the quality of food you get. And that is coming from a San Francisco foodie who will pay stupid prices for a really great meal.....

Reviews.Title: “Almost makes Kaanapali prefered Maui destination...”
Reviews.Author: OriginalMurph
Reviews.Content: We normally stay in Napili bay area when we visit Maui, but our favorite place (Napali Shores) was all booked up, so we looked at Kaanapali area where hotels were available (this was week bracketing Christmas). We stayed in Kaanapali area (opposite end of the beach and boardwalk) once before and I was not that impressed with the crowds or the snorkeling. My stay at this Hotel has revised my opinion significantly. It is an older hotel and is very affordable, but is extremely clean, the staff is superb, the drinks at the Tiki bar are priced reasonably with generous pours on the Mai Thais, and the food in the restaurant was (for Maui) inexpensive and well prepared when we ate here. Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately we are back home...”
Reviews.Author: WesRichmondVA
Reviews.Content: My fiance (now wife) and I just got back on 1-5-10 from a two week stay in Maui at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We got married at the hotel on their site the Naupaka Lawn at the beach. It was a very serene setting with black rock in the back ground. We were so pleased with their wedding coordinator, Madalene, who helped us arrange our wedding while we were still in RIchmond VA before our trip. She recommended a few ministers and the one we picked was absolutely wonderful. Reverend Laki is incredible and will make your day if you are getting married in Maui. The staff at the hotel were so friendly and hospitable. They really make you feel like you are at home away from home. The hotel is located in Kaanapali, which is very convenient to shopping, etc. in Lahaina. Our room was always cleaned by our excellent room attendant Mi Nan, who was so friendly. The view from the 6th floor in the Maui wing was beautiful, a nice view of the grounds beneath directly out to the ocean. We went to the magic show at the hotel and would highly recommend to everyone to see it. The magician, Jodi, was very funny as well as the magic show. We also ate dinner one night at the hotel restaurant, Tiki Terrace. We were very impressed with the food. I had lobster and my wife had hawaiin beef kabobs. The beach in front of the hotel was always nice and never crowded. Plus, you can walk to black rock in a few minutes, which has excellent snorkeling. Overall, very good value for the money. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful wonderful gem of an hotel”
Reviews.Author: emah
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at KBH = I stayed here back in 2007 and I loved it then too; since I was here last the Kauai wing (where I stayed both times) has been renovated and the new room furbishments are wonderful: new carpet, new furniture - incredibly comfy bed. It was a real treat to open my door and discover a room that was furbished better than my room next door at Sheraton (where I stayed for the first few days of my trip, due to a really fantastic deal which made it only a little more expensive than the KBH (instead of 3-4x as much) for the first few days of my trip. The staff are as fabulous as ever, and because this time around I was there peak season (Christmas-New Year) instead of low season (late January) everything was open - the grill, the pool bar etc. I went out twice with Trilogy - this time making it to Molokini which was fantastic, and up to Honolua Bay, and I also got up at 1.45am to head up to Haleakala Crater for the sunrise which was simply astounding. KBH charges for internet ($10 a day) because there is no resort fee, but the first time I turned my computer on, my bluetooth whatsit showed that there were about a dozen unlocked networks floating around, so in the event I didn't pay for the internet the whole week - an unexpected bonus. I think KBH is just a fantastic hotel and I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A great palce for the whole family to experience Hawaii.”
Reviews.Author: Jimswdy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for three consecutive New Years weeks and we love it there. The hotel has an ideal location with shopping and restaurants nearby, as well as a short drive to Lahaina for even more of the Hawaiian experience. Our grandkids are kept busy with fun programs, and there are cultural seminars for the adults. Two world class golfcourses are walking distance away. Awesome snorkling is right up the beach at Black Rock. You can watch whales breach from the beach or go on one of many tours with "Trident." The beach and water is beautiful and as safe as ocean beaches can be. The hotel features all the amenities one could wish for, and the staff really share the "Aloha Spirit." We'll hopefully be back for many New Years to come!

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is ........Wow!”
Reviews.Author: LandMTing
Reviews.Content: We had our honeymoon here at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. We had booked the trip months in advance and were very excited about going. We were in Maui 6 days and 5 nights. When we drove up the Hotel didn't jump right out at you but it had a certain cozyness about it. the minute we saw the gardens and native plants and bird life we knew we were in the right place One of the most relaxing things we experienced while staying, was the incredible sounds of the native birds. While the birds were quite vocal they were very relaxing and interesting to listen too throughout the day. Although we didn't play we thought the checkers board with the coconuts was a noval game. . The rooms were being remolded and our room smelled new and looked new as well the bed was very comfortable. We had a Garden view room but could also see the ocean from the balcony. The weather was very accomidating, we left our sliding door open every night and listened to the surf as we drifted off to sleep. The nightly entertainment was fun. the staff was great very polite and helpful. My wife and I are early risers, often getting up before sunrise. As we sat on the balcony and watched the sunrise with the wonderful coffee provided, we could see the grounds staff picking up the fallen leaves and such making sure the grounds were clean and fresh everyday. The attention to detail was excellent. The food and drinks and the resturantes was very good with good size portions. We went on the Hana tour and horse back riding as well as shopping at Whalers village a short walk away. All in all we had a wonderful time at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and will be returning as many time as possible. The only thing I can think of that could be added is room service, but with room service you would probably not be enticed to go down and enjoy the nightly music at the outdoor theater and meet all the different people visiting, so maybe the lack of room service is by design. The other item that would have been nice is to have the main resturante open a little earlier than six in the evening Either way it really didn't make much of a difference to my wife and I we had a wonderful memorable honeymoon and will be returning the lual at lahani town was wonderful and worth mentioning, a must see to anyone who visitis Being from southern California this is a nice change of pace for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and friendliest hotel in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: ntilmo
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be great value. Clean, spacious rooms with great views, friendly staff always happy to help, delicious breakfasts and more. Could do with being slightly updated soon (flat screens and usable wi-fi in the rooms for example) but anything it lacks it makes up for in charm. Would stay here again any day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,location,fun fun fun!”
Reviews.Author: Dncrgrl012
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 days in October. It was mine and my friends first time to Hawaii! It was a great experience from the moment we checked in until the moment we departed! The room was great we were on the ground floor and looked and saw gardens, pool, bar, and a little bit of ocean! (we had aloha value). Ground floor was great to just walk out and do whatever. We had breakfast in the tiki terrace a couple of times. The 2 ladies that were always in the gift shop when I went in were great. There is a conveince store about a mile or so down the road and we stocked up on some lunch/breakfast items as well as drinks! Fridge was nice and cold! Didn't care for the magic show that much. Vendors in the lobby every morning, bought lots of stuff from the locals! The spa is awesome ladies!!!!!! Tiki bar and grill is kind of expensive but good food none the less portions are huge... Walked down to Whalers Village and they had some good restaurants (try Hula pie if restaurant offers it)... Didn't do any snorkeling at the rock, we had some bad surf a couple of days. Kept a lot of people out of the water, but it was great to see the local kids come out and take advantage of the waves! We did snorkel with the Hula Girl company they go to Honolua Bay (something like that) you can get there by car we later found out, so I would recommend the other place everyone goes to snorkel..... If you have a car when you get to the light for the entrace of all the Kanaapali hotels turn left, you are in for a real treat with all the beautiful views and scenery.... Also go to Iao Needle! That was fun our tour guide took us up there. Did a few of the classes and they were great, did Lei making the last day we left so it was a great farewell touch as well as the lei's they give you at the farewell ceremony.... The crater is cool I recommend going up there, didn't do the sunrise thing (too early) but do take a jacket it is chilly up there! Also we left at 10 pm the day we were going home so we checked out at 12 and then did road to Hana, came back down around sunset with a rainbow in the sky.. Great way to end trip! Overall staff is great, hotel is great, and I love Maui with all my heart, it truly is a different world!

Reviews.Title: “Its great, a few things to know....”
Reviews.Author: FasteddieAZ
Reviews.Content: All the good reviews are accurate. Loved the hotel overall, the food, the shows were free and wonderful, great grounds, excellent location. Couple of things to be aware of; our bed was harder than we were used to (not a Hilton or Marriot bed, thats' for sure). No hot tub or gym (not important to us), ask directly for the free breakfast. EXCELLENT breakfast buffet and I noticed some people had free vouchers and some didn't.. We made our reservations direct. Also, the rate quoted on their confirming e mail didn't match the bill at the end of the stay. This waqs resolved satisfactorlily. They have old computers! Very clean 3 star rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in the world.....”
Reviews.Author: murphysmum
Reviews.Content: I think that we just completed our 10th visit to the KBH...in about a ten year period. We've considered purchasing a condo on Maui, but have decided that we'd never like it as much as simply staying at the hotel. It feels like we're coming home when we arrive in the lobby, always full of tropical flowers,see old friends on the staff, and see the view through the grass, pool and trees to the ocean as we walk to our room. We prefer ocean front, but have looked in many of the rooms and the views of the grassy area, pool and entertainment area would be equally nice. The unpretentious feel of the hotel, the graciousness of the staff, the the tropical flower gardens and mature trees and huge grassy lawn lend to a feeling of complete relaxation. My husband enjoys full sun on the beach loungers; I like a covered cabana on the beach or a simple beach lounger under a tree. It's also nice to be able to walk a very short distance to Black Rock to snorkle with sea turtles, a favorite activity. Most of the people working at the hotel are Hawaiian. There are many activities such as nightly music and Hawaiian dancing (no charge), educational walks, children's activities based around Hawaiian culture. We never fail to learn something else about the beautiful state of Hawaii and the Hawaiian people. The hotel seems to be equally pleasing to families with young children, honeymooners and couples or individuals of any age. Others have made the point that this is not a luxury hotel, but it's very well appointed with lovely carved Hawaiian furniture, beautiful artwork, nice linens, Hawaiian style quilt bedspreads, good lighting and every amenity one could want. Room maintenance is stellar. The only thing lacking for some might be room service, but it's such a short walk to the Tiki Bar and you can order food from your room and have it ready to pick up. It's so nice outside that I can't imagine wanting to eat in anyway. If you've had too much sun, there's a great selection of pay per view movies available. We always order a package including breakfast and a car; it's a very good price and their breakfasts buffets are full breakfasts with all anyone could want...and more. Having said all of this, I will tell you that prior to discovering the KBH, when my husband was in administration, we visited nearly every new luxury hotel on every island for conferences. If it was built over 10 years ago, I've been there. I've had my fill of marble bathrooms, Disneyesque courtyards with waterslides, dress codes in the lobby, etc. I'm still a bit of a hotel snob, won't stay in a chain hotel unless it's a Four Seasons, Oberoi, Aman or Fairmont. I like charming B &B's and boutique hotels, but in Maui I prefer the distinctive Hawaiian charm of the Kaanapali Beach Hotel, it's lovely staff and the "flavor of Hawaii". I'm already planning our next trip. We travel a lot, but have resolved to make it to Maui at least twice a year now. It's where we feel most at home. Enjoy! Aloha......

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT HOTEL WITH GREAT VIEWS AND A GREAT STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: Lyn2Go
Reviews.Content: What a great experience we had at a great hotel! At one point, midway through our stay, though,we had to change rooms, due to a hotel problem. We did have an ocean view room, with barely a view of the ocean. However, we were moved to an ocean front room. A few feet away from the ocean. What a view!!!!!!! I got a picture of a whale spouting from my hotel balcony. Not to mention a neat pic of someone para sailing. Our room was clean. The staff was phenomenal! Sure was hard to leave. They have local vendors in the hotel lobby. So, in order to stimulate the Hawaiian economy we decided to buy some homemade items. My husband and I made a personal date, at three o'clock each day, to meet at the pool for drinks and reading our books. And then swimming. We also swam in the ocean. It is so beautiful there. Yep, we are DEFINITELY going back and requesting the same room we had before. We loved it. Hula and music show each night. Dining at the open concept restaurant was fabulous! Tiki Bar and Grill right near the pool was wonderful and convenient. Oh yeah.... very nice place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: giantsequoiaredwoods
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and we were delighted that things hadn't changed (due to the economic problems) We were treated like family. The nightly hula and music shows were enjoyed every bit as much as on our first visit. MKeahi and Dale helped to make our visit very special and made us feel like family. As we sit here in our 40ish weather we are missing the sun in Maui. One of the things most enjoyable was the free yuekleli (sp) lessons where we had a great laugh at ourselves. The teacher was very warm and intertaining. Our bed was turned down every evening and and cookies placed in front of our pillows. Seasonal decorations were all around us. We will definitely be visiting again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: ronrotty
Reviews.Content: The travel brochure photo and comments didn't show all that this hotel offered and we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The first thing we noticed was the well appointed foyer/lobby with interesting artifacts made by hotel staff. Check-in was efficient by friendly staff. We experienced great sevice from staff members only too happy to help us. Our standard room met expectations, though a little dated,and had authentic historical Hawaiian photographs on the walls. The amenities were great with a bar & Tiki grill in the courtyard and a restaurant looking out into the courtyard and facing a stage where we were entertained by a nightly Hula show with authentic Hawaiian music whilst we dined. The beach was a short stroll through the courtyard. We were pleased to see this hotel preserving their Hawaiian heritage and customs and it was reflected in their music and show and in the general friendly atmosphere. We would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “True paradise.”
Reviews.Author: susned
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and answered any questions we had. They also had great recommendations for tours, sightseeing, etc. The restaurants were expensive but that's expected in Hawaii. The food was fantastic and the kids loved it too. The beach was beautiful and not too crowded. I would love to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Honeymoon Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Hoot45
Reviews.Content: So we took a chance by staying here for our honeymoon instead of closer to downtown. So glad we did! It's on the nicest stretch of beach on Maui and 3 blocks from snorkling off the beach. Wonderful room with modern amenities and the best sheets/comforter ever. So glad we took that chance and stayed here. Perfect for a honeymoon. Extremely quiet, minimal kids.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: gmhr16
Reviews.Content: We recently took a week long vacation to Maui and of the 8 nights there spent and 6 nights at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel 2 nights at the Westin Maui . Arriving at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel is always a pleasure. As always, we were warmly welcomed. The Kaanapali Beach Hotel makes you feel at home, the staff is friendly and most importantly it is organized and CLEAN! Walking into our room, you immediately notice the difference in the attention to detail, organization and cleanliness in comparison to the the Westin. The room was well organised, user friendly, clean and exactly what you need for Hawaii; a clean, organized space to dump all your stuff when you come back from the beach or pool all day. It's cleaned very well every day. The Tiki Terrace restaurant, located next to my favorite spot ( the very excellent Tiki bar & Grill) is very nice as well. We found the service and the food to be better than a comparable meal at Leilani's. An added bonus is live local Hawaian music and stories while you eat. I like that if I'm flying all the way to Hawaii, that's part of what I go for. The property is arched around an outdoor courtyard with a pool and you can basically throw a rock to the beach so you pretty much walk out of your room and you can see the beach. It's very kid friendly with lots of activities but balances it just fine for adults as well. If I want the flash, I'll go to Vegas. If I want a great room at a good price with a true local Hawaiian feel and without all the pretense I can get in the mainland US, count me in for the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We are never disappointed. It's kind if like being in your own home, you just happen to be in Hawaii! As for the 2 nights spent at the Westin, although the Westin is considered a 4 star hotel, our room did not reflect that at all. There was mold of some sort near the a/c vent, the room was unorganized, had too much furniture for the space available and the TV was situated to the far right of the bed with a large armoir directly in front of the bed. Therefore only one person on the bed could really see the TV well. There was a table and two chairs in front of the desk the TV was on, so you couldn't really use the desk and the table also partially blocked the door to the balcony. You could see a dirty piping under the bathroom sink and the wall paper in the bathroom was starting to peel off in spots. They had a small refrigerator in the closet that had some folded up magazine paper under one side of it to keep it balanced. It was clear that interior decorating 101, attention to detail and general management oversight of the property was siginificantly lacking. To top it off, when our waiter handed us our menu at the restaurant, there was a cockroach on it. Seriously. It just din't, in anyway, match our expectations. We've stayed at a lot of Hotels in Hawaii but our favorite is always the Kaanapali Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel With A Lot Of Heart”
Reviews.Author: koko269
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before deciding to book this hotel for the first half of my trip. I wanted an authentic Hawaiian hotel that was in Lahaina area. This fit the bill. Yes, this hotel was on the older side, but the amount of effort and customer service that was provided cannot be matched. The staff try really hard to make you feel a part of the family and we were always greeted in a friendly manner. You get a welcome breakfast on the first or second day on your stay. The welcome breakfast wasn't all that great because it was just a buffet that consisted of scrambled eggs, potatoes, cereal, fruit, juice and coffee. It was however, a very nice gesture. They took this time to tell you about the activities around the island and which tour companies were available. The staff also provided information as to what to watch out for, example - if you were to add this option to your excursion, keep in mind it's not free and this is the price for it. (Insider tips I would tell my friends or family if I were to tell them about excursions I've been on) This was something that this hotel didn't have to do, but they chose to do so and I found it thoughtful. The rooms are decent size and I was fine with it. There isn't much to do at the hotel in terms of nightlife though. There is a show performed at night, but no one ever hung around their bar, so my husband and I just went to sleep around 9PM every night. That actually worked out since it forced us to wake up early every morning. The pool wasn't very big, but it was cute since it was in the shape of a whale. The best part of the hotel was the location. I enjoyed the beach quite a bit and was barely ever at the pool. My husband jogged on the beach every morning and he loved it. There was no room service and parking is $9.00 a day. Laundry and internet aren't free either. We stayed at another hotel in Maui and all this was free, except the room service of course, but I'm not sure if that's the norm. It sure made the trip more relaxing knowing that you didn't have to shell out more money though. There is only one thing I absolutely hated in this hotel are the pillows. I had a hard time sleeping since the pillows had no support and it was worst than sleeping on a bag of marshmellows. Other than that, I thought the service was fantastic in this hotel. I would have given this hotel 3/5, but because of their attention to detail, I would rate this hotel 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “One of the family”
Reviews.Author: maui2009Eastcoast
Reviews.Content: We just got back and wanted to tell you about it. It was a 3 star hotel so I had reservations about it. Due to many family members going for a wedding we had to watch the prices. We felt like one of the family...everywhere you went on the grounds, you were greated with a hearty hello...something you don't always see. The food was great...no matter what we ate...presented beautifully. The only real complaint we had was that the air conditioner wasn't on when we came into the room so it kind of smelled like mildew. Once you opened the sliding door or put ac it was okay. The other guests in our party complained of the samething too. I did address this issue when we left. The grounds are kept clean and the activities were plenty. We were there for Thanksgiving so we made reservations for there feast and what a feast it was...variety of foods. We also had the Deluxe Buffet Breakfast with our daily room rate and it was unbelieveable. The location was great but I do have to say that everything closes up at 10:00. We were on vacation and would like to hear music or have a drink by the bar after 10:00. It was like this at other hotels too. There was also a day they had to worn us about the ocean. They left us a personal message on the phone to all there guests about the under tow...not to go in the ocean for 24 hours ...sorry none of the guests listen and they were quite right. I would go back to this hotel in a minute but I don't know if I would go tback to Maui again. ..being from the east coast it was a long ride and we have several beautiful areas down in the caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: owenswh
Reviews.Content: Good location within walking distance to Whalers Village shops and restaurants, and good snorkeling site at black rock. I would recommend bringing mask and snorkel because fins are not absolutely necessary here. I was able to stand on bottom and see sea turtles within arms reach. Otherwise, you will spend 10$ an hour per set. Whalers village has good restaurants and good place to go for coffee or a quick breakfast. Room spacious but not luxorius (comparable to best western or similar). We stayed in room 146 which I would recommend due to closeness to parking garage, pool, ice machine and house cleaning (where you get beach towels). My family enjoyed the magic dinner show held at the hotel. My 7 and 5 year old boys got bored of the pool fairly quickly; the water was cold and no slides or anything exciting. The Sheraton next door has a much nicer pool for kids IMO. Count on spending additonal $9.00 a day for parking or $11.00 if you choose valet. Some of the negatives I experienced included no pool side drink service. The pool is right next to the Tiki bar so I expected to be able to lounge poolside and have a server come by to take drink orders. The "happy hour" was lame IMO. Only one beer and one cocktail were reduced slighlty. No food specials. The facility is a little dated. For example, there is no fan in the bathroom for ventilation. No free internet access, but you can print out airline boarding passes for free at front desk. Overall, just an average experience for our 4 day stay over Thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful place in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Nani11
Reviews.Content: I spent the most wonderful week in the world at Kaanapali Beach Hotel with the most wonderful people that work there. I felt I became just like family. Everyone was wonderful and the hotel was marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: martinibaby57
Reviews.Content: stayed 7 days was very clean, reasonably priced service was very nice, view was extradinary for partial ocean view would come back. close to resteraunts, shopping very nice walkway to everything, beach was clean but bring your own towel they charge you to use the loungers and cabanas

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Plus”
Reviews.Author: VALERIE1943
Reviews.Content: Compared to other hotels in the area this one is smaller and older but situated on beautiful grounds. Staying here is Hawaii not just a hotel you find in any city. Where else are you treated to a welcome breakfast with entertainment by the staff! Be sure and take in the Sunday brunch. It is pricey but worth it - don't pass by the omelettes or waffles. Enjoyed the garden walk and the hula lessons. Our room was very comfortable and included a table and chairs and an armchair which the chain hotel we stayed in in Waikiki did not have. For me this hotel had it all; a pool, on the beach, close to shopping and if you golf there is a course across the street.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel are my friends and I would welcom them in my home anytime”
Reviews.Author: kbhclark
Reviews.Content: Who would you ask for information about Hawaii? A Hawiian of course. And that is what we found at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Native Hawiians who took the time to explain the culture, history, the best island features worth seeing, the best restruants (including the local fruit stands) and the best places to shop from the local bargains to the high end stores located on the island. It was very hard to leave the hotel to enjoy the rest of Maui because of the snorkeling (we got to pet a giant turtle), the beach walks, the shopping so close by and the manicured floral grounds with plenty of space to lay out in the sun in privacy or at the pool where we could smell the huge variety flowering trees and shrubs all around us and sipped on their fresh fruit pina collottas every day. As if the wealth of information was not enough we also took advantage of the FREE lessons to make native hawiian art and jewelry that we took home as our most treasured souveniers from Maui. A quick shout out to Malihini "WE LOVE YOU" - You are the heart of Maui and a treasure to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Maui's Most Hawaiian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lbporter
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and no matter how many times we will ever go to Maui, we will only stay there.... You can not ask for a better Hawaiian experience. The grounds, staff, and helpfulness of everyone there is beyond compare. Thank you for making our vacation such a wonderful experience again. We were able to walk to shopping restaurants and your famous tiki bar's along the beach. And we could easily drive to Lahaina when we wanted something different. We hopefully will be back in 2011 if not sooner... Again Thank You.... Linda and Lloyd Baker

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust the reservations clerk - tough hotel times means short change”
Reviews.Author: RoseTreeStallion
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late October, early November because a relative had recommended the place as most Hawaiian and taking Halloween into account there was not much available in Lahaina when we inquired late September. When we phoned to inquire about rates, etc. we were told we would get a "free lunch" because we were referred by a previous guest. Well when we checked in we were told our relative would have to send some sort of referral form to the hotel first. We also booked a garden room and got one on the back side of the hotel looking at grass between us and a condo building. We complained about our room location and questioned the lack of the promised lunch and asked the clerk AND HER MANAGER to see what the could do for us. Not a word, and this was when the hotel was only half full - too bad for them, we won't be coming back. Try the Lahaina Inn for real Hawaiian.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: amymob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for the second part of our honeymoon. Our travel agent recommended it to us because it was within our budget and in a great location. I was leary after reading many reviews, but I would stay there again. CONS: **The hotel is very much a 3 star hotel and needs to be refurbished and remodeled. **The tub did not drain and water filled to the top of the tub while showering. **Bar and dinner service at the Tiki Terrace restaurant were billed separately and were expensive. The host at the Tiki Terrace restaurant was the least pleasant person at the hotel. (He was the exception.) **The pool looked run down, had cracks, and had leaves on the bottom. (We did not swim in it.) **The bed was very hard! PROS: **Excellent location!!!! **The hotel room was very clean! The sheets, towels, etc. were worn but clean. **The beach is fabulous and very close to Black Rock. **Service at the Valet Desk and Front Desk was great and people were friendly. **The air conditioning was very cold! **The dinner at Tiki Terrace was delicious (but pricey) and you can watch the entertainment while dining. **Shows every night were not excellent quality, but were fun to watch. **Shows also ended early enough so that they did not keep you up if you were in your room. **Breakfast at the Mixed Plate was not the best ever, but good variety and quality. **The landscaping is very well maintained and very pretty. Large outdoor area to relax. **Local artists displayed their work in the lobby. **Great variety of free activities. **Lei ceremony when you leave is very heartwarming and sincere. We stayed at a nicer hotel in Honolulu before we came to Maui. Because of this, it took me a few days to adjust to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. I will stay here again because now I know what to expect. Do not come here expecting a luxurious hotel or you will be disappointed. The people, location, and beach are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rev_dog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week on our honeymoon. It's not a ritzy hotel, but pleasing, clean & comfortable. We felt like we were tucked away from the hustle & bustle; it's very calming. The beach is right there for swimming or snorkeling. All the staff are very friendly and happy. We even had a bottle of champagne in our room when we arrived. We stayed in an older wing of the hotel, which was fine, no elevator. But I'm sure the updated rooms are lovely. We bought beverage holders and liquor when we landed, then filled them and brought to the pool with us. More affordable. The location makes it very easy to drive around on the island. Cell phone coverage was great. Internet access for a fee. There's an in-room safe too, definitely made use of that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great hospitality, great time!”
Reviews.Author: ericl1098
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 17 days in Hawaii (Maui, Kauai, Oahu) on our honeymoon, and we liked the KBH best of all three hotels we stayed at. The location on the beach was terrific, the pool was great, and the Tiki Bar and nightly entertainment was fabulous! We would definitely return and stay at this hotel on our next vacation to Maui, and would suggest KBH to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hawaiian atmospher in rooms, garden, and activities”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasBeaver
Reviews.Content: We spent five days enjoying this lovely hotel, pool and beach. Our favorite activitiy was the TiKi Bar with the evening Hawaiian entertainment. We also enjoyed the Magician Dinner Show at the hotel. The gardens were bautiful and the caretakers were busy daily removing litter from the trees, etc. Rooms were very comfortable and we felt very safe. Enjoyed a couple trips into Lahina - especially the Halloween parade.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Our Family”
Reviews.Author: utalkitype
Reviews.Content: I told my kids that this was not the most expensive hotel, but I thought it would be more like our family - comfortable, unpretentious, and entertaining. When we walked in my 10-year-old son said, "Mom, what do you mean not fancy? This place is awesome!" ...and it only got better. We loved all the cultural activities for the kids and the guest breakfast really made us feel welcome. We learned a lot about Hawaiian culture at this hotel, and that made the trip all that more meaningful. We travel with our kids to learn about other places, and that is definitely what we got at this hotel. The day that we had our little ceremony before leaving, I got a little sentimental. The people there were so wonderful and friendly that we really felt like we were leaving friends. Many peope we spoke with at the breakfast had stayed at this hotel multiple times, and I am not surprised. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, unpretentious stay in Maui where I am confident you will be welcomed back year after year as family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a paradise location”
Reviews.Author: Hippyaquadave
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an ideal location for getting around Maui. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The beach out the back of the hotel is ideal for snorkeling. The evening entertainment with Jason in the band is also fantastic. It is a wonderful Hawaiian hotel. They teach you about the history if you want to know it. Otherwise its just perfect. The rooms are cleaned everyday. The Barfoot champagne was $17 a bottle so i was very happy. The whole atmosphere made our honeymoon wonderful and it has made me determind to go back. Thank you KBH.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be Missed!”
Reviews.Author: biz_pleasure_whiz
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful time. In several previous visits we always stayed in Kihei, and I was not really eager to be up in the "big hotel resort" area, but the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH) is such a gem it will always be first on my list in the future. In 10 minutes you will understand why it is called the "most Hawaiian hotel" on Maui. The staff are amazing, and the activities, which you might be jaded enough to pass on, are really culturally interesting and give you a chance to meet real Maui people doing what they love--sharing their age-old knowledge, arts, food and music. So get out of your lounge chair and go make a lei! This is not a big box hotel, but I wouldn't trade the penthouse at the Sheraton for the authentic experience at KBH. Rooms are spacious, but not elegant, and the bathrooms small, but who spends time in their room in Maui anyway? Friendly bar and pool environment is conducive to meeting other guests, and they actually have a little market that doesn't have jacked up prices. Imagine that!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views, the spirit of Hawaii.”
Reviews.Author: DobsnDougo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at KBH for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon, in a newly renovated room. The grounds are amazing (great gardens and spotlessly clean lawns etc)and the location is perfect. right on the beach, right near Black rock ( a must snorkell spot) and a 10 minute drive from Lahaina. Our check in was smooth, the staff are friendly, the valet parking boys are especially helpfull with some tips on what to do, Our room was a 1 King size bed on the 4th floor, was nice and spacious, air cond, good size bathroom, fridge, iron, TV, etc. we were given a gift bottle of champagne to celebrate our honeymoon, nice touch KBH Mahalo! when you check in you get an invite to a free breakfast and orientation of the hotel which we did and was good, the concierge is nice and friendly who hosted the brekkie and we were treated to a hello hula and songs from the staff, and a brief magic show by the in house magician which was great, worth your time. you learn you can do free Hawaiian activites during the day and what happens where in the hotel grounds. They recommend Trilogy to do your tours/activities outside the hotel while on maui and have a Trilogy info/rentals shop outside the hotel on the beach. We didnt use them. I will cover them further down. there was renovations during our stay but it wasnt a problem.In the evenings there is a live Hawaiian band that play 6-9pm every night and do try to catch a show they are amazing. Have a drink from the Tikki bar'n'grill and a snack while you enjoy the music. On the whole its a great hotel for your money. now some do's and donts! Go to black rock on dusk to see the cliff diver light the torches and say a prayer every evening, once the sun has gone down walk along the beach and look for the luminescant lights in the sand right on the shore line, trust me ive never heard of it or seen any reviews on this but theres something magical in the sand right on dark there. Go to Black rock and snorkell... you WILL see turtles every day right there 5 minutes from your hotel. walk around the hotel grounds, the flowers and gardens are beautiful, the shops in the lobby arent dear for a momento of your stay. Do the Aloha ceremony before you leave. but if your from Australia dont take your lei home customs will bin them, keep them at the hotel for your next visit where they will add another seed for every visit.(we did). And some Donts... Dont expect Maui to be as cheap as Oahu... Dont expect your parking to be free... $9.00 a night or $11 plus tips for valet which is a bit steep. dont bother with the resturant there, we tried a small breakfast and it was over $40!! before the tip (which they expect atleast 17% tips and the service by the resturant/bar staff wasnt 17% good) dinner menu is dearer but we gave it a miss. But the breakfast was nice. Dont expect your room safe to be free.. they will charge you and its not even a pin code safe ( but you do get an option to use it or not which is good). Dont expect free internet, $3.oo minimum and 50 cents a minute and 50 cents a page, we were not impressed. and the ATM was out of order for 2 days. If you go to the beach you have the option to hire everything you might need but its not cheap, the shady beach chairs are a good idea but they'll cost ya! we didnt bother, sunblock works just fine but for families maybe worth doing. we made some enquiries at the Trilogy desk for activities/ beach hire, but thet are way too expensive eg, parasail for 10 minutes $75.00 each!! dont bother with the Whalers village shops close by, unless your going to the ABC shop there, waste of time. Sorry to end on a few sour notes guys, i'll cheer it up now... Overall KBH is a lovely hotel, Great for couples or the family, As a beautiful place to stay its hard to beat, we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would go stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: nursesar
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. You can't beat the location on one of Maui's best beaches. This hotel is cheaper than all the others around it. It is not the resort type hotel. Just a nice hotel with great staff and beautiful grounds. They have free activities for adults and children (lei making, hula lessons, etc). Lots of culture and old Hawaiian spirit here. Rooms could use some updating, but our room was a suite room and quite large. Nice lanai on each room. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely casual hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mid-state
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely helpful and always positive. The beach is one of the widest on the island and has good snorkeling at black rock just one hotel over. Ask for prescription mask if you wear contacts or glasses well worth it. We saw some sea turtles. The breakfast buffet was fresh and filling we did not need to eat lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jslc
Reviews.Content: I love the location, close to lahaina, love the pools and the beach. The room was very outdated and old. It was noisy at night due to the luau happening every night. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel On Maui”
Reviews.Author: pressie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at your hotel last week. This is the third time we have stayed at KBH. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. The staff and hotel are excellent. It is very true when they say Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is Maui's most Hawaiian Hotel. Norma and Leonard Swindler

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to experience Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: BobM01
Reviews.Content: Our trip to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel in Sep 09 was wonderful. The staff was very nice and accomodating and went out of their way to ensure we had a great time. The daily hula shows made each evening an event to remember and the fantastic Sunday brunch and its Hawaiian show was the best I have ever attended. Our room was recently remodeled and very spacious with a view of the ocean. I highly recommend this hotel to visitors looking for the Hawaiian experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is the, "most hawaiian" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RideFreeForever
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have vacationed in Hawaii long enough to see a transformation from a cultural community to a capitalistic economy. If you don't understand what I mean, then by all means, have a stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for a taste of old style. From the beach, you can turn right and walk down to Black Rock and get some snorkling in. Turn left and you make your way to Whalers Village where you can find everything from Gucci bags to shave ice. Pay a little extra for the breakfast buffet when you book your room....mmmm...good. Along with all the usual breakfast foods, the fresh fruit, miso soup and portuguese sausage is outstanding! There are plenty of activities through out the day and hula shows every night. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation in ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: LaurieAA
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't the most posh and plush on the beach, but it is the best! The staff works very hard to make each guest's stay comfortable and memorable. The place needs some updating, but you can't beat the service and the location. It is within walking distance of Whaler's Village for shopping and restaurants and the Maui Bus Stop. We stayed in an oceanfront room. The view was gorgeous and the sunsets spectacular. You can save a little money and book an ocean view. The paved walkway along the beach is ideal for an early morning or evening stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Great Service. Authentic Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: DougCentralNJ
Reviews.Content: First I have to say that the location was great. The hotel is located on the beach, with a nightly show of authentic hawaiian culture. Sitting on the balcony we could listen the music every night. We were steps from the beach, and a very short distance to Whalers Village and Black Rock. The room was spacious and very clean. I couldn't ask for a better place to stay. When we were leaving they hold a little ceremony. It's nice to learn of the culture from natives of the islands.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location right on a great beach!”
Reviews.Author: PattyAnn45
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful value. It is located right on the beach and located next to restaurants and shops within walking distance. Boats take off for snorkeling and other tours nearby. The staff is so nice and you can get involved with native Hawaiian culture. It is not the place to go for fancy water slides and extensive grottos and landscaped grounds. It is more a quiet escape where the beach and nearby snorkelling is the attraction. We've been back several times. Fantastic Sunday Brunch!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: BCtravelerette
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I took a 5-day trip in Maui at the begining of September, and we are so glad that we stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. It is no 5-star luxury, but it's very clean and the location is just perfect. The hotel staff were friendly and knowledgable, and they were willing to give an elaborate answer whenever we had questions regarding Hawaiian culture or places to go in Maui. We arrived at about midnight, and once the front desk person saw us, he immediately addressed us by our correct name. It could because that we were the very last persons to check in, but we still felt very welcoming. Because it was our anniversary, we got upgraded to a partial ocean view room, literally 10 steps away from the beach (facing the widest part of the beach and less than 5 minutes walk to Black Rock snorkeling site). How wonderful was that! Breakfast buffets were good with varieties; the rental from the hotel were on average 15% cheaper than those from Sheraton (e.g. Cabana was $32 per day here, and $40 over the Sheraton). We had such a great time, and I was so sad when I had to leave. I also regreted that I didn't have time to attend a few of the Hotel's complimentary classes. Next time, I will definitely try the hula dancing, sand drawing, and lei making ones. We will defintely stay in this lovely hotel again! I do want to point out a few things. The swimming pool isn't very exciting. So if you are more of a pool person than beach person, you may want to check out the other bigger hotels on the Ka'anapoli beach, such as Westin. I will avoid any of those Aloha rooms facing the parking lot; they are very close to the pakade, and could be noisy. Also, I didn't find any fitness facilities except a pingpong table in a cornor. For us, this didn't matter, as we run on the beach and swimming in the sea was the only other exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, affordable rooms with outstanding service and location”
Reviews.Author: algray
Reviews.Content: The rooms were simple but affordable with good standards of cleanliness. The rooms weren't fantastically sound proofed which is nice waking up to the birds in the morning, not so nice to hear the neighbours arguing or people upstairs taking a shower. Above all the friendliness is truly Hawaiian and the location is right on one of the best beaches in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Maui Ocenfront Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dcheney101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Kanapali Beach Hotel September 5, 2009 for 13 nights. It is a great hotel. We stayed in an updated room that was clean, quiet, and confortable. The staff was very friendly and courteous. We booked POV and they upgraded us to OV with a bottle of champagne for our 30th anniversary. The grounds are great, and right on the beach. So you can lounge by the pool; or under the palm trees; or walk a few feet and jump in the ocean. There is a boardwalk in front that takes you to other hotels and an upscale mall. Parking is very convenient, and reasonable at $9 per day with no resort fee. Housekeepers are very very nice. The free welcome breakfast was great with no pressure sales at all. They show you some of the activities and offer you a discount. We spent a lot of time researching the trip. We felt that since we wanted on the ocean on a great beach, that this one was the best...and best deal. It definitely exceeded our expectations! We actually moved down the hall the last 5 nights to full ocean front, which was a little more. But this was an outstanding deal. We will always remember the waves crashing down in the evening, lulling us to sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location - Value can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Lottifish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 9 days for an anniversary trip. The location is amazing. Right on a beautiful beach with relatively calm waves and a short walk to amazing snorkeling with sea turtles. We arrived a ltitle early and our original room with a King bed wasn't ready so they offered us a double queen room if we didn't want to wait. We took it which was great because it was on the 4th floor in the newly remodeled wing. (Our original room was in the old building and on the ground floor). They didn't charge us any extra. Even though we booked the cheapest category of room we could see the ocean if we looked over our lanai. The room was immaculate. The beds were a little soft as were the pillows but some people may like that. The only real complaint I had is that the bathroom was a little small - if you layed the bath mat towel on the floor in front of the shower the door couldn't open without smooshing it. However, there was good water pressure and again, everything was clean. Staff was very friendly, parking was super easy, and it was nice having a convenience store and restaurants on the premise. We had the Sunday champagne brunch at the hotel and it was amazing. I've never seen so much food! And it was all yummy! Go if you can! We also paid for the buffet breakfast one morning but that wasn't worth it. The selection was limited and it was $19/pp!! I really loved this hotel. They seem to still be remodeling some of the buildings/floors so try to get one that is remodeled if you can. Not sure what the other rooms are like. I would stay here again in a second. You really can't beat the price when you're staying right on this beautiful beach!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: harvey79g
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and it was a pleasant stay. The staff was nice and welcoming and it has your traditional Hawaii'an feel. I didn't have any complaints about the room, it was clean and tidy. Their restaurant is very good. We ate their on 2 separate occasions and enjoyed it both times. When we first arrived their restaurant was closing in 5minutes but they still cooked our entrees for us which we devoured in our room. It was a skirt steak and they included a free slice of cheesecake cause it took a bit longer but I can't fault them since they were probably closing up. The other time I had their lamb which on the 3 course menu it was one of the best lamb chops I had and the dessert that came with it was also great. Their bar stand food is your typical bar food it was alright but I didn't like their fried calamari which was too greasy even for me. The location of the beach is a great location, near the end of it where it wouldn't get too crowded, the water and sand was nice but there wasn't much in the water. I find it's just more to sit there and relax. The time I went is considered the off season so it wasn't crowded. Overall, I enjoyed the stay here especially their restaurant food. If you're one of those who needs a more modern and updated room then perhaps this isn't the place for you. If you want a hotel that has a more traditional Hawaii'an feel then you would enjoy this place

Reviews.Title: “#3 in Lahaina???”
Reviews.Author: allegraversace
Reviews.Content: I am an avid Tripadvisor user so when I thoroughly researched where to stay on Maui, I chose the KBH based on those reviews. I guess I will no longer rely solely on Tripadvisor. Stayed for 6 nights. When you arrive at the KBH, you get a cheesy/motel like feel. I am wondering if this is what everyone keeps referring to as the "Most Hawaiian Hotel". I think the word "hotel" is misleading. You have to walk outside to your room, which to me feels like "motel". The rooms are small and functional. The lanai is tiny but adequate for sitting outside for a bit. Rooms are kept clean but I do have to note that the shower head looked like it had never seen a sponge. Kind of gross. The bed was plain awful. We kept talking about missing our chiropractor on vacation. Not a good sign. Sleeping on a slab of concrete would have been more comfortable. Parking is expensive. We chose to self park since valet used the same garage and there was plenty of spots. You have to get pool/beach towels at housekeeping or at a shack on the beach. The towels are no bigger than the bath towels and they make you sign a slip as if you are going to steal them. Our package included breakfast. The Sunday brunch was fabulous and I highly recommend it. I do not recommend the Mixed Plate near the lobby. The food tasted like cafeteria food and the place needs to be remodeled badly. We ate at the Tiki Terrace and we should have gone there every morning. The pool--shaped like a whale but small. Lots of kids floating around and sandy by the end of the day. Never saw anyone cleaning it. The beach--very nice but that shack that gives you towels rips you off by charging you for loungechairs/cabanas. There is a fixed price so if you are not out there all day until 4:30, you get the same price. The lounge chairs at the pool were "free to use". The staff was always smiling, friendly and happy. We never made it to the Welcome Breakfast. Went on a few tours and were given wrong information by the tour desk. Note: It is cold on the sunrise tour to Haleakala--a beach towel will not suffice!! Take 2 blankets from the room. And how can I forget--our wakeup call for Haleakala was 10 minutes late, giving us 10 minutes to get ready for our 2:20 pick up time. Imagine if we missed the tour that we woke up for in the middle of the night. We were also given wrong info about the Road To Hana. Roads were closed, there were delays but nothing major. The location is ideal--within walking distance to stores and restaurants at Whalers Village. Spent most evenings on Front St. Recommend Kimo's--fresh fish, great service, great view. Ate there two nights in a row. Also recommend Aloha Mixed Plate for Hawaiiain food and relief from the exorbitant prices everywhere else. Went to the Westin for spa services. The salon located at KBH looked scary. After walking through the Westin, we were so jealous and kept talking about how comfy we would have been in their Heavenly Beds. We realized that we know what we like and we need to stick to it. We missed the activities at the hotel as we were out exploring on our own. The farewell is a nice touch and we were given a kukui nut lei to wear. I now understand why the KBH is a 3 star but am still perplexed as to how it is so high on the list. I can imagine that it was beautiful back in the day (maybe the 70s). I am putting that I would not recommend to a friend but I would recommend it to a very frugal friend. PS Maui is beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “KBH makes you feel like family.”
Reviews.Author: happytrails81
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Kaanapali Beach Hotel and am looking forward to when I can schedule a trip back! The photos on the web do not do the hotel grounds justice and the beach really is one of the best in Maui ( the other being Makena near Wailea but I only saw it from the boat). Most of Maui's beachs have rocky entry, and some are small coves, but Kaanapali is a huge, long, magnificent white sand beach. The hotel was situated well and offers two restaraunts and two small stores. Additionally there are vendors in the lobby selling authentic hawaiian crafts- such a treat! If you are like me and want to soak up some of the culture the Hawaiian activies offered by the hotel are a cream come true. I learned a hula dance, made several leis ands learned various ways to cut a pineapple. The nightly Luau was great-and the show changed nightly. The sunday brunch was great too! The food was tasty and the luau during the meal included various dancers. The pool wasn't was impressive as the neighboring hotels but the grouds were lush and the beach was right outside your door. Guest Services were such a pleasure and helped us plan all our activies and helped with tips and recomendations. The hotel staff went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable! Thank you KBH! A hui ho!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again, loved the room, great location, happy helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bcogswell
Reviews.Content: I loved the Kaanapali location. It is right on the beach and the hotel sits on a nice sandy beach close to Black Rock. The snorkeling at Black Rock is good, I saw a ray and my husband saw a sea turtle. There is a cement path along the beach and Whalers Village and excellent restaurants are close by. Lahaina is close and we enjoyed driving there. The staff is very friendly and helpful and always smiling. They seem like they are happy to be working there and really want you to have a good vacation. We liked the orientation breakfast and the free luau show in the evening. The hotel does seem a little dated from the exterior but it is nice place to stay for the price. We stayed in the Kauai wing and our room was spacious with a large lanai. We did not have an ocean view but we didn't spend to much time in our room. We also had a small fridge in the room. The Kauai room has been recently updated and the rooms have nice bedding and furniture. I would definitely stay here again. We had a great time and loved the room.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: MasonDixonGirl
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay that makes guest feel comfortable for a low cost. I went down with friends and we each stayed at different hotels along Kaanapali to compare. Our room was the smallest of all the hotels spaces, but we were the only couple with out any complaints and that paid the least!! We felt at home and did not want to leave! We will be back in Maui again and plan on being welcomed back at the KBH! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Ohana feeling”
Reviews.Author: TravelBress
Reviews.Content: For our 5th Yr Anniv, we stayed at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel 08/11 - 08/15. We truly enjoyed our stay and the staff was very friendly. In fact, they went out of their way to help us regardless of if it's their job or not. As an example, we attended the complimentary welcome breakfast buffet -- staff from all depts presented and gave the "ohana" feeling. There was no pressure to sign up to any of the events they presented. We won a free dinner coupon, which we used for lunch at the Mixed Plate restaurant. When we were there, the cashier was not available but the lady from cust service dept was getting her lunch and noticed that we were waiting to pay. She stopped what she was doing to help us. Talk about customer service! This is not a Hyatt or Prince Hotel -- It's "old" hawaii and gives you a sense of "ohana" (family) feeling. The staff is wonderful and we even talked to Keiki and his wife -- they have a table presenting hand-made HI weapons and jewelry. Get to know them -- attend the presentation and you'll have a better understanding of the real Hawaii and it's traditions, culture, history, etc. Location is awesome! The hotel is only a few steps away from Hula Grill and Leilani restaurant as well as shopping center. There's a running/walking path. Watch the sun set behind the Black Rock. It's a great place to be! Every night, they left cookies on our bed. Everyday, there's a voice mail to let us know of hotel events. There's also washer/dryer, which is convenient since we went to Kauai the next week. Since it's our anniversary, they even welcomed us with a bottle of champagne. Also, instead of welcoming each guest with a lei, they do it when you leave. Unfortunately, due to our early flight to Kauaia, we missed this event. If you want to be a tourist and expect to be a "diva" don't stay here....if you want to be a local, and learn about HI's culture and tradition, then this is a great place to be. p.s. we filled out the comment card before we left. We gave credit to the staff who've helped made our stay memorable. We rec'd a letter from the manager letting us know that our comments would be shared w/ their staff. We've stayed at many high and low-end hotels here and int'l. We've never got this response. Give credit to those who truly deserve it. This hotel is awesome. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for a modest hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler97
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel, although it is obvious that it is aging and needs some updating, and some might not like the looks of the lobby, which is a mish-mash of different things with no particular interior decorating to speak of. The best thing was the service whenever we needed anything, and the worst thing was having no small refrigerator in the rooms to keep food or drinks cold - getting ice in a bucket was the only alternative and could only be used for beverages, so we had to throw away food that we had brought back with us to the hotel room. Otherwise, it was okay, and the staff was especially friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, great location, great beach.”
Reviews.Author: frankovegas
Reviews.Content: Most of the previous positive reviews of this hotel are on the money. The people are super nice, the location is incredible, the grounds are gorgeous and the beach is one of the best I've ever been on in my life. Sure, the hallways and stairwells (we were on the second floor) could use some sprucing up, but that is the only negative I can report on. They don't gouge you are the Tiki Bar/Grill, the food at the outdoor cafe and Mixed Plate buffet was very good, and you can't help but be in a good mood when you are there. In fact, you almost have to be looking for a reason to be disappointed with something if such trivial matters as the condition of the hallways "ruins" your time in Ka'anapali. Considering the price, especially compared to the neighboring hotels, this is a great choice for anyone who doesn't need max luxury at every turn. A very nice, simple, comfortable property.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel really work to make you feel welcome.”
Reviews.Author: microchick
Reviews.Content: The staff at Ka'anapali Beach hotel are very friendly & greet you with an "aloha". The staff were quick to move us to a better room when we found that the room we booked had a funny odor. The free classes offered at the hotel (lei making, ukelele lesson, hula lessons, etc) are a lot of fun. The grounds are immaculate & beautiful. Yes, it does cost $9 a day to park, but many places, especially in Lahaina charge for parking. Restaurants in Maui are very pricey & not that great, but we found Maui Taco, & Mama's Ribs & Rotisserie very good & reasonable (for Maui). Haleakala sunrise is a must see!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, great location, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: nycastle
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this property was very enjoyable. The best part is the location on the beach. It is right next to Black Rock (in front of Sheraton) where you can swim, snorkel (frequent turtle sightings) and jump off the rock into the sea. The beach itself is long, wide and not at all crowded even with the hotels that line the shore...plenty of room for everyone. And, the ocean was calm and inviting, of course. The hotel claims to be the "most Hawaiian hotel" which may be the case. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful at every opportunity. The rooms are a bit dated and nothing fancy, so if you're looking for luxury this probably isn't ideal. That said, the rooms were clean, beds comfortable and water pressure great (no tub, just standing shower). And, we were upgraded at no fee to a room that had a nice ocean view (all rooms have patios too). The pool is a little crowded with families and the bar scene was a little cheesy, although the beer and drinks were very fairly priced as compared to other spots we visited. Worth noting, they have a couple of restaurants with descent food, nothing great. And, no room service. They also have a hut on the beach where you can rent any thing you want for the water, and charge it to your room. Again, the beach was just wonderful. You can also walk along the beach or walkway to other places to eat and shop, like Whaler's Village. All in all, this was a clean, friendly place with a beautiful beach. I would say it is best for families and "chill" couples, like us. It's not The Four Seasons, but sun, sand and the warm ocean are all free so don't forget that. :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds mixes with culture”
Reviews.Author: 5frys
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are roomy and comfortable. The staff is helpful and the daily activities are included in the price. Other hotels charge extra for lei making and things. The restaurant on the grounds is fabulous and we enjoyed the evening free Hawaiian show. The beach is great and black rock offers some of the best snorkeling on Maui. This is a great hotel on Maui, but wish they were more accomodating for families........on a return visit they would not let us keep a small child in the room on a slider bed, as would any other hotel in AMerican.........they wanted to put us in a very pricey room, so we stayed elsewhere on our next visit. Nice for couples though.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, great location, and excellent customer service...can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: luvinlifeWashingon
Reviews.Content: This is not a new and flashy hotel but it is comfortable, clean, and has a great location. We found the staff to be very accomodating and the hotel to be just the right size to spread out and have what we wanted but not so large that you had no connection. We loved that it was on a beautiful beach and very close to Black Rock snorkeling area in front of the Sheraton Hotel. The staff was fantastic and we felt very welcomed and that the cared about our stay. They have a nice welcome breakfast and a ceremony when you check out. We will definately stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best value on West Maui”
Reviews.Author: ncdadws
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this hotel. Rooms are basic but clean. great location. great beach and good snorkeling from the beach. Affordable food on site and nearby. Friendly staff. Good place for families. Only drawback is a small ( but nice) pool area. Quite a bargain for West Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel - do not stay”
Reviews.Author: Harry_Singh
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst "hotels" I'ved stayed at - more like a MOTEL. The room were given was dirty, smelly, bathroom moldy and yellow stuff in the bathroom. The drain in the tub was clogged and no help to unclog it. The bed was one of the most uncomfortable I've ever stayed in. I mean motel quality (or lack of quality). The staff would not help at first. We had to wait until the next day for the day guy to arrive and asked him for a change of room. At least he did get us a new/better room. However, just because the room is bigger, doesn't make it better. It still smelled a bit, the bed was still HORRIBLE. In fact, we had to cut our losses and just leave early and book at the Marriott just down the street .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the value, will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: aamargo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the last week of July, our first trip to Maui. We stayed in an oceanfront room in the Kaui wing, king bed except we added 1 more night and moved to a double room. The rooms with double beds were actually bigger so I'd recommend those instead. Staff was very friendly, room was always clean, our room was updated although the building as a whole may look a little dated it's still pretty nice and quaint. After reading some other mixed reviews I'm so glad we decided go stay here. This hotel was as good as its neighbors (Sheraton, etc) but at a better price. Convenient restaurants and store on site, and Whalers Village within walking distance which is great. Nice snorkeling at Black Rock just a few mins walk away and lots of turtles in the water. Took a hula lesson at the hotel, that was quite fun. Wish we would have spent more time doing some other things the hotel offered, but I booked lots of exursions before arriving and so we weren't able to do a lot of the stuff they had for free. Can't wait to go back again. It wasn't crowded, summer season is slow this year for Hawaii, so that made it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful place right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Yakima_WAKaytee
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 5 night stay at KBH and couldn't have been happier. When we arrived they upgraded us to a partial ocean view which was beautiful. The grounds are gorgeous and you're literally just off the beach - also an easy walk to shopping and more restaurants. We went to the welcome breakfast which encourages you to book excursions through them - worth the hour for a free breakfast (I guess). It was very clean and quiet - we would definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Diappointed”
Reviews.Author: rocker48
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in our stay at the KBH. It was not awful, but would not go back again. The room was clean, but small things like no exhaust fan in the bathroom or only one mirror in the room were inconvenient. The common areas and the elevators were bland and shabby. The staff was inconsistent- some very helpful, others not. We ate dinner on our first night at the restaurant and it was horrible. Location was very good and access to the beach was great. The Sheraton next door was not that much more expensive and much, much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauihawaii09
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful stay at the KBH. We stayed there for 11 nights and wished we had booked for longer. Our room was lovely and very clean it had Hawaiian decor with new carpets and tiles in the bathroom. The grounds were so beautiful and well kept and the flowers WOW!!!!!
