We came with our 3 children who were delighted with all the activities the hotel had to offer....hula lessons, ukelele lessons, lei making, garden tours, pinapple cutting...etc. The director of Guest Services Rance Villarimo was always available to answer questions and would chat with us and the children.......everyone in Guest Services was amazing! We felt like family. Our older son loved chatting with Nani at the tour desk and would visit her every day! We learned a lot about the Hawaiian culture and were very sad to leave. The food at the Tiki Terrace was amazing! We will definitely return!!!! Thanks KBH for making Maui feel like home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HaysteLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon as we didn't want to stay in huge faceless chain hotel or complex and we were absolutely blown away by the beauty and amazingly friendly staff at this hotel, we were a bit concerned before our arrival (after we had booked and paid) as we had read some disappointing reveiws but I honestly don't know where they came from- the grounds are fantastic, the staff are very friendly and helpful, the room (we stayed in the Kaui wing) was clean, spacious and beautifully decorated and had a wonderful view of the grounds and the beach. There was champagne waiting for us in our room on arrival and free buffet breakfast at the Mixed Plate Restaurant as a Honeymoon gift from the hotel which we thought was a lovely touch. The buffet breakfast was great quality and very tasty with a huge selection - we would have paid for it if we hadn't been given vouchers. We enjoyed our honeymoon here so much we are planning a secong stay in two years time, in fact after our week at the Kaanapali Beach we went to the MGM Grand in Vegas for a week and were no where near as satisfied as we were with the Kaanapali Beach Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: elh015
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui and stayed with family at a timeshare but planned to spend one night away from the kids to celebrate our anniversary. After reading reviews here, I booked the one night at this hotel and we had a great time. We didn't have a big budget so I booked a garden view, which looked pretty and when we checked in, we learned we were upgraded to an ocean front room. We were on the 2nd floor of the Molokai building with such a beautiful view. And a room that was huge. We spent almost 4 hours just laying on lounge chairs on the lawn area outside our room...all the sounds of the beach but with shade and no sand. The best part was sleeping with the window open and hearing the sound of the ocean all night. We really wished we could have asked to extend our stay, but we needed to return to the rest of our family. One thing the room needed- for a room that had a king bed, plus a sofa that converted to a bed, plus another room with a full size bed, it should have had a mini fridge. Since the room could fit a family, a fridge would be a must. Very friendly staff and a good central location- family joined us the next day for fun on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Spirit Of Aloha Lives at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Two-For-Texas
Reviews.Content: We found out about this hotel on Maui while having lunch in Austin, Texas at a local restaurant. A couple overheard us planning our Hawaii trip and moseyed over to our table to ask if we would like to know of a great place to stay on Maui. Well, they could not say enough good about the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel, its location, its staff and its style of hospitality. Not to mention, it was more cost competitive than many hotels in the Lahaina area. This couple returns annually and stays for a few weeks, they told us. Wonderful hospitality and sharing of Hawaiian culture and history. We stayed for five nights at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel - Feb 15 to Feb 19 - and this was a major enjoyment during our total three week stay in Hawaii. Everything about the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel made us happy to be there. Things that impressed us included: welcome buffet breakfast and songs by staff; daily buffet breakfasts; really good advice on how to get around on Maui; the convenient parking garage; our room and its lanai; the Tiki Bar and the nightly musicians; whale tails visible from the beach; the beach itself and the beach walking path; how we were treated by phone when making reservations; our greeting upon arrival and our special departure with kokui nut leis. The leis hang in our library to remind us of this very special place on Planet Earth and in our hearts. We hope to stay at this hotel again- sooner than later. The hotel lacks the very things that we do not enjoy such as - hundreds of deck chairs and loungers all lined up for the tourist; giant, exotic swimming pool with attractions for kids; overly fancy retaurant with fancy prices; fru fru decor. If you seek that style hotel, then Ka'anapali Beach is not the place for you. On the other hand, we loved the large, park-like courtyard with its many trees and small swimming pool. This hotel does not need a fancy pool and play area because it is right on a superb, wide, sandy beach with a great view and ease of access from your room. Some of those fancy, modernistic hotels do not have much beach at all. The long, beachwalk passes close to the hotel and you can stroll along the beach all the way to the shops and the other hotels. The best thing about Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is the Staff. We cannot extoll them enough. The staff has deep roots in Hawaii and each person could share many things with us involving places to see, meaning of Hawaiian words, history of Hawaii, art of Hawaii and much more. For example, we debated whether or not to make a drive to a village where the map indicated the road might be very hard to travel. Well, one of the staff lives in that very village and we were given helpful information and enjoyed our drive and the peope we met while there. Each night, we enjoyed the three piece Hawaiian band on the outdoor stage, the drinks, the conviviality. Morning breakfast buffets were a great value and we would be full enough so that our next meal might be late afternoon. We stayed in the older Moloka'i Wing, first floor with doors to our lanai and a small view of the beach which was just a few steps away. There was a small guest laundry on the floor which we used. Anything we needed was easy to get from the staff. And, the staff m ade us feel at home. It felt like we were staying with people and not with a corporation. Highly recommended. Steve and Marcia

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, peaceful, friendly”
Reviews.Author: TresJolieMarie
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to return to this hotel. We found the staff charming, helpful and sincere. It is an older hotel, but I prefer quiet, peaceful and friendly. We found most hotels nearby overcrowded, loud and exposed to passerbys. This hotel has large private courtyard with sun or shade. There is a swimming pool, a snack bar and outdoor Tiki Bar. Hawaian music and dance is performed nightly. The night air is filled with the fragrance of plumeria and tuberose. Ahhh...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: alohomora
Reviews.Content: Our original hotel was a major disaster, and we were fortunate enough to get a room at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. They absolutely erased our memories of the awful start to our vacation. Our room was in Kaua'i and it was comfortable, clean, and had a wonderful view of the resort's grounds. Housekeeping staff was excellent. We're in our 20s and I noticed a lot of older couples and families, so this might not be the ideal place for younger people. We spent our days out exploring, so it didn't bother us in the slightest. The on-site restaurant and bar are decent, but on the spendy side and the food wasn't anything special. Also, the live music they had every night was absolutely wonderful! We loved to open our patio door and let the music drift in. The greatest part was the lei ceremony on our last day. They really appreciate and care about their guests here! We'll definitely stay here again if we end up back in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: IndyCyndi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live on Oahu and made our first trip to Maui in June. After reading the reviews of the hotel and looking at pictures, I felt confident in my reservation. I was very disappointed upon my arrival. I did not feel like the pictures of the hotel told a true story. From what I could see, the entire hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. Everything looks tired and worn. Our room was at the far end of the complex and there was no elevator to our third floor room. Not a huge deal because we are young and only had a weekend bag. This would be a big deal to older visitors and those with large suitcases. We had free vouchers for the hotel's breakfast buffet at the Mixed Plate restaurant. We got take out the first morning since we were catching an early snorkel trip. We were some of the first people in line so there was no excuse for the poor quality of the food. We took two bites and threw it away. We didn't even bother to go back the next morning. If you are traveling to Maui on a budget and don't mind cheap hotels, this hotel will do. Just don't expect any bells or whistles. They didn't even have shampoo and conditioner in the room. It is well-located on the west side of the island and you can walk to the Whalers Village for meals and entertainment. If you are looking for a resort experience, this is not the hotel. Not a great pool and not much atmosphere. Luckily, we knew this was not are only trip to Maui so we made laughed it off and made the best of it. If this would have been my honeymoon, yearly vacation or one and only trip to Maui, I would have been very upset.

Reviews.Title: “most hawaiian hotel indeed!”
Reviews.Author: sparkle_gurrl
Reviews.Content: this hotel was huge, including the grounds. we could have easily just spent our entire time just on the hotel property, cos there was so much to do! the pool was great (although there were lots of kids!), there was a massive checker board, which coconuts as the pieces, a tiki bar (with cool drinks in cute souvineer glasses), a tiki restaurant (with decent food), and lots of lounging space. the room itself was not bad. it was a garden view, on the main floor. we had our own little terrace, but since it was on the main floor, we didn't use it, and we kept the shutters closed, since anyone could have walked by. that was abit annoying since we were on our honeymoon, but they did give us a free bottle of champagne. breakfast was really good. there was tons to choose from, however the line up to get in was long! sometimes we had to wait 20 minutes to be seated. the hotel was in a great location. it was walking distance to an outdoor mall, and its right on the beach. you definately need a car if you want to se more of the island though, and parking is not free! the hotels offers loads of free activities, living up to their slogan of the most hawaiian hotel. they can teach you how to play the ukulele, dance, make a lei, and many other things. the morning after you check in, there is a meet and greet, which was nice. and when you check out, there is a whole ceremony, and you get a really nice lei. whenever you return to the hotel, you are supposed to bring it back with you, and they will add a different colour nut on it, to signify how many times you have been. overall, a nice place indeed, and I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It was like a cruise on land”
Reviews.Author: landjfk
Reviews.Content: Staying here was an absolutely fabulous experience. I have never been treated so well at a hotel in my life. My family said it best -- "this was the best vacation we have ever had." The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The Sunday champagne brunch was fantastic. The ability to relax in the beautiful courtyard was exactly what I needed. I could go on and on, but basically we would love to return to this hotel and plan to do so in the near future. My family has never felt this way about any other vacation location we have visited.

Reviews.Title: “went for 25th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: rainbowribbon2002
Reviews.Content: location is ideal, it is in the middle of really ritzy hotels, has beach front property, balcony, pool, beautiful mountain view in back, saw a rainbow almost every day, cookie lady visits people in the evening, (turn down service) , everyone is so nice, and they really stick to the roots of their culture, a short 3 minute walk to a mall made good for evening shopping...room was clean, bathroom needed a face lift....location/beach was great! watched cliff diver light tourch every night, has hawaiian singers in evening, watch them from your balcony, could see whales, went snorkeling by cliff, (7 minute walk on beach) great colorful fish, and sea turtles, could hear whales talking..... i did not purchase any excursions from them, alittle pricey, get a coupon book or go to lanei and book directly with companies.....

Reviews.Title: “This hotel surpassed my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: mauiPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Maui with my husband and children,ages 12 and 9, was exceptional at this hotel. The warm and friendly atmosphere and beauty was amazing. This hotel not only provided us an awesome place to stay beach,pool, garden,best snorkeling at Black Rock only yards away-it enriched our knowledge of Hawaii and the beautiful culture it prides itself with. The hotel offered complimentary classes on hula dancing, ukelele,sand art, lei making, notecard, story telling, and garden walks. Not only were the activities fun my family and I were given detailed information on the culture and how the activities relate to their history. Malihini,staff member, taught most of our classes and her pride in sharing her wealth of knowledge embraced us all. This hotel also offered complimentary entertainment nightly at their Tiki Terrace Restaurant next to the beautiful gardens, this entertainment was superb-dancing,singing, hula, ukele. The entertainment was just as fabulous as the expensive luas offered at Maui. I walked along all the hotels along Kaanapali and did not get the warm welcome feeling that the Kaanapali beach hotel gave me. If I am ever fortunate to get back to Maui-Kaanapali Beach Hotel is where you will find me.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Family Trip to Maui”
Reviews.Author: mwinkle001
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Maui with the family....(4 kids under the age of 18) and had a great time. We stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and it was perfect. It's known as the most authentic hotel in Kaanapali. The price was extremely reasonable (especially when comparing to the Westin, Hyatt, etc.). And, you are in the middle of all the hotels. You can head out to the beach from the hotel, walk to Whalers Village, or just hang out by the pool (good size, just needs to be a little updated when you compare it to the pool at the Westin with a water slide for kids). We stayed for 5 days and had plenty to do. Definitely rent a car to explore the island. We spent one day driving the Road to Hana. It's an extremely windy road with one lane bridges and beautiful lush scenery. Pass the town of Hana and head to the Waimoku waterfall and the seven sacred pools to take dip. You can take a 4 mile hike (even my 6 and 9 year old came along, no complaints) and pass through this amazing bamboo forest to reach the waterfall. On another day we took Captain Steve's rafting trip to Lanai. Although it was a little pricey, it was SO worth it! They serve you breakfast and lunch on the boat and take you to see tons of dolphins and great snorkeling spots. We also took a day to just do very little, relax by the pool..go to the beach...rent surfboards to surf (you can rent these near the Westin). We had a blast!! Maui never disappoints and we can't wait to go back! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: OCLuv2Trvl
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. When we arrived, I was not pleased with the so-called "ocean view" room I was given. It was obscured by several trees and was definitely a "partial-ocean view" in my book. By 6pm that same night, we were transferred to a beautiful "ocean view" room. The front desk staff were so accomodating!! They really do treat you like family. We had the same experience with the housekeeping and engineering staff. When we had a problem, they made things right in a timely manner. We tried out all three restaurants on the premise and found the food delicious and reasonable. We also went to some of the free classes they offer and loved the fact that we were just footsteps to the beach and to the Trilogy Shack where you can get towels and rent cabanas, fins, snorkel, etc. They also offer great scuba, snuba and snorkel trips. The pool is adequate, but since we have a pool at home, it wasn't our main focus. We checked out other hotels and still felt we had the best view and the best deal for the price. Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful vacation we ever had”
Reviews.Author: PolishMauilover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at KBH for one week and absolutely loved it! The hotel has the most beautiful grounds in the whole neighborhood and it's located on the best part of the Ka'anapali Beach, close to Black Rock with it's snorkeling opportunities. We loved the entertainment and Tiki Bar. We very much enjoyed the food at the Ka'anapali Mixed Plate restaurant that is located right next to the hotel entrance and has a buffet with great local dishes at very reasonable prices. We would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dump1567
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from June 30th to July 7th. This was our first trip to Maui & was a late honeymoon/ 40th B-day for me. Instead of just reviewing this Hotel, I'm going to review my whole trip, so bare with me. Hopefully, you can find some helpful info. in all this. We booked the trip trough Expedia which seemed to be on par price wise with the other on-line travel agencies. Some of the features I liked while booking was the option to upgrade cars, rooms, non-stop flight etc. Travel Guides: We took "Maui Revealed". A lot of great info. Also, all over the Island are travel guides with maps. These are filled with discount coupons for different food and attractions. Flight: We took a non-stop flight on United. If your tall, pay for the $50 upgrade to Economy plus. You'll appreciate the extra leg room. Also, the emergency exits have the most leg room, but you must be willing to help out in an emergency. When you check-in with your flight prior to departure, you may be able to get these emergency exit seats without having to pay the upgrade (we did on the flight over). Packing: Pack light. United charges $125 for over 50 pounds. But I found they didn't really pay too close attention to this. They also charge for each booked bag (cheaper if paid before hand on-line). We brought more than we needed. I had no need for slack or a coloered shirt. If you do an activity at a hight altitude, it can get cold. So take that into consideration. But there's no reason not to bring back a nice Maui sweatshirt you bought. If you plan on buying shirts or other clothing in Maui, just wear it while your there. This will allow plenty of room in your suitcase for those souvenir bring backs. The flight offered only free drinks and everything else you had to pay for (although head sets are now free and the jack will work with your ipod head phones). They offfered food for purchase, but if you want to save money, bring your own snacks or sandwiches (TSA will make you ditch your drinks). Car rental: If your going to drive most the Island and spend time in the car, make sure your car is big enough and comfortable. Also beware of upgrades they'll offer you. Know what your insurance or credit card will cover before you go, or you may end-up paying for extra not needed coverage. We were offered a convertible upgrade, but with temps in the high 80's, I wanted air conditioning. I also didn't feel at a loss without a convertible, but it's a personal preference. Food and items to bring to the hotel: There's a Costco and Wal-mart on the way to the hotel. We stopped at Wal-mart and picked-up some snacks. We also picked-up a case of water to leave in the car & a case to leave in the room. The rooms have mini-friges, but no Microwave. Don't forget utensils (paper plate, towels, bowls, spoons, knife, etc,). We also picked-up some rollout sand mats for just under two bucks. These we just left behind. Cheap towels may also be a good idea if you plan to checkout different beachs. The hotel offers free towels to use for the beach, but they're the same as the shower towels in the rooms. And if you didn't bring your own snorkel gear, this may be the time to pick some up. Sets sell for $30 to $50. Rental's I saw where $8.00 for two hours. And don't forget sunblock , hats and watershirts to swim/snorkel in that are SPF rated. The sun will eat you up. The Hotel: Staff was friendly, and the room was clean. But this is an older hotel. If you like a new hotel that's more upscale, this isn't it. It worked fine for our needs. Our bacony room was on the top floor (6th) and faced the pool. You had to stand on the balcony to see the ocean (I think they consider this a ocean view). We spent ever morning out there feeding the birds and mapping out our day. We also sat out there at night enjoying the music from the band that plays every night. No major problems, but they were doing construction upgrades to the wing next to ours. And one of the two elevators wasn't working for about 4 days. The grounds here are larger than any of the other hotels I saw. A ton of grass area complete with chairs. Also, several trees to lay under if you want out of the sun. They have a nice activities rental hut right at the boardwalk. This is were you get your towels for the beach. Or can rent snorkel gear, booging boards, etc. And there's a shower to rinse off sand right near the hut on the boardwalk. The beach in this area is nice and big compared to the beach area in front of some of the newer hotels. The waves are just small shorebreak. Further down the beach are some nice surfing waves. But as you drive Hwy 30 into Kaanapali, you'll see other nice beaches with surfing waves. The other end of the beach takes you to Black Rock. This has some excellent snorkeling. We even saw sea turtles here. The Hotel offers you a free buffet breakfast. They give some great info. at this breakfast on activivites around the island and a few other things. And there's a ton of different free activities offered at the hotel you can sign-up for. They also give you a checkout lay. Parking is $9.00 a day, but my room safe was free. And since it was our honeymoon, they gave us some free champagne, chocolates & cookies with bed turndown service. Very nice touches. The prices at the hotel gift shop were on par with everywhere else. Internet is available in the lobby (at a cost) if you just need to check your e-mail. Food: The hotel offers a few different buffet choices. They also have a mixed plate restaurant, but we never made it inside. There's plenty of places to eat for $20 to $40, but if you look around, you'll find cheaper places. Subway and Round table pizza are only five minutes away. The tiki grill at the hotel isn't a bad deal. $10 burgers and 3 chicken or beef skewers for $8. And the bar offerers drink specials. Avoid the food court at Whalers village (the Mc Donalds is probably ok), but the rest tasted or looked horrible. There's also plent y of outdoor farmer markets to check out. There's a real nice one on Lower Honopali'ilani Rd towards Napili. Complete with free tasting. Choose between 10 different jams or dips. Also plenty of fresh fruit or breads to buy. Check out Mama's Fish House on your way to or coming back from Hana. Excellent food, view, and atmosphere. It really isn't that expensive when you compare it to what they're charging at the hotel restaurants. And for breakfast, try Pineapple bananna pancakes w/ macadania nuts and coconut syrup at the Gazebo. Park in the Napili Shores parking lot and follow the signs. Other Hotels: You can walk the boardwalk all the way down to the last resort in this area. This is where you'll see the newer hotels in the area. Some are definetly more kid friendly with beautiful pools. But I noticed there wasn't much area to hangout in and this included the beach in front of these hotels. So I guess the trade off is newer/nicer rooms, but more kids and crowds. We booked several adventures: Make sure you know the location of the outfit you booked with in correlation to the hotel. No sense driving two hours away to do something they offer 5 minutes form the hotel (we did this with Ziplining). We drove two hours to the Skyline Eco-Adventure at Haleakala, when it's offered by the same outfit 10 minutes away in Kaanapali. I was very pleased with this Zip line company. We also took the Pacific Whale Foundation boat to Molokini & Turtle Arches for snorkeling. I recommend joining the Pacific Whale Foundation, as the savings on this trip by being a member, pays for the membership. And you get a free shirt. This seemed like a very professional outfit, and I would use them again. Lu'au: We did the Old Lahaina Lu'au, which is just off Front St. in Lahaina right next to the Aloha mixed plated (our waiter at Aloha mixed plate was also a dancer at the lu'au). Everyone we talked to recommended this Lu'au, and we weren't disapointed. There's also the Feast at Lele, that offers dancing and food from Hawai'i, Tonga, Tahiti, and Samoa. The Old Lahaina being just Hawaiian. If you go during the fourth of July: There's a fireworks display in Old Lahaina. And fireworks are permitted on the beach and can be purchased at Wal-mart (wish i had known ahead of time). Road to Hana: Your choice. We just went to mile marker 2. Walked a mile inland to the waterfall there. Wife swam in the pond. If you want that jungle feel but don't want to do the road to Hana, we found an area about 15 minutes from Kaanapali. The parking area to Honolua bay (excellent snorkeling) is like a jungle. This is just past Napili. You have to walk through this thick jungle vegetation on a trail just to get to the bay. Complete with wild roosters (which seem to be all over the Island). Sunday Service: The hotel offers a non-denominational service. I also noticed several of the other hotels setting-up services. Westside Calvary Chapel is only 5 minutes up the road. Early service is in their new building & the late service is held down the road on one of the small beaches off Hwy 30. Overall this is a nice Hotel and I wouldn't hesitate in staying here again. After driving around most of the Island, I felt Kaanapali was the best place to stay on the whole Island. I hope this info. helps with your trip. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we could have imaged”
Reviews.Author: hazmar
Reviews.Content: Hawaii has always been my husbands dream location, and I was very concerned that he might have been disappointed.. I need not have worried, he just loved it, cant wait to plan our next visit. When we arrived in Maui we had the bad luck to get stuck in a bush fire. We were stuck on the road for eight hours. Boy were we fed up, I was with my husband and another couple. You can image how pleased we were to reach the Hotel, and what a Hotel. The staff were wonderful, every single one of them, Our room was beautiful. We relaxed as soon as we arrived there. The next morning we were greeted to a ceramony to welcome us to breakfast adttheir lovely Hotel. The entertainment was truely Hawaiian, and just what we were hoping to see. The food in the Hotel was great, but what ever you do, do not miss Sunday Brunch, Superb, we sat for two hours, the champagne flowed and the food, oh the food, something for everyone. All this time hawaaian folk music played. I have never cried before upon leaving a holiday, but after the very moving ceramony given to all guests as they leave, I couldnt help myself. We would definately go back to the Kannapali Beach Hotel on our next visit, it may not be the most up to date Hotel in Maui, but it is certainly the one with the most heart and the biggest welcome and the best of all, at least for us, the most Hawaiian.

Reviews.Title: “I would call it the 3p's- pleasure, perfection and paradise”
Reviews.Author: NanSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This was our first time on Maui and we could not have chosen a better Hotel to stay in, to get the true feel of Hawaiian culture and hospitality. The staff were more courteous and caring than anywhere else that we have stayed and I am brimming over with admiration and love for them that I find it hard to put into words. My friends feel the same and we can't wait to return. This was our holiday of a lifetime and we could not have wished for a better destination. The rooms were excellent. They were clean and well furnished. Food was delicious, especially the champagne brunch. We were there when the Hawaiian guitar festival was on and it was amazing. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise '08”
Reviews.Author: Wary_Traveler_9
Reviews.Content: Better ocean view than some more expensive hotels. A very pleasant surprise. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: rosekristin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBH 4 years ago for our Honeymoon and had a wonderful time. We were back last week for our "Babymoon" and had a terrific time once again. The staff is welcoming and helpful. The grounds are well kept and the updated rooms in the Kauai Building are beautiful. We will definitely be back for many more visits to come. Thanks KBH!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: aseymour1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for week and absolutely loved it. We even walked the beach daily and checked out the other resorts and still thought this was the best by far for the $. The grounds are bigger and more lush than many of the other hotels, and was one of the few places you got free nightly entertainment. The food & drinks we're very comparable to what you would pay anywhere else. I will definately be staying here on my next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL - TRULY THE MOST HAWAIIAN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: RICKF406
Reviews.Content: What a terrific hotel. I just stayed at the hotel with my family last week. They certainly made me feel like family, The whole staff is fantastic. The guest service agents conduct FREE intereactive Hawaiian activities that really give you a taste of the island's history. What more could you ask for ? The staff really shows a lot of patience. The welcome as well as the farewell ceremony brought tears to my eyes. I did not want to leave. It was like I was leaving my best friend. My room was overlooking the ocean. It was wonderful looking and listening to the surf. The food that is served in the restaurants is great, and everything is close to the hotel including supermarkets. I have stayed at more expensive hotels like Hiltons and Westins, but I would truly stay at Kannapali beach hotel again before I stayed at those. Give it a try, you won.t be sorry. Richard Furtado, So Dartmouth, MASSACHUSETTS.

Reviews.Title: “This is such a family/friendly atmosphere. I felt like I was at home only pampered!”
Reviews.Author: karensp69
Reviews.Content: My 2 sons and I and a friend went in June and we had a wonderful time. I had broken my ankle 2 days before arriving and the guest services helped me rent a wheelchair and all staff were very accomodating. My family enjoyed surfing, swimming, shopping, and snorkeling. The food was outstanding and the entertainment very nice. I have been to Hawaii 8 times visiting Oauhu, Lahina, and Maui before and Maui is my favorite. I felt I was treated to enjoy their culture and atmosphere. It was the best relaxing vacation we have ever taken. Thank you so much for the wonderful memories!

Reviews.Title: “Next best thing to a honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: weathermanNewYork
Reviews.Content: Wow! what a terrific vacation as my wife and I loved our choice of staying at truely "Hawaii's most Hawaiin Hotel" The grounds here are beautifully landscaped and without being overcrowded. The goregeous beach is just a 50 yard walk away and there's fantastic snorkeling within a 5 minute walk down the beach, don't need to spend a lot of money for an excursion, just rent the equipment there and go in! we saw so many fish and sea turtles which were right in the wash! amazing. I would highly recommend the romantic package if you're traveling with someone special as it includes a car, picnic, which can feed an army! massage and diner cruise, we also went to the nearby Old Lahaina luau which was fabulous. I've never stayed anywhere where the staff was more friendly and helpful, you really get to know them, they were just great! This is not a huge high rise hotel, it's large enough but yet intiment so you know that you're really in Hawaii, and not some big city resort. Definitly a "10". I hope we'll be able to go back some day since I can't say enough good things about our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to soak up the local culture”
Reviews.Author: airbender1963
Reviews.Content: Others say this hotel is a plain jane, I thought it very charming. The staff is incredible, they go way out of their way to be helpful and generous. When I asked questions about places to eat and things to do I felt like I got a "local" perspective and not just a sales pitch for a tourist. The room was nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A great way to absorb Hawaiian culture.”
Reviews.Author: akspeech
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 274. We came for my nephew's wedding, which was held on the grounds right in front of the ocean. I, and many of my family members, really liked the free classes. I learned alot about Hawaiian culture (the story telling class), and we were fortunate that Hawaiian steel guitar events coincided with our stay. I give the hotel alot of credit for investing in their employees (they attend Hawaiian culture classes), and it is evident that they are treated well. I really liked having a fridge in the room, so we didn't have to eat breakfast out. One small tip -- if you need hair conditioner, bring it. They provide "shampoo/conditioner" (all in one), but it really only functions as shampoo. We took the "Trilogy" snorkle/sail cruise, and it was fantastic. It departs from a kiosk right on the Kaanapali property. The food was excellent (cinnamon rolls for breakfast, BBQ chicken for lunch) and they gave just the right amount of guidance for an excellent snorkle experience. We also did a zip line experience which was fun, but if you want to do it, I would advise bringing shorts and a T-shirt that you don't particularly care about. The hills that you climb to get to the zip lines are quite dusty and the dirt is red, and doesn't wash out of clothes. I made the mistake of wearing newly purchased clothes. The Kaanapali appears to have alot more built in activities than the other resorts, the grounds have more dimension. The pool is open from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm. I wish it opened at 7:00 am, so that I could take a dip before there was sun on the pool. I found the sun to be much more intense than I could have imagined. I put on 45 sun block and covered my body as much as I could, but I still walked away with a nasty burn. The hotel appears to be one of the best values in Hawaii. It's not a 5 star resort, but it's warm and we found it fulfilling.

Reviews.Title: “Return ticket please-again.”
Reviews.Author: Marene
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at KBH over the Christmas period for the last 4 years and hoping to make it for the fifth visit this year. It's not a flash hotel-but it's all about location and service. Here you have the plainest "home" on the best beach strip- let's face it-how much time do you spend in your room when you have beautiful grounds and a gorgeous beach. Short stroll to Whalers village- no need to have a car. Shuttle buses totake you around-small fee. The place has a beautiful "old world" hawaiian feel to it- the other massive resorts-once inside you wouldn't know whether you're in Vegas, LA or Florida- just big commercial and cold-no atmosphere. If you need a massive pool, waterfalls, slides etc-this is not the place for you. If you want location, atmosphere, service with a smile, manicured tropical gardens and the beach.......this is the place for you. Still can't work out why some people travel all the way to Maui- to sit by a pool. If you're in Kaanapali in Dec- you can actually see the whales swimming through...can't see that at the pool....maybe sometime ; )

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Hana_hou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from almost three weeks in Maui at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. This was our sixth stay at Mauiâ€™s most Hawaiian hotel. It had been three years since our last visit and we were very happy to see that the hotel is still as wonderful as ever. The staff cannot do enough to make your stay perfect. Dale always keeps everyone at the Tiki Bar happy with his excellent service and lively conversation. We also enjoyed the fabulous Dinner Theatre Magic Show called Kupanaha at the hotel one night. Children to seniors will enjoy this show â€“ there is something for everyone during the performance. We never miss the Sunday brunch in the Tiki Terrace Restaurant. This year for the Fatherâ€™s Day brunch on Sunday, Willy K. performed making it even more special. The nightly hula show in the courtyard was very good. Friday nights children from the various dance schools perform. Margaret & Peter (New York, USA)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karenelaine65
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Maui, and we stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel from June 10th to the 21st. One guest we spoke with said he has been to Maui 9 times and 6 of those times have been at KBH now as he won't go anywhere else. I can see why. Staff were very friendly and the the hotel lives up to it's "most Hawaiian" hotel theme. We stayed in the Kauai wing, and our room was kept very clean. There was some remodeling of the 5th floor being done, but I can't say that it bothered us as they started mid-morning and we were always on our way out for breakfast and to do things. We both thought the food was great at the Tiki Terrace, The Tiki Grill, and at the Kaanapali Mixed plate. The Sunday Champagne Brunch was absolutely to die for, though, and was probably the best food extravaganza I've ever experienced. They had table after table of various foods set up in a room and it was amazing (and all you could eat and drink of champagne or other nonalcoholic beverages if you choose)! It included steamed seafood (and raw oysters!), various meats, including ones that can be carved right off the bone, salads galore, and various fruit that you can dip in the flowing chocolate fountain if you want. If you stay here, don't miss it! Food at the hotel isn't cheap, particularly at the Tiki Terrace, although the Kaanapali Mixed Plate was quite affordable compared to many restaurants we ate at in Lahaina, but it is buffet dining, and both my husband and I thought the food was very good. I would consider the hotel more casual in nature overall, which suited our style. There is no exercise room or fancy amenities, although we did get fresh exotic flowers put in our room during our stay. The pool is small by some people standards, but I really didn't see alot of people using it so it wasn't crowded. You do have to pay a parking fee of $9/day, $1.50/day for use of the keyed safe in the room, and for internet usage ( we didn't use it so I don't have the cost). Again, I can't say enough about the friendliness of all of the staff, and our maid service was excellent (thank you Lina). We hope someday to return to Maui and to this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “They empasize that this hotel is the "most Hawaiian hotel," and i agree with them”
Reviews.Author: MauiAloha
Reviews.Content: Aloha! My family and I had just returned from an enjoyable vacation at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. The staff is very friendly and is alway strives to make your stay the best. The environment of the hotel is very relax and chill. If your looking for a five star hotel, this hotel is probably not that you'll be interested in. They empasize that this hotel is the "most Hawaiian hotel," and i agree with them; during my stay I felt that I have learned a lot about the cultural aspect of the Hawaiian traditions. There is an 'Ohana Fun center and guest services where the hotel provides complimentary Hawaiian activities for no cost (activities such as lei making, hula lessons...). My family and I stayed in the sixth floor in the Maui rooms. The view from the balcony was amazing! The view showed the beautiful garden in the court yard, a glimps of the beach as well as the pool (we were able to see whether or not the pool was busy or not). The view east of the hotel room was spectacular---with many beautiful valleys and the garden around the hotel. The first day we arrived, a rainbow was displayed on the east :) Cons: I would say that security in this hotel is not the best. I feel this way because the entire hotel is not connected to each other. So, in order to get to the lobby you would have to walk outside to get there. And anyone from outside can access the elevators. Another negative aspect is the "complimentary" internet access they said they would provided. I thought that the Wi-Fi would be "complimentary" in the lobby, but I was wrong. There is internet access-- if you pay $9.95 per day or use the computers in the lobby and pay per minute. (But then again we are really there to enjoy Maui and relaxation, not to be glued to the computer. )

Reviews.Title: “Encapsulated the Aloha Spirit”
Reviews.Author: egd07
Reviews.Content: Overall, my family's experience at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel was very enjoyable. We read reviews here and though most were generally positive, there were a few negative ones that made us a little unsure of what to expect. I think your perspective of this hotel depends on your what you plan to do while in Maui. If you are interested in getting an authentic Hawaiian feel, learning about the culture, exploring the island, or doing outdoor activities, this hotel would be one for you. However, if you are looking for a place where you can spend most of your time hanging out and lounging around the hotel, a more resort-type experience, like room service, spa, fancy restaurants, etc, this probably would not be the best fit. The pros of the hotel: The staff/guest service employees are all very helpful, kind, and friendly. They extend the warmth of the Hawaiian culture while providing quality service. The complimentary activities such as the activities/information desk, lei-making, pineapple cutting demo, nightly music/entertainment, informative welcome breakfast buffet (not pushing any certain companies, just helpful hints to customize your time and enjoyment to what you want) and other Hawaiian cultural activities are great as well. The grounds of the hotel are nicely maintained and there is quite a bit of shade from the trees-great for those who want to relax outside but not broil in the sun (I noticed other resorts didn't have a lot of trees or shade on the grounds). The pool is not large and extravagant, but it wasn't crowded. The lanai was spacious and comfortable. The Tiki Bar had a great atmosphere. Didn't try the other restaurants-the Deli Corner at the hotel had a decent selection snacks/drinks. The macadamia nut cookies they left on your pillow in the evening were delicious! The location of the hotel is great. The beach is very nice, soft sand, gorgeous clear water (not rocky at the bottom). You can see Black Rock from the beach front. Close to lots of activities, shopping (we walked down to Whaler's Village frequently-less than 5 minutes), water sports, and dining. Parking ($9) is very close to the hotel. The rooms are not huge, but comfortable enough for our needs. The style/decor is fine (not a big deal for us). The cons of the hotel: We stayed in the Moloka'i wing, which I believe has not been updated. They are updating the hotel (we never heard any noise though), so the other wings may be improved. The beds were a little small-not queen size. The toilet/shower area is a little tight and could use a little update (the sink/counter outside of the toilet/shower were a good size and fine). Not a fancy or ultra-modern hotel. We would definitely stay again. Made us feel like family. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! WHAT AN AWESOME PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: traveling55555
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best I have ever stayed at! It is not fancy and "high class," but that is the appeal of this hotel! They make you feel awesome when you stay there! They do the little things to make you feel special such as cookies at night, welcome and parting gifts. The hotel is super clean and the staff is very friendly. I wouldn't stay anywhere else when I go back to Maui. It is right on the beach. Great place and great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “KBH, the friendlist place on Maui”
Reviews.Author: NoneCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Aloha, We just had the most relaxing vacation at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. The staff is so friendly and it has the best beach in the world. We love choosing a place on the grass to rest and then swim in the lovely pool or ocean. It is a great location. We didn't even need a car this time. It is our favorite hotel anywhere. We like it so much that we even named our "start-up" company Maui Imaging, Inc. Sue and Don

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: julesandheath
Reviews.Content: We had ourselves the best time ever staying at this hotel. It was thanks to the tripadvisor reviewers that we chose to stay here - thank you all who have posted. It's important to be aware upfront, that this is the "grand daddy" of the hotels on this strip. It might need a lick of paint here or there but for comfort, value, location, service, facilities and the most beautiful team of people you'll ever come across, then this is the place to stay. This hotel would be a hit for all groups - families, honeymooners and those who want a bit of a tipple, there is a great cocktail bar for you just next to the pool. The hotel is a U shape so that the pool, Tiki Bar, Tiki Restaurant, sunbathing areas, chess area (giant chess with coconuts as markers) among others, are all facing on to the beach. This makes you feel that no matter where you are staying, you are very close to the beach - which you are anyway as it's absolute beach front. We chose one of the cheaper options of accommodation and were thrilled. We received room # 269 of the Kaui wing which although wasn't directly facing the ocean, we certainly enjoyed easily looking right for beautiful views of the ocean from our room. The room was quite a large size. The bathroom was great although it has a slight design flaw with the door - but if you keep the door shut when you're in it there's no problems, we just happen to shower with the door open. We really loved our cocktails at the Tiki Bar and we also had dinner one night at the Tiki Restaurant. There is also a magic show dinner if you want - we had a preview and it looked pretty good. If we'd had more time we'd have gone. The absolute highlight of this beautiful hotel was the staff, particularly the Guest Relations staff. A strikingly beautiful Hawaiian lady (sorry, I couldn't remember her name) has gorgeous long hair and you will see do a hula dance on stage at the evening show, i think at 6pm. She is also the host of the farewell ceremony which is significant in it's meaning but she makes it a spiritual event to experience. She was a beautiful warm person and we loved meeting her. There is also a welcome breakfast that you'll be invited to. Yes it's a free cooked breaky but the stage show is informative and fun and the host is hilaroious. If you can pronounce his name at reception the rumour is you'll receive big discounts! 5 minutes walk down the beach to the left is Whaler's Village. Here are a heap of shops and restaurants - and also a food court. We had a few meals here for dinner (chinese or pizza etc) and for breaky although there was a mcdonalds we went to Nick's in the same group of shops - he makes fantastic hot cooked breakfasts for about $7 and breaky next door in the same group of shops for smoothies. It's very inexpensive and you eat so much you'll be fine til dinner! We will be returning to Maui and instead of staying at Paia (convenient for my windsurfer hubby) we will stay here because it is just so good. The sunsets on the beach in front of the hotel can't be beat, Whaler's Village is close, Tiki bar's cocktails are delicous, the hotel is lovely and comfortable - but the happy and lovely staff take such pride in their jobs that there is such a good feeling about them and staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Hawaiian Experience”
Reviews.Author: ohana00
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a tremendous hotel to experience the authentic Hawaiian experience..from the amazing knowledgeable friendly staff to the excellent location on Kaapanali Beach, this hotel offers everything for you to enjoy. In addition to contemporary cuisine, you can enjoy local hawaiian cusine in any of the restaurants including a 'luau meal' for dinner. The free nighlty entertainment is an excellent way to end a day while relaxing to the hawaiian sounds and looking at the sunset. My kids 7 and 11, thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and had fun playing a 'Giant' game of checkers with coconuts (yes coconuts) as the play pieces. I would definitely recommend this hotel and WILL be back.. You are truly OHANA (family) at this hotel...Mahalo and Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Maui Hotel Search Is Over”
Reviews.Author: Skyhawk72u
Reviews.Content: In 1994 my wife and I were married in Maui less than one mile from the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. That was our first trip to Maui but since then we have been back to the Hawaiian Islands four more times. We always visit two islands each trip but we always include Maui as one because it is our favorite. May 18th we went back and spent six days on Oahu and seven on Maui. As usual while planning our trip we checked the reviews of hotels and did a lot of research. We have stayed in the Kaanapali area on each of our visits but never at the same hotel. After much research this time we decided to try the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and now we never again need to spend the time reading reviews. Most of the other hotels we stayed at were much larger and had more "glitz", but none (in our opinion) could hold a candle to this one. We had a partial ocean view, which was exceptional. Our room was clean and very nice and included a small refrigerator which more than suited our needs. The beach was excellent although most of our stay we had red beach flags and did not spend a lot of time in the ocean. The pool (which we did use a lot) was small but was not crowded and was very nice. Our stay included breakfast each morning, which was very good and was varied. I guess you could say the hotel had all of the things you would expect. What sets this hotel apart is the atmosphere. All of the hotel staff, maids, grounds keepers, bartenders, front desk workers, valets, gift shop workers, everyone, were the greatest people you could ask for. There is no way our stay could have been any better and the staff of this hotel, along with the small (REAL) Hawaiian atmosphere of the grounds is what made the difference. We will be going back almost every year and we have found our hotel. There is no longer any reason to spend hours going over reviews. I just hope nothing changes. There was remodeling going on in two of the wings while we were there. As a matter of a fact we were on the sixth floor and the entire floor below us was being remodeled in our wing but we were never bothered by noise and never had any problem getting one of the two elevators. I will add pictures to the review later

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Funny42day
Reviews.Content: This hotel give you true Hawaii and a great location. Just minutes to great shopping and sitting on the best beach ever for walk out snorkeling and sunbathing. Just a nice walk down the beach walk is great shopping at the Whaler shopping mall and lots of good food and free entertainment galore! You can't go wrong here unless you expect fancy over the top rooms!

Reviews.Title: “nice but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: bairfootn
Reviews.Content: While the reviews are true the staff is wonderful the hotel leaves something to be desired. I made our reservations months in advance so we could get into the newer building but was put in the older wing. They did upgrade us to the suite. The room was old, ugly and anything but peaceful. The bed coverings are polyester, kelly green wild hawaiin print - I turned them over to expose the white underside, as there were 2 beds of too much print. A few upgrades and this place would be a gem. The location was fabulous, we loved that there were chairs all over the property and chaise rentals right on the beach which is feet in front of the hotel. Everything was OK, the view from our room and the location of the hotel and once again the staff were all excellent. We would not stay here again, I am not a hotel snob but this place is just a bit too old for me.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: slstanley
Reviews.Content: If you are used to a marriot or similar you will be disappointed in this hotel. This hotel is advertised as the most hawaiin hotel and I guess that what it is. There are no fancy facilities, the pool is small and the rooms are ok. Not kept very clean, in fact there was a bug on the floor in our room when whe arrived which I purpously left to see how long it would be to be swept up....it was still there the day we left. Location, however is good......it is amongst other hotels on the beach. Another grievance was we had to pay $9 a day for parking even though we were guests at the hotel. If you are looking for an upscale hotel at Kannapali beach, I suggest the Hyatt or similar. If you are looking for a family type vacation hotel this is your place. For those of you who are English, I would compare this to a Butlins Holiday Camp without all the entertainment ( although there is some, including an english family of magicians)

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel was a lovely experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jagtones
Reviews.Content: We had a nice ground floor room with a walk-out to the pool area/beach. We had a king-size bed and a daybed. Our girls (ages 9 & 12) slept on the daybed facing opposite directions (for more room). The bed could have been a little bigger. The other choice was 2 queen-size beds. We really enjoyed all of the free activities you could sign up for. The family enjoyed a hula dance lesson, Ukulele lesson, making leis, cutting and eating pineapple. There were several activities to enjoy! The hotel had 3 eating places. The first night we ate dinner at the main restaurant and the food was amazing and beautifully prepared! I would recommend going to their website to see the location and all that they offer. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is the most economical choice for families on Kaanapali Beach.”
Reviews.Author: cre8adventures
Reviews.Content: As a travel consultant with cre8adventures.com, I've seen quite a few resort hotels in Maui. The Kaanapali Beach Hotel surprised me, in a good way. The resort provides something none of the other resorts on this awesome stretch of beach can - authentic aloha spirit. It's not a luxurious option for sure, but ongoing maintenance keeps the hotel in satisfactory condition. And the following features helped me look past small annoyances: - excellent beachfront location - fun regional touches - free sunset hula shows - Hawaiian activities - Hawaiian meals - performances of Hawaiian songs and dances by the staff This property is a throwback to Old Hawaii. It offers a real change of pace. That it's close to golf, tennis, shopping and all of Kaanapali's attractions is icing on the cake. The landscaping and outdoor facilites aren't amazing, but the courtyard with a large lawn and a whale-shaped pool facing the placid beach is nice. The terrace restaurant roasts a spitted pig every Friday as part of its luau ritual. Again, it's not fantastic, but it's above average and the atmosphere is solid. The tiki bar in the courtyard showcases Hawaiian music and torch-lighting ceremonies We highly recommend splurging for an oceanfront unit in the Molokai Wing. The views are amazing and compared to other similar vistas, the rates are relatively low. The units are all large and generally well maintained, but we did notice some oversights (worn carpeting and nicked up furnishings) in our room and the hallways. I can't over-emphasize the staff. They are friendly and always smiling. This hotel offers more old-fashioned aloha spirit than any other resort on Maui, and the flood of good cheer casts the maintenance flaws into the shadows.

Reviews.Title: “True Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: betbrit
Reviews.Content: There are big resorts with 12 swimming pools, etc, but there's no place like Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. The offer an orientation breakfast which is wonderful, and the farewell ceremony is a MUST. We learned so much about the Hawaiian culture from Makalapua, and when we talk about our week long trip to Hawaii, the majority of it is what we learned at KBH. Oh, and the plumaria trees where amazing. Can't say enough about this home away from home. Mahalo We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Overall - OK - Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesJudy
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the second floor of the Kuaia building. Upon arrival, we went to the hotel room. I am not sure what on earth happened in that hallway, it REAKED of cat urine or pesticide. It was unbearable. I was concerned this would be an issue in my room. It was so strong, I was concerned it would give us all an illness. The good news was two things, in the room, it did not have this odor and we left the patio door open anytime we were in the room and we could not smell it - so the only time we could smell it was when the room door opened - such as to get towels etc. The smell was awful enough though that I immediately found a second entrance closer to my hotel room just so that I did not have to expose the family to the smell. So the room itself was nice enough. I never found it dirty and I am a bit freaked out by all those 20/20 hotel expose's but it did seem to be clean enough to not have me feeling scared to touch things. The pool is wonderful - especially if you have small children. About 50% of the pool is between 2-3 feet deep so the little one's can learn to walk in the water and enjoy it, like a giant bathtub for them (but not as hot and filled with chlorine). The Chlorine is needed however because the bathrooms for the pool appear to be in the hotel lobby and I did not see people (children) getting out to use the bathrooms. Needless to say, it is heavily chlorinated but very enjoyable. (yes - gross I know but all public pools have kids peeing in them - so what are you going to do?). The beach is very enjoyable at the hotel and there is a nice boardwalk that is just before the beach which makes for a nice night walk. So overall, the room was nice - some of the rooms have tile floors. I would have loved a room with a tile floor - if I had that, I would likely have rated the overall experience much higher however - overall - the location was good, the staff was nice, the rooms were not terribly cramped or anything and they were clean. There is still construction going on at the hotel but they try and keep it away from the guests some how.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value trump any other concerns”
Reviews.Author: vacationplannermom
Reviews.Content: Stayed from dec 27 to jan 2, 2009. Not impressive when you first get there, but it grows on you. Kinda stuck in the 50's-60's. Picked it based on TA ratings. Didn't interact with staff much, but all experiences helpful/good. Didn't partake in any of the on-site activities. Buffet breakfast was part of our package and completely adequate. Much cheaper than surrounding hotels with same beach, shopping amenities, and snorkeling. Ratings vary so much because there are at least 6 different room types/sizes. Our first room was lousy and old, and we had to wait a day for an upgrade. Neighboring rooms smoking on the balcony was a problem, and when we switched, it was still a problem from the room below us, but rooms were much nicer (newer carpet/wallpaper/granite counters). King rooms have a twin bed/couch against the wall, perfect for kids. Some rooms at this hotel are great, others aren't. On-site restaurants were so-so, but plenty of choices within walking distance. We hit other TA recommendations for dinner, Hula Grill, Lalaina's, lots of places in Lahaina. Plenty of returning families - only hotel on the strip where everybody decorated their balconies with xmas decorations/lights. Felt homey in a good way. Large grass areas and beautiful plumeria trees are almost nicer to lay out than going to the beach. Rooms facing the courtyard/pool much better than the ones facing adjacent hotels. All are close to beach, not a big property. Snorkeling at black rock was great - go early for turtles (7:30-8 am). No good boogeyboarding on Kaanapali (while we were there) - drove 5-10 min north to Fleming Beach (public) and hung out there.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Chajuram
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by all the positive and glowing reviews that this hotel has received. It fell way way below our expectations. We spent quite a substantial sum on a room that promised to be an "Ocean View" room, but were given a room that could at best be called a partial view room. The so called display of Hawaiian culture appeared to me to be a put up show. And the last straw was a wedding party that went on late into the night right under our window. With a lot to do in a small number of days, it is a pity if one cannot sleep in ones hotel room because of a party going on right next to it. I would not recommend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “"Our home away from home!"”
Reviews.Author: Sherwood_9
Reviews.Content: Out of the last 6 years, we've visited our Kaanapali Beach Hotel family 5 times. Upon arrival the first words we hear are "Welcome Home!". Our first year was to attend a wedding on the beach, which was unbelievably unique and romantic. Since that first year weâ€™ve brought friends, children and parents. Last year Johnnieâ€™s 88 year old father came with us. He had so much fun that heâ€™s planning to come back next year with a friend. I especially want to give praise to two marvelous individuals. Malihini Keahi ensures that we always have the best and truest Hawaiian experience. Doris Saribay of Reservations, responds quickly to our requests and has helped us with any of our unique needs. Cindy & Johnnie Koger - Topeka, Kansas

Reviews.Title: “absolutely the best family hotel in ka'anapali”
Reviews.Author: clemoEssex
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by chance searching online after being invited to a family wedding in Hawaii and cannot recommend it highly enough. We read some very positive reviews about this hotel and they turned out to be entirely correct. We have had the holiday of a lifetime, combining our trip with a stop off in San Francisco and a week in Honolulu. The staff at the hotel could not have made us more welcome or be more helpful. The free activities for the kids brought the history and traditions of hawaiian culture alive for us. The location was superb and although the hotels around it could be considered more plush (and much more expensive!) we found this hotel more intimate and perfectly comfortable and sharing the same fabulous ocean views. The free breakfast should be attended because the staff give you invaluable information as well as entertain you. The leaving ceromony we were invited to on our last day was so very moving. We can't wait to return to our new "ohana" at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!”
Reviews.Author: munchkinhead_9
Reviews.Content: I really can't believe all the positive reveiws for this hotel. We searched a few months ago on where to stay for our honeymoon, looking for online reviews, travel guides etc and decided to spend our 2nd part of our honeymoon at this hotel. However when we first arrived the lobby decor was decked out in old carpet, displays that looked like it hadn't been changed since it first open and when we got keys to our room, we were gobsmacked! There were tiny bugs, no bath, old safe (which btw we had to pay to use as well as the car park) sticky furniture, the list goes on. I have spent days in travel lodges that were cleaner! We got moved to another room which was a bit better however our view was of the contruction yard. After two days we moved to the Sheraton, 100 times better! I wouldn't be so angry if I payed alot cheaper to stay in Ka'anapali beach hotel but i didn't, the rates were only a few dollars cheaper than the 4 star hotels nearby. If your young, modern etc don't stay here, pls! I understand it is a family, traditional hotel, that doesn't mean cash in the profit and don't update the hotel since the 70s.

Reviews.Title: “A great place and value”
Reviews.Author: wownewjersey
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is awesome..near Black Rock for snorkeling, whalers village,,excellent beach, & trilogy is located on site. The rooms were clean , alittle outdated, shower area small,nice pool but no jacuzzi( missed that)..The staff was exceptional very friendly, accomodating and welcoming...i would definitely return...the restaurants were lacking...tiki grill was good...had programs for the kids..nightly entertainment..the groounds were immaculate...a great experience over all.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: JohnInRenoNV
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the KBH recently, and the room was not worth it. We were put in the kauai wing, on the ground floor. The room was old, smelly, fixtures were rotted or broken. We had booked for family of four, and they gave us this room that was quite small for a family of four. Very small closet (no lights in the closet; the wing allows smoking in the balcony, so we could constantly smell cigarette smoke coming into our room from outside when we opened our balcony door. So we had to keep that door closed most of the time. We tried to make the best out of our trip, so we did not complain. Agreed that the staff is nice, but when we came back to our room every day, we did not feel good about our room. I mentioned this to the front desk person during check out, and got a blank look; I guess because we were on our way out! I will certainly look for another hotel in kaanapali for our next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RightNearDaBeach
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to say except the service was excellent. We had a complaint about a smell and it was immediately taken care of. Also, they charged us for parking and when I told them it should have been included with our package they didn't ask any questions, just took it off. The rooms are big and you get a lot of towels which is surprisingly useful. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Clabbyroad
Reviews.Content: Arriving very late at night after a 8 hour flight we were warmly greeted and surprised to find a note in our room advising there was a bottle of Champaign in the fridge. The room was fantastic - large, great view of the ocean, pleasant gardens, all the staff were so helpful and curious always acknowledging you. Advised us what we should see after a few probing questions to our interests in the 4 days we were staying and booking the required trips. The small touches this hotel does makes the stay memorable e.g., bed turned down, macadamia nut cookies on the pillow, misc little gifts, "kukui lei", Ukulele Lessons. This hotel has not followed the big chain mentality where everything is the same regardless of location or country. The stay here gives you an understanding of native Hawaii with a great staff. Thank You Should we be back in Maui we will 100% stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Home Sweet Hawaiian Home"”
Reviews.Author: haneprn
Reviews.Content: The KBH is very special hotel in a great location! You are treated like family while you are there. It is right on Kaanapali Beach just steps away from great snorkeling at Black Rock. There is a very nice breakfast buffet(eggs,fresh fruit, cheeses, sweet rolls, breads, cereals, meats,coffee, milk, juices...) which is very handy and stress free,complimentary Hawaiian Activities to take part in (Lei making, pineapple cutting, hula classes, garden walks...), a huge shaded open grass courtyard with beautiful trees, flowers,and birds. There is a complimentary Hula Show every night. You can watch the whales from the courtyard area or your balcony or you can relax in a chaise lounge in the shade under the big breadfruit trees.You can play in the ocean. Whaler's Village-shopping and restaurants is just a quick walk down the beachwalk. We have stayed at KBH 3 times since 6/05. We love it and would not stay anywhere else. Be sure to stay long enough as once you arrive in paradise, you will not want to go home...

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier”
Reviews.Author: JinxSJ
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. Rooms are big because it is an old hotel, but recently refurbished. Very clean bathroom. Old TV, but adequate. But hey, who comes to Maui to watch TV? We took a "Garden/Pool View" room, and would highly recommend not wasting your money on an ocean view unless you really MUST see the ocean out of your room. The garden areas are beautiful. The beach is a short walk through the gardens. This hotel is much less expensive than most. I would go straight back to this hotel if I ever go back to Maui. The Kaanipali area is much prettier than the Waimea area. Parking is valet or self, which I like because I like access to my car. Parking is close so you can come and go easily.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect oasis in Maui”
Reviews.Author: sunworshipr
Reviews.Content: My family spent 5 nights at the KBH the last week of March 2009. It was a fabulous hotel. Couldn't ask for a better location close to Lahaina and just situated almost perfectly between Black Rock and Whalers Village. The staff were awesome. Everyone greeted you with Aloha from the managment to the grounds staff. And what beautiful grounds they were. I can still smell the plumeria flowers. What really makes this hotel stand out is the free cultural classes. We did lei making, lau printing, sand images, pineapple cutting, whale talk etc. All very informative and fun. The evening hula show is wonderful with a very talented group of singers. The included buffet breakfast was such an awesome start to each day. Not continental, but full deluxe breakfast. This place is a diamond in the rough. My only complaint is that there is not a hot-tub. That would be a nice touch. The ocean is a beautiful blue and perfect for swimming. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 of Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: OmahaSevenStar
Reviews.Content: Great location on beach. Old worn out rooms, moldy walls, stained carpet, bored staff. Avoid their Mixed Plate breakfast buffet, cheap cheap cheap, little selection, pay the xtra for their other buffet or go anywhere else. We left after 2 days, and won't be back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location...and with some personality”
Reviews.Author: ficusyou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel (my wife and a bunch of my family) right after the New Year. The hotel was quaint and felt more like a local hotel than some of the resorts nearby. The rooms were clean and decent. We enjoyed the hula show in the evening and some of the food at the bar area. The Ka'anapali Beach itself is awesome for swimming. It was very calm and warm. At night, walks along the beach or along the path that runs the length of the beach, is absolutely terrific. Our only complaint was that our bill got really messed up. It was probably because some of my family members switched rooms and that caused all sorts of confusion about the package, but it involved a bunch of emails and calls that eventually got things cleared up. I'd definitely stay again...but would be careful about any itinerary changes ;)

Reviews.Title: “Don't wait! Save up for that plane ticket and go to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ridgefamily
Reviews.Content: My family just got home from a lovely stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in Maui. My husband and I first visited the KBH in 1998 while on our honeymoon. We had such a great time as newlyweds there. We decided to return this year for Spring Break with our kids, ages 8 and 6. We didn't know how family-friendly it would be since we had only visited there as twenty-somethings. We had a wonderful time in 1998 and a wonderful time in 2009. The children's passport program was one of the highlights of our visit. The kids loved learning their Hawaiian names, collecting stamps and getting little "happys" along the way, such as water bottles, beach backpacks, little radio flashlights, rubber bracelets, etc. The gift for completing the passport was great. We loved making leis and taking hula lessons. Seeing my husband concentrate so hard while doing hula was priceless! All of the staff members were so nice. My husband said they acted like they'd been to Disney school even though they hadn't. They're just nice because they're happy to be living in paradise and they seem to love the people who come visit them. One of the staff members cried on our last day. I felt like it was the last day of camp! We loved the wonderful breakfast buffets, the nightly hula show, and the great cabanas on the beach. The rooms were big. 2 double beds and a twin daybed. Very comfortable for a family of 5. The rooms were nice but not fancy. I'm picky about staying in a nice room and this was nice. Pretty furniture, thick carpet, super-clean. We stayed on the first floor which I loved. We just walked right out our back door to the pool, the beach, the tiki bar, or to the stage where something fun was always going on. There were Macadamia cookies on our bed every night. One day there was a fresh fruit platter in our fridge. Another day we got a box of chocolate covered macadamias. It seemed like we were constantly showered with gifts. We were made to feel so special all throughout our stay. KBH is known as the most Hawaiian hotel. It's so true. Here's to going back before another 11 years pass! When we return to Maui, we will definitely be staying at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel! Catherine in Arkansas

Reviews.Title: “We had no idea how much we were to enjoy our stay!”
Reviews.Author: CeciliaandGreg
Reviews.Content: Never having been guests before at the Ka'anpali Beach Hotel we hoped to enjoy our first stay. We knew our third trip to Maui was going to be wonderful no matter what. How could we miss, we were bound for Maui. But what we didn't know, what we didn't expect, was that this time we were going to experience a glimse of Hawaii that opened our eyes to the amazing history of the islands. The Hawaiian story came alive to us both by the staff and the many artifacts at the Ka'anpali Beach Hotel. In a very subtle, unimposing way they revealed the history of their culture. In our minds they have earned every accolade they've been given. We enjoyed the live music and shows in the courtyard every night. As a musician I can say that I was very impressed was by the talent. The Tiki Bar with the bartender that was so efficient is a real plus. You will not need to go into Lahaina or anywhere else to whale watch or snorkel Molokini.The hotel has tours leaving from their beach. Snorkeling at Black Rock is just a few minutes walk away.Three meals a day at the buffet at the Mixed Plate Restaurant was an advantage we didn't expect. Great food, inexpensive and a real time saver. If this sounds like an advertisement we meant it to be. We really enjoyed our stay and we want others to know and we want the staff of the hotel to know. We traveled there for our anniversary. It was wonderful! The next time we go we'll stay at the Ka'anpali Beach Hotel when the whales are visiting but we'll be sure to bring our daughters (no matter how conflicted their schedules are.)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not fancy”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTraveller2
Reviews.Content: The beach front that this hotel occupies is quite nice. The sand was clean and there was a good length of access to the water. It was somewhat maintained by the staff. Beach umbrellas and chairs were a tad pricey but nice that they were available for renting. The room was always clean and the staff that cleaned the room did a very good job. They also came in nightly to turn down the bed and leave a treat. Nice touch and we really appreciated the cleanliness and amenities of the room. Towels and sheets were very nice and plush. Coffee machine and tea in room. TV was a good size, various channels. Balcony was a treat to have. Saw the mountains and the ocean from it. Front desk and restaurant staff was okay friendly. They were definitely helpful. The food is my only real complaint. Their menus need an overhaul! Spam (a canned mystery meat product) should not be featured on any menu but it seemed to have a special place here. Prices were much too high for food being served. Service at the restaurant at the hotel was not good, quite slow. The buffet breakfast at the casual restaurant (there's 2) was very basic. Everything tasted very processed, fake. Nothing fresh or healthful. Nothing could be described as delicious. Location was good, nice to be near Whaler's Village for shopping and restaurants. Literally steps away. Room offered peace and quiet except for work being done outside that we were not fore-warned of. Lots of loud machinery. A courtesy room was offered for our use after we had checked out but before we were to leave. So we had a chance to shower and change before heading to the airport. This was free of charge and greatly appreciated. Since this was our honeymoon we were given a bottle of champagne which we enjoyed. The pool is tiny so if that is a priority for you or if you have children who enjoy pool swimming this may not be the place for you. The staff that maintain this hotel is to be commended. They were consistently warm and friendly. And finally, the grounds were immaculate. Not a leaf or flower blossom fell that wasn't raked up immediately! Groundskeeping staff on the ball and hard at work every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Maui's Most Overrated Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: preciousgemcrystal
Reviews.Content: I came on a business trip for work, with colleagues. We're all familiar with the hotels in Maui, but this was my first time staying in this hotel. I was rather excited considering how much it had been hyped up. When I pulled in the first thought in my head was "that's it?".
