Now I'm a pretty good judge, I know this wasn't gonna be a Sheraton or a Westin. But that doesn't mean for a moderate that I couldn't be impressed in some shape or form. Upon checking in the staff was rather friendly. The rooms were basic, nothing much to them but then again as I mentioned I wasn't expecting the Ritz. I went to turn on the TV to find that the remote wasn't working, I had called the front desk to ask for assistance and the response I got was "Oh, you can get up and change it yourself" and a click. I didn't fly 10 hours so I could get up and change the channel every few seconds. Now granted, I didn't come to the island to watch TV but all I wanted to do before I had to get up and working was relax for half a second. I called back and got another staff member, whom had apologized for the situation when I mentioned. All it needed was a simple battery change, not so difficult right? After that I had shook it off, I opened the fridge to find a nice little welcome amenity, chocolate chip cookies and orange passion juice, great right? I set it up on the cabinet so the cookies wouldn't be so hard to eat later when I came back. Before I made my way out I discovered mold...yes...MOLD! I had requested yet again, and 3 calls to the front desk within an hour is not a good sign! For the situation to be handled accordingly. I had left the room and figured by the time I got back they'd have the time they needed to figure it out. I had appointments and meetings I had to take care of. Upon my return I had found that we had been moved to another room. I went back and packed up only to find a swarm of ants climbing over my cookies. Needless to say, as easy to please as I usually am. This did not impress me!!! They are also in dire need of renovations. My suggestion? Move to the Royal Lahaina, I stayed there on my vacation, LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel Value”
Reviews.Author: MauiRon56
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an eleven night stay at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. This is an outstanding Hotel on a near perfect beach. Get one of the courtyard rooms with an excellent view of an extremely large and well landscaped courtyard. The entire staff has a sincere desire in trying to make your stay an exceptional Hawaiian experience---with many Hawaiian activities at the Hotel (lei making, hula lessons, ukulele lessons, pineapple cutting). The rooms are more than adequate with recent upgrades and our rooms were diliently cleaned daily--a great job by the housekeeping staff. The Hotel is located right on Ka'anapali Beach-less than 5 minutes from any room. The Whaler Shopping Mall is a short walk down the beach and Lahaina is a short drive from KBH. And best of all-there is a nightly hula show---a great way to finish the day. I will return to KBH on our next visit to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: susykat
Reviews.Content: I have to preface this by saying that my husband and I are not resort people. We try to keep on a budget most of the time, and we have very simple needs. When we decided to go to Maui, we knew we would be a few days in the Kaanapali area (we also camped and stayed a night in Kihei, which I liked better) so I wanted to find something that wasn't too fancy. I found it in the Kaanpali Beach Hotel, which was perfect for us. If you are looking for a luxury spot, this is not it. In fact we joked how our hotel looked a little sad in between the fancy resorts-it is older and it's obvious. However, if you want a place that is clean, friendly and has easy access to all that the Maui beachfront has, this is your spot. The hotel is large, though by no means a mega-resort, but it manages to feel homey. I didn't have any of the staff interactions that I read in some of the other reviews, but everyone seemed very friendly and accommodating. The first day you are invited to a breakfast, which they swear is not a timeshare promotion. It's not--but what it is is a plug for their entertainment and preferred tour services. Fair enough-you get a breakfast and don't waste too much of your time. I didn't mind it as there was no sales pressure. On your last day you are invited to a going away ceremony. They give you a beaded lei and the woman talks a bit about Hawaiian traditions. It sounded really corny to me before I actually did it, but I have to tell you, they seem sincere, and I enjoyed it and appreciated it. If I were to stay in Kanaapali area again, I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “The old Hawaii you have been looking for”
Reviews.Author: PatricksWife
Reviews.Content: That old Hawaii you see in movies still exists in this little hotel on Kaanapali Beach. The employees all wore hawaiian clothing, they have free nightly music and hula, they offer all sorts of free activities from learning the hula to poi making, and they give you a kukui nut lei the day you leave. The people were very friendly and the service was great. The rooms aren't exactly up to date. But it's Hawaii so you shouldn't be spending all your time in the room anyway. The pool is a little small but you are right on Kaanapali Beach. We loved staying at the KBH and believe that it is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, stairwell noise terrible in room, staff so-so”
Reviews.Author: Parrotheads
Reviews.Content: It took me a while to get to this review because I wanted to be as fair as possible. We were there from the end of October through the first of November on a spontaneous trip with airfare only $406 from Oklahoma. We celebrated Halloween in Lahaina which was fun. My husband found this room for $150 night and since our airfare was such a good deal we decided to splurge. It was by far the most expensive place we had stayed having very recently stayed on Oahu, Kauai and in the Virgin Islands for just under $100. The grounds had a lot of tiki theme which, being into exotica and tiki fans was fun. The parking garage, lobby and the gift shop were very nice. Our room was o.k. Had a mini-fridge and little balcony and king-size bed. They had a bottle of champagne (albiet $7 we saw it at the store in town) waiting for us for our anniversary. The shower was stand-up only and a little small but big enough to do the job. The main complaint was that our room was on the 2nd floor next to the stairwell and many, many people including bell hops dragged their wheeled carts and baggage up and down the stairs rather than picking them up (there was no elevator in our buiding). This was HORRIBLE. The noise began and 4:30 a.m. and continued all day but of course the worst was while we were trying to sleep at night. Our first full day began very early so we left hoping it was a fluke. Night two, more of the same. On day 3 I reported it to the front desk who tried to assure me their people would not do that and definitely not early in the morning. However, we climbed out of bed and ran to the hall to look and see what inconsiderate people were causing so much noise. We saw uniformed hotel staff doing it just as much as guests. Note: if you are too weak, too old or unable to carry your bags, you should request a first floor room. It is very, very inconsiderate to hotel guests trying to relax or sleep to hear ka-clunk, ka-clunk, ka-clunk up and down 3 flights of stairs at all hours of the day or night. I might expect this at Motel 6, but not at a $150 night resort. At any rate, the noise continued. We were only there for 5 nights or we would have moved but by day 4 realizing it was a constant problem, we didn't want to move all of our stuff for 1 night. So for $150 I had to wear ear plugs to bed every night and my husband slept with his head under a pillow. We both work up with pounding headaches 3 of the mornings. The tiki bar on the grounds was pretty cool, but the first time I approached the bartender to inquire about where we might find the pool towels, he was very rude. I was even extra nice knowing he probably hated answering questions from guests. A couple of days later when we consumed a couple of drinks at the bar and left a tip he was much nicer. Hmmm. We ate at the buffet restaurant one night. Big mistake. There were 4-6 hotel guests only and a big local family with a bunch of kids that were running all around the restaurant and jumping on the booths. There were dirty tables. The staff knew who they were too and no one said anything. The buffet was gross and at $18 each, was an outrage. (have you ever been to CiCi's pizza on a Friday night?) We were both very sick by the middle of the night. Now, the snack shack near the bar served great food and good service. We ate their about 3 times for late night munching. The grounds ARE beautiful and right on the beach and next to great snorkeling. You can walk the sidewalk along the beach which connects several of the resorts and the shopping area. But, basically every day we were up early and on the road exploring so we didn't hang at the hotel much, but did use the pool one morning after snorkeling. Kaanapalii was not our favorite area. Probably the best thing was being close to Don the Beachcomber's just a 10-12 minute walk away. The Polynesian music and dancing show in the evenings was great and free and non-hotel guests even came. If we ever went back, we'd stay on the south east side, less snooty and more down-to-Earth. We had to get on the road and were going to miss the checking out ceremony. They allow you to still pick up a lei at check-out if you cannot attend the farewell lei ceremony. We were told to go out front to the parking attendant. I approached and said good morning and explained that we had to leave early but were told inside to stop to pick up our leis. WELL, let me tell you, you would have thought she had hand-made them herself and was offended we were leaving early. She didn't even speak. She reached down, grabbed two under the desk, flipped them over the counter and said "here". It was the rudest treatment of all by any of their employees. I smiled and thanked her and told her to have a nice day. When my husband pulled up with our car, I told him how she reacted which was not all the Mahalo we were expecting. We certainly expected more than we got. So to re-cap, don't get a room near the stairwell, don't ask the bartender any questions when you aren't paying for drinks, don't eat at the buffet restaurant, and be sure to attend the lei farewell ceremony and you should be just fine. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful repeat visit - like coming home!”
Reviews.Author: ejbirdie
Reviews.Content: We (two couples) spent 10 days at KBH this March - my wife and I had been there 3 years ago and enjoyed it so much we brought new friends with us again. Malihini greeted us with a warm hug and a sincere "welcome home" that brought tears. This hotel is not glitz and glamour as has been stated many times . . . but it is a fantastic place to stay. We were not upgraded when we checked in and when I asked about it (repeaters) the desk clerk said they would do so the next night when rooms became available - we then received a DOUBLE upgrade. We were pleasantly surprised to receive a letter from the GM invisting us to be his guest for dinner at the Tiki Terrace restaurant = we had not eaten there the previous visit as we thought it quite expensive. This dinner was one of the best we had on Maui! The location on the beach - in the middle of all the action - close to Whaler's village is just great. The Tiki Bar and the Tiki Grill (with the fantastic Mahi-Mahi sandwiches and juicy Teryaki burgers) are also great features of this resort. Everyone we met, from cleaning maid, bartenders, grounds staff, desk clerks, were all extremely helpful and sincerely warm with their greetings and assistance. We consider ourselves fortunate to have visited Hawaii 3 times . . . and hope to be able to visit again. KBH will certainly be our Maui headquarters if we do. EJBirdie

Reviews.Title: “3 weeks of pure bliss...”
Reviews.Author: Mauijack
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed 3 weeks of pure bliss at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel in Maui. This was our 12th visit over 30 years, and the hotel keeps getting better. Our room was beautiful, the courtyard gardens a paradise of Hawaiian flowers, and we did not want to leave after 3 weeks. Our daily routine of a wonderful hot buffet breakfast at the Tiki Terrace restaurant, a mile walk on the beachwalk watching for whales, collecting shells on the beach, and snorkeling with beautiful tropical fish and huge green turtles right down the beach, was pure relaxation with no hassle or driving. We could watch whales breeching in the ocean from our balcony. Our housekeeper made sure everything was perfect for us. We felt like royalty. The hotel had so many Hawaiian cultural activities, and the gardens are so beautiful, especially the plumeria trees. Local artists display their crafts in the lobby several days a week. Each night, Hawaiian bands and hula shows entertained for free in the court yard, we have so many wonderful pictures and videos of them. Many nights we had dessert and coffee at the Tiki Terrace while watching the shows. You can walk down the beach to all the beautiful shops and restaurants at Whaler's Village. There is no better place to stay on Kaanapali Beach. This is the best value, and the best hotel, because it is smaller and can take much better care of you than the big resorts there. It is our favorite hotel in Hawaii. We always visit one or two other islands for several days, but book the majority of our time at the Kannapali Beach Hotel. Even three weeks this year was not enough. I met many people staying there for several weeks, and they were all sad to leave. I always told them " planning your return visit to KBH takes the sting out of leaving." Many were already repeat visitors. We will be back next year - it is where we go to refresh our souls from everyday life. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “It is Always a Homecoming from us at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alohafrommn
Reviews.Content: Aloha, We want you to know and any potential guests that we feel very much at home when we visit the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Whenever we visit Maui we will stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel because of the Very Friendly Staff, the Facilities, the Traditions, the Location(Fantastic Beach!!!), the Food and Sunday Morning Church Service with Rev Bev !! We cannot wait till our next homecoming. We think of you all often and miss you very much. Thank you very much for all of the wonderful experiences and memories that we carry in our daily life. We now Practice Aloha !! ALOHA from Minnesota, Cindy and Kevin Reynolds Rochester Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; comfortable and charming”
Reviews.Author: Snert41
Reviews.Content: I was leary about choosing this hotel for my vacation after reading other reviews. I'm pleased to stay we did enjoy our stay at the KBH and would choose again. Great location, good amenities, large and clean room. Comfortable, conveniently located and I did enjoy the Hawaiian culture that this resort brings. I would definitely stay here again. A solid 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Maui Vacation At Ka'anaplai Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: consue231
Reviews.Content: 30 wonderful days we spent on Maui at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel where the staff is unbelievable. Everday we were greeted with hugs and smiling faces who go out of their way to make your vacation the best ever.The location is perfect as you are within walking distance to shopping and other hotels. The rooms are clean,spacious and comfortable. We can't say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Carissa_9
Reviews.Content: Aloha Thereâ€™s not enough beautiful words to explain the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel experience. For four years in a row we have relaxed, ate well, enjoyed the activities and personnel involved at the hotel. No one has remained a stranger for long. Everyone is helpful, makes you at ease and answers any questions there might be. The hotel grounds are well kept and rooms are sparkling clean. The Welcome Breakfast is excellent and Michaelâ€™s comments are informative and entertaining. The Nightly Hula Show is fun to watch. We can hardly wait to return next year and always hate to leave. Mahalo Frank and Glenda Thompson Illinois

Reviews.Title: “I picked this hotel for a specific reason.”
Reviews.Author: gibsor3
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling to Hawaii for pleasure for 30 years, recently sometimes 2 or 3 times a year. On Maui I have stayed at a private condo on Ka'anapali Beach (the Mahana), The Marriott Ka'anapali Beach, Kapalua Bay Hotel (since demolished), Ritz Carlton Kapalua, Renaissance Wailea and Four Seasons Wailea. This was my first stay at KBH. This trip my wife and I were accompanied by my mother in law, an 82 year old lady who was experiencing Hawaii for the first time. After a five day stay on Oahu to take in Pearl Harbour and the Iolani Palace, Maui seemed like the right place for the remaining 8 days of our trip; nice beach, good golfing for my wife and myself, a little history (historic Lahaina), and restaurants all within walking distance. My biggest concern was that while my wife and I were golfing (early morning every day), I wanmed to be sure that my mother in law would not be bored stiff. I also wanted to show her as much of the Aloha spirit as I could. I had always heard that the most Hawaiian hotel was KBH, so I booked there. I could not have made a better choice. While other hotels are definitely fancier and the staff may be more fawning over guests and the restaurants more spectacular, KBH is the hotel that I would say can truly show a new visitor why Hawaii becomes a favourite, perhaps almost obsessive, destination for many. Other posts here are fairly accurate in their descriptions of the hotel and its amenities so I will not dwell on repeating them. I will make some observations based on extensive travel to the islands. The price of KBH is easily half of almost all other nearby properties. The beach at KBH is identical to all others - spectacular. The breakfast at the Tiki Grill is better that the Mixed Plate. The free daily activities are terrific for those not looking to sit on the beach all day. My mother in law made her own lei, loved the walking tours, attended and appreciated the historical discussions and lectures and made her way over to the Whalers Village shops every day for a coffee and a browse. Restaurants not to miss if staying at or near Ka'anapali: Chez Paul - French, small and you must reserve, even in these economic times. Gerard's at the Plantaion Inn - also French.- if staying at KBH you get a coupon for $50 off your meal. Longhi's - still a great table in Lahaina. For golfers, try out the Kahili golf course about 30 minute drive, less expensive than Kapalua, but a great track. Kahili is the old Sandalwood, but it's been improved. We never saw a bug in any of the rooms at KBH, although it is Hawaii and bugs are there. The rooms were very well maintained. The staff at KBH are more like family than employees. They are not fawning, they are friendly. They say "aloha" like they know what it means. At the farewell kekui lei ceremony, my mother in law had tears in her eyes and so did my wife and I. I would rather go out for a beer with one of the bell desk staff at KBH than at the Ritz. If you ask the staff at KBH for their opinion or help, you will get it, honestly and earnestly. Mahalo to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: COretured
Reviews.Content: This was a very relaxing week. We also learned some of the ancient culture of the islands, very interesting. Whale watching was fantastic, the weather was great and we wanted to return again and again. MM from Colorado

Reviews.Title: “A lovely pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SFRookies
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at this property was quite delightful. If you are looking for a 4 or 5 star deluxe property then look elsewhere. If your needs require deluxe, sleek, spotless accommodation then you will be disappointed. But if you would enjoy an authentic Hawaiian experience with a wonderful local staff who are proud of their heritage and are willing to go the extra steps to make your visit to Maui memorable, then you will enjoy a stay here. Some rooms feel older than others, depending on the building and if it has had recent renos. Ours was clean, spacious and certainly met our needs as we were not requiring cooking facilities. The "Best" things: The evening entertainment with authentic music and dance from 630-9ish The caring and knowledgeable staff The location is amazing, thus I rate a 3 star property with 5 star location All rooms have a mini fridge Lovely landscaped property The boardwalk out front to take you down to Whalers Village for some nice shopping and great dining at Leilani's or Hula grill within a 5 minute walk Beautiful beach out front with decent snorkelling next door The Cons: The pool is in need of a facelift and not exceptionally clean. We noticed sand and a slight oil slick every day and a few "chunks" had come loose on the flooring The buffet breakfast was not exciting but since it was included with the room rate, how can you really complain? Food at the other 2 facilities on site were just average. The overall property could use a really good cleaning (stairwells, etc.) but for the most part guests here dont seem to be the type to be overly concerned in this regard Beach chairs and umbrellas on the beach in front are not provided and have to be rented Overall it was a lovely experience, just go with the right expectations. The cultural experiences and lovely staff should more than make up for the "small stuff"

Reviews.Title: “whale-watching; close to everything”
Reviews.Author: cruiserSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Beach Hotel is our favorite hotel on any island in Hawaii. Services are excellent with a natural aloha from all the staff at KBH. It is close to everything, including the sensational, ongoing show by numerous whales offshore. It was a thrill to see the whales breaching as we relaxed on the beach. We caught a sunset cruise on the catamaran that stopped on the beach at the hotel and encountered sights we had never seen before as the whales rolled and played around the boat.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay Here !”
Reviews.Author: Midothian
Reviews.Content: Hotel reviews are very subjective. What 1 person may love, another may hate. I will try to be objective here. The travel agent selected this hotel for us. It is the oldest hotel in the area and in need of major renovation. There is peeling wallpaper and the carpet dated back to the 1970's. A rule of thumb for me is you can generally (but not always) tell the quality of a hotel from the condition and decor of the lobby. My expectations were low from the onset of walking in the door at this hotel. Our room was oceanfront on the top floor at the corner. The room had a light switch not fully attached to the wall and no bathtub (just a standup shower); a 20+ yr old tv and just plain aweful. We are an early 40's professional couple and used to staying in luxury hotels. I was not expecting the Fairmont or Four Seasons but I was also not expecting such a dump. I would equate this hotel in quality to a Super-8 or Econolodge hotel - very poor quality. The breakfast buffet was worse than something you would find at Shoneys both in terms of variety and quality. The pool is small and simply unattractive. The property is advertised as Hawaii's "Most Hawaiian Hotel" but I'm not sure why. The grounds are simply plain and the service staff is not as outgoing as at other hotels (again, if you keep your expectations to a Super-8 or Econolodge, you will not be disappointed). The people staying here seem to be split into 2 equal groups from what we observed - those over 65 and those who appreciate budwiser and body art and seem to talk quite loudly. Neither of those groups describe us so the hotel just wasn't for us. As previously stated, reviews are subjective and this hotel seemed to work well for at least two specific categories of people (just not us). The location is outstanding (right next to the Sheraton on Black Rock). The beach is fantastic (it's all public access everywhere here). So, if you're looking for a ratty hotel in a great location - this is your place. After one night, we could not stomach this place any longer. The travel agent said there was nothing they could (more like would) do to help us move and said since we prepaid, all money would be lost and any move would be at our cost. So, the next morning I went to the hotel manager and requested to immediately depart and get a refund of the unused nights. The 1st response from the manager was that she would not issue any refund as the economy was tight and they basically needed the money. She was sorry that the hotel was not a 5-star property but they never advertised themselves as such. After much discussion, the manger agreed to let us check out and issue us a refund for the unused 3 nights. (We moved next door to the Sheraton where the hotel and grounds are incredible). When we return from our vacation, I will post pictures of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sayddy
Reviews.Content: We, together with another couple, celebrated our 49th wedding anniversaries at KBH. This hotel was recommended to us by friends and we heartedly agree that the staff was very warm and friendly and the the accomendation were comfortable. In fact, there was nothing that we didn't like about the hotel. We certainly would recommend this hotel to others and hopefully we will be able to return for a visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hkw_acw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at KBH for the 2nd year in a row during New Year's week. We stayed in a ocean-view room, with a lanai (balcony) that has a fabulous view. It was close to the room we stayed in last year, but it looked a bit different as KBH is doing some renovations. There was a huge mirrored wall in the bathroom, which made it nice for four people trying to get ready in the morning. We also enjoy the Hawaiian entertainment around the Tiki Bar in the evenings. The crab artichoke sandwich is delicious!! I do not think you can beat the location of KBH, with Black rock to the right, Lana'i ahead, and plenty of beach and Whalers Village to the left. On top of all this, the staff at KBH is incredibly friendly, they are all very "Aloha." We love it and can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “thoroughly enjoyed our stay, will definitely go back again”
Reviews.Author: stormWestMids
Reviews.Content: this was a once in a lifetime trip to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and it more than lived up to expectations, so much so i think we will be saving up for another trip albeit not for a few years! And the first place we will aim for is KBH. Unlike some of your reviewee's we had no problems with front desk staff on arriving very late, the two ladies on duty couldn't have been more helpful (at 2.30 in the morning). We had had delay after delay and it had taken us a total of 31hrs to get there in the end so you can imagine how tired and frazzled we where, the staff did there best to make checking in as painless and quick as possible so that we could get to our bed. The room was more than adequate and the views from it nice. All the staff from front desk to housekeeping where superb, nothing was too much trouble, they always seemed happy in their jobs and had smiles and greetings for everyone. There's only one problem we did have and that was the on site restaurant on New Years Eve - the menu for that night was very limited and very very expensive for what you got. I personally would recommend eating out if you have transport (or you can use the dollar trolley to Lahaina where there are lots of eateries - pick up outside Whalers Village last trolley back 8.45!). Try Kimo's - we had our anniversary meal there and it was excellent. I will and have recommended this hotel to friends and even strangers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: cmims06
Reviews.Content: The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel was so much more amazing than we had ever expected! We arrived to Maui and were met with hospitality and genuine decency that is particularly uncommon in today's world. Our room was amazing, the food was great, the grounds were unparalleled, and the atmosphere was truely relaxing. My wife and I expected an amazing honeymoon in Maui, but we never anticipated the quality of the KBH and its staff. If you are planning a trip to Maui, please concider the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. Take it from me, once you've stayed at the KBH you'll immediately begin plans for your return!!!

Reviews.Title: “It is the Most Hawaiian hotel”
Reviews.Author: londontowne
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights here over New Years Eve. We had been at Waikiki for 5 nights and as soon as we entered the KBH we wished we had come straight here. Everything was spotless and the gardens gorgeous. I had to stay out of the sun and there were lots of trees around to move the lounge chairs anywhere I wanted. There were also no problem at any time of the day to find lounge chairs. The staff were unbelievable and so helpful and friendly. There was a welcome breakfast (not timeshare) where all the staff were on the stage and sang to us. It was so moving and we had never seen anything like it before. We stayed in the Kaui building on the 3rd floor, 3 doors down from the beach end on the outside. We had a great view of the beach, water and Lanai in the distance. Every evening there was music and hula at the outdoor cafe area. It was really great. It is good to have a car so that you can sight see but you don't really need one since there is the Whalers village within a short walking distance that have restaurants and shops. Lahaina was a nice place to visit and had expensive and inexpensive stores. We drove up almost to the top of Haleakala and went to several other places but we had nothing planned other than to do whatever we felt like, so no pressure. The beach is great and not very crowded. We did go to the Sheraton Luau since it was just a short walk next door to us. We really enjoyed it. Didn't do Old Lahaina because it was just hula and didn't do Lele because we couldn't see anything on the menu we would eat so Sheraton was really good. The day we left was the Aloha (Goodbye) Ceremony. I almost wanted to cry. With all the travel we do and all the 4 and 5 star hotels we have been to I hated to leave this one. We live in England so it is a long distance trip so I don't know if we will be going again but I am so glad of the experience. Just loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER return or recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: ShoeGalSITC
Reviews.Content: Our AAA guide told us that this was a good pick for a hotel because it focuses on local culture and has a lot of great activities. I would have preferred it if the focus left that and was put on improving the condition of the hotel! Our room was disgusting. The sheets had holes in them, there were weird bugs (scorpion looking) and the carpet needed replacing about 20 years ago. At the end of the day, all I want is to return to a room I can feel comfortable and safe in. I don't care about perks - I just want cleanliness!!!! On check in, the woman behind the desk offered us the option to pay extra for the in room safe. We declined but soon reconsidered after discovering that all the hotel doors from the outside were constantly propped open. There was also a large event going on that weekend which added a huge population of people at the hotel that weren't guests. Anyone could just walk in, no questions asked! My husband wouldn't let me go out alone into the stairways or corridors. It didn't give me a warm, fuzzy feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Planetekarl
Reviews.Content: When you book a stay in Maui, you're expecting it all. We arrived at the hotel at 11:50 p.m. Flew more than 11 hours to get there from Ottawa. Upon arrival, there's one clerck at the desk, not the friendly type. We were tired and starving so we asked if we could get some food? The clerk tells us the kitchen closes at midnight, so we asked right away to ring them up to see what they could prepare. He then explains that the staff starts closing up the place at 11:45 p.m. Now most people would go out of their way to help us here, but no, not him...Not a single call. No help at all. We then ask if we can get fruit or anything at all, the answer was still no. We take our key and walk to the building where our room was. Stairs only to the third floor. The building is old, the carpet is old, and the room we're about to discover is old. Moreover, it looks like an Econo Lodge. I don't mind the Econo Lodge that much, but if paying 2500USD for it, I have a huge problem. The next morning, we're up early for breakfast(!). We had an invitation coupon to a special buffet. We get there, the place is dark and looks like an unfit congress center. The buffet is cold and the food not so good. The host tries to push us into buying package tours. We left early and walked on the beach to discover the Hyatt. Called our travel agent and cancelled our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mauionly
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Beach Hotel is in the best location in Lahaina. The beach is beautiful with Black Rock on the North and Whalers Village a two minute walk to the South. The hotel is older but well maintained with a staff that is predominantly Hawaiian and have worked their for many years. Their customer service is fantastic! We enjoy staying Ocean Front as you are about 100 feet from the ocean. These rooms are some of the closest ocean front in Lahaina! They have great balconies and we whale watch right from our room. The rooms have refridgerators and they provide great coffee with the coffee makers. We can not say enough about this hotel! It is such a relaxing vacation as the hotel is not over crowded and the staff make it stress free. We have stayed at three other hotels on Maui but we will not stay anywhere else now!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: WhereInTheWorldNext
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for our Honeymoon. We traveled all over the Hawaiian Islands and this hotel was BY FAR the best of the hotels we stayed in!! Being totted the 'Most Hawaiian Hotel in Hawaii' was certainly an accurate statement. The employees were very friendly and greeted everyone with an 'aloha'! The Mixed Plate for breakfast was a good variety, the rooms and the rest of the grounds were very clean and the beach was fantastic!! The view from our room was wonderful and the nighttime entertainment was nice...but for one night only as it was the same thing every night. Parking was available and right on par with the other hotels. I will absolutely return to this hotel in the future and would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Newmzedo
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are a bit retro 70's, they were clean and the staff pleasant. The Mai Tai's at the Tiki Bar were not the greatest and overly priced as was the food, the atmosphere was very relaxing with a beautiful beach and walkway for those mid night strolls. My first impression upon walking in our room was you gotta be kidding we paid how much to come to Hawaii and this is the best our travel agent had to offer. When it came time to check out we did not want to leave. The Lai ceremony for departing guests is a nice personal touch. A rental car is a must, but be prepared to pay to park$9 for self park $11 a day for valet, there is no free parking here. They also offer free breakfast at their restaurant where the food was barely edible. For the most part, I found it to be a did it time to move on, I can't say I would go back and if I did I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the KBH”
Reviews.Author: eagoertz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBH over this past Christmas and New Year's holidays and had a great time. The nightly live music, aloha spirit, location to Whalers village and great beach make it great place to stay. It is an older hotel but I still highly recommend the KBH. If you snorkel, pick up your gear at the Maui Dive Shop in Whalers village as it is much cheaper than at the KBH/Trilogy shop. Lahaina is a great place to shop and relax as well. The Old Lahaina Luau was superb and a must do!

Reviews.Title: “Small flaws, but otherwise a PERFECT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ae82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 7 days in January. The location is perfect. A very short walk to the Whaler's Village (shopping & restaurants) and a short drive to Lahaina. Ka'anapali area is very nice and somewhat secluded. The hotel is located on Ka'anapali beach and close to "Black Rock" for great snorkeling. Ka'anapali beach was one of our favorites... plenty of space, and never over populated. Service and friendliness of staff was amazing. They truly make you feel welcome and part of their "family." The room was OK. The size was good, with fridge and safe. However, the rooms we stayed at were a bit out-dated and slightly noisy. Good thing our neighbors were quiet. KBH is remodeling, hopefully they will get to the building we stayed at soon. Parking was "reasonable" for Hawaii at $9 per day. The garage was very convenient and safe. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel based on location, service, & amenities. Rooms do need to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “We love the nightly Hawaiian music”
Reviews.Author: Mauimama05
Reviews.Content: My husband and two boys stayed at the Kaanapali Hotel in January 2009.This was our second time visiting this hotel. The rooms were clean,the property was clean and well maintained.There is free nightly music and hula shows outside at the Tiki Terrace .Also The Tiki Bar has awesome frozen strawberry margaritas.The Tiki Grill has yummy onion rings!!We ate dinner a couple of times,downstairs at the mixed plate restaurant.This is the best value for dinner on Maui. Trust me. They have salad items,meat items,prime rib,fruit ,dessert,ice cream,much much more.Also ice cream and your drink is included!! My husband took the boys scuba diving at the big black rock just a short way down the beach. They had such a good time.The staff always made us feel welcome and like we belonged.I would stay there again and again...

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aloha000
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to write and say once again we had a wonderful holiday visit in Maui thanks to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. The staff is fabulous and there is no other place I would want to spend the holidays in Maui but the Kaanapali Beach hotel. Thank you and we hope to visit again next year! Mahalo, Suzanne and Alexandra Graff

Reviews.Title: “My Family Loves KA'ANAPALI Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kacie1994
Reviews.Content: My family loves to stay at the KA'ANAPALI Beach Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: strissell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is certainly top of the line in my book. Clean Spacious Rooms with awesome views of the courtyard or the ocean off Ka'anapali Beach. They have the friendliest staff of anyplace I have ever stayed. At any given time anyone of thier staff members is willing to go out of their way to make your vacation the best it can possibly be. Utilizing Guest Services is a must. Malihini and Mikala are amazing and they have always helped us plan great adventures when we are on Maui! If your planning a trip to Maui you'll definately want to check out this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to get married and spend your honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: kellilynn81
Reviews.Content: The staff is outstanding!! We were happy with every aspect of our stay. Only thing is to be careful to where your rooms is. If you are in the Molokai Wing, I would recommend changing rooms. We were original assigned there, and were ok with it, then a friend upgraded our room to the Lanai Wing and it was 200% better. The views and location is more than we could ask for. You are a short walk from the Black Rock and the Whalers Village. Also the Tiki Terrace restaurant is very yummy. Our wedding was very beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “Familiy Trip”
Reviews.Author: physedmom
Reviews.Content: KBH is a great place to bring the family. The staff is great and the hawaiian activities/passport program for the kids will keep them busy. Every night at the bar the whole family can enjoy a hula show and music while your liitle ones dance.

Reviews.Title: “friendliest Hotel in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: NHGrammy
Reviews.Content: In November we returned to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for our third stay. As soon as we pulled up to the front we felt as if we were coming home. The staff here are so friendly and accomodating. It is such a nice feeling to actually be remembered from a previous stay! It would not be classified as "elegant" but it is clean and comfortable. The food at the Tiki Terrace was outstanding and the breakfast buffet at the Mixed Plate was always delicious. The staff are very proud of their heritage and it shows. There were many different classes offered to learn about the Hawaiian culture that were fun. We enjoyed the entertainment every night. It is located just a short walk to the Whalers village shopping center which made it very convenient for shopping . The lei ceremony the day that you depart is very touching. We would not hesitate to go back whenever we can.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the BEST!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: williewoohoo
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at 'ka'anapali beach hotel' and i will continue to make this a yearly destination. This hotel creates a uniquely hawaiian experience from the moment you enter the hotel grounds. Unlike other hotels on the island, this one is a bit more simple. If you are going to Hawaii to stay in a resort with an indoor pool, an exercise room and the likes then this is not your place to stay. But, if you are going to Hawaii to really experience a different culture then this IS your place to stay. I mean seriously....an indoor gym? You have the entire island to hike, swim and just have fun on. I really don't get those people that 'visit Hawaii' and just spend time ordering room service and watching tv. Ok, back to the hotel. The rooms are simple and Hawaiian. Our room consisted of two double beds, desk, armoire with tv (that was not once turned on in eight days), a balcony with a table and chairs to enjoy the sunset. It couldnt get better. And the hotel grounds were impeccable. There were plenty of lawn chairs to lay out or read on (and an amazing book exchange room....to give and take). The plants, trees and abundance of birds were just amazing and somewhat calming. And the hotel has plenty of things to do......there is the nightly hula show with live music (free), morning and afternoon classes where you can learn to make leis, hula, play the ukelele and more (also free), a swimming pool, a huge checker board with red and black coconuts as pieces, the tiki bar, etc. So much to do. And did I mention that you are right on the beach? Absolutely amazing! Now onto the staff, they are probably the biggest incentive to come to this hotel. You actually feel like a part of their family. They are helpful in any and every part of your vacation. I had them help me book a zipline tour and just help me with things that would be fun to do. They suggested many locations and trips, and gave me maps and directions to get to each location. Upon leaving you are greeted by the staff where they sing a song and extend their gratitude for your visit. You are then given a kakui nut necklace...with a special story. Last of all, price. Our room ended up being around 200 dollars a night (and an additonal 9 dollars a day for parking). Neighboring hotels on the same beach were more than twice the same amount and those rooms didnt have an ocean view! You would pay roughly three times the amount for the same view. So, if you don't need an indoor gym and the likes I would check this place out....and maybe you will see me on your visit. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, We Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sequioatrees
Reviews.Content: We could have not asked for a nicer experience than we had at the KBH facility. First and foremost the people who work there treated us with respect, are friendly and we were always greeted with an Aloha and a big smile. Nothing quite like that to start your day!! Our room was great and had a beautiful view of the immmaculate grounds and pool. We found great shopping within walking and easy driving distance. We were fortunate to be there at the time when the Christmas program was presented, it was heartwarming and beautiful, just like the Hawiian culture. All the programs were entertaining and full of local culture, which we did not experience on the big island last year. Special thanks to Dale (at the Tiki Bar) and Malihini Keahi-Heath in the front lobby for making this an especially great stay. WE WILL BE BACK!!!! TWO VERY HAPPY PEOPLE FROM CALIFORNIA

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Hotel treated us like family”
Reviews.Author: shell16
Reviews.Content: I saw this hotel featured on the Vacation channel. It was described as the most Hawaiian hotel. The show featured the grounds, hotel rooms and the special features they offer such as lei making, hula instructions, kids crafts and so on. What impressed me the most from this show was how the hotel staff said good-bye to their guests. They presented a special lei and sang a song. When I booked our trip, I specifically asked for this hotel and would not accept any substitute. I read a lot of reviews and opinions about this hotel and fell in love with the place even before I got there. We arrived the first week of November. There were 3 girls with more suitcases and bags you could even imagine. Without hesitation, comments or anything, they gladly helped us with the luggage and brought it to our room. We asked for another chair for the balcony along with addtional towels-we had them in an instant. The view from our room in the Kaui wing was the most beautiful you could ever imagine. The hotel was going through some renovation, but it never interferred or interrupted our stay. The nightly shows, the staff that made you feel like family, the convenient location, the beach, everything about this hotel will fill all your dreams of a Hawaiian vacation. I would most definitely return to this hotel. The special treatment while we were there was outstanding and something we did not find while we were in Oahu and the big island. The finishing touch was the good-bye ceremony when they presented the Kukui bead necklace. We all hugged just as if we were family leaving, for now, but will be returning. I highly recommend this hotel for all that is Hawaiian and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the 'Aloha Spirit'”
Reviews.Author: BubbaBearLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a very enjoyable 2 week stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel, Lahaina, Maui. All the staff here are the most friendly, happy and helpful that we have ever met. The hotel encourages and demonstrates traditional Hawaiian crafts and skills and it's well worth observing these. The grounds are beautiful, spotless and very spacious so thereâ€™s no overcrowding. We enjoyed sitting at a table outside in the evenings listening to the bands and dancing to their music. All so enjoyable and we really felt the 'Aloha Spirit'. All in all the KBH has a fantastic atmosphere and service and we shall definitely return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “not very good”
Reviews.Author: duster36
Reviews.Content: My travel agent spouse and I decided to stay here for a few days after reading some of the reviews on here. She wanted to review the property since more Canadians are visiting Maui than ever. We are both very experienced travelers and not especially demanding. Firstly, I'm baffled by some reviewers who have given this hotel such a high ranking. It makes me wonder where else they've been staying. For the money, there are much better values on Maui. On the plus side, the room was clean, the cleaning staff very polite and the grounds well maintained. The hotel was nowhere near as crowded as the other hotels. If that's all you are looking for, you'll be ok. Now the negative side. The service at the front desk over the weekend was at best indifferent. To be fair, it was a different person on Monday and she was very friendly and helpful. We were put in a room with a lanai for smokers and when we asked to change (my spouse has very bad asthma), we were told we were lucky to get what we had and not to complain. I don't think the hotel was full so I suspect the desk person couldn't be bothered for some reason. Needless to say, my spouse couldn't go outside since the neighbours to our right were heavy smokers and a first attempt sit on the the lanai resulted in a cloud of smoke coming our way and lots of coughing on my part and hers. There was no mention of the construction that starts at 8 a.m. when we booked. For reasons unknown, we were not given the 20 dollar breakfast coupon that supposedly came with our room or any of the advertised features that came with the room usually. Not part of our package we were told. Why? No one could say. Again, this was never mentioned to us when we checked in or when we booked on the phone. Who wants to spend 36 dollars per person on breakfast? They did advertise breakfast for 14 dollars but the person at the restaurant said we needed the 20 dollar coupon. Huh? We found the restaurant overpriced and not very good. I would suggest the Hula Grill in the property next door instead or the restaurants in Whaler's Village. There are no beach towels and to rent a lounge chair will cost you anywhere from 10 dollars to 30 dollars. The beach staff pack up things at around 5 p.m or so. The beach is not really suitable for swimming so you might be better off at the pool if you have kids or you're a senior. Both computers at the business centre were not working and, on further inquiry, we found out that someone had removed the "out of order" signs on each for some reason. Despite putting a sign out at the door of our room asking not to be disturbed, the cleaning staff came in anyway much to our dismay. At night, we noticed that the back door of the building near the main walkway is left wide open and there is no security in sight. Anyone can walk in without a problem. There were other problems as well but I think the point is made. In short, nothing major but enough to put off some people who are hoping for a hassle free vacation.

Reviews.Title: “My other Home”
Reviews.Author: Nurse039
Reviews.Content: this was second trip to the Ka anapali Beah Hotel. It was like coming home. The staff are amazing, the events that are planned every day are just what anyone would want to do to find the true Hawaiian culture. There was never a day that I didn't feel at home. I went solo on this trip and as a single female, I was comfortable , met great people and was well looked after by my other "family.I have told everyone who has asked me about my trip that it is the one place they have to go and the only place to stay. I will be going back as soon as I can. Debbie ,Miramichi, New Brunswick Canada

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrbubble70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at KBH for 3 days in Nov. as part of a 10 day trip to Maui. Our first room was in the Moloka'i wing and was not acceptable. It looked like it had not had guests for a long time and needed cleaned again-dead bugs on the counters and dust and grime everywhere. It was very disappointing after a 15 hour airplane trip. One call to the front desk and we were moved to the Maui wing to a nice clean room that was a great improvement. The grounds are beautiful and the beach is gorgeous. We are planning a trip back with our kids in June and will return for another short stay at KBH. We were there celebrating our 15th anniversary which I indicated when we made the reservation and on check in but it was not acknowledged. Staff was pleasant but no more than everyplace else on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “True Aloha Spirit with Great Value”
Reviews.Author: polkabop
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in an awesome location, get true value for your money and meet the nicest hotel staff in the world then this is the place for you. Staying at this hotel means you will be paying a fraction of the price that the nearby hotels charge so if you want super luxury and the amenities that go along with the high price then reconsider. However, if you want the true Hawaiian aloha experience, comfortable accomodations, good food, warm and attentive service, exceptional Hawaiian activities, and the feeling that you are home with family-then this is the place for you. Their welcoming breakfast is a prelude to a wonderful vacation and their farewell lei ceremony sends you off with a tear and desire to return as soon as possible. Don't leave Maui without seeing KUPANAHA. / Polkabop/ Hobe Sound, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: dlc159
Reviews.Content: We went to Kaanapali Beach to celebrate our 46TH, anniversary from 11/01/08 to11/10/08. When we got to our room , there was a bottle of Champaigne in our refrigerator & a nice card on the desk.WE loved the Hotel &the beach was so nice &it was just beautiful. Every one was very nice, the nightly Hawaiian Music was nice, we had a great time & we are already planning our next trip to Maui & The Kaanapali Beach Hotel. I hope to see Malihini Keahi Heath,when we return. She is A special &very talented Lady. Thank you. Aloha &Mahalo . Dewey &Linda Cassel-Chillicothe,Ohio

Reviews.Title: “OK stay at KBH”
Reviews.Author: BIBIX3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 19month old daughter after reading all the reviews her on T.A. It is a beautiful location and we chose an oceanfront room b/c we have an infant and knew we could hangout on the lanai while she was in bed. The rooms was lackluster but the view was amazing. The grounds were beautiful. The staff was OK....I didn't get the Ohana vibe at all. We had 2 instances when the staff was clueless. I probably would stay here again but might upgrade for a place where the staff were a bit more accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonBelle57
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Ka'anapali Beach Hotel was like the icing on the cake of our most wonderful vacation ever! What an amazing hotel with incredible staff. Everyone is so knowledgeable and helpful in every way. There are a variety of classes offered daily in order to take advantage of the knowledge and talent of the staff members--- hula, lei-making, ukele, Hawaiian medicinal plants, several lessons on Hawaiian culture and history, as well as fun things for the kids to do. There is nightly live Hawaiian music and hula dancers under the stars, surrounded by plumeria trees and the sound of the ocean. We were always made to feel special, and at the end of our stay were presented with kukui nut leis and sung on our way by the staff members. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and plan to return sometime in the future...maybe for our 15th anniversary in 2 years.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Wicker34
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 8 glorious days at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel in Maui Hawaii! I have travelled extensively throughout the Caribbean, going to Cuba at least once a year........however, absolutely nothing compares to this beautiful Island and the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. I've often returned to certain resorts and hotels based on the friendliness and the service of the staff.......not only was the staff at this hotel friendly, courteous, prompt.....I truly consider many of them friends. I visited many hotels while staying on Kaanapali Beach in Maui (I was attending a conference at the Westin Maui) and not one offers the service that the KBH does! Not one! When they claim that they are the "most Hawaiian Hotel" they are not exaggerating. While other hotels offered beautiful surroundings, the KBH felt like I was coming home every night. The staff are there to help in any way they can, always offering smiles and TRUE Aloha Spirit! The grounds are beautiful, they offer authentic Hawaiian activities to take part in every day ...and free I might add (lei making, hulalessons, cultural walks, etc). The restaurants are also quite excellent...the Tiki Restaurant, the Grill and the Mixed Plate. And finally, every night beginning at 6:00 there is a Hawaiian "show" complete with music, singers, hula dancers ...... absolutely beautiful. Staff members told me how much they truly enjoy working there.....how often do you hear that! And to top off an amazing stay, there is a "goodbye ceremony" where you receive a kukui lei. I won't spoil the ceremony, but let me tell you there is never a dry eye at the ceremony! Please take my advice and stay at this hotel if you ever decide to go to Maui........you will definitely not regret it! I already can't wait to go back! PS - Hi to Malihini, Mikala, Brad and the awesome Bell Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Gem in Kaanapali Resort Area”
Reviews.Author: AkanaOhana
Reviews.Content: Reviews from this site sounded good. Wasn't interested in the avg. price listed though, so I called the hotel directly. Pleasantly surprised to be able to stay there for less than accomdations I found in Lahaina (Front St) and Kahului. Got to check in early. Got everything I requested: Kauai Wing, Renovated room, King & daybed. Parked in structure on 2nd floor (covered), used both the elevator and stairs, either way, a short, pleasant walk. Worth the $9 charge. Stayed 2 nights and wished we could have stayed longer. Room and beds very comfortable and clean. Refrigerator was handy. Bought snacks and drinks from the sundry shop and enjoyed the grounds, beautiful and relaxing. Ate dinner and breakfast at the Mixed Plate restaurant after checking the options at the Whaler's Village. Excellent dining, every meal is complete buffet, many beverage and dessert choices too, well worth the price! So much to choose from and so delicious! Catch the "Early Bird" dinner time for a discount and fresh food, not sitting long in heated pans. Took soft serve ice cream back to our room, put in the freezer, and ate it later. Caught some of the free entertainment. We (musician family from Oahu) thought it was good. Impressed seeing staff from the lobby earlier in the day dancing hula on the stage the same night. Deep drop in the beach, besides that, very enjoyable for families, really nice sand. Nice shopping and museum at Whaler's Village-less than 5 min walk. Enjoyed browsing through the expensive resort hotels along the beach by walking or the free trolley. Bought beautiful handmade bracelets Friday morning in the lobby from Geri "Kalei's Krafts" for friends and family back home. Aloha spirit was in every employee we came in contact with. Excellant customer service, kudos to the managers who lead the KBH ohana. Want to return to Maui and definitly stay at KBH again!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: glassartlover
Reviews.Content: First, note that there are 3 hotels with Kaanapali Beach in their name. Until we arrived, I thought I had reserved a different one. I would say that this hotel is a solid 3 star rating. Adequate is how I would rate most facets of this hotel. There are no large rooms or suites here. The pool is small and must be crowded when the hotel is close to full. The rooms are clean. The hallways and elevators are run down. The Mixed Grill restaurant is a small buffet with mediocre food. The other, larger, outdoor restaurant facing the stage area has better food. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The location is quite good, being close to The Whalers Village and a short shuttle ride into Lahaina town, which is a lot of fun. They have free outdoor stage entertainment every night from about 6:30 - 9:00pm. Don't pay rack rate for this hotel. It is a good value if you book it at a package price. Considering how very expensive Maui is in every way, one way to save money is to use this hotel on a package rate. See my recommendations for Hula restaurant and the Warren & Annabelle show.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: IdaOslo
Reviews.Content: We had such a great stay at the Kanapali Beach hotel. Since we were on our honeymoon we got upgraded to a better room (with oceanview) for free. In the room there were two glasses and a bottle of champagne waiting for us. Excellent!! The staff was really friendly and helpful. The location was awesome, the garden a great place to relax, the room nice and clean . We also enjoyed the farewell ceremony were we got a really nice Lei as a gift. The only thing we were a bit disappointed with was the breakfast arrangement. We didn't like the breakfast buffet that was included, so we decided to use the breakfast vouchers in the Tiki restaurant. The result was that we ended up paying for breakfast as we could only use one voucher pr breakfast and the voucher didn't cover what we ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Truly the most Hawaiian Hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: R0binH00d
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had such a wonderful time at the hotel. Amazingly I can truly say that the Aloha Value room had everything that we could have needed (after Vegas and San Francisco we needed somewhere affordable and the hotel did not let us down!) The staff 'went the extra mile' to make sure that we had a great holiday and the concierge Malihini was very helpful and informative. There is plenty to do if you like a more active holiday; the hotel will arrange trips around the island but one of the things I really liked were the activities provided by the hotel. There were lots of sessions throughout the week where you could learn to Hula, make leis, learn about the garden and the medicinal plants and lots more, and all free!! Or you could just chill on the loungers (plenty of them too) in the garden and relax. The beach is quite literally right next to the hotel garden with just a path in between. The hotel prides itself justifiably on being the most Hawaiian hotel on Maui. The only slight problem is that the building where our room was situated had three floors but no lift, having said that the staff were always happy to help with your cases and let's face it you only have to carry them up once don't you! I would happily go back there tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sorrentogirl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBH in Maui for our honeymoon for just 1 week. We were immediately upgraded and we were also left a bottle of champagne on our day of arrival. The staff at KBH were extremely professional, kind, hospitable and always available to help and resolve matters quickly. We were also left cookies every day on our bed for when we arrived back in the evening and we found this to be an extremely gentle and additional gesture to what was already superb hospitality. The view from our room was amazing, we had ocean front. The gardens were pristinely kept. The facilities were superb. The food in the restaurant was top quality and the nightly entertainment was well thought out and enjoyed. We left KBH with such a feeling that they had truly made our honeymoon a gift to cherish forever. We were only sad that we had not booked longer! Book this hotel for whatever occasion you are thinking of celebrating, you will not regret it. It was indeed a holiday of a lifetime. Sangita and Lorenzo

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Charm”
Reviews.Author: kglady61
Reviews.Content: We were at KBH for 3 nights this last week. We loved the Hawaiian charm of the place. The staff is very friendly and made us feel at home. Yes it is a tired resort, but everything was clean. The location was in walking distance to other restaurants and shopping! We met a few couples that return to KBH every year, so they are doing something right :) The (free) nightly entertainment was enjoyable. It was a nice ending to a full day. The Kukui lei ceremony on our last day was sweet. A very nice touch and it made me sad to leave. The island of Maui is so beautiful we would love to come back again and we will definitely stay at KBH again!!

Reviews.Title: “Most Hawaiian Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dmiller0216
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three weeks at the KBH from 9/20 to 10/11. As a return guest, we were treated to many extra amenities under their Lei Aloha program. Yes, the resort is showing it's age (they are currently doing some upgrading to rooms in the Kauai Wing and exterior painting to the Lanai Wing), however you will not find another hotel on Maui that exemplifies the Hawaiian spirit of Aloha and Ohana like the KBH. Housekeepers, servers, valet and guest services individuals will all treat you as part of their family. There are numerous complimentary Hawaiian activities that you can choose from on a daily basis, from lei making to weaving, to garden walks. This is not a five star resort with waterfalls, hot tubs and room service, but if you truly want to experience Hawaii this is the place to stay. We spoke to people who had just come from the Westin (a few hotels down the beach) and they were required to wear wrist bands to get their pool towels! Who wants to be treated like that, unless you are a child at a waterpark. (And contrary to a previous reviewer, towels were plentiful and free at the beach services hut in the courtyard). Our room was serviced daily with fresh towels, linens and toiletries by a wonderful housekeeper named Minan. We spent the extra money for an oceanview room (6th floor) and it was well worth it. If you don't care about your view (or lack thereof) get the cheapest Aloha Value room, but keep in mind you may be looking at another hotel when you sit on your lanai. Or upgrade to at least a pool view, part ocean, or ocean view and marvel at the beautifully immaculate grounds, whale pool and deep blue ocean. Parking is $9.00 a day, but parking charges are standard in Hawaii. The KBH is on the best beach with the nicest grounds, you'll pay way more at the other resorts in Kaanapali and wll receive way less for your money. Plenty of choices for meals, a buffet only restaurant that is indoors, a menu restaurant facing the courtyard with free entertainment each evening, and a pool side grill for even more casual dining. Be sure to catch the evening entertainment at least a couple of nights. It runs from 6pm to 9pm with different groups rotating performances. All were excellent. From about 6:30 to 7:30 they have hula dancers too. Although the entertainment is adjacent to the Tiki Terrace Restaurant and Tiki Bar, there is no purchase of food or drink required to attend. You will not find a better hotel on Maui than the KBH. Check out their web site and book direct, they have some fantastic deals and packages. You will not be disappointed and once you stay there you will be family and never stay anywhere else on Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Our island home”
Reviews.Author: travelingmomof03
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful, relaxing beautiful place to stay. The staff is so kind and thougtful, you truly feel like family. The site is beautiful, you couldn't ask for a better location. It is right on Ka'anapali Beach and two doors down from Whalers Village. The hotel is old but feels so Hawaiian not like the sterile big chain hotels where you can't even tell which state you are in because they all look the same. The graciousness of the staff is most impressive. We will not stay anywhere else on Maui. Susie, Heather and Ashley

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jams33
Reviews.Content: Maui was the relaxation portion of our Hawaiian honeymoon adventure. We chose the KBH because my husband had stayed there back in 2005 and thought it would be perfect for us. Great location but not as expensive or frilly as the other resorts on Kaanapali Beach. Plus we are big fans of supporting the little guy and avoiding the mega chains. We booked the room, meals and wheels package and were happy with every aspect of it. We had a partial ocean view room on the 4th floor of the Kaua'i wing. The room was clean and comfortable with a wonderful view of the pool, the courtyard and Black Rock through the trees. We spent most days at the beach or pool or relaxing on a lounge on the grass. We enjoyed breakfast each morning at Mixed Plate and it filled us up till dinner. Every staff member we encountered was warm, friendly and full of aloha spirit. We were surprised to find a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room when we arrived and were delighted by the macadamia nut cookies brought nightly to our room. We also enjoyed the goodbye ceremony at the end of our stay where I received a kukui lei and my husband had a new nut added to the lei he had from his previous stay. Hopefully someday we'll return to Maui and if so, we will definitely return to the KBH.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Paradise”
Reviews.Author: RyanGUK
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the KBH as the first leg of our Honeymoon. Fantastic. The beach is idyllic, golden sand, blue ocean and views of Molokai and Lanai. The hotel is lovely, the breakfasts were nice and there was a nice feel to the whole place. We did feel a bit younger than everyone else there but that wasn't offputting in anyway. The rooms weren't really quiet, but they didn't disturb our sleep at all and the live entertainment was a great way to chill in the evening and had finished plenty early enough so it didn't disturb guests. This is not as swanky as some of the other hotels on the beach but has character, great staff and makes Hawaii affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: RCMaui
Reviews.Content: This hotel is our favorite in Maui. We keep returning each year and have been going there since 1984. The staff is so friendly and warm and truly want your experience to be special. Everyone, from every department, greet you with true Aloha Spirit. They have a free sunset Hula Show each evening. It is wonderful to eat at the Tiki Terrace Restaurant and enjoy the music. Their Sunday Brunch is the very best! At the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel you can learn about the Hawaiian Culture, there are many activities you can join, or you can just relax on the grounds and enjoy the warmth of the sunshine. When we return each year, we truly feel we are "coming home".

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was back!!”
Reviews.Author: missbb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after doing alot of research and after some negative reviews, we were slightly dubious about staying here. These doubts were completly unfounded and this was one of the best holidays of my life. The staff were friendly, the location amazing and the room perfect. There was a real feel of Hawaii rather than some of the other sterile four and five star properties nearby that we visited. The grounds were stunning and the view from our Lanai was breathtaking. I would stay here again and again and would recommend it to anyone. Take advantage of the free activiteies, they are really fun and I wish we had done more. The leaving ceremony was great and Malihini Keahi-Heath from guest services was so lovely!! We got married on Maui and received a room upgraded and a bottle of champagne as well as some coffee the next day which was a charming touch. The maid also left little messages and the cookies in the evening are an added treat. I would recommed this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxing Hawaiian holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Most Hawaiin Maui Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelrunner1
Reviews.Content: The KBH is a smaller property, but very comfortable. Our room overlooked the garden and the ocean. You can hear the evening music from your lanai and hear the ocean waves along with a gentle breeze. Cookies on your pillow is also a nice touch. The rooms are clean and generally have all you need including a little fridge and sofa. Breakfast at the Tiki Restaurant is a little better than the Mixed Plate. At the Tiki Restaurant you can have eggs and pancakes prepared just the way you like them along with a full buffet. The food choices at the Mixed Plate are about the same, but it's an indoor restaurant while the Tiki has its tables outside overlooking a nice garden area of the hotel. If you have a tourist activity the hotel will prepare a box lunch, which is gteat for hiking or downhill biking. Can't comment on dinner as we were out doing things and generally didn't get back until later. The hotel is only a short walk from the shops at Whaler Village and is nice in the morning since you are right on the beach. The pool is nice and great for an evening swim. The hotel has a small outdoor bar that is always busy. Our drinks were fine. The staff is really helpful with anything you need as far as activities and questions. Check-in is never long no matter what hour your long flight gets in. Be sure to participate in the lei ceremony before you head home. You get a Kukui nut Lei and the story about it with nice music. Makes you want to come back soon. The only bad thing is I don't like to pay for parking at any hotel, It's $9 a day and a bit more for valet parking. I guess for Hawaii, that's not too bad. I don't know if the other hotels do the same, but I would guess they do. This is our 6th return trip to this hotel and next year we will be staying here again. When you find a place you like, why change.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic,quaint and unique”
Reviews.Author: frappuccici
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise. It was very charming with a very authentically Hawaiian feel. The staff is very friendly, the bar and restuarant is a nice place to spend your evening with a free live show every night. They turn down your bed and leave very tasty cookies, and their restuarant has the best Maui Onion soup in the world. Before you leave you must be part of there goodbye ceremony where they sing a song and place kukuis lays on you. Definitely a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Hotel is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Lolirs
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place! Its not new or fancy, but its one of the most comfortable and friendly places we've ever stayed. We were visiting Maui for the first time to run the marathon. I booked this hotel based on the recommendations on this website. I'm so glad we stayed here, and I'm looking forward to returning. Our room was spacious, quiet and comfortable. The food at the Ohana breakfast and the Kaanapali Mixed plate buffet restaurant was really good. The Kaanapali Mixed Plate buffet opens at 6:15, which is nice when you're 5 hours away from your "home" time zone, and awake and hungry earlier than usual. We had easy access to the pool and the beach, and there were so many things to do at the hotel that we didn't have time to try all the things that sounded fun and interesting. Guess we'll have to go back. :-)

Reviews.Title: “True feeling of Ohana”
Reviews.Author: beachbriciks
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd visit to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and we were pleased to see that the feeling of ohana was still very much intact. Everyone greeted us with a smile and an "aloha" and we immediately felt at home. We were welcomed with a gift, and sent on our way with a kukui nut lei. Each night we were entertained with a free hula show and daily we enjoyed the free classes to learn about the Hawaiian culture. It was a most wonderful visit and the Kaanapali Beach Hotel is the only one we will consider when visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Hotel ,great value, lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: linlubber
Reviews.Content: Our current stay here is, in a word, outstanding. No, this is not a luxury resort. This place is a comfortable, charming, old school Hawaiian type of hotel, and a great value. The location is directly next to the Sheraton, and the Whalers Village on the other side. There is a beach sidewalk linking all the resorts around here so restaurants at other hotels and the Whalers Village is easy walking. The beach here is fantastic, right in front of the property. We switched from the Sheraton after 2 nights. The Sheraton room was an internet special, it was dark (next to a building) and we didn't like being on the ground floor. When we inquired about moving our room, they informed us they could move us for an additional $75 a night. I felt like I was being punished because we got such a good rate on the internet. Well, we moved to the KB hotel, to an ocean front room, practically overlooking the sand for about the same price. The grounds are like a park, where you can sit on lounge chairs in the shade under the trees, or by the pool, or on the beach which is the same beach as the Sheraton. This hotel has a more casual, laid back feel than some of the more upscale formal hotels. My husband and I are loving this experience and we keep talking about what a good value this is.The staff go out of their way to be friendly. If you want luxury and don't mind spending your money on it, go ahead. If you are looking for value and a nice, decent, charming, friendly place,,, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: januaryqueen
Reviews.Content: We had the best time at the hotel! We actually switched hotels half-way during our stay, and we were so sorry that it worked out that way for us! After having stayed at the KBH, the hotel we changed to (which cost more than double per night) was a disappointment. Our family was still staying at the KBH, and so we spent as much time as we could with them. The atmosphere was friendly and fun, like being a guest in your friends home. The kids loved it too! We attended as many of the classes as we could, and the kids filled up their Passports and got the special prizeâ€¦ Our favorite thing about the hotel, by far, was Malihini Keahi-Heath! She is an amazing woman who helped to make our family vacation the best ever! Her warmth, attention and kindness, as well as her knowledge that she openly shared about Hawaiian culture made us feel as if we got our moneyâ€™s worth and then some at the KBH! The next time we go to Hawaii, there is no doubt where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “A hawaiin jewel”
Reviews.Author: donder
Reviews.Content: This is a jewel of a hotel. The complete guest service staff were very knowledgeable about Maui and Hawaii. This hotel has a real wealth of history about the island and its traditions and they enjoy sharing with guests through the various programs. The grounds are beautiful with lots of established flora and fauna! The Restaurants were wonderful and the location to everything was perfect. This hotel could become a Hawaiin state treasure. There truly is something for everyone at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “paradise in maui”
Reviews.Author: alohaNewJersey
Reviews.Content: this was our second time staying here,& we can't wait to return. the rooms are clean,service was great, and we were truly treated like family. also the food was very good.nightly entertainment was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Family”
Reviews.Author: vacationtime03
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second visit to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel! Returning to the hotel was like coming come and catching up with old friends and family.
