Everyone made is feel at home and very welcome. The experience was truly Hawaiian as the staff are dedicated to keeping to traditions and values. We look forward to going back some day. Our entire family would strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Hotel has the best beach”
Reviews.Author: SanCarlans
Reviews.Content: If you are there mainly to enjoy the beautiful sand, swim in the turquoise ocean and snorkel amongst tropical fish; enjoy the laid-back Hawaiian atmosphere, this is the hotel for you. This hotel is a gem amongst the steroid-sized hotel chains nearby with their pool-centered crowds. Kaanapali Beach Hotel is at the best part of the beach, with great swimming, and only a 100 yards from one of the best snorkeling spots: the Black Rock. It is 5 minutes away from a number of decent restaurants and a 5 minute drive from Lahaina - which is not the quiet village we fell in love with 25 years ago anymore, but that's another story.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMauiLover
Reviews.Content: There were 10 of us total who visited Kaanapali Beach Hotel..8/4 to 8/11/08. My parents treated us..it was their third visit to the hotel and our first visit and first time in Maui. The staff at the hotel is so friendly and seem to cater to your every need. We all had an awesome trip and cannot wait to visit there again. In our books...this is definately a 5 star hotel! The Tonar family and the Crabtree Family

Reviews.Title: “comfort plus”
Reviews.Author: Dolores25
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the staff. I can't remember when I've been somewhere and everyone around me had a smile on their face. I had a few problems with medical equipment, but all in all I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marksample
Reviews.Content: The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in Maui was a wonderful place to "come home to" at the end of our busy days while on the island. It was so relaxing to sit out on the lawn overlooking the ocean. The staff was very friendly , and we hope to return some day and spend more time enjoying the beach and taking things a little slower. Maui has so much to offer, and we didn't want to miss anything, and we would definitely return to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “KBH is the best”
Reviews.Author: KALENA117
Reviews.Content: Ka'napali Beach Hotel is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at. We will stay there every time we return to Maui. The hotel has an excellent pool, tiki bar and grill,along with tropical landscaping you would expect to see in paradise. The location of the hotel is right on the most beautiful beach, with easy access to all the activities. The rooms are clean and decorated with Hawaiian style furnishings. The chocolates and cookies every night on your pillow are delicious. The views were breathtaking from our lanai. The hotel offers many free activities to experience the true Hawaiian culture. The staff is so warm and welcoming that you feel like family. We will cherish all the memories. Karen and Alan (Waltham, MA)

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay "Again"”
Reviews.Author: bears60
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this Hotel AGAIN. We have stayed at this Hotel five times in the last few years and always receive great service. The entire staff makes you feel like family. We would not consider staying anywhere else in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “smashing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anyescape
Reviews.Content: this is a smashing hotel, really individual with knowledgable, friendly staff, a great, underrated restaurant, right on the beach. we had a brilliant holiday here and would love to return one day

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, beautiful, welcoming place-- KBH”
Reviews.Author: anda11thatjazz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for introducing yourself to what a Maui beach resort is all about. Really nice for families, couples, all ages. KBH is next door to the Sheraton Hotel, which has the luau and Black Rock for snorkeling, diving. The beach walk also takes you straight to the Whaler's Village, great for casual shopping and dining. Keep walking and you'll pass some time share resort properties as well as the Westin Hotel with its grotto and swans and big crowds, and then the Hyatt is all the way at the other end of the beach path. The atmosphere at KBH is relaxing and pleasant, and there are very nice remodeled rooms in the Maui and Lanai wings. Mixed Plate Diner is the breakfast buffet cafeteria and offers better value and choice than the Tiki Terrace, which is outside, more picturesque but also much pricier. The hotel's fresh pineapple is phenomenal. KBH staff are plentiful, accomodating and knowledgeable. They very much have Hawaiian spirit so you feel really welcome and comfortable at this hotel. The hotel makes a point of welcoming returning guests as well as people there on special occasions. Last summer booking a room and car package direct at the hotel website worked out well. KBH used Dollar Rental, which provided a good reliable compact. You can even get a courtesy room for 30 minutes on your day of check-out, if you want extra time at the beach. All in all, an excellent holiday at a super relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We left our heart at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenWashington
Reviews.Content: Aloha, We left our heart at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and our Ohana. I read much about many of the hotels on Ka'anapali Beach, but something about KBH took my heart and felt like home. It was much more than ever expected. We had a list of things we wanted to do...but we rarely left. We had a timeshare to go to...but we came back. We so missed the sweet, tender, loving spirit of those at KBH, who made us feel like family as we feel toward them. This is such a wonderful place for young or old. A family can find just about anything they want on the grounds without having to leave. We would never go anywhere else by choice. There are wonderful classes to go to, and while you are making a lei you might learn about all the uses of kukui nut, or Malahini might soothe your sunburn with the Ti leaf. There is entertainment at night along with hula dancing as you view the sunset. On Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Sunday, craftsmen from the area come in to share their wares. If you are lucky, Auntie Nani will be there making leis and sharing her beautiful wisdom, We loved everything about the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel, a world unto its own...and shed tears as we left. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff make this hotel shine!”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie808
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time staying at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel over the past 4 years. We return for several reasons. The staff is very friendly, from valet, check-in, housekeeping and wait help. They always say hello, good-morning, or aloha. A little really does go a long way here. Also, the location really is great for going to the beach or shopping at Whaler's village mall. The Mall is within walking distance, so it's a good place to browse, shop for trinkets, or get necessities at the ABC store. The room are not luxury however. They give you everything you need, but they are dated. While there, we noticed that they are renovating by floor, so in a few months time, it may be different. Our room was ocean view and faced directly toward the ocean in front of Kaanapali beach. We spent the majority of our time on the beach, under umbrellas or in the water. The location is perfect if your idea of relaxing is gazing out into the pacific from dawn till dusk. The most perfect sunsets! This is a great value hotel with a great location and friendly staff. The food at the hotel is pricey as with any hotel, so I would recommend eating outside of the hotel. Malo, near Lahaina, is a great place for breakfast right on the water. Enjoy the pacific ocean at this "most Hawaiian" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just a lovely place to stay - very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DonnyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We booked the romance package direct with the hotel this turned out to be great value, we had an ocean view room on the 6th floor, breakfest included, picnic hamper, massage,1 free activity (we went snorking $200 value) and a dinner at the hotel. A rental car was also included (Dollar Car Rentals), this was not so good lots of extra hidden charges we were 15 minutes late bring the car back after 5 days and they charged us an extra days rental, the car was a mustang old dirty and lots of marks, I paid for the prepaid full tank of gas only to find out it was only half full, staff were inflexible and rude ($450 extra over and above free cost from hotel) other than that I'd highly recommend this hotel one last thing beware of the 3:30pm checkin

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: AnyExcuse2Travel
Reviews.Content: Older hotel but right in the middle of a beautiful stretch of beach surrounded by expensive, pricey hotels. I stayed here over Easter with my daughter who just turned 8 at the time. My oceanfront room I reserved wasn't "available" the first night but we were given an ocean view room and the bellman moved our things the next day while we were swimming. The pool is nothing spectacular but it was perfect for my daughter and I could sit close and watch her. The life-sized checkers game using coconuts as checkers was fun. The restaurant was good and the Easter egg hunt and buffet was wonderful. My daughter expecially enjoyed the "passport program" the hotel has. She had fun going to every station on the passport and the hula skirt making acitivity was interesting as well. The hotel has hula classes and several Hawaiian cultural demonstrations. The staff is especially friendly and helpful. I would stay here again. If you don't need a big, fancy pool to make your vacation complete, this is your place. Rooms were somewhat dated but I'm not here to spend my vacation in my room. IThis is a great location at a good price. Within walking distance to may very good restaurants and The Whaler's Village shopping plaza. The ocean is right out back of the hotel. Rent a covered lounge chair for a few hours if you like the beech. The beech was good for making sand castles but the waves are rough at times. You can walk next door to the famous "Black Rock" behing the Sheraton for amazing snorkling and a sheltered cove for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: WenTrip
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to stay. Everyone is very friendly. It is not owned by a franchise but locally owned. Other people from other hotels came to this hotel for a drink at the Tiki Bar. Everynight they have live outside music that you can hear from your room.The grounds of the hotel are amazing!! Overall, excellent place to stay in Maui. You will not regret this stay at his hotel!

Reviews.Title: “we had an amazing time!”
Reviews.Author: diane8656
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Maui and Hawaii and we could not have picked a better place to stay!. The hotel was only two minutes down the beach boardwalk to Whaler's Village with tons of shops and places to eat. Another two block walk in the other direction is Black Rock where we snorkled every day with green sea turtles and tons of fish. It was amazing! The hotel itself was great. The room could certainly use some updating but it was very clean and quiet and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. We went to the free welcome breakfast the first morning and they entertained us and did about a one hour slide show and explained what to see and do on Maui. Every night there was a free hula and live band show. We had great teriyaki pineapple burgers at the Tiki Shack Restaurant on site. Lahaina is a ten minute drive away with excellent shopping and restaurants - we loved Bubba Gump's Shrimp House. The grounds of the hotel are immaculate with lots of lounge chairs everywhere so you can sit in the shade or sun. The pool is small but clean and we used it a lot. The beach in front of the hotel is awesome but you really do have to be careful of the waves coming in. They will knock you right off your feet and the drop off is very steep very close to shore so be careful with kids and people who don't swim well. On our last day we were sung a goodbye song and given a Kui Kui nut lei which we are to bring back with us on our next trip. I can't wait to go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “KBH- Great location, beautiful grounds, great packages.”
Reviews.Author: kcorn
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at KBH. Last time we chose the Aloha Value Package, this time we did the returning guest package with ocean view with breakfast buffet included. Our view was great, view of the ocean and grounds. The grounds are gorgeous with plumeria trees, pool, and are groomed each morning. You can't beat the value for this beachfront property in Maui. We went and checked out the Westin and Sheraton nearby, and while very nice looking, they didn't have the shady space that KBH does to take your lounge chair to where ever you want....especially the Westin. The lounge chairs were crowded together in full sun. If you want the pool with the slides and a bunch of screaming kids running around, go there. If you want peace and quiet, go to KBH. Our room was roomy enough for 4 of us and our luggage. It was always clean and we loved having coffee on the lanai/balcony each morning. My huband and I would go to the breakfast buffet every morning. Our kids would sleep in and walk down to Whaler's Village (about a 5 min walk) and go to McDonald's when they woke up. So it worked out for all of us just perfectly. The buffet would have been a waste of money on them since they wouldn't have eaten fruit or banana mac nut pancakes! You have to rent a cabana on the beach, you can spend the day in the water and have some shade as well. You can snorkel at black rock which is super close to the hotel. We came home refreshed from our vacation, just sad we had to come back!! We can't wait to go back!!!! Once you go, the hotel will send you specials, so I know we'll be tempted...... : )

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: nmfink
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I spent 10 days for our 20th anniversery @ the Ka'anapali beach hotel . It was a once in a lifetime vacation for us . The hotel staff was incredible and very helpful my husband managed to plan our renewal of vows without me knowing with the help of the staff it was unbelieveable. I was suprised to say the least and it was most enjoyable trip ever. We used the hotel to book all our activities. We did everything.. The hotel staff was kind and very helpful. I would recomend this hotel to everyone. If you want a stress free vacation this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: rinehokie
Reviews.Content: I read reviews everywhere I could find regarding hotels on Maui. We booked in February 2008 and stayed at KBH from 7/30-8/9. Just returned home yesterday, but I felt compelled to write a review on this hotel. Actually first time I have ever written a review or felt I needed to do so. While on Maui we visited the Sheraton, Weston (we stayed at the Hyatt on Maui 12 years ago), Marriott and even swam in the pool at the Ritz-Carlton (with permission from the hotel to see the property - not sure if could afford even a day there but it is very nice) in Kapula one day. All of these hotels are very nice, and their pools are far better than KBH which has a small pool. But we wentfor the ocean, island itself, food, etc and not because the hotel had a great pool with a slide. So here is what I found at the KBH. The rooms are 'normal' (not great nor horrible), the breakfast was good at both resturants, the spot on Ka'anapali Beach is perfect for sun bathing, swimming, snorkeling, etc. Short walk to the Whalers village for supper and shopping. Staff was excellent and very helpful (we have 2 daughters and the kids program is great). We had the breakfast meal deal in the morning, lunch in the room (we are not rich so had a budget to keep) and then dinner out in Lahania, Kapula or at the Whalers Village. We went to Kapalua beach (Ritz Carlton Pool and to the Kapalua Beach) one day, Trilogy for a trip to Lana'i, daughter took a surfing lesson, snorkeled off of Black Rock (even jumped off myself), Old Lahania Luau and just had a great time. In closing I just want to say that we really hope to go back to Maui again and we will definitely stay (and only stay so long as the rates stay where they are in relation to the other hotels - most resonable price I could find after months of looking) at the KBH. As far as the negative reviews on this hotel I have come to figure out that some people just have an unhappy life, can't be pleased and are just in general negative people. Hopefully these negative people will stay at another hotel because I really do not wish to be around them. But if you are a 'normal' traveler I hope you have as good a time as my family and get to experience the Hawaiian Culture on display at KBH. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Loved the KBH”
Reviews.Author: megebo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel on two different occasions and can't wait to get back. The staff is the best and helpful. If you want to relax this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: stace7590
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed at the KBH for our honeymoon in June. What a wonderful stay, the rooms were a little small but very clean and well kept. We stayed in an oceanfront room, and oh my goodness what a view, we were in the Kauai wing on the fourth floor it was amazing. We spoke to other couples who were easily paying $600 for the view we were paying $350 for (including our car) and felt we really got a great deal. It has the best location on the beach and the staff was very friendly their was a bottle of champagne in our room when we arrived and I enjoyed the nightly turn down service. We ate at the Tiki terrace restaraunt and it was great my husband had the steak and I had the shrimp it was all perfectly cooked we were quite impressed. This was a special time for us and a moment I will remember for the rest of my life, Thank you Kaanapali Beach Hotel for making it all that much more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: RaySimpson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the KBH between July 18 and 25. We'd read the reviews on Trip Advisor, and so we had a good idea what to expect. We weren't let down in any way. The location can't be better -- there were some lovely sunsets, a good clean beach, and close to all the amenities of the Kaanapali beach resort, and slightly further afield Lahiana. We booked a garden view room via United vacations, but when we arrived, we were given a double upgrade to a partial ocean view room. Partial = magnificent. The staff were always friendly and helpful, and we liked the little touches, such as the welcoming letter, the nightly biscuits, and the fact that somebody prepared our room by drawing the curtains and turning over the top cover of the bed every night. There was even somebody watering the hot sand when we walked on to the beach. At reception, we were given breakfast vouchers for either the hotel restaurant or the buffet just outside the hotel. We tried the buffet first morning, but there was a long line, and people walking around looking for empty tables, so for the rest of our stay we dined in the hotel and paid the little bit extra for breakfast. We booked an airplane trip via the hotel, and when it was cancelled, they quickly managed to arrange an alternative helicopter trip to Molokei -- and that was well worth the money. We didn't have evening meals in the hotel, instead we just wandered along the concrete path and ate in the restaurants there, but be advised, make sure you book in advance because all of them were packed. There's also some very good restaurants in Lahaina and elsewhere -- in fact, we didn't have any sub standard meals when we were in Maui. When we left, we were presented with lei in a lovely ceremony in reception. All in all, we had a memorable stay. There was a real Hawaiian feel to the hotel, which added to our holiday. We hope to go there again sometime in the future, and certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: jbcsIndiana
Reviews.Content: A beautiful place to stay with a great beach. Had a wonderful and relaxing stay here. Everyone was so helpful, all you had to do was ask and they provided. Their welcoming ceremony and goodbye ceremony just topped it off. Hope to come back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly the MOST Hawaiian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnandLeann
Reviews.Content: A wonderful time was had by all in the family during our recent visit to the hotel. This was our second visit and we enjoed it even more than the first one. This time we made it a point to "get involved" with the staff and take classes on weaving, lei making, sand art, how to cut a pinneapple, hula dance etc. Every experience was just great and we loved the interaction time and the personal level that the staff shared with us about their lives. The hotel is truly the MOST Hawaiian in how they treat you like Ohana (family). The room was great as well as the nighlty shows. Although we don't know how long before our next visit, we will be dreaming of it daily! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “The KBH is Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Mauzay
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were not fantastic, but were very clean and the view from our's was beautiful. The outdoor spaces were very nice and much more open and less crowded than other places down the beach. The KBH was very relaxing and it was nice to have a free show every night in the courtyard. The little extras like the welcome breakfast, Hawaiian classes, and excedllent beach location, would bring us back to this location again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service BUT Rundown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tikaroo
Reviews.Content: The beach of course is beautiful outside the hotel, the grounds were nicely kept but I think most all of the hotels in Hawaii are. The employees were very friendly but my goodness they need to renovate that thing. Just seems dirty and old. My husband and I cant figure out why its the #6 pick on the Lahaina Hotel list.

Reviews.Title: “Ourtdoor Dining”
Reviews.Author: onemite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton- but ate at the Ka'anapali Resturant 3 times in one week stay.. The food was awesome, and the entertainment down to earth. Waitresses and other employees of the Hotel graced us with their beautiful Hula dance. We danced and enjoyed the "nightlife" of Maui from there, since our own hotel closed everthing an hour or two earlier.Our friends stayed in the Kaanaplai Beach Hotel, and the next time we go, we plan to stay there also. It is definitely more value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Total Satisfaction!”
Reviews.Author: Butter08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have taken our children and grandchildren on three trips to Maui and have always stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. This facility has every feature that we desire for a relaxing, fun vacation: a laid back life style, a great beach, lots of activities on the grounds as well as at other nearby Maui attractions. Probably most importantly, the hotel and grounds are like an oasis in the midst of high-rise hotels and condos. We have always felt like a welcomed friend or family member when we arrived, during our stay and when we left. This time, Malihini brought tears to our eyes as she gave us kukui nut leis and explained how, in the Hawaiian tradition, they bring all people together. All the staff are so helpful and friendly, but Malihini makes the stay extra special. As the grandkids "leave the nest" this was our last opportunity to have the entire family with us. A great time was had by all!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: mattjr2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I honeymooned here for 5 nights at the end of January to the first of February. Well, first off, the hotel looks like a 2nd rate motel. Not very nice at all. I was very dissapointed in the rooms. The service was terrible. The first shower I took was all cold water! I mean freezing cold water. I called down and it took a couple of hours to get someone up to fix it. Another incident occured when my wife and I were in our room changing for dinner. Without a knock or anything, one of the employees walked right in on us changing and half naked!! They just inserted their key and walked right in. Absolutely horrible. Also, the guy at the excursion desk tried to rip us off and sell us an excursion for more money than it was selling for elsewhere. Dont book anything through the hotel. Also the food for the free breakfast is absolutely terrible. I mean disgusting. Same thing everyday and very poorly prepared. The 2 good things were the beach and the restaurant downstairs had a good banana's foster type desert that i had twice. Otherwise, the hotel was terrible, do yourself a favor and spend a little more to stay at a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time and nice experience at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpicySass
Reviews.Content: We just returned on 7/18/08 from 6 nights at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in Maui. We had a partial ocean view room in the Lanai wing. We were impressed from day one with the beach. It was plenty wide and not rocky at all. The hotel property was never crowded. We felt there was plenty of space to lay out and to wander the property in the evenings at dusk to view the sunset. Our room was kept very clean. The front desk was always helpful, and the employees who provide the welcome breakfast are a riot. We took two of the Hawaiiian culture classes the hotel offers (lei making and hula lesson). Book early as the classes fill up 3 and 4 in advance. There were several other classes we wanted to take and couldn't because they were booked already even though we checked on our second day there. The hotel location was very convenient -- when we felt like driving for supper it was only 5-10 minutes to many good restaurants in Lahaina, and when we wanted to stay near the resort for supper we would just take the boardwalk -- several good restaurants only two or three few hotels away. The Mixed Plate buffet breakfast that comes as part of package is just OK. Same thing nearly every day with only a little variation. We were glad to have it included with our package, but the lack of variety got a bit old by the 6th morning. The bartender at Tiki Bar was rude and very slow. Took him 30 minutes to get one drink and get our receipt to pay the bill. The grounds of the hotel are kept up very well. Beautiful landscaping -- it appeared to us to be much better than the landscaping at neighboring (more expensive) hotels. Overall, we would return to this hotel for its decent price. It is a clean, welcoming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect 35th anniversary trip!”
Reviews.Author: CeceliaMichigan
Reviews.Content: Since this will probably be our only trip to Hawaii i agonized over my choice of hotels. Our travel agent said it had absolutely the best beach on Maui and it does! Our room was not glamorous but it was clean and big and the ocean view from the lanai was spectacular. The staff was helpful and courteous at all times. We loved walking to Whaler's Village to eat or shop and our trips to Lahaina were delightful. The neighboring hotels were definitely more glamorous but they just didn't seem as welcoming or comfortable to us. Location, ambiance and service made this an anniversary to cherish!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to KBH”
Reviews.Author: RooBug
Reviews.Content: We've just gotten back from our six day stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH) and we're already trying to figure out when we can go back. It was our first trip to Hawaii and it was so much more than we ever expected; much of the credit for our wonderful experience goes to the amazing staff at the KBH. We felt completed enveloped by their hospitality. My children (10 and 12 years old) and I thoroughly enjoyed learning about Hawaiian culture through the hands-on classes and demonstrations offered at the KBH. We LOVED the lei making, the ukulele class, the pineapple cutting, etc. etc. Each night we were lulled into the Hawaiian state of mind by the sounds of traditional Hawaiian music accompanied by Hula dancers in the hotel courtyard. We were also able to book other activities off-site (a luau and surfing lessons) right from our hotel where the staff not only booked the events for us but also offered great advice about when to get there and what to bring. If I have any complaint it is that we could not stay long enough to participate in everything that the KBH has to offer. It was truly difficult to leave the KBH and the warm, friendly staff that had become a part of our ohana.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel & my wedding was gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: EngagedAnna
Reviews.Content: I loved the KBH. TheY coordinated my wedding on the sand. It came with the Minister, hula dancer, photographer, prints & fresh flower leis. We had the ocean front room on the 1st floor & walked right out from our patio onto the lawn & just a sidewalk away from the sand. The staff was wonderful. They gave us champagne on arrival since we were getting married & then on the day of the wedding they gave us another large bottle & chocolate covered strawberries. The buffet breakfast was simple & easy, nice way to start a day. The Tiki Terrace restaurant served incredible food & I bought some great stuff in the gift shop. The valet guys couldn't be any cooler. I read a few reviews about the hotel being outdated but I didn't think so at all. I went over to the Sheraton next door & it was almost too stale & blank. Too modern without a lot of personality plus there were tons of kids there which I didn't want on my honeymoon so the KBH was perfect for us. There were a few older kids but that was it. We had the "Island Romance" package which included the car, daily breakfast, a dinner at the Tiki Terrace, a picnic lunch is a backpack that you keep which is awesome. It came with plates, silverware, glasses, napkins, table cloth, cheese knife, cutting board, bottle of wine with an opener & all the food inside. We took it on our road to Hana trip & it really came in handy. We also got 2 bottles of water every day & an excursion. We chose the Luau at the Hyatt & that's the only thing I would have done differently. It just wasn't our speed. Too much waiting in lines & the food wasn't that great. Also a lot of kids & parents on stage learning to hula dance. It was cute but not for our honeymoon. I would choose the surfing lessons or dinner cruise next time. All in all it was fabulous & I didn't want to come home!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Balance”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravelmatt
Reviews.Content: The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is not the 'nicest' resort on Ka'anapali Beach but I think it is the best place to stay for the money. During this trip we also stayed at the Hyatt down the road and ventured into some of the other hotels. While the Ka'anapali Beach does not have the amenities (fancy multi-level pools, restaurants, spa services, huge lobby, etc) that many of the other resorts in this complex offer, it has the best stretch of beach, very comfortable rooms, great staff, and is so perfectly located that I would stay here first on my next visit to Maui. It is less than a 5 minute walk to Whaler's Village which offers great restaurants, shopping, etc that the other resorts try to make all inclusive. Our room was huge and had a nice balcony that overlooked the very well maintained grounds. If you are looking for a centrally located hotel, with clean rooms, great staff, and are willing to walk 5 minutes to get great food, this is absolutely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great for families”
Reviews.Author: ohanagoodtimes
Reviews.Content: Overall good experience at KBH. Great location between Black Rock and Whaler's Village. Pool is very accomodating for young children with 40% of pool 2-3 ft deep. Check in was okay, had to wait till 3:30pm. Clean rooms, grounds, friendly and helpful staff. Rooms: Had ocean front room 5th floor in Kaua'i wing. Great view of sunsets, better sunsets on the beach. Clean room with basic hawaiian decor. Double beds for parents and both kids (2 and 5). Balcony was great to relax on. Grounds were well kept. Beach towels are located at the Trilogy shacks. The Tiki bar/grill had general bar food with drinks that are reallly strong!! Plenty of lounge chairs and room at the pool. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Kids programs included a Passport program that encourages kids to visit different venues and activities to receive a gifts. Must do the orientation morning breakfast and lei ceremony at your checkout date. Great information and part of becoming KBH ohana. Mixed Plate restaurant was good with some local food on Thu and breakfast was good with variety of foods. Not fancy, just good, decent breakfast. Nightly ground activities with free shows of hula and music. Access is easy to Whaler's Village, just walk on the boardwalk . 5-10 min walk. Overall would stay there again. Not too fancy as some of the other hotels, but the aloha spirit certainly makes up for it at the KBH.

Reviews.Title: “KBH Feels Like Home”
Reviews.Author: HulaGirlNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at KBH in April 2008 and we stayed there for our 2-week honeymoon afterwards. We found all of the staff to be extremely welcoming and friendly. Everyone from the valets, bus boys, waitresses - everyone was very nice. The wedding coordinator was very helpful during our wedding planning process. The grounds are maintained to perfection. Our room was average. We stayed on a ground level room looking out onto the gardens and pool. Next time we would like a room on one of the higher levels. We bought the breakfasts with our packages. We grew very tired of the Mixed Plate breakfast buffet. Actually by the end of our stay, we didn't even want to eat there any more because we were so tired of it and the food was only so-so. The dinners at the Tiki Terrace restaurant were delicious and the entertainment was very good - especially the Saturday night band. The parking in the lot isn't very good and the spaces are very tight, so you definitely want to pay for the valet parking. Some of the best snorkeling is right on the beach there at Black Rock. Whaler's Village is a short walk away. We will definitely stay there again and bring our leis back with us. It's an excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good, except if your are honeymooning!!!”
Reviews.Author: MJ9
Reviews.Content: I booked the KBH about 9 months in advance. It was our honeymoon and I spent hours reading all of the reviews and still was very hesitant about staying there. I did not want to fall into the same situation as some of the other writers who got a non-updated room or got stuck in a gloomy part of the hotel being this was a once in a life time trip to Hawaii. So I thought it would be a no-brainer to get the Ocean Front room, as it was the most expensive one at 345 a night, which was the cost of a Garden View room next door at the Sheraton. For sure, these 54 rooms would have to be updated first compared to the 300 something other rooms in the hotel. I called many months in advance and reminded them that it was my honeymoon and I would really prefer an updated room. For nine months I would call every other month and re-confirm this information; â€œHigh Floor, non-smoking, up-dated room.â€� They did inform me that the sixth floor was updated and that smoking was allowed on the Lanai, but I clearly told them that the sixth floor would be fine as long as the room did not stink of smoke like some of the other reviewers wrote. They assured me that smoking was allowed only on the lanai. Well,,,, the day finally came and my worst nightmare came true. They put us on the fourth floor which was one of only two other floors that was not remodeled yet. Plus, there were two other floors being worked on and totally unavailable in our wing. When you walked through the hallway you got that depressing feeling that people wrote about and there was a toxic like smell in the hallway of cleaner overuse. When we arrived to the room the description of â€œMotel Roomâ€� that was used by other writers was perfect. The sink was being held up by one of those old flimsy aluminum type bars, that we had to adjust a couple of times ourselves. The tub would not drain properly and the SCREEN DOOR WOULD NOT SHUT ALL THE WAY ALLOWING THERE TO BE A 3 INCH HOLE AT THE TOP OF OUR SCREEN WHICH THE FLYS and MOSQUITOS FOUND. The carpet was old and the bathroom floor had that Motel look to it. When we walked out onto the lanai, YES it was ocean front, but only 2/3, as there was a big yellow wall that came out to the right about ten feet and our view of the long stretch of beach in front of the Sheraton and Black Rock was obstructed, actually you couldnâ€™t even see it if you leaned over. As you may or may not know, Black rock is one of the areas main attractions. At night we had to shut the glass door because of the damaged screen which was a shame and a real buzz killer because the sound of the crashing waves outside was so soothing and nice, but the glass door had to be shut because the bugs would have a field day with us coming in through the damaged screen. (My wife had three mosquito bites after the first night) When you walked to the other properties you could see the difference and it only added to my frustration. Plus, all the other hotels are just as Hawaiian, they have the Aloha spirit, local employees and all the cultural activities that KBH had. Yes, I clearly understand that these hotels cost 100 to 150 more a night for ocean front, but after this stay and the great experience we had the week after in Kauai at the Sheraton, I would have preferred an updated Garden View room somewhere else, compared to the one we had. I would like to conclude by saying I clearly understand that you get what you pay for and this is what we got for not staying next door. But then again, we were in one of the only rooms of the hotel that was not re-done and it was the highest priced room. This hotel is perfect for families or people visiting on a budget, but absolutely not for honeymooners. Even if you get an updated room there is no romantic feeling to this hotel what so ever. Every time you return back to the property from your day or night out you canâ€™t help but notice the â€œMotelâ€� look and feel. I am one of those people who like to make the best of every situation and am one of those romantic Italian guys who can make something out of nothing, but I feel compelled to give notice to all other honeymooners. If you are going to stay here you have to mentally prepare yourself to do so. Do not listen to the hype that the hotel markets and donâ€™t waste your money on Ocean front as the Ocean view rooms on the 4th, 5th and 6th have views that are just as good. I did ask for an updated room after we checked in but the hotel informed me that it would not be possible until the 3rd night and they tried to use the â€œnon-smokingâ€� request as an excuse for giving me the room, but I made it clear to them many weeks in advance that an updated room on the sixth floor would have been fine since smoking was only permitted out on the lanai. As for everything else we had a perfect time in Maui and even a better time in Kauai, but if I could do it again I would have booked the Sheraton next door.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location Ever”
Reviews.Author: bigtraveler01
Reviews.Content: When traveling I always use this site to get feedback and decided I should share my experience so that it may help anyone undecided. I surprised my 11 year old daughter and my mother with tickets to Maui. We stayed at the Ka'anapali and it was absolutely perfect. I like nice things, love a big hotel with marble floors, but for this family vacation nothing beat our hotel. Our room was an ocean view on the ground floor level, for easy acess for my mother. The view was amazing. Unlike the other hotels on the strip, if you stay in an ocean view ground level, you can actually open your patio and walk out to the beach. There are activities for kids daily, the staff is very nice, and it was not crowded. The pool is small, but honestly we preffered going in the ocean just steps away. Anything that you may be concerned your missing from any of the other hotels is uncomparable to the service, island experience, and location you'll recieve here. You are walking distance to the shopping, and best snorkling by black rock. I promiss you wont be dissapointed if you really want to enjoy a truly relaxing, familly friendly, beautiful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Love KBH”
Reviews.Author: tiffyde
Reviews.Content: This is our third time at this hotel and it gets better every time. This year we brought our son on vacation. This is the perfect hotel if you have kids or if you are single. So much to do and the staff is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation Place”
Reviews.Author: mcb1001
Reviews.Content: We had the pleaseure of staying at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel in Maui this past month. It was such a wonderful hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and they really remembered so many of the guests there. The rooms were clean, and spacious; and the view of the pool and beach from our balcony was beautiful. We loved the true Hawaiian feel of the hotel, including the entertainment at night, with Hawaiian dancing. The beach and pool were right out our window, but there were plenty of other activities available - and the Guest Service Agents were always ready and willing to help us plan what we wanted to do. On our last day, we loved the farewell ceremony, and the kukui lei that the hotel gave us. They made us feel part of their Ohana (family)

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not for a Honeymoon...”
Reviews.Author: ShoeMuchacha
Reviews.Content: This place is ok if you're on a budget. The Hotel is not up to date. My husband and I went there for our honeymoon in December. We enjoyed the location because it's next to the Sheraton and a few steps from the Hilton and other great hotels. You do get nice views of the beach, but don't expect any room service or good food. The lobby and the restaurant are kind of stinky and it just feels like you walked in to the 70s. I say spend the extra money and stay at the Sheraton or any other hotel in that area because Ka'anapali IS beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “Top choice for a reason”
Reviews.Author: 1999Spurs
Reviews.Content: I wrote a lengthy review of this hotel and it didn't make it through screening...guess I was a bit too hard on those persnickity types who give this hotel a hard time because it wasn't built yesterday and they didn't feel people visiting paradise really needed to walk across marble and granite and have their drinks pouring from some gold embossed fountain to feel like they were on vacation. So, anyway, my toned down version would tell you that this hotel is fantastic, great staff, great location, great family oriented activities, (the Magic Show is still talked about by my kids over 1 year later...I didn't expect much from it but it was great). The hotel might come off a bit 'cheesy" at times, but it is all authentic and a great time. If you don't take yourself too seriously and don't feel like you need the hired help to have to bow down to your every whim (don't get me wrong, they were great but the negative posts are people with obviously very different priorities than enjoying paradise and nature) you will love this hotel, this place, and the 100% Ohona vibe that is created here. Want granite and rare food and for people to treat you like royalty? Look elsewhere. Want a Hawaiian family at a nice place with great culture/feel? Welcome home!

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here”
Reviews.Author: travelfanIowa
Reviews.Content: I'm a little slow at getting a review written but after having so much trouble deciding to stay here because of negative reviews I really wanted to tell people how wonderful we thought this place was. We stayed there because our neighbors had stayed there 6 times and liked it a lot. Why people seem to complain about it on this site I don't understand. If you are looking for ultra modern, plush then it probably isn't for you. If you are looking for a nice comforable, extremely clean, large room and friendly, welcoming, hospitality then you definitely should consider staying here. We stayed here from March 5 thru the 11th. Our room was on the 6th floor of the Maui wing and was very nice. It was very large and had a wonderful view of the gardens, pool and ocean. I like the fact that the sink and counter are separate from the stool and tub and the area with the tub is very large compared to most places we have stayed in recent years. There is a small fridge and housekeeping was excellent. We could sit on our balcony watching whales through our binoculars. The music and entertainment each night was pleasant and even if we were in our room we kept doors open and enjoyed it all. We loved the huge and beautiful grounds with enough chairs you could always find one and move it to sun or shade. The pool isn't large but was never crowded and was nice and warm. The friendlyness of the staff is wonderful and the activities like hula lessons and lei making are a lot of fun. We had a package that included breakfast at the Terrace Restaraunt and it was a wonderful buffet that could have been breakfast, lunch or a combination thereof. We did eat there one evening also. It is so pleasant to be able to walk all along the Kaanapali Beach area and go to Whaler's Village for shopping or dining. I will agree that a new mattress with the softer top would be a nice addition and maybe they are working on replacing things like that since they seem to be remodeling. After being there, visiting the other hotels in the area I definitely know we made the right choice by staying here and only hope we have the opportunity to return. It was going to be our one and only trip to Hawaii---we'll be married 45 years this year---but after being there we definitely hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Again! - The Second Time”
Reviews.Author: sls9929
Reviews.Content: Our family has visited Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH) twice, first in in October 2005 and recently in June 2008. We love the location-right on the beach and close to some great snorkeling, Lahina, and The Whalers Village. We also have been very well taken care of by the staff. The concierge, was able to make all the arrangements for us to a boat snorkeling trip, parasailing and recommendations for restaurants. The guest services was able to send a very fragile package to the mainland and it arrived intact. The magic show was a real hit with my young son, while the evening entertainment was what my husband and I enjoyed most. The entire staff has always been very knowledgeable and helpful with any requests or questions we had. We are already planning our next trip back to KBH.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the Memories!”
Reviews.Author: Deni08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary at the KBH. We would like to thank you all from the bottom of our hearts for making our Anniversary such a memorable one. Our experience at the KBH was exceptional from the time we checked in, until the time we checked out. Guest Services was extremely helpful with suggestions as well as helping to book other activities on the island. Everyone, including the friendly maids and landscapers, made us feel welcome and right at home. Our room was clean and we had a great beach front view. The hotel grounds were exectionally beautiful and cleaned daily. This may have been our first visit to your fine establishment, but it definitely won't be our last. Thanks for the memories! Maui 5/08

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel On Maui!”
Reviews.Author: sunbathinshorty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our second stay at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel (KBH). We can't ask for more from an affordable hotel. KBH has the most friendly staff that provides excellent service. They treat you as part of the family. The hotel is steps away from the beach. Has a large courtyard with a Tiki Grill and Tiki Bar to enjoy your food and drinks by the whale pool. At night they have a music and dance show...for free! There is no need to pay money to go to a Luau. They also offer free activities during the day, such as lei making and learning to play the ukelele. Lastly, they say goodbye with a lei to bring back with you your next visit. We wouldn't stay at any other hotel on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hawaiian experience”
Reviews.Author: Princess77
Reviews.Content: We booked at the advice of a friend that has been to Maui many times and knew the area. She highly recommended the Kaanapali Beach Hotel due to the location and for us to experience the Hawaiian culture, from the moment we arrived until our departure it was incredible. On the day your arrive you are invited to a welcoming ceremoy, this was wonderful, on the day you depart the staff greets you in the lobby to gift you with your lei and bid you farewell. Every evening they had a show with hula dancing and Hawaiian music. Everyone enjoyed of all ages. We had the Room, Wheels and Breakfast, this was a wonderful deal and great breakfast to start each day with before we journeyed out.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was acceptable, but I'd stay next door at the sheraton next time”
Reviews.Author: rockohorse
Reviews.Content: The one major problem I had with this hotel was the check-in. We booked online at the beach hotel website - hard to go wrong there. We had the printout (with the name of the hotel and the website printed on the sheet!) and we got a really good price - apparently too good according to the manager that told us that we couldn't have possibly booked with them because the price was too low - since coming home i checked the website, there is another deal only 10$ more than we paid online right now - first they told us to go back into town to their sister hotel (the plantation) and check in there, then they made us wait a really long time (probably hoping that we'd go away) and then they begrudingly gave us a room all the while pretending that they were doing us a favour (I sent them a complaint but apparently they are ignoring me). As long as you can avoid the management the hotel is ok for a cheap hotel (we paid 160$ before taxes and parking) The beach is good - for reference the sheraton, kbh and the whaler seem to have the best beaches, as you get down to the end - i believe it's the westin the beach drops off, the surf gets rough and people sunbath on the lawn. Snorkling - snorkle in from of the sheraton by the rocks, you'll see fish and possibly a turtle. I'm guessing kbh rents snorkle stuff (we had our own), if not the sheraton does. The pool is small - we didn't use it - the sheraton pool looks much better and so do a few of the other hotels. The hotel rooms are standard, the rooms facing the garden are noisy as they have shows during the afternoons and evenings. The breakfast food is pretty bad - and really overpriced, but it was included in the room. In a nutshell, if you want a cheap hotel I think that this hotel is acceptable, but if you want a bit more class go next door to the sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl715
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so family friendly. Grounds are excellent for children to play. Something for all age groups. You can play with the kids all day on the beach, by the pool, near shopping and than relax in the evening and listen to Hawaiian Music in the outdoor bar area. The hotel is not glitsy but the most friendly and helpful staff. All needs were met when ever we asked for anything. It is definately a place we would come back to in a heart beat. Both for the Hawaiian atmosphere and the friendly and courteous staff. Rooms were great and our Partial Ocean View was excellent with a great view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, rooms are dated”
Reviews.Author: amyxoxo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel (actually forced) as a result of a cancelled flight. Here's the good and the bad. Good: Very helpful staff, beautiful grounds, prime spot on the beach, and plenty of Hawaiian activities (lei making, hula lessons, etc.) Bad: Very, very outdated rooms. Pretty shabby and everything was dingy and felt dirty. May not have actually been dirty, just felt dirty since everything was old. And you can hear everything from your neighbors. Walking from above, showers running, toilets flushing, etc. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again...rooms need major renovations. However, I would recommend the Mahana! It was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “True Hawaiian Vacation”
Reviews.Author: 50-and-retired
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th trip to Maui and my 1st stay at the KBH. It has a great location on Kaanapali Beach. It is an older hotel but has just been updated. The service people are very friendly and helpful. The food is wonderful at the Tiki Resturant but you should pass on the tiki grill by the pool. If you want the true old time Hawaiian stay on Maui this was by far the best I have found. There is so much to do on Maui, you need to get the book, Maui Revisited - long before your trip. It will help you plan your trip, and you need a plan. I will stay at KBH again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmkennedy
Reviews.Content: We just completed our week-long stay at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in Maui, and wanted to give it a definite "thumbs up". While not the newest hotel on Ka'anapali Beach, it was clean and comfortable. The view from our lanai was absolutely wonderful. The hotel prides itself on promoting Hawaiian culture, and I think they're doing a wonderful job. We enjoyed the free welcome breakfast buffet -- it was interesting and informative, without taking too long (and they even gave away some great prizes). We also looked forward to the nightly cookies also! Both of my daughters joined the Aloha Kids Club and eagerly attended the activities -- I'm not sure they even realized how much they were learning about Hawaiian history as they enjoyed themselves. The program is for kids and their families, and while I did not look forward to attending the kid's club activities (I have enjoyed drop-off kid's club programs in the past), I found all of the activities to be interesting and enjoyed spending the extra time with my children and seeing learn new things. The hotel, I feel, has one of the best locations on the beach and is within walking distance to restaurants and shopping. And as a bonus, we actually saw a whale frolicking in the water one morning while sitting on the beach. The pool isn't large, but was the perfect size for our family (and was not crowded). There is nightly entertainment that can be enjoyed (for free!!), and a Tiki Bar that serves great tropical drinks. The KBH has two restaurants which are both good, we ate breakfast at both and were happy with the food choices (as were our kids). We also enjoyed a great dinner at the Tiki Terrace. The Guest Services department helped us enjoy our stay, and they seemed to enjoy their interaction with guests. The hotel offers a magic show called Kupahana, which I HIGHLY recommend to anyone staying in Maui -- it was awesome, and the food was great. We would return to KBH in a heartbeat...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the quiet surroundings!!”
Reviews.Author: dazey337
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an 8 night stay for our 25th wedding anniversary from Apr. 16 - 24th. In comparison to the other hotels surrounding ours, we found that we had the most property to sprawl out on and put your lounge chair wherever you wanted and had your own space without being on top of your neighbour. There was never a problem of getting a chair even around the pool as was evident at the other higher end hotels nearby. The fragrance of the plumeria trees in bloom in the courtyard was amazing. We had an oceanfront room with 2 double beds even though we had requested a king size bed. We were disappointed upon entering the room and found this however we were on the 3rd floor of the Molokai Wing which was the top floor and the view of the beach was amazing. When I called the front desk and asked them about a king size bed, they said they did not have any available with an ocean front room. They said to check the next day for any cancellations if we wanted to. We decided to stay where we were and didn't bother inquiring. My husband enjoyed watching 3 young dolphins at play one early morning from our balcony! Our room was a little tired looking but on the whole not bad and for the location of the hotel and price compared to the others, it was well worth it. The meals weren't bad at the hotel. We bought the Romance Package and it included a buffet breakfast at The Mixed Plate Restaurant or your coupon could be used toward your meal at The Tiki Grill but then you had to pay the extra and really, there wasn't a great difference in the quality of the food there from the other restaurant. Our package also included our rental car and an insulated picnic bag to keep along with a picnic lunch which included enough food for a couple of lunches for the 2 of us so we were pleased that we had purchased that particular package with our travel agent. The weather was perfect. The staff for the most part was friendly, not over the top but okay, with the front desk the friendliest. We went to the magic show offered at our hotel and very much enjoyed it and the meal provided. On our day of departure, we were given kukuei nut leis to wear in keeping with the Hawaiian traditions which this hotel is noted for. On the whole, we had a nice relaxing holiday and would stay at the KBH again should we ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: wearetravelintexans
Reviews.Content: We just went to the Kaanapali Beach hotel with our two kids, ages 4 & 6 and had a marvelous time. I have to admit when we first checked in we were not impressed with our room and were a little concerned that the rest of the hotel would have the same rundown feel but that was not the case. The room was very spacious and frankly, we didn't spend a lot of time there anyway - the real value of this hotel is in the beautiful location and the activities you can participate in. They post the activities and you have to register for them beforehand (don't just show up because there is preperation that goes into each of the activities) and the ones that we did were awesome - we learned how to play the ukulele, made leis and took a hula class - all really fun! My four year old son took the lei making class with us and actually did great. You have to take the initiative to participate in the activities - it would be easy to miss if you weren't aware of them! (Also, it was nice to go to a welcome breakfast where they didn't try to arm wrestle you into buying a condo) Our kids just loved the passport program, and I didn't feel pressured to buy anything - they were just thrilled that they got a stamp and a gift at each location throughout the resort and totally got into the whole program - my daughter wore her passport even when we weren't in the hotel. She was very proud and told every kid she saw about it. The shows in the evening were nice, we could sit and have a cocktail and the kids danced to the music, so relaxing! If it's luxury you're after or you're on your honeymoon, I probably wouldn't stay there, but with family it was perfect - check rates and you'll see that it's a great value for that part of Maui. It was our first time to take the kids to Maui, I would have been ticked if we took them to a four star hotel and hung out at the pool the whole time. We felt very welcome and very comfortable and would definitely go back. We had a free night at the Marriott Wailea which was really awesome - they have an incredible pool (hey - weren't we on one of the best beaches in the world? why were we at the pool?) And the rooms were first class, the buffet breakfast was absolutely first class but it definitely didn't have a relaxed family feel, the beach wasn't directly in front of the hotel (if you stay in Wailea be aware that they have a pretty small beach compared to Kaanapali and all the hotels share it - in Kaanapali most of the hotels have their own beachfront) not to mention the going rate was nearly 3x that of Kaanapali Beach Hotel, we couldn't have swung a whole trip there but it was nice to have a little luxury at the end of our trip. All in all, as far as value - Kaanapali Beach Hotel is worth it - stay there, save the cash and use it for excursions and the HUGE cost of dining throughout Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Treaded like Ohana”
Reviews.Author: KlementisFamily
Reviews.Content: Dave, Jennifer, Isaac, Alexis Klementis and Patti Diebel From Gresham, Oregon Stayed with Maui's most Hawaiian Hotel from April 11-18, 2008 I can not express fully just how much our family loved our stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We truly felt like their Ohana and we canâ€™t wait to go back. For our first trip to Maui and their Hotel we didnâ€™t know what to expect but this hotel exceeded our expectations by leaps and bonds. Our vacation was wonderfully memorable mainly due to the stuff at the KBH. Our children loved the whale pool and our daughter Alexis had such a great time learning the hula and lei making. Our son Isaacâ€™s favorite part was the cookies on the pillow at night. As for the adults we were so fascinated to learn about the Hawaiian history from the Guest Services not to mention that they all can dance the hula!! Even the waitress got on the stage and danced. Their love of the island and culture was so evident that we all felt like it was our home too. Upon our checking out the Good bye ceremony was so beautiful it brought tears to our eyes. Everyone sang and danced to not just one song but I believe there were four!! They all showed us how grateful you were to have us there that even the nice lady that cleaned our room left us a beautiful thank you letter. I ask you where else can you find that kind of Hawaiian spirit!!! Mahalo to them for giving us treasured memories that will last a life time. We will be back as soon as we can. Aloha until then!!

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious but beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: piedmontcamom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel with my husband and 4 year old daughter in early March 2008. Here's the good and the bad. Good -The location is wonderful. Right on a beautiful, very long stretch of beach. It was whale season so we could look right off our balcony and see whales cavorting out at sea! Magical! -The grounds are meticulously groomed every day. There are huge lovely shade-giving palm trees all over the property. There are plenty of lawn chairs and picnic tables in which to relax. -There is a nightly free hulu show. It was fun and my daughter loved it. The hotel staff dance in the show and they are very talented. -Go to the welcome breakfast. It gives you a nice overview of what to do on the island. There is zero pressure to buy anything. It is just informative. -It was a decent value for the money. -KONA COFFEE - mmmmmmm! -Walking distance to many restaurants and shops in the Whaler's Village. Bad -The rooms are very average. Nothing special at all. They are worn and dated and ours had only a very small shower stall (no bath tub). The hallways are dingy and there are dirty marks on the walls where luggage or carts have scraped. -The staff is not all that great. Some are friendly, some are not. They all seem to know each other very well and get caught up in personal conversations and can ignore the guests. -The kids passport program was pretty dumb. It really just encouraged my daughter to go into their stores and ask me to buy her things. -The breakfast was just OK. There was a large variety but the food was not so tastey. -The pool area was nothing special. -The Mixed Plate restaurant was not very good. All things considered, I would not stay here again due to the "just averageness" of the hotel. Next time, i will stay at the Sheraton next door or the Alii a few hotels down.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this "most hawaiian" hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JobAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: The kaanapali beach hotel is a very shabby and ugly looking hotel! the hallways were the most unpleasant i`ve ever seen! the breakfast was expensive and very very bad! this hotel is not worth three stars! avoid this hotel in maui becaue there are a lot nicer hotels for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Most Welcoming Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: kwalters2k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at KBH for our first visit to Hawaii. We booked it directly through their website after looking at several Maui resorts online. I was a little hesitant, because you never really know what you are getting when you book online, especially since their package deal seemed too good to be true, but we couldn't have been happier! We received everything they promoted in the package (with no glitches) and most activities/amenities exceeded our expectations. I am easily stressed when I travel, but I was immediately put at ease by the friendly staff and relaxed atmosphere. Check-in was effortless, the staff was incredibly welcoming and helpful. Our room was bigger than we expected with a great view (categorized as only partial ocean view, but it was a clear, tropical view of the beach and ocean). The resort itself was very clean and well-maintained. The private beach was very nice and secluded. There were tons of activities for the whole family, and we loved sitting on our lanai listening to the local musicians that would perform nightly. What sets this resort aside from other Maui hotels is that it truly feels authentically Hawaiian. The staff prides itself on keeping its culture and heritage alive. There is an intimacy here that you can't find anywhere else. Other resorts in Maui felt like just any other glitzy hotel in any other state once you were inside. But at KBH, you truly become part of their Ohana. We still receive Christmas cards from the resort each year! And they offer amazing benefits and upgrades for returning guests. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: remofire
Reviews.Content: My husand and I spent a week at the Ka'anapali Bech Hotel and we couldn't have been more pleased! The first day there we went to an amazing orientation breakfast that the staff put on. The food was wonderful! They staff entertained us(they were very talented!) and the Guest Services manager(I can't remember his name) gave us an overview on thing to do on the island. That overiew was so incredibly helpful in making our vacation fun. The room was beautiful and very clean. The cleaning staff did an excellent job and were very careful to not invade our privacy. We had a room with a partial view of the ocean, but it did have a full view of the grounds and it was beautiful! They beach was just outside the hotel and we really enjoyed the beach cabanas we rented from them. The daily events were great too! The hotel offered different classes during the day and music and dancing at night. The Hawaiian bands sounded amazing! We only wished they could have played alittle longer. We attended the magic show that is performed there every night. It is an informative, entertaining, and family friendly magic show. We absolutely loved it and highly recommend seeing it! We even went to the Sunday church service that is offered there. It was very nice too. They Guest Services staff was always so helpful and knowlwdgeable! The hotels motto is "The most Hawaiian hotel" and they are! We really built a great friendship with Malihini who was so gracious and kind to us during our stay. She gave us great insite into the Hawaiian culture and traditions. We highly recommend the Ka'anpali Beach Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: johnti006
Reviews.Content: Unless you want to pay $400+ per night (Sheraton/Westin) we would highly recommend this hotel & would definitely stay here again. We stayed here at the end of January and were extremely happy. The key is that this is not a high-end hotel so do not expect top notch accomodations. However, it has THE BEST location on Kaanapali beach. Whaler's Village is about 5 mins away to the South & Black Rock (snorkeling) is less than 5 mins to the North. You can walk to both locations on the boardwalk. There is also a Trilogy Sports kiosk by the beach. They rent snorkel gear, boogie boards, and can book whale watching trips (which depart right there). The hotel has cabanas for rent for $30 per day or $21 per half-day. Every night they have an outdoor band play until 9pm. Our room was very clean and we had a view of the ocean and pool. The entire staff was extremely friendly. In addition, we were given a free daily breakfast which was nice---the food was decent enough.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Earth”
Reviews.Author: HUSKERTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: We travel at least 6 weeks out of the year and have been to MANY, MANY places. This is hands down the BEST HOTEL we have ever been to!!!! We did not want to leave! It is the only place I have ever been to that I COULDN'T WAIT to return to, and we hardly ever return to the same place twice, let alone WANT to return. We have never experienced such hospitality! This resort is so charming and welcoming! The staff is extra friendly and genuinely happy. They are hard working and go out of their way to be helpful. The groundskeepers were hard at work early every morning before a lot of the guests were up. They even washed all the lounges. The maids came twice a day. They turned down the beds at night, straightened up, and left the most delicious cookies. We tipped the maid and she left us a thank you note!! All the food was great! We chose the breakfast plan and thought it was a great value. Every morning there was a different selection of foods from all over the world and everything tasted so good. The beach grill is open until 8 PM through the winter season ( 6 PM in the summer season ) , and serves HUGE, delicious burgers and sandwiches for $10. For dinner there is a buffet with different selections nightly, and an early bird special price before 6 PM, or there is a more elegant ( open air ) sit down restaurant with fairly reasonable prices. The pool bar has a great atmosphere and friendly bartenders. There is a nightly hula show for entertainment. The dancers are nothing spectacular but the music is nice and the atmosphere is authentic and relaxing. Everything about this resort is casual. No need to dress up. Everything is laid back and relaxed. Nothing stuffy here. The staff was the most helpful I have ever encountered. We had a problem with our flight and the manager contacted the airport late at night and resolved everything for us. Where else do you get such service!! We were given formal invitations to a welcome breakfast ( which would be very helpful to those who didn't plan their activities ahead of time, but we did ), and to a departure ceremony ( where the staff presents you with a beautiful nut shell lei, hugs you, sings to you, and invites you to return again. ) Incredible! We also received a letter thanking us for our stay. Overall, the resort was mostly quiet. Great for families or those wanting to get away from it all. We had reserved an oceanfront room and were pleased to be upgraded to a suite! Our suite was very spacious and had lots of closet space and a large vanity. The bed was very comfortable and felt new. Nothing was fancy, but the rattan style furniture felt authentic. Rooms have a safe, a small refrigerator, and the TV had a large selection of channels. From our balcony we could sit and watch the whales. ( a most amazing experience ! ) At night we enjoyed the clear, star filled sky and could hear the music from the luau at the Sheraton next door. In the morning we were treated to the song of native birds. The large courtyard was filled with palm trees and beautiful flowers. The whale shaped pool, while a little small, was quite cute. There was lawn chess and ping pong, and a water sports activity hut. You can even sign up for free lessons in Hawaiian activities such as lei making. My only complaint was that the resort really could have used a hot tub or two in the courtyard. That is the only thing that would make this place any better. Maui was the most beautiful place we have ever been, and the atmosphere was so inviting, and relaxing, and casual. We will definetly have to sqeeze in another visit to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and Maui on our next trip to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Great snorkeling - for kids too”
Reviews.Author: LuvTheMauiSun
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a relaxing holiday with kids. The emphasis on Hawaiian culture was not over the top, but was available for any one with an interest. The beach was amazing - not crowded in the hotel's section and the water was just right for kids to start out snorkeling. We eventually got out to Black Rock and saw lots of smaller but colorful fish (and a sea turtle - amazing). The staff were unobtrusive, but available when we wanted to book events or get information on local sites. We ended up going on a Trilogy whale watching trip (2 hrs or so) and spent almost the whole time watching a mother/calf/escort trio breaching and tail slapping - could not have been better - I think we were quite lucky. Room was good - clean, quiet and good beds.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryinsky
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a retreat in Maui, this is a great hotel with big lawns, nice staff, beachfront property and a free nightly hula music and dance show that makes you feel like ohana (family). They call themselves "Maui's most Hawaiian hotel," probably because they are so personable and their property is less flashy than the waterfalls in the lobby hotels, and because they offer some Hawaiian crafts and history, if you ask. We've been there about 4 times in the last 10 years and have always been impressed by the atmosphere and service. It's a calm place, though there are activities you can book for variety. The music and hula show features a rotating cast of players. Our favorite dancer is Malahini, a concierge (the dancers tend to work there--Malahini learned hula as she grew up on Maui) who also leads the "aloha" ceremony you can go to the day you leave, and get a kukui nut lei with the story of the nut and a sincere wish for you to come back. You can walk down the boardwalk to shopping and restaurants. We get a feeling of the best aspects of the Hawaiian tourist industry. They want you to return there to make money, of course, we assume, but they give you an experience you are happy to pay for. Look for packages online, though we found a good enough one with the hotel the last time. It's maybe not popular with people who want a lot of flash and pink flamengos; it's more a friendly spot with just what you want from Hawaii. You can walk down the boardwalk to see the bigger hotels, which look more like Grand Central Station tropical style, but stay with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: mitchell001
Reviews.Content: The rooms were good the food was alright the beach and ocean was good, the staff were alright but it is not the best place to stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Most Hawaiian Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zenren
Reviews.Content: This is the third time my family and I have stayed at this hotel, and it just gets better and better every time. The staff is amazing and truly treats you like family. The private beach is beautiful. The grounds of the hotel are kept impeccable. There are activities to keep the kids busy, and whale watch/snorkel trips that leave right from the beach! Its walking distance for Whaler's Village with its fantastic restaraunts and shops. You really cant ask for much more in a hotel than Kaanapali has to offer. Go see for yourself, you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Too old, Termite damage”
Reviews.Author: goosehonker
Reviews.Content: Fist thing we saw was a front counter with worm holes and termite droppings lying in the holes. I would've thought they'd have at least vacuumed those out. The front desk was nice enough at first until we'd slept overnight; beyond the wall was an elevator which was opening and closing all night and keeping my wife awake. When we went to ask about changing rooms, the day staff (couple of young girls) were quick tempered and short with us. Rather than have a confrontation during our vacation, we decided to go. We seriously considered changing hotels and taking the extra charge for dumping the remainder of our reservation, but we found it was impossible to get a hotel room on short notice. The room itself was okay, although the bed was uncomfortable and the "partial ocean view" was one of those you stand on your tiptoes at the edge of the balcony to see the ocean. The rest of the view was the wall of the adjoining building. The shower was apparently made for wheelchair access and drained toward the room instead of the drain, so it was always wet. The beach is nothing to write home about, just brown sand, but there are multiple signs up along the boardwalk warning not to go into the water because it's unswimmable due to sudden drops, rocks, waves and rip currents. The restaurants are better; the buffet breakfast we had every morning at the Mixed Plate was as expected although--again--termite droppings in the windowsills next to the booths. The Tiki Terrace had pretty good fare, as expensive as eating out in similar restaurants at home. There's also a burger shack next to pool bar, very expensive, but decent enough. The pool bar is unremarkable. Courtyard entertainment is enjoyable once, then it's the same every night. It's local musicians accompanied at times by (older) hotel hula dancers, through an awful sound system. If you rent a car (and you should) then parking is 9 bucks a night in their gated lot. The best thing I can say about this hotel is that it's close to other hotels so you can enjoy their superior pools and decor. And, I should mention the Kaanapali was less expensive to stay, so we could spend more money on other activities. With time we got used to the cut-rate ambiance, but after 5 nights we were tired of the doldrums of this expensively cheap hotel and were both glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth going”
Reviews.Author: ioananv
Reviews.Content: What I didn't like was the nightly entertainment. Because all rooms face the garden where the show takes place, you are force to listen every night to the same loud music. Since we stayed for 12 nights it is very difficult to enjoy hearing the same music for such a long time. I, personally, would have preferred to hear the ocean (this is why I spent do much money and traveled so far away), but of course other people might enjoy it. We had the ocean view room but it was not worth the price, since all you see is the hotel garden with some patches of ocean between the trees. We also had the breakfast included in the price.
