Unfortunately, the third day we chose to have dinner at the Mixed Plate Restaurant (the one where the breakfast is free), and I was unlucky enough to spot a huge cockroach near the food. The hotel is really average, not worth paying the price. I have not noticed any friendliness, or people trying to be helpful. I specified twice (when booking the vacation, and later when using their online check-in form) that I wanted a room with a king bed, but we received a room with two queen beds. The consequence was that my 4-year-old fell off the bed one night. Luckily, he was ok. The vacation was great, but next time we will go to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not pretentious”
Reviews.Author: rorojovi
Reviews.Content: it's a nice place to stay if ur on a budget. the place just needs a new paint job and it will be a better looking tropical resort..since it already has the "most hawaiian" feel to it compared to the other hotels around. the WELCOME BREAKFAST is the BEST! and they have a "Welcome" and "departure" LEI CEREMONY which is also the BEST. Their swimming pool is small but that shouldn't matter as the whole island is surrounded by "swimming pools". I din't like their Aloha Mixed Plate restaurant.. their selection for breakfast buffet there wasn't vast. but overall it's a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TLNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Oahu for 6 nights and had a great time. Once we arrived to Kaanapali Beach Hotel, we were told that we were not registered at hotel. We prepaid for 5 nights in our package. After a delay of about 20 minutes, front desk clerk found our reservation under someone elses name. Front lobby has not been renovated since 1960 and looked extremely cheesy. Room decor was outdated. We got two full size uncomfortable beds instead of Queen bed. We asked about Queen bed, but were told that we would have to change rooms the next day which we did not want to do. Room had urine smell for full stay. Aloha special cost us same as a garden view room because our room price dropped a week before our vacation. With Aloha special, breakfast is not included w/ room. However, w/ garden room breakfast is included. Bathroom had a 1/2 shower and did not seem very clean. Safe was already in room, but they charge $1.50/ day. Parking is $9.00/day. This hotel even has the nerve to charge $25-$45 per plate for dinner. I could not believe that this hotel was rated as a three star hotel. Despite all the above issues, we had a nice time in Maui. Kannapali Beach is beautiful and Maui is a great island. I would recommend spending more money for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be great”
Reviews.Author: mrhomeboy
Reviews.Content: Been coming to the KBH since 1978 off and on. This is the eighth time in six years and something has happened. Not sure if it is a labor management issue or what. No one smiles, no one says Aloha, pay for valet parking no one helps you when you return with your car. Upon our arrival no one was there to help with our luggage even though three employees were standing at the bell desk. If you were coming for the Hula Show with Rudy Aquino, he is gone and so is the great hula show. More than likely we will not stay here again and will be looking elsewhere to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: maryfunner
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week vacation at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We love it there as it has so much to offer. They have packages that include free breakfast and a car. We stayed in the Maui wing on the bottom floor. We like to be able to walk right out the back door with easy access to the pool, Tiki Bar and Tiki Grill as well as the beach only a few more feet away. The Whaler Village with lots of shopping and a food court is just 5 minutes down the boardwalk. My son likes the snorkelling at Black Rock next door at the Sheraton. My daughter and I went on a Trilogy whale watch cruise. They pick you up right there at the beach. She also took surfing lessons which was a 15 minute walk down the boardwalk. The hotel offers daily activities for the kids (and adults too) like lei making, hula lessons and sand images. They have a huge checker board using coconuts for the game pieces on the grounds. They also offer a ping pong table for everyone's use. They even have washers and dryers. They have entertainment in the courtyard every evening until 9:00PM. There is the most wonderful magician who performs most nights. It is amazing the things he does. I won't spoil it for you but you will not be disappointed and you get a discount for staying in the hotel. The best part about our stay was the staff. We had been there previously and they still remembered us. The same people have been working there for years so they make you feel like family. On the day we left they had a ceremony to wish us a safe trip home and gave everyone a necklace made with kukui nuts. Everytime you visit them they replace one of the brown nuts with a white one. We now have 3 of them. Take care and have Fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSeq
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stated at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel, based on the recommendation of a family friend. We chose the least expensive room and it wasn't bad for the price. Other reviews on TripAdvisor have mentioned that the hotel was run down or showing it's age, not in our case. Our room was very standard, clean and neat. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful (and our value priced room even had a slight view of the ocean). The pool area was nice as well. The pool was perfect for familes with children of various ages. We did find that the restuarants at the hotel were over priced (as are most in Ka'anapali) by a wide margin. Paying over $45 for breakfast is not reasonable anywhere (especially when it's a buffet). We chose not to pay to have our breakfast included in our room rate and couldn't have been happier (there are several places to find breakfast deals or even the local grocery to buy a box of Cheerios). The housekeeping staff was generally efficient and did a throuough job. The only complaint (other than the price of the restuarants) is that the walls seemed a bit thin as goings ons of neighboring rooms could be heard at all hours. When we go back to Maui, if we stay in Ka'anapali, we will definitely consider staying at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kaanapoli Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii25yr
Reviews.Content: Kaanapoli Beach Hote, Maui HI Trip date 3-1-08 This is the second time we have been to this hotel. The first time was in 2004 and we plan to return again in a few years from now. Everyone is very friendly and accommodating. We have booked partial ocean view rooms and they have had a nice lanai for viewing whales and the garden area. This is an authentic Hawaiian hotel which is what draws us back. The buffet breakfast that came with the package was also wonderful, the food was different every day. The pool and garden area are beautiful and very well kept. You can lay in the sun or shade around the pool, it is a very large area. They also offer many activities that are conveniently located right on the property or they come to pick you up if not. This is our favorite place so far in Hawaii and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay -- Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AVacationer
Reviews.Content: Last week, my husband and I along with 2 other couples returned from staying at Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH) for 5 nights. We had a great stay there. Through our travel agent, we had requested staying in one of the remodeling wings (based on what I had read) and we did stay in the Maui wing. We were on ground level which was nice because our 3 rooms were next to each other and we were able to walk out to the garden/pool area. One of the couples had an odor in their room and after they complained it was immediately looked at. Through our travel agent, we had a buffet breakfast each morning which we thought was good. It was similar foods each day, but a good variety and a good way to start the day. It was nice having a refrigerator in the room. We loved the beach! Snorkeling was great by the Black Rock! We rented a van for the 6 of us and went to LaHaina a few times which was fun. We went to the entertainment at KBH a couple of nights. One night the band asked if there was anyone with talent. One of our friends went on stage to sing (she performs with a band back home). Though KBH, we booked a helicopter tour, whale watching (which was awesome), and a snorkeling tour. Before leaving home, I had booked a luau in LaHaina, the Feast of LeLe, which was the BEST! All 6 of us would highly recommend staying at the KBH.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean View ???”
Reviews.Author: brandys0524
Reviews.Content: I know that a lot of hotels idea's of a ''ocean view'' room leave a lot to be desired..... but you expect when you pay more for it to at least be able to see a little blue water. But nope........ could not even see the sand, much less the water. When i complained , they told me to call travelocity, who i booked thru.... and they were of no help at all. Long story short.... no view for me... and i learned never to book thru a travel website again. Other then that, the grounds are beautiful, the rooms average, and breakfast was not that great.... i belive it cost about $30 bucks including tip for the breakfast buffet..... don't fall for it. We were also a little put off when we had a ''do not distrub'' sign up, and the maid walzed in anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return here!!”
Reviews.Author: Ackers00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the beginning of November, 2007 for a week. My biggest complaint is that it wasn't long enough. We exchanged one of our time-share weeks with RCI. Tried to get 2 weeks but couldn't. This resort is fabulous - great location on the beach, wonderful pool with onsite scuba lessons, scuba diving right from the shore, good restaurants, clean and comfortable accommodation, spacious suites, friendly and helpful staff and onsite gift/convenience store. Only drawback was the price of the parking. A bit steep in our opinion. However it was very secure. We were invited to an introductory 'breakfast', which we suspected was a time-share presentation, but as we'd never been to Maui before we went to see what was available in the way of tours etc. We had the breakfast and stayed to hear about the tours and shows, booked a couple of things and then left before the presentation started. No-one hassled us to stay when we said we already had a time-share in Mexico. So that was fine. We'll definitely be returning to this resort. However next time we'll ask for a room overlooking the pool instead of the back alley!! But in Maui even the back alleys are quite beautiful. What a place!!

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Hotel Cultural Kidness”
Reviews.Author: aandmtravel
Reviews.Content: The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in Maui (KBH) offered, for free, daily events and activities that were the kind of unique Hawiian cultural events we hoped for; and had a free Makahini celebration and Lua which is traditionally celebrated at the end of this peace season (Febuary). The staff was sooo genuine, kind, and emotionally connected that we laughed, cried, and LOVED with them. We felt soo connected to the whole experience I am going to come back next year at the same time. I could not Imagine comming here any time of year and staying some where else. I walked next door and saw other Hotels and the things going on where so comercial and generic. Our staff was helpfull informative and patient, especially with our friend who was with us who is developmentally disabled. Access was easy and convienient. The location was gorgeous and the near by snorkling was as epic as our trip to nearby La' Pe'rouse Bay (also recommended by staff) which was a worth while drive. Nearby Lahina was lots of fun and so close it was almost too convienient, (cuz it was kinda touristy, butr we needed some of that). LOVED our trip and all on it said so and they would return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Yossarian47
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 days at the KBH. It is, indeed, the "most Hawaiian" of all the hotels on that stretch of beach.... and has the best chunk of that beach as well. It is not a big fancy resort type place, but is quiet, with beautiful grounds, very nice rooms, a good staff, good food, and reasonable (for the location) prices. We would recommend it for anyone looking for something other than the "full resort experience".

Reviews.Title: “For the third of many more trips to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zaphods2
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we (our family of four) have stayed with the wonderful people at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. While we have visited many other of the hotels in Lahaina, this is the only one we will stay with. The people are wonderful and the atmosphere is so relaxed (and relaxing). Every time we return it is like we never left, it brings us great comfort to know that there is a place like this which while a hotel, is a home at the same time. Our first time was in 1999 and the most recent was in Feb. of 2008 and the staff obviously enjoy being there as much as we enjoy joining them. We have traveled with our friends and brought them there as well and all of them are repeat guests as well. We are already making plans for our fourth visit next year and would recommend it to all (just make sure there is a room for us in February - don't want it to be booked up)...

Reviews.Title: “A Great Resort to Stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiVacationer
Reviews.Content: This is not one of the large hotels on Maui but it is the friendliest. The staff makes you feel at home in their welcome, activity planning, and question answering. Rooms are large, beautifully decorated, and clean. All rooms face the ocean or pool. The grounds of the hotel have many varieties of plants and the grounds are well kept. Activities and classes are available for guest to partake in, and an outdoor stage show is presented every evening. We especially loved the buffet breakfast each morning--big assortment of foods and very tasty. The chef cooks individual egg dishes and pancakes to order right near the dining area (just wonderful). This was our third stay at this resort and plan to stay here again on our next trip to Maui. For a mid-size resort, it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dave24684
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at night, the hotel did not have a room available we reserved over 2 months ago. We were put up in another room. The staff moved our luggage to our reserved room the next day. I did have to remind the management twice to refund the difference. The room was just average in my opinion even though we had a ocean view room. The property was showing its age. It was clean, and well maintained except for some minor peeling wall paper, and old caulking etc... Overall its a nice hotel, but it needed some updating.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: BramptonBri
Reviews.Content: we stayed here feb 10 for 7 nights. I booked a garden view room, and requested a low floor, newly renovated room, close to ocean and king size bed. upon arrival we found our room to be in an older wing, but did have a king size bed, fairly new bathroom, small mini fridge. It was steps from the beach with a partial ocean view and on the ground floor. Although we were not in a new room, it didn't matter. the room was quite nice with plenty of space. as per other reviews, the furniture could be updated, but it didn't really bother us. the room was extremely clean and comfortable. the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Turn down service each night with cookies on the bed. Very flexible housekeeping, superb grounds and an amazing beach. breakfast was included with our package. the all you can eat buffet was very good compared to European standards, but slightly below expectations by North American standards. Every day offerred the same food. Although it was quite tasty, we did suffer with the lack of variety over 7 days. We were quite surprised to have to pay for lounge chairs on the beach. $10 per chair per day. an umbrella was another $10. this added up. We found if we only wanted to spend a couple of hours on the beach, it was better to simply put our towels down on the sand and save some $$$. the staff was excellent. the fun centre booked many of our excursions: sunshine helicopter tour, old lahaina luau, america II sailing. We drove to hana and back one full day, and watched the sunrise on the crater one morning. All worthwhile. As long as you remember this hotel is a 3 star, you'll love it. the price and location simply can't be beat. I highly recommend this property to "tourist" class travellers looking for value while not compromising service or location.

Reviews.Title: “KBH, a great experience”
Reviews.Author: capitolhula
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH to those who love it) is the perfect place to experience all the beauty of Hawaii, from the beach to the huge palms surrounding the pool; from the great food on the breakfast terrace to amazing hospitality from every staff member you meet, KBH offers it all. All of the staff are friendly and very helpful, but the guest services staff deserve special mention. Whether you have questions about the island or culture, or want to learn the Hula, how to make a lei or about uses of native plants, they can provide you with anything you need to know. There is an extensive program for kids who seem to be having a blast, I have never seen so many noncomplaining children in any resort. When the staff greet returners with "Welcome Home" they really mean it and if you've been luck to have been here before, you really feel it. No place else will give you a true Hawaiian experience and includes all the amenities of a great hotel. I've stayed at this hotel four times and each time the experience was as warm, hospitable, and relaxing as the last.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Us”
Reviews.Author: TaliaLT
Reviews.Content: I had read many reviews on the Kaanapali beach hotel, and tripadvisor did not let me down. No, this is not the newest or greatest hotel in the Kaanapali area, but it was clean, quiet, and comfortable. If you are looking for luxury, go elsewhere, but if older elevators and carpet aren't a problem for you, the Kaanapali beach hotel is a great place to spend some time. The hotel is easy to navigate, parking is affordable (and fairly close to the rooms), and the grounds are beautiful as well. Everyone we encountered, from the housekeeping to the check-in desk, made us feel very welcome and were very friendly. This is definately a family oriented hotel, but I never encountered an overly crowded pool, or hoards of wild screaming children...(if that is a concern for you). Our room was slightly bigger than we had thought it would be and we ended up with a partial ocean view, even though our reservation was for a garden view. This hotel definately gives off a mellow 'classic hawaiiana' vibe, and Whalers village is only a five minute walk away with great dining and shopping. I was originally planning on staying at the Royal Lahaina, but due to a mix up with expedia, I ended up booking KBH, and I'm so glad I did. It is affordable and you can't beat the location. Any imperfections of this hotel (mostly it's age) are more than made up for by the friendly staff, great location and the 'aloha spirit' offered by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiix5
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and we liked as much as the previous stays here. The staff is friendly the property is located on a beautiful strech of beach and the fragrant plumeria trees on the grounds are so pretty. The Tiki Bar is a great place to relax with a Mai 'Tai and you are always guarenteed to meet nice people from all over the world. Because we were return guests we got upgrades to our room, breakfast at the Tiki Terrace and a car. We have stayed at the Westin twice and I like it too but the KBH has a more Hawaiian feel to it and many of the employees have worked at the hotel for years. I would definetly recommend the KBH if your looking for a small Ohana style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Ohana”
Reviews.Author: 808HI
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from another wonderful trip to Maui. The island is georgous but the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel makes our vacation. We have all stayed at the hotel at least twice and my parents have returned 5 times. We will only stay at this hotel becuase all of the staff are so friendly and interested in your life and vacation. Their dedication to Hawaiian traditions and cultures are amazing and inspired us to give back to the community this year by helping on a habitat for humanity house for a local family. Malahini, Mikala, Tom and Jimmy are a few of the staff that make our trip each year so special. I not only recommend this hotel, I would tell you this is the only place to stay on the island. Be open to the Hawaiian traditions and your vacation will be filled with lasting memories and Ohana! Much Ahola to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel Staff. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Holiday At KBH Maui!”
Reviews.Author: MSBell
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Maui and had another fantastic holiday staying at the wonderful Ka'anapali Beach Hotel! This was our third year in a row(Jan 2006, 2007, 2008) and we can't wait to go back again!! The entire staff really make you feel that you are a part of their family(ohana) and everyone goes that extra mile to ensure that your time spent with them is perfect!!! Being Maui's "Most Hawaiian Hotel" is extra special as well since all the staff are very knowledgeable about the Hawaiian Culture which they pass along to us so that we can appreciate Hawaii that much more! From the nightly hula shows and entertainment, to the pineapple carvings, lei making and the enthusiasm thorughout the hotel, we highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to go to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: PiggyHawaii
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time. The hotel was especially nice because of it's location. You can walk to dinner and shops at the Whaler's Village. Being able to just walk to the beach was wonderful too. My grandson's favorte time was going to the Luau each night and dancing with the music. People were very friendly..the ground were beautiful. Loved the plumeria trees. I would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wyo.Native63
Reviews.Content: We love KBH. We have stayed here on two seperate occasions and we are returning this summer. (July 2008) This time my brother and his family are going with us. I just can not say enough about this property. Last time we stayed in room 301 in the molaki wing. This was a ocean front room with the most incredible views.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is so incredibly helpful and nice.”
Reviews.Author: nurserygal
Reviews.Content: We spent a week +, for the second time, at Kaanapali Beach Hotel on Maui. The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay comfortable and fun. The second day of our stay we received a lovely fruit plate that was the basis of our lunch for two days. What a nice touch. We will absolutely return to this property again and again. The grounds are well kept, with large lawn areas for sunbathing or relaxing in comfortable chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: where2nextOhio
Reviews.Content: The grounds were nice and the staff was very friendly. Located not too far from Lahaina. There is a beachwalk connecting all the hotels in this area and a shopping area. We could walk to other restaurants and to the luau at the Westin or Hyatt. They have a welcome orientation breakfast on the morning after your arrival. There is a magic dinner show at the resort. We enjoyed the show! The first room we were given was not nice. I would not recommend it to anyone. Especially not for the price I paid. The bathroom door kept coming off the rollers when I tried to close it and the bed was hard as a rock. I complained and was moved the next day to another wing. This room was much better and more in line with my expectations and the price I paid. The bed was softer and the bathroom had a regular door, with a tub. From the lanai I could see the whales. Much better, too bad I wasn't put in this room from the beginning.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha Spirit”
Reviews.Author: JennS78
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here the last 3 nights of our honeymoon. The rest of the week we were at a condo so we were really looking forward to the luxury of a hotel. Our room package came with the free rental car, so we dropped our previous rental off & picked up the free one. It was a really cute Dodge Cailber - so much nicer than the crappy Cavalier we drove the rest of the week. Like a ditzy teenager, I mistakenly left my purse at a restaurant near the airport and didn't realize until we were getting our bags out of the car with the valet. The valet was super nice to help me make sure it wasn't in the car or with my bags and the concierge helped me locate the phone number to the restaurant. The drive back to get my purse sucked b/c Kaanapali is not close to the airport at all and it was "rush hour" on the one & only road to the airport. Our room was oceanfront and really nice - there was a card & champagne waiting for us (plastic flutes, but still nice.) This hotel is not swanky by any means & luxurious it isn't. But it's a great deal for budget conscious people. One bank of elevators was broken the whole time we were visiting, so getting back up to the room was a chore. We also had trouble getting a concierge to help us book a luau. It seemed like she was on lunch everytime we went down there. We eventually booked, though, and had a great time. Each night, we had turn-down service where they left an orchid & macadamia nut cookie on your pillow. I thought it was a cute touch. When you leave, you have the option of attending a farewell ceremony where you get a kakui nut lei that you are supposed to bring back every visit. They will then trade out the nuts on your lei for different nuts. They really try to make you feel like your are "ohana" - "family". The pool is nice but nit near as cool as some of the other pools down the strip. Our package included free breakfast at the Blue Plate every morning - really good buffet - and one free dinner at the on-site restaurant. It was probably the best meal we had all week. The whole Kaanapali area is nice and we loved how close (walking distance) it was to Whalers Village (shopping and restaurants). Just writing this makes me want to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “January 2008 KBH”
Reviews.Author: redondored
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the KBH. i already knew what to expect, so i was not put out by the dingy, out of date lobby or the musty rooms. there were no leis or friendly greeters, just a tired check in person, we arrived at 400 on a friday. we got to our ocean front room only to find a huge tree blocking the view in front and a wall extending out 10 feet on our right, blocking the view towards black rock. we were grateful that they had another room available which gave us a practically unobstructed view up and down the beach. we were on the 3rd floor and felt like we were on the beach -- made THE difference in the whole trip! if you dont like people noise during the day, dont get these rooms, if you love to see the ocean and whales jumping from your room at all hours of the day, it is worth it (ok,ok not if your view is blocked by a tree and a wall). DO NOT EAT at this hotel. neither the aloha plate (THE MOST NASTY OF FOODS),the tiki grill (why we ate here and got Costco frozen pattie hamburgers and not the Hula grill which is 50 yards from this hotel is beyond me)or the actual restaurant, you will be disappointed with all of these.the tiki bar was a nice friendly place and the mi tais were good. the grounds we very clean and meticulously kept. i would not like this hotel if i didnt get the room that i did. although below us was construction during the day, all 7 days we were here, the view still made our stay bearable. keep in mind that when people say it (this hotel) is a glorified motel 6, they are correct. check out was done by an elderly woman who could not use a computer to save her life. ... but again, the room made my stay here wonderful. i rated this at a 3 becuase i felt that even though my room's view was magnificent, i paid big bucks for it, so that should be a given. the rest of the hotel was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: VacationWhen?
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last part of our honeymoon. The previous two places we had stayed were fabulous, and having seen several negative reviews here, I was a little nervous about what to expect. Overall, we were pretty pleased with the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. I believe our room was one of the renovated ones (first floor in the Maui wing), and while it was not the height of luxury, it was clean and well kept and really BIG! We had all of our breakfasts at the Tiki Terrace, and the food was pretty good. We only ate dinner there one night, and it was also okay. The Kaanapali Beach Hotel has a great location - right on the beach, right next to the Sheraton at Black Rock, which cost twice as much. (The snorkeling at Black Rock is awesome!) If you are expecting luxury accommodations, you might be disappointed. But KBH is a really good value - MUCH cheaper than the hotels that surround it. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Barbb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live on Maui and were looking for a reasonable place to stay for our anniversary. They gave us a kamaaina rate - something that is becoming more scarce as the years go by, and were friendly and accomodating upon check in. Our room wasn't ready until 2pm (check-in is 3:30pm), but we were able to use the pool and facilities until it was ready. Then surprise! they provided us with an ocean view room at no extra charge. Their nightly hula show was fun and we enjoyed having burgers outside (a full menu is available) and having drinks at the Tiki bar - our entire evening came to $100. This hotel is right next door to the Sheraton Resort and black rock in Kaanapali, with a gorgeous beach. The hotel itself is looking rundown, but they are in the middle of renovating, so that won't be the case for long, and they certainly keep everything neat and clean. I would consider this a great choice for couples and families, who want to enjoy beautiful Maui, but don't want to pay resort prices. And, if you want to visit the resort, well they''re right next door.

Reviews.Title: “A truly Maui Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Suban
Reviews.Content: For those looking for a warm, tropical feel for their Christmas celebration, look no further than the Kaanapali Beach Hotel in Maui. Known as "Maui's Most Hawaiian Hotel", the KBH has earned that title by incorporating a variety of free Hawaiian cultural activities in their daily schedule and employeeing a primarily native Hawaiian staff. While not the most luxurious resort on the beautiful Kaanapali Beach, KBH offers large, Hawaiian-themed rooms, great food, and a friendly, personalized service that cannot be matched by the larger chain hotels. Special Christmas activities here include holiday entertainment, an outdoor candlelight Christmas Eve service, and a popular Christmas banquet. Extra special touches include candy canes placed on guests' pillows and Christmas carolling by the hotel staff, as well as nightly Hawaiian music and dancing. I almost hate to tell others about KBH as I want to keep this wonderful place all to myself(!), but in the spirit of the season I'll let you in on the secret--Kaanapali Beach Hotel can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: MammothSnobunny
Reviews.Content: Our family visited the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for the Thanksgiving holiday and had an unforgettable time. My 3 year old son had just learned the huki lau (sp?) at his Montessori school so every night that we were at the hotel he would go to the show and get up on stage and do the Huki lau with all the other children and perfomers. We had to make all dinner plans around that show so he would not miss it! The grounds are so beautiful at the hotel and of course the best spot on the beach near phenomenal snorkeling. We had a really wonderful time and enjoyed the friendly staff at KBH. We would definitely recommend it and go there again. We were able to use a family photo taken on the beach in front of the hotel for our Christmas card. Thank you KBH!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: akandresen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at KBH after getting married in April of 2007. It was our first trip to Hawaii and we already have dreams of going back. We can not imagine a better honeymoon location. The entire trip was like a dream come true. The staff at the hotel made us feel like we had found a home away from home. A month after returning from Hawaii, we found out that we are expecting our first child in January. We can not wait to return to Maui and the KBH for a family vacation someday. We can't imagine wanting to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, the Ugly of KBH”
Reviews.Author: Amacski
Reviews.Content: The Good the Bad and the Ugly of our stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH) We stayed here on our honeymoon (April/May 2007). It had good reviews so we spent 5 nights here. It was ok, but it was not worth the price in our view. We stayed on the ground floor in a one bed room (Lana'i Wing). Here are our thoughts: The Good -Big room (it was a bit musty and old - but ok - i'd consider it 3 stars though for appearance). -Friendly staff. The cleaners would always say smile and say hello, and the staff at the desk were very nice. -Helpful tour desk (helped book us a car and cruise - very efficient). -Very Nice Breakfasts (the actual food) - not the rooms (see below)! -The Beach - so close and so beautiful (one of the best beaches in Maui / Hawaii). The Sheraton is next door (where Black rock is) and yes you can access black rock and snorkle (recommend!). Walk through the Sheraton and look at the big gold fish! They are amazing. -Close to Whalers Village (2 minute walk - and catch $1 bus to Lahaina). Plan your trip. -Ice Machines available at every wing. Convenient -The Grounds are Maintained Beautifully (Very green, and healthy gardens). -When we left, the bag guy offered to drive us to our next hotel (Royal Lahaina). Of course you feel obliged to tip, i just gave him $5 as thats probably what the Taxi would have cost. -Housekeeping came in every day to tidy up as expected. -Bottle of wine on arrival and occassional biscuits left on our bed for being honeymooners. -Bar at the pool is good. But would be better if it was a swim up bar.(you have to get out of the water for this one). The Bad -Fuzzy TV reception. -Shower Curtains (never like these as they can touch you when you shower). -Bathroom was very old, bathtub didn't look very good, water pressure was hopeless (although think thats a hawaiian drought thing). -Musty feel. Room was dated felt 1980's. Needs some paint and freshening up. Furniture dates also. -The ground floor room we had opened up to the common area facing the pool. Wasn't very private (everyone sees you if your curtains are open on the ground floor). -Very old construction maybe 60's? - could here neighbours on either side and above us (footsteps!!). Soundproofing was not good maybe not there. -Pool was ok, but something that should be improved. The whale shape did not excite me, i thought the pool was a bit too small for the number of rooms at the site. Beach is better than the pool anyway. -Air conditioning system was not very good. Probably as old as the building. The Ugly -The Diner & Breakfast venue - very crusty and creates a cheap feel. I think they need to renovate and buy new chairs and tables (felt like a staff room at a constuction site). -Exteremely noisy plumbing from surrounding rooms. This was annoying in the middle of the night if another toilet was used or someone was having a middle of the night shower. -We left a heap of alcohol in the fridge also (forgot about it) and I think a courtesy call would have been appropriate. Apart from Breakfast (buffet) we did not eat at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. So we cannot comment on the restaurant or food (apart from Breakfast which was yummy - a decent selection). I guess it was a very nice place at the end of the day, nothing really special though and not what we expected for the price paid (I should have demanded a renovated room!). When we checked in we were excited and that quickly turned to slightly dissapointing. But then we just got used to it - we've stayed in worse places. We didn't develop an emotional connection to the place - we were glad to leave. I can't say the selling point "the most Hawaiian Hotel" really did it for us as well. In our view it wasn't that much different to any other hotel we stayed at in hawaii (2 others). Perhaps on our part we should have done more research and expected that it was going to be $$$ being Maui. But We stayed at the Royal Lahaina (in the tower) which was cheaper and for us much better value. Kaanapali Beach Hotel might suit families more. Honeymooners, maybe not. Having said that it appears that many American's come back here regulary as staff seemed to keep saying "see you next year" and knew their names. So some people must love it - maybe they get it much cheaper because they are regulars (or timeshare?). Book this one only once you do your homework, perhaps book if they guarantee you a renovated room and as others suggest, get a good deal because we found this overpriced. The Price was probably the biggest let down for us. Price sets the expectations, and when expectations are not met, naturally one will focus on the negatives. Our rating: 5 / 10

Reviews.Title: “Nice but....Not for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: lovethesun1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there this past December until the beginnig of January for six days. I was very surprised when I arrived to the KBH. As soon as you set foot in the lobby you can sense that the hotel is very outdated. For the amount of money we paid (high peak season) I was expecting something a little nicer. We had informed them that we were celebrating our honeymoon. They told us when we checked in that there was a little something waiting for us in our room. I was expecting maybe matching bath robes or rose petals on the bed (something romantic maybe). Instead it was a card, and two plastic, stained champagne flutes and a bottle of cheap champagne in the refrigerator located inside the closet literally outside the bathroom door!!! The KBH is definitely not a place to stay to celebrate this kind of occasion. We requested a newly renovated room and stayed on the 6th floor in the Lanai wing. Our view was the garden, whale pool, and part ocean view. The pool was always very crowded and very difficult to find a place to sit. KBH is a hotel to book for a family vacation. It is definitely a "kid friendly" hotel. They provide ample activities for children to take part in. However, despite its lack of modernization, the hotel is very clean, staff are very friendly and catering. Word of advice if you are making a reservation make sure to request a renovated ocean view room! The breakfast at the Mixed Plate was tasty (but nothing to brag about). The food at the Tiki Terrace ( restaurant on the premises) was excellent. Their pina coladas are pretty good. They have a musical performance daily for a few hours, but it's literally the same performance daily so that can get boring. You'll hear the same songs each night. Overall our stay was pretty good but would have liked something a little more modern so if your looking for something a little more luxurious this is not the place. From a scale between 1 through 10 I would rate this hotel a 6.

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home”
Reviews.Author: Excelemv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel over the Christmas and New Year's holidays for a total of 10 nights. This is our 6th stay at the KBH and it never fails to please. It's not a "ritzy" resort but more like a comfortable "family" feel to it, like coming home to your second home. Great "included in the price" breakfast buffet at the Tiki Terrace. Excellent Mahi Mahi sandwiches at the Tiki Grill. And good entertainment and hula dancing in the evening, every evening, also free! Be sure to watch Malihini dance in the evenings, you can feel the joy and aloha that she has for her hula. And get Kawika to sing some Hawaiian songs and hit the high notes! Affordable and right on Ka'anapali Beach, which for my money is the best beach in Hawaii. Christmas Buffet Dinner was excellent by the way. New Year's Eve celebration in the courtyard was cut off at about 10:30 by the hotel manager however, due to guest complaints about the noise (??? Huh?). Now who is dumb enough to stay at a hotel with a New Year's Eve celebration scheduled and think that they could sleep before midnight anyway??!!! That was the only complaint I have!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby on the outside, but with a heart of gold”
Reviews.Author: Spellspinner
Reviews.Content: The KBH is showing its age, but hey, aren't we all? It remains the best value on Ka'anapali Beach, and one of the few hotels left with a personality all its own ... no corporate culture, no homogenized experience ... when you're at the KBH, you know you're at the KBH. You couldn't be anywhere else. I don't know if the staff actually live on the premises, but they sure seem to. You have the feeling that they are a family and that you are their cherished guest, their old friend from the mainland. The feeling of welcome and the "aloha spirit" are everywhere. The KBH takes their reputation as "Hawai'i's most Hawai'ian hotel" very seriously, and diligently maintain the relaxed, friendly atmosphere. When you first drive up, you will be dismayed by the rundown exterior -- the ugly awning over the entrance, the peeling paint in the dark, low-ceilinged lobby -- and steel yourself for a nasty experience. Well, you won't get it. The KBH pours its $$ into keeping the rooms nice rather than dressing up the facade. So the rooms are nice. You won't see a bug and you'll always have plenty of towels. And you can't beat the location. Our package, like most, included a daily buffet breakfast. Again, the ambiance was lacking (coffee-shop style and no view to speak of) but the breakfast itself was excellent and varied. Can't say the same for the nightly free entertainment by the pool, alas. This time of year (Christmas week) you must book a minimum 5-night stay. They ought to require that the musicians come up with a minimum 5-night repertoire. You get pretty sick of listening to the same show night after night ... and you can't escape it since it takes place in the center of the grounds and the buildings all surround it. ("Oh no .... it's "Hukilau" again!!")

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: campingthree
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Ka'anaplai Beach hotel the end of November. We had a wonderful stay! The staff was very friendly and helpful from the person cleaning our room to the desk staff. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast each morning. We also loved the beach and the proximity to black rock and shopping. We were impressed with how family friendly the hotel was. Our children were engaged in programs throughout our stay. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: snowtothebeach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wre lucky eought to win an 8-day-7-night stay at KBH ~ compliments of Steve & Barry's and The Maui Division of Tourism. The folks at KBH were FANTASTIC! I cried when we had to leave! This was our belated 5th Anniversary honeymoon..my first trip to Hawaii.. my husband had been to Maui in 1998 - we both agree that Ka'annapali Beach Hotel is where we will return! The grounds are breath-taking..we never even made it to the top of the crater to see the sunrise, because sitting on the lanai each morning and watching the beach come "alive" was beautiful enough for me. Our room was in the main building, 5th floor - perfact view of the gardens, pool and beach. We ate breakfast at the Mixed Plate buffet each day - great! The Tiki bar was a favorite - HUGS to Dale! Ended up purchasing our own snorkle equipment and walking/swimming the short distance to Black Rock to swim with the fish and green sea turtles. The room itself was perfact for us - no complaints at all. Clean adn comfortable. I count the minutes until our return! Thank you, Luana! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the kids”
Reviews.Author: cvictoriac
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for the kids. They LOVED the whale shaped pool. We had a pool level room which was great -- we just ran in and out the screen door all day from the pool. The grounds were nicely kept and the staff was wonderful!! The extras (lei making, skirt making, etc) added to the stay -- and they were free!! They had a ping pong table for guest use ... no charge! Just get the paddles from housekeeping. The Aloha passport was great -- the kids got gifts at different locations throughout the hotel. A backpack at the restaurant. A frisbee at the gift shop. Take advantage of the welcome breakfast. They give away lots of stuff in there!!! The magic show was fun. The dancers were the best -- they told the story of Pele and it was very entertaining! My daughter liked the Hawaiian dancers better than the magic. My son, the magic. Kinda pricey but they will work with you when its slow ... One bad thing, you have to pay for chairs on the beach??? There is a rental place where you can get snorkle gear ($$$) and RENT chairs for the beach (they are free at the pool).

Reviews.Title: “beautiful kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: premed30
Reviews.Content: what a beautiful hotel. the grounds were immaculate, and the beach was pristine. the rooms were nice, but i think we stayed in one that was not renovated. it was quiet, which was nice, and we had a partial view of the ocean, balcony was small, but nice to step out on and smell the air. hotel was centrally located to town and to snorkeling. the staff was very nice and friendly. the breakfast was really good and plentiful every morning. there was a store on sight, with jewlery and i bought some gorgeous pearls and gold pineapples. this resort had a wonderful hawaiian atmosphere. it was fabulous, i would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at KBH”
Reviews.Author: TexasCityTexas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our long awaited trip to Maui - my mother, sister, brother-in-law, a family friend and myself and we stayed for 5 days. We had a wonderful time - huge clean rooms with a great view of the gardens (partial ocean view - we could see the water through the trees but the garden view was wonderful). Our welcome with the orientation breakfast and then the farewell ceremony were both really special. We felt welcome and then felt sad on goodbye. Special thanks to Malihini for her help in making our trip special - she gave us a really good idea of where everything was and significance so renting a car and driving was an excellent experience. Beautiful beaches, great food, and don't miss the road to Hana - some wonderful surprises along the road. Personally, I really enjoyed getting up early, before sunrise and walking along the beach. We talked to quite a few people while we were there and many were returning guests who said Maui was the best choice and I believe as well that KBH is the best experience.

Reviews.Title: “A True Hawaiian Experience”
Reviews.Author: TJOS
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Beach Hotel will not disappoint! Our family of 4 stayed for 4 nights and really wished we could have stayed longer! The Hula Show in the evenings, the lei making, ukelele and hula classes, the fabulous beach (so close to Black Rock), helpful staff, and the good-bye ceremony all made our stay so worthwhile and our time in Hawaii extra special. We were also able to get a great on-line special with a free rental car, 2 massages (the best massage I have ever had!), and vouchers for 2 adults at the delicious breakfast buffet for each morning of our stay. If you are looking for brand new, this is not the place for you. (However, there were some renovations in progress while we were there.) If you are looking for "a different kind of hotel" with old Hawaiian charm you aren't likely to find in other hotels, don't look anywhere else...stay at Kaanapali Beach Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing location”
Reviews.Author: Ruby067
Reviews.Content: We spent a very relaxing week in this hotel, where we found all the staff to be extremely friendly. We had a large garden-facing room, which was very comfortable, though perhaps a little dated - or traditional? Delighted to receive a complimentary bottle of champagne to help us celebrate our ruby wedding! Whenever we used the pool, we were the only people in it. Beautiful spacious gardens, with plenty of shady spots.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisi2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and really enjoyed our stay. The staff are very friendly and helpful with anything you ask for. I believe altho the hotel isnt a fancy 5 star joint that the welcome and atmosphere make up for it. We had an ocean view room and were very pleased with our view overlooking the gardens and ocean. If you want the perfect view of the ocean you need ocean front room though, dont get confused. We did at another hotel ! But at the KBH our room and view was lovely. The room was a little dated but everything was clean and in working order. Our room was right next to the elevator but we did not think the noise from it was even worth mentioning like some poeple have put on here..I guess it depends on how sensitive your hearing is, we coud hear the 'ting' of the bell just about in the background..but it didnt bother us. The Hawaiian entertainemnt every night was fab, we enjoyed it so much we bought a cd, songs of Maui so we can listen to it at home. We had vouchers for breakfast in the Mixed Plate buffet, now this was OK but not great and you would get fed up if you went every day I thikk. BUT what you can do is use your vouchers to upgrade to the Tika Grill where you can have much more choice, we did that a couple of days and it made all the difference. We organised all our trips out thru the hotel but we did it via email with them about 3 months before we went so I would recommend you do that because things get booked out way in advance such as the Maui hike we went on or the Old Lahaina Lau. Anela in the activity centre made all our reservations with us via email and it was all waiting for us with our itenerary when we arrive. Nice touches due to our honeymoon included champagne and a nice card in our room when we arrived, and chocolates the following day. We enjoyed our stay very mcuh and as long as you are not expecting 5 star granduer then you will enjoy it here.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pcwalton1
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to KBH and it was just fantastic. The staff was friendly and helpful (as usual), the room was great, We had a ground floor room in the Maui wing that looked out on the well kept grounds. For our drive to Hana, the activities desk arranged a picnic lunch that included items such as pasta salad, cheeses and wine in an insulated backapack. Yummy. We walked down to some of the other hotels such as the Westin and the people looked like sardines the way they were packed in. If you want a comfortable, friendly, beautiful hotel on one of Hawaii'sbest beaches, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Price”
Reviews.Author: GCrackr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBH for 5 nights in October/November 2007. We booked this hotel for its location and value price. We received what we expectedâ€”premium location with moderate accommodations. The grounds and common areas are neat and well kept, and spacious. However, the pool was small for a facility this size. Our room was in the Kauai wing on the ground floor facing the central gardens. It was clean, but older. The furnishings and decorations were dated, but properly serviced. Construction at the beach end of the building (opposite from ours) indicates this wing is undergoing renovation in stagesâ€”ours being a room not yet scheduled. We had just a peek of the beach/ocean from our patio, even though we booked a â€œgarden viewâ€� room. We were close enough to hear the ocean at night. The location is greatâ€”5-minute walk to Whalers Village (south) or Black Rock (north). There is a Trilogy Activities Center in the central area right next to the beach to use for booking activities, tours, etc. All the staff was friendly and efficient. On arrival day, we noticed a bit of water creating a small puddle under the sink. We notified the front desk the next morning, and by that afternoon, the faucet and all under sink plumbing was completely replaced (problem solved). We did not eat at the hotel, so cannot comment on the food. Some very minor negatives: They only give you one packet of coffee per day for the in-room coffee makerâ€”with a sign advising you that you can purchase more. Parking is $9 per day extra (we were aware of this ahead of our stay), use of the in-room safe is $1.50 per day extra, and loungers on the beach are extra ($16 for a Â½ day use of a 2 person unit w/ sunshade). If you are looking for an upscale full service resort with all the latest trimmings, this is NOT it. If you are looking for a clean, value-priced centrally located comfortable place with a few resort type facilities, this IS it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at KBH!”
Reviews.Author: luvs2binmexico
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Maui with a group of 39 to stay at KBH in November 2007. Everything was absolutley fantastic! The entire staff was so welcoming and friendly. I have never had an experience at ANY other hotel that could compare to the wonderful hospitality from everyone at KBH! (Hi Malihini :)) The rooms and grounds were very clean and very well kept. The food was terrific and the beach was beautiful. I highly recommend a week (or 2) at KBH. I will be there again (soon I hope). If you go stop by the Tiki Bar and say "Hi" to Dale, have him make you a Chi Chi!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Panoramio54435
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon from June 25th to August 7th. This hotel is classified as a 3 star, but should be rated more as a 4 star. Other hotels in this area are of course much more luxurious, but for the price and location you can't match this. The hotel overall is kept quite nice. Has one of the best beaches on Maui. The food is excellent. And the service from hotel staff is amazing. The staff here really care about your stay and you can tell by all the attention to detail, especially the little things they do. They have a free buffet breakfast for you (once per stay ~ the next morning) which is all right, and the good-bye/thank you for staying at our hotel is a nice touch to finish your vacation here. If we come to Maui again, it will definitely be to this hotel. For those coming back ~ remember to bring the lei they gave you!

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Hotel: Absolutely the best hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Camai
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after spending a few days at the KBH and I must say that my stay there was a most pleasant one. All the staff--from housekeeping to guest services to the front desk, as well as all the others we encountered there--greeted us with friendly smiles, "alohas", and a level of attention and hospitality that was truly incredible. The staff literally makes you feel as if you're part of the KBH family and that their focus is to ensure that your stay is as enjoyable as it is memorable. Although I've been to Maui several times this was my first time at the KBH. It will not be my last. This hotel has all the amenities we were looking for as well as a great location. More than that though, many of the staff members are ethnic Hawaiians or are Hawaiian residents who have lived in this beautiful state long enough to know about Hawaiian culture, and they appear pleased to share this cultural information with those of us who are eager to learn more about these very special people and these beautiful islands. I was very touched by the kukui nut lei ceremony on the day we had to leave for home. I know of no other hotel or resort that goes to such lengths to bring us all together as one family no matter who we are or where we're from. Malihini, a guest service agent, conducted the ceremony on the day we left. Her explanation as to its meaning and how it started, as well as the significance of the kukui nuts to the Hawaiian people was most enlightening and added an extra layer of richness to my whole experience at the KBH. In fact, I would like to send a special mahalo to Malihini for the hospitality she extended to us during our stay as well as for her beautiful interpretation of the hula she danced at the welcome breakfast we attended shortly after our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Western Hotel is a 5 star compared to this! HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: PscGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Maui for our honeymoon, excited to stay at "Maui's most Hawaiian Hotel" on Kaanapali Beach. Our travel agent had recommended it and the reviews I read on tripadvisor weren't bad. When we got there it was old, dirty, and a horrible place to stay Especially for a honeymoon! The elevator door opened before it stopped, the room was a one star at best and the outdoor atmosphere was cheesy. We thought about trying to "grin and bear it" since it is one of the cheaper places but would have rather slept in our rental car then in that hotel. So with some looking around at nearby hotels (all VERY nice), we ended up paying more to stay at the Marriott Maui Beach Club hotel which was FABULOUS! I would not recommend staying at the Kaanapali beach hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on Ka'anapali”
Reviews.Author: clearh20snorkel
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on here prior to going and thoroughly prepared my wife that this was not the Ritz Carlton but perhaps more like a dated Holiday Inn and we were both fine with that based on the price/location. We were on our anniversary trip and the hotel knew this and gave us a upgrade from the garden view we booked to a partial ocean view as well as a bottle of champagne in the room! Now the view was quite nice - but only accessible by going out on the balcony and then only on one side of the balcony, the rest of the time the view was of the Whaler next door (not a very exciting view). The bed was much firmer than my liking but not unbearable, the pillows are extremely soft but there were extras in the room so between the two of us we had six pillows in use and made it work. We were in the Kaua'i wing which as far as I can tell is not yet renovated, however we did see the entire second floor appeared to be under renovation (rooms were stripped) so perhaps it is being done now. The room was nothing fancy but appeared to be clean did not stink or any of the other complaints I read about before going. All of the hotel staff we encountered were extremely friendly especially Jenny at the front counter when we checked in - we were already kind of bummed as our flight was late, Dollar rent a car took forever to give us our car and traffic was horrendous because of the Halloween party in Lahaina - so it was nice to see a smiling happy face. As for the food onsite, we ate at the mixed plate restaurant and really wish we hadnâ€™t it was not very good in our opinion at all. However there were other people there eating and they seemed to enjoy it so maybe its personal preference. We also ate at the Tiki Terrace for the Sunday champagne brunch - that was absolutely wonderful and I would recommend that to everyone to try, itâ€™s a bit pricey but based on the sheer number of food options they provide its totally worth it, add to it that if you enjoy champagne you wonâ€™t be disappointed, they never let my glass get 1/4 empty. The only other meal we had onsite other than the welcome breakfast was going to the magic show. The meal was good and the mai tais were great! The show was worth seeing but definitely paying a premium for front row seating - but again we thought it was worth it. I wish I could report more on the snorkeling at Blackrock, but out of a 6 day trip I only got to snorkel one time, but I did see a large sea turtle and several schools of fish including tangs, triggers etc. The snorkeling area does get extremely crowded and if there are any kids who decide to jump off Blackrock then it gets worse as you have people jumping in the area you would typically snorkel. The rest of the trip the surf became too high (the hotel alerted us with voicemail on our phone about the surf warnings) and one day it rained the entire day. That was very disappointing since I love to snorkel but of course nothing the hotel can do about the weather! All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone as long as they are not expecting pampering/luxury etc as this is not what you get at KBH, you will however get a nice well taken care of hotel with extremely friendly staff and a good bargain for being on one of the nicest beaches in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: lewisgang
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel, and we absolutely love it. We were celebrating our 20th anniversary,and the manager sent us several nice gifts during our stay. The staff is always friendly and helpful, the food is wonderful and reasonably priced (for Maui), and the room was very nice. The KBH has one of the best locations in west Maui, yet their rates are nearly half that of neighbor hotels with fancy pools. We wil definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value on a great beach!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach hotel in June of 2006. Since the reviews of this hotel were mixed, we were not sure what to expect. The room that we had was excellent. It was quiet, clean and had a partial view of the ocean. The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is once of the few hotels left that view themselves "as truly Hawaiian". There were a number of crafts to do (uke lessons and lei making, etc.) and the entire atmosphere was very laid back. The property grounds are beautifully kept. I was not impressed with the desk staff. I felt they were aloof and indifferent when asking for help or general information. It seemed the friendliest people on the property were the other hotel guests that we met and the housekeeping staff. The section of beach is one of the best locations on the strip. We walked to the other hotels and were more impressed with our location. They have wonderful nightly entertainment, which again, is mostly the true Hawaiian music that you'd see and hear if you watched the old movies that Elvis filmed in the islands. I would definitely recommend this hotel. For the price, you won't find anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Pantunes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBH on our first trip to Maui, an must admit that although the rooms were okay, nothing special, a bit old, I would not have minded if I had payed $80 per night, but for the $200/night without breakfast which I indeed payed, that was a ripoff in terms of price/benefit....First the hotel did not have a king size bed, it was 2 sepparate beds....the bed was Ok, a bit worn-out, there is a little balcony with a lateral view to teh ocean, and the bathroom was really old, shower did not work properly (there was very little water running) and walls needed a new painting. the hotel is located at the KaÃ¡napali strip, which is a great location, but compared to the other resorts (Sheraton, Westin, Marriott0, the KBH is definitelly among the worst ! I only recomend this hotel if you manage a very good deal, but I read other reviews of fellow travelers who managed a rate of $150 at the Westin on priceline, so probably I'd search other hotels first. If you are on a budget trip and don't mind a hotel which has not recently been renovated, the KBH will fit your needs. Be ready to pay a "resort fee" which indeed only grants you access to their own paid parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “The Friendliest and Most Hawaiian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALB63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel , Maui, Sept. 18 - 22, 2007 and enjoyed every moment of our stay. It is a beautiful hotel, directly on Ka'anapali Beach. The best part of staying at this hotel is the friendliness and welcoming spirit of all who work there. We had stayed there over 20 years ago, and, because we were returning guests, we received a lovely gift of fruit and cheese when we arrived , plus vouchers for two bottles of water and complimentary drink coupons at the Tiki Bar. We also received notes of welcome from the manager and other members of the staff. We were made to feel like friends returning to a special place. Our ocean view room was comfortably furnished. The gardens are beautiful and there is a walkway along the beach leading to Whaler's Village and the other hotels along Ka'anapali Beach. The Tiki Terrace Restaurant served delicious meals and there were complimentary Hawaiian acitivities everyday. When our travel plans bring us back to Hawaii, we will definitely return to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and experience the warmth and hospitality of old Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, comfortable atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: lmpaddock
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just absolutely wonderful! My new husband and I stayed here during the 2nd half of our honeymoon and had a fabulous time. We only wish we could have stayed longer! We stayed in the Kauai wing and had a gorgeous oceanfront room (spring for that if you can, it's worth it!) It is not luxury, but it is VERY clean and comfortable! The staff is very welcoming and helpful, regardless of the situation. On your first morning, they hold a "welcome breakfast" and give you lots of great information for Maui activities as well as give away prizes. The hotel is right on the beach and is about a 2 minute walk to the Whalers Village which has LOTS of shopping and great restaurants (I recommend the Hula Grill, we ate there twice!) In the center of the hotel wings is a courtyard that has a tiki bar, grill, pool, several lounge chairs, and LOTS of trees! It is very comfortable, homey, and just plain fun! It really doesn't feel like a hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Hawaiian - fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeckyJones
Reviews.Content: We read some of the reviews on here with trepidation, and I can see how some of the negative things may have come about. A lot of the rooms are being redecorated (inc new windows etc) and the Tiki Bar was being renovated while we were there, which may show that some work was needed to spruce the place up.Our room was one that hadn't been renovated but was perfectly clean, quiet and everything worked. That said the staff, from the Head of Guest Services to the Chambermaids were all charming, efficient and happy. They can arrange anything you want to do, and we found their recommendations to be honest and accurate, and we never felt pressured into doing anything we didn't want to, they really wanted us to enjoy our stay. You can stay at the Sheraton, or the Westin next door, which are a bit more 'swanky', but you could be staying anywhere in the world. The staff have a program of cultural activities and a free nightly hula show that wasn't cheesy and was part of desire to tell us something of their traditions and culture. The KBH is deservedly 'The most Hawaiian hotel' it has character and an ambience that makes you feel like you are staying with friends, and we were genuinely sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “KBH was just ok.......”
Reviews.Author: ziggychik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 5 days at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for our honeymoon. While I do think its a descent deal for the price, for our honeymoon I guess I was hoping for a better hotel. I had booked this place on the recommendation of my cousin, but it turns out she was in a renovated building- I was not!! As honeymooners, I was hoping for a room upgrade, which we did not get.....so I was glad that I at least had reserved a ocean view room. Well I don't know how they can consider that ocean view!! We were on the top floor (6th) in the Kuaui building, the only way to see the ocean was if you went to the far right side of the lanai (balcony), and we weren't too comfortable doing that since the balcony railing seemed loose! If we do go back to Maui, we'd probably try to stay at the Sheraton next door. We snuck over there on our last day to check out Black Rock- we went to the top floor and it was just amazing over there!! I guess it made it worse for us b/c we had just stayed at the Westin Moana Surfrider in Oahu which was an amazingly beautiful hotel!! So the only positive things about KBH were the free breakfast at the Mixed Plate (was actually pretty good) and its on the best stretch of the beach. Some of the other resorts further down pretty much have zero beachfront (they're on the beach, but there's no room to even put a towel down on the sand, the water is right there by the boardwalk area- I'm referring to the Hyatt, and I think the Marriott was the same way). The Whaler also seemed like a good option as its all condo units, perhaps the next time we'll go to Hawaii will be with our future kids, I'm sure the kitchen in the condo's would come in handy! As for friendly service, I had very little interaction with the staff other than check in/out......there was only one night that the music by the bar seemed to be good and it was the night we went to the luau, so we only caught the end of it (all entertainment is over by 9PM). Oh and I read some reviews of honeymooners getting champagne & chocolate, we only received champagne....oh well!! Also- our room (#660) was right next to the elevator- which was super loud!!! they don't even have elevators in all their buildings, so we thought we were lucky.....uh no, because we got to hear everyone coming & going w/ that elevator running all the time. Bottom line: if you're on a budget and don't mind the old decor, then this place isn't so bad.....just be sure to write down the name of the renovated wings (which I forgot to do before we left!!)- which I believe are the Maui and Lanai wings. Happy traveling!! -HJ New York

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii4u
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews, I was a little wary about staying here for our anniversary. However, let me tell you, this hotel exceeded our expectations. Our room was clean, bright, and we got upgraded to a partial ocean view for our anniversary-- basically, if you acutally stepped onto the lanai, you could see the ocean. We got a box of chocolates and champagne in our room, as well as fresh flowers. The beach is beautiful. We are vegetarian so were not planning on eating at the hotel restaurant- the Tiki Terrance- but then I won a free dinner at the intro-breakfast raffle. The pasta dish they created was AMAZING, probably the best pasta dish I have ever had. The people were incredibly friendly, and there was nothing about the hotel we were unhappy with. We would def stay here again. The only thing KBH doesn't have compared to other Sheratons that we have stayed in (in Kona and Kauai) is the price. Stay here, just make sure you get a "modern" room.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best.”
Reviews.Author: imsoezgoin
Reviews.Content: Simply put the best service, location, food, bed, veiw you could possibly imagine. The staff is amazing. Stay in one of the ocean front rooms, the view makes it worth every penny. The updated rooms are just stunning. The location on the beach is superb because Black Rock separates this hotel from the other mega-resorts down the street. You literally can have a nice quiet stretch of beach to yourself. I have stayed at hundreds of hotels across the U.S./Mexico/Canada and I can honestly say this is the THE BEST hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good Cultural Experience but Problems”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye_Traveller
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel in June 2007. We chose this hotel primarily due to the Hawaiian cultural activities offered, but for the beach front property as well. This was our first trip to Hawaii, and expectations were high. My first experience was making the reservation on the phone. The lady who answered was very friendly. I really appreciated that. But I was not thrilled that I had to make a 2-nights deposit on the hotel room to reserve it. This was a bit unusual for me. I also found out that parking was additional, as well as the breakfast. We did book the adult breakfasts with the package. We later found that this was a mistake. Upon arriving at the Kaanapali Beach hotel, we were immediately descended upon by valet parking people. Valet parking is optional, and thus costs more, so I opted out. That did not make them happy, which also meant that we could not use the luggage carriers, which are normally available to guests at no charge at other hotels that we have stayed at. So we had to haul our luggage from our rental car in the parking deck to our hotel room. This was a bit of a hassle, but we have managed before. Our biggest surprise came when we found that our 3-story building had no elevator! We had a 2nd floor room, and it was a hassle hauling that luggage up the stair case. It would have been much worse for the 3rd floor guests. I still cannot believe that they did not have an elevator. Here, I really feel sorry for those with physical disabilities. They have a â€œfreeâ€� music show at the hotel, in the courtyard, which was touted in their ads. But when we sat down at a table to watch the show, we were descended upon by a cocktail waitress, who asked what we were ordering. We said that we did not drink [alcohol], and were just there to watch the show. She said that these tables were for bar customers, and if we were not going to order anything, that we would have to move. Now that was not communicated to us in any of the brochures, or upon check-in! We were not happy with that, but we moved to some seating in the far back of the area, and not at a table. Our 1st full day at the hotel, on Maui, a Saturday, we took an all-day tour on the â€œRoad to Hanaâ€� that we had booked prior to arriving in Hawaii. So we had to get up very early and arrived back in the evening. Since it was late, we had dinner at the hotel. The food was ok, but the service was not very good. They had a special person to pour water, but he did not come back to our table after the initial sitting. When we asked the waitress, she had to get after him to come back. The young man was definitely foreign, and did not seem to speak English well, but I think he was just being lazy since he was sitting around most of the time. The 2nd day at the hotel, a Sunday, we were up for doing the Hawaiian cultural activities that the hotel is so famous for. This was in the afternoon, after attending outdoor church services down the road at a beach park. To our suprise, we found out that we were supposed to sign up for the activities in advance, and that they only take 10 people per activity! Now we were never told about this sign-up, and we think it is ridiculous that they only take 10 people per activity for a hotel that houses hundreds of people. Mind you that there are only a handful of activities per day, and there is not always someone at the activity desk to arrange those. After some time, we finally were able to get on the waiting list for some of the activities. I was so glad that our children were able to participate in all, but one of the activities, as it was one of their vacation highlights. It was especially nice that children get a prize at every activity and location at the hotel, including a backpack, t-shirt, frisbee, ball and coloring book. The lady who did the activities was also very nice, and was probably the only really nice person who we dealt with at this hotel. She was a local person, and had been working at the hotel for many years. On the 3rd day at the hotel, we were able to attend a welcome breakfast. Overall, it was very nice, and something that we never experienced at any other hotel that we have stayed at. We could not attend on our first day due to the early departure of our day tour. Then we could not attend the 2nd day because they do not have a welcome breakfast on Sundays. After attending the welcome breakfast, which is available to all guests, we found out 2 things that would have helped us earlier. First we found out about how the activities worked, and how you had to sign up for them in advance. This was not told to us upon check-in or when making reservations. The other thing that we found out was that we actually lost out on a free breakfast for my wife and I because we had ordered the breakfast package with our hotel reservation, and it was not refundable. Anyone who did not order the breakfast package got a free breakfast that day, but not us! Besides the problems that we encountered, that I listed above, we did have a good time for the most part. We did get some good snorkeling in on the beach, just a short walk north of the hotel. There is a whale shaped swimming pool on the property, as well as a giant checker board on the lawn. The kids enjoyed those! We also met some nice guests. The other thing that was really nice was the departure ceremony. This was a compliment to the welcoming breakfast. We gathered with other guests in the lobby. The same nice lady, who did the cultural activities with us, was there to see us off with a nice macadamia nut shell lei and a kiss on the cheek, thanking us for staying at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. She said to bring back the lei on following visits, and the lei will be modified with more additions. She said that this is to show that we are not only guests, but â€œohanaâ€�, which means family. That meant a lot to us. In the end, we were glad that we stayed at the hotel, but with the problems that we incurred, including no elevator and the unfriendliness of much of the staff, we are not sure if we would stay at this hotel again. I would say that if you stay at this hotel, schedule it so that you can attend the welcome breakfast on the very first full day. This will help you understand the hotel and area much better! You may also want to use the valet service if you end up on a higher floor with no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “A different experience than others...”
Reviews.Author: jenhip
