Reviews.Content: We are just returning from our honeymoon, and the last leg of our HM was a 5 night stay on Maui, particularly Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. We spent a lot of time deciding where to stay on each of the three islands we were visiting, and decided on KBH for its value and good reviews received from various sites - including this site. So, as I read them after returning from there, I am surprised at the difference between ours and others' experiences there. First, we arrive and check in. We are a little concerned with the dated look of the lobby, as we had just finished up in Kauai in a gorgeous resort. That said, we knew we had to put our prejudices aside and keep an open mind. To compare the two places is wrong. I had read about some parts of the hotel being more updated than others, so when we were checking in, I asked about this, and the lady at check-in advised that we would be staying in one of the wings that were renovated, but that this renovation was not recent. We requested to have a safe in the room, so they had to change us out of our original room and put us into another that had a safe. Although some guests may not use the safe, why not just put a safe into all of the rooms? Not to mention there is a $1.50 a day safe usage fee. Not a lot, but come on... So the hotel is motel style and we are in the Lana'i section on the 4th floor. Our view from our front door is a view of the dumpsters and the overbearing smell of laundry detergent. Yes, laundry detergent is not a bad smell, but it was strong and it clashed with our view of the dumpsters. I read another review that this place will undergo multimillion renovations, which is great...while taking the elevator with another guest, he said that in his area, the elevator was making funny noises and he didn't want to risk getting stuck in such an old elevator. Our ocean view from our lanai was limited. We had stayed at the Outrigger Waikiki with a supersaver rate with limited ocean view and that view was better than the view we "paid" for at the KBH. And yes, it is truly a Hawaiian hotel, and maybe it doesn't have the funds to upgrade the pool at this time, but how can it be referred to as a resort when the only pool on the property is in the shape of a whale? It is great for families and those with kids, but for us as honeymooners, laying out on grass near a whale shaped pool just didn't cut it. The staff for the most part was super friendly and all smiles. This made us feel a little sad bc they were so nice and we were just not enjoying the experience. When we were in the room, we tried to call the front desk and was immediately put on hold for awhile. My husband was the one on hold and he memorized their theme song from being put on hold for so long. We finally just hung up. We called guest services to ask about towel service and lounge chair service for the beach, and she didn't know much about it. (In their defense, it might have been that particular employee just being lazy, as the following morning we went in person to ask and the person there was helpful and pleasant.) Also, a few weeks prior to leaving for the honeymoon, I had sent an email inquiring about their safes in rooms and I never even received an email back from them. The rooms were clean. No way were they updated in any way, but they were clean. However, the safe area had a mildewy smell when we opened the door. We loved the lady who was stopping by to turn down the bed - but we didn't get macadamia nut cookies like others mention in their reviews...we got Hershey Kisses... Now don't get me wrong - we are no way snobs, but we also wanted to enjoy the last days of our honeymoon. Staying here meant counting down the days until it was time to leave. We called our travel agent to arrange to finish the rest of our visit at another hotel. We gave this place a night to see how we felt...but it was just not for us. Many things that other reviewers seem to be raving about - albeit little things, but little things that "make" a stay that much better - we did not receiver. No warm welcome greeting with leis, no glass champagne flutes for champagne ( tho we did receive champagne), no native treat at bed turndown time, not one stinking upgrade from what we had selected even though we were staying there for five nights and we did choose and ocean view, no nice little surprises at all. Not saying that our love could have been bought, but we would have felt a little more welcomed. But I guess it was all for the best, as it made it that much easier for us to make the move out of there after the first night. Jen, New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Passionate about Hawaiian Culture”
Reviews.Author: calianddelaney
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find the words to express the love I have for the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. Although our room was average, the staff, the activities and the grounds were above my expectations. My daughters participated in the children's Passport program at the hotel. What a blessing. We learned how to Hula, make a twisted lei, make a braided lei, make a threaded flower lei, etc. It was all geared around family. While participating in these activities, I met Malihini (who works for the hotel). She was a sensational woman. She showed love and passion for her culture. She not only showed us the hula, but brought out pictures to explain the movement and history to all of us. She is someone who makes you feel special. She remembers your name. She is a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach”
Reviews.Author: wjl1924
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali beach hotel, Maui Hi. We just retured from week stay at KBH beautiful beach front hotel clean kept grounds with friendly staff 24hrs. Theres nice restaurant with live shows every nite theres also gift shop along with deli for everything thats needed. This was our 1st time visit along with Hawaaii had best time while staying there will be back to stay at kaanapali beach hotel sooner then later Bill & Robin Lepore, New York

Reviews.Title: “Truly Maui's Most Hawaiian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snowieflake
Reviews.Content: This was my family's second time to Maui, but our first stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We stayed in the family suite with the full ocean view in the Molokai wing and every day was wonderful and beautiful. Every night they came to turn down the beds and leave a macademia nut/coconut cookie. I loved being able to learn so much about the Hawaiian culture and I enjoyed doing traditional Hawaiian things with my mom, such as learning how to dance the hula, lau printing, and making many types of leis! It was so much fun! I would love to do it again! They also helped us plan out what we could do each day of our vacation. In the end, I was able to parasail and learn how to surf with my brother. It was great! The pool isn't as big as the ones in the hotels around it but the atmosphere makes up for it. There are native Hawaiian plants and flowers all over the place and its right next to the beach. The free nightly music show is beautiful and calming. The hotel staff were all very warm and welcoming; they even remembered the name of my family. At the very end, the kukui nut lei ceremony was very touching and I felt ecstatic about becoming part of such a loving family. I would definitely love to go back. This was one of the best trips to Hawaii I have ever taken.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Memories”
Reviews.Author: champArkansas
Reviews.Content: Because my daughter and I had such a terrific time vacationing at your KBH last month, we're already booked to return next summer. Among others, we're especially looking forward to seeing staff members Malihini Keahi-Heath and Lanila again. Marquetta and Mone' Rogers, AR

Reviews.Title: “KBH made us feel like family!”
Reviews.Author: DBH080407
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the KBH for our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. The grounds and rooms were beautiful. The staff was helpful and courteous. The director of guest services went out of his way to make sure we had a great time, giving us a free ticket to the magic show and setting up a special hawaiin dance for us. Guest services were so helpful in guiding us to the fun things to do in Maui. For the over all package and all it includes, the price was very reasonable. We will definitely be going back some year for an anniversary! We wouldn't recommend anyplace else on Maui. You haven't experienced Hawaii unless you've stayed at the KBH. Daniel and Brittany Hernandez

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Swan-Landrash
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel on Maui. You can't beat the price of the rooms. They do need some updating, but are very clean. You also can't beat the location, right on the beach! The staff is great and the grounds are beautiful. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Maui”
Reviews.Author: cforsans
Reviews.Content: from August 9 to 18 , we were greatly satisfaied of our excellent stay in Kaanapali beach hotel. We were received as special guest in the hawaian culture of "Aloha". We appreciated the kindnes and open attitude of all the employees. We feel right at home...in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “15th Wedding Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: Bullbeggar
Reviews.Content: I believe Hawaii is beautiful no matter where you stay. The flight was long but well worth it. If we ever do again we would do a stay over somewhere in California to break up the long flight. Rent a car. If you don't you will miss out on so much. We rented a convertible - enjoyed it so much we then came home and bought one!! The drive from the airport is absolutley beautiful. We drove that road a lot during our stay and never grew tired of it. Our check-in was effortless. The people kind. Our room was good and we left the door open to our balconey every night. We were rewarded with the sound of the waves to go to sleep with at night and each morning by little birds in our room. Hint: pick up some birdseed and you will have them too! We had no trouble with mosquitoes in our room. The doves were always the first birds we heard. They were numerous around thehotel and into the other areas. Very soothing. Upon our arrival we were presented with a lei and were instructed to keep for a return trip so a white nut could be added. I forgot how to spell it. Our room had a bottle of wine and a fruit and chees platter waiting for us. Mind you we got the romantic package so there were extra things included. On one day the hotel packed us a picnic basket(came with our package) for one of our day excursions. There was enough food for 3 days!! They included a bottle of wine and also there were real plates, eine glasses and utensiles. NO PLASTIC forks!! We went on the trip line excursion (ok if you have never done. We have done in Jamacia already), a submarine trip to check out the fish life, the road to Hana, a helicopter trip around Maui (highly recommend) took in a show in Lahana called Ulalena (highly recommend), a Luau, Haleakala, a winery, and whale watching (highly recommend), went to see Neil Sedaka in concert (was really nice) and lots of other things too mumerous to mention. The whale watching was the highlight of the trip. We went out 3 times and the whales came right up tot he boat! Breakfast buffet which was included was generic. However the pineapple and the fresh juices were really really good. We never grew tired of them. There are other hotels that might be a little more upscale. This was was nice and really did not have any real complaints. Would have rather had a oceanfront room, but the little birds made up having a garden overview room. We really did not spend much time in our room and wanted to see all of Maui we could so ithat was one of the reason we didn't pcik a more upscale hotel. If you ever get a chance to go...make the time! Can share photos upon request.

Reviews.Title: “We'll come back again”
Reviews.Author: goldi-locks101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel from August 15th-22nd. This was my first time to Hawaii (Maui) and I went with my fiance. Our first impression of the room was "Wow, this is really nice". I had been reading Trip Advisor for about a month before I went on my vacation to see what other guests had to say. I began to scare myself when I would read some of the more negative comments. However, when we arrived -- all doubts had escaped my mind. The front desk was genuinely polite and check in was a breeze. The room was a partial ocean view on the ground level (Room 144). It was a renovated room that was pleasing to the eye. Just outside our lanai were beautiful gardens and it was only a two minute walk to the gorgeous sands of Kaanapali beach. The location of this hotel couldn't get any better. Snorkeling was a five minute walk down the beach to the serene underwater world near Black Rock. Whaler's Village is about a 10 minute walk - if that. Lahaina town was about a 10 minute drive down the scenic road. Everything was very convenient to get to and the staff is exceptionally attentive to it's guests. We truly felt welcome. This hotel is a great value and we will be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Our ohana away from family”
Reviews.Author: jowho
Reviews.Content: I've read some of the negative reviews and i'm not sure what they are talking about. First, to allay any fears, we learned that KBH is undergoing a $47 million dollar renovation. That will make an awesome place even more awesome. This was our third stay here in four years. It was great to see familiar faces upon our arrival. When Mikala, from guest services saw us, he remembered our names and said "welcome home". I know I wouldn't get that personal service from one of the big, corporate owned hotels on the beach. We love the spacious grounds. For having 300+ rooms, the grounds never seemed crowded, even with beach chairs spread around. During our week there, we never saw a lawnmower, leaf blower or hedge trimmer, yet the grounds were always well maintained. I liked that the plants were what you would expect to see in Hawaii: hibiscus, ginger, plumeria, kukui nut, banana trees and even a small taro patch. Our kids loved the Hawaiian activities: hula lessons, lei making, lau printing and more, and this year ukelele lessons. There are a lot of classes, almost like a cruise, yet you don't feel over scheduled. We liked the Tiki Terrace. If you get free breakfast vouchers from the Mixed Plate, you can redeem them at the Tiki Terrace for $13.50 a person. My husband, our seven year old and I would have full breakfasts (or breakfast buffet) for a total of $5-- the cheapest meal around. (Five and under eat free). Plus, they have local breakfasts, like taro pancakes or spam and eggs. Also, at night you can watch the hula show from the Tiki Terrace while you eat. The hula show has different songs or a different trio of dancers each night so you don't see the same show twice. One night after the hula show, we got our Tiki Terrace dinners to go and ate on our lanai so we could listen to the live music. This year we stayed in the Lana'i wing and the rooms looked like they were recently renovated. I've read the reviews about mold and mildew but have never saw/smelled evidence of that in any of our stays. The rooms have always been clean and comfortable. We had a room facing the courtyard which had an ocean view from the lanai. They keep upgrading us each time we stay there. One day our daughter was in The Maui News. Malihini, who works in Guest Services, called her husband and he brought us three copies of the newspaper to take home. That's the kind of personal service you get at KBH. My guess is that given their location on the beach, their extremely friendly, personable staff and their expensive renovation, you won't be reading any negative reviews about this hotel. It's our ohana away from family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: obriens22
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the KBH. It was great. We stayed here for 5 nights for our honeymoon before departing to Kauai for another 5 nights. The staff were so nice and accomadating. We were so happy that we stayed here first and became immersed in the culture because when we went to Kauai and stayed at a 5 star hotel it felt like being back on the mainland. Our room was an ocean view room with a perfect view of the ocean, and was cleaned daily. We loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone looking for a true Hawaiian experience in a low key environment.

Reviews.Title: “KBH - Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: reginab100
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a week at KBH. I have to admit that we had some trepidation about the hotel, having read some of the negative reviews. But my concerns were put to rest as soon as we got there. We had a very nice oceanview room - it was comfortable, absolutely clean, and perfect for what we needed (who spends a lot of time in the room in Hawaii??). The view from the balcony was spectacular. Here's the deal. If you're looking for a luxury hotel, pampered service, a big pool with slides and waterfalls, KBH is not for you. This is not a luxury hotel. We've stayed in four star hotels and like them very much, But for this vacation we chose to go the more Authentic Hawaiian route. KBH is comfortable, welcoming, has a great beach, and is close to great snorkeling at Black Rock. The staff was friendly and accomodating.The hotel was full, but never felt crowded, as the grounds are large and pretty and there was always a place to sit and relax. The restaurants are ok, not special. What is different here is that, if you desire, you will get an authentic Hawaiian experience, lessons in Hawaiian culture, hula lessons, lei making, etc, all "on the house". You pay extra for parking, in room safe, chairs on the beach (which you don't really need as you can sit on the lawn close to the beach for free), etc, but when you consider the value of the room price, I didn't find these extras bothersome. Overall, I thought this was a great value and a really enjoyable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This place will not let you down”
Reviews.Author: MissBuffalo
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui for our honeymoon and split our time on the island between this hotel and another one in Wilea. We stayed 6 nights in the Lanai Wing ( 2nd floor partial ocean view) of the Ka'anapali beach hotel. I will admit that some of the reviews made me worry, but they were all very wrong in our opinion. We had a wonderful experience at this hotel from start to finish. They are warm, inviting, kind, and professional at all times. Every person there makes you and your loved ones feel like you are family. The location is extremely convenient, the grounds were incredibly clean, the staff was outstanding, and the food was good as well. They offer a variety of activities (lei making etc) at the hotel - all for free. If you want to kick back, stay someplace clean and welcoming, give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bgt07
Reviews.Content: I feel that this was one of my best vacations. The service from the staff was incredible and the location of the hotel was on the one of nicest beaches I have ever seen. The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel definitely lives up to its claim as 'Maui's most Hawaiian Hotel'. The hotel was so laid back that i left more relaxed than I have ever been. I would definitely go there again and it is a great place for a family vacation. By the end you feel like they're part of your family.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite place in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Wahini-Granny
Reviews.Content: Maui: The Kaanapali Beach Hotel Date: January 2007 This was actually our fourth visit to The Kaanapali Beach Hotel; that in itself speaks volumes. When we told one friend we were going back to Maui, she said "Do I even have to ask where you're staying?" She knew from a personal experience that this is just the best vacation hotel. When you arrive and are registering at the front desk, you're greeted with "Welcome Home". And that's exactly how we feel when we get back to Maui; we've arrived 'home'. You'll find this hotel to have all the amenities you could possibly need. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The three dining options provide any dining experience you or your family could require. The Tiki Hut is great for snacks and mid-day meals and serves up some great cocktails. The Mixed Plate has a very nice buffet; great for family dining as it is reasonably priced. And the Tiki Terrace Restaurant has some very good upscale meal options. The Kaanapali Beach Hotel is one of the few hotels that provide nightly entertainment; and very good entertainment at that! Although we've only travelled here with other couples, it is a family hotel and you'll have no problem keeping your kids entertained; they have a great children's program. You'll find the staff friendly and welcoming and make you feel a part of their ohana. This is one of the best value hotels we've found that gives us the vacation experience we enjoy. The Kaanapali Beach Resort is our "Maui". - This review is by a Trip Advisor Member

Reviews.Title: “KBH - Your Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: calaway2004
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Beach Hotel â€“ Your Home Away From Home Our family has just returned home (sadly) following our second year in a row, two-week stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH). We stayed from July 7 to July 22, 2007. My wife, daughter and I cannot express enough the warmth and special friendship all of the staff gave us once again during our stay at KBH this year. When we think of the number of people that pass through the â€œdoorsâ€� of the KBH, for the staff to remember us from a year ago, and after a while to call us by name, was truly special and we must admit, unfortunately, so very unique in the world today. Each of us had a tear in our eyes when we hugged and said our good-byes this year and you don't expect, and certainly would not get, that feeling leaving an impersonal name brand chain hotel. It was this special treatment and feeling of being "home" that all of the staff at KBH demonstrated, that made leaving so hard - and the desire to return so strong. During our stay we had the opportunity to walk along the boardwalk in front of the KBH and to visit the other hotels along the Kaanapali Beach waterfront. While others have larger pools and more elegant buildings, none has the charm or green space that the KBH has. We stayed in the Molokai wing â€“ the older section which was quaint â€“ and visited the newer wings (Maui and Lanai) which may appeal to those looking for more modern accommodation. The location of the hotel is convenient to all of the amenities of Kaanapali â€“ Black Rock for snorkeling, Whalers Village for shopping and restaurants, and two golf courses only minutes away! However, the real selling point of KBH, and we must admit the one feature that can only be understood by those who have stayed there, is the hospitality and warmth you get from the people there â€“ from the time you check-in at the front desk or while you dine at one of the many eating establishments on-site (all casual, relaxed and very family friendly); at the guest services desk, where new â€œfriendsâ€� are always there to help you maximize your Hawaiian experience during your stay; and finally to the housekeeping staff, who ensure that your room is made up during the day, and that your bed is turned down at night, with your Macadamian cookie treat waiting for you on your pillow. Our family is looking forward to staying at the KBH next year and for all our return trips to Maui. We treasure the opportunity to reconnect with many of the staff there who have become very special people in our lives, in particular with Malihini of guest services, who has become a treasured â€œAuntieâ€� to our ten-year old daughter. If you are planning a trip to Maui and are looking for a place to combine the convenience of location and reasonable price with a hotel experience that is something other than a cold and corporate place to stay, where your are always made to feel like a treasured guest, then our family encourages you to choose the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for your stay. To use the language of the Islands, it is more of an "Ohana" (family) feeling when you stay at the KBH! We would highly recommend the KBH to our Ohana and friends alike, or to anyone else who is looking for a â€œtouch of homeâ€� combined with the culture and adventure that a stay in Hawaii, and especially Maui and Kaanapali in particular, has to offer! The McLean Ohana Toronto Canada

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kylie86
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Maui where I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. After booking the hotel I read some not so great reviews about it so I was a little worried as to what I should expect.... I had one complaint, the shower/toliet room was rather small! The hotel buildings themselves are a bit dated as are the rooms and corridors but when you book into the oldest hotel in Maui this should really be expected! The beds were comfy and the rooms were cleaned everyday which is all I really ask for when I'm only sleeping somewhere! The Hotel prides itself as being the 'Most Hawai'ian Hotel' and it really is, the staff are the friendliest I have met and go above and beyond to make sure you have a truely Hawai'ian experience. The pool is quite small but its rarely crowded given that the hotel is located right on the beach. A must if your staying in this hotel or in the surrounding area is a meal at the Restaurant on the terrace (I forget the exact name) but its the hotels a la carte restaurant! It was the best meal I had on Maui and excellent value for money, I recommend the steak and shrimp combo, delish! The Tikki Bar is also recommended for snacks and light meals. When staying in Ka'anapali Beach, you must also visit Whalers Resort, its great for shops and restaurants, another recommendation for here is the Rusty Harpoon (Happy Hour 2 - 6!) Overall, I would give this hotel 9 out of 10 and Ka'anapali/Maui a 10, a must see island! For any tips on Maui trips feel free to get in touch!

Reviews.Title: “KBH WAS WONDERFUL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tristar20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBH from July 18th-July25th. We requested a room that had been remodeled. We were given a room in the Maui Wing with a partial ocean view. The room was very nice and plenty of room for 2 adults and a child age 14. The view was of the beautiful gardens, pool, and ocean. The staff at the KBH were just wonderful!! Don't miss the welcome breakfast--you will learn alot about all the things to do on the island and have a very nice buffet breakfast. We were very worried about choosing this hotel after reading some negative reviews. After staying at the KHB for 7 nights, we could not have been happier staying there.The staff is just wonderful and do all possible to make your stay very enjoyable. The free hula show and music every night is great. When we return to Maui, and we will, I will be booking my stay at the KBH again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and authentic hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: brownscutie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful on all counts. It's located in a great place (very close to Lahaina) and the staff is so incredibly helpful and friendly! The first morning after you arrive, attend the welcome breakfast where the staff first sings and dances some hula for you and then they take over an hour to get you acquainted with the island and show you all of the extra-curricular things you can do on the island. If you are interested in any of these trips, you may either book them yourself, or you can go to the guest service booth in the lobby and they will do it for you AT NO EXTRA CHARGE. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and were greeted with champagne in our room and a wonderful view (although it was not an ocean-front we still had a view of the ocean through some trees). This hotel provides nightly entertainment at no charge and it is very very Hawaiian in nature. The hotel also offers free classes like Hula dancing and lei making (sign up for these in advance). The boardwalk right behind the hotel follows the beach and you are within walking distance to Whaler's Village and other resorts. The water on the beach has a very strong undercurrent. My husband and I swam in it, but enjoyed the beach at the Big Island much better. In my opinion, it was too strong for children. It was pulling me out to sea and I'm a strong swimmer. But the pool is great. The kids love it because it's whale-shaped. Adults can drink alcoholic beverages at the pool but not on the beach, so we split our time between the two. There were a lot of families and small children, so if you don't like kids, don't come here. My husband and I didn't mind as we still had our privacy and it was still very romantic. This is truly THE most Hawaiian hotel. When you leave, the staff has a lei ceremony and you receive a free lei (the nut kind) and an invitation to come back anytime. I highly recommend this hotel. My husband jumped over to a nearby chain resort to use a computer (there is no business center here but you can hook up your laptop in your room) and he said that the other hotel just seemed so "sterile" compared to the this one. If you stay here, take the short drive to Lahaina because it is a very cute little town with great shopping and cool restaurants. Try the hula pie at Kimo's if you have a sweet tooth! All in all, a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Ka'anapali Beach Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Missionlady03
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui with another couple in May 2005, it was the first visit for both of us. I had researched hotels on the internet but did not know about Trip Advisor at that time. I was lucky enough to find the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and book online. This was an amazing hotel. We stayed in an oceanfront room which was wonderful. The beach is beautiful and the staff is very anxious to please. We enjoyed it so much I booked my sons Oct 05 honeymoon there also! If you are looking for true Hawaiian atmosphere be sure to book the Ka'anapali. Also, don't miss driving the road to Hana. If you have a rental car you can do it yourself and don't need to take a tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joyce31965
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 2 boys, ages 9 and 12 stayed here 7-29 to 8-3-07. I was a bit nervous having been constantly reading other reviews for the last 3 months. Everything was great and it was right on the beach and a 2 minute walk to some of the best snorkeling on the island. We did a Triology snorkel cruise to Molokini Crater and while it was great - we saw the same fish and tons of turtles 2 minutes from our hotel. Everyone at the hotel were always smiling and most accomodating. We asked for additional pillows, got em, asked for a fan (because we are all used to sleeping with the "noise" at home), got it no problem! The kids went in the pool a couple of times but preferred just playing in the waves, boogie and skim boarding. One note though - if you are picky about your pillow you really need to bring it. Their pillow were very very soft. Dont miss the magic show at the hotel. It was sooooo good!! The dancers were a highlight - almost like a luau with the magic show. The boys loved it too. You can get anything you need with a 2 minute walk to Whalers Village. (Shops, fast food, nice restaurants, souveniers, etc.) Great Location and would definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Vacation”
Reviews.Author: toasttime
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the KBH July 19-24. From the first day we were treated like royalty. The grounds were well kept and the beach front is the best on Maui. We went on a sunset sail and loved it so much that we booked the same sail the last night we were there. The sunsets were AMAZING!!! Short walk to the Whalers Village where there were fun shops galore! We ate at the Hula Grill two nights with our feet in the sand, Mai Tai in hand, and watching the sun set. Life does not get much better than that! The staff at KBH were the best and we will not hesitate to stay there for future viists. We snorkeled with the turtles at Black Rock every morning and drove to our favorite beach up north in the afternoon. I would recommend staying at the KBH if you want a relaxing vacation on somewhat of a budget. You can not beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Maui4MeOregon
Reviews.Content: I was expecting problems..... even in the best of circumstances planning a wedding in one's hometown, is a venture for the brave. And my girl, wanted a garden wedding... on 7/7/07... in Maui... a place that she, the groom and I had never been to! I couldn't believe it... there were no problems! Our early morning Polynesian processional-style wedding complete with: live singers, drummers, dancers and even a conch shell sounding out the call, for everyone to assemble.... went smoothly thanks to the staff of the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. It was a wedding that dreams are made of. Thank you again for all that the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel O'hana (family) has done for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty and Smelly”
Reviews.Author: jltdjt
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at this hotel for a wedding, which was also held on the grounds. We were put into a room that had not yet been renovated. The room smelled of urine and was beyond disgusting. We complained to the hotel staff, even a manager, and it took them 2 nights to move us into a new room - we were in no way compensated for our inconvenience. As soon as we were moved, they put new guests in it. Don't stay here if cleanliness is high on your priority list. I would definately not stay here again and would not recommend it to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel staff and grounds”
Reviews.Author: DebbieArizona
Reviews.Content: I wanted to let everyone know what a great time I had staying at this Hotel. My husband and I had ocean front room on the 5th floor. The room was very clean, it looks like a Holiday Inn, nothing fancy but nice. My view was great, woke up looking at the ocean from my bed. We had a great housekeeper by the name of Lena, who was so friendly. She left me flowers one day and nightly cookies. The grounds at the Hotel is so green and well taken care of. After walking around to other hotels I think this one has the nicest grounds. When one of the staff or workers walked by they would say Aloha to us, very friendly. I would use this Hotel again and would recommend it to everyone. Great for the price! Michael and Debbie

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Maui stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corleonis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequent travellers to the Hawaiian Islands. This was our first visit to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and we stayed for two weeks. What a great place! Firstly, and most importantly, the staff. They were always friendly and available. It seems that the guest service staff were there when needed and they gave us the insider advice we as travellers need so much. We really felt the Hawaiian pride and culture in their manner. Secondly, the location. Just a few minutes walk to Black Rock to snorkle, or to Whaler's Village to shop or eat in one of the fine restaurants, or to the golf course across the street. By car, Lahaina was just 15 minutes away. Lastly, the hotel atmosphere. Some days we just lounged around the grounds, either on the large lawn or close to the pool. It was never crowded and always peaceful. The beach was wonderful, wide, and also uncrowded. We will definitely go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the culture”
Reviews.Author: Gipsie
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Ka anapali despite feeling under the weather. I particularly was impressed with the courtesy of the staff and the culture, of which I learned only a little. I would lke to return to Maui someday, however, maybe not to this hotel. This is due to the fact that vegetarians/vegans aren't catered for as I would have expected. One evening we went for a meal and there was nothing suitable for us on the menu so we asked if we could just have vegetables without the meat or fish. This has always been granted whenever we've made this request in various places throughout the world. The request was denied with the comment that, 'we don't do this!' That is the only negative comment I have to make about a wonderful 6 days that we spent there before flying off to Los Angeles and a completely different atmosphere. Thank you to all at the Ka'anapali.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: MCHayes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Kananapali Beach Hotel July 8-14, 2007. We were celebrating our delayed honeymoon/1 year wedding anniversary. We booked online with the Romance package. I had to fax over my credit card, and received written confirmation soon after. (I tried to book through AAA, but they said it they had no availability, so glad I did it on my own!). We arrived at the airport and got our rental car (included in the pkg). It was about a 45 minute drive to hotel, but boy was it gorgeous! Mountains on one side and the ocean on the other! Check in was quick, and we received a welcome basket and all our coupons (for the pkg items). After parking the car in the parking garage (have to pay $9 a day to park here, use room key, gets charged to room). We parked on the top deck, 3rd floor, and took the elevator to our room, 549. This room was very nice! We had tile floor in bathroom, fridge in closet, a bench of marble in the tub/shower, and a big balcony overlooking the gardens/pool/ocean. We used the in-room safe ($1 a day added to room bill) to lock up our cameras, etc. The king bed was huge, and they gave us 4 pillows! There was a standard TV with cable, 4 dresser drawers and 2 night stands along with a couch/twin bed and a large luggage holder. We were very pleased with the room! Only note, they conserve water on the island so sheets are washed every-other day. The hotel keeps its ground immaculate! Upon waking around 7:30am, my husband and I would sit on the balcony and watch the employees. They meticulously arrange the lounge chairs in rows, clean the pool, hose down the sidewalks, and rake the leaves and landscaping. They work hard! We attended the welcome breakfast, and got a great buffet with entertainment. They did a power point presentation of all their recommendations to see and do on the island. They rush through, so its a good idea to do your HW ahead of time! Besides, they didn't recommend an activity we did, but very much enjoyed! Speaking about breakfast, we ate at the Mixed Plate daily (included in our pkg). It has fruit, cereal, eggs, oatmeal, cornbread, lunch meat, and it rotates serving waffles, pancakes, crÃªpes, or French toast. There is plenty to drink including coffee, tea, hot chocolate, cappuccino, juices and soda. The hotel offers free Hawaiian activities like lei making, hula lessons, pineapple cutting, etc. SIGN UP EARLY for these activities with Guest Services! I tried all week to get in to lei making, and was put on a wait list. I got in, and it was very fun! The hotel has a nice pool with the Tiki Grill nearby. This grill is popular lunch spot! You can order burgers, hot dogs (1 foot!), salads, chicken nuggets, fries onion rings, etc. It is a little pricey, but can be put on your room so you don't have to bring cash down poolside. Next to the Grille is the Tiki Bar. I ordered a Pina Colada and since it was "close enough" to the daily special (Mango Colada) I got the discount price of $6.00. The other hotel restaurant is the Tiki Terrace. We got a free nights dinner (in our pkg). It was amazing! The salad was small, and reminded me of rabbit food. But I guess thatâ€™s considered fancy! I got BBQ ribs and my husband got steak. We also got masked potatoes with veggies. For dessert he got NY Cheesecake and I got Tiramisu. Our bill was about $70. All we ended up paying was our tip! Included in our package was a picnic lunch. This picnic came in a backpack loaded with real plates, silverware, cloth napkins and tablecloth, wine glasses and a bottle of wine! The lunch was cheese & crackers, sandwich meat, pasta salad, and fruit salad with chips and soda. There was so much food we ate it for 2 days! The beach in front of the hotel is the widest on the strip. We walked down to Whalers Village and past to the Hyatt, and the beach becomes non-existent. I can't imagine staying at a hotel on the ocean and not being able to lay on the beach! I loved ours, and the sand was so soft, but does get hot so wear for flip flops! The water does "drop off" so you will only be like 7 feet from the sand but up to your neck in water! The waves crash in and can be very strong under tow. For these two reasons, not many children swim in the ocean. Another down fall to the beach is the sand. Everyday between 1-4 the trade winds blow and the sand blows with it. You have to shut your mouth and eyes, and hold on to things like floats and empty Styrofoam coolers! Lastly, I want to mention the spa. We got a great massage (included in pkg). Also, the hotel has a convenience store which has everything from medications to postcards. There is also a jewelry store with great items like pearl earings! What else can I say about this hotel? The Romance Package we choose was perfect for us and exceeded our expectations! It was the closest thing to a Hawaii all-inclusive. Everything I was nervous about (the hotel being booked, the rental car, etc) was fine! The hotel was clean, friendly, and the best value. We liked the little things like turn down service with cookies, champagne and a welcome note, and an invitation to the goodbye ceremony on the pillow. Those little surprises make you smile. I would definitely recommend this hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! But..............”
Reviews.Author: Gregc11514
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Maui June 29th 3007 and went to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH). I had some reservations after reading the reviews before we went. In all honesty this is a very nice place to stay IF you make sure you take one of the newer remodeled rooms. Our first room was the "older" style it was kind of depressing. Not dirty, but old. What really got me was the first morning. I awoke and used the bathroom. There were little ant like insects ALL OVER the bathroom.... Sorry but I dont like bugs anywhere.... After going to the front desk we were immediately put into a new room on the 6th floor, on the water... it was heaven! We then started to see how friendly this place is. Every thing works well, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The pool is small but clean and fun... the bar is right there as is a little food place.. the evenings are great with the music playing, the palm trees swaying, the sun setting, the sound of the surf.... More than other hotels this one excels at giving you the hawaain feel. While we went out most nights (there's alot to do all over" we did spend a few relaxing evenings at our hotel and enjoyed it alot. Make sure you take in the magic show and dinner at the KBH. It was great for adult and kids. Lei making, outdoors dinner, this is a wonderful place and its probably the best deal on kaanapali beach. If you want to do some sightseeing, go to Lahaina and book your "things to do " over there. You'll be amazed at the great dicounts you can get on the activities you want to do while on Maui. You might have to take in a Timeshare presentation or 2 but get this... beside the discounts (saved over $350) we also got $200 is gift certificates from the marriott and the sheraton.... they were useful in many places on Kanaapali beach and Lahaina... they were as good as cash! The beach in front of the KBH is one of the better in the area... some of the more expensive hotels had alot of rocks on their beaches, ours had none.... There were seven of us in our party ... all of us were very satisfied with the KBH... and would go back again... were were actually sad to leave it.... Just make sure you take a REMODELED room.... you will have a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but could use some remodeling”
Reviews.Author: kbroeck
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the service. Our bed was turned down each night with island cookies placed on our pillows. The leaving ceremony was a great touch. I priced the lei given and it was around $10 if I had bought it at Hilo Hatties. The Tiki Bar was great as well as the breakfast. The only negative comment that I left on the comment card was that it was in need of some redecorating. I would make sure my friends are aware of this before they booked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: jmthornton
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a nine day stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. This was our first trip to the Hawaiian islands and we chose the KBH because of its reputation as being the most Hawaiian resort and its great value. When we first arrived, the hotel seemed small and unimpressive compared to the newer condos that surround it. I soon realized the KBH had something the other places don't: very large, beautifully landscaped grounds and a large easily accessible beach. In addition to the beautiful property, the staff was always friendly and helpful. Our room was very comfortable and the view of the ocean from our balcony was gorgeous. We'd go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsBigglesworth
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (June/July 2007) for the second time and loved it just as much as the first. They claim to be "Maui's Most Hawaiian Hotel" and they live up to that reputation! We stayed in the "Kauai" wing on the 5th floor (last time was the "Lanai" wing on the 4th floor) and both have a great view of the grounds and partial ocean with sunsets in the evening. We could hear the wonderful Hawaiian music from our balcony every evening - although most of the time we went down and watched them perform on the outdoors stage, which you can also view from the Tiki Terrace Restaurant. The rooms are being redone and they are beautiful (our building is the last one, so it hadn't been done yet, but still nice). The rooms are a nice size. We had a king-sized bed which was comfortable, a single day bed, a large glass table with 2 chairs, dresser, 2 night stands, and nice sized closet which gave us plenty of room. There are 2 chairs and a table on the balcony too. The room also has a refrigerator (which is great for sodas, water, snacks), a safe, cable TV, iron & ironing board, coffee maker with free coffee and tea, and free soaps, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion. Plus, every night they turn down your bed and give you 4 coconut macadamia nut cookies! The grounds are large and full of grass, plants, palm and plumaria trees. Their pool is shaped like a whale (very Maui) - not big and fancy like some of the resorts, but it keeps you cool and it's cute! There's also a giant checkerboard that you play with coconuts as the pieces! Lots of lounges are all over the grass area so you can lay in the sun or shade and just relax. They have a couple of large "huts" that have beautiful wood tables and chairs that are great for a picnic lunch or dinner. The Tiki Grill, which serves yummy burgers and hot snacks, and the Tiki Bar, which is their only bar, are both located outdoors and are convenient to everyone. The Tiki Terrace restaurant is located outdoors on a covered lanai and has a delicious breakfast buffet with fruit, pastries, juice, toast, quiche, omelets, macadamia nut pancakes, bacon, sausage, hash, potatos, and a few other items. The dinners were excellent and a great value with a lot of the dinners in the $25 range. The lobby has several bamboo couches and chairs with glass coffee tables boasting beautiful tropical flower arrangements. If you have a laptop computer, there is free internet access in there (and around the grounds nearby) if you have a WiFi connection. The hotel also has a lot of activities. They have a keiki club (for kids) and other activities for the whole family. We did the hula and lei making lessons last time. This time, we learned how to play the ukulele and did the lei making again! They also have local artisans show their crafts in the lobby from 8am-12pm on Sun, Mon, Wed, and Fri. We found a lot of fun gifts to bring back for family and friends. Most importantly, the staff make you feel as if you are family. They are the most friendly and helpful people! They really go the extra mile. The hotel may not have a spa or be a resort, but that's what makes this hotel so charming and wonderful. It's half the price of the hotels surrounding it for the same views and beach - and the service and staff make it a perfect place to spend a vacation. We would never consider going anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: jam8681
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel to celebrate our honeymoon. I was apprehensive prior to booking due to some of the negative reviews I had read. We were looking to book a less expensive room that was right off of the beach so we ended up going with it. However, we had a great experience and would stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel again in a heartbeat. We made sure to request one of the newly renovated rooms when making our reservation. The staff was very accommodating and we got the exactly what we requested. We checked in early and they even gave us a call on our cell phone when our room was ready, so that we did not have to sit around waiting for it. We stayed in a partial ocean view room in the Lanai wing. Our room was clean, well maintained, and surprisingly big. We enjoyed sitting out on the balcony and listening to the nightly music. We even received a complimentary bottle of champagne since we were celebrating our honeymoon. The breakfast at the Mixed Plate grill was pretty good, nothing gourmet. They always had fruit, cereal, potatoes, rice, eggs, toast, pancakes or waffles, and some sort of meat. Some of the other resorts nearby were definitely more luxurious and had nicer pool areas. However, we thought that our hotel was not as crowded or noisy as some of the others nearby (and it was much cheaper!). I think the best part of the KBH is the huge stretch of beach in front of the hotel and its proximity to great snorkeling at black rock and the Whaler's Village shopping area. Down towards the south part of Ka'anapali Beach the beach starts to narrow and it seems to be widest in front of the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. We would recommend the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel to anyone who wants a basic and clean hotel room for a cheaper rate (well at least cheap for Maui!) with a great beach side location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Birthday Adventure”
Reviews.Author: DM13
Reviews.Content: My husband decided to take me to Maui for my 28th birthday. It was a long flight there, but totally worth the adventure. We stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. It had great food and entertainment. The staff was very useful in helping us decide how to plan out our days in the sunshine. The views from our balcony were amazing. We watched the sun set into the ocean nearly every night. We even saw a sea turtle while snorkeling off the shore at the beach. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. The service is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Were nervous at first....but LOVED our stay AT KBH”
Reviews.Author: CincyBengals
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon and stayed on the Big Island, Maui and Honolulu. We stayed the majority of the time (7 days) in Maui at the KBH and thouroughly enjoyed our honeymoon stay. I was apprehensive at first after having read some negative reviews, but understood it was on a nice area of the beach and because of the great price, decided to go for it. Boy was I relieved. Upon checking in, I couldn't have been more pleased. We were in the Kaui wing and had NO complaints. The room was spacious, clean and we had a partial ocean view while also overlooking the lawn and part of the pool area. The beach was great and we NEVER had to worry about getting a chair by the pool or spreading out. We walked the lovely boardwalk to the Sheraton, Westin etc. and they were SOOO crowded. I actually talked to a few people at the KBH pool who felt the exact same way. I'd personally never pay more money to stay at a more crowded hotel. Their poolside was literally chair to chair. The pools were much bigger at other hotels, but KBH was a decent size and perfect for getting in to cool off and float. Breakfast was included in our package and we went there every morning except when we did the volcano bike ride. Fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, toast, etc etc were on the daily buffett - what more would you need? I'm used to cereal and something healthy/simple at home so this was nice. I travel quite a bit and usually stay in "brand name" hotels and my now husband and I were VERY happy with our stay at KBH. I'd disregard the negative reviews. I'll post some recent pics of our stay when I get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: contessamell
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel from start to finish. They offer a lot of different activities and the staff is very friendly, helpful, and professional. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: danielrice20
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the KBH. Of course it isn't a 5-star property, yet it represents one of the best values on Maui. Great beach, great location, clean rooms, tasty restaurants, and a very friendly and professional staff. I will stay at the KBH next time on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach with amazing views & sunsets !!”
Reviews.Author: imas98
Reviews.Content: The people at the front desk are really nice. The hotel is all decked out reflecting the old charm of Hawaii. Luckily we had a room facing the main area of the hotel (courtyard/pool area) with an open air hallway (RM 453) because in going to the elevators you could see the other part of the hotel which looks older and darker. The hallway is enclosed and smelled a bit musty so I was happy we weren't staying in that section. The hotel could use some updating but we still had a great time. It has the BEST BEACH in Kaanapali although you need to rent the cabanas & umbrellas. We rented a cabana twice and it is so worth it if you want to hang out on the beach all day comfortably. ($30 allday) I loved the food at the Tiki Grill by the bar !! The bar is fun if Dale is there, the other bartender is slow and not very friendly. The drinks are good but expensive unless you drink the special of the day choice. We only ate at the restaurant for breakfast using the hotel food voucher. I thought it was expensive since we still wound up spending another 20 bucks each morning beyond our voucher ?!? Luckily the food was good. The Whaler's Village is right next door and has a bunch of restaurants and shops to go to so it was a very convenient location for us. We didn't participate in any of the hotel activities except the leaving ceremony where they give you a lei and sing a Hawaiian song which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Island_Girl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the KBH near Black Rock for a week...kids loved it. It isn't glamorous, glitzy or hip...not techno savy either, but hey, on vacation I am NOT answering a cell, going online or doing business. Rooms are ok...not the ritz, but good for a beach trip. Location is fantastic. Tiki Terrace is good, Tiki grill is standard. bar is good. Mixed Plate breakfast place should be skipped. Staff is the most friendly Hawaiian staff that I have ever encountered. Makes up for all the other items of the hotel. May even get me to return to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: O_WI_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel from 6/9/07 thru 6/15/07 and had a very enjoyable time. If you are looking for a place to stay in Kaanapali that's lower cost, w/ a great location on the beach, and has a slow paced, relaxing vibe, this is a property to consider. Almost everyone that's reviewed this place has indicated its location on the beach is one of its strongest attributes. and I agree w/ this. The beach behind the hotel is wide and the walk down to Black Rock and some wonderful snorkerling is very short. We actually found the snorkeling at Black Rock to be a little better than Molokini (we saw sea turtles on a couple different days at Black Rock). Regarding the rooms, we stayed in the Maui wing of the hotel and found the room to be very clean, comfortable, and spacious. Having spent the last night of our vacation at the Westin, I can tell you that our room at the KBH was just as nice, if not larger, than our room at the Westin (and much, much cheaper). Rooms w/in the Maui wing have been renovated and I think they are classified as 'partial oceanview' (although you have to peer through many a tree to see the ocean). We were originally slotted for a garden view room but were upgraded as it was our anniversary. Not sure what condition the rooms w/in the Kaui and Molokai wings are, but it seems like some of the more negative comments regarding this place have come from folks staying in these areas. If this concerns you, it may be best to reserve a room w/in the Maui or Lanai wings as it will insure you a renovated room w/ at least a really nice view of the courtyard - and, this will still be considerably less expensive than a stay at the higher end hotels (although, one should really think about how much time you're going to spend in your room as we were only there to sleep, shower, and change clothes - our room at the Westin was oceanfront w/ a really great view of the ocean and we spent no more time in that room or out on the patio than at the KBH). The pool area of the hotel is satisfactory. It's a no frills pool in the shape of a whale. You can't compare this pool w/ the spectacular one at the Westin which has waterfalls and waterslides; however, the kids in our party had fun swimming in it and it was never crowded during our stay - no need to endlessly search for chairs or strain to keep track of your kids because of the sheer size of the pool complex or the mobs of people (see an afternoon at the Westin pool area for this). Lastly, I'd just like to say that the feel and tone of this place was just what we were looking for....Very relaxing...Very slow paced....I think some people think their slogan of being the 'most Hawaiian hotel' is cheesy and such; however, having also stayed at the Westin during our vacation, I can say our experience at the KBH was more in line w/ how we expected to feel while in Maui. Additionally, their nightly Hula and music show was very entertaining and contributed to this feeling. A nice touch and perfect way to end a fun filled day in paradise..... With that said, I think any return trip to paradise for us will include a stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks”
Reviews.Author: NYCityTraveler
Reviews.Content: Locked in the 60s. Maybe the 50s. It's a glorified motel. The rooms are Holiday Inn-ish at best. I had a "garden" view room. Make that a room facing the property line and the backside of the adjacent hotel. And dark... I needed every light on in the middle of the day. And because it was so close to I had relatives in a beachfront room... and that meant, a patio that opened onto the walkway parallel to the beach. It was loud, day and night and you felt as if you were sitting in the middle of a public square. Which, I guess, you were. The walls are paper thin, and I heard more than any decent person would want to, as well as the rumble of the elevator. I asked to be moved, but was told there were no alternative rooms. I was there for a family wedding, and really only used the room to change clothes and sleep. Otherwise I would have checked out. They had a bunch of tacky "real" Hawaiian experiences, such as a Spam cooking class and a jumbo sized chess board with three foot high playing pieces. If you want a safe, convenient place to shower and change your clothes, go for it. Otherwise, stay home, or spend the money for a decent hotel where they have put money into making a more comfortable property instead of cans of Spam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TeacherDee
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui for our last spring break vacation and stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for about 9 nights. We have always stayed there on our trips to Maui and find it to be the most amazing and interesting hotel to stay at. We have learned many things about Hawaiian culture through the guided walks, the singing, and other programs available to hotel guests. The children's aloha passport program was loved by my daughter from the time she first went at age 7. The crafts for the children were so much fun and the little gifts they received on their passports simply added to the joy. As adults we loved dining at the Tiki Terrace restaurant for an elegant meal and the Sunday buffet. The Tiki Bar and the Tiki Grill are more informal and are great for drinks and grilled foods. The nightly outdoor entertainment is free and is truly wonderful. The staff at the Kaanapali beach hotel go out of their way to make your stay the best. When they say it is the most Hawaiian Hotel they are not kidding. The turn down bed service is available and an orchid and a macadamia nut cookie are placed on your pillow. This is just one of the added services of this hotel. One of their guest relations personnel, Malihini, is without a doubt the most accomodating and lovely person you could ever hope to meet. She and the others can help you with any need you have and will do so with a smile. We always feel like we are coming home when we return to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a truly Hawaiian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Part of the Ohana”
Reviews.Author: lulessie04
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from our amazing honeymoon in Maui. KBH is a wonderful place to stay. It is in a prime location where there is a lot to do. The beach is so beautiful. We had a room facing the water and just watched the sunset from our balcony~ can it get any better?! The main goal of the staff is to make you a part of their Ohana (family) and they really excel at it. When it was time to say goodbye, it was such a bittersweet ending. We definitely hope to come back and visit our new family at KBH.

Reviews.Title: “Authentically Hawai'ian”
Reviews.Author: harmony-monkey
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from out third stay at the KBH. We had enjoyed our first visit so much that we decided to be married there! The wonderful spirit of aloha permeates every aspect of this hotel - it is truly a special place. While not a luxury resort, it's the people - management and staff - and the sense of an experience of the authentic Hawai'i which has brought us back. The excellent location, perfect beach, great snorkeling and the feeling that you're family - ohana - all combine to make this hotel unique in our experience.

Reviews.Title: “KBH - The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Mormad
Reviews.Content: Absolutely LOVED our stay here! Unfortunately it was only 3 days - wish we had spent more time here and less at the condo. Husband, myself, granddaughters 11 and 9. Our room was partial ocean view category in the Maui wing. We had a ground floor which was Perfect. The ground floor rooms are larger, utilizing the space that would be a balcony, in a step-down configuration for a daybed and table with 2 chairs. Then you still have your large patio opening to the beautiful grounds. ( We enjoyed the nightly entertainment from the lawn in front our room drinking our own wine! ) Easy access to pool, lobby, restaurants, gift shop, etc. Our package included breakfast which was convenient and adequate, nothing special, but the girls loved the buffet option and tried foods they would not have, otherwise. The programs for the kids were great . Loved Mikala and the gift given with completion of activity were very nice. We all loved the pool and the easy access to the beach. We walked around some of the "high-end" places and 100% agreed our place was calmer, prettier, greener and the best. Tiki Bar serves up good food and was most convenient. I did ask for a foam pad a different pillow which was promptly brought to the room. All in all this was a great choice for our family and we would return again in a heartbeat! (The Magic Show was entertaining and kids loved it...to me it was a bit cheesey)

Reviews.Title: “True Aloha Spirit”
Reviews.Author: LesRose
Reviews.Content: We just got home, still feeling the spirit of Aloha. Having found a few mixed reviews I had some trepidation - but all in all it was wonderful. We had reserved room on the Aloha rate/Garden view, (this was our anniversary) not knowing what to expect - they gave us a partial ocean view in the Kauai wing, ground floor as requested. However, this wing is in tired shape and I could not tolerate the smell or the lumpy bed - so we immediately went to change rooms and they graciously allowed us to visit several rooms and choose our own. We upgraded to Ocean View in the Lanai Wing and it was perfection!! Lovely room and fantastic view, though the bed was a typical hotel bed - we had no trouble sleeping on it. 90% of the staff was as gracious as I could have hoped for, and some were outstanding, but there were a few with a bit of a hearing or attitude problem. There was never any difficulty or irritation. We were told on our last day that the highway was closed, there had been a bad accident, we were not going to make our flight, after we checked out and the shuttle could not get through - - we juggled flight and shuttle and the hotel managed to give us back our old room. (we were not going to complain about anything and took the extra day as a gift/blessing) The nightly show was nice, we viewed from Tiki Terrace on our first night - had fresh snapper and it was delicious - every other night we listened to the music from our balcony. Our last night we again ate at Tiki Terrace and had the traditional Hawaiian dinner - the salad was the best part but hubby got a big old stem in his. The daily breakfast at Aloha Mixed Plate was ample and it's a cute place. The Tiki Grill - well, we ate there and I suggest you all avoid it. The Tiki Bar had wicked Mai Tai's, but there again I think better can be had elsewhere. This was not our first visit to Maui and we went to chill - no car and it can be done! There are now buses on Maui, traffic can be crazy and we didn't want to add to that or hassle with a car. So YES you can do Maui without a car. There is much in the area that can be walked to. Would we stay here again? Absolutely! We have stayed at B&B and a condo rental on previous visits, both in south Maui (Kihei and Wailea) . The activities provided by the hotel are fun. Budget stretching advise - the food court at Whalers VIllage has several choices that are fine. Our favorite place was Leilani's, with the best food, atmosphere and service of our trip - we liked it so well we ate there on our last full day and took the extra day we got to eat there again and get a carry out salad for our final dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: chrisang
Reviews.Content: Chris and Angela (Alexandria, MN) We stayed at KBH April 11th through the 18th. This was our first time in Maui or any of the islands. From the first time pulling up to the hotel all the way through our stay, all we felt was family friendliness. Not only was the staff at Kaanapali Beach Hotel friendly, but they were also really helpful. The Welcome breakfast and orientation of activities on the island we appreciated a lot. If it wasn't for this, we wouldn't have enjoyed half of what Maui has to offer. The staff worked with us and helped us book the activities that interested us. Finally, we wanted to say how impressed we were with KBH on teaching the Hawaiian culture. Their classes they offered were very informative and fun. We participated in the lei making and the hula dance lessons in which we thoroughly enjoyed. So not only did we bring back souvenirs and tons of pictures, we also brought back appreciation for the Hawaiian culture. We want to give a big Mahalo to everybody on the staff at Kaanapali Beach Hotel for helping us enjoy our vacation. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Hotel: Not for Asthmatics!”
Reviews.Author: alleycatD
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I was so excited to stay at this hotel after reading all of the wonderful reviews on trip advisor. I was really dissapointed that the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel was not a better hotel. Good Points: 1) The front desk staff was friendly. 2) People seemed to be enjoying themselves out in the courtyard playing with the giant checker board Bad Points: 1) Mildew / Unhealthy Room Odor: The first room we were given had a heavy mildew smell. The mold/mildew smell was so overwhelming that it triggered my mother's asthma. I was supprised that the hotel would actually try to put a guest in that room. That room should have been closed off and bleached down. It was uninhabitable. To the hotel's credit they gave us a room in another building. Unfortunately this room also had a mildew smell. The smell was no where near as bad as the original room, but there was definately a strong odor of mildew. My mother tried to tolerate the smell, but the previous room had already triggered her asthma and she needed fresh air. She could not tolerate the mildew/mold odor and we had to leave the hotel. 2) Poor functioning Room keys: This was just an annoyance. We had a difficult time getting the room keycard to work. In fact, another guest came by to try to help us open our room. She said that her room keycard also had the annoying habit of not working from time to time. 3) No Internet Acess: This as also an annoyance. I guess I never realized just how much I like having an available internet connection. It comes in especially handy when you need to search for a new hotel. 4) Profit Grabbing: The front desk staff smiled and told us in a very friendly way that we would have to pay for one night's stay at the hotel despite their rooms having a strong Mildew odor. I explained to the front desk staff that my mother has asthma and that the Mildew smell in both of the rooms was triggering her asthma. However, they refused to give us a full refund. They charged me for one nights stay. Does it seem fair to charge a customer for a night's hotel stay when the air in the room is so full of mildew that it is triggering an asthma attack? I don't need marble bathrooms or fancy surroundings but I do need a clean room with breathable air. This hotel was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe it”
Reviews.Author: ATM99
Reviews.Content: WHAT A DUMP! Brief background. Married, mid fifties, active (surf on Wakiki, climb Diamondhead,etc), like to travel and soak up local food, customs and way of life. Never complained about a hotel room or sent food back in restaurant. Usually stay at Hampton Inn type motels. Don't stay at fancy hotels . Don't eat at expensive restaurants. Checked into Ka'anapali Beach Hotel after reading all the great reviews on TripAdvisor. Drive up to hotel which is quite close to road. Outside looks a little drab. Go into lobby and start feeling out of place. Everything is old and drab, carpet dirty, low ceilings and very humid. Get keys to room. Bellhop walks us and luggage over to building where rooms are and jokes that there are no elevators in the building. No joke. NO ELEVATORS ! Walk up to 3rd floor. Hallways and stairs are open aired, no A/C. Smell of mildew. Carpets are FILTHY. Walk into room and almost fall over from mildew smell. The room REEKS OF MILDEW! The mattress is filthy and has mildew stains on it.Walk aroung grounds and look at restaurants. They are all the same. Old, mildewy, hot, dirty and drab. The "Hawaiian Entertainment" is a young guy on guitar, a 60 yr old on guitar/singer and a 70 yr old white haired woman playng the uke. And they chitchat back and forth with each other. There are about 40 people in the crowd, scattered around about 20 tables. It was like a Saturday Night Live skit. We checked out in the morning. I went back and read all the glowing reviews of this place. They must have this mixed up with another hotel because THIS PLACE IS A DUMP! I have never stayed in such a run down, unhappy place. The free brerakfast was in a large windowless room which was as run down as the rest of the place. I hope this review saves you some heartache. This is a rundown dirty hotel from the early 1970's. DON'T STAY HERE! ANYWHERE ELSE WILL BE BETTER!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, nice beach.”
Reviews.Author: hhkexplorer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stop in Maui on our way back from New Zealand and decided to stay at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel because it offered a location on Ka'anapali beach for a lot less than the other hotels on this beach (As we stayed for only 3 nights, we did not look seriously at any of the condo locations.) Our room was located on the ground floor of the Maui wing and included breakfast each morning and a car from Dollar Rent a Car for $240/night. The room was quite large and had a separate sunken sitting area connected to an outdoor patio area overlooking the hotel's gardens and the ocean about 150 yds beyond, but our entry door looked out on the parking garage. The furnishings and the decor are beginning to show their age, not broken, just worn and dated. As a whole the hotel felt dated and in need of a facelift. The Mixed Plate offered a basic ,blah tasting breakfast buffet with the ambiance of Burger King. Because of this we didn't try the other restaurants in the hotel. The staff was helpful in all regards and recommended the luau at the Hyatt. It is a 15 minute walk down the boardwalk. We sprung for the VIP access to the luau which gave us front row seats, a drink waiter, and first access to the buffet dinner. The show was quite entertaining and the food was decent, not great. All in all the hotel is a good value if your primary interest is staying directly on the beach, but I certainly would not say that this is anything close to a luxury hotel, so don't be surprised that you will be charged to use the cabanas and lounge chairs on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalMankato
Reviews.Content: I returned from the KBH a couple days ago, and just wanted to say that those who think this place isn't very nice are total snobs! I am a travel agent, and have seen the worst and have stayed at the best. The KBH is definately one of the best! The staff was wonderful. The food, though a bit pricey I thought, was very good....not really excellent! We had a bunch of fun at the Tiki Bar and ate a couple times at the Tiki Grill. Our room was big and roomy and always clean. We left a few things behind when we checked out. When I called to inquire, I was told that the according to the "Log book" there was more than just a couple of items of clothing! The head of housekeeping started naming off all the things we left behind....which we didn't want to bring back...like candy bars, chips, crackers...! They were more than happy to send our clothes back to us, which I thought was awsome! Most hotels would say..."Sorry....can't find it...tough luck!" The KBH is in a great location. Spent a lot of time at Whalers Village. Hung out at the Rusty Harpoon when we wern't at the Tiki Bar. Rudy and the boys were fun! When you see them...ask them to play Free Bird!! (inside joke...but Rudy'll get it!) Next year my daughter and son-in-law will be renewing their vows at the Kaanapali so I'll be making another trip for the ceremony and I can't wait!! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “losing its aloha”
Reviews.Author: FlMauibound
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 years ago and remember the staff to be so pleasant and refreshing. This time some of the staff were great and others were just rude. When we checked in I had some questions about room rates and options since my mom decided to come the day before we left. The man originally assigned to us knew less about the rooms and rates than I did. The other lady was just plain snippy and unconcerned(you know when you can tell whether someone is even paying attention to what you say much less care). Anyone this woman couldn't care less what our predicament was. ON checking out I do remember I nice young lady named Jenny who couldn't have been friendlier who I wish had been there when I checked in. Mom also found one of the bellman to be rude and lazy when taking something to the desk to be picked up. The bar staff was great and housekeeping should get an award. I think is in a great location for the money and housekeeping does keep it clean. The turn down service is a nice touch. The rooms and the aloha are no longer anything to write home about though. We stayed at the Marriott for the three days before for the same price with a military discount. Felt more aloha there and had a full service resort and renovated room to boot. It's a good value if you can't get a deal at a better resort and it does have a homey feel but i used to rave over this place to anyone that would listen and now I wouldn't even stay there myself.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: curnutten
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel April-30- May-7. It was a beautiful place. Our rooms were comfortable, the staff was amazing, some of the most wonderful people that I have ever met. We renewed or vows there and it was magical. Beverly Powers who holds the church service at the hotel did it for us. She is one of the most amazing people that I have ever met. So if you go to this hotel, make sure you go to the church service on Sunday morning to meet this wonderful lady. It was our first trip to Hawaii and hopefully will not be our last. One thing is for sure when we do return it will definitely be to this hotel, a beautiful and magical place. We will never forget this trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel for a real Hawaian Experience”
Reviews.Author: opawalt
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 5th visit to Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We had 2 weddings on Maui and as always we stayed at the KBH since it has the best atmosphere, the ohana (family) spirit, which will make you feel welcome. And yet at the same time you share the same greeat beach and amenities of Kaanapali as you would by paying twice or three times as much at the surrounding resort hotels. It may only be a 3 star rated hotel, but the feeling of being at home, with the large uncrowded garden space and the free nightly entertainment will make up for it. The 3 restaurants available give you great choices for good but reasonably priced food. The guest services personnel will give you the friendliest and efficient service for all your other actitivities you may want to enjoy while you are on Maui. Say a special Aloha to Malihini - she is the best. So if you want to enjoy Maui at a reasonable cost and still feel like you are being treated as family - stay at the KBH. Opawalt

Reviews.Title: “Over 30 Years and Loving it still”
Reviews.Author: starbc
