Reviews.Content: Aloha! From the Garnett Family, Penticton, BC, Canada. Mom and Dad Garnett have been staying at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for over 30 years. Now a new generation of KBHer's are hooked look for Bailey, Sydney, Jackson, Cole and Zackary running free, searching for gechos, basking in the sun and having the time of their lives. We wouldn't stay anywhere else. It's the best place for the kids of all ages! This picture of our crew was taken on New Years 2007! Thanks again Malihni Keahi Heath! We had a wonderful Christmas at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We'll see you soon. Take Care and God Bless.

Reviews.Title: “What a giant disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lelofson
Reviews.Content: This review is a couple years late, but my wedding anniversary is approaching and I started thinking back to my wedding in Maui and how KBH tried their darndest to ruin my experience. I had booked a partial ocean view room for my then-fiance and myself, as well as three rooms for our wedding party. My fiance and I arrived and were sent to a room that absolutely reeked of cigarette smoke - I didn't even make it over the threshold. Reminding the front desk that we had requested a non-smoking room, we were told that since we'd arrived late in the day (um, 4pm?) they were full and we could either pay up for the next room class or take a smoking room. ?!?!?! We ended up in a room that they claimed was a suite, and that boasted a view of the side of the next building over. How romantic. I was told the manager would call our room to discuss options, and shocker that call never came, even when I reminded them I was still waiting for it. Our wedding party's rooms were to the booked specifications, but were located down an enclosed, carpeted hallway that smelled strongly of mildew and looked generally unclean. I was completely embarrassed that my friends had to stay there (although they were staying for free, so they weren't about to complain!). The front desk and restaurant staffs were surly and I don't understand where this "most Hawaiian" reputation comes from... unless most Hawaiian means most bitter toward tourists. However, the maids, bartenders, and beach staff were extremely friendly. The beach is lovely and the location really is tough to beat, but I would give up a lot of location to get something better than Motel 6. The better bet (for a better price) is the Mauian in Napili. Oh, almost forgot - a giant LOCUST flew into our room (from the interior hallway) on our wedding night. Good thing we have a sense of humor, because we found this hilarious and still laugh about it today.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Michigantravelers7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the KBH but it seemed like two different hotels at one time. We were in the Kauai wing - NOT renovated,and our room was somewhat down at the heels and worse for the wear. We wanted an oceanfront room, so we didn't have much choice as this is the building in which such rooms were located, but walking around the property in the evening, we saw rooms in the other wings that clearly had been renovated and looked much, much better than our room - completely different. (But I still wouldn't trade my beachfront patio). Also, we never received any turn down service with cookies and flowers, have no idea what the other writers were talking about. All that having been said, the people were friendly, the location can't be beat, and if you spend too much time in your room when you are in Maui, well, you don't know what you are missing. But I would insist on a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “MAUI NO KA OI- MAUI IS THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: mrvinny
Reviews.Content: Rob and Cindy Swaluk Newmarket Ontario Canada We took our first trip to K.B.H. in Maui in Feb 2005 our second trip inFeb 2006 and our thrid trip in Feb 2007. Each trip gets better than the last one.The staff is excellent. The three weeks we spent here were the best three weeks of any vacationwe have had. We felt so welcomed and part of the K.B.H. family. Duane,Malihini,Rudy,Alan,Mikala,Ranceand Michiyo impressed us always. They all spoiled us each day. At K.B.H. you get treated like royalty. We would not want to change a thing. We just wish we could stay longer. What a wonderful place to spend you winter vacation. We dream about our next trip in Feb 2008 fer another three weeks. Thank you all for a wonderful time. The best one is yet to come.We love them all. Mahalo, Mahalo.From Rob and Cindy Swaluk Ps When we went back the second and third time they greeted us by our names and they welcome you home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ka'anapali Beach Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: anna502
Reviews.Content: We have followed the reviews for a better part of a year. We were a little skeptical because some of the negative reviews were so bad. Once we arrived at the hotel though, all of our doubts were gone. Don't go to this hotel if your looking for 4-5 star elegance. Go to KBH if you are looking for simplicity and a warm atmosphere provided by the staff. This is one of least expensive hotels on the island but the richest in customer service. We spent almost 7 nights there for our honeymoon. We truly could have stayed at any hotel on Maui. We did not stay here because it was the cheapest but because we thought we would have the best Hawaiian experience here and we were right. You can still enjoy the wonderful spas and restaurants of the other larger, shinier hotels. You don't have to be a guest there. I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know. We had such a great time and we took more pictures of the view from our balcony than anything else all week. The first time we entered the room (which was very nice, clean and comfortable) we walked onto the baclony and there was a rainbow that went clear across the sky. I loved waking up every morning and enjoying the view that we had of the ocean, palm trees and the adjacent islands of Lanai and Molokai. If you have doubts, don't. But do request to stay in the remodeled part of the building. The older section did not appear to be as nice. We will definately stay at KBH the next time we go back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: theresa_marie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maui. We stayed at the Kaanapali for our 20th Anniversary and loved it. The property is very clean and the gardens our gorgeous. Nice walk/jog path along the beach and this hotel by far has the best beach area compared to the other hotels on the path. Black rock is to the right of the resort which was awesome snorkeling. Saw lots of fish and turtles every day. The staff was very friendly and the food was very good. Pool was nice size - no waterslides or anything like that but very few people used it when we were there. Everyone heads to the beach. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone on somewhat of a budget. Only thing is to get a ocean view or partial view. It was beautiful sitting out on the lanai everyday watching the ocean. Also some sections are not new. Make sure to request one of the newer rooms. They are slowing upgrading but some sections are not done yet.

Reviews.Title: “Our best vacation - at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Papai
Reviews.Content: From Phoenix, Arizona - Aloha! This was our first time to Hawaii, 4/12 -4/17, and was encouraged to stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel by Costco Travel. For four months, I frequently reviewed Trip Advisor's reviews, to make sure it was the right hotel for us. We wanted a nice, clean hotel with all the amenities a higher-rated class hotel would have, but at a cheaper price. Most of the reviews were very good. But, I began to get skeptical after reading some of the negative reviews. The room we stayed in was in the Lanai building on the 6th floor, and it had an amazing ocean view. You won't find granite countertops or marble floors, but you will find a standard, very clean room with nice Hawaiian touches. The bed, table with 2 chairs, and TV armoire were made with rattan and possibly bamboo - just what I'd wanted in a Hawaiian hotel. The island pictures also added a nice touch. The air conditioning worked just fine, as well as the refrigerator. The bathtub even had a sitting ledge, which was nice to shave my legs. Since it was our anniversary, the hotel provided us a bottle of champaigne - what a nice surprise! The nightly turn-down servie with a flower and cookies were great too. The expansive grounds on the property provided privacy for everyone. The plumeria trees, habiscus plants, and other native plants/trees on the property were just beautiful. The chairs and loungechairs were scattered throughout the property for privacy. The pool is not an enormous lagoon pool, but just the right size and in the shape of a whale. We had tickets for free daily breakfast which was very good. Although it was not a huge buffet, they had scrambled eggs, sausages, potatoes, several varieties of fruit and cereals, pancakes/waffles, crepes, and breads. We did not eat at the Tiki Terrace, but others said it was very good. The Tiki grill by the pool had good burgers and fries. The also have a beach bar which we attended to several times. The entertainment with Rudy and his band provides great entertainment. This hotel is just a short walk to Whalers Village, on the beach boardwalk. There are many stores to shop for souvenirs, jewelry, artwork and clothing. A few are high-end, but there a many shops that provide lesser price items. There you will also find The Hula Grill which has fantastic food and nightly entertainment, right on the beach. We took a stroll to see the Hyatt and the Sheraton and were very glad we chose the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. The Hyatt's pool area was not as grand as others I've been to, and they were swarming with people. They had absolutely no room to spread out. The beach area was also extremely small. The Sheraton's lagoon pool was nice, but they also don't have room for privacy. We found some of our best souvenir deals in the town of Lahaina, a few miles south of the hotel. The General Store there has all the souvenirs at great prices. I would by-pass the Cannery mall - there are just a few shops open in there. The hotel also has a few shops in there as well. Every day, at the hotel lobby, we would find locals selling crafts and wooden tiki items. The farewell ceremony by Malihini was very touching and made me think I was part of their family. They provide everyone with a Kukui nut lei. As you can tell, I was thoroughly happy with this hotel. If you can live without granite countertops, marble floors, and a lagoon pool, you will love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: wish92
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week vacation in Maui. We loved the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Although the facilities are not as nice as those of some other resorts and the rooms are modest, we loved the location (perfect spot on the beach and close to Black Rock, turtles and great snorkeling) and the staff was VERY friendly. In addition, it is really the most Hawaiian hotel in Maui, and the sunsets, which you can see from the hotel, are spectacular. It is also within a pleasant walk to Whalerâ€™s Village, where you can shop and have dinner in some very nice oceanfront cafes. I really recommend this hotel if you are an ocean lover. If you want a nice swimming pool go elsewhere. I have to say that we spent the last night at the Hyatt in Kaanapali Beach, and although the resort in luxurious and beautiful we wished that we had stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. In comparison, the Hyatt felt impersonal and the spot on the beach is not good for swimming or snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Most Hawaiian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kandy46
Reviews.Content: While visiting the Island of Maui we stayed at the KBH. The hotel courtyard was very large and full of beautiful flowers and plants. The restaurant and tiki bar had a selection of food that was very tasty. We very much enjoyed the nightly musical entertainment that was free! The band and Hula dancers were great. The balcony and the room were clean and comfortable with amazing views. There was beach cabanas, snorkling gear, and whalewatching activities available. The snorkling was great. We hope to return. Kandis and Andy from Vermont!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, best value hotel”
Reviews.Author: wyomingwelcome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBH for 9 nites, Feb. 6 thru Feb. 15th, 2007. The location and beach are perfect. The grounds are authentic and lovely. The pool is non-heated ,so can it be a little cool for some people. Snorkeling and all activities are right here. Our room was in the Molokai wing. It had a lovely view, with turn down service and cookies on the pillow. We were given breakfast buffet tickets for our complete stay and totally enjoyed the meals. There was everything you could want, and enough to make sandwiches for later in the day. Recommend taking a short trip into Lahaina to "Canoes" for the happy hour and best sushi-type appetizers around. Lovely view and the appetizers make a great meal. All in all, this hotel is great place to stay, relax and enjoy. Don't need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: FlBluEyz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui and stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel utilizing their 2007 Romance Package! What a deal! What a honeymoon! What a hotel! From the moment we pulled in front of the hotel, we were greeted with the most superb and friendly staff. We fell in love with Esther at the front desk and even brought her some banana bread we bought on the Road to Hana. I can't say enough about the warm and friendly staff...they were the best! I had done a lot of research on where to stay in Maui on a budget and like others, had read some mixed reviews of this hotel. But let me be another traveler who says I WILL stay no place else when returning to Maui. The grounds are beautiful, again the staff friendly, and the room we had was clean and spacious. We stayed on the Maui wing on the 6th floor and had the most spectacular view of the ocean and the hotel grounds. We loved the turn down service each night and the closing ceremony made us feel like family. We can't wait to return and get a "light colored nut" for our Kaanapali family lei. We were on our honeymoon, but the hotel really is a great place for families as well and we plan on bringing our two sons back next year. Snorkeling at Black Rock was amazing....and we loved the shopping just a few short steps away at Whaler's Village. We did the whale watching with Trilogy and had the best time. I can't imagine any vacation we take can compare to this one....but we will definitely try...and the next time we go to Maui...we will be returning to our family at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel! Mahalo Kaanapali family for your wonderful generosity! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Hotel in Maui - extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: MauiloverOmaha
Reviews.Content: Our family of four has been to KBH twice in the past four years. Our first experience was so wonderful that we returned this year and insisted on accomodations at KBH because it is very family friendly with activities for the whole family and especially kids, it is right on the beach, it is near shopping and restaurants. There is also a hut with reasonably priced sandwiches, etc.. You get to learn about the history of Hawaii through activities. All of the staff are very friendly and truly treat you like family. Especially great are Alan and a young woman from Japan (her name starts with M and she wears a retainer) Since we returned, the hotel greeted us with a fruit and cheese plate which we greatly appreciated. If we are fortunate enough to return, we will stay at KBH if at all possible. The last day of your stay you are invited to a very special ceremony that you will never forget. I highly recommend KBH to anyone interested in an unforgettable Hawaiian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Family Paradise”
Reviews.Author: cjwldrn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's vacation in Maui. We stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and we LOVED it!! Our friends visited Maui last summer and stayed at one of the big, luxury hotels. They walked along Kaanapali Beach and decided that if they were to come back, they would stay at KBH because of the location and lush grounds. We followed their recommendation and booked our vacation there. What great advice!! The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are very clean, and the staff is so friendly. We have 3 children (ages 11, 9, and 6). We got two adjoining rooms and it was perfect for the five of us. They had great activities for the kids, the food was great, and the best part is that you are right on the beach. We were able to snorkle in the ocean right in front of the hotel or walk a few minutes down the beach to snorkle at Black Rock. This was our first experience snorkling and it was so fun and easy. If you are planning a family vacation, we highly recommend the Kaanapali Beach Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Noeau
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love KBH! We stumbled upon it a few years ago, and now we have been going there ever since! The people are so nice and friendly there. My kids, ages 8 and 11, love the Passport Activities. They enjoyed learning about the Hawaiian Culture and had fun doing the crafts that went along with it. The food at the restaurants on the grounds was very good. Room size was spacious, and housekeeping was done well. The pool was very clean and fun. Walking distance to the beach a definate plus. Many great activities and restaurants nearby as well. This hotel has the true Hawaiian Spirit! We will use this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for Families”
Reviews.Author: Bug2Travel
Reviews.Content: We spent a glorious week at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel on Maui and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. For anyone with young children, this is the place to stay--it is the ultimate family hotel. We loved our ground floor garden room in the Molokai wing, which afforded us views of Black Rock, easy access to the beach and gave our 2 year old the opportunity to run around "our yard." The staff members are all warm and friendly. We loved the immersion into Hawaiian culture, as all the employees must take Hawaiian culture training and they offer many classes to the guests at no charge. I loved learning the hula! My daughter loved the whale pool --the entire tail is only 2 feet deep. The welcome breakfast and farewell ceremony were wonderful and memorable touches that set this hotel apart from the massive chain hotels that surround it. Special thanks to Mikala for his amazing recommendations of activities and beaches. The Trilogy snorkel adventure "Discover Ka'anapali" was fantastic! Excellent snorkeling is just down the beach a few steps at Black Rock - we enjoyed it every morning (earlier is best.) Ultimately, if you are looking for a high-end, luxury hotel with room service and miles of pools, this is not the place for you, but if you are looking for a true Hawaiian experience in a comfortable hotel, on a beautiful beach --I highly recommend the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. The Cannon Family

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: lisabir
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 night at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and loved it. We can't wait to go back. Their beach is beautiful, and the location is great. An easy walk to Whalers Village for shopping and eating. The staff is extremely friendly and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The only thing to be aware of, is that our room was on the 3rd floor (great ocean view), but there was no elevator. Not to much of a hassle for us, but it would have been nice to have known ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: ExcitedAboutAruba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBH for 9 nights starting 2/20/07. We paid extra for an ocean front room and it was worth every penny. The view was outstanding from our floor (the 5th). Sometimes we just wanted to go nowhere/sit on our balcony. The furnishings were average but clean. We did kill a bug in the bathroom the first day but none after that so that was not too bad. Breakfast that was included not very good so next time we would probably book a package that did not include the breakfast. Champagne brunch on Sunday was worth the price - we were full the rest of the day. Next time we stay here we will most likely not rent a car. We did the Old Lahaina Luau (worth it do this once-need to book months ahead). We did the Road to Hana (a waste of a beautiful day) so the only other thing we would need a car for when we go back is to go up to the top of Crater. You can take a bus for $1 each way to Lahaina. The only problem is the last bus comes back around 8:00 p.m. We spent a lot of time on the beautiful beach in front of the hotel and when it was time to dinner went a couple of times to the Hula Grill and a couple of times to Leilani's on the Beach. If you eat on the outside patio the food is reasonable and the view of the sunset is outstanding. Also ate at Ruth Chris Steak House in Lahaina - excellent food and prices about the same as the mainland. Cheeseburger in Paradise was fun, but the food there was average. We did a timeshare presentation at 8:30 a.m. one morning. It was worth the 1 hour time. We got a "buy one, get one free" whale watching cruise (the Safari boat-excellent) and $29 for me and my husband to take a sunset dinner cruise (awful). We look forward to staying at the KBH again. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Bodono
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed here March 9-10. Just like others have said, the place smelled musty and was very run down. Location of hotel is very good, but rooms are shabby and bed hurt my back. However, the price we paid for ocean front room was cheap at only $300 per night, so at that price, I wasn't expecting Westin or Ritz, but still would not recommend staying here. I won't be back, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Wow in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Travelerpjs
Reviews.Content: Overall, not rated highly on my list of places to stay in Maui. Will give you the pros and cons of that decision. On the plus side, the hotel is in a good location with a very great beach running along the front and right next door to the Black rock by the Sheraton. You can snorkel off the beach right there at Black Rock and you can walk the pathway along other hotels and to Whalers Village which has lots of shops and eateries. That said, the hotel itself is very dated. The original room we were given and the building it was in needs renovating desperately. It was very rundown looking from the hallways, to the rickety elevator, to the room itself. Didn't feel or smell clean to me. Viewwise, our room provided a view of the parking lot & small shrubbery path not well kept. This was advertised as the garden view. After a few days I realized that we were in the oldest section and that others had been updated more recently. With the hotel seeming not that full on guests, I asked for a less run down room, which they accommodated right away. Second room was certainly an improvement. Newer carpet, appeared cleaner, and some general updates. Smelled much cleaner too. Balcony view was much better, faced inner court . Must say the staff was always very friendly and helpful to us, Staying here I felt I was at an outdated tourist hotel. The entertainment was not bad but a little too old style entertainment for us although we are not young by any means. If you are looking for good location, don't care about the amentiies or ambiance, just a good location then perhaps this might work for you if you have one of the newer rooms. In fairness the food was not too bad. This is not the hotel you will rave about to your friends or cherish the memories of the luxuriousness of your stay. It is more the econo hotel you will say that you stayed at because it was more affordable in comparison to others, you didn't need anything upscale and don't care about esthetics and you just want a good beach, convenient location and nothing else matters. I honestly will not recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned: This is a Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ricep
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel for the start of our first year wedding anniversary, we couldn't have been more disappointed. The rooms are old and grubby and smell strongly of damp and mold. The beds are very uncomfortable. The grounds of the hotel are unkempt and shabby. The lobby area and 'restaurant' are filthy. The hotel calls itself the 'Most Hawaiian Hotel' on Maui. What a joke. We had to get out of the hotel early and book into another property nearby. For the price of the rooms, it is the biggest rip-off I have ever come across. Don't be fooled by its cowboy marketing on its website like we were. This hotel has no redeeming features and should be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, loved it”
Reviews.Author: rumpointsunset
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the Kauai wing of the hotel. We had a non-smoking room on an upper floor with a beautiful view of the beach, the black rock and gardens below. Each night weâ€™d sit on the balcony and listen to the nightly music from below. The electric harp (looks more like a xylophone) gave the evenings a unique and memorable ambiance. Lina, our maid, became more like a friend. It was a pleasure to stay there with an excellent location, walking distance to Whalerâ€™s Village, a beautiful beach in front of the hotel and snorkeling around the black rock about 300 feet away. The pool isnâ€™t huge but it was adequate and it didnâ€™t seem like that many people use it. Most people are on the beach or on the large grassy areas relaxing or reading. Considering the location is in a busy area among a lot of other huge hotels, the atmosphere at the hotel very relaxed. There werenâ€™t a lot of screaming kids and it didnâ€™t seem crowded. Most people were just sitting in the sun reading or enjoying food and drinks from the Tiki Bar. My husband and I also liked staying on this part of the island because it seemed to rain less. The other side is more lush but for a good reason. The last time we were in Maui, we stayed at the Sheraton but we both decided we liked the Kaanapali Beach Hotel better. The Sheraton is high class and about twice the price. Parking was much easier at the KBH with a parking ramp and close to the hotel, versus a lot. The beach and elevators were close also. It seemed that the Sheraton was a lot more walking to get anywhere and the grounds seem smaller and more crowded in the public areas. The KBH has many return customers because of the atmosphere. The hotel seems genuine and is very relaxed and enjoyable. The KBH is an older hotel and some areas could use remodeling and the walls seemed a bit thin but our room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. It is a good family hotel, similar to a good family restaurant. Our room was a standard hotel style room without the wow-factor of the more expensive chain-hotels but for half the price and an awesome location and personality.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs an update.”
Reviews.Author: IowaJanie
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is in need of remodeling. Our experience staying there for our 30th anniversary made me cry. I was expecting a much cleaner and updated room. The staff always had a smile, but not always accommodating. They did not always let us know the truth about matters concerning the room. The first room was old and dirty. Second room was larger, but still old and stained. We loved the location and the service they provided. It was a real disappontment after booking our room 6 months in advance. I wish they would have been more accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “The Road to Ohana”
Reviews.Author: Sam_n_Janet_Evening
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka`anapaliBeach Hotel for two weeks in February. It was our seventh stay at the hotel. We knew from our first stay at the Ka`anapali Beach Hotelâ€”14 years agoâ€”that this was where we wanted to return each time we come back to Maui. The people at the hotel are more than just employees at an establishment: they get to know you, they make you feel welcome and as though youâ€™re a part of their family, and they remember you when you come back despite having met hundreds or thousands of other guests between your stays there. When people say Ka`anapali Beach Hotel is the most Hawaiian hotel, they are so right. It is more than just a place to stay; it is place where you feel like part of the `ohanaâ€¦ the family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience - Best Place to Staff”
Reviews.Author: MySugar
Reviews.Content: Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is a wonderful place to stay in Maui. The Hawaiian Culture is present throughout the hotel. The service is excellent. The people are always smiling. One person in particular made our stay more enjoyable. Her name is Malihini. She has excellent information to help you plan side trips if you are interested. She is a wonderful, kind and caring person. We have stayed at this hotel before and will come back on our next visit. Chip and Lynda Galinari

Reviews.Title: “Clean, wonderful, and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: hhowell
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for 10 days when we went to Maui to get Married. Our room was WONDERFUL! Get the Oceanview room on the top floor! We had cookies on our pillow every night and from 630pm to 930pm there is live Hawaiian music everynight in the Garden, and we sat on our lanai, drank wine and listened to the music. It was fantastic. If your looking for a quaint, family oriented, HAWAIIAN hotel this is your place. If your looking for a RESORT HOTEL with a ton of snooty people around this is not the hotel for you. I will return again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price but get the Remodeled Buildings”
Reviews.Author: oinkflower
Reviews.Content: After a rather poor experience in the Upcountry B&B, it was a delight to get to an actual hotel with proper amenities. The grounds are lovely for being an old hotel. We were lucky enough to stay in a building that had been romodeled and our room was spacious and very clean. We were on the third floor of the Lanai building. Smoking rooms just happened to be the 1st and 2nd floors so as your evening breeze came up so did the rancid smoke. Other than this, our room was excellent. Don't leave your sunglasses lying around in your room. The housekeeping staff came into clean and I left. Returned and my glasses were gone and I hadn't taken them with me. If they weren't $100 pair I wouldn't even have worried about it. The nightly entertainment was great. Would have been nice to have more variety but still who can complain it's free. Don't underestimate the Tiki Terrace. The food is INCREDIBLE and Sunday Brunch a must. We will be back but with Cheap Sunglasses.

Reviews.Title: “The best time of my life!”
Reviews.Author: katiecoombs6
Reviews.Content: Aloha! I just returned from the Island of Maui, USA. I stayed at the Ka'anapali and had the time of my life. I never new a hotel could be so accomadating and loving. The staff at the hotel were prepared to bend over backwards to make their guests as happy as possible. The hotel offers many classes/activities such as Hula dancing, pineapple carving workshops, Lei making and so much more. Alan was a great help when it came to making sure you got into the class and making sure everything ran smoothly. The classes/activities were very educational and it was great to learn the hawaiian way. The hotel is located in a great location within walking distance from Whalers Village and restaurants. The hotel also has a staff member readily avalible to book tours for you. They are definitly reliable and extremly helpful. The weather was beautiful and really warm. From the months of December to April the whales come to the waters of the Hawaiian islands to raise their babies. I rented snorkeling equipment and you could hear the whales talking/singing to each other. Over all i had an amazing time at the Ka'anapali beach Hotel and am counting down the days to my next visit. I highly recommend this hotel mainly because of the staff who always great you with a warm smile. Once you've stayed at the hotel you are considered family. I promise you will have an amazing hawaiian expirence as i did! Mahalo! Kathryn Coombs Winnipeg Manitoba Canada

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: LWF56
Reviews.Content: Stayed at KBH from Feb. 9th - 14th as part of our 30th Anniversary 3 island vacation. The hotel lived upto it's advance billing as the most authentic Hawaiian hotel. After staying on Oahu and Kauai in regular hotels we wanted to experience the Hawaiian culture. The only problem we had was that our space-available upgrade from POV to OV was not honoured at check-in even though OV space was available. Said they didn't provide unpaid upgrades in Feb. and March. Other than that disappointment everything was excellent. Daily buffet breakfast, free evening hula show, on-site activities were as expected. Although the hotel is old it is well maintained and clean. The grounds are well kept and the place was full. Good location, a 5 minute walk from Whaler's Village and a 10 minute drive to Lahaina. The onsite Dinner / Magic show was phenominal. Other activities depart right from the beach (e.g. whale watching, scuba, etc.). Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place! Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovely_Lori_Mae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBH for 9 nights and absolutely loved it! Our room was more spacious than we had hoped, and the people there are incredible. My mom, my 6-year old daughter and I were addressed by name and treated like family. The kid's passport program was a lot of fun for all of us, and kept us busy between swims in the pool and lounging on the beach. We made our own Leis, took hula lessons, learned to weave, and got a hefty dose of Hawaiian culture the whole time. The Tiki Terrace restaurant had great food and service and the drinks at the Tiki Bar were phenomenal. I definitely recommend the Lava Flow. (They even make a non-alcoholic one for kids!) The nightly music and hula show was entertaining and fun. Coming back to our room after dinner every night to find cookies and flowers on our pillows was a very nice touch. The goodbye ceremony on our last daywas touching.We were each presented with our own nut leis to keep bringing back on future visits. We were sad to leave our tropical paradise. We look forward to another stay at the KPH, hopefully sooner than later! Lori, Roxanne & Ivy

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home in hawaii”
Reviews.Author: chathamgirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times as I escort groups. It is the most friendly and comfortable 4 star hotel that I have found in the Islands. It is not a plush 5 star hotel that looks like every other 5 star hotel, but rather has a special charm that radiates from it. The people who work there go out of their way to make your vacation memorable and are all trained in the History and lore of their ancesters, the Hawaiian people.. The garden is so well maintained and private, offering a wonderful ambiance and fronts Kaanapali Beach. What could be better at a reasonable price.?. The rooms are large and comfortable as well as the beds. An Aloha nut lei is offered on your departure.,with a beautiful Hawaiian wish....Grace Morrow

Reviews.Title: “In Another World”
Reviews.Author: TexasGirl205
Reviews.Content: Our family of five adults and one four-year old stayed at KBH two years ago, and we are still smiling. The food was great. Rooms were comfortable, clean and quiet, but not luxurious. Not once did we encounter any hotel representative who was less than gracious in the true island spirit. Moonlight chats under the trees, watching the gorgeous sunset, lying on the beach, after lunch naps, birds, lizards, beautiful flora, smiles all around...hard to beat. Heart rates slow, blood pressure decreases, all is right with the world. The goodby ceremony was touching and left us feeling we were leaving friends behind. Highly recommend KBH if on a budget and you don't mind driving to other locations. Close proximity to Whaler's Village and great shopping. Even the drive in from the airport was full of awe.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Kaanapali!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: The-Traveling-Two
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel in late January 2007 for the first 6 nights of our honeymoon and absolutely loved it! Neither of us had ever been to any of the Hawaiian Islands before, and this place was a great environment to start off our Hawaiian honeymoon! Our room was large and VERY close to the ocean - we booked a garden view but we could see and hear the ocean from our room. They had champagne waiting for us upon arrival, and we also had turn-down service every night where the hotel staff left delicious coconut macadamia cookies on our pillows along with fresh orchids. Like other reviews stated, the staff at KBH were awesome and very friendly! This hotel is by no means the classiest or ritiziest hotel around, but the location is amazing, the staff is very friendly, and there is the perfect balance of low key and cheesy Hawaiiana. The Tiki Terrace also has GREAT breakfast and we enjoyed sitting there every morning watching the birds and eating delicious pancakes with coconut syrup. We will most definitely stay here again - can't wait to go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"The Most Hawaiian Hotel" is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaSpiritBoston
Reviews.Content: This is truly "Maui's Most Hawaiian Hotel," as it is known, because "KBH" (as it is called) has made a priority of preserving Hawaiian culture and hospitality. The Aloha Spirit is alive and well here! We were greeted most graciously, given a tour of the hotel's tropical gardens and treated to a delicious dinner at Tiki Terrace, where Chef Thomas Muromoto presented amazing entrees cooked in ti leaves, the traditional way, in addition to the many other offerings on the menu. We sipped an after-dinner drink beneath the stars on Ka'anapali Beach, one of the most beautiful in the world. Our room, with its own private lanai, looked out over the blossoming plumeria trees, pool and ocean view. Employees are the friendliest anywhere and treat guests like family--which is one secret of the hotel's great success and popularity. When you leave, they sing a special chant and present guests with an keepsake gift lei. In addition to classes on Hawaiian crafts, culture and customs, there's a popular program for kids. Golf and tennis are just steps from the hotel. KBH has a great welcoming spirit and the highest standards of hospitality and guest service. We would definitely go back and, in fact, made new friends there. Perfect for a honeymoon destination, or your special get-away. You will cherish the memories of your stay! See the hotel website at: http://www.kbhmaui.com for further details.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: photopiggy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for our 6 days in Maui, and we had a fantastic time. Compared to the other hotels that we stayed at on the other islands, KBH was definitely our favorite. The staff was incredibly kind - they really made the experience lovely. Our room was not jaw-droppingly amazing - it was just simple, spacious and we really did like it. It was clean, and bright, with a veranda overlooking the courtyard. The KBH had live entertainment in the courtyard every evening, and one of my great memories is falling asleep with a gentle breeze coming in from the veranda, and the soft sounds of beautiful Hawaiian music intermingled with the sounds of crashing waves. When we were planning the honeymoon, we were sligtly nervous about one or two bad reviews that we had read (even though 99% of the reviews seemed to be great). We had no cause to worry. I am the type of person who likes things to be clean and comfortable. KBH was perfect. If you are on the fence about this hotel, I hope this will help to convince you - We really loved it there. I can say with absolute certainty, that the next time we go to Maui, we will be staying at KBH again.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cowconnection
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. The hotel was great! They upgraded our room from POV to Oceanview because of the anniversary (and because they had availability). The room was nicely decorated and clean. (We stayed in the Maui wing.) We had read some of the previous reviews that were less than complementary and I have to say that we didn't experience anything bad. KBH is a smaller, cozier hotel. They really strive to be the "most Hawaii hotel" and it works. The staff is wonderful. Everyone greets you. We had breakfast at the Mixed Plate each morning and it was good. The breakfast potatoes are the best I've ever had. The nightly show at the Tiki Bar is a real plus. Rudy Aquino is a jewel. We overheard other people around us saying that they were from nearby hotels and had walked over to enjoy the free show and dance. We walked next door through the Sheraton Hotel. Their grounds were beautiful and everything was upscale. But it also appeared large and less personal. If you want the "resort" experience, stay at the Sheraton. It is beautiful. But we preferred the coziness of the KBH. We had a wonderful dinner at Lelanie's on the Beach at the Whaler Shopping area. Don't miss their Hula Pie. It is to die for. We also took the bus from The Whaler Shopping area to Lahaina for $1.00 per person each way. It is a very easy way to get into Lahaina and not worry about parking or traffic. You can have a drink or two and not worry about driving. The only negative about the bus is that the last pickup in Lahaina to return to Kaanapali is 8:50 pm. That is too early for an evening out. Again, we would definately recommend the Kaanapali Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Aloha!”
Reviews.Author: laugherty5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 25 th wedding anniversary at this lovely hotel filled with the Aloha spirit it is know for. I spent a great deal of time researching our stay in Hawaii and kept coming back to this place. The room was extremely spacious and clean, aware that we were celebrating our anniversary we were welcomed in our room with a personal note and bottle of champagne to begin our celebration. The Tiki Terrace has a wonderful menu and the dinner is excellent. The breakfast at the Aloha Mixed Plate is OK... You do get a little tired of buffets after a while. The location is terrific , there is a beachwalk that spans quite a while and is a lovely and safe place to walk.. If you are looking for a casual Hawaiian experience in a hotel, this one is for you, it is a memorable place.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Maui Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trayhop37
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I spent one day at KBH in early January, and the hotel grounds and room were great. The KBH staff is wonderful. Malihini, whom we took hula and lei making classes with, particularly made us feel so welcome we would love to come back. It's great that unlike most of the Kaanapali resort hotels, KBH stresses Hawaiian culture and employs the largest percentage of native Hawaiians. We can't wait to come back to Maui and visit our new friends at KBH. Tracy and John from Brooklyn, New York

Reviews.Title: “We are so ready to go back!”
Reviews.Author: travelling_monkeys
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and had a fantastic vacation! I, like many others, was a bit leary of the negative reviews scattered throughout tripadvisor. Our experience was nothing but positive and we will definently return to KBH again. This is not a fancy place (but we aren't fancy people) and was very kid friendly- the staff, the pool (with the very large shallow area), the restaurants. The location and beach are perfect and this hotel really had everything we were looking for in a tropical, relaxing vacation. Our room was clean, as were the meticulously kept grounds. The view, even from the "partial ocean view" room was picture perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place, perfect location and a "family feel" to their vacation. There are much fancier places to stay along Kaanapali Beach with a much bigger price- we loved the KBH and enjoyed spending the savings on a convertible rental car and lots of good food and drink. And check out the magic show at the hotel- we went mainly for our 4 year old but it was a great show!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Visited”
Reviews.Author: Boniman
Reviews.Content: ALOHA, My wife and I, along with my brother and his wife, stayed in Maui after a previous week on Kona. It was our first time staying in Maui and we had been told by our daughter who had spent a week of her honeymoon at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel in 2005 to not think of staying anywhere else. Our travel agent also agreed. We are delighted that we chose to follow their advise! I can not imagine staying in a better managed property. From the moment of our arrival right through till we had to reluctantly return to winter's reality we found the accomodations to be well equipped, comfortable, clean and well maintained. The grounds and the views from our rooms were spectacular and the hotel staff were the friendliest and most helpful that we have ever experienced. Delicious food was available in casual as well as more formal locations and menues ranged from simple to gourmet. Daily entertainment was offered for both children and adults and we delighted in dancing under the stars after an ellaborate dinner in the Tiki Terrace Restaurant. In addition to a lovely whale-shaped pool, the hotel has a fantastic stretch of gorgeous and easily swimmable beach for anyone who chooses a salt water swim. There are lots of excellent attractions and restaurants off-property as well and many are within walking distance from the hotel. A farewell ceremony is conducted for all guests who are checking out and everyone is presented a Kukui Nut Lei to bring home to help preserve the memories. The staff will add different colored nuts if we bring back our leis on a future visit. We are counting the days till we can return! Paul & Barbara Geoffrion Reading, Massachusetts 01867

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay there.”
Reviews.Author: maspsmom
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was amazing. The only problem we had was when we checked in we were told one price & when we checked out they tried charging us $200 more. Completely unexceptable. The manager was very rude emplying we were lying That is the only reason they didn't get an excellent score becuase everything else was great. Thank you again. Sarah from Oahu

Reviews.Title: “Great "Budget" Resort”
Reviews.Author: MrAsian96
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the KBH 1/6 to 1/10 in the older Molokai wing, "garden view". Overall I can't complain too much since I paid $125 a night for the room. Room: The room was cleaned daily and decent size. Mine had a king size bed and a sofa and didn't feel cramped. We hardly stayed in our rooms (Road to Hana, Haleakala crater, Whale watching cruise, snorkeling, Olivine pools and Nakele blow hole, dinner at Mama's fishhouse) so getting luxurious accommodations wasn't a priority. But for your "hotel/resort snobs" here are some negatives: There was a musty odor (like wet dog) which resolved by running the fan and AC. The TV had cable but was a "regular" set (not flat screen let alone flat panel). The furniture had some chips here and there. The bedding was motel qualitly. The shower door didn't have any sort of latch and there was some rust stains on the edges. My "view" was of the Sheraton's fence. So of course this was no 4 or 5 star room, but hey, I got a great deal on the room. Service: Friendly staff. My wife had a hole in her bathing suit that needed to be sewn and the staff brought up a sewing kit in 5 minutes (and didn't accept my tip). Check in and check out was straightforward. Hotel/Resort: Only thing really missing is a gym. Otherwise they had everything else on site if staying in the resort was all you wanted to do (restaurants, gift shop, spa/salon, activities, pool, bar, etc). Also the grounds are well landscaped with palm trees and banana trees, etc. The pool is a decent break from the sand and salt water, but with Kaanapali beach and Black Rock at your foot steps, I didn't spend much time at the pool. Restaurant: My wife and I had breakfast at the Tiki Terrace (taro bread french toast, papaya juice, eggs, taro hash browns, portugese sausage, coffee) which came out to $40. The food was good quality but obviously there are cheaper options out there (Moose McGullicutty in Lahaina for example). Didn't try any other on site options since we dined out the rest of the time. Location: Couldn't be better. Walked to Black Rock to snorkel my last 2 days (and swam with a sea turtle on one day). Walked to the Whaler's village mall to rent my snorkel gear at Maui dive shops (waaay cheaper than the on site vendor and better quality gear). 5 minutes to Lahaina for more dining and shopping options. Other notes: Eventhough I got the Aloha value, it still included one free "orientation" breakfast (which I didn't partake in since I already had my activities planned out which required leaving the hotel by 6 or 7 AM 3 out of the 4 days I was there). Parking is an extra $8/day. The in room safe is $1.50/day. The farewell "ceremony" is a nice touch. It takes literally 5 minutes and you get the farewell lei. Overall, I would stay here again owing to its great location, plus I'm not a "hotel snob". However if you care about the thread count on your sheets, having marble in the bathroom, ordering room service and champagne, pools with waterfalls and slides, etc, you will NOT be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Family Tradition”
Reviews.Author: kramsugs
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to KBH. This is our family vacation spot, there has been as many as 22 of us at 1 time. Everyone finds something special here from the kids to the granfparents. The staff is great and the location is perfect for all ages. Thanks for making our vacation great, see you next November. Mark and Sheri Shahrok Turlock, CA.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to go back”
Reviews.Author: FingerLakes
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay from 12/21/-12/28/06 at the KBH. Check in was a breeze. Parking was easy and convenient. We had two rooms on the ground floor, ocean front. The rooms were clean, spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was wonderful, everyone was so pleasant. We enjoyed the welcome breakfast. The early risers took advantage of the free breakfast every morning, without much complaint. We liked the Champagne brunch on Christmas eve day. We enjoyed making leis in the lobby. There were a lot of whales we could see from our rooms and it was fun to take the nearby Trilogy catamaran out there to see them up close. One day a seal came up on the beach. We were a couple minutes walk to Black Rock for snorkeling and when we went out around the point a turtle swam up to us. Whalers Village was a short walk in the other direction and we had plenty of restaurants and stores right there, including the Maui Dive Shop. The beach sidewalk was perfect for early morning and late night strolls. For supplies we drove a short distance to the Cannery Mall, where there is a Longs drug store which sells practically anything, and a big grocery store. There was a nice crowd every evening to enjoy good music and dance. I was told this is where Hawaiians stay when they come to Maui, and I know why, it is a relaxing place in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendlist Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Bernapet
Reviews.Content: Once we stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel 4 years ago...no where else will do! They have the friendliest staff! The grounds are comfortable, and very Hawaiian. The activities are fun. There is something for everyone, yet very relaxing! When you are there you feel like you are part of their family! I have stayed at almost every hotel in Lahaina, and this is our hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Sue & Sam-What A Fabulous vacation stay”
Reviews.Author: samandsue
Reviews.Content: After hearing many experiences our friends had while staying at your beautiful Hotel, we had to make the trip with them this March. We then decided that while at your hotel, we would renew out vows on the beach. The staff at the hotel were Remarkable. One of your guest services representatives, Alan was exceptional. After meeting my husband and I, only once he rememberd us by name and greeted us with a smile everytime we passed him by. We also enjoyed Rudy and his group on stage every night. The show was always worth staying to watch in its entirety! The rooms were always kept clean. Out of the three islands we astayed at during our first trip to Hawaii, Your hotel was the absolute best. When we come back to Hawaii, we will definitely stay at your Hotel. Thanks for making our vacation worth while. Sam and Sue from Norristown, PA

Reviews.Title: “Loved KBH on Maui”
Reviews.Author: CHARLIE777
Reviews.Content: The best hotel to go to in Maui if you would like a true Hawaiian experience. The staff is excellent and the view is outstanding. Food is great and they have a show every night of the year that is free to everyone. Have been to this hotel seven times and going my eight very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a Lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: NonnieMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: We experienced the most amazing vacation this summer over 4th of July at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in Maui! Our son & daughter-in-law had their wedding at the hotel-it was just amazing! The wedding planner was fantastic-to cover all of the details from long distance was truely the best! Once we were all checked in-the fun began. Our room had the most fantastic view-we asked for ocean view-with view of the grounds also-it couldn't have been any more magnificent! Our whole family stayed here, including all of the guests. Our 2 year old grandson had the time of his life at the beach & just soaking up all of the goings on! No matter what age-we were all in a true paradise! Whatever we needed-we received. The food was incredible-breakfast came with the room as did the rental car! We had the most amazing breakfast buffet the morning of the wedding-then the beautiful wedding dinner that night! The hawaiian music playing all the time-spending nights at the Tiki Bar was just the best. The Ka'anapali made you feel at home away from home! We cannot wait to go back again & hope to have the same room. Other family members had oceanfront rooms-you can only imagine how that was!!!! We wouldn't stay anywhere else-other family members had vacationed there previously -with the same feelings! You simply must experience Ka'anapali to believe it!! Walking distance to the Whaler's Village Shops & so much more! The staff was like family-you felt as if you had known them forever! Ask about the special ceremony the day you leave! And those fabulous cookies every night on your bed-to die for! Aloha! Linda Zschau Bridgewater, Ma

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: InsideTrack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rundown - plain and simple. Maybe my family's standards are too high, but old and grimy aren't what I expect for my money when staying at a hotel - and it wasn't cheap. Although the staff are pleasant, they don't necessarily bend over backwards to service their clients. We had to ask servers and front desk staff repeatedly for things to be done. For what we paid, I don't think that is reasonable. The pool is dinky for the hundreds of people staying there. The place is also over run with partiers. Not exactly the kind of place you want to stay at if you want a quiet, restful paradise vacation. Definitely NOT a good place to stay for a Hawaiian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best of our trip”
Reviews.Author: mareby
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Hawaii. Last trip did 4 islands. This trip 3. Both times we stayed at a Hilton on Kauai and on the Big Island of Kona. But this trip on Maui, I decided on Kaanapali Beach Hotel. And I am so thrilled I did! I was traveling with my husband, daughter and son in law. It was our 43rd anniversary. We have all traveled together in the past and looked forward to this trip. I always use trip advisor before I make my choice. Let me just say, this hotel was our favorite. The hotel was so Hawaiian and romantic. We had a first floor room looking out at the garden. Every morning we went out and picked flowers off the ground for our room. The smell was incredible. On the beach is a walkway that takes you to outdoor/indoor dinning, shopping etc. A beautiful night stroll. Every evening there is entertainment in the garden. Dinning while you are listening to wonderful Hawaiin music. The staff is delightful, and you are surrounded by wonderful hotels and condos. Our room was huge! We had two double beds, and a step down to a level with table and 4 chairs plus a big day bed. Walk out to patio and garden. Facing pool and ocean. The dressing area and bath were out of the way, so we never, ever felt crowed. I really did not see other wings, or rooms, so I can only tell you how delighted we were with this hotel. After leaving a Hilton, and after the next Hilton, we all, and I mean all of us, would have preferred this room over all others. Our stay at the Hilton on Kauai was a nightmare of roach's. But that is another story for another island. If other's have found fault with this hotel, I cannot say why. I wish I were 43, instead of 63!!! I would go back every year. I made all my arrangements by emailing the hotel directly. I prefer to do it that way. I feel it is more personal and you can let them know of any special request. As I have problems walking. I hope this helps anyone considering this hotel. You will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Value & Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: STARR1
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the KBH in November 06. We have both been to various 5-star resorts all over the U.S, Caribbean, Mexico and Dominican Republic and none can compare to the staff of the KBH. They were always friendly, helpful and absolutely brilliant. Actually, everything about the Hotel was wonderful â€“from the cleanliness of the premises to the entertainment and food. Malihini and Mikala in Guest Services were wonderful. The entire staff made us feel at home. We also cannot brag enough about the housekeeping staff= they were all fantastic and always made sure our needs were met. I had forgotten souvenirs in my room and they were kind enough to keep it for me and send them to my home. The overall service was outstanding. The bar service was also great; it was so nice to be surrounded by people who always had a genuine smile on their faces and for them to remember our names!! We could go on and on with how much we enjoyed our stay. About the Beach, I can honestly say that if youâ€™re looking for a perfect beach with no waves, you will be disappointed. But in comparison to all of the other hotels nearby, this was the best beach. One aspect I did have complaints about was the fact that you had to pay for lounge chairs on the beach, I believe $30 day, and couldn't take any regular chairs on the beach either. You had to rent them from Trilogy on the beach=werent the friendliest of guys either. For all you single people out there, this is a family place, mostly married people. Its a great place to come if you wanna be alone. But, the positives definetly outweigh the negative with KBH. Also, if you are looking for a ritzy hotel, this is not for you. In that case, go to the Hyatt, but then youre NOT going to have a great beach and you're going to be spending a ton of money. I'm recommending KBH to everyone I know and more than likely will return. If anyone has questions, feel free to contact me at ShininStar1@aol.com. Aloha & Mahalo CHRISIE from Yonkers

Reviews.Title: “Ohana Feeling at KBH”
Reviews.Author: MauiTimeatKBH
Reviews.Content: Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is a modest hotel in terms of amenities and facilities but the service compares to none. We've stayed there 4 years in a row and each time we are greeted as returning ohana (family) members. The staff is genuine and the atmosphere is in true Hawaiian aloha spirit. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are tired of the mega hotels with their "you're just a number" attitude. KBH really cares about your stay and will do everything possible to make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hawaiian Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: harry&debbie
Reviews.Content: In March of 2006 we had our third wonderful vacation at the KBH. This time we brought two of our closest friends that re-newed their wedding vows on the beach. Even though we had told them how wonderful this hotel was, it could not compare to their experience. They quickly saw why we return to KBH every year for vacation. The staff, the true Hawaiian hospitality, location, amenities and restaurants make it the best hotel in the islands. We are always amazed how the staff remembers our names, greets us every time they see us, shopping and dining recommendations and take the time to give directions . The nightly entertainment is fun and also enlightening about the Hawaiian culture. Rudy is amazing. We watched his show every night. But without a doubt Alan in Guest Services is the best. He always took the time to answer any question and made us feel like we were true Ohana. Alan always has a smile on his face, and took the time to make sure that our vacation was perfect. We are planning our 2007 KBH, hope to see you there. Harry & Debbie Skippack, PA

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelfrmaz
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here the last three days of our visit and had a wonderful time. As soon as you step on the property the feeling is that of family and relaxation. If you are looking for something more upscale then this is not the place for you, but if you are looking for something down to earth, relaxing, and very enjoyable then you are going to love staying here. I wish that we would have stayed more nights here during our 12 days. We stayed at the Hyatt for nine nights due to getting a great rate and then moved to Kaanapali after that. I'll post a Hyatt review also when we get back to the mainland. This hotel sits in a quiet spot on Kaanapali beach next to black rock which is all lit up at night and nice to see. While at the hotel we went to their magic dinner show and that was fun for all ages. We also attended the nightly hula show which was fun. They involve everyone at the show and there is music, laughter, and fun till 9pm every night. Many visitors that I met stay there every year so that is good to say about the place. For the money that you pay you get a great deal more then the higher priced hotels. I will come back to this hotel again and again if I ever get the chance to come back to Maui. You wont be wrong in chosing this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: cozi35
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in Nov 06. This place is a dump. Please spend the extra $ and stay next door at the Sheraton. Get a garden view. There is no point to staying in your room. Its run down and for seniors. Which is fine if you have to save $$. Black rock is a 3 min walk down the beach and attached to the Sheraton. Ka'anapali grounds are ok but the rooms where like a hotel in downtown Detroit. DO NOT GO HERE. I beg you. The molokini snorkel trip was fun and worth seeing the turtles. Don't get the "extra" wet suit. Rip off. Or the snuba, another rip off. The clarity is 100 ft. No need for it. Haleakala was really fun and not that bad of a drive. I think a mountain bike trip is insane unless you like getting up at 2am on vacation. We went at 4pm and it was just fine and the drive is pretty tuff. Hana Highway was ok. Its a tuff drive. Pack a lunch and water. I suppose I'm glad I did it. There is a lagoon pool you can swim in which is worth the whole trip. Just be careful. Search out restaurants in Lahana, Cheesburger in Paridise is cool. Forest gumps is $$$ and crowded. There is a Italian restaurant called Pene's which is great! And a Mexican place with great burritos. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Just donâ€™t injure yourself there.”
Reviews.Author: jwneddotcom
Reviews.Content: Let me get the good points out there first. The housekeeping staff is really friendly and helpful crew. The grounds keeps are also friendly, and work very hard. There is also a bartender at the Tiki Bar named Dale that really makes people want to come back. The location of the property is very convenient. Oh and my bed was extremely comfortable. I have read reviews where guests complained about the rooms not being updated and requesting newer upgraded ones. We booked a full ocean view room, ground floor. We did not want to take the chance of having to move. So paying full price here, really isnâ€™t worth it, the room was no where near updated. The drawers needed serious WD40. The patio door was stuck for the 9 days we stayed there. It was obvious this room was in line for a serious shove into the update department. But, I lived with it. That was the good, and this is what turned the whole experience off for us. On the third day of my 9 day trip, I went out in front of our expensive ocean front view room to relax in a lounge chair to read a book, where upon my ankle found a rather large, and grass covered hole. It was about 9 inches deep. My ankle snapped. I heard a *pop* and down I went. On their impeccably well groomed landscape, which they tend to each morning without fail, raking, mowing, and collecting debris (I was up at 6am each day. I saw it) they simply ignored two huge holes. The drainage pipe I was told had collapsed the ground in two places. The grounds crew immediately covered the 'one' hole. I was privileged to view an orange cone for the rest of my stay. I immediately iced my own ankle but it was clear that by 6pm ice was not the answer. I sent my brother to the front desk for an ace bandage. He returned with 2 security members. One told me I had torn a tendon. The other said if I wanted to see a doctor he would have someone come check on me in the morning and see how I was. No one came. We had to seek them out. I did go to the clinic, spent almost 3 hours there, and received a pair of crutches, Ibruprophan, an ankle brace, ace bandage, AND upper respiratory infection. I guess that was the bonus. For the balance of our stay, not once did anyone inquire of my condition. We basically felt as though we were purposely being ignored. We had to cancel several activities, dinners, and a trip to Hana and the Aquarium. My remaining days were spent hobbling around a hotel I felt could care less that my vacation was ruined because they choose to ignore their own part in all this. By the time we were ready to leave we decided the good-bye ceremony was simply too contrite for us. I didnâ€™t have the stomach to face a group of people that made me feel so unwelcome. I was grateful to be going home. Although I will probably never go back, I will say this. I think for anyone who visits the island for the first time, this is a fine hotel to stay in. The small details that make a vacation nice, the turn-down service with cookies and flowers at night is lovely. The goodbye ceremony I am sure is very sweet. They try to be helpful, when they donâ€™t think you require too much. I would defiantly recommend this hotel. Just donâ€™t get hurt there. Hints are this. Avoid the Mixed Plate Diner for your free breakfast. We ate once and decided to use our $12.50 coupon toward the breakfast at the Tiki Terrace. It was excellent. Also, if the special on the menu at the Tiki Terrace happens to be All you Can eat crab legs, avoid it. They do not provide small shellfish forks. Trying to dig out crab meat from those legs is not only an exercise in futility, itâ€™s also dangerous. My brother ended up with crab pickers throughout his finger. More ended up on the floor than in his mouth and the $29.00 Item was not removed from the bill. They would rather you be unsatisfied than lose a dime on a meal you couldnâ€™t fight. Or bring your own fork! And one last thing, there is a Longs drugstore just passed the Front Street exit, in the Lahaina Cannery Mall. This is an excellent place to get needed supplies at reasonable prices. Avoid the hotels convenience market. Itâ€™s way over priced. If anyone stays in room #186, please take care of my birds! Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experiance at Ka'anapoli Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love4Maui
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this Hotel to anyone going to Maui. The people are wonderful and the beach is just a few steps away. The great hawaiian music they provide everynight on the open stage is great if you are right there or just listening from your room. Also the Whalers Village, a shopping area is just a short stroll down the beach, but of course with a walkway. We have been 4 times and loved every minute of it. There is something for everyone from young to older. We just got back from a 6 day stay over Thanksgiving, weather was beautiful and we can't wait to go back. Mahalo, Jim and Penny from California

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: mwforbes
Reviews.Content: Reviews are accurate. Excellent beach and location. Hotel has some renovated and some non renovated rooms. I heard overheard numberous guests at front desk complaining about their rooms and wanting a change to a remodeled room. We had an old room. Was terrible. Mold in the closet, old beds, nasty carpet, 1960s bathroom, no fan, and a half working AC. However, Hotel was kept very tidy, and the grounds was very nice. The hotel is somewhat cheezy/kampy. It reminded me of an old folks home. The staff--very very friendly. I believe this with coupled with the location and price is why people stay here. Also, the lunch buffett was the nastiest buffett I believe I have ever seen....and I'm serious. It looked like leftovers from our Luau--3 days prior. We turned right around and ate somewhere else. (There are numberous places to eat just yards from the hotel). I honestly can't give it a terrible rating because of the staff, location and grounds. If you're used to a Hyatt/Sheraton,etc...then stay there....you will be very unsatisfied with this property. The Whaler next door is an excellent alternative as well.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali's beach rocks!”
Reviews.Author: JohnS110
Reviews.Content: This stretch of hotels along KB is arguably the best place to stay on the whole island. Great beaches. KBH is perfect for families - very welcoming atmosphere and prides itself on an authentic Hawaiian feel. Great snorkeling off of Black Rock reef which is right outside your door. I advise against renting snorkeling gear from Trilogy. I don't think they're directly affiliated with the hotel - they have a separate bungalow right off the beach. They don't have the best equipment or rates. I promise you're better off bringing your own or renting from local shops in and around Laihana Town.

Reviews.Title: “Always Home to us”
Reviews.Author: Pellete1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have shared incredble moment on your island and Kaanapali Beach Hotel is the best family to come visit for the holidays. We have been back home 12 times in a row and each time is more memorable. We even bring family from Phoenix to experience your Ohana and they are completly in awe when they meet the staff and all the great people that keep our home going. I have read some of the reviews written and alot share our experience and the little few who don't , they need to open there eyes just alittle wider. My husband and I wish you , our other Ohana a very Merry Chistmas and a prosperous New Year. See you Nov. 2007 Aloha Dante & Esther Pellettieri

Reviews.Title: “Paradise and more”
Reviews.Author: snowboardbrandi
Reviews.Content: Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is a wonderful paradise vacation spot. This was our 4th time to go as a family. The staff makes you feel like your with friends and the beach and water activities are great for all ages. We took scuba lessons in the pool and then went out to black rock to scuba around there. Harry was a great instructor. The Thanksgiving Feast was just that. Something for everyone, traditional and gourmet was more than we expected. The magic show at the hotel was fun and the nightly Hula shows are always great. This is truely the only was to see Maui, you are able to experience Hawaii in the true fashion, with its culture, beauty and friendliness. The kids will love the passport program, with the learning to make lei's, hula, painting and other gifts they receive. It is a paradise for the whole family. Looking forward to next year. This is a must see destination!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, definitely will not be back ever”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBrettski
Reviews.Content: We spent our first night in Maui at the KBH and were so thankful we only had to spend one night there. We arrived from the airport at 10pm to find the lobby staffed by only one person. After checking in, we were given a confusing map and sent off to find our room. It took us 20 minutes, carrying all of our heavy luggage, to reach our room. When we finally did, I inserted the key... and found other people sleeping in "our" room, their luggage all over the floor!!! We hurried our way back to the front desk and told the man what we had seen. He seemed completely unsurprised and unfazed and took about 30 min. to get us another room. He again did not offer us assistance finding the room and we again lugged all of our things through the confusing maze of buildings. Our new room wasn't occupied, but it was two double beds when we had requested one king our queen. The "complimentary" coffee we so desperately needed the next morning was not there and we had to call down for it. The thermostat was falling off the wall, although it did work. The Kauai wing (where we stayed) was filthy, dated, and had the slowest elevators ever. We were so happy when we got to our condo, the Maui Eldorado, where we spent five blissful nights and soon forgot our hellish experience at the KBH.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the KBH!”
Reviews.Author: travelesmuybien
Reviews.Content: My parentâ€™s and I stayed in room 138 over the Thanksgiving day holiday. We had such a great time! The room was perfect with a view of the gardens and the Tiki bar was only steps away with the daily drink specialsâ€¦it was heaven. We have already booked our rooms for next Thanksgivingâ€¦canâ€™t wait to toast with the kind employees at the KBH again! Colleen Kelly San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Non-chain paradise!”
Reviews.Author: GITFIT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Maui four times; staying at the Kapalua Bay condos, Maui Prince, Ritz, and last January at our new home-away-from home the KBH. We loved it so much that we are spending 11 nights there over Christmas and New Years. Can't wait! KBH is on our favorite beach, and has a most wonderful staff filled with aloha spirit and knowledge of the island, its culture, and activities. The resort actually implemented a program to send every staff member to sample the activities tourists enjoy so they can talk about their experiences with you. I want to work there in my next life. They treat you like ohana (family), which is not to be taken lightly in Hawaiian culture. It's a privilege. There is an absence of convention goers with 3-ring binders walking around. I don't want to be reminded of work when I'm on vacation. There is an absence of corporate policy and the feeling you could be in any Hyatt anywhere on the planet. You can read about the hotel culture on their enjoyable website, [--] (I visit it often as a mini-vacation). So, instead of a chain-hotel feel, you enjoy feeling like a welcome guest in a genuine Hawaiian atmosphere. And the price is right. Will take photos and post in a few weeks. Aloha and mahalo to our home-away-from home. K & K Phoenix, AZ

Reviews.Title: “Great Cultural Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travlin4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Beach hotel for our 20Th. anniversary, and had a wonderful time! This hotel was exceptional! Wonderfully located off the beach, it allowed you walking access to all the other hotels, restaurants , and The Whaler Museum along the strip. The hotel itself was very authentic, had plenty of free cultural activities for adults, as well as children. The rooms were spacious and clean. The decor was very nice, and each room provided balconies to view the ocean or courtyard, as well as watch the sunset or even whale watch! The hotel is older, and if you were wanting a newer hotel, it would be better to look elsewhere... The hotel also offered a great buffet breakfast, which offered spectacular fruits being prepared right in front of you, as well as a hot breakfast. We enjoyed their free nightly laua and presentation, where you could sit outside and sip those great Mai Tai's! We did have a problem upon check in however, as they said they wouldnt guarantee our reservation, and gave us a room with two beds! After speaking with the manager on duty, they fixed the rooms and accomodated us. Overall, a great stay, and would definately stay there again ....

Reviews.Title: “The most Hawaiin Hotel in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: denwen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a vacation at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel at Maui, HI. We were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary. Everything was perfect. The room, the food, the beautiful grounds, the Hawaiian music. We are looking forward to our return, to the hotel someday soon. This is the most Hawaiin hotel in Hawaii. Especially touching was the farewell ceremony, where we were given the special Kukui Lei s. Aloha, and thanks for "the time of our lives". Denis and Roberta (Pittsburgh, Pa)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bellies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for only 2 nights, but thought it was good value for money. Its an older hotel which could use a face lift, but the rooms are clean, large and comfortable. Its right on the beach, which was great, the pool area is big and has plenty of deck chairs. Breakfast is included each morning, with a large range of fruit & hot food to choose from. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a clean hotel that isnt over priced. I wouldnt stay at this hotel if you wanted something luxurious. Hotel staff are friendly and hotel grounds are well kept. There is parking available for US $8.00 per day. Rooms have air-conditioning, hairdryer, cable TV and inroom safe for US $1.50 per day.

Reviews.Title: “KBH rocks!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLisa
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and could not have been happier. After lots of exploration of the island, we were satisfied that we were in one of the best locations, and the hotel is outstanding! It is not a corporate hotel with no personality that could be anywhere - the "aloha spirit" is all around you. The people and service are superb.
