You can dive as shallow or as deep as you'd like into learning about Hawaiian customs. Our room was great and faced not only the ocean, but also the beautiful open courtyard and nightly show. The property is beautiful and every night ends with a great hula and Hawaiian show. You can walk right out of the hotel onto a spectacular beach with views of Lanai and Molokai and head right in for swimming and snorkeling (right next to one of the best spots on the island!) It truly felt like home and we look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing- full of Aloha spirit!”
Reviews.Author: mmpierce
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long trip to Maui. I can honestly say that we made the best choice possible for our hotel. The location is great- the beach wasn't terribly crowded (unlike the Sheraton next door!), but was a 1 minute walk to Black Rock for snorkeling. Everyone was so wonderful, from the bellman to the housekeeper. Mary, we thank you for a wonderful week! This is truly the most authentic, Hawaiin hotel on Maui. I cannot say enough about the room- it was exactly what we'd envisioned for our first trip to Maui (we stayed in the Maui wing). We had a split of champange in our room upon check-in, and our lanai was large and inviting. The orientation breakfast was informative and funny, if a little long-winded, and the Kukui nut lei departure ceremony almost made me cry. We really felt like part of a big family here. From free towel service, to the free nightly entertainment, I feel that the KBH goes above and beyod to separate themselves from the cookie cutter resorts. We got a great deal through our travel agent, and will definitely be back to receive a white kukui nut in our lei!

Reviews.Title: “KBH Great hotel- From Long Island , NY”
Reviews.Author: Vee123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at KBH for 6 nights as part of our honeymoon. The hotel staff were truly wonderful. They were so nice and friendly. Our room was very nice for the money, except for the bathroom, it was older and needed some updating , and the toilet made this terrible noise each time we flushed. I regret that we did not bother to change our room though, we were just so happy to be there and we didnt't feel like lugging all of our things around again. The location of this hotel had to be the best on Kaanapali Beach. The beach was big and the water was nice and calm. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is a great value, and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, almost magical place”
Reviews.Author: TimberTales
Reviews.Content: Our initial impression of the hotel was not favorable. For our honeymoon we had requested a non-smoking king room but upon check-in were told that no non-smoking king rooms existed and that we had to take a non-smoking room with double beds in the Kauai wing. The room wasn't awful but was far from nice- the furniture was worn, the stained wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the lighting was bad and a musty smell permeated the place. As for the "partial ocean view", we had to go out on the balcony and look through a row of trees to see the sand and water since the room directly faced a huge condo tower. We went to the lobby to complain to the front desk about the room and they were more than understanding, as if they knew that the room was bad (I overheard another front desk conversation later on where the guy was telling someone that some rooms in the hotel were due to be remodeled- I'm hoping that is the case). We were shown another room on the other side of the property that was much nicer. We took it, although it still wasn't a non-smoking king room (I never understood that generic hotel policy- if someone requests a specific type of room, why would a hotel rent that room to someone else if they know someone else already reserved it, or offer it in the first place?) Our new room had a beautiful view of the courtyard and the beach. While the bathroom was very small, everything else was nice. The furniture was fairly new, there was a big ceiling fan in the middle of the room and everything had a tropical look. It was so much better than the depressing first room we had! The KBH advertises itself as Maui's Most Hawaiian Hotel and I have a feeling they are right. Everything about the place screams Hawaiian culture. The lobby is very well done and the courtyard area is a small tropical paradise on its own. There are immaculate gardens, tons of lounge chairs, a Tiki Bar, a Tiki Grill for a quick meal, the Tiki Terrace restaurant for more elaborate food offerings and an outdoor stage where there was always something going on. The hotel's resident performer, Rudy Akino, performed there six nights a week and was a pleasure to watch. While he and his band were great at performing Hawaiian tunes, they had no problem taking other types of music and giving it a Hawaiian feel. Rudy always made the audience feel welcome and he is one of the things we missed most when we had to leave. What really makes the KBH so great is the staff, which is as close to flawless as they come. The front desk was very friendly and accomodating when we wanted to switch rooms and that "guest first" mentality was shared by everyone we encountered. Every staff member we came across was more than eager to offer help or just smile and say "Aloha" as we passed. All hotels should send their staffs to the KBH for training because they are THAT good. The farewell song and lei distribution almost brought tears to my eyes because by the time our stay was done, we really did feel like family. At first we didn't want to stay but when it came time to go, it was like everyone had to be dragged out kicking and screaming because they loved the place so much, ourselves included. Complaints are few. The breakfast buffet in the Mixed Plate restaurant was a little lackluster- the food offerings were average at best, as was the quality of the food. The convenience store was pretty lousy- there were more souveniers and hard liquor than stuff that you go to a convenience store to buy. And there is that problem with some of the hotel rooms being pretty lousy... But as long as you get a good room, the KBH is a wonderful place. We'll definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the KBH!”
Reviews.Author: MauiMama643
Reviews.Content: Aloha All! I just wanted to let everyone know how much I enjoyed staying at the KBH last week. From start to finish, everything was wonderful. The location was perfect - right on the beach and a short walk to a very nice shopping and dining area. The grounds are gorgeous and very well kept. We could see the ocean from our room. The room was great too, spacious with a sitting area and a large lanai. The welcome breakfast was great with the helpful tips and entertainment. We were lucky enough to be there for the Aloha Festival and got to participate in that. We also enjoyed the nightly shows while dining outside. We had fun taking craft classes and getting to know other guests and staff. Everyone was very friendly and warm. We loved the little touches - cookies and flowers on the beds at night, and the notes that were left. They really do make you feel like you are part of the ohana. The KBH is a truly wonderful place to stay and very hard to leave. It was hard not to cry during the goodbye ceremony. I chose to stay here based on what I had heard and read about it, and I hope others will do the same after reading this - you will be very glad you did! Many many thanks for making this vacation special!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time!”
Reviews.Author: Doug_Car
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the KBH Oct 5-12. We had a wonderful time. Our rooms were upgraded from garden view to partial ocean view in the Kaua'i wing. They were as I expected from reading the reviews. Nothing fancy, but who spends their time in their rooms when in paradise? They are still in the process of upgrading the rooms in this wing. We travelled with 2 teenagers, I child and grandma, and there was enough to interest all of us! The classes were excellent, (my 11 year old loved the passport program and all the little goodies he received) we did the Garden Walk (great job Mikala!), the printing, lei making, and Ukelele lessons. The teenagers LOVED the close proximity to the mall (Whalers' Village). It was handy, there is a little food court there that has a McDonalds to fill them up with reasonably priced food. However the burgers were excellent at the Tiki Hut, especially the terriyaki burger with grilled pineapple! The buffet breakfast had enough choices to make all 6 of us happy (Mixed plate). The drinks were amazing at the Tiki bar....a must try is the Kaanapali Flow, dessert and drink mixed into one! We did Sunshine Helicopters, the road to Hana (all the way around, quite the adventure!), and the Maui Ocean Centre. The helicopter was unforgettable (thanks Glenda!) and we were able to purchase a DVD of our flight.. a must do trip!! I would recommend going to the welcome breakfast, will give you a feel for what activities you should do. We spent our last night at a luau at the Sheraton next door ( wed and fri only). Preferred seating is the way to go. They put on an excellent show, with a firedancer as the finale. The weather and the beach were perfect, with the waves and the undertow creating excellent body surfing for the kids, entertained them for hours. We have travelled many places, and I was a little worried that Maui might be a little too commercialized for us, however, we had a FANTASTIC time and would definately recommend KBH as the place to stay so you don't get that "part of the crowd" feeling. P.S Rudy (who played with Don Ho) at KBH steals the show!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: raelarder1976
Reviews.Content: Just come back from week long honeymoon at the hotel and had fantastic time! Hotel is in GREAT location - Kaanapali Beach is beautiful with great snorkelling a Black Rock. If the sand is not your thing don't worry - it's steps away from the beautiful pool and gardens of the hotel so you can nip back and forth. Only bad point to note is that the hire of beach cabanas, umbrellas and sun loungers is not free for hotel guests - would of been nice to get them as perks of being guests - think other hotels along the beach got them free. Food - breakfast was in with our deal - all you can eat buffet with PLENTY to choose from - we ate at hotel restaurant twice - reasonable price and EXCELLENT food (HAVE THE LAMB CHOPS!!!!) - only downside is the nightly Hawaiian show playing on the terrace next to you (!) - if you like that sort of entertainment then this hotel will be a hit - we're not really into it but the older folks enjoyed it! The great thing about the location of the hotel is the fact that it's right next door to The Whalers Village. A collection of shops and restaurants so it's easy to take a quick walk down the beach and have some cocktails and dinner in some different restaurants rather than driving to Lahainna for dinner (although I'd recommend this also but sometimes you want to both have a drink) We were slightly disappointed with our room - they gave us an upgrade to an ocean view because they had no rooms with king beds in - we got two queen beds and a great view of the gardens and the ocean but for our honeymoon I had visions of us snuggling up in a huge KING bed rather than squashing into a queen one and using the second bed as a dumping ground for clothes etc! They did however give us a free bottle of champagne as a newlywed celebration which was nice but a King bed was what I really wanted! OVERALL - Great location, nice big rooms, very clean but in need of a lick of paint - if comes down to the usual though - if you want the Ritz you'll have to pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “KBH is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: robcandia
Reviews.Content: We just got back on Sunday and I couldn't wait to write a quick review. The KBH is wonderful. It was clean, comfortable, and convenient. Every staff member we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful. We booked a beachfront room and was upgraded to a suite. The view was spectacular (see pictures). It's not the Four Seasons, but it was still very nice. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Should have listened to the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: studiorack
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of reading prior to booking this stay and I should have listened to the negative reviews. I'm very suspicious of the reviews that are stellar for this place, since I think that the best case stay could only get a three star at best. I booked us at the hotel 6 months in advance after looking at the pictures on their website and reading reviews. I decided to go with their best room. Upon arriving, we found ourselves at a place that is falling apart and had been kept in such poor condition over many years, that doubt that there is any way for them repair the place, other than just taking a wrecking ball to it. Book anywhere else and you'll get a better place. When we arrived, we found the hallways dark, dirty and the walls stained. The rooms were no better. The carpets were disgusting, furniture falling apart and the bathroom was dirty. I was not about to spend our hard earned vacation time and money in that room. I told the front of the situation and they were non responsive, they just didn't care. I promptly called another hotel and made arrangements, even though I would have to pay full price there. I would have saved myself a lot of money had I booked with the other hotel instead 6 months ago. I paid the price for taking a chance with the KBH. We went to the front, told them of the problem and the manager told me that they would not refund the required advance payment when I first booked this place. The assistant manager's response was that if they refunded the deposit to every unhappy customer, then they would go out of business. So in other words, they have our money and tough luck to us. Don't risk losing your hard earned money on them, book anywhere else on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: SmPenny
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review the day after coming home from Maui as I was very apprehensive about the hotel based on all of the reviews I read, and wanted to give future travelers my opinion on this hotel and the ones around it. Normally I stay in Marriotts, Hiltons, Hyatts, etc. for business and can be a bit of a hotel snob, but I did not want to pay a lot of money for a room I would basically be sleeping in, so my decision for this hotel was primarily based on price, and secondarily on location - I wanted to be on Kaanapali south of the Sheraton and Black Rock. Overall the hotel was not as bad as I was expecting - I was expecting it to be very run down. I had requested to be in one of the newer wings and stayed in both the Lanai and the Maui - our requested king was not available when we checked in around 10PM but we were moved as soon as one was available. The Maui wing was definitely the nicer of the two in my opinion. The hotel lobby is a bit run down and the rooms are not the Four Seasons, but for the price and location it was great and I have no complaints. I did not smell any of the mustiness that we heard about. The bellman are willing to bring your bags to your room, so if you are in a wing without elevators I would have them brought to your room, probably worth the tip. Originally my plan had been to "sneak" into the pools at the other hotels but ended up using only the KBH hotel and beach - in the grand scheme of things a lawn chair is a lawn chair, and the other pools were quite crowded and had more children. The beach in front of the KBH is amazing - the widest stretch - if you are at the Marriott or the Hyatt you cannot even really lay on the beach - at high tide the water was going up to the plants at the top of it, and the Hyatt's beach was very rocky on top of that. The Hyatt had the best lobby of the hotels on the beach, I had expected to be sorry I was not at the Marriott as I had stayed there before, but it is looking run down and I was happy to be at the KBH instead. The cabanas on the beach at all of the hotels are rented out by the various resorts and associated travel groups, and were well worth the price (about $20 for half the day). There were no problems getting lawn chairs at the pool at any times of the day and the water was a great temperature. The grounds of the hotel were beautifully maintained and while they may not have been as elaborate as the other hotels, it was still nice to look at. We had garden rooms in both wings but since they overlook the pool area, we did have some ocean view way in the distance (at least in the buildings we were in, the doors into the room faced the back of the hotel). The bathrooms were small but were ok for the two of us (a couple), and maid service brought us extra towels when we needed them. The staff was friendly but not overly so. We went for the valet parking since it was only $2 a day more than regular parking and I also think that was worth it - made things easy on us. We did not eat at the hotel restaurants aside from the Tiki Bar and Grill at the pool - the burgers were excellent as were the blue hawaii's. I had the best steak of my life at the Westin's outdoor restaurant. As far as things to do - this hotel is close enough to Black Rock that you can walk to snorkeling, to Whalers Village for meals and shopping, and scuba, etc. is offered (for additional fees). Originally I had wanted to stay at the Westin and their grounds were beautiful, but I think when I return to Maui I would stay at the KBH again, with perhaps one or two nights at the Westin to splurge. Now, if you are looking for the frills of room service, in-room internet, and being catered to the way the Intercontinental, Ritz-Carlton, Four Seasons, etc. do, I would recommend the Westin or perhaps the Hyatt (if you don't want beach. If you are looking to explore the island, enjoy the beach and pool, be on a great stretch of beach, and are ok with a basic hotel room, this is honestly the place to be. I don't think you'll be sorry, and if you are horrified with your room, it does seem that the management will move you and try to accomodate your requests.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel”
Reviews.Author: aajj00
Reviews.Content: What a truly memorable experience that will last a lifetime! Every moment of our stay at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel was fantastic. We were pleased with our room and the tropical garden that allowed you to have space to spread out on a lawn chair - no other local hotel offered this feature. The hotel is located on absolutely the best part of Ka'anapali Beach if not all of Maui: wide stretches of soft-golden sand, black rock with terrific snorkeling opportunities and the nightly tiki torch lighting ceremony. We thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast orientation which was valuable to learn more about the hotel and staff in an entertaining fashion. The nightly shows were a feature we could not live without especially since the other hotels do not offer such Hawaiian-style performances: nice music, talented hula dancers, and funny jokes. Matter of fact, guests from other hotels ended up at KBH! We loved the breakfasts and dinners that were served at The Mixed Plate. It was such a great variety every day at a reasonable price, we did not think of going to dinner at any other place. We generally like to explore and try different local restaurants during our travels, but this is the first for us to stick to The Mixed Plate every evening. The most rewarding part about staying at KBH was interacting with the friendly staff while participating in many of the daily cultural activities. The staff made it so interesting to learn about the different native arts! ALWAYS keep the cultural garden walk on the agenda along with all the other wonderful classes that are great for all ages to gain more knowledge about the Hawaiian culture! It was hard to say good-bye, but it was ended in a lovely gesture by having the kukui lei ceremony before our departure

Reviews.Title: “Musty, ugly rooms.”
Reviews.Author: carlareno
Reviews.Content: Rooms looked like a Ramada....cheezy furniture and horrible musty smell. Tiny bathrooms and no bathtubs! We were in Hawaii for a week so we had several VERY heavy bags so being placed on the 2nd floor was not "fun" because they had no elevators. Pool was just "so-so". The Front Desk staff was very nice, however. Concierge was helpful once we flashed some cash - she was actually surprised that we were going to tip her! Probably indicative of the type of clientele they get there! Location was pretty good - convenient to shops and golf.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: AlohaGirl06
Reviews.Content: We just go back from our marriage/honeymoon in Hawaii and I miss it already! The hotel was wonderful. Don't stay here if you're looking for a really fancy hotel. This hotel is old, but really has a "Hawaiian" feel to it. The hotel doesn't have that commercial look or feel to it the other hotels around it have. There is beautiful landscaping and gardens on the property. This is an older hotel and needs some updating, but who goes to Hawaii and stays in their room? It was just perfect for us. Tiki Bar and Grill is great and so convenient. The mixed plate breakfast isn't that great, but the Tiki Terrace restaurant is excellent! The nightly entertainment was great, the store on the property was so convenient. They also have a little shop in the hotel with some cute things in there. After a long day of sight seeing and sun bathing it was nice to come back to the quiet, peaceful KBH and have a drink from the Tiki Bar and dinner at the Tiki Terrace. The location is great. You can walk to many restaurants and do all the shopping you could imagine, without even moving the car from the garage. We had a blast! I would 100% recommend this hotel and I will be staying here again on my next visit to Hawaii. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “most amazing trip-”
Reviews.Author: missyourkiss26
Reviews.Content: my family and i had traveled to maui during spring break. it was a gift to my parents for their 30th wedding anniversery. My Father is 50, Mother 47, and me and my sisters being 14, 18, and 26. We all loved it. The hotel is older, but in excellent shape. we barely spent any time in our rooms, but our rooms were very nice. The cabanna boys were very nice and extremly helpful. I would recomend taking surfing lessons {which can be booked at the hotel, down at the trilogy hut} I would highlyyy recomend this hotel, wether your an older or younger couple, with or without children. = ]

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl26
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the KBH for 5 nights, Westin 1 night, Hana 1 night, and Grand Wailea 1 night (Don't stay there!). We loved Kaanapali Beach Hotel!! The staff was warm, sweet, helpful, entertaining and they made you feel like that was your home throughout your entire stay. This hotel had THE MOST HAWAIIAN feel more than any other hotels we stayed at. We learned so much about the culture, dance, crafts, language,etc. This hotel offers more activities than any other hotel. The checking out ceremony was so cute! Three or so of the Hawaiians teach you a lesson on how to make these "nut" leis (from trees) and then they give you a lei and a huge hug! I loved the grounds at KBH. They were so relaxing. The rooms are very "basic" and the pool is very "basic" but the beach is absolutely beautiful. I would recommend splitting your stay up between here and the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel actually...”
Reviews.Author: caramela
Reviews.Content: KBH is a fun hotel. Staff is VERY friendly but don't be fooled its an old establishment. So if you're looking for luxury you won't find it here... However, I had a wonderful time at this hotel and I would go back because despite the fact that its old, you feel so comfortable here that your room doesn't matter. Believe me, we then went on to stay in Oahu at the HHV (very VERY upper class hotel) and we wished we'd never left KBH! KBH made me feel welcome from the very first day and the staff are wonderful. They made our honeymoon memorable. When we left Maui we were really sad... oh and the beach here is amazing. We went to Big Beach and it didn't even compare to KBH's beach... plus there is black rock right there for snorkeling. Room is very clean... pillows are not so great and bed kind of uncomfortable BUT its hard to complain when you're having such a great time otherwise. Also, they really do everything to get you oriented on your first day. We were able to do all the excursions we wanted and they had all the information and we never once had any problems. I love KBH! I'd go back again and again...and I will because I loved Maui!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: zoraM
Reviews.Content: I think the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel really exemplifies the spirit of Aloha that pervades Hawaii. The staff are not just friendly in a "it's my job to be friendly" way -- they truly seem to care about the well-being of their guests. The rooms are clean, well-appointed, and--at least in the Lanai wing--not at all worn-out or threadbare. Yes--it's not the Westin or Sheraton that are on either side. It is, for my dollar, a better value. Why spend $500 a night for flamingos in the hotel pond when you can get the best beach on the island, friendly service, and real Aloha for a fraction of the price?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: KrazyZippy
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon, in part, in Maui at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel( We went to Waikiki first but will skip that next time). When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted warmly by the friendly staff and quickly checked in. We were escorted to our room by a very friendly bell man and were pleasantly surprised by our accomodations. Top floor ocean view overlooking the beautiful grounds. We had read many reviews about this hotel being outdated and we found just the opposite to be true. The hotel decor was very nice, the room was clean and the view was beautiful. We enjoyed the balcony at night where we could listen to the music from the stage below where there is a free show every night. We ate every morning at the mixed plate and a few times at the Tiki grill. Both were excellent. Make sure you go to the welcome breakfeast when you get there, lots of info about activities. The staff was wonderful and they really do treat you like family. We will definitely go back there again and would highly recommend it. Hampden, Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “Great Hawaiian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlekimmer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for a week prior to cruising the islands. I loved the hotel. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice and spacious. We had everything that we needed. The hawaiian cookies on our pillows at night was a very nice touch. The hotel had great free activities planned. We did some weaving with palms, a cute quick craft. We also enjoyed the nightly music and hula show. The dancers were fun to watch and the musicians very entertaining. We really felt the location of the hotel was perfect. Down by the beach there was a sidewalk path that took you to all the other hotels at Kaanapali beach. We often walked the path to shop or dine at other restaurants. We had a rental car as well and also drove to places such as Lahaina, The road to Hana and Haleakala. It really was a great place to stay. Family oriented, friendly helpful staff. It was not a fancy, ritzy place but it had everything we needed. If I were to return to Maui I would stay at The Kaanapali Beach Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: aelyn
Reviews.Content: I was a little leary of staying here after I read the reviews of the hotel on-line. I think you either love this hotel or you don't. We stayed in the Molokai wing (for non-smokers) which is a pretty old wing. Our room was fine, pretty clean overall. But because the hotel is old the bed is super firm and very uncomfortable. I did ask about softer beds and they promptly gave us an egg crate to put on it. We also found it very noisy. The nightly show could be heard easily from the inside of our room, normally I wouldn't mind but we brought our 2-year-old so we had to go to bed on her schedule. We could also hear the neighbors coming and goings, conversations, and their TV. The food at the buffet is okay for breakfast. I would use the voucher (if you have them) at the Tiki Terrace instead. The best part was the pool for our toddler. She loved swimming in the shallow end which is all the whale's tail. I was expecting the staff to be more friendly than they were, based on the website and other peoples reviews. I found them to be friendly with eachother rather than the hotel guests. This didn't really bother me but it was interesting to note. Many of the other guests we spoke with liked the hotel and come back year after year. I heard they upgrade your room but if you want non-smoking the rooms are all the same except for the views. I would rather stay at a place which is more comfortable than my own home. I really looked forward to my own bed and clean shower when I came home. Next time we will stay a different hotel/resort.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Act was great!”
Reviews.Author: ksalmon
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was very much in our style. It was very nice with well-manicured grounds, right on the beach. The staff was very friendly and the entire atmosphere made us feel wanted. It was not a super-plush, super perfect, super expensive place like many of the hotels in that area. It was a bit older, not quite as modern and one could see areas of design that would probably be redone today if they could. We had a corner room overlooking the ocean. We thought it was quite fine and were very happy with it. The deal we had with breakfast included at the mix plate, or substantial discounts at the Tiki Terrace, were well-suited to our family with two young girls who liked picking from the buffet for their breakfasts On to the magic show... Included was a breakfast on one of our first two days, The breakfast was even better than the Tiki Terrace or the Mixed Plate I thought. The purpose was for the concierge to let you know what things you might consider doing while you were on Maui. Very useful I thought. The last part of this was to let Jody the Magician come on stage and give a taste of the show he put on every night. My girls had never seen magic before and I was unsure of the effect on them. I quizzed them later and they were ambivalent about it. I had thought that if they showed amazement or keen interest I would take them to the show even though it would be nearly $200 for our family. (It does include a very nice dinner, some drinks, and dessert.) Jody had a habit of hanging out in the hotel lobby afterwards as it turned out. I approached him and he was very friendly and affable. We talked about this and he encouraged me to see the show. His show was quite good I thought. But what made it really special was the way he got everyone involved. And I think he gets all of the kids in the audience up on stage at one point or another. He seems to really enjoy it. And that helps us enjoy it. But getting to see our kids up in front of everyone and helping him perform magic tricks was worth the price of admission. I wish we had had a camera at that moment. At the end our youngest was given a lei of about 20 animal balloons. She was told in front of everyone that these were magic balloons and if she put them under her pillow and one of them popped that she would receive $1 for each popped balloon. And then I was given a big wink. The girls were quite excited by the whole thing and very happy. We bought a magic set on the way out and we have been very happy with that as well. If you are in the area and have young kids, you should definitely take them to see this show! Kids under 5 were free! Bring a camera. Jody will make you and your kids feel like the center of attention!

Reviews.Title: “KBH made our first Maui trip unforgettable.”
Reviews.Author: NancyfromGoldrush
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week on Maui at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We had booked the Best of the Beach package. We got a fabulous ocean view room with lanai, daily buffet breakfast(which we only used two days since we had to leave the hotel very early in the morning for our trip to Hana(a lot like Hwy 1 to us Californians), drive to Haleakala to see the sunrise(don't miss it), and the very early morning snorkel trip out of Maalea(would leave from Kaanapali if we were to do it again), our car, lunch around the pool, tickets to the Maui Ocean Center(a great aquarium-go in the morning before the crowds), 3 days snorkel rental or a covered lounger for two, a great backpack filled with snacks as well as plates, glasses, silverware, cheeseboard and knife, wine opener, wooden salt and pepper shakers, and fabric tablecloth and napkins. We will use this again on many vacations. Waiting in our room-Lanai 549, one of the newer units( I read many reviews on Trip Advisor before we left, so I requested this building)-was a plate with pineapple, cheese, macadamia nuts, and grapes. But the best part was the people that work there. Everyone greeted us with "aloha". KBH might be a large hotel, but it feels like family. Thank you to everyone who works so hard to keep it that way. This hotel also has many free programs to participate in and a nice hula show each evening which we could hear from our lanai. Would I book the Best of the Beach again? No, but we can't wait to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hawaiwn Family Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sparkleworks
Reviews.Content: If we ever go to Maui again, we won't look for another place to stay. We have 5 and 7 year old girls, and everybody had a wonderful time at the hotel. Our girls loved to learn hula dance and making leis and lau printing, and they simply loved to find plumeria flowers in the hotel garden every morning. The whole family enjoyed the nightly hula shows. Food at Tiki Terrace and Tiki Grille is great, and tropical drinks at Tiki Bar are ones to remember. Everything quiets down at 10 pm at the hotel, but you can walk to Whaler's village to have more fun if you want. The beach is wonderful and not crowded, and Black Rock, one of the best snorkeling places in Maui, is within 2 minutes of walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a hotel in maui should be”
Reviews.Author: mamadwarf
Reviews.Content: This hotel truly is "the most hawaiian hotel". The people are wonderful and friendly. There is an orientation breakfast the first day that is fun and informative and has a wonderful breakfast besides! They are super helpful in booking day trips and outings and by day 2, you feel like you just got home when you arrive after a day of "doing hawaii". I read that the pool was small and I suppose it is compared to the monstrosities of other hotels but we loved it. The food is great, the grounds are immaculate, the rooms were cleaned well. We stayed in the molokai tower for 6 days then we were supposed to go home but just couldnt bring ourselves to leave so we booked 2 more days! Then we were in the newer section and it was a bit nicer but still the same great service and care. They have a going away ceremony that is very touching and you really feel like you are leaving friends behind. We will stay at this hotel any time we go back to Maui. We loved the people and the place so much. The valet guys are wonderful too! We even brought them pizza one night! They know all the best places for everything and really made our trip a blast! If you want a nice, friendly hotel that is clean, with great food and sincere, hard working people, this is place for you! If you want to be lost in the crowds and the shine of a glossy hotel, go somewhere else. Here, it is family. There, you are just another face.

Reviews.Title: “KBH Rules!”
Reviews.Author: Maui-sunset
Reviews.Content: Aloha everyone! We just wanted to say that we've traveled around the world and no where else have we felt so welcomed by such a capable staff. This hotel definitely accomplishes their goal of weaving Hawaiian heritage and local lifestyles. Making lei's, learning hula, and lau painting are experiences we wouldn't have found elsewhere. Paddling an outrigger canoe and snorkeling right off the beach was just incredible. These folks are the best! Oh by the way, Alan Caban has to be the best concierge we've ever met. He was always willing to go beyond the call of duty and extend efforts to accommodate our every need. Call him if you need anything. Mahalo and we will definitely be back to visit again and we'll bring our lei's with us for a new nut.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Hotel reflects true meaning of Aloha and Ohana”
Reviews.Author: LibraLin
Reviews.Content: Ka'anapali Beach Hotel was fantastic! We felt like royalty and never wanted to leave!! The KBH Ohana were incredible! We learned about Hawaiian culture and traditions and found a true and heartfelt respect. They touched our hearts! The accomodations are first-rate and the grounds are stunning. The beach is unbelievable. The Tiki Bar and Tiki Grill were scrumptious. Their Sunday Champagne Brunch at the Tiki Terrace is out of this world! There is no need to find any other place to stay on Maui - this is the best! Thank you to the KBH Ohana!

Reviews.Title: “Maui Waui!”
Reviews.Author: jamesbearfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely true to its initial billing. It fosters its Hawaiian roots with live music and dance. It also has a great staff. From the maintanance workers to the the guest agents, everyone is quick to shoot over a smile, a "good morning" or a proverbial "Mahalo!". We definitely plan on coming back in the near future. On the flipside, if I had one complaint it was that Room 131 of the hotel's north end is extremely loud and should be converted to an exercise room. The room is right next to the unit's staircase (there is no elevator) and at all hours of the day you hear people 'checking out of their hotel', so to speak. You hear boom, boom, boom as people bounce their suitcases down the staircase. But, we're from L.A. so noise isn't all that new to us. We just didn't want it during our 8-day honeymoon stay. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: GoLions12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the KBH for a week August 13th-19th. We stayed in the Kaua'i wing and were very pleased with our room. They had actually upgraded us to a partial ocean view. The balcony views were beautiful. Moutains on the one side and ocean on the other. The room was very clean and the cleaning staff did a wonderful job each day of our stay. No complaints. The beachfront seemed to be the best out of the whole beach. Very spacious. Never felt crowded. I would definitely recommend the welcome breakfast. We won a free ticket to the magic show there. It was fantastic! Great food, drinks, entertainment. It was worth seeing for sure! We had the daily breakfast with our room. I would recommend the Mixed Plate there if you're happy with fruit for breakfast. For the rest of the stay we used the vouchers at the Tiki Terrace restaurant breakfast...excellent food and staff! Out of all the restaurants we visited, the Tiki Terrace was the best. We ate dinner there twice. They actually had the most reasonable prices as well. We felt really welcomed there and we would love to get back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: BRF
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after our initial stay in Oahu on our honeymoon. Our only disappointment was in our room. Although it was in the older section, that still didn't bother us. We were next to the elevator shaft which was quite noisy, and the air conditioner wasn't the best, but everything else at the KBH was absolutely amazing. You can't ask for a better staff. We both cried at the going away ceremony they have the morning you leave. We were touched by the sincerety of the staff, and how quickly they make you feel a part of the KBH family. The grounds were amazing, the entertainment was very well done and all the little extras (turn down service with cookies at night, poi making demonstration, hula show, lei making, etc.) are not offered by any other hotel on any of the islands. If we're lucky enough to make it back to Maui, there will be absolutely no question where we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: kinca06
Reviews.Content: We were totally impressed with the staff and accomadations at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. They go the extra mile to may your stay comfortable and try to make you feel like family by the end of your stay. Our room was spacious and the grounds were great. Upon our arrival, our room was not ready on time, so they put us in an even better room and gave us free drink and dessert coupons for the hotel restaurant. This was our first trip to Maui and an anniversary trip as well. They are so nice! From nightly turn down service, to complimentary bottle of champange, the Kaanapali was a treat!!! We hated to leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii_Lovers
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel made our trip to Maui July 18-27, 2006 a truely wonderful experience. We have stayed at the Westin and the Sheraton in the past and your hospitality and Hawaiian charm far surpassed anywhere we have ever stayed. This was my seven year old daughter's first trip to Maui. Your children's passport program and free classes were the highlight of her trip. She tells everyone about the nice "hula lady" at the front desk that taught her sand art and hula dancing. The free breakfast and presentation on things to do while in Maui our first morning was very helpful in planning our week. We loved the Kapanaha Magic Dinner Show and the Tiki Restaurant was our favorite of all the restaurants we tried on the island. Also, the free nightly hula show was wonderful. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Travelers425
Reviews.Content: We made our second trip to Hawaii this spring. We loved the KBH so much the first time that five years later we stayed there again. We were very well accomodated. We asked for ground floor rooms, but they were not available the first night. But the desk clerk was able to arrange our move to the ground floor for the remainder of our visit. We were treated very nicely in any request we had. They were helpful in planning our activities and excursions. We thoroughly enjoyed the nightly show with Rudy and the dancers. We liked the beach being a few steps from our room. If the opportunity arises again for a trip to beautiful Maui, the KBH will definitely be our destination!! We give it 5 stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Keyla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the KBH from August 3rd to 8th while on our honeymoon. The reviews on Trip Advisor were mixed, but we decided to take a chance on the KBH. Iâ€™m glad that we didâ€”we were not disappointed. We paid $200 for a partial ocean-view room with a king bed and complimentary breakfast in the Mixed Plate restaurant. If you do some research you will find that other hotels on this magnificent beach start at over $300 for a mountain or garden view room. We were hoping for a free upgrade as this is promised to honeymooners if space is available; however at this time the hotel was fullâ€”take note of this if you are hoping for a free upgrade. We were glad that we booked the partial ocean room rather then the garden view room. After reading trip advisor reviews when I booked through our travel agent I requested a room in the Maui or Lanai wings. When we arrived at KBH they had noted this and we were placed in a first floor room in the Lanai wing. Our room was very big and spaciousâ€”because we were on the first floor we gained some extra space because the 2nd floor lanais were above our â€œsitting roomâ€� which included a table and day bed. Additionally, we had a lanai outside our room that looked onto the courtyard (and we could see the beach!). Every night the housekeeping staff did a turn-down service and left a flower on the bed with 2 packages of coconut-macadamia nut cookiesâ€”they were very good (apparently at the Marriott you have to request turn-down service). In terms of meals at KBH on your first day you are invited to a â€œWelcome breakfastâ€� where the hotel staff explain some of the fun things to do in the area. It was a buffet breakfast and it was very good. We had complimentary meal tickets for the Mixed Plate restaurant for the rest of our stay. We used 1 set to order a boxed lunch for our trip to the Road to Hanaâ€”we were actually surprised by how good the lunch wasâ€”it hit the spot! We used another set to go to the Tiki Terrace Restaurant for the Sunday Champagne Brunch. The tickets count for a $12.50 credit towards the cost of the buffet ($31.50)â€”definitely worth it! The buffet was VERY expansive and included a variety of foods. We went at 10:00 a.m.; however I would suggest going a bit later as there are many delicious lunch foods (roast beef, egg rolls, stir fry etc.) and great desserts! You definitely wonâ€™t need lunch and youâ€™ll only want a small dinner. The Tiki Grill was great for a quick meal or snack. The beach outside the hotel is amazing. It is the widest stretch of beach along the Kaâ€™anapali Beach (those staying at the Hyatt and Marriott have just a sliver!). It is also only a 3 minute walk from Black Rockâ€”a great snorkelling spot. The waves arenâ€™t 10-12 feet high as another reviewer suggested; however they are powerful and you do need to be careful. If you are going snorkelling I would suggest using a noodle or life jacket in combination with flippers to make the swim easier. Some additional charges you should be aware of: $8 a day for self-parking or $10 for valet parking (plus tip of course) and $1.25 a day for the safe (all of the hotels we stayed at in Hawaii charged for the safe and this was the cheapest.. you can also store your valuables at the front desk for free; however it is nice to have your money etc. in the room for easy access). The KBH is within driving distance of the Road to Hana and Mt. Haleakala. Both are well-worth the drive and shouldnâ€™t be missed. The concierge at KBC recommended that we leave at 6 a.m. for the Road to Hana and we are glad that we took her advice as we were in front of the tour buses which made the ride more enjoyable. We also went up Mt. Haleakala to see the sunrise. The concierge at KBC recommended that we leave no later then 3 a.m. This was the perfect time to leave as we got to the top of the mountain just before the crowds arrived so we got a front row spot to watch the sunriseâ€¦remember to take jackets/sweaters and wear pants as it is cold (45 degrees in mid August!). We were worried that the drive up 10,000 feet would be difficult; however it is well-marked and easy for a good driver. It is said that the KBH hotel is Mauiâ€™s most Hawaiian Hotelâ€”after staying there we believe this claim. The staff are almost entirely of Hawaiian descent and there really is a Hawaiian feel to the hotel. We found the staff to be VERY friendly and helpful and very sincere. The closing ceremony where they present you with leis etc. is heart-warming and the icing on the cake. In closing, if you are used to staying at the Ritz this may not be the place for you to stay; however if you are looking for a clean, safe place to stay at an affordable price I would highly recommend the KBH. If you are planning on spending a lot of your time at the hotel then you might like to pay the higher prices at the Westin, Marriott, or Hyatt for their beautiful grounds, pools with caves etc. ; however if you are a couple that likes to travel you will spend minimal time at your hotel so you will appreciate paying less for a place to sleep and leave your bags. Overall, a great choice that we donâ€™t regret. We were sad to leave and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the KBH”
Reviews.Author: NG13
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the KBH, and had a great time. We went to Waikiki first and then flew onto Maui for some relaxation. When we arrived, we were told by the manager that our ocean front room would not be available until the next day because they had double booked. Obviously we were very disappointed, but we didn't cause a fuss because the manager was very apologetic, friendly and very accomodating. He told us he would be putting us in an ocean view room on the top floor for one night and would then arrange for our things to be moved the next day to an ocean front room. He refunded us the difference between the ocean view and the ocean front and gave us a voucher for a complementary dinner in the Tiki restaurant for all of us. The ocean view room was ample big enough for all of us (2 adults and one 4 year old) and the view was amazing. The next day we moved to our ocean front room. The swimming pool was great, it had a lovely shallow end for our daughter to play in. The beach was also great, but be careful of the waves - while we were there, they were about 8-10 foot high and very powerful. There are signs everywhere saying don't swin in the sea (but everyone did) and there were a number of people walking around with broken shoulders / arms and ankles as they had been caught out by the stength of the sea. Reception even left a message on everyones phone one day warning of high waves and advising not to go in the sea. If you have small children, don't leave them on their own, the tide will quite easily pull them and then knock them flying. Needless to say, our daughter only paddled, we didn't allow her to go in. As I said before, the rooms are big, comfortable and very clean. We had no complaints. The food at the Tiki restaurant was great, and it even had a kids menu. The food at the Tiki Grill was also good, although a lot of fried food. Having said that, the cheese burgers were delicious. We had a great time and basically were a bit lazy in that we mainly spent our days either by the pool or walking along the beach and the nights trying out various restarants. Had we been there for longer, we would probably have hired a car, but we had to take into account our 4 year old, who was already exhausted from all the activities and travelling we did in Waikiki, Oahu. We would certainly go to this hotel again if we ever got the chance. One final point, we chose this hotel based on the good reviews posted on this site and glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at KBH”
Reviews.Author: Annielinz
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from a week stay at the Kaanapali Beach hotel and we found it to be a wonderful experience. We were a little apprehensive due to some reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is older and not "plush" by any means but it filled the bill for us. The grounds were well kept and spacious. There is ample shade in the afternoon to sit under the trees to read and enjoy the wonderful weather. The pool is small, but for a family with small children it is great area to spend the day. The beach is incredible. Lots of sand and no rocks and on most days the water is calm- but there is a undertow, so be careful. The best kept secret is the Tiki bar and may I recommend the Mai Tai's!! My sister and I tried quite a few at the various bars and resturants in Whalers Village and by far the ones at our little Tiki bar ranked the best!!! Our plan included the comp breakfast- now it wouldn't win any culinary awards- but it was filling and tasty. The hotel is located a short walking distance from other resturants and shopping in Whalers Village. The staff was friendly and the evening turn down and cookies were a very nice surprise. I would definetly return again to KBH!

Reviews.Title: “Was good but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Vicar36
Reviews.Content: The good 1. Good value for Money 2. The pool area was not crowded and we could always get a sun lounger 3. Rooms were very clean and spacious 4. Great location for restaurants 5. Good beach The Bad 1. we stayed 5 nights by the 3rd day the swimming pool was filthy you could not see your feet at the bottom of the pool it was that murky. 2. Everything shuts by 10pm on our last night we tried to get a drinks at 10.05pm but was told no they were closed. 3. They lost our luggage when we fist checked in and i was really annoyed by the dont care attitude it even went to the point where they denied that i had left my cases with them 4. Was annoyed they charged us for dialing free phone numbers from our room what a con 5. The nightly entertainment got a little bit much by the 5th night 6. When trying to book the shuttle to take us to the airport the girl was on the phone to one of her friends she then made we wait 15 minutes while she finished arranging her Saturday night out and outfit !!! Overall was nice but could have been better i would go Maui again at a drop of a hat but would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Loved Kaanapali Beach Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: neeley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and absolutely loved it! The staff was very friendly and accommodating and we found the hotel grounds to be one of the best on Kaanapali Beach. A couple of suggestions to anyone planning a trip to this hotel: 1. Make sure to ask for a room in the renovated section of the hotel. Our travel agent made this request for us and we did get a room in the renovated wing of the hotel. These rooms are much nicer and more updated than the others. 2. Use the breakfast vouchers at the Tiki Terrace as opposed to the Mixed Plate restaurant. Although the breakfast at the Mixed Plate is free with the voucher, the food is really not nearly as good as it is at the Tiki Terrace (each voucher is good for $12.50 at the Tiki Terrace). My husband and I ate their every morning except our very first morning and we really enjoyed it--they even make sure to give you the same table everyday! It was the little touches like this that made the Kaanapali Beach Hotel a great place to stay. I was a little concerned about staying there because of all of the "family friendly" reviews that I had read since it was our honwymoon and you should know that we saw hardly any children at all at the hotel, maybe because school had not let out yet. In the end, I would highly recommend this hotel to other honeymooners and anyone else wanting to relax on one of the most beautiful beaches in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: cherrybop
Reviews.Content: If you read any bad reports about this place,forget them!! Just spent 9 nights of bliss in this wonderful location.The hotel isnt the most modern but its very well kept by the friendly staff who never stop working. This was the best place to have a honeymoon or even get married.Lahaina is just 15mins in a taxi and well worth a visit. If your after late night partying go to Ibiza(Spain) Mr & Mrs Senior (Yorkshire,England)

Reviews.Title: “we loved the kaanapali beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my family just got back for staying 8 days at the kaanapali beach hotel, this was our first time in hawaii, i really think this was our BEST vacation ever, and we WILL go back. this hotel has got every thing you need, and then more. it is close to every place you want to go, if it isnt, they have DOLLAR buses and FREE shuttles that will take you where you need to go. but every thing is WALKING distance. we rode buses to ride the candy train, th e ocean center and the BEST kaanapali beach luau,that was the BEST i have ever seen.so if you go to hawaii you HAVE to seen a KAANAPALI BEACH LUAU.there is not one bad thing, i can say about this trip, everything was beautiful. we can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very family orientated place to stay. Beautiful gardens and an awesome view of the beach. The location is fantastic! The rooms were very old and badly needed renovation. The room smelled musty and was not very clean. The restaurants were also old and dirty, althoug the food at the Tiki Terrace was pretty good (just dont think about the kitchens). The pool was less than stellar...also needed updating. The staff was very friendly and helpful which convinced me to try to get over the dirty room. Eat at the other hotels on the strip and at Whalers Village...and most your time will be on the beach snorkeling. Id go back for a family stay....but bring the lysol!

Reviews.Title: “Experience true Hawaiian spirit at the Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Beach Hotel provides a wonderful glimpse into the Hawaii of old, with modern conveniences to enjoy today. The retro feel doesn't mean a lack of services. On the contrary, customer service was unparalleled. Each employee was sincerely interested in ensuring that our stay at the hotel and in Maui was the best possible. You are made to feel part of a large family. And the evening entertainment accented that intimate feeling as you enjoyed a very personalized show headlined by the amazing Rudy Akino and his band. I would recommend the Kaanapali Beach Hotel to everyone. And, I look forward to many more stays!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: TBEE_9
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending 7 days at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for our honeymoon. Overall I would say you get a good deal for the price and I would consider stay there again provided the price was right. We're 27 and 30 years old. Good Things: 1. The hotel was a bit dated but very authentically Hawaiian. Rooms were large with huge windows and a patio. 2. Almost all of the hotel rooms get treated to a great ocean view so that was also a bonus. 3. It was one of those hotels that really gave great bang for the buck. They even gave you cookies every night before bed. Plus you get free nightly entertainment which was pretty nice. 4. Room was clean. 5. We don't have kids but it would be a good place to bring kids to. They had a lot for them to do. 6. There is a fridge in the room so you can buy your own food or alchol. 7. Good location. A lot of hotels and shopping in the area within walking distance. Bad Things: 1. Rude staff. This is the number one reason I would think long and hard about going back there. I'm generally not a complainer and as a person who has worked in the service industry for a while I usually forgive peoples rudeness as we all have busy or bad days. But it was bad enough at this hotel that if I hadn't paid up front I would have left. For example, we tipped the bellman for bringing up our bags. We had just gotten off the plane so we didn't have much small cash with us. I tipped him with a few dollar bills and gave him 4 quarters to try and add on another dollar. When he left he put the coins on our door lock so they fell everywhere when we opened the door again as almost to embarrass us for giving him change. I felt insulted that he did that so rudely as I was only trying to make up an extra dollar for him. The man who checked us in was also rude. When we asked him a question while checking in he replied maybe I could answer you if the damn phone would stop ringing and then answered and assisted several phone inquiries in the middle of helping us which in turn meant it took us about 20 minutes to check us in. 2. There are not enough check in/out staff and we found they were disorganized. 3. After 9:00PM there is nothing to do. Everyone goes to bed. This might be a plus or a minus depending on the type of person you are. 4. This really has nothing to do with the actual hotel but the traffic to get to Ka'anapali Beach can be quite horrible. The beach is good once you get there but be prepared to sit in traffic for a while (sometime up to an hour to go about 5-7miles).

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel022
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a trip to Hawaii. We stayed on the big island for 5 days & then on Maui for 2 weeks. We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel on Maui, it was wonderful! This is our 4th visit to the KBH hotel and we have never been disappointed. It is listed as "Maui's Most Hawaiian Hotel" and it truely is. You can learn how to hula, make a lei or walk through the garden and learn about the plants & how the hawaiians use them. The hotel staff always calls us by name and does everything in there power to make sure we are having a wonderful stay. Mikala Nolan in guest services always gives us good advise on activities and has always made us feel as if we were apart of their Ohana (family). The hotel sits on one of the best beaches in Maui. We walked down the beach and snorkelled at Black Rock where we swam with the turtles. When we returned we found that the hotel left a tasty fruit plate in our room. Every night with our turn down service we had Macadamian Nut cookies, my husband is hooked on them. In the evening one of our most favorite things to do is to sit in the courtyard and listen to Rudy play and watch the hula dancers. The Tiki Resturant not only had the best macadamian nut pancakes (with hot coconut syrup) but in the evening had some of the best fish that I had tasted on the island. I wish the world would show the "Aloha Sprirt" that the employees show. It would be a world filled with kindness. We are already looking forward to our next trip to Maui and the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “What an experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for 10 days in February, celebrating our 55th wedding anniversary. We first stayed there thirty years ago on our 25th anniversary and have returned to Hawaii every five years since then. This was the fourth time we stayed in this hotel. The wonderful breakfast is a big plus for us, and we will continue to return until we are not able to travel. Their friendliness, information for the rest of the island, their willingness to help in any way that they can is superior to the other places we have stayed. Our room had a full ocean view, was comfortable and convenient. It was in an older part of the building, but very comfortable.. The parking is too expensive, but many things are within walking distance and HEY! it's Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “The best and most hawaiian hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomnlaw
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Beach Hotel ,Maui July 6, 2006 The Kaanapali Beach Hotel lives up to its reputation as the most hawaiian hotel on Maui. It is the place to stay. It is located right on the beach and you can walk to all the shops and restaurants. They are child friendly and have a great kids program where kids five and under eat free. The staff is friendly and makes you feel very welcome and apart of the hotels family. They have a magic show six nights a week that should not be missed. It is entertaining for all ages and has the best three course meal I have ever had. When you leave they have a goodbye ceremony, and give you a kukui nut lei and ask you to bring it back when you return to their hotel. They change one nut for each year you return. That is how they get to know their guests. Although it is not the Sheraton or Westin it is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly...we keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When it's vacation time we look forward to getting away from work in fast-paced Southern California and relaxing. Kaanapali Beach Hotel is the best place to do that. This was our 3rd year in a row at this hotel and we love it more each time. Make sure to bring your beads back each time. They will exchange a brown bead with a white one. This represents each time you are a guest and part of their family. We love the nightly Hawaiian music while sipping mai tai's. The staff is so friendly and several of them have remembered us from our previous trip. If you want a stuffy highrise hotel, this isn't the place. But if you want to experience true Hawaiian hospitality we recommend Kaanapali Beach Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “KBH Best Time Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel! We were impressed with the staff, accomodations, entertainment, and beach access. This was our first trip but we look forwrad to staying there again in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiin Style”
Reviews.Author: duzerma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 1990 and couldn't wait to come back. The hotel is very Hawaiin with hula lessons, lei making and other free cultural/nature acitivities offered. Entertainment every night in the courtyard area. The small touches suchs as orchids on your pillow everynight, cookies too, box of macadamia nuts, and a bottle of champagne in the fridge because it was our anniversary. The welcome breakfast my husband wanted to skip but I am so glad we did it, the whole staff housekeeping included gets up on stage to sing a hawaiin song/welcome. The place is not fancy like upscale high rise glass and chrome places but has a homey atmosphere. The tiki bar is outside and fun to sit and relax, watch the show, watch the sunset. The Tiki restaurant is outside and we ate there every morning for breakfast the food is great, but not cheap. I think you are paying for eating outside. But we loved it. Plus that area the sidewalk runs along the beach and lots of of other hotels restaurants to eat and explore. We ate a Lelainis the first night at the nice restaurant not bar and grill food was good, $40-range. Again you can eat outside which we loved. The Hula Bar and Grill was ok too we started at the bar and then ate outside when we got a table, the entertainment was a little more "hip" than the KBH. Nice change. All in all Maui is great - don't miss the Volcano drive and we ate in Paia at Charleys where Wille Nelson stops in - he is right there breakfast is great!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, but not our room June 13 - June 20 2006”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan05
Reviews.Content: I had to write a review as soon as I got back to help those who were a little nervous about the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. First off I am not a whiner or a complainer just giving you hints and tips. Okay The KBH is a great resort for those who like a slower pace. The photos of the hotel grounds do not do it justice. I was absolutely amazed at the beauty of the trees and other plants in the middle area of the hotel and everywhere around the hotel. Very comfortable atmosphere. There were literally a hundred different lounge chairs around the grounds. After a day at the beach it was so nice to grab a lounge chair and lay under a tree and relax. The pool is heated. Not a bad size either. But mainly for the little toddlers. Everyone I noticed seemed to be having a wonderful time. This is an older hotel. There are cracks in the sidewalks and such but none of that mattered to us. The feeling in the air was so relaxing and comfortable and made us very glad to be in MAUI. If you are one of the many who need a perfect resort where everything is more brand new, that isn't a problem - stay in the Sheraton next door, Kaanapali Ali, Westin etc. They were very nice and had more of a posh feeling with waterfalls, koi ponds and people who will wait on you hand and foot. You can still come and sit on a lounge chair under a tree at the KBH resort. They are welcoming. No one will even notice if you borrow a chair and relax. Very friendly. Okay here goes some complaining... DO NOT STAY IN THE MOLOKAI WING if you have a problem with your back or do not like a very OLD room. We booked late and could not avoid staying in this wing. We were in room 125 bottom floor with a walk out garden area and patio which was a little blessing. The bad news is the mattresses were so bad and very uncomfortable in our room. Also double beds. They must have been at least 25+ yrs. old. Very bad for those like me with bad backs. Also our dresser/entertainment center had three drawers and all THREE drawers were broken. The furniture was outdated and run down, but we didn't notice that so much. The room was VERY CLEAN though. The maids are so wonderful. Very nice, eager to please. The room had a little smell but I planned ahead thanks to previous reviews and brought two vanilla scented glad plug ins and that did the trick. The smell is not their fault. Maui is more humid. They try very hard to make everything perfect for you. Really they do. Also the bathroom was so funny! there is a little 3 1/2 X 6 1/2 foot area with a sliding door where the toilet is and a shower stall. No way two people could fit in that area at the same time. I forgot to take a picture. Outside of that area is the closet (good size) and long vanity area with sink. The refrigerator worked great and we were able to stuff a lot of water bottles, and tons of food in there. We stuck it out and it did not ruin our trip we did not have a bad stay. Just will make sure to get the Maui or Lanai Wing (but I will get to that in a minute) The good news was that I actually liked our garden area and could hear the ocean from our room, which helped relax us and slept better. We could walk straight out and up the back of the wing to the beach. You did have to see the back of the Sheraton but believe it or not I really didn't mind that. Between the breeze, the palms, the little birds it really wasn't bad. However the garden room patios in the Kauai wing were not as good they were more enclosed, you couldn't walk out and view of an old fence and the Whaler is pretty close on that side. The patio furniture in all of the rooms is old and used. But think about it. They are outside in the elements they won't be brand new. But again we didn't mind. We put our towels (you get them from the Triology place by the beach free and clean each day) on the chairs and didn't mind at all. We were close to the laundry area which was extremely helpful and we didn't have to climb stairs because there isn't an elevator. I did talk to three different people who were in the same wing, in the ocean view or partial view rooms and they said their rooms were outdated but they were very happy with them. So that is good news. And the air conditioner worked with a great ceiling fan. Okay more good news for people who demand to stay in the Maui or Lanai Wings. I saw those rooms VERY nice. Nicer new furniture. Big bathroom with tub and shower. The beds are King or Queen. Soft comfortable beds. Everyone seemed to love their rooms. The Kauai Wing is a heck of a lot better than the Molokai Wing but not as new as the other Maui or Lanai wings but still more recently remodeled. We borrowed the hospitality suite before we left on our last day and we were in the Kauai Wing room #159. The room was 100 times better than the Molokai room. Queen soft comfortable beds. No ceiling fan though and the air conditioner switch didn't work. Older furniture but at least there were SEVEN usable drawers with a little cabinet too. Also tub and shower in a huge bathroom. But try not to stay in that room because there was a lot of mold in the corners, etc. The food at the Terrace room was terribly overpriced for what they served. There are many places down the little path like the Hula Grill and many others that for the same price had a better atmosphere and better food. We didn't like the Mixed Plate either. It is okay if you are just too tired to find another place, but if you just take a short 2 min. drive heading north on Hwy 30 - take the Lower Honoapilani Road to the left and at the first right is the Honokowai Marketplace - go down the strip mall until you find Soup Nutz & Java Jazz toward the end (right acrossed from the Maui Dive Shop). This place is sooo good. Omlettes, pancakes, breakfast burritos, bagels, etc. $10.00 and under. Great for lunch and dinner too. In that same strip mall there is Subway, Gyros, Pizza, Mexican food, etc. Our very favorite place to eat though was the Lahaina Fish Company. They take reservations and you will get an ocean side table. Great food. We ate there twice and between the four of us we tried just about everything and it was excellent. Good kids menu. My most expensive dinner there was $23.00 (for me) and it was worth every bite. We liked the Hard Rock Cafe, especially if you are lucky enough to have Phred as our waiter. Yes that is Fred with a PHred. Very funny guy. Also loved Giovani's right at the front of the Kaanapali Parkway entrance on left. And had a wonderful breakfast right acrossed the street at the Mango Bar and Grill. The Tiki Grill at the hotel in the main area next to the pool was great for little lunch items. The Tiki Bar was packed all of the time. Everyone is so helpful and nice. Yes they did have a sweet little singing time every night and those of you who are picky will make fun. But it grows on you and I loved it by the end of our stay. Also on our last day we found this great Beach Market place at the Westin for those with a more expensive taste. They have Starbucks coffee (not a regular Starbucks) and tons of fruit, yogurt parfaits, etc. I wish we would have found that sooner. There is another Market like that on Lower Honoapilani Road right by Boss Frogs and they are a god send for natural foods, etc. For those of us who love Starbucks you will find one at the Lahaina Cannery Mall and one downtown Lahaina on Papalaua St. next to Foodland and McDonalds. Old Lahaina Market place. I am sure there are others but not at the Kaanapali Resorts. Stop at Costco which is right on your way out of Kahului. On Dairy Road (which turns into 380) on the left side of the road passed the fire department and just to the left of Home Depot is Wal-Mart. It is completely hidden from the road so you can't see it from the road. One more thing... We used Pride Charters to do to Molokini they were all about the money and not really into helping you at all. Would not recommend them. I chose them because they had the biggest boat. Unfortunately I still got sick. I would try Pacific Whale Foundation or for those who love smaller rides there are plenty of others. Ask Boss Frog's they are very helpful. On our trip to Molokini no one on our boat saw very many fish. You are way out in the middle of the channel so not really a reef place for fish. But even though I was sick I enjoyed the boat ride and it was pretty cool swimming around the crater. Then we went to "Turtle Town" which is basically anywhere they think there is turtles closer to Wailea. There were about four turtles and some were lucky enough to see them. You are out in a unprotected area so keep an eye on little ones. If you just have to go to Molokini you need to keep an open mind and not be obsessed with seeing fish or turtles, because frankly you might not see any and just enjoy the ride. My husband and 14 yr. old daughter had a great time with Maui Mountain Cruisers with Jim on biking down the crater, etc. Only use that outfit as you are extremely protected the whole time and Jim is a very experienced bike rider. They loved it. I have tons of more information and would love to help anyone with planning. Just email me. You will love MAUI.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love this palce, nice caring, personal touch. My family's 3rd visit.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place, beautiful, the entire staff knows you and remembers you from one visit to the next. Great views from all rooms. YOu never have to leave the resort, but are within walking distance to some of the best snorkling, and shopping and Lahina is just a short drive or trolley away. This has been our 3rd visit and will go again.....

Reviews.Title: “Rooms 20 years out of date”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui and could have had a terrible vacation had we not been able to cancel out of our reservations at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. Think the worst Best Western in west Texas and you'll still be disappointed with what you get. The rooms are long overdue for a renovation, the beds are worn out, the rooms stink and there are bugs at the front desk and even bugs in the soap packages in the room! The grounds are ok but the pool is small when compared to the other hotels right next door. Over priced and over rated. The location on the beach is attractive but there are other options right next door including more modern Westin, Sheraton, Hyatt and The Whaler condos. Don't be swayed by all the reviews about how nice the staff are. They are just as freindly at the other hotels as well. We had originally booked for 8 nights but after staying 1 night we were fortunate enough to be able to switch to the Sheraton Maui at Block Rock. Still had a beach view and for less money! Now that is a great hotel. We were able to have a fantastic Maui experience staying at the Sheraton. It would not have been the case had we remained at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews that I could before I left and have to admit I was a little wary, but figured I was not as picky as some others might have been....BUT I was a bit disappointed that we were put in the Kuai wing---it is the oldest most run down building. The view however, was absolutely AMAZING!! The staff are incredible and the whole feel of the hotel was warm, friendly and relaxing. We left KBH to go on to the Big Island where we stayed at the 5 star Hilton and I have to say both my husband and I agree that the KBH was overall a much better place and much better location despite it being smaller and older. At the KBH we felt like we were in Hawaii, where as at the Hilton we felt we were in any resort that could have been in the middle of the desert. The incredibley genuine staff at KBH can't be beat. The rooms in the Kuai defintiely need updating and hate to say it but i saw a roach which totally creeped me out. So it's a great place to stay, great price, great location and people but definitely INSIST on getting into one of the other buildings. the Kuai needs to be completely renovated. UNBELIEVABLE sunsets!! Great scuba diving at Black Rock and awesome shopping down the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull place to relax.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel last week. We had a awesome time there. The "Hometown Aloha" spirit was great there. We felt very comfortable. relaxed and welcome there. My wife and I spoke on the way home, and decided that we will go the Kaanapali Beach Hotel from now on. Thank you Kaanapali Beach Hotel, Michael and Erin Lake Forest, Ca

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maui and Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Hawaiian Islands before, but the person that went with me this time had not. This was ther first time to Hawaii and our first time to Maui.
