We stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. We were greeted and made to feel like family at the Ka'anapali. The staff were frendly and very helpful. They were able to help us see the wonderful sights that Maui had to offer. The room was wonderful, had a great view of the ocean. It was breath taking to see the sun rise and set from the balcony. There was plenty to see and do on Maui. The food was excellent and there were many selections there to please anyone. The people were very friendly and made you feel like part of the family. We can't wait to come back to Maui and stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel again. If you or anyone that has not been to Maui... Go and stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Hotel is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello! I can not give enough accolades to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Our stay was nothing short of amazing. The staff is some of the best that I have ever experienced in my life. The bartenders at The Tiki Bar are great and Rudy always provides great music to relax and have fun to. The guest services were excellent as well. We had signed up for two free lei making classes and since we werenâ€™t able to make the other two on a different day he took time to give a couple of us private classes after we finished our first two. We ended up going home with 4 beautiful leis that we made for FREE! We explored other hotel bars and dinning areas and within ten minutes you could tell how dry they were compared to the fun, warm atmosphere of KBH. The snorkeling at Black Rock was amazing too! We thought it was even better than Molokini. We had so much fun and I could write pages on the positives of KBH. Many mahalos, weâ€™ll be back! A hui hou!

Reviews.Title: “The Great Kaanapoli Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Netanel
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of our stay at the Kaanapoli Berah Hotel was excellent. There is a free first morning breakfast where you are introduced to the hotel and its services. Every staff member has a smile and a greeting for you on every occasion. The free hula show and music every evening is very enjoyable. Our room was sparkling clean and madeup early every day. The grounds, pool, beach are always clean and comfortable. There are plenty of lounges around the pool and on the luxorious grounds. The Tiki restaurant at the hotel was better than any of the nearby restaurants that we tried. There were always service and information personel to answer questions and solve problems. Our room in the Lanai wing seemed to have refurbished very recently. On the last morning of your stay there is a ceremony and you are presented with a lei. During your stay there are free amenities like fruit plates, boxes of candies, free dinner coupons depending upon the length of your stay. This hotel really knows how to treat its staff and its customers. We talked to a number of other guests who had stayed at the Kaanapoli Beach Hotel several times. What better recommendation can one get than having guests continue to return. Thanks Kaanapoli!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed in paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent ten wonderful days at the Ka anapali Beach Hotel in Maui. We had a large room with a king size bed and a balconey view of the ocean. The staff was wonderful and happy to attend to all of our needs. Breakfast each day was at the hotel restraunt where you were provided a wonderful list of choices in addition to the breakfast buffet. The dinners that we experienced from the restraunt's evening menu was some of the best cuisine we tasted in Maui. Alan at Guest Srevices was great. He can help with all your needs, for suggestions on what to do and where to go for evening dinners. He will even make your reservations while you decompress in the sun, by the pool or at the beach. Our days were spent mostly lounging on the beach reading a book only to get up to cool off in the 79 degree ocean water. Water so clear you could see your toes on the bottom. Towards the afternoon you can walk up to the Tiki Bar and get a beer or mixed drink to quench your thirst. On a couple of occations we rented masks snorkles and fins and swam over to Black Rock to explore around the rock and look at all the fish. We even spotted a turtle in about twenty to thirty feet of water. In the hotel loby you can find many ideas on what excursions are availavble, costs and times to fit your schdule. It was our third time to KBH and we will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, skip the partial ocean view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, and an excellent location. Our only complaint was that we booked a partial ocean view and good barely see the ocean through the garden trees from our balcony. We stayed in the Kaua'i tower on the 4th floor facing the courtyard. Save your money and just get a garden view room. We've attached pictures from our balcony so that you can judge for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “KP Beach hotel still great.”
Reviews.Author: Rich&Krn
Reviews.Content: We last stayed in the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in 1984 and we all had a wonderful time then. The entire famiy (4) have fantistic memories of our 4 day stay back then. We returned May 17, 2006, and stayed there for 6 nights. Our ages are as follows: 9,10,20. 35,36,39,40, 64 and 66 years old. Each and every one of us made many pleasent memories and none had a bad thing to say about Maui or the hotel. If I were to offer suggestions they would be: go soon and return often. I hope the hotel never changes. The commons grounds area is superb, and the people were fantistic.

Reviews.Title: “Above average room, great location, terrific price.”
Reviews.Author: Jmuskratt
Reviews.Content: While a little frayed, this little hotel is a nice choice for staying on the west coast of Maui. It's next door to Black Rock with some decent snorkeling and the staff is very friendly (unlike many locals who seem to resent tourists). Nightly free music and an efficient and *thorough* housekeeping staff make this hotel a little gem. It's a short walk to restaurants and shops in Whaler's Village. It may not be the poshest of digs, but it gets the job done nicely and CLEANLY. I would not recommend vacationing here if you plan on staying on-property the majority of the time. The pool is rather small (and plain compared to neighboring hotels), and the dining options limited. However, the included breakfast is a great deal. If you plan on hanging out on the beach or exploring Maui, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Most Hawaiian”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Ka'anapali beach hotel in Maui four times now and have never been disappointed. The service was great. We were always made to feel like part of the family instead or just a guest. The nightly shows in the courtyard were great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Maui. Frank and Michele Malley Lynnwood, Washington

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A wonderful value for this location. Ka'anapali beach is so beautiful that we ended up staying at the hotel and enjoying the beach and pool there far more than we had expected. A very short walk along the beach to black rock for snorkeling. Another short walk the other direction to Whaler's Village for shopping and dining. On-site restaurants are average in quality and high in price (but price is on par with other restaurants in the vicinity). The nightly hula show was very nice -- the performers really seemed to enjoy what they were doing. Our room was in the Kuai wing. A bit dated, but not horribly so. Always clean. Even though we were on the "outside" side of the hotel, we could still see the ocean from our balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the KBH!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to drop you a line and let you know what a wonderful time we had at the Kaanipali Beach Hotel. I brought my wife, our 2 kids, my parents and my mother-in-law. We loved all the fun activities, the laid back atmosphere, the outstanding service and friendly staff. We look forward to seeing them again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just recently visited Maui for business/anniversay. Every staff member was extremely pleasant and willing to help with whatever our needs or concerns were. The gardens are beautiful, rooms clean. The management staff is extremely helpful. Guest Services outstanding. There are free onsite things plan for those days when you are just hanging out at the pool and relaxing. Mikala Nolan is very knowledgeable about Hawaii past and present. Makes you laugh and smile even on a rainy day. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Best beach location on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: TiQue
Reviews.Content: Stay here for its beach location on Kaanapali Beach. It is very close to Black Rock where there is great snorkelling and rock jumping, and close to Whaler's Village with shops and restaurants. The beach out in front of the hotel is sandy and great for kids and adults alike. Unlike staying at the Sheraton, where the beach is very crowded since Black Rock is a draw for visitors staying elsewhere the beach at the KBH is not crowded at all. The property is well kept. The hula show was great fun. The restaurants on property are pricey and the food is OK. One restaurant is a buffet and the other is a table service outdoor restaurant with a good view of the nightly hula show. There are lots of "free" things at the KBH. You get a complimentary breakfast one day and a nice Kukui nut lei upon your departure. Beach towel rental is free. They charge you for parking and your in room safe of all things. I would stay here again. The staff and grounds plus the location make it great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and i had a wonderful stay at the kaanapali beach hotel. the hotel was beautiful. we were treated as family. the service was superb. we enjoyed the nightly entertainment. i loved the courtyard with all of the lovely trees and flowers. we also had close access to the most beautiful beach in the world. we intend to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around Is Even Better”
Reviews.Author: jcsord
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at KBH - our first stay was so enjoyable we booked again 2 years later and it was even better than the first stay. You read the reviews about courteous staff and outstanding service? Our first vacation here our son left his blankies in the room bedding. We got home, unpacked, realized they were missing, called the hotel, housekeeping talked to us, and 3 days later we had the missing blankies...they wouldn't even let us reimburse them for the postage! THAT is going above and beyond. Why pay $$ for a luau when the Tiki Terrace has a great show with music and hula dancing? We booked a garden view room, but we overlooked the courtyard/pool area - ocean view off our balcony and what a treat with the whales playing! Immaculate grounds. Staff is super fantastic. Rooms are clean and a great value especially for Kaanapali and being literally steps away from that wonderful beach! A five minute lazy saunter to great snorkling at Black Rock. We had wondered about a pricier hotel a few places away (mainly because it had a great pool for the kids)- we ended up walking down there to check it out - absolutely jam packed (literally no empty lounge chairs) and would have been a nightmare keeping tabs on kids. By contrast, the KBH hotel pool was clean and convenient (we spent most of the day on the beach anyway). Price, location location location, and above all CUSTOMER SERVICE all added up to a great vacation. We'll be back in 2008!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and wheelchair accessible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED our stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in Maui. From the beautiful landscaping with wonderfully fragrant Plumeria trees to the nightly entertainment with Rudy to the best pork chop at the Tiki Terrace and the most pleasant staff all around. They truly taught us the meaning of Ohana (family). They assisted us with all of our daily excursions, including a helicopter tour, luau, and the wonderful show Ulalena. I do not beleive that there is a better place to stay in Maui. Our honeymoon was fun and relaxing all at the same time. We are already talking about an anniversary trip back. And we wouldn't stay anywhere else. Maile at the Mixed Plate greeted us every morning with a smile. And on my last day there one of the staff made me a beautiful piece for my hair from several plumeria blooms. Don't pass this one up.

Reviews.Title: “KBH a wonderful vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just love vacationing at KBH. As a returning guests we where once again so impressed by all the staff. They go out of thier way to make your stay with them so pleasant. Every evening it is such a treat to sit at the Tiki bar and listen to Rudy and the gang play music. Not to mention the drink fo the day that Dale will make for you. There is no other place we would rather be then at KBH on vacation. Aloha- Tom Samuel and his future wife Teresa Hegg P.S. Tom ask Teresa to marry him on the beach in front of KBH. Once again KBH has a very special place in our heart.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Maui, and we stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (KBH) We were family when we were there in April,2006. This is the best place anyone could stay. Everyone there is great and treat you all so nice. We are not world travelers but I will be going back and staying in the same place for they treat you so well... A+++++ to everyone there and a special Hello to "Mary" Kevin and Susan Danville,Va

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel Mar 18th thru the 25th of 2006 and had a great time. We met Mahlihini in 2003 and she remembered us 3 yrs later. We felt like we were part of the family coming home for a reunion. This time we met Alan and he was very helpful also. We will definitely go back. They don't have all the 'extras' but you are not a number at this hotel and that is worth it all. Joyce, Terry, TJ Crystal and Adam Schwartz

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Island”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Give Kaanapli Beach Hotel a try! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: stacyd
Reviews.Content: When at KBH you are treated like family. The workers are very friendly and down to earth. Mikala Nolan and Alan from Guest Services went out of there way to take extra time and make the experience that much more wonderful. The rooms were very nice and access to the beach is amazing. We truly enjoyed our first visit to Hawai'i and after experience the non-commercial feeling of KBH we are hoping to return to this hotel every couple of years. Thank you for any amazing experience. Stacy and Michael Omaha NE

Reviews.Title: “WOW What a great destination”
Reviews.Author: auskez
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. I was with my husband and my sister and her husband. We have never felt more welcomed we can not sing this establishments praises enough. We loved the welcome breakfast and the farewell ceremony had my sister and I in tears we truely felt like we were part of the most friendly family in Hawaii. THe band every night was a lovely touch and the facilities spotless. Great work we hope to come again and stay much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We take great pleasure in writing our thoughts about our stay at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel.We've been fortunate to have traveled around the world and we can honestly say that KBH is the very best for us from check-in to check-out. The Staff is the most knowledgeable and friendliest we've had the pleasure of staying with. The whole atmosphere is something everyone needs to see and enjoy. The food in the Tiki Terrace, Tiki Grill and Mixed Plate was very satisfying to the palate. Exceptional entertainment, Jody's illusionist show was worth every moment, would like to see it again. Rudy and his band was a pleasure to listen to nightly and you couln't help but enjoy the hula dancers. The entire atmosphere made you feel and home and part of their ohana (family).

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: ScarlettTripod
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (two children, two adults) stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel from April 11th to April 18th, 2006. This hotel is definitely one of the most family-friendly hotels in all of Maui. I have never heard so many â€œAlohaâ€™sâ€� and â€œMahalosâ€� in any hotel on Maui except this one. It may not be a luxurious resort catering to the rich and famous, but they have all the amenities the vacationing tourist needs. We arrived very late (10:00pm) the first night after three long airplane rides. As we drove up, the valet walked to the rental car and opened the door. He said, â€œHello, we have been waiting for youâ€�. Now, I donâ€™t know if he said that to everyone, or even if he knew who we were, but it made us feel welcome. He also said, â€œGo check in and go to your room, we will take care of your bags and the car.â€� Wow! That was just what we needed as we were exhausted from traveling all day. The room was clean and spacious, with a small lanai. It overlooked the ocean and the hotel grounds. When we checked in, we were given an envelope that contained breakfast vouchers for every day of our stay at their Mixed Plate Restaurant. We were also invited to attend a Welcome Breakfast Buffet, which we did go to. This welcome breakfast featured live entertainment, along with a monologue given by one of most humorous hotel employees. This employee gave very amusing travel tips on what attractions to see (and what not to see) while in Maui. As we have small children, each child was issued a â€œPassportâ€� by the hotel. The purpose of this passport was to have the child visit an area in the hotel and/or participate in one of the many free activities to get their passport stamped. As each area in the book was stamped, the children received a gift from the hotel such as a keychain, a back pack, a t-shirt, free French fries, a flower lei, etc. The pool at the hotel was not very large, but it was clean and unique. It was in the shape of a giant whale. The tail of the whale was the shallow end for the Keiki to play in. The grounds were large, grassy and had many fragrant plumeria trees to provide shade in the hot sun. There were an abundance of lawn chairs and one did not have to stake out a chair in the early hours of the morning â€“ there were plenty to go around. The lawn featured a giant checkers game board with painted coconuts as markers. The walk to the beach was short, as was the walk from the room to the pool. This hotel had a small outdoor bar called the Tiki Bar. It served reasonably priced drinks. There was also an outdoor grill for ordering lunch and snacks. The prices and quality of food were good. Some of the menu items were cheeseburgers, onion rings, French fries, and the like. The hotel offers a free hula show each evening outdoors by the Tiki bar. Overall, the staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, the food was affordable, and there were not thousands of guests to arm wrestle with over the lawn chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Hotel-Truly the Most Hawaiian Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Aloha! If you are looking for the PERFECT family hotel, this is the place! The Ka'anapali Beach hotel provides lovely rooms, exquisite scenery, and the experience of Maui and it's history and culture. Our party ranged in age from 12 to 82, and we all had the time of our lives! (Actually, this is our third year in a row, and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else). The Guest Services department is beyond compare. The Cultural and Craft classes allowed us to explore the history of the island and the people, the traditions and to create our own handmade treasures (woven items, sand images, leis, etc.). The newly renovated Spa provided us with excellent pampering. The hotel is within walking distance of Whaler's Village, however, the hotel provided most of our "goodies". Snorkeling off the beach was comparable to the Boat trip to Molaki (and it was free!). An absolutely fantastic find...almost hesitate to recommend Maui's best-kept secret!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: joepyeweed
Reviews.Content: The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is the best place to stay on the island of Maui. The staff is exceptionally friendly and willing to go out of their way to make sure your vacation is perfect! The grounds are impeccably kept and are beautifully peaceful and relaxing. It is located along the best part of Ka'anapali Beach where the beach is wide and provides plenty of room to watch the Maui sunsets. It is within a short walk of some awesome snorkling at Black Rock. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a traditional Hawaiian experience at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Irishgrl721
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at KBH for part of our Hawaiian Honeynoon in February 2006 and enjoyed every minute of it. The grounds and rooms at the hotel were beautifully kept. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurants at the hotel (the Tiki Terrace and the Kaanapli Mixed Plate ) were great - service and food wise. We are actually in the process of planning our next trip back !

Reviews.Title: “RE: honeymoon disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: uniqaznmeg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on our Honeymoon in July of 05. We stayed at this hotel for 4 days. The day we booked this trip with Apple vacation this hotels is alert that we are honeymooners. The day we checked in we were told that they are out of king sizes bed. So we room with 2 beds. The reception that checked us in was Not friendly at all. Maybe she had a bad day but that's no excuse. On our 2nd day we requested a king size bed and they were able to move us. They told us not to worry about the luggage and will have bellman move our luggage to new room. 10 hrs later after comming back from our long day we did not see our luggage in our new room when we were told that the lugguage will arrive before we come back. We had to called reception to track down our luggage. I find this very annoying. Our room was clean, The door to the patio was really hard to open. It made alot of noise when we tried to open it. The fridge does not work in the room. We called and asked reception and was informed that none of the fridge works in the room. I don't understand why they still have it in the room. Besides having problems with the room. we enjoyed the fact that our room is so close to the beach. The breakfast was average. It's buffet style with eggs,cereals,juice and fruits like most hotels. We did not have a chance to eat at the restaurant so sorry can't give feedback on that. The pool was very clean and nice. It wasn't to crowded. We were able to find chairs and lay out for couple of hours. Anyone looking for an average hotel to stay at I do recommend this hotel but if you are looking for luxury I suggest you shop elsewhere. Hope my experience help you decide.

Reviews.Title: “The best is the KBH!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to share that I just spent the most wonderful week in Maui at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. I first found out about this hotel though an Internet search last year when I made a trip in the fall of 2005. Needless to say I could not wait a whole year to come back and to spent the first week of April there at the KPH. Itâ€™s like coming home to see lots of family and friends. I love the fact that the faces are all familiar and that they promote such a wonderful welcoming attitude. They really want it to be like your own personal home away from home. Everything from knowing your name to the constant Alohas from everyone including the friendly maids and landscapers make this a wonderful place. Everyone cares and delivers top-notch service to make it the best vacation possible. Some of my favorites are of course the fun crafts for all ages and the family-feel around the pool. Whether you want to read in solitude or strike up a conversation â€“ its possible and readily available. I guess they attract the perfect combination of people. The closeness of the drink bar, food stand to the pool to walking out the door and seeing, being on the beach made for the greatest of delights. And let me not forget the nightly Hawaiian music and hula show!!! Oh my â€“ I could go on but donâ€™t want to take up all your time. Just want to say thank you for my wonderful time and I canâ€™t wait until I can plan my next return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii at its most Hawaiian”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel ten years ago when we last visited Maui. I don't know why we waited so long to return, but finally went back in February this year. It was like coming home! Nothing had changed, and it was all just as we remembered it. The staff are all very welcoming and warm, and made us feel so special. Every evening brought another small surprise in our room accompanied by a note, and when a mistake was made with a reservation we were lavished with free drinks by way of apology. The hotel itself is located right on the beach in what we believe is THE prime location for all activities, from whale-watching to shopping. There are also a variety of activities available at the hotel throughout the day. The quaint town of Lahaina is a short drive away, or a dollar on the local bus. There is so much to see and do, and a great deal of history to be discovered too. There are many larger, grander hotels springing up around the Ka'anapali Beach, but if it's real Aloha spirit you are looking for, "Hawaii's Most Hawaiian Hotel" is the one for you!! We are definitely not going to wait another ten years before we return!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Kept Secret on the Island”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you ever want to experince the ambiance of Hawaii make your next trip to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel on Maui. For a great price they offer a wonderful hotel with beautiful courtyard which they invite the guests to use, move you chair anywhere in the courtyard and enjoy the day in the sun. The staff is unbeatable, the food surpurb and the nightly entertainment is the best on the island plus it's free. IF you want to experience that true Hawaiian spirit with loving, caring people, make your next visit to the KBH. It's a great place for the whole family. The Aloha Passport for children to enjoy includes, pineapple cutting, lei making, sand painting and more and it's free to the children. They have a Champagne Sunday Brunch, best on the island. This quaint resort doesn't have all the fancy frills of those big expensive hotels, it has the warm cozey atmosphere you want to call home.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have recently come back from the hotel and had a great family holiday I felt the staff were polite and helpful especially Alan Caban and Michelle (RECEPTIONIST) Nothing was to much trouble. The hotel was always been cleaned day or night and the little extras ie hula classes thanks Alan and Lei making along with the kids club made this a great family holiday cheers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: markoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the KBH Maui in Apr 05 for our honeymoon, and loved every minute of it. We had an ocean front room and it was worth it. The sunsets are incredible, and we could see whales from our balcony. The KBH is not quite "luxury" quality, but the rooms are clean & well kept, and the staff is very nice. The whole place has a very laid back feel, which is a good thing. The beach there is beyond beautiful, the beachwalk is cool, and for snorkeling, Black Rock right there and it's even better than Molokini Crater. We would definitely recommend the KBH!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the KBH”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the KBH from the 3-10 of April 2006. What a wonderful and warm place to bring your family. We had such a great time, and the staff was so nice and caring. A special Mahalo to Alan Caban in Guest Services. He was so helpful to our two children, he made the stay extra special!! We will be back!! The Myers' Family San Diego, Ca

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: FrozenFeet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 2 children (ages 13 and 18)stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel March 24-April 2, 2006. We enjoyed the hotel very much. We had 2 connecting ground floor rooms in the Maui wing. (We met people who asked to be moved out of the Molokai wing because they thought the room was in bad shape. We didn't actully see any rooms in that wing, but be forewarned - it is the older part of the hotel.) The rooms were nice size, and it was nice to be able to just walk out onto the grounds without having to wait for an elevator. The carpet was showing a little wear, but after we had gone in and out a few times, I could see why! I was amazaed at how quiet the room was; I know the hotel was full, but we never heard noise from any other room. The staff, except for one snippy guy at the beach hut, was great! They were all really friendly, helpful, and willing to go out of their way to get you what you needed. I appreciated the little extras like turn-down service (complete with cookies and orchids on the pillows), free use of beach towels, and free classes every day (we took lei-making class and ukelele lessons.) I also appreciated the bigger extras like the Welcome Breakfast during which you are given a lot of infomation about the island and how the staff can help you arrange activities, the free nightly music and hula show, and the ceremony on the day you leave in which members of the staff sing to you and give you a kukui (sp?) nut lei. You also can't beat their location. We spent time at some other beaches on the island during our stay, but were always happy to get back to Ka'anapli Beach. The sand is soft, the surf is managable, and the water is beautiful. We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A true pleasure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 10 days and must say that it was one of the most pleasurable vacation experiences ever. We travel a lot and stay at first class hotels wherever we go but nowhere can compare with the friendly staff, cleanliness and helpfulness of the people employed here. It is as though they all have a stake in the hotel and can't do enough for you. It was beautiful, freindly and everything was done the right way. I would not hesitate to go back without question.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We saved for years to be able to take a trip to Hawaii.Finally on March 19 2006 our dream came true.We had booked through our local travel agent and by chance they booked us with Kaanapali Beach Hotel on the beautiful island of Maui.A wonderful experiance, we were treated like we were very important people but we are just the average American man and wife.Every aspect of the day of our stay was GREAT.The Hawaiian women that cared for our room were very kind to us and gave us great service. Breakfast was included. It was far more than we expected, very, very good.They put us on the sixth floor room 670.What a view! We were right on the beach, Great swiming,Snorkeling was great(about a 5 min. walk to Black Rock.) If you didn't want to see the Island you woulden't even need a car. A 10 min. walk to Whalers Village (your wife will love the beautiful Mall there right on the ocean)as well as many great places for lunch and dinner.We were very satisfied with all the staff,they treat you like family.Had a great time on our trip. Aloha Mahalo Chet and Pam

Reviews.Title: “True Meaning of Aloha”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you don't like to get lost finding your hotel room after dinner, the Kaanapali Beach hotel is for you. If you need a waterfall or a slide into the pool, then it's not. The first time that we stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel I felt the KBH was a little funky, but when I went next door to the Sheraton to use its Business Center, I was struck by how cold and corporate it was, and gladly returned to the warmth and hospitality of the KBH. Every year, we received a Christmas card from KBH, and I put it on my desk and dreamed of Hawaii. For Valentines day my dream came true. We stayed in the old Moloka'i wing, which doesn't have any bathtubs, but looks out over the garden and the first day that we were there, whales jumping and flipping in the ocean. Every night there is a free Hula show, and we loved eating at the dining room outside (try the volcano dessert)and meeting the same people that we saw by the pool and at the beach. Our 4-yr-old, Joy made so many friends, that she began counting them. She met some at the beach by the rocks, looking at fish with her googles, then after lunch at the Tiki Grill for Chicken/Ceasar and foot long hot dogs, she met more swimming in the whale-shaped swimming pool, and went home with a new social skill. The hotel is not swarming with children though, as some prefer the Disney-like theme elsewhere. With emphasis on local culture, we found that everyone at KBH was an expert on the local flora and fauna and culture. Mikah and Alan at the concierge are especially po'okela, and went out of their way to make us a part of the family. When we said goodbye, they presented us with our special kola nut necklaces and sang a song with us even though it was just the three of us. When other guests tryed to pass between us, the guys were adamant that they respect our ceremony! Very nice. From the free hula to a giant out-door checkers game, played with painted coconuts, it was all so fun and magical, a real old-fashioned vacation, and I hope that they never change the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: dunwoodywoman
Reviews.Content: First time I stayed in this hotel was 20yrs ago...thought it was truly paradise. This time was a much different hotel. Stayed in an ocean side bottom level for the view,however,the view was behind some shrubbery so couldn't see much. The room was very musty and the linens smelled stale. The water in the shower never got beyond warm and with the air-conditioner running..water droplets stayed on the bathroom ceiling for quite some time. The free show was also disappointing as they seemed somewhat bored and tended to cater to the elderly people who went to bed at 9. They used to have a fantastic hula show and cook-out with wonderful music and flowers in pots surrounding the area. No flowers to speak of as well.. The show was over at 9 and the Tiki Bar closed around 9 or 10. So that left us with not much to do except to visit the other hotels. Where did paradise go? Won't be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hawaiian Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 2 week, 4 islands, vacation in Hawaii and had a great time. Of the four islands and four hotels we stayed at, Maui and the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel were the best. The staff was the friendliest and most helpful the we have ever experienced on any vacation. We were celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary and the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel made us feel special. If we ever have a chance to vacation in the islands again, and we hope we do, we will definitely stay at the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel. Phil & Carole Englebert Howards Grove, Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you are in paradise, you never expect anything to go wrong, especially on vacation. However, when our son had gotten sick late one night all it took was one call to the front desk and security was at our door with all new bedding, towels and the offer of any medical help we needed. They treated us like they had known us for years. The next morning asking about how he was doing or if there was anyting further they could do for us. They could have just dropped off what we needed and been the end of it but they were very kind and their entire staff is SERVICE ORIENTED. Our vacation with them was excellent,

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Maui and all things considered was our best. We arrived late on 3/16 (after a 9 1/2 hour flight) to a room with 2 double beds. Through our travel agent we had requested, months beforehand, a king w/a daybed as our daughter was traveling with us. The front desk said they did not have any other rooms available as I was not willing to give up our ocean front view, but could possibly move us later in the week. When we woke up the next morning I decided we could live with the sleeping arrangements after I stepped onto our lanai. The view was fabulous! Yes, the rooms are standard hotel style and could use some updating, but I would stay there again. The grassy, spacious courtyard was great for sunning or relaxing under a plumeria tree. The beach directly in front of us was swimmer friendly (no volcanic rocks to stub toes on) and had free towels for use and cabanas for rent. The whole courtyard setup, including the interesting life size checker board, was great for my 10 year old daughter. She had a little freedom, but was still within my sight. We participated in several of the hotel's cultural classes which were all very interesting and free. My daughter participated in their Passport Program which is designed to teach the children some Hawaiian culture. She really enjoyed the program and came home with some 'cool' things. They have local artisans in several times a week for craft shows and we left a few dollars with those talented people. We did not try the Mixed Plate restaurant, but really enjoyed the Tiki Terrace for breakfast (which we had free vouchers for) and supper (one of our better meals while we were in Maui). We ate lunch at the Tiki Grill several times and tested out the Tiki Bar for research purposes only! All of these facilities are located at KBH. There is a paved walkway from KBH to the Whaler Shopping Village (a very short stroll) that linked us to shopping and dining experiences. It was a good setup for our family and we were in our room such a small amount of time that its size became a non-issue. I would highly recommend the KBH to people who are more interested in their experience in Maui than in the glitz and glamour of a high dollar resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: engineer64
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in March 2006 and reserved the garden view room w/breakfast for $220. This is the best deal on Kaanapali Beach. The staff there is incredible. This is not a chain - this is a family taking care of you. We were lucky and were upgraded to ocean view - just a few feet from the water. We left the glass lanai door open and slid the wood shutter door closed - and listened the waves all night. By far the most Hawaiian beach stay we had. The bedding is showing its age, there was not an elevator in our building - so do not go here for the facility. There is good entertainment at the Tiki Bar at night - not quite a luau - but good Hawaiian song and dance. The check-out ceremony is a classy touch. The staff presents each guest with a nut lei - not a cheap lei. These are $8 each at the ABC store.So, a nice touch for a family of four. The concierge is great. Within minutes, we were booked on a whale watch at the time we wanted. Go here for the location and the staff. The value is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As the saying goes, 'You get what you pay for'. This is one of the least expensive hotels on the beautiful Kaanapali beach. However, the accomodations (i.e. rooms) are the quality of a 'budget' hotel even though you are NOT paying budget prices. When we went to our 'first' room, we were in the unrenovated section. There was hair in the bathroom and when we were ready for bed found hair in the bed, mold and something hanging down from the pipes in the closet and the shower did not have a shower head on it. We called the front desk and asked to be moved. The asst manager on duty does not understand the concept of customer satisfaction. We viewed the 'second' room and it was not any better. After pressuring the asst manager, we were moved into a 'renovated' room. It's sad that quality was not a factor in the renovation. Also, the room walls are paper thin. It was hard to sleep. There were also not enough people working the check-in/out desk. We had to wait a considerable amount of time. While I think the amenitites and location are great, i.e. welcome breakfast, classes/shows offered, this is NOT a quality hotel. EVERYTHING needs to be updated. They are sitting on a gold mine and they don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: purplekerri1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for our honeymoon. We were very pleased with the hospitality, location, grounds/pool area. You cannot beat it for the price especially being right on the beach. The lei making classes as well as others were great. They offered a non-denominational outdoor service on Sundays as well. We definatley want to return there!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Loved it, Loved it!!! You have to go to KBH!!”
Reviews.Author: littlel30
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Maui--Stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel--will MOST DEFINATELY stay there again. There's not enough room here to list all the wonderful things about KBH! The grounds--IMPECCABLY kept, gorgeous, has a HUGE checkerboard outside you play w/red & black coconuts, LOTS of chairs to sit on, shady areas, clean pool--I loved spending time in the courtyard sunning and reading.On a great section of beach-beautiful ocean walkway to other hotels and shopping center. Not a far drive to Lahaina either. EXCELLENT LOCATION!! The staff--OMG, I have NEVER been so impressed with customer service!! Their staff is really inspirational--they are so friendly, knowledgeable (EVERY employee goes every 3 mos for training of Hawaiian customs, activities, history) and really couldn't be nicer! We missed the welcoming breakfast but their goodbye brought a tear to my eye. I didn't want to go home! We were invited to the lobby where they greeted us with many thanks for visiting them, gave a nut lei to remember our trip-instructing us to bring them back every time so they can re-string and add a different nut to mark another special time with them--sang a hawaiian song, kissed us goodbye and wished us safe travel. It was something I always will remember. Nightly turn down was much appreciated-a flower and cookies on the pillows and they even left choco-covered macadamia nuts. Housekeeping always left the room perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Has Always Been A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel full of the spirit of Hawaii - this is the place! The staff is full of the aloha spirit! The rich tradition and heritage of their islands carry through with the activities, restaurants, entertainment and the service offered by the hotel. A friendly smile and aloha is always offered in the lobby or anywhere on hotel property. Comfortable, clean, and nicely furnished rooms are what you'll find. A basic style whale pool with no fancy slides or waterfalls. Nice, well kept, spacious grounds in a fantastic beach location. It's not a luxury property, but the friendliness, helpfulness,and aloha staff makes up for that. We have visited Maui three times and have stayed there each time. We love it and intend to go back! Aloha and Mahalo to our Kaanapali Ohana

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected”
Reviews.Author: bradfordRyeBrook_NY
Reviews.Content: Just left Kaanapali Beach Hotel 2 days ago after 6 day stay 2/11- 2/16/06. We'd read many TripAdvisor reviews prior to going, and most were right on the mark. Hotel is in a great location on the beach, has lots of activities for the kids (we have 3, ages 9,6,4), decent but not great food in the restaurants, a VERY friendly staff, and reasonable prices compared to surrounding resorts such as the Sheraton, Westin, and Hyatt. On the negative side, the room (we had a family suite which had a main/living room plus a small, separate bedroom) was definitely dated, and the small bathroom looked like something you would expect to find at a Super 8 Motel. Several other reviewers had mentioned this, but some pointed out that part of the hotel has been updated, so apparently this is not a universal problem there. All in all, I felt that what we received for $425 a night, including breakfast, was a good deal since we don't require a ritzy hotel, and having the suite was mandatory for the 5 of us- getting a suite elsewhere, or 2 rooms, would have been far more expensive. Take your savings and stay another week somewhere, as we are currently doing in Kauai! Aloha...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome spot on Kaanapali beach”
Reviews.Author: KalsandSansC
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week in Maui at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel, and I find these reviews very helpful so I thought I'd put in my own two cents. Of all the hotels on Kaanapli Beach (and we saw them all while walking along the beach), the Kaanalpi Beach Hotel is the over-all best value. The area: Kaanapali Beach is a beauitful stretch of sandy beach lined by resorts/hotels. It's definitely a resort area. In the center is a little shopping area called Whaler's village with everything from super high-end stores to little tourist shops. At one end of the beach is Black Rock, which is great for snorkeling. The hotel: Kaanapli Beach hotel is one or two hotels down from Whaler's village, and a very short walk from Black Rock. It's not a high-rise. In fact, unlike all of the other large hotels, you can hardly see it from the water---instead you see all of the lush gardens. It is right on the beach, and even though there are fewer rooms than some of the other hotels, it has one of the larger plots of land, a lot of which is taken up by the huge courtyard/pool/garden area. The pool is kind of small, a little cold, and nothing super fancy but very clean and nice. There is a great Tiki Bar in the courtyard with the best Mai Tai's I had in Maui, and they have a super-cute nightly hula show and live music. The whole hotel is just very laid-back. It's advertised as the most Hawaiian Hotel, which I thought was a little silly at first, but by the end of the week I totally agreed. Every single staff person I encountered was friendly and helpful. The rooms: The Maui and Lanai wings are updated so the rooms seem more modern and a lot nicer. Also, I highly recomend getting a first floor room in one of these wings (that's what we had) because they are bigger than the regular rooms. There is a little sitting area you step down into (this is the deck in the rooms above) and then you walk out onto a patio that is still bigger than the decks! So it's like getting 30% more space. The bathroom is basic but nice in these updated rooms, and you get the additional space of the seperate toilet/shower and vanity (unlike the older rooms). None of these are "ocean front" but even from our "partial ocean view" room, we could see and hear the ocean. The extras: You get welcome gifts upon arrival (a box of chocolates) and turn-down service every night (cookies and an orchid on your pillow)! There were also gifts and cards delivered before we left. It's really cute because they are the sort of extras I didn't expect at a less-expensive hotel. There is a hut on the beach where you can arrange lots of activities (although we didn't use it for this so I can say much about that) and you get free towels for the beach and pool---very convenient and again, something I didn't expect for the price. Hint: If you do a package with breakfast, you get coupons to use in the "Mixed Plate" resturant. It's not open air or ocean front, and the food isn't great---although the fruit is. Anyway, we found out on our last day, that you can use those coupons ($11.75 value) towards breakfast in the hotel terrace resturant, which is open-air in the courtyard and the food is MUCH better. That definitely makes the breakfasts more worthwhile. This hotel was a great value (it's not a luxury hotel but the price really is remarkable for the location and what you get), and made for a wonderful temporary home in Maui. It's a nice, clean, friendly, fun, hotel in the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was my first trip to Hawaii. Thought I might give the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel another perfect score. Perfect for me atleast. We had a very nice stay. Very polite staff, not intrusive. Clean rooms, clean pool, nice beach (very hot sand). Nice outdoor dining, (breakfasts were great), nice bar, nice Snack Hut for lunch. NOT fancy!! Very casual, relaxing atmosphere. The Pineapple is fantastic. If you (are fit and) get a chance, do the sunrise and bike ride down Haleakala (starts REAL early AM). Also, if you like to drive, take the road to Hana (long trip - all day).

Reviews.Title: “Terrific for families!”
Reviews.Author: NeedaVacation44
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the internet while planning a last minute getaway for our family so we were not really sure what to expect. I have never been so pleasantly surprised!. This place is not about extravagance, it is about the Hawiian culture and family. From the moment of our very late arrival we were treated graciously by all the staff members. Our children absolutely loved the passport program and the entire family enjoyed the Hawiian activities that were offered every day. The hotel is on a gorgeous stretch of beach with the best snorkelling we experienced on the island just next door. The food was great, the entertainment was terrific, and the environment was fantastic. I could, and have to many friends already, go on and on about the great experience this was for our whole family. Much Mahalo to all the staff(especially Malihini and Alan)for making this the best family vacation we have had! P Sibbald, Calgary

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kaanapali Beach Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending eight nights at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel in Maui. Bar none, it is the best hotel experience we have ever had. The customer service staff prides itself on treating guests as if they are family (ohana) and that is exactly how we felt. Our room was excellent, we received nightly "turn down" service with fresh flowers and cookies on our bed, a concierge befriended us immediately (thanks, Alan C.--you are in our hearts!), and the grounds and nightly entertainment were lovely. We were saddened to have to leave, but are already devising how and when we can return to Kaanapali Beach Hotel! Thanks for the vacation of a lifetime! Until we return, mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Compare Prices”
Reviews.Author: stevendm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel twice. I have had good experiences both times. I have read reviews complaining about the quality of the hotel for the price. They invariably say that they stayed at better hotels in Waikiki for less money. That is probably true, but these are two different islands with two different price structures. They are comparing apples to oranges. If you want to compare, compare to the Sheraton or Westin in Ka'anapali. You will find that the KBH is much cheaper than other Maui hotels. It is a good value for the price and a very friendly hotel. Steven

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: pdxfamily4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a truly perfect stay at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. We traveled with our two young children. This hotel met (usually exceeded) our needs in every way. The staff is wonderful and always made us feel like family- they knew our names and greeted us daily. They all have this wonderful enthusiasm for their Hawaiian culture and really go out of their way to share it with their guests. They were always available to answer our questions or make any arrangements or reservations that we needed. Our room was great! It was on the ground level which allowed us to walk out our lanai door to the lovely grounds or over to the pool. The kids loved it! The room was kept immaculately clean throughout our stay. We had turndown service nightly which included wonderful cookies and fresh flowers. The food was wonderful as well. In fact, the dinner we had at the Tiki Terrace restaurant was the best meal we had on Maui. And the kids could play in the adjacent courtyard while we relaxed after our dinner. We are frequent travelers and usually stay in 4-5 star hotels. But I must say that this particular hotel offers something much more than any of these chain hotels can offer- a truly unique and purely Hawaiian experience. Oh, and don't miss the Ohana Welcome Breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in December and it was excellent! The staff was warm and friendly and the rooms were spacious and very clean. Most impressive, they have a variety of complimentary classes...I suggest the hula lessons and the hotel is located on the best part of the beach. If you're looking for a great value, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I honeymooned here and we had a fantastic time. The staff were friendly and treated us like old friends. We had complimentary Champagne on our first night and chocolates and other little treats were left every other night. The staff at the desk where trips were organised were very helpful in helping us decide what to do and where to go. The roads around the island are narrow in places which suits me as I am used to driving in the British countryside, make the drive more interesting. Our only critism is not about the hotel but the car hire at the airport. Apparently you need a credit card in the name of the main driver - we didn't and there was a moment where we thought that we weren't going to get a car. (My wife didn't have her drivers license with her and I don't have a credit card!)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a long planned 25th Anniversary celebration for us. We first went to Honolulu, Oahu for 4 nights and then the KBH for 9 nights. Could it use some updating? I suppose. But our room was clean, spacious and very pleasant. My one and only complaint would be that our "free upgrade" from a partial ocean view to an ocean view did not seem like an upgrade. I would call it a partial ocean view. But we loved our lanai, and slept every night with the sliding glass doors open listening to the sounds of the ocean and feeling the warm breezes over us. Just as I imagined it to be! This hotel is so much more comfortable and inviting than your more upscale hotels. Definitely a great family hotel. Our experience with every staff person we came into contact with was excellent. We asked questions frequently of the concierge staff and did not buy any tours. They could not have been more helpful and friendly. As soon as we got settled in our room, we noticed the light in the bathroom was very dim. We called the desk and in minutes a maintenance man was there changed the bulb. The grounds are relaxing, the beach gorgeous, and the pool was adequate (who wants to sit at a pool when they are in Hawaii on the beach???) We were more than satisfied with the buffet breakfast at the Mixed Plate. We ate breakfast one day at the Tiki Grill and paid alot more for basically the same food! The restaurants in nearby Whaler's Village and Lahaina offer a great variety of food and prices. We didn't eat dinner at the same place twice. I did not like that you have to rent the beach chairs every day, which can add up. We took the advice of another reviewer and bought a cheap beach chair (and some beach mats) at the ABC store and gave it away when we left. Problem solved. Overall, it was a wonderful value for the money spent and we were more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali, Maui is the best of the best”
Reviews.Author: TravelAnswerMan_10
Reviews.Content: The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is beautiful, a virtual Polynesian paradise and well maintained. Yet probably more important is the fact that your staff is excellent in all areas of hospitality. They show a very conscious effort to put the guest #1 during their stay. I believe you and your colleague's secret to success is a true spirit of Ohana! I have traveled extensively during the last 29 years and have been able to see some of the finest resort properties in the world. It has enabled me to experience first hand what superior customer service is intended to be. Your executive team can surely be proud of everyones concerted efforts. And finally, I couldn't believe the fantastic location of the property was in the center of the number one rated beach in the state of Hawaii. It was also a convenient walk to the shops and restaurants of Whalers Village which was a great bonus for my wife. You can be confident I will continue to sing your praises enthusiastically.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wondeful time here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long vacation at the Kaanapauli Beach Hotel and I had a great time! I went with one of my best friends for a girl's trip and we loved it! We had a first floor room close to the lobby, partial ocean view. The room wasn't outdated - as many postings claim. It was exactly what I would envision as far as decor in a Hawaiian hotel. The room also wasn't musty, smelly, etc. It was clean, nice, perfect for us. The Tiki Bar was fun and the bartenders there were great! The pool was a little small, but when you're right on the beach who needs the pool? The staff members were very friendly and helpful. In fact, when I got the flu halfway through the trip the hotel's restaurant even made me chicken noodle soup - which wasn't on the menu. And I must say it may have been the best chicken noodle soup I've ever had! (My healthy roommate agreed.) Once out of the hotel, the guys at the Trilogy Aquatic Center and the cabana boys made sure we were well taken care of, and the prices for activities were fairly priced. If there was something we wanted to do they didn't offer, they'd make the calls and get us set up somewhere else. We loved them! All in all, I'd definitely go back to the Ka'anapali Beach hotel. We got out of it all we wanted and needed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised to see the reviews about the Kaanapli Beach Hotel. There were so many bad reviews. My husband and I stayed in this hotel for about 5 days back in August 2002. We really enjoyed our stay. Everything was very clean, the gardens were neat and tidy and although the hotel was full, it was still very quiet. The staff were very hospitable and helpful. The location of the hotel was excellent and we would love to go back there sometime. I can't find fault with hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional hawaiian”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Date: Traveled 12/17-12/24 Just returned from this trip with my two children, 17 and 13. I had not been to Maui since 1979. I booked through Expedia and upgraded to an ocean view room. It was well worth the extra. Loved the pleasant atmosphere at the hotel. Does not have the bells and whistles of an upscale hotel but it certainly met our needs. Small pool with a cute little Tiki grill for lunch hot dogs and burgers. While the pool was small, you could get a chair anytime. I walked to neighboring hotels and by 10am on such a peak week, chairs were not available, so I liked the casualness and lesser crowd. Definitely a relaxing family experience. One small problem, the shower/tub stall did not drain well, so we justed paced our use.

Reviews.Title: “Kanaapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxFan95
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kanaapali Beach Hotel in Maui in November, 2005. At first I was very disappointed in our room. It was old, not too clean and a smoking room (we asked for non-smoking). After a long flight from the east coast, we were tired and right outside our door there was a very loud function going on. We looked at another room on the third floor (no elevator and lots of luggage to carry), but the rug was filthy. The third room they offered us was wonderful and we were very pleased. The beach at the hotel is the best beach I have ever been to. The water was perfect. Further down the beach towards the Sheraton near the black rocks there is incredible snorkeling. They offer a welcome breakfast that shouldn't be missed. It was great. Upon departure, you are given a wooden Kukui bead lei that is very nice. I would stay there again because of the beach, but would be very specific about which room I stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Beach Hotel - Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: OhioCrnQun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at KBH 11/24-11/30. This was our third trip to Ka'anapali in the last three years, having previously stayed at the Westin and then at the Whaler. We booked the KBH and our flights together through Travelocity (and as explained below, I'll NEVER use Travelocity again). Let me say that my husband and I did not expect a 5 star experience at KBH, and we're very low maintenance--as long as a place is clean, has a good location, and we don't have any "logistical" issues, we'll be happy. We're not into over-the-top, elitist service, and I don't think I've ever complained about a hotel room (other than when I've received a smoking room). I had reserved a king, non-smoking, partial ocean view room. Travelocity called KBH directly to make these arrangements for this wedding anniversary trip for me. The Travelocity rep even told me we would probably receive a room upgrade at the time of check-in. KBH knew it was our anniversary because we received a split of champagne and a note. We arrived Thanksgiving day around 4:00 and were not greeted with a whole lot of aloha, despite reports to the contrary from others. We were then told that the only room available was a first floor room with two double beds--not at all what we reserved. I asked if anything with a king--or even queen--was available, and was told no (after the gentleman scanned all reservations and determined he would not break up groups traveling together in order to find us the type of room we reserved). We then asked if we could be moved when one opened up, and he told us he could move us on 11/26 and then would have to move us again on 11/28---so we would have to change rooms every two nights. Not being happy with this, I called Travelocity--you know, the company who advertises that all you have to do is call them and they'll make it "right" (see, e.g., its ads in USA Today, in which it uses "right" in every sentence). After 1 hour, 9 minutes, and 21 seconds of talking to a series of 3 Travelocity reps who told me it would cost Travelocity too much money to resolve the problem, and who seemed bothered to have to even speak to me, I ended the call (with a very elevated blood pressure). The rep called me back during what was to be a relaxing dinner on the beach to tell me that I could be moved every two days--exactly the pathetic solution that the front desk had offered me hours earlier. Travelocity may have good rates, but don't go with them--I got a very strong impression that those rates are based upon receiving the bargain basement, leftover rooms--which probably also explained why KBH had no interest in helping us out. Travelocity was no help, and certainly didn't make it "right." Its money would be better spent improving customer service than on "clever" advertising ploys. Our room, room 124, was dark, the bathroom was ridiculously small--you nearly had to stand on the toilet to get the shower door open (a bit scary, with some mildew, etc., throughout), the carpet was dirty, the ceiling tiles were stained, and although I've stayed in many oceanfront hotels and condos all over the country, this was truly a laughable "partial ocean view"--if you pressed your face up against the glass sliding door, you could sort of make out a sliver of ocean . . . . The room was in serious need of an upgrade. In any event, I decided we would just take our chances with the offered room moves, and get on with enjoying our vacation. The next morning, 11/25, we went to breakfast at the Mixed Plate (decent, but not great, and it's the same food every day, which gets old). When we got back to our room, our key card didn't work. My husband went to the front desk, and they reactivated it. He walked back to the room, tried it again, and it still didn't work. He walked back to the front desk, where he was given a new key. He walked back, tried the new key, and it didn't work. We went back to the front desk and explained it again, and they said security would be called. We walked back to the room and security arrived a few minutes later with the "master" key. He informed us that housekeeping had called about the door the prior day and reported that it didn't work---but apparently they decided to place us in the room despite the key entry system not working properly!! He also tried to explain that this was a new key system, and that they were having some problems. He said they would have to call an engineer, and that they would have to enter our room to examine the door. I told him that was fine, that we were leaving to run some errands (this was early--about 8 AM) and if it could be fixed by the time we came back, that would be great. We drove down to Lahaina and picked up some things at Safeway, Long's, etc., and returned. We lugged our purchases up to our room, only to find that our key still didn't work! We went to the front desk, they called security, and he told us that they hadn't been able to enter our room because the "kapu" (i.e., do not disturb sign) was on our door. I reminded him of our conversation, but he said that's their rule--they don't enter rooms when the sign is displayed. So he called the engineer and he and the engineer were in our room for about 30 minutes fixing the door (which was not exactly conducive to changing for the beach, etc.). They finally fixed the door. During this whole key fiasco, a gentleman at the front desk told my husband that we were moving to a new room that day, 11/25--which was contrary to what we had been told, 11/26. I went up and asked a woman, who told me that my husband was clearly mistaken, it was 11/26. When I told her that a man had told my husband that, she said it was the manager, and he was simply mistaken when he told my husband that--she said she had heard the manager say that and wondered why. I asked to speak to the manager; she went into the back room, and without any introduction, apology, etc., the man/manager came out and bluntly said "It's not today, it's tomorrow." I was a little taken back by his lack of, well, tact and customer service, and explained that we had not exactly had a great experience since we'd arrived. He just sort of looked at me, told me we would be moved on 11/26, and would not have to move again (also contrary to what we had previously been told), and as I walked away he sort of mumbled "sorry." We did move on 11/26, to room 214. The room was just as shabby, but being on the second floor was a nice change, and we were slightly closer to the ocean . . . so if we walked out onto the balcony and leaned forward around the floor-to-ceiling privacy fence, we could see the water (!). The rest of our stay was fairly uneventful, but a few more items pretty much sum up our experience: *We received some sort of broadcast voice message from the hotel staff nearly every morning--warning about dangerous ocean currents, etc. One morning there was a message notifying us that they would be entering rooms that day to spray for insects, and to call if we didn't want them to do so in our room. I called and asked that they not spray in our room, and the woman seemed quite put off. I know that properties have to keep up with this type of maintenance, especially in tropical climates, but it should be their responsibility to do so during room turnover--not on my time with my personal belongings and toiletry items in the room. *On our last full day there, we had (just like every other day) left the do not disturb sign on the door. When we returned from our activities for the day, we were surprised to find the sign removed, our bed made, and a note on our bed. Apparently, despite their "rule" about not entering rooms with the privacy sign displayed, they saw fit to enter the room and ensure that we knew the name of our housekeeper (presumably so we'd know who to tip). Unbelievable--guess the rule re: not entering rooms is only followed when convenient for them. *On the one rainy morning we had, we stopped by the concierge desk on our way out to see if they could provide any weather info. I know they had probably been asked a million times, but that is their job . . . The man at the desk sort of looked at us and then said "It's gonna be like this all day, honeybuns" and then went about another task. I'm really very laid back and not at all conservative, but #1--honeybuns?? And #2, he didn't even make an attempt to give us weather info---it cleared up mid afternoon and was beautiful the remainder of the day. Not too interested in helping us with the weather, obviously (but they seemed very willing to help folks who wanted to arrange for paid tours, etc.). As others have said, the KBH has a great location. It is cheaper than surrounding properties (Sheraton, Whaler, Westin, Hyatt), but for the money, you are far better off staying somewhere else. I did like the live music, etc. every evening, but you don't have to be a guest to wander in and enjoy it--so stay elsewhere and stop by for entertainment if you like. KBH does take what appears to be a genuine interest in the Hawaiian culture and educating others about it--which I greatly commend--but perhaps it's time for its owners to start putting some money back into the property so that it doesn't fall into total disrepair and disfavor. The current state of the property is a shame. I know I will return to Maui--and probably Ka'anapali many times; but unless I see substantial improvement, I will not again stay at KBH (particularly not at the current prices). By the way, I know we're not the only ones who had a bad experience at KBH last week--I'd love to hear from some of the large group of University of Wisconsin football fans who were staying in our building and were none too happy about their shabby rooms and their "garden" view (i.e., staring at a fence) rooms.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was Charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am 20 years old and stayed in this hotel with my mom and brother (16) over the week of Thanksgiving. We had read the reviews, and weren't sure what to expect. Upon arriving, we were pleasantly surprised. The staff was more hospitable than I could have imagined. Our room was spacious and clean, even though we were in an older wing of the hotel. The beach was spectacular. The pool wasn't crowded at all. The food at the Tiki Grill was reasonably priced and delicious. I'm a vegetarian, and I was delighted to discover they served veggie burgers there. We ate there every day for lunch. This hotel is a short, beautiful walk to Whaler's Village, where they have fantastic shops (think Tiffany's and Louis Vuitton)and good restaurants. The last night there we ate dinner at the Hula Grill as the sun set. It was breathtaking. We didn't go to Hawaii to sit in our hotel room, but while we were in there it was very comfortable. There were plenty of clean towels, and the nightly turndown service included cookies and chocolate. I am so glad we chose to stay at this hotel. The Hyatt and others in the area were stunning, but I got the feeling that everything was commercialized and a little forced. The Ka'anapali Beach Hotel was wonderful. It captured the essence of Hawaii, which is why we wanted to go to Maui in the first place. We wanted our Hawaiian experience to be authentic, and we got just that at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, my husband and our two girls ages 10,and 9) and I just returned from a 7 night stay at the KBH. I had not gone to Trip Advisor before booking as I booked through AAA. This was a package deal including airfare, rental car and hotel. I was not expecting a deluxe experience and did not receive one. What we did get was a clean room, exellent customer service and an unbeatable location. Our family does not go on this trip to hang out in our room or swim in the pool. While an awsome pool set-up is fun for the kids, the girls had a wonderful time boogie boarding (boards bought at Longs Drugs $16.00 each for the week, then given away to new arrivals) and snorkling at Black Rock. Yes, there is a shorebreak and a bit of an undertow. Our kids are excellent swimmers, so if yours aren't it could be an issue. The beach was huge and never crowded. Yes, everything is expensive, but that's Hawaii. It is possible to spend less if you try eating at fast food places and buy breakfast stuff for the room. The road to Hana was great, but we did get tons of misquito bites( our fault for not wearing repellant). The highlight of our trip was seeing a turtle while snorkling at black rock- the girls were thrilled. Yes the KBH is dated, and the pool is small, but the people who work there are friendly and full of the aloha spirt. I have stayed in far more luxurious hotels but the staff makes a difference. I would absoultly recommend the KBH to any family that wanted a great beach vacation at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value at the KBH”
Reviews.Author: tngl4ut
Reviews.Content: Overall I really enjoyed the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel (KBH). I stayed there November 11th through the 15th. My room was real nice and I paid $175 a night for it. Room number was 553 in the Lanai wing. I have read some reviews about rooms that needed to be remodeled. The room I was in was clean and was probably remolded recently. No bugs and the bathroom was a very good size (seems to be a theme on these review boards). The Tiki Restaurant is a little over priced but there is the Tiki grill in the courtyard a few feet away that is located next to the outdoor bar. Both are located next to the pool. The beach is very nice and wasn't crowded at all. Very small waves. Whalers Village is located 2-3 hotel\condominimums down. The Rusty Harpoon is nice and outdoors along with two other outdoor restaurants. The village has some nice shops along with some touristy shops and an ABC store in the back section (away from the beach). There are nicer hotels in the area with the Hyatt being the best in my opinion. As far as activities is concerned I drive the Road to Hana. It was nice but overated and a little dangerous. Get going early say by 7 am to avoid the traffic. I made it to the Charles Lindbergh's gravesite. As long as you are able to you must do the Haleakala bike ride from the summit to the ocean by decling 10,000 ft in 38 miles. It is awesome. Overall, this hotel was a good value considering where it is located and the price paid with an excellent beach and great view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and entertainment!”
Reviews.Author: JeremyC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated a portion of our honeymoon at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel (as well as at the Maui Price and 10 days in Kauai). Having stayed at several other resorts, this gave us a good barometer for what to expect. Basically for the price and location you really canâ€™t beat this place! First off, the location does not get any better for Kaanapali beach. This hotel really shares the nicest portion of the Kaanapali Beach with the neighboring Sheraton. The swimming and snorkeling is simply awesome. We booked a sunset catamaran cocktail cruise that picked us up (with others) one block away right on the beach. Plus there is a beachside path that runs along Kaanapali beach so you can walk and see all the resorts and restaurants without having to drive. The landscaping of KBH is really gorgeous as well. Sure it is not as grand (or stale) as some of the Ritzier resorts, but it has character and a genuine Hawaiian feel that many of them lack. The KBH really has a more inviting feel than many of the mega-resorts that dot the beach. The poolside Tiki-bar (cheap food) was also great with very friendly waitresses who were responsive and kept the drinks coming. The breakfast buffets could not be beaten for coming with the room charge. My wife and I were suckered into $25 breakfast buffets at other resorts that were of the same if not worse quality. I donâ€™t know about you, but spending $50 on breakfast is a rip, vacation or not. Iâ€™d suggest getting the buffet with your room. One of our favorite memories of the KBH was the nightly outdoor music entertainment with Rudy. What a great show his band and dancers put on each night. Plus we did not meet a nicer or more genuine person on the island than him. The KBH is labeled as the â€œMost Hawaiianâ€� resort and it really lives up to that billing with free nightly performers as these. We were also lucky enough to be there for the national junior hula competition. During the open-mike portion of Rudyâ€™s show, numerous Hawaiians who had come from all over and were staying at the KBH for the competitions performed various music and native dance that was simply beautiful to watch and hear. My wife and I were truly lucky to see all of this free of charge. Other reviewers who left less than flattering reviews of the band must be the most cynical of the bunch not to appreciate these talented and warm performers. The only minor let-down was the room view. We had booked an Ocean view that could have been better. However, it did not smell and was very clean. Next time we will either splurge for the ocean-front or just get a partial view. But we were hardly even in our room except to change, shower and sleep. Obviously we spent more time in our room when we stayed at Ritzier Resorts, but I felt wrong sitting in a resort room with so much to see and do around me.
