Right on the best beach in Hawaii, 5 minute walk up the beach to Black Rock for great snorkelling from shore. The beach itself must be 2 miles of the nicest sand and warmest water you'll find anywhere and absolutely clean. Second, and as important, the staff are great and respond quickly to anything you request. Turn down service daily and free buffet breakfast are just a couple of the unexpected things we were happy to receive. The hotel itself is older and a little outdated, but very well kept and very clean. We ate at the Tiki Terrace one night and weren't dissappointed with our dinners. The restaurant is competitively priced to similar fare in the local restaurants in Lahaina. There is a very nice retail mall about a 2 minute walk from the hotel called Whaler's Village with nice shops and some very good restaurants. Although not as highly rated as the Sheraton next door, or the Westin a couple of hotels down, you're not paying $400 US a night either. For the money the KBH is a great bargain. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Beach Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui for the first time this year and stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We went on February 26, 2005 for a week. It was a birthday gift from my husband. He booked through Signature Vacations and the package came with flight, hotel, breakfast and transfers. When we arrived in Maui at 11pm, we thought there would have been someone from Signature to direct us to the transportation (or Transfer promised in our package) but there was no such person. We ended up taking a $US65 cab ride to the hotel. I guess we expected the same kind of treatment like when we went to Mexico last year where a tour rep met you and guided you to the ground transportation which took you to your hotel for free! So we got to the hotel and checked into a room in the older part of the hotel. We had requested a King non-smoking room but got 2 double beds. The front desk attendant said that we could check the next day to see if a King room became available. One did become available in the Maui wing and it was very nice. The weather in Maui was wonderful all week. Sunny and in the 80's everyday. One thing we didn't know was that if you wanted a cabana on the beach, it would cost you $US30 a day. So we did that for a couple of days as I couldn't lie directly in the sun so didn't have much choice. You do have to get there early though if you want one as they run out quickly. One of the neat things was the whales. You could actually see humpback whales spouting and beaching from the beach! We also drove the Road to Hana. Gotta get up early to beat the rush. We got on the road by 6am, stopped in at Charley's Restaurant in Paia which is at the start of the Hana Highway. Charley's is a great place for breakfast and apparently Willie Nelson hangs out there! I had a huge delicious macadamia nut pancake with coconut syrup. Delicious! My husband had a breakfast burritto which was huge and yummy. Charley's was featured on the Food Network Show "$40 a Day" so I had to try it out! It opens at 7am. The drive to Hana takes all day. We didn't get back to our hotel until after 5pm. Saw some amazing sights along the way like waterfalls, lush tropical forests, black sand beaches, etc. Very pretty, but the road is very curvey and dangerous so you have to be extra cautious. The locals take the curves fairly fast! And there are lots of one lane bridges. Maui is expensive so be prepared to open your wallet for lots of things. Even the drinks at our resort were $8 each so we stuck to Happy Hour at $5 each. It's different than a Mexican All Inclusive, but the difference is you can explore the island in a rental car and feel safe. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and the staff and service were very good. It is the most Hawaiian hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Three days at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: We were a little disappointed with our experience at Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. The room was small, musty, outdated and the carpet was stained. The staff was hospitable and the food was fair. We felt the Ka'anapali was not a bad place to stay, but it was further from the best too.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me by booking a trip for the two of us for a weekend at this hotel. We currently live on Oahu, and were looking for a relaxing and romantic weekend. Boy did we get it!! Because of our evening flight, we weren't able to check in till about 10 pm, but the staff was still great! The hotel is about 45 min. away from the airport, but the drive is lovely. The bed was a bit hard, but if you call the front desk they will have an egg carton pad sent up and that makes a world of difference. Upon check in you will receive two free days of complimentary all you can eat buffet breakfast for two (four coupons). The breakfast is great: fruit, cheese, cold cuts, sausage, baccon, bagles, eggs, pancakes, creps, cereal, oat meal, has browns, basically you name it they have it. It's free and all you can eat! My husband and I then were able to take a shuttle to go shopping. The shuttle only cost $1 per person per ride. Not bad, but you'll have to rent a car to get to the hotel from the airport, so you might as well drive. The hotel provides cabanas on the beach right next to the surf. You can charge your room for a rental for an entire day for only $38 (8 hours) or you can rent the cabana for half a day for only $21. It is well worth it!! It's like lying in bed on the beach with shade that you can move around! The dinner at the Tiki Terrace Restaurant was AWESOME! We only paid $50 and had the best pork chops and new york steak of our lives. There was also live music and dancing and everything is practically outside. It felt very classicly old fashioned. I would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect or fancy, but would happily stay again”
Reviews.Author: DMonette
Reviews.Content: I already did my research and knew what to expect before I got there. It is an older hotel, but the service from the staff was outstanding. The breakfast at the Mixed Plate was fine. It had a good mix from eggs to fish to breads and cereals. It was to appeal to a very diverse group of visitors. It was good, but the food could be hotter. The hostess was as nice as can be. Remembered us every morning. Our room was disappointing at first. I had expected a non-smoking room with a queen size bed. Instead it was smoking with two double beds. Because the room smelled clean and free of smoke, we decided not to complain and just keep the room. The small bed was cozy. Still would have like the queen, but we made do. Our housekeeper was Editha. She kept our room spotless and never bothered us. She was always pleasant in the halls, smiling and wishing us well. The day we left, we caught up with her and left her a tip and a Thank You for keeping our room so nice. Unfortunately, we tend to forget these people who clean up after us and they work so hard. It made us feel good seeing her smile and she was pleased that we recognized her hard work. I'm glad we didn't complain about the room, because although smoke seeped under the door from the hall a couple of times, we just opened the lanai and it was fine. I also discovered that the glass sliders when closed really blocked out the sound from the garden area. I heard some music at night from all the partiers at our hotel and beyond, but it was not enough to keep me awake. The staff was great. We loved the cook in the Tiki Restaurant who made the pancakes and omelets. What a comedian. The hula show had personable entertainers. Drinks in the garden area were very good. Valet parking was quick and efficient. Every morning, the groundskeepers worked hard raking leaves, trimming bushes and picking up after the party people from the night before. The garden was always perfectly manicured and lounge chairs back in their places before most people woke up. We strolled through the other hotels and yes they are more grand, but not worth the extra money to me. I would rather spend the money we save on dinner cruises and helicopter tours, etc. Probably the very best part of this is the location. The beach was perfect , black rock is a short stroll for snorkelers (I wish I could have done this, but was just getting over surgery), Whalers Village was a 5 minute walk with great shopping and dining. Rusty Harpoon was great. Just from standing on the beach we saw turtles and whales swimming. Would we come back??? YES. In a heartbeat. I look forward to returning someday.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ this hotel for 3 nights while in Maui Feb 19th to 22nd. The room was good. Really liked the parking ramps on same level as our room. Parking was 6 dollars a day and also had to pay for the use of the safe. We had a partial ocean view which was good. Roomy patios. Enjoyed the breakfast's. They were similar to what you would get on a cruise ship. Sunday brunch is good in the restarant in the back-service was a little slow. It was our first morning there so we were anxious to explore. Maui is absolutley gorgeous. We enjoyed every minute there. Loved the atmosphere and the people. Staff friendly. Would stay there again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Impression”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here, Feb. 2005. My room upon check in smelled bad, was very cold and damp feeling. Returning to the front desk I was told they were running at 100% and another room would not be available for a couple of days. I returned to the desk again at which time they moved me to a room that was at least dry feeling. The next day I was moved to another room which was tolerable. I had never stayed at this hotel before so I did not know what to expect, having stayed there once now I would never stay there again. The best thing I encountered was the staff at check in she worked very hard and I am sure she went out of here way to help me during my stay. I commend all of the staff, I just was not impressed with the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Riley5788
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at this hotel in August '04. It was a great choice for us because we didn't need something really fancy. We were happy to have a clean, well maintained hotel to come back to at night. Instead of spending the outrageous rates at the larger hotels down the beach we spent our vacation funds on romantic dinners and excursions. The staff at this hotel were always friendly and willing to help out. As far as the food, we bought the breakfast package and were able to find enough choices at the Mixed Plate restaurant for breakfast all week. That's about the only meal I would advise at that restaurant, though. The hotel has great pool-side food (although a little pricey) and I strongly recc. the terriyaki burger. We tried the more formal restaurant once and had average food and similar service. The pool is nice for families but we weren't over-run by children which was nice for us (we were on our honeymoon after all). And there were many lounge chairs around the pool and the surrounding green space. The beach in front of the hotel is the best for miles and the snorkleing right off the beach (black rock) is outstanding. We made the mistake of paying for the $75/person snorkle trip to Molokini and ended up seeing many more fish and 7 giant sea turtles for free at Black Rock. Over all a very memorable trip, helped in part by this nice hotel. One more thing, believe everyone when they say the best show in Hiawaii (and maybe anywhere) is Warren and Annabelles Magic Show.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Traditions - Marginal Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: baileyno6
Reviews.Content: While the KBH does seem to be the "Most Hawaiian hotel", the bad smell and marginal rooms made for a below average stay. We made our reservation over the phone and were clear we wanted to attend the Ohana Breakfast. Upon arrival, the clerk said that we were not entitled to it. After objecting, he relented, but it felt like we were "ripping them off". Not a good start. Then the room was small, basic and plain. That was the good part. The walls are thin and it smelled - bad. So, it was easy to spend the day outside. The location is okay - not a beach to snorkel at, but if you've been to Maui, you know that. The traditions at the hotel are nice. You feel good upon leaving with their farewell ceremony. All in all, we will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, but not spectacular (3.5 stars)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the KBH. Overall, it was a very good place to stay. It's located in Ka'anapali, along a strip of about 8-10 different hotels and condos along the beach. The main thing holding me back from giving it a higher rating is that several of the other hotels along that strip appeared more luxurious and impressive. That said, KBH was more reasonably priced than the others. Pros: (1) great location -- five minute walk to the Whaler's Village shopping area and its fun outdoor bars/restaurants; could also easily walk to several other hotels; (2) great beach -- along with the Sheraton next door, it appeared to be one of the best beach locations in Ka'anapali, with wide beaches and safe swimming; (3) room placement -- it appeared that every room has at least a marginal view of the ocean; we stayed in a "partial ocean view" room on the third floor in the Maui wing, and we had a very niceview of the pool and ocean; (4) nightly entertainment -- although we never made the nightly hotel entertainment our main event, it was very nice that every evening, while we had cocktails on our balcony and got ready to go out to dinner, there was a live band playing Hawaiian music; (5) pretty big room -- not huge and nothing fancy, but plenty of room to spread out; also, large shower/bath; (6) easy and close parking -- no need for valet; (7) decent bar and grill outside, which was nice and convenient for beach days; (8) room was pretty clean. Cons: (1) not fancy; we had a little bit of "hotel envy" towards some of the neighboring hotels like the Sheraton, Westin, Marriott, and Ka'anapali Alli; (2) pool is weak (although we went more for the beach, so it didn't bother us too much); (3) we did not find the staff to be as exceptionally friendly as their reputation on these boards and in some travel guides; that said, they were not bad either; but, with a few exceptions, we generally did not find the staff overly nice or accommodating, especially compared to the place we stayed next in Kauai; in particular, the people at the towel station outside were relatively unhelpful and unfriendly; (4) "free" breakfast at the Mixed Plate restaurant was pretty bad and basically felt like a school/dorm cafeteria; if you can, skip the room w/ breakfast deal and find yourself a cheaper, better, and less gross breakfast somewhere off-grounds; (5) bus into nearby town of Lahaina only ran once an hour and stopped running at 9:20 pm; however, this may be a common issue for every hotel in Ka'anapali unless other hotels/condos have their own shuttles into Lahaina, which most don't seem to. Overall: price was pretty good, but it's not some fantastic out-of-this-world deal; we pretty much felt like we got what we paid for: a decent hotel at a mid-range price with a great location. We'd probably stay there again, although we'd be tempted to check out another place if the cost weren't too much higher.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the KBH!”
Reviews.Author: maxxy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel in Maui and loved every minute of the experience! We requested and recieved a room in the Maui wing which faced the beautiful grounds and the ocean. The room had a king sized bed, was plenty big enough, and nicely decorated. We were on the 4th floor (out of 6) which was great for the view. The free breakfast served at the Mixed Plate each morning was wonderful - a very good variety of food with lots of fruit, eggs, sausage, cereal, pastries, etc. The show out in the courtyard each night from 6:30 till 9:00 was delightful. For the first hour of so Rudy and his small band played Island music with hula dancers to entertain you and then after a break the band came back to play regular music for the crowd to dance to. My husband went fishing one on the days and brought back some Ahi he caught. The chef at the Tiki Terrace outdoor restaurant agreed to fix it for us and it was absolutely delicious! Meals at all Maui restaurants are very expensive so we were happy they only charge us $19 a plate for the incredible ahi meal. There is no better beach in all of Maui. It is huge and was never crowded. A short two minute walk away is Black Rock which had the best snorkeling we experienced, and that includes a boat trip out to Molokini Crater. The snorkeling was the best in the early morning hours. You do have to pay $6/day for parking but another thing about the Maui wing is that is connects directly to the parking garage so was very convienient. It is also just a short walk over to Whalers Village with some good shopping and places to eat. One of the best meals we had was at Leilannis - we ate inside upstairs and watched an incredible sunset over the ocean. The staff at the KBH was very nice - the going home ceremony held the morning you leave was touching. I should say that the KBH is NOT the Sheraton next door as far as being super fancy if that's what you want. Instead it is a comfortable, fun, and relaxing atmosphere with no pretense of high class ritz. Every day they offer free classes (be sure to sign up ahead of time). I took a class in lei making and even brought my fresh flower lei home with me. We certainly are looking forward to returning to the KBH in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The KBH is an older property that is nice but not glamorous. It has a very nice beach and good location close to the Whaler's Village, but it's not as classy and polished as the Sheraton next door. The room was nice, big and clean, but you feel as though you are in a nice motel as opposed to a fancy upscale resort. The pool was small and cold and the grounds were O.K. The breakfasts were pretty good in the outside restaurant(omlettes - pancakes made to order), and the service throughout the hotel was very good. If you're on your honeymoon and you can afford better, try the Sheraton, otherwise the KBH will do for most people on a limited budget. For dinner or drinks, the Hula grill and Leilanis were great at the nearby Whaler's village. If you are golfing on your trip, the courses were better in Wailea or Kapalua as opposed to Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: dkbrig
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 15th wedding anniversary in paradise....the 19th through the 22nd. I did a lot of research and I wasn't dissapointed! Even with research, you never know what your going to encounter so in all honesty, we were nervous. KBH is a very well ran facility. The entire staff is very friendly and the farewell ceremony is a sincere thank-you, with a hearfelt personal invitation to return to KBH! It is often the personal touch you remember so much, and KBH tries very hard to do that. We had so many memories and WOW, you have to see it to believe it. While watching the visitor channel, Kaanapali Beach is the number 1 beach in Maui, rated by all visitors to Maui. As I was watching the top 10 list dwindle down, I kept thinking...."wow, Kaanapali Beach didn't even make the list!" and so I was very proud when number one came up and it was the very beach we were sitting on! We were looking for the type of vacation where we could really just relax. There is soooo much to do there, but we chose to sit by the beach and just enjoy the scenery. For the price, the atmosphere and the location, you really can't go wrong! If you are the type of people who really like to be pampered, you are looking for the best quality and are quick to complain, I would look elsewhere. It is Maui, in January! What more could you ask for! We will be returning....

Reviews.Title: “No problem with the Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pattie-2004
Reviews.Content: I just read the review posted by someone from Phoenix. It was stated that those who have written good reviews on the K Beach Hotel are either owners or tourists who don't know any better. Well I'm sure not an owner, but I am a tourist who does know better! And I also do my research before I travel. I have been to Hawaii three times. The last time was Feb. 04, and my husband and I stayed at the KBH. I did a lot of research on this hotel before booking it. I found that some of the bldgs were renovated and some not. I then requested a room in one of the re-done wings. Our room was perfect, and very updated. No smell either. The ocean was a bit rough during our stay, but it isn't always like that. A lot depends on the time of year that you are there. Sometimes it is worth strolling a bit north or south on that stretch of beach to check out other swimming possibilities. The boardwalk that runs in that area is great for walking and exploring. In my trips to Hawaii, I have never had a bad experience with any hotel. And we never use a travel agent. I can do more research than a travel agent would ever care to, or have the time to do. My sister-in-law is an agent, and I'd never dream of letting her plan my trips. The KBH is in a great location. Their grounds are nice and kept up. They aren't a Hyatt but don't have Hyatt prices either. I knew before we stayed there that it wasn't a five star hotel, but I checked out everything about it. I went to their website and even printed out a map/diagram of the property which was color coded with the types of rooms, wing(bldg) names, proximity to the pool and beach. All of this paid off and we were not disappointed. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Our Maui Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love to travel, and examine all the "little things" about what makes a hotel special or unique when we stay there because we do travel so often. Of all the places we have stayed, we love Hawaii the best. There just is no comparison to anywhere else in the beauty of the islands and the friendliness of the people. We just got back from our second stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. The first time was in 1999, and this time was from Jan. 7 - 15 for our 25th wedding anniversary. We loved it just as much this time as the last time. We stayed in the Moloka'i wing in an ocean front room both times. It was pure paradise. We took a walk over to another wing just to see if there were any differences. We did not notice any smells in the halls or in the rooms. We spent time on the beach every day, renting cabanas each time. On certain days of our stay, the surf was much higher due to the time of year, but it affected all the hotels on our strip and on all of Maui, not just the KBH. As the hotel employees and the visitor channel stated, the red flag and signs are always up - just to show the dangers of the ocean. Most days the surf was perfect and fun. We snorkeled, rode the waves, and enjoyed the laughter of others experiencing the same thing. Saw whales breaching right from shore on two different days - it was amazing! Bottom line: If you want to relax on the most beautiful beach in the world during the day, go out to a nice dinner at night, and come back to dance in the courtyard to Hawaiian music with the one you love each night - stay at the KBH. If you are picky about unimportant things, or want the college party scene you should stay somewhere else. The KBH is not just a hotel, it is a state of mind...It broke our hearts when we had to leave. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “It Stinks!”
Reviews.Author: Arizona_RVers
Reviews.Content: The raving reviews of the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel make me think they were either written by the owners or by tourists who don't know any better. We stayed there 1/12/05. The hotel is marginal at best. The carpets have a horrendous smell. Really. It almost smells as if someone who has not had a bath for a week or two is standing next to you when you walk out into the hallways of the hotel. Yes, the grounds are pretty, but how many of those who have stayed there actually spend any good beach time there? The surf is way too rough for kids, there are signs all over the place warning the guests about the surf. Trust me, there are lovely places to stay on Maui that are A) Cheaper, B) Have a better beach, and C) Are not rediculous tourist traps. We will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good experience”
Reviews.Author: mimib
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Kaanapali Beach Hotel, had a good experience all around, evening entertainment was the best. Hospitality genuine, and the kukua beads lei at the end was so sweet. Our rooms were in the Kaui building, I'm not sure I spelled this correctly, but i think it was the older section. We had two teens with us, the room had two double beds, and a tiny bathroom-our biggest complaint was that the dresser drawers smelled weird, so we could not put our clothes into them. But on the whole it was a good experience, and a reasonable price. We would go back, loved the beach and the board walk, and it was near black rock, for snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: pnadler
Reviews.Content: I am giving KBH 4 stars for the exceptional value of the hotel given it's fantastic location and the price of our stay there. We spent 4 nights there over Thanksgiving, and really had our anxious moments considering we had just left the Princeville Hotel on Kauai. This was definitely our "budget" hotel for the trip (11 days, 3 islands), and the $250/nt price included a rental car and breakfast. When we pulled up, I was thrilled with the location, which, as many here have previously mentioned, is on a beautiful beach with relatively calm waters and always warm waters year-round. In the winter months, you can see whales right from the beach, and there is wonderful snorkling (sea turtles abound) and scuba diving at Black Rock right down the beach, a couple hundred yards away. In the other direction, again, about 100 yards, is the fabulous Whaler's Village, with the usual upscale shops, but also some unique Hawaiian craft stores and some good restaurants. KBH prides itself on being "Hawaii's Most Hawaiian Hotel," and they really are. They tell you all kinds of folk stories at the first day "orientation breakfast." They also give you a kukui nut lei when you depart. They are friendly, and go out of their way to help, and I have to admit, I would be very likely to stay there again, despite my inital concerns when I read some of the comments here about the wicker furniture and the like. The rooms are average hotel rooms, but have room to stretch out, and you cannot hear anything through the walls or from the floors above you, which was a relief. The turn-down service each night is a nice touch, and the cookies and orchids they leave are very nice. They even left a little bottle of champagne for my parents who were celebrating their 40th anniversary, and gave them memorial luggage tags the night before they left. The hotel also has convenient laundry facilities, which we desperately needed and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “The KBH is WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Candy-n-Scott
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the KBH from 12/9/04 - 12/14/04. We had a partial oceanview room, but we could only see a tiny bit of the ocean, mostly it was a garden view. Nevertheless, the grounds are gorgeous! And the rooms are fantastic. The furniture is all new and tropical looking. The bathrooms were clean and roomy. Everythings was just great! And the employees really do make you feel special. We paid for valet parking which is only a couple bucks extra per day (plus tips) but the bellman were awesome! We just called down to the bell desk when we were getting ready to leave and they'd have the car ready for us, cleaned out from the day before, the top down and ready to go! We ate at the Tiki Terrace one night and had the traditional Hawaiian meal. The bamboo salad, roasted banana and pineapple, and steamed fish were excellent, but the poi, OY! And the desserts were heavenly. Food from the Tiki Bar was good, for bar food. The welcome breakfast was ok, nothing to write home about. Our package included free breakfast everyday. Again, it was just ok. I would try to work another deal out with the hotel other than the free breakfast - and then just pay for breakfast in the restaurant (which looked very good). The Mixed Plate Grill was closed for renovation while we were there, so I don't know what it's like. Also, you have to REQUEST the nightly turn down service in order for them to turn your covers down and put the Hawaiian cookies on your pillow. They don't just do that automatically. The only thing we were disappointed with at the KBH was our farewell ceremony. The night before our departure, we received an invitation to the farewell ceremony that takes place in the lobby between 8 and 12 at every hour on the hour. We went down at 11:45 and waited. At 12:05 when no one approached us, we were told that since there were only two of us, we could just get our leis from the bell desk out front...no ceremony! NOTE: I did write the KBH after our return home to let them know of our disappointment and they sent us a sincere apology and some chocolate covered macadamia nuts. While on Maui, you do not under any circumstances need a 4WD vehicle. We drove completely around the island (on both sides) and never needed one. The drive North of Kaanapali onto the Northern coast and around to central Maui was breathtaking. It wasn't dangerous at all (as the maps suggest). There were many other tourists checking the area out (altho it wasn't crowded). One of the best sights is the blowhole. You'll know you're there when you see a bunch of cars parked near boulders with rocks stacked on top of them. Just walk down a little bit (or all the way) and you'll see the blowhole. It's amazing! We also drove the road to Hana all the way around and didn't have any trouble. The road is dirt in some parts, but I never felt scared or in danger. In fact, the back side of Maui was simply breathtaking....especially around 4 pm when the sun casts wonderful shadows on the back side of Haleakula. We bought the book called "Maui Revealed" from the gift shop at KBH and used it like a bible to find all these wonderful places. I recommend it! ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Beach, Great Hospitality and Amazing Tiki Bar !”
Reviews.Author: FutureAstronaut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel, Maui, for our honeymoon. This is a great bargain hotel ! The room is clean, the staffs are very friendly and helpful. We booked our flight and hotel via Travelocity. We paid for an ocean front room and received a confirmation from Travelocity. When we got there, Ka'anapali Beach Hotel didn't have our reservation. They called Travelocity and Travelocity couldn't even locate our hotel reservation. It took them more than 30 minutes to get back to Ka'anapali Beach Hotel and almost 24 hours to get our reservation faxed to the hotel. Because Travelocity messed up our hotel reservation, we were not able to get an Ocean Front room, but we did get an Ocean View room. Through all that, the hotel staff who was helping us was very patient, helpful and understanding. The Tiki Bar at this hotel is the best in Kaanapali beach. I understood that guests from next door luxury hotels such as Marriott, Sheraton etc come to this bar to hang-out. Our favourite bar tender is Dale. His Mai Tai, Pina Colada and friendliness are worth flying 11 hours for ! The Sunday Champange Brunch is very affordable and the food is better than any 5-star restaurant. This hotel provides a live nightly entertainment. The band is great ! Rudy's voice is very soothing and give you that wow-my-vacation-just-got-better feeling . The room towels are a bit small and rough but I got over that in no time because the view from our 5th floor room is just breath-taking. We were thinking about staying at the Westin or Marriott, and were glad that we did not because the best spot on the Kaanapali beach is right in front of the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. I will never do business with Travelocity again but my husband and I are already planning to return to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel in May 2005!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location, good ocean view, caring staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: jamestom
Reviews.Content: Wonderful memories and smooth service and convienence. There were no hitches and staff were all great. My best memory was how they handled my sweathearts birthday, not only taking a flower order, but the activities manager hand-made a lai with tradition birthday significance (inter-twined fern and tea flower). The breakfast service inclusion is not recommended (in the garden/drivway facing plain coffee-shop), but we were able apply our bkfst tickets to the resturant that is open to the ocean-side at rear. Interesting layout of 2 story motel-like but facing garden that opens to the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel with a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of spending a week at the KBH right before Thanksgiving. We chose to upgrade to an oceanfront room, and WOW, were we happy about that decision! The view from our room (#302 Molokai Bldg.) was AMAZING - day and night! There is nothing like waking up to the waves crashing on the beach and a view of Molokai and Lanai from your bed. I only wish we could have brought the view home with us. We did takea ton of pictures from the balcony, so I don't think we'll forget it anytime soon. The hotel is quite cute. You'll feel like you literally stepped into an episode of the Brady Bunch when you arrive in the lobby. Fancy it's not, but it does have a certain charm and we felt right at home once we checked into our room. No, the rooms aren't top of the line furnishings, but they do make you feel like you are in the islands, and after all, isn't that why you're here? Everyone from the check-in person to the maids were very nice, and they always greeted us with an "Aloha" when we passed by them. Oh, and you will LOVE the coconut macadamia nut cookies they leave on your pillow each night with turn down service! My husband and I are avid travelers, and we have stayed in many overly nice luxury hotels (in fact we came to Maui after spending 3 nights at the Hilton Waikaloa on the Big Island), but we both loved our stay at the KBH and we hope to go back someday and ask for the same room. You can't beat the location of this hotel, right on the best strand of Kaanapali Beach. Who needs a giant pool with superslides when you have the beautiful Maui ocean right there? Take advantage of Black Rock snorkeling and check out the restaurants at Whaler's Village (especially Hula Grill, our personal favorite). If you don't want to sit in a dark hotel restaurant over breakfast, take a walk along the beach to the Marriott at the other end of the beach walk. They have great options for breakfast and you'll get some exercise while you're at it. As one of the previous reviewers mentioned, the Kaanapali Beach Hotel is NOT the Ritz. Don't come here expecting ritzy rooms and people waiting on you hand and foot. But if you are looking for a beach escape to a beautiful location, think about choosing the KBH. Whatever you choose, have a wonderful vacation. It would be next to impossible to not have a good time in Maui....it's AMAZING!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fake and negligent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Avoid the fakeness of this "Hawaiian hospitality" and certainly avoid the valets. After damaging my rental car, the hotel refused to take responsibility, which caused me hours of paperwork and some money. I wish that I had not chosen this hotel -- it is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Maui-we spent 4 nights at Kaanapali. Location is great-beautiful beach, great pool, loved the grounds. Our room was ok-older, could use some re-decorating, but the view was nice. You're really not in the room enough anyhow-- Fun little Tiki Bar, and Tiki Grill for lunch/snacks, etc. Nice jaunt up the beach to many other restaurants, bars, shopping, etc---we enjoyed ourselves immensely-and would go back in a minute! Maui was gorgeous!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: zeul
Reviews.Content: This place is a great value. We reserved garden view but as honeymooners were upgraded to a really nice room on a corner with a good partial view of the ocean, beach, etc. It is walking distance to Whalers Village & to Black Rock for snorkeling, has beautiful grounds (the Sheraton looked like it was a concrete jungle), a tiki bar & grill, a nightly hula & musical show. The hotel staff is very nice - our housekeeper even brought us flowers from her garden! The welcome breakfast could be skipped. We ate & took off. The talk was mostly pretty cheesy & sell heavy - geared to older folks.

Reviews.Title: “Most Hawaiian”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After leaving Waikiki on Oahu, we spent the second week of our honeymoon in March 2004 in Kaanapali Beach Hotel. It was a bit difficult to receive some information at the airport, because the hotel does not provide an own shuttle. As booked in our German travel agency, we expected the "Garden view" room for a moderate price. We found in the room a bottle of bubbly and a nice greeting card, but unfortunately the room itself was located in the ground floor of Moloka'i wing, next to the fence & street and the room smelled like newly painted/treated in some way. We refused to stay in this room. After some arrangements we were offered a pool/partly over the ocean room upstairs in the Maui wing. Very friendly offer! The room was furnished the hawaiian way, quite clean. We found every evening some Hawaiian goodies on our blanket (cookies or chocolate). The complementary breakfast on our first morning was not so tempting: dark, too cold room, mainly Japanese specialities, lots of presentations "where to spend your money", elder audience. We decided to have our breakfast in the Whaler's village or in other restaurants in Lahaina the following days. The activities in the hotel, like lei making and hula dancing were quite fun. The Hawaiian teacher of lei-making - very nice person, curious about other cultures. My dried, self-made ti-leaf lei is still hanging over our window, here in Finland! And my ti-plant growing! Also, the beautiful Plumeria blossoms on the bushes and lying all over the hotel garden, made this stay unforgettable. However, we experienced also the rough weather changes (and huuuge waves) of Maui. The Tiki shows were nice to watch from the balcony, drinking a Maitai. I would recommend Kaanapali rather than Lahaina itself if you look for a quiet vacation. The sunset between the two islands: Molokai and Lanai is an experience!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pleased with our Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from KBH and were there for 10 nights for our Honeymoon. We feel that the hotel met all of our needs and because of the fact that we are travellers that research ahead of time, we also had appropriate expectations. Keep in mind that I am a rather fussy traveller - not expecting bells and whistles - but, do expect a clean and well-kept place to stay. KBH is just that! Sure you could have stayed next door at the Sheraton - pools galore, ambiance, etc. - but....Wooh! Pricey! The location was ideal - minutes (on foot) to Whaler's Village. Our room was ocean front (6th floor)....how often are ya going to lay in bed and look at the ocean the minute that you wake up?! It was overall a nice experience.... just don't walk in expecting a Brand New hotel...it's not! But, it's CLEAN, Location is GREAT and a Good Value. By the way, I am going through withdrawal missing my FAVORITE drink the Ka'anapali Flow at the Tiki Bar (Can't get that in MN!)

Reviews.Title: “An honest review. Nothing spectacular but very well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: bjwood72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in July '04 for my honeymoon. I recommend staying in one of the renovated wings of the hotel. Was originally put in an old wing and asked to move because of old carpets, furnishings, damp feeling...etc., was moved next morning. The newer wings are much nicer and just feel cleaner and brighter. You can't beat the location of this hotel, great beach, snorkeling, walking distance to shopping. The view is spectacular from the ocean facing lanai. The hotel has huge grounds that are nice and well maintained, the pool is simple (didn't care anyway because wasn't in Hawaii to sit by a pool). They have parking but the spaces are very tight, not a big issue. Hotel puts on a show every evening with singing and dancing which is a nice touch. They also have many vacation packages that should be taken advantage of. The Mixed Plate has food you would expect to get at any buffet. Since I am not picky in what I eat I liked everything but I can see some people not being impressed (we only ate breakfast there, can't speak for other meals). The restaurant at the hotel is good, not great. The menu has a lot to offer as well as many specials. We ate outside during the evening show and really enjoyed it. Overall the hotel offers everything a vacationer needs. Don't expect an expensive resort with the spectacular pools and fancy architecture. I feel it is well worth the value. I would recommend staying here and will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week mid september. We were not surprised at the resort and its age since we did extensive research via books and online. Everything we read said the same thing-that it is an older hotel, but definitely well run and a great place to stay. Our room was in the Molokai wing and was quite nice-Hampton Inn level not Hilton level. We had a king bed and a twin and there was still plenty of space in the room for moving around-quite roomy Because it was exactly as we expected we enjoyed it immensely. We emailed them ahead of time and asked for an upgrade which we got. We also got the plastic champagne glasses(so what...it was a fun cute idea) with the small cheap bottle of champagne. It was fun and we enjoyed the atmosphere. The location was to die for!!! It was amazing to see the beach and hear the waves from our room. I felt completely relaxed walking around the resort in my bathing suit and bare feet. I didn't feel the need to get dressed up to go out of my room like I do when at higher end resorts. The sunsets we took each evening from our lanai were so amazing they look like post cards. We didn't eat at the resort at all...not sure why, except we purchased a book about hidden restaurants in Maui and we chose to do those kinds of things. We were looking for an "off the beaten path, not run of the mill, not hoity toity, absolutely relaxing and restful no kids" kind of place and we got it!!! We will definitely go back again and without the kids again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: 8031pc
Reviews.Content: We spent one week at KBH for our honeymoon as part of a package deal through Hawaiian Airlines. This was our first time to Hawaii and we had an awsome time. I picked the KBH for its price, value, and beachfront location. We got stuck in the Lanai building and I believe that this is one of the older buildings in the complex. When we arrived we were not greeted as I had had imagined. We checked in and our room was not ready yet. I asked for a free upgrade (as I have read here) but was nicely denied. They finally gave us a room. We got to our room and it had a bottle of champagne, two cheap plastic wine glasses and a letter addressed to a different couple. Obviously this room was meant for some one else. About an hour or so later a bell boy came up and said he was to pick up something but didn't know what. We assumed correctly that it was the champagne. He took the items and off he went, no sorries or apologies. I was starting to get the feeling that no one knew exactly what was going on at this place. A few days later they did send up to us our own set of cheap plastic wine glasses and Korbel champagne. Our room was decent for the price. It definately wasn't four or five star quality but it sufficed. The closet door stuck alot and you had to pay a riduculous $1.50 per day fee to use their small safe. Our TV went out twice and had to be replaced. Their service was prompt though. Be advised: There is no room service at this hotel, also no spa or any of those luxury amenities. Our room opened to the center court area of the hotel. The lanai was spacious and we could see part of the ocean from it. The hotel has only one pool and it is quite small for a hotel this size I thought. One of the benefits of KBH is their complimentary breakfast. It has all the goodies but got old after a few days. Probably the best thing this hotel has going for it is that it is right on Kaanapali Beach with the "big boy" hotels. The beach was litterally 100 feet from our lanai. With the slider open, we could hear the waves crashing ashore at night. I'm glad I did not book in Kehei. This beach is completely awesome. The water is perfect and the sand is very soft. So in conclusion if you are looking for a decent hotel without spending a million dollars, stay here, but if you want the four star treatment look else where. In the end, I was satisfied with KBH, no more and no less. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: ET88BaskingRidge_NJ
Reviews.Content: Our group of nine travelers from the East Coast was impressed with the information that the Kaanapali Beach was the 'most Hawaiian' of the Maui hotels. That and the moderate room rates influenced our decision to choose the resort. The rooms are clean and neat, the location ideal and the staff genuinely gracious and friendly. But be advised this is definitely a notch or two below the surrounding hotels. For those traveling great distances for a 'once in a life time' vacation, all nine of us would advise saving your pennies for a more upscale experience. If price is more important than ambience, this family friendly place would be a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel! I wouldn't hesitate referring my friends and family to stay here. Prime location, very friendly staff, nice rooms and grounds! I was worried when I read some of the negetive reviews, but when I arrived I felt like I made the right decision. Don't forget if your on your honeymoon to let them know.

Reviews.Title: “It was like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had just a few nights at the KBH but we loved every moment of it. The room was not the most modern decor but it only leant to a homey atmosphere. The staff were incredibly friendly and the location was great for beach access and walkability. Going one way you hit Black Rock and some great snorkeling and the other way you get the shopping of Whaler's Village. It offers a little something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Best hotel on Kaanapali Beach. Let me say straight out, if you want silk sheets, a giant pool, and to go to the bathroom on gilded gold plate, then go elsewhere. Elsewhere also includes ridiculous prices, tons of people and kids, and an automaton corporate staff. The facilities at the KBH are nice, clean, and extremely comfortable. We had an ocean front room and the view and access to the beach were incredible. The hotel is about 500 yards south of black rock, some of the best snorkeling on the island. We snorkeled straight out from our room and saw rays, turtles, and a rainbow of fish. The KBH has the best stretch of beach on Kaanapali. All the other hotels, both spartan and luxury had very small and very crowded beaches. At medium to high tide, most people south of the KBH have to sit on the grass of the hotel because there is no more sand. Not at KBH they have the widest, cleanest, least crowded beach in the whole area. My wife and I ran into several people who walked up or down from the "luxury places" to enjoy our beach. The grounds of the hotel are impeccable. Grass, exotic flowers, bushes, all well manicured and clean. Dozens of coconut and bannana trees surround the inner garden area. These trees really have bunches of coconuts and bannanas hanging from them, looked really cool. You've heard all the stories, some may think they are cliches, about the "most Hawaiin" hotel on Maui. Well, there true. Everyone we met or interacted with were great. Always quick with a smile and an "Aloha". The housekeeping was timely and we never wanted for towels, pillows, etc...The entire staff seemed as if they really cared not only about the guests, but also about their job, and most importantly, their culture. Make time to take some of the classes offered by the staff, they are well worth it. The food and drinks at the Tiki Terrace were always great. The food from the Tiki Bar and Grill always hit the spot. Quite convenient to order and carry stuff down to the beach. Don't miss the show from 6-9 nightly next to the Tiki Bar. Great authentic Hawaiin music, dancing, and great stories. We returned to the show about 4 different nights, and enjoyed it in a new way everytime. Definetly rent a car. Maui is pretty easy to explore in its entirety in about 7 days , if you have a car. Parking at the KBH was easy, in a covered lot, and only 6$ a day. My wife and I were celebrating our 10th Aniv. and the trip was FANTASTIC. The hotel, staff, food, and location only enhanced our pleasure and enjoyment. I read many reviews on this site for many months. I'll admit, I was a bit leary of the KBH. Now that I have been there, let me tell you, don't cheat yourself, make your own decision. If you are really experiencing your travel partner, and the Island, and the culture, and the beauty, how can you possibly complain about old fixtures, smoke smell, bad traffic, wind, prices etc...??? Hang loose bra, you're in paradise. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “We're heading back to Kaanapali Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Beach Hotel - no ka oi We have been there 3 times, and have a 4th trip planned. Accommodations are very nice, clean, well kept. People at the hotel are absolutely great!!

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Maui and absolutely loved the KBH. The location is FANTASTIC. Sure, the decor could use some "sprucing up", but who cares, really? It's not like we spent that much time in our room, though we did have a gorgeous view in our partial oceanview room. The beach is beautiful and uncrowded. There's so much to do just walking distance away. We'll definitely return to the KBH, hopefully very soon!

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 nights at the KBH. Sorry if this review is a bit long, but they deserve it!! There were four of us, including my son, 17 and daughter, 15. We had an ocean view room with two double beds. The room was spacious enough to give us all room and the lanai overlooked the spacious courtyard to a view of the beach and ocean. At night, the sun would set in the distance, the courtyard tiki torches would be glowing and we would be serenaded by the nightly Hawaiian hula and music show at the Tiki Bar. If you walk up and down the beach, you will see many hotels with fancy pools and a sea of lounge chairs and a small strip of sand. At the KBH, there's a small pool and a very large courtyard and easy access to a large beach area. The green space creates a great setting. We had dinner at the Tiki Terrace restaurant and it may have been the best meal we had in Hawaii. We took advantage of the free Hawaiian activities, including lei making, sandprints and pineapple cutting. It's rare to stay at a hotel and have them greet you and call you by name as you walk through. There was an orientation breakfast that was enjoyable and funny as much as it was informative. I recommend making sure to go to it. The staff makes sure the Hawaiian heritage comes through in everything. At the end of the stay, there's a farewell ceremony when they present you with a lei and a hug. You're welcomed back as extended Ohana (family) and you feel that way. We saw many hotels on Maui, including the ones up and down Ka'anapali Beach, and this one doesn't have the flash, but it has the class. When we left, both my son and daughter remarked that they would never want to stay at another place. That's high praise from a couple of teenagers!!! Don't be afraid to book it, take advantage of everything they have to offer, and have a great Hawaiian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on Ka'anapali”
Reviews.Author: soozee56723
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel the last 3 years in a row. Everytime we go back, it's like going home. The people who work there are friendly, sincere, and the atmosphere is laid back unlike the other chain hotels on the beach. There are complimentary Hawaiian activities, and hula shows with music every night. Their section of the beach is the best on Ka'anapali. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with a nice Hawaiian feel, with a nightly turn-down service. They really make you feel like a part of their family, especially with their good-bye ceremony. They also have the best Pina Coladas and Lava Flows on the beach!! So if you're looking for a real Hawaiian vacation, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, it definitely grows on you.”
Reviews.Author: Mabg40
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about this hotel, as I had read mixed reviews, but definitely wanted to try this "most Hawaiian" of all hotels. My first impression, as we stood in line to check in July 6th, was dismay. The wallpaper behind the check in counter was stained and peeling, the lobby looked in need of a makeover. I was slightly reassured by our two teenaged girls (15&17) who explored the grounds while we waited in line. They declared it was fabulous, pretty grounds, nice beach, etc. Our room was not ready, so we walked out to the Tiki Bar for a drink. Let the vacation begin! The bartender (Dale) was great, courteous, seemed to know all the people there. The guests were incredibly friendly and helpful. We met two women in their late 60-s or so who were at the KBH for the 25th time! The girls ordered food from the Tiki Grill, which they enjoyed and we relaxed while waiting for our room to be ready. Our room, when we entered it was just at it appeared on the web site, and perfectly positioned as I had requested, ocean view in the Lanai wing. Things were definitely improving! The girls were a little disappointed by the lack of room service, but got over that rather quickly. The staff is incredibly friendly, and all the guests were, too. We chatted every day with different types of people from all over. I did receive a dirty glass and knife in the Mixed Plate restaurant, but that was it for poor service. The food was mediocre. The sunsets were glorious, and the nightly entertainment was fun, and we all learned to "Just Hang Loose". The farewell ceremony was very touching, and our Hawaiin hostess actually cried. My 17yr old felt guilty as we were just moving down the beach to the Marriott,, as previously planned. The KBH is a lovely, friendly place to stay. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Made Us Feel Like Ohana! (Family for you other haoles!)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (wife, sons 10 and 6) and I arrived at the KBH on July 7th for a week's visit after spending a week in a 2-bedroom condo on the Big Island. My wife was a bit apprehensive about having the entire ohana in a single room after staying in a beautiful apartment, but her fears melted soon after our arrival at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. This wonderful resort offers few of the luxury trappings of a corporate mega-resort, but it is far superior in providing the sense of feeling welcome. In a week's stay, we never received less than a smile and a warm "aloha" from a single staff member. My kids enjoyed visiting different parts of the hotel to get their "aloha passports" stamped and to receive free gifts. My wife and I were delighted to receive a beautiful fruit platter as a gift for returning to the hotel after an 11-year absence, and were downright surprised a few days later to receive a box of chocolate-covered macadamias as an additional "thank you". The Guest Services staff got to know everyone in our family over the course of our stay, and made a point to ask us to join them in the lei-making classes and other free activities offered daily. Most evenings, we marked sunset by grabbing frozen drinks at the Tiki Bar and taking in the free nightly hula show. Even though many of the songs were the same each night, the show truly made us long to stay in our Hawaiian paradise. Yes, the room was a bit more cramped than our Big Island condo, but with everything going on in the hotel, not to mention the beach and pool just steps away, we never felt crowded a bit. Of course, having our sons with us cut into the potential Hawaiian romance a bit... but that's why we're already conspiring to return to Maui next spring... ALONE! And when we do return, it will be to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A taste of Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has given this hotel less than 4 stars is just one of those people who looks for the half-empty glass in life. This was truly a Hawaiian experience for us. My husband and I stayed at the KBH for an entire week in July to celebrate our 25th anniversary. The KBH lives up to its motto of being Maui's most Hawaiian hotel. We were treated like family by all staff. Our room was an ocean view with a beautiful lanai. We were also fortunate enough to have a complete garden view of the immaculate grounds and pool area. The maintenance crew works diligently to keep the grounds spotless. Pool is clean and sparkly. This hotel is right on Kaanapali beach and it was heaven to leave the door open at night and hear the waves crashing against the shore. We were pleasantly surprised upon check-in to have free breakfasts included with our stay. I will agree with others that after 7 days the Mixed Plate left us desiring something different for breakfast but the fresh pineapple each day made up for any blandness anywhere else. Many ammenities included with our stay....cookies each night on our bed, a box of chocolate covered macademia nuts one night, flowers on our bed several nights, beautiful luggage tags given to us on our last night, and the wonderful kukui nut necklaces given to everyone upon departure. Room was spotless, bathroom was nice, coffee maker included, along with hair dryer and refrigerator. We attended the welcome breakfast but we were never coerced to buy any trips. Tiki Terrace restaurant is superb. Tiki grill is perfect for that pool front snack or lunch. Tiki bar serves awesom maitais...or if you dare, try the Tropical Itch complete with its own back scratcher. Also great rum punch. Yum! I cannot say enough about this wonderful hotel. If you are looking for a glamorous high rise on the beach then this is not your place. The KBH is quaint and authentic. And you can't beat the location of just 3 miles north of Lahaina. We booked through Suntrips and got a great deal! We shall return...let us hope it doesn't take another 25 years to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Old School- In All the Best Ways”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the KBH from June 27 to July 2nd for the first leg of our honeymoon. We paid for a large part of the wedding so we were on a somewhat tight budget for the honeymoon. We initially had every intention of staying at one of the big name resorts like the Sheraton, Grand Wialea, Fairmont or the Ritz-Carlton -Kapalua, but as we saw out budget shrink we reluctantly agreed on the KBH. They say everything happens for a reason and this was certainly an example as we couldn't have been more pleased with our stay at the KBH. The KBH was SO comfortable....we visited the other resorts and while they were more visually striking than the KBH they didn't have that intangible quality that the KBH had in spades. As you've read in previous reviews of the KBH, the staff is great and the atmosphere is wonderful. The rooms were nice, clean and well kept and they did the little things too...a bottle of champagne was in the in-room fridge when we arrived, macadamia nut cookies were left on the bed after it was turned down each night and even a bag tag was left for us on our last night. At other resorts you may have to contend with the "See and be seen" or "look but don't touch" atmosphere, at the KBH you can be yourself and enjoy! It's on the best stretch of beach on Kaanapali, the grounds are well kept, the pool gets the job done (although I never have understood why people go to a BEACH resort, then spend all their time at the pool....go to Arizona for that!) the Tiki Terrace restaurant is great, the Tiki Bar has the best tropical drinks in Kaanapali and the Tiki Grill is there for lunch or a quick bite whenever you want. We loved hanging out on our lanai each night, sipping a cocktail and listening to the live Hawaiian music while we watched the sunset over the Pacific and neighbor islands. The nightly hula show is good hokey fun...I half expected to see the Brady Bunch sitting out there while we watched, it's a must see if you are around the hotel for sunset. My only advice- skip the Ohana Welcome breakfast if possible...I suppose the info they gave on activities on the island is useful if you're starting from square 1, but if you've even glanced thru a travel book or websites on Maui you'll already know all the info they are telling you. We looked at the KBH as a comprimise, now we feel like it's the best place on the island. If you are looking to pay $500 a night and share the beach with Britney Spears and her new fiance then go to the Fairmont or the Ritz. If you want to relax, feel comfortable and enjoy all that Maui has to offer then go to the KBH, we certainly plan on coming back next time we make it to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “real hawaiian experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Kaanapali Beach Hotel 3 days ago. If you are looking for a relaxing, laid-back, true Hawaiian hotel, you can find it at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms on the ground floor. Our room was very spacious, clean and tastefully decorated with wicker furniture and pictures depicting images of Hawaii. There were plenty of amenities in the room, including a refridgerator, iron, hair dryer, etc. The point which stands out most about this hotel is the laid-back, family atmoshpere. If you have children or are just young at heart, there is a pool, a ping pong table and an oversized checker board for your entertainment. The grounds are large with beautiful old trees bearing sweet smelling blossoms. The hotel encourages its guests to pull out a lawn chair and just relax under the cool shade of one of these trees while you watch the sunset over the ocean. While you are relaxing in your lawn chair, don't forget to grab a Lava Flow cocktail at the Tiki Bar and some great tasting munchies (hamburgers, fries, spring rolls...) at the Tiki Grill located by the pool. Every evening, you can enjoy the nightly hula show. We really enjoyed seeing the show in person or just hearing the Hawaiian melodies play softly in the distance from our room. The music was nice and really made you feel like you were in Hawaii. The only complaint we had about the hotel is that the food at the Mixed Plate is really not good. The waffles there are made of plastic. Don't even waste your money going there. If you have food vouchers, use them at the Tiki Terrace restaurant at the hotel and just pay the fifty cents difference. The restaurant has a really great breakfast buffet where you can watch as your own custom made pancakes are prepared. We walked by the other hotels nextdoor on a daily basis and each time, we were really content in our choice of hotel. Granted, the Sheraton and the Westin have much more grandure pools, but their pools were always crowded and had a uptight feeling about them. Plus, you will probably spend more time hanging out at the beautiful, long sandy beach or snorkeling at Black Rock. Our stay at the Kaanapli Beach Hotel ended with a informal gathering where we and other parting guests were serenaded with a traditional Hawaiian song and presented with a lai by members of the staff. On our next stay in Maui, we will definitely choose the Kaanapali Beach Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed twice, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: matjas922
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed in this hotel already two times. We recently returned from our trip to maui last week. We returned to the same hotel, we just love staying at the KBH. Staying there just makes you feel like you have returned home. The staff is very friendly , the rooms are nice and clean. They have a bar outside and a great pool. I just can not say enough about this hotel. We plan on going back to maui next summer, and we will stay at the KBH , of course.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - Will Stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I came here for our 10th anniversary and had a very nice stay. For our anniversary, we got complimentary chocolate covered strawberries & a small bottle of champaign. Each night we came back from dinner to find cookies, flowers or some type of mint on our pillow -- simple, but unexpected. We had an ocean front room which was on the 2nd floor. The room was simple but clean & had a decent sized balcony. The hotel's beachfront was one of the best on Kaanapaali beach and thanks to a beach "sidewalk" we could walk to shopping, eating or whatever. If you want the occasional pampering, you can book appointments next door at the luxery hotel thru the reservation desk. All in all, when we come back we will book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of their policies! Rude and unreasonable.”
Reviews.Author: laracs
Reviews.Content: I never actually stayed at the hotel so I won't give it the worst rating because I can't say anything about the hotel itself. I booked a room on the hotel's website Sunday night for a stay the following weekend. On Tuesday morning, I called to cancel the reservation because it turned out we couldn't go. The hotel refused to cancel it and said they would charge me the entire amount ($360) because they have a strict policy that you have to cancel 7 days in advance. Their website does not tell you the policy if you go through the "online reservations" process. It's there, but only if you click on the "rates" link and scroll all the way down. Since I wanted to know availability as well as rates, I clicked on "reservations" and the policy was never disclosed. Nor did it tell me that I was essentially booking a non-refundable rate since it was within the 7 days. The confirmation e-mail that contained the policy didn't arrive until two days after I booked (and after I had tried to cancel), but it wouldn't have helped since it was non-refundable from the second I booked it online. They were very rude when I called to cancel, telling me it was my fault for making a hotel reservation when I wasn't sure we could come (to which I replied, if I had known it was non-refundable, I wouldn't have made the reservation). They did not even acknowledge my letter to their management explaining the problem. I got my money back by contesting the charge with my credit card company. The management of this hotel clearly doesn't care about fair dealing or customer service. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Old School Style”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: â€œWe donâ€™t do this fruit stuff in Chicago!â€� a woman with a stadium sized voice screeches from the lobby of Mauiâ€™s Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Apparently the wedge of fresh pineapple in her drink is sending her midwestern palate into a state of shock. Welcome to paradiseâ€¦no one ever said it was going to be a private paradise. On the contrary, every Tom, Dick, Ethel and Marge will be sharing this magical island with you, after all, Ohio, Michigan and Illinois arenâ€™t exactly balmy come mid-February and you really canâ€™t beat those internet specials. The staff at â€˜Hawaiiâ€™s most Hawaiian hotelâ€�â€”decked out in purple and green muumuuâ€™s and kukui nut necklacesâ€”are beyond helpful, especially the bellman, though if you look closely you may detect a worn thin patience behind their silky smiles and helpful manners, a side-effect no doubt, of large guests with larger voices screeching about fruit garnishes. One gets the feeling that the Kaanapali Beach Hotel was once the height of American exotica with its Tiki gods and Lava Flows. Kind of like when the Brady Bunch went to Hawaii minus the ancient burial grounds. What was once modern though, is now a little tired, and like a crazy aunt who still wears false eyelashes and frosted eye shadow you have to either disassociate or join the club: the outdoor hula show starts at 7:00â€¦ Try not to be put off by the dropped-ceiling fluorescent lobby lights circa â€˜74 or worse, the creepy oxygen-less hallways (also fluorescent lit) leading to your room. Donâ€™t mind the carpetingâ€”of which thereâ€™s plentyâ€”or the ancient bedding: 100 percent synthetic. Resist the impulse to run for the hills, to the Sheraton, the Hyatt, or anything with a 300 thread count and a Frequent Stay Program. If you give it a chance and keep an open mind you will see that the magic of the Kaanapali Beach Hotel goes much deeper than its 1965 exterior. The best thing to do after you get over the fact that youâ€™re paying 250.00 for something that would be 59.99 back on the mainland is get out of your airplane clothes and into something more Mauiâ€”flip flops plus anything breezy will do. Next go and stand on your lanai (thatâ€™s patio, Hawaiian style). Now breathe. Whenâ€™s the last time that felt so good? Next float out of your room and down to what I believe to be the heart of the Kaanapali Beach Hotel: the outdoor Tiki Bar, where the aforementioned open air show is performed nightly by Rudy Aquino and his band La Hau Nui. Mr. Aquino used to play with Don Ho back in the day. Thatâ€™s right, Tiny Bubbleâ€™s Don Ho, you canâ€™t get much more authentic than that. His ukulele skills and vibe prowess will transform you to another time, and that Lava Flow youâ€™re downing doesnâ€™t hurt matters any. The show is honest and easy going â€“ wait, isnâ€™t that how the Midwest is described?â€”complete with one of Rudyâ€™s daughters performing the hula. Keep an eye out for Smiles, the stone-faced bass player with shoulder length hair, brilliant. When you get back to your room hours later the fact that the sliding screen door falls off its track if you look at it sideways or that the shower sprays water everywhere but on your body wonâ€™t bother you nearly as much as it did when you arrived. Sleep to the sounds of the crashing waves and awaken to a symphony of overly expressive birds the next morning. Pull back your industrial strength drapes and youâ€™ll realize youâ€™re definitely not in Kansas (or Chicago as the case may be) anymore. One of the nice things about the grounds at KBH is the organic laid back feel they have, no topiaries or showy stone statues here, just a carpet of green, green grass, gorgeous flowering trees, seductive palms, and a fun oversized checkerboard complete with red and black painted coconuts for game pieces. On a friendâ€™s recommendation my sweetheart and I purchased beach chairs at the Wal-Mart near the airport thereby avoiding the 30.00 dollar a day charge for a private cabanaâ€”though it has always been a dream of mine to have a cabana boy, better to save the dough for more â€˜usefulâ€™ things like umbrella drinks and pineapple shaped refrigerator magnets. Once ensconced in the sandâ€”drop-dead gorgeous view of neighboring islands and allâ€”spend the day drifting in an out of consciousness while intermittently dipping yourself into the sparkling blue waters. You know those Salt Glow things you pay 70 bucks for back on the mainland? Itâ€™s right here baby, and itâ€™s free. If you get hungry doing nothing lazily make your way up to the Tiki grill next to the whale shaped pool and order a cardboard container of yummy fries or better still a hot dog (avoid the teriyaki chicken and beef skewers at all costs, incredibly salty with a highly questionable texture). Later in the afternoon, make like the other guests and move to one of the many free chairs on the lawn to read your copy of Michenerâ€™s Hawaii or the latest issue of Oprah. Go back up to the room (which at this point is really growing on you) and nap for an hour or so then take a delicious shower around 4:00 or 5:00 and get yourself back down to the beach for the near religious experience of a West Maui Sunset. If youâ€™re traveling with a painter as I was, watch as the artist falls to pieces over the mind-blowing display of color: purples, indigos, pinks, oranges. It is, as they say, worth the price of admission. Thereâ€™s so much to do on Maui itâ€™s enough to give any travel bee a panic attack: how can you do it all in such a short time? Guess what, you canâ€™t, so kick back, pick a few things you really want to try and do those. Whether itâ€™s a sunrise bike trip down Haleakala the dormant volcano (we opted out of this after we found out a van picked you up at 2:30 AM for this 8 hour trip) a whale watching tour or the drive on the infamous road to Hana. On our 8 day trip my guy and I drove to the hippie surfer town of Paia, watched windsurfers at Hoâ€™okipa Beach, went to a hemp store in Haiku, went whale watching, snorkeled Black Rock, explored the rugged coast of North Maui, took in the Old Lahaina Luau (highly recommended) and went to a magic show for humiliation Rodney Dangerfield style (not recommended). All that and we still had time for hours of being and nothingness. We ate at a bunch of great places including Mamaâ€™s Fish House which felt like being on the set of South Pacificâ€”gorgeousâ€”and bought raw Ahi Poke from the local grocery store, basically tuna sashimi in ponzu sauce, for a picnic dinner of our own next to the ocean: simple and perfect. The fact that Maui is literally crawling with honeymooners can make those of us living in sin feel a little left out never mind downright pressured. If the constant â€˜you two just marriedâ€™ question starts to grate on you simply smile, nod and hoist your Lava flow to the heavens, best not to disappoint. Who knows, maybe heâ€™ll get some ideasâ€¦A pleasant side effect of all the just marrieds is that there is a considerable lack of creepy singles slithering about. The locals do of course have their own cruising behavior involving the universal slow driving, low slung cars and parading of low slung jeans but if youâ€™re a pasty mainlander you can consider yourself invisible. So if youâ€™re looking for pristine grounds and the perfect tea service try one of the five dollar sign behemoths such as the Four Seasons and the Fairmont. Everything will be freshly scrubbed and sterilized for your, um, pleasure. If, on the other hand you want to relax and work on that thing you use to have called fun, try paradise old school style: the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Tom, Dick, Ethel and Marge will grow on you and your smile will grow with the passing days. Just donâ€™t be surprised if you come home with a muumuu collection, an ultra-bronzed tan and a penchant for extra long cigarettes.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back...truely enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: EmpressLala
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay a KBH. As they are the first to say...it's not the fanciest hotel on the island. But, we're not the fanciest people as well! We loved it being a down to earth, friendly, non-pretentious hotel. The rooms were clean with an adequate amount of moving around space. We didn't plan to spend much time in our room, so the room itself was not all that important. Nice lanai with 2 chairs & a small table for morning coffee... Great time at their Tiki Bar! Nice pool and garden area. Beach was beautiful! Also great snorkeling right on the beach at Black Rock. Good location to walk to other restaurants and shopping. We will definatley stay here on our next Maui trip!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stacie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week in April 04. The hotel was nice. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The pool wasn't as fancy as some of the other hotels but it was very low key and uncrowded-there was always plenty of lounge chairs and shade-not a lot of loud kids. They have a great tiki bar with good drink specials everyday. The tiki hut grill also served up suprisingly good munchies also at a reasonable price. We received free breakfast buffet tickets because our booking agency had made a mistake-I would not recommend using these for the Mixed Plate buffet. The food here was cold and not very good.Not much variety either. You can use your breakfast tickets at the other Tiki restaurant where the food is much better-don't waste your time going to the Mixed plate buffet. The hotel is a very short walk from black rock where there is the best snorkeling-almost better than the snorkeling cruise to Molikini we took. We saw some turtles and tons of fish too. Also a very short walk to the Whalers Village where there is lots of good shopping and great restaurants-try Hula Grill or Leilani's. We tried them both and we would highly recommend them. There is no jacuzzi at the hotel but we just walked next door to the Whaler hotel/condo resort and used there's-they didn't mind.The room we had was kind of outdated but very clean-you're hardly ever in your room anyways. It was actually a garden view room but we still had a really good ocean view. We had requested a renovated room but there wasn't one available when we checked in. All in all this place was pretty nice and we had no complaints. We would definately stay here again. It's a lot less expensive than all of the other hotels. Some people will always find something to complain about so I wouldn't be too concerned about the other reviews on this site.
